glosses.latin: Primum quidem gratias ago Deo meo per Iesum Christum quia fides uestra praedicatur in uniuerso mundo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]generaliter[/GLat] airisdia do cách isinchétne tuiste [GLat]aliter deo meo Specialiter[/GLat] óre donécomnacht [GLat]spiritum sanctum sibi et gratiam praedicationis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. generaliter airisdia do cách isinchétne tuiste aliter deo meo Specialiter óre donécomnacht spiritum sanctum sibi et gratiam praedicationis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. generaliter airisdia do cách isinchétne tuiste aliter deo meo Specialiter óre donécomnacht spiritum sanctum sibi et gratiam praedicationis
footnotes: g: In do-n-é-com-nacht, as in tecomnacht Wb. 26d 23, donecomnacht 25c 26, 33d 8, doécomnacht 14c 33 (from *to-en-com-anacht), the com is perfective
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. generaliter, for He is God unto every one in the primal creation. Aliter Deo meo specialiter, because He has impartedg Spiritum sanctum sibi, etc.

glosses.latin: Primum quidem gratias ago Deo meo per Iesum Christum quia fides uestra praedicatur in uniuerso mundo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdiasom domsa hóre nocretim í[Con]s[/Con]u [GLat]christo ut ipse dixit nemo uenit ad patrem[/GLat][a] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. isdiasom domsa hóre nocretim ísu christo ut ipse dixit nemo uenit ad patrem rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdiasom domsa hóre nocretim ísu christo ut ipse dixit nemo uenit ad patrema rl.
footnotes: a: John xiv. 6
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He is God unto me because I believe in Jesus, etc.

glosses.latin: Primum quidem gratias ago Deo meo per Iesum Christum quia fides uestra praedicatur in uniuerso mundo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isairdircc ícachthír rocretsisi[b] dodía [GLat]et[/GLat] ismór athorbe de dúnni [ie].i.[/ie] húare ro creitset ardlathi[c] inbetho cretfed[d] cách iaru[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] intí cretfes ní ágathar ángreim
glosses.glossText: .i. isairdircc ícachthír rocretsisi dodía et ismór athorbe de dúnni .i. húare ro creitset ardlathi inbetho cretfed cách iarum et intí cretfes ní ágathar ángreim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isairdircc ícachthír rocretsisib dodía et ismór athorbe de dúnni .i. húare ro creitset ardlathic inbetho cretfedd cách iarum et intí cretfes ní ágathar ángreim
footnotes: b: leg. rocretsidsi? W. S., but cf. Celt. Zeitschr. II. 212, J.S.
c: = ardḟlathi
d: for cretfid, as sóirfed Wb. 32d 13 for sóirfid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is well known in every country that ye have believed in God, and great unto us is the profit thereof, to wit, because the chief princes of the world have believed every one will then believe, and he who shall believe is not afraid of their power.

glosses.latin: Testis enim mihi est Deus. sine intermisione memoriam uestri facio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He knows: there is no concealment from Him.

glosses.latin: Testis enim mihi est Deus. sine intermisione memoriam uestri facio.
glosses.glossFullTags: déde didiu nand [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]memoriam facio sine intermisione uel in orationibus meis sine in[Sup]termisione[/Sup][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: déde didiu nand .i. memoriam facio sine intermisione uel in orationibus meis sine in[termisione]
glosses.glossFNs: déde didiu nand .i. memoriam facio sine intermisione uel in orationibus meis sine in[termisione]
footnotes: h: The two things seem to be the two constructions of v. 9, viz. taking sine intermissione with memoriam, or taking s. i. with orationibus
glosses.glossTrans: Two thingsh, then, are therein, i.e. memoriam, etc.

glosses.latin: si . . . prosperum iter habeam in uoluntate Dei ueniendi ad uos.
footnotes: e: A word erased, maith?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if perchance I may have.

glosses.latin: si . . . prosperum iter habeam in uoluntate Dei ueniendi ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that I may come.

glosses.latin: Desidero enim uidere uos, ut aliquid inpertiar uobis gratiae spiritualis ad confirmandos uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: cid æm no.domberasa cucuibsi ni[Con]anse[/Con] [GLat]desidero enim[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: cid æm no.domberasa cucuibsi nianse desidero enim
glosses.glossFNs: cid æm no.domberasa cucuibsi nianse desidero enim
glosses.glossTrans: But what is it that will bring me to you? Easy (to answer): desidero, etc.

glosses.latin: Desidero enim uidere uos, ut aliquid inpertiar uobis gratiae spiritualis ad confirmandos uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní ógthindnacal [Res]as[/Res]ṁbeir som óre rotectsat ní de riam andudesta didiu difoirbthetu for nirisse conrufailnither[f] [GLat]á mé[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ní ógthindnacal (as)ṁbeir som óre rotectsat ní de riam andudesta didiu difoirbthetu for nirisse conrufailnither á mé
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní ógthindnacal (as)ṁbeir som óre rotectsat ní de riam andudesta didiu difoirbthetu for nirisse conrufailnitherf á mé
footnotes: f: The letters nru are doubtful
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (it is) not a complete gift which he mentions, because they had previously possessed something of it (spiritual grace): what, then, is wanting to the perfection of your faith, that it may be supplied a me.

glosses.latin: consolari uobiscum per eam. uestram. meam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] condib dídnad do[Con]m[/Con]sa foirbthetu hirisse dúibsi [Res]con[/Res]d[Res]i[/Res]b foirb[Res]thetu[/Res] fornirisse [Res]dom[/Res]sa
glosses.glossText: .i. condib dídnad domsa foirbthetu hirisse dúibsi (con)d(i)b foirb(thetu) fornirisse (dom)sa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. condib dídnad domsa foirbthetu hirisse dúibsi (con)d(i)b foirb(thetu) fornirisse (dom)sa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that perfection of your faith may be a comfort to me: so that it may be perfection of your faith unto me.

glosses.latin: consolari uobiscum per eam. uestram. meam.
glosses.glossTrans: yours.

glosses.latin: consolari uobiscum per eam. uestram. meam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. mine.

glosses.latin: usque adhuc, ut aliquem fructum habeam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. hitherto.

glosses.latin: usque adhuc, ut aliquem fructum habeam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]hic ut ministerii sui ap[Con]u[/Con]d d[Con]eu[/Con]m habeat fructum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [a]ardofórmaich[/a] fochricc doso[Con]m[/Con] sochude docreittim[b] triap[Con]re[/Con]cept
glosses.glossText: .i. hic ut ministerii sui apud deum habeat fructum .i. ardofórmaich fochricc dosom sochude docreittim triaprecept
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hic ut ministerii sui apud deum habeat fructum .i. ardofórmaicha fochricc dosom sochude docreittimb triaprecept
footnotes: a: MS. ardofór maith
b: rectius dochreittim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for that a multitude has believed through his preaching increaseth the reward for him.

glosses.latin: Grecis ac Barbaris, sapientibus et insipientibus debitor sum.
footnotes: c: rectius ecnib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for all the wise Gentiles.

glosses.latin: Grecis ac Barbaris, sapientibus et insipientibus debitor sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for the foreigners.

glosses.latin: Grecis ac Barbaris, sapientibus et insipientibus debitor sum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dlegair do[Con]m[/Con]sa p[Con]re[/Con]cept docách[d] [GLat]quia omnium linguís loquor[/GLat] am [GLat]debitor[/GLat] iaru[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]omnibus sapientibus et insipientibus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. dlegair domsa precept docách quia omnium linguís loquor am debitor iarum omnibus sapientibus et insipientibus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dlegair domsa precept docáchd quia omnium linguís loquor am debitor iarum omnibus sapientibus et insipientibus
footnotes: d: rectius dochách
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is my duty to preach to every one, because omnium linguis loquor: I am therefore debitor, etc.

glosses.latin: promptus sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am ready.

glosses.latin: Non enim erubesco euangelium. Iudeo primum et Greco.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní mebul lemm p[Con]re[/Con]cept sos[Con]céli[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] precept [GLat]passionis et incarnationis christi quia secuntur uirtutes[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]resurexionem et ascentionem et ....[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ní mebul lemm precept soscéli .i. precept passionis et incarnationis christi quia secuntur uirtutes .i. resurexionem et ascentionem et ....
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní mebul lemm precept soscéli .i. precept passionis et incarnationis christi quia secuntur uirtutes .i. resurexionem et ascentionem et ....
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am not ashamed to preach the gospel. i.e. to preach the Passio, etc.

glosses.latin: Non enim erubesco euangelium. Iudeo primum et Greco.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]ait, íte docéte omnes gentes[/GLat][e] [Com]in marg. l.[/Com] airechas ceneóil airsiu[f] ní airechas [GLat]fidei[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: ait, íte docéte omnes gentes [in marg. l.] airechas ceneóil airsiu ní airechas fidei
glosses.glossFNs: ait, íte docéte omnes gentese [in marg. l.] airechas ceneóil airsiuf ní airechas fidei
footnotes: e: Matth. xxviii. 19
f: leg. airsin?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. primacy of race therefore, not primacy fidei.

glosses.latin: notum est Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aithgne [GLat]et[/GLat] adrad [GLat]quia non possunt non seruire[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. aithgne et adrad quia non possunt non seruire
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aithgne et adrad quia non possunt non seruire
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. knowledge and worship.

glosses.latin: Inuisibilia enim ipsius, a creatura mundi, per ea quae facta sunt, intellecta conspiciuntur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ætgnithi[g] [ie].i.[/ie] isfollus doib asnoipred fir oirdnithi
glosses.glossText: .i. ætgnithi .i. isfollus doib asnoipred fir oirdnithi

k: literally, one ordained
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. understood, i.e. it is manifest to them that it is the working of a supreme being<sup>k</sup>.

glosses.latin: Inuisibilia enim ipsius, a creatura mundi, per ea quae facta sunt, intellecta conspiciuntur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their eternity is perceived.

glosses.latin: non sicut Deum glorificauerunt. obscuratum est insipiens cór eorum.
footnotes: h: This seems a confusion of amal as ndia ‘sicut Deum’ and amal ní bad dia ‘tanquam non esset Deus’
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: non sicut Deum glorificauerunt. obscuratum est insipiens cór eorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have not shewn the reverence due to God.

glosses.latin: non sicut Deum glorificauerunt. obscuratum est insipiens cór eorum.
footnotes: i: recedentes, Migne, Patrologiae Cursus, tom. 30, col. 675
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from (the) light of (the) knowledge of God.

glosses.latin: Et motauerunt gloriam incorruptibilis Dei in similitudinem imaginis corruptibilis hominis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní delb adrorsat actiscosmulius delbe ↄd ... diud e ... lann fr ...
glosses.glossText: .i. ní delb adrorsat actiscosmulius delbe ↄd ... diud e ... lann fr ...
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní delb adrorsat actiscosmulius delbe ↄd ... diud e ... lann fr ...
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not an image that they have adored, but it is the likeness of an image ......

glosses.latin: ut contumelís adficient corpora sua in semet ipsis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they offer their bodies ....

glosses.latin: ut contumelís adficient corpora sua in semet ipsis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]inter semet ipsos[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]dum sibi in sacramentís idulorum[/GLat][a] [GLat]cauteria et conbustiones infligunt. cauteria[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] aithchumbe
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: inter semet ipsos .i. dum sibi in sacramentís idulorum cauteria et conbustiones infligunt. cauteria .i. aithchumbe
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: inter semet ipsos .i. dum sibi in sacramentís iduloruma cauteria et conbustiones infligunt. cauteria .i. aithchumbe
footnotes: a: eorum, Migne, ubi supra
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. brandings.

glosses.latin: Propterea.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]propter causas commemoratas[/GLat][b] [ie].i.[/ie] óre asṅdúil foruigensat nach dúlem
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: propter causas commemoratas .i. óre asṅdúil foruigensat nach dúlem
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: propter causas commemoratasb .i. óre asṅdúil foruigensat nach dúlem
footnotes: b: superius memoratas, Migne, col. 676
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is the creature which they have served, not the Creator

glosses.latin: exarserunt in desideriis suis in inuicem, masculi in masculos turpitudinem operantes et mercidem, quam oportuit erroris sui in semet ipsís recipientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. each towards another.

glosses.latin: exarserunt in desideriis suis in inuicem, masculi in masculos turpitudinem operantes et mercidem, quam oportuit erroris sui in semet ipsís recipientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the shamefulness.

glosses.latin: exarserunt in desideriis suis in inuicem, masculi in masculos turpitudinem operantes et mercidem, quam oportuit erroris sui in semet ipsís recipientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is to them will be paid the recompense of their sins.

glosses.latin: repletos omni iniquitate. sussurratores.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with every iniquity.

glosses.latin: repletos omni iniquitate. sussurratores.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] fodordchu [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non in faciem sed in aure loquentes[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. fodordchu .i. non in faciem sed in aure loquentes
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fodordchu .i. non in faciem sed in aure loquentes
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whisperers.

glosses.latin: Detractatores.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. slander of a neighbour.

glosses.latin: digni sunt morte.
footnotes: c: Zeuss read itcointsi, but itcointfi is right, cf. contfi Laws IV. 344, coindme LU. 74a 6, coindfea O’Don. suppl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are worthy or they are proper.

glosses.latin: o homo omnis. eadem enim agis qui iudicas.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. O all man, i.e. O every man!

glosses.latin: o homo omnis. eadem enim agis qui iudicas.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when thou consentest.

glosses.latin: o homo omnis. eadem enim agis qui iudicas.

glosses.glossText: asnolcc quod facit alius [in marg.] .i. qui consentis facien. non quod esset malum corripere alios sed non satis est ad iustitiam sí malus sis (et corripis) malum .i. nam(mi)tter .i. diacairigther et lasse dongní so iarum ... ri essin té ipsum contempnás .i. is follus addrogduinesiu lasse (n)omidter et nocairigther anolcc diacocéitbani
glosses.glossFNs: asnolcc quod facit alius [in marg.] .i. qui consentis facien. non quod esset malum corripere alios sed non satis est ad iustitiam sí malus sis (et corripis) malum .i. nam(mi)tter .i. diacairigther et lasse dongní so iarum ... ri essin té ipsum contempnás .i. is follus addrogduinesiu lasse (n)omidter et nocairigther anolcc diacocéitbani
glosses.glossTrans: That quod facit alius is wicked ... i.e. thou judgest him, i.e. if thou reprovest and when thou dost afterwards ....... i.e. it is manifest that thou art a bad man when thou judgest and blamest the evil to which thou consentest.

glosses.latin: Scimus enim quoniam iudicium Dei est secundum ueritatem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. punishment.

glosses.latin: Scimus enim quoniam iudicium Dei est secundum ueritatem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní boco[Con]m[/Con]itesti[d] dó acht baléicthi [GLat]iudici iusto[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ní bocomitesti dó acht baléicthi iudici iusto
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní bocomitestid dó acht baléicthi iudici iusto
footnotes: d: rectius -chomitesti
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he should not be indulged, but he should be left iudici iusto.

glosses.latin: Existimas hoc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou thinkest, or a question.

glosses.latin: Án. Ignoras quoniam benignitas Dei ad penitentiam te adducit?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is not?

glosses.latin: Án. Ignoras quoniam benignitas Dei ad penitentiam te adducit?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dothudidin domenman doaidgniu dobeir cachmaid duit
glosses.glossText: .i. dothudidin domenman doaidgniu dobeir cachmaid duit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dothudidin domenman doaidgniu dobeir cachmaid duit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to lead thy mind to knowledge He giveth thee every good thing.

glosses.latin: Iis quidem, qui secundum patientiam boni operis gloriam st. et honorem et incorruptionem quaerentibus, uitam aeternam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they who.

glosses.latin: Iis quidem, qui secundum patientiam boni operis gloriam st. et honorem et incorruptionem quaerentibus, uitam aeternam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [Com]in marg. l.[/Com] [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]quia[/GLat][b] [GLat]sancti fulgebunt sicut sól[/GLat][c] [GLat]Né putemus eandem esse[/GLat] [d][GLat]gloriam[/GLat][/d] didiu [GLat]uenite[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [GLat]honor possedite uel honor filiorum dei per quem angelos fugitiuos iudicabunt[/GLat]

glosses.glossFNs: .i. [in marg. l.] Pelagius: quiab sancti fulgebunt sicut sólc Né putemus eandem esse gloriamd didiu uenite rl. honor possedite uel honor filiorum dei per quem angelos fugitiuos iudicabunt
footnotes: b: qua, Migne, col. 679
c: Matth. xiii. 43
d: MS. gloria
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] foditiu cech imnid [GLat]in praesenti[/GLat] oc asgnam [GLat]gloriae et honoris in futuro[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. foditiu cech imnid in praesenti oc asgnam gloriae et honoris in futuro
glosses.glossFNs: .i. foditiu cech imnid in praesenti oc asgnam gloriae et honoris in futuro
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. endurance of every tribulation in praesenti while striving after glory and honour in futuro.

glosses.latin: Tribulatio. Iudei primum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. tribulation.

glosses.latin: Tribulatio. Iudei primum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. most greatly.

glosses.latin: Non est enim personarum acceptio apud Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní na pe[Con]r[/Con]san ateclimm actis[GLat]operum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nísnain ciasberat ní[Con]n[/Con]tánicc recht
glosses.glossText: .i. ní na persan ateclimm actisoperum .i. nísnain ciasberat níntánicc recht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní na persan ateclimm actisoperum .i. nísnain ciasberat níntánicc recht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not of the persons is the acceptance, but it is of the works, i.e. it will not protect them that they say ‘the Law has not come to us.’

glosses.latin: Quicunque enim sine lege peccauerunt, sine lege peribunt per legem iudicabuntur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] nád robe mesrugud forsindimmarmus níbia mesrugud forsindígail
glosses.glossText: .i. amal nád robe mesrugud forsindimmarmus níbia mesrugud forsindígail
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal nád robe mesrugud forsindimmarmus níbia mesrugud forsindígail
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as there has not been moderation as to the sin, there will not be moderation as to the punishment.

glosses.latin: Quicunque enim sine lege peccauerunt, sine lege peribunt per legem iudicabuntur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. legal punishment upon them.

glosses.latin: Non enim auditores legis iusti sunt apud Deum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Law which they have outraged, it is through it they will perish.

glosses.latin: ipsi sibi sunt lex.
glosses.glossTrans: a bond.

glosses.latin: testimonium reddente illís conscientia ipsorum et inter se inuicem cogitationibus acusantibus aut etiam defendentibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their conscience is a witness to them.

glosses.latin: testimonium reddente illís conscientia ipsorum et inter se inuicem cogitationibus acusantibus aut etiam defendentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] imrádat imráti cid maith asdéntí [GLat]et[/GLat] nertit adénum inmaidsin connessat im[Con]murgu[/Con] ingníi[Con]m[/Con] nolcc [GLat]et[/GLat] arangairet
glosses.glossText: .i. imrádat imráti cid maith asdéntí et nertit adénum inmaidsin connessat immurgu ingníim nolcc et arangairet
glosses.glossFNs: .i. imrádat imráti cid maith asdéntí et nertit adénum inmaidsin connessat immurgu ingníim nolcc et arangairet
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they think thoughts as to what good is to be done, and they encourage the doing of that good thing: they contemn, however, the evil deed and forbid it.

glosses.latin: In die, cum iudicabit Deus occulta hominum, secundum euangelium meum, per Iesum Christum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nibamaith rúun [GLat]occulti hominum in die illa[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nibamaith rúun occulti hominum in die illa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nibamaith rúun occulti hominum in die illa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not good will be the secret occulti hominum, etc.

glosses.latin: In die, cum iudicabit Deus occulta hominum, secundum euangelium meum, per Iesum Christum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] istri í[Con]s[/Con]u p[Con]re[/Con]dchimse [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]iudicabit deus pater per iesum christum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ismacc míastar [GLat]in die iudici ut omne iudicium dedit filio[/GLat][e]
glosses.glossText: .i. istri ísu predchimse ɫ. iudicabit deus pater per iesum christum .i. ismacc míastar in die iudici ut omne iudicium dedit filio
glosses.glossFNs: .i. istri ísu predchimse ɫ. iudicabit deus pater per iesum christum .i. ismacc míastar in die iudici ut omne iudicium dedit filioe
footnotes: e: John v. 22
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is through Jesus I preach: uel iudicabit, etc., i.e. it is the Son who will judge in die, etc.

glosses.latin: Confidis té ipsum ducem esse cecorum.
footnotes: f: cf. foncerdam illeth ar tigernai LL. 283a 19
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou dost not trust thyself with any one else<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Eruditorem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: sacrilegium facis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. denial of God.

glosses.latin: Qui in lege gloriaris, per praeuaricationem legis Deum inhonoras.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou dishonourest.

glosses.latin: Qui in lege gloriaris, per praeuaricationem legis Deum inhonoras.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat][b]: [GLat]dicis té beatum quod noueris dei uoluntatem dum sensum legis qui de christi incarnatione est praeteriris deum inhonoras[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isindí nadcreitid [GLat]christum[/GLat] [c][GLat]quem[/GLat][/c] [GLat]praedicat léx[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: dicis té beatum quod noueris dei uoluntatem dum sensum legis qui de christi incarnatione est praeteriris deum inhonoras ɫ. isindí nadcreitid christum quem praedicat léx
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagiusb: dicis té beatum quod noueris dei uoluntatem dum sensum legis qui de christi incarnatione est praeteriris deum inhonoras ɫ. isindí nadcreitid christum quemc praedicat léx
footnotes: b: This passage is not in Migne. It is found (according to Olden) in the commentary of Hilary the Deacon
c: MS. quen
glosses.glossTrans: in that ye believe not Christ, etc.

glosses.latin: Circumcisio quidem prodest, si legem custodias. circumcisio tua praeputium facta est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aingid imdibe arbibda[Con]m[/Con]nact rectto arbabibdu báis leuso[Con]m[/Con] intí nád imdibthe
glosses.glossText: .i. aingid imdibe arbibdamnact rectto arbabibdu báis leusom intí nád imdibthe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aingid imdibe arbibdamnact rectto arbabibdu báis leusom intí nád imdibthe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. circumcision protects from the condemnation of the Law, for with them he who is not circumcised was guilty of death.

glosses.latin: Circumcisio quidem prodest, si legem custodias. circumcisio tua praeputium facta est.
footnotes: d: cf. Matth. xi. 13
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. mysteries of the Law ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Circumcisio quidem prodest, si legem custodias. circumcisio tua praeputium facta est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is the same as not circumcised.

glosses.latin: Praeputium. nonne praeputium illius, in circumcisionem reputabitur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the non-circumcision.

glosses.latin: Praeputium. nonne praeputium illius, in circumcisionem reputabitur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whosoever he be that may have iustitia Legis.

glosses.latin: Praeputium. nonne praeputium illius, in circumcisionem reputabitur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is the same to him as though he were circumcised.

glosses.latin: Et iudicabit té, quod ex natura est praeputium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ditróscibea a iudidi [ie].i.[/ie] bid ferr oldái
glosses.glossText: .i. ditróscibea a iudidi .i. bid ferr oldái
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ditróscibea a iudidi .i. bid ferr oldái
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he will surpass thee, O Jew, that is, he will be better than thou art.

glosses.latin: in manifesto.
footnotes: e: MS. chác
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in presence of every one.

glosses.latin: cuius laus non ex hominibus, sed ex Deo est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]a iudeis[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nitorbe do animdibe adchi cách
glosses.glossText: .i. a iudeis .i. nitorbe do animdibe adchi cách
glosses.glossFNs: .i. a iudeis .i. nitorbe do animdibe adchi cách
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no profit to him is the circumcision which every one sees.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo amplius Iudaeo est? aut quae utilitas circumcisionis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] másu and is [GLat]amplius[/GLat] inimdibiu [GLat]quae utilitas[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [Com]in marg. at vv. 28–29 of chap. ii.[/Com] Ní fortorbe nimdibi t[Con]ra[/Con] dotéit so[Con]m[/Con] act is formolad [GLat]iudeorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. másu and is amplius inimdibiu quae utilitas rl. [in marg. at vv. 28–29 of chap. ii.] Ní fortorbe nimdibi tra dotéit som act is formolad iudeorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. másu and is amplius inimdibiu quae utilitas rl. [in marg. at vv. 28–29 of chap. ii.] Ní fortorbe nimdibi tra dotéit som act is formolad iudeorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is therein that it is amplius, in circumcision, quae utilitas, etc.? So he (Paul) touches, not upon the profit of circumcision, but upon the praise of the Jews.

glosses.latin: Multum per omnem modum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]multum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] is indil asferr [GLat]iudeus quam gentilis[/GLat] frecre inso dar cenn ind iudidi dongeintli[Con]diu[/Con]
glosses.glossText: multum .i. is indil asferr iudeus quam gentilis frecre inso dar cenn ind iudidi dongeintlidiu
glosses.glossFNs: multum .i. is indil asferr iudeus quam gentilis frecre inso dar cenn ind iudidi dongeintlidiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is greatly that Judaeus is better than Gentilis: this is an answer on behalf of the Jew to the Gentile.

glosses.latin: Quid enim si quidam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for why?

glosses.latin: iniquitas nostra iustitiam Dei commendat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. our sins.

glosses.latin: iniquitas nostra iustitiam Dei commendat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that He is the more righteous.

glosses.latin: Si enim ueritas Dei in meo mendacio habundauit in gloriam ipsius, quid adhuc et ego tamquam peccator iudicor?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in my evil.

glosses.latin: Si enim ueritas Dei in meo mendacio habundauit in gloriam ipsius, quid adhuc et ego tamquam peccator iudicor?
glosses.glossTrans: if veritas Dei be the greater.

glosses.latin: Si enim ueritas Dei in meo mendacio habundauit in gloriam ipsius, quid adhuc et ego tamquam peccator iudicor?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Si enim ueritas Dei in meo mendacio habundauit in gloriam ipsius, quid adhuc et ego tamquam peccator iudicor?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. why is a sinner made of me?

glosses.latin: Et non, sicut blasfemamur, et sicut aiunt quidam nos dicere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cani am[Con]al[/Con] non ǽicndichtherni [ie].i.[/ie] iscosmil nade isamlid
glosses.glossText: .i. cani amal non ǽicndichtherni .i. iscosmil nade isamlid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cani amal non ǽicndichtherni .i. iscosmil nade isamlid
footnotes: c: Cf. cani epir? nate atbeir, infra 10d, and see G. C. 749
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it not as we are slandered? i.e. it is like, nay<sup>c</sup>, it is so.

glosses.latin: Et non, sicut blasfemamur, et sicut aiunt quidam nos dicere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as they say of us.

glosses.latin: Et non, sicut blasfemamur, et sicut aiunt quidam nos dicere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]dicire[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] asmbera[Con]m[/Con]ni [ie].i.[/ie] líit fornn aép[Con]ir[/Con]t [GLat]sicut paulus dixit[/GLat][a] [GLat]ubi habundauit peccatum superhabundauit grat[Con]ái[/Con], etc.[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] dicire .i. asmberamni .i. líit fornn aépirt sicut paulus dixit ubi habundauit peccatum superhabundauit gratái, etc.
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] dicire .i. asmberamni .i. líit fornn aépirt sicut paulus dixita ubi habundauit peccatum superhabundauit gratái, etc.
footnotes: a: Rom. v. 20
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we say, i.e. they accuse us of saying it.

glosses.latin: Quid igitur? amplius praecellimus? causati enim sumus Iudeos et Grecos omnes sub peccato esse.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni derscigem nech dialailiu bit bibdid huili
glosses.glossText: .i. ni derscigem nech dialailiu bit bibdid huili
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni derscigem nech dialailiu bit bibdid huili
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we do not excel each the other: they all will be guilty.

glosses.latin: Quid igitur? amplius praecellimus? causati enim sumus Iudeos et Grecos omnes sub peccato esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for all the Gentiles.

glosses.latin: Quid igitur? amplius praecellimus? causati enim sumus Iudeos et Grecos omnes sub peccato esse.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doracartmar cois caích niferr nech alailiu and
glosses.glossText: .i. doracartmar cois caích niferr nech alailiu and
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doracartmar cois caích niferr nech alailiu and
glosses.glossTrans: we have argued the cause of every one, none is better than another therein.

glosses.latin: Quia non est iustus quisquam. Non est intelligens, non est requirens Deum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. being without wisdom causes un-righteousness.

glosses.latin: Quia non est iustus quisquam. Non est intelligens, non est requirens Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] huaire nád riarfact furuar buid cenengne [GLat]et[/GLat]cenfírinni
glosses.glossText: .i. huaire nád riarfact furuar buid cenengne etcenfírinni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. huaire nád riarfact furuar buid cenengne etcenfírinni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since he has not sought Him it has produced the state of being without understanding and without righteousness.

glosses.latin: Omnes declinauerunt, simul inutiles facti sunt; non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because they have not sought after God.

glosses.latin: Omnes declinauerunt, simul inutiles facti sunt; non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without exception.

glosses.latin: Omnes declinauerunt, simul inutiles facti sunt; non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
glosses.glossFullTags: cid cossin nóin [vel]ɫ.[/vel] cosin nóin [ie].i.[/ie] co cr[Con]ist[/Con] ar nifarnic sede nach maid arachiun isindomun
glosses.glossText: cid cossin nóin ɫ. cosin nóin .i. co crist ar nifarnic sede nach maid arachiun isindomun
glosses.glossFNs: cid cossin nóin ɫ. cosin nóin .i. co crist ar nifarnic sede nach maid arachiun isindomun
glosses.glossTrans: as much as one (ἕως ἑνός), or until the one, that is, until Christ, for He found not anyone good before Him in the world.

glosses.latin: Quorum ós maledictione et amaritudine plenum est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of every kind of bitterness.

glosses.latin: Quorum ós maledictione et amaritudine plenum est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who curse every one.

glosses.latin: Veloces pedes eorum ad effundendum sanguinem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] islúud leu teistiu fuile [GLat]ut gentes, etc.[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. islúud leu teistiu fuile ut gentes, etc.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. islúud leu teistiu fuile ut gentes, etc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have an impulse to pour out blood ut gentes, etc.

glosses.latin: Contritio et infelicitas in uiis eorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. destruction.

glosses.latin: Contritio et infelicitas in uiis eorum.
footnotes: b: leg. an dodced sidi?
d: i.e. the misfortune which they work recoils on their own heads
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they deem it a misfortune to every one (else) although the misfortune of it is (really) their own<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: ut omne ós obstruatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] connách moidea nech arbed[a] áarilliud nod nícad
glosses.glossText: .i. connách moidea nech arbed áarilliud nod nícad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. connách moidea nech arbed<sup>a</sup> áarilliud nod nícad
footnotes: a: cf. ar bemmis Ml. 102b 16, as dunn as maith ar bem sund Rev. Celt. IX. 22, ardottáigthe L.U. 68b 28
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that no one may boast that his merit saved him.

glosses.latin: Iustitia autem Dei per fidem Iesu Christi, in omnes et super omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. into bodies and souls peccatorum.

glosses.latin: Iustitia autem Dei per fidem Iesu Christi, in omnes et super omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is through belief in Jesus Christ that every one is righteous.

glosses.latin: Iustitia autem Dei per fidem Iesu Christi, in omnes et super omnes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg. l.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]altum quod non sapitur[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] isósib atá
glosses.glossText: [in marg. l.] .i. altum quod non sapitur .i. isósib atá
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg. l.] .i. altum quod non sapitur .i. isósib atá
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is over them He is.

glosses.latin: Iustificati gratis per gratiam ipsius, per redemptionem quae est in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the faith of belief in Jesus Christ.

glosses.latin: Iustificati gratis per gratiam ipsius, per redemptionem quae est in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ishéso[Con]m[/Con] doradchiúir ⁊ ishé da[Con]no[/Con] astaidchricc [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]per sanguinem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ishésom doradchiúir ⁊ ishé dano astaidchricc .i. per sanguinem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishésom doradchiúir ⁊ ishé dano astaidchricc .i. per sanguinem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is He that has redeemed and it is He also that is (the) ransom.

glosses.latin: Quem propossuit Deus propitiationem, per fidem in sanguine ipsius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arrudérged írúnaib innadeacte [GLat]ut propitietur eís qui credunt sé sanguine eius libiratos esse[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. arrudérged írúnaib innadeacte ut propitietur eís qui credunt sé sanguine eius libiratos esse
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arrudérged írúnaib innadeacte ut propitietur eís qui credunt sé sanguine eius libiratos esse
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it has been set forth in the mysteries of the Godhead ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Quem propossuit Deus propitiationem, per fidem in sanguine ipsius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] trihiris incháich cretes áhíc tria fuil
glosses.glossText: .i. trihiris incháich cretes áhíc tria fuil
glosses.glossFNs: .i. trihiris incháich cretes áhíc tria fuil
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through the faith of every one who believes in his salvation through His blood.

glosses.latin: Ubi est ergo gloriatio tua? Exclusa est. Per quam legem? factorum. Non; sed per legem fidei?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou hast nothing for thee to boast in.

glosses.latin: Ubi est ergo gloriatio tua? Exclusa est. Per quam legem? factorum. Non; sed per legem fidei?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through deeds of (the) Law.

glosses.latin: Ubi est ergo gloriatio tua? Exclusa est. Per quam legem? factorum. Non; sed per legem fidei?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no: i.e. it is the same as though it were not boasting.

glosses.latin: Ubi est ergo gloriatio tua? Exclusa est. Per quam legem? factorum. Non; sed per legem fidei?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is through it that gloriatio is.

glosses.latin: An Iudeorum Deus tantum? Nonne et gentium? Immo et gentium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]numquid solós creauit nonné omnes creauit homines[/GLat] frecre inso do menma[Res]in[/Res] [GLat]iudeorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. numquid solós creauit nonné omnes creauit homines frecre inso do menma(in) iudeorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. numquid solós creauit nonné omnes creauit homines frecre inso do menma(in) iudeorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. numquid, etc., an answer, this, to (the) mind Iudaeorum.

glosses.latin: An Iudeorum Deus tantum? Nonne et gentium? Immo et gentium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isnesa dogeintib [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quia ante legem sancti deo placuerunt ut[/GLat] ábial, séth, enóc, nóe
glosses.glossText: .i. isnesa dogeintib .i. quia ante legem sancti deo placuerunt ut ábial, séth, enóc, nóe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isnesa dogeintib .i. quia ante legem sancti deo placuerunt ut ábial, séth, enóc, nóe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He is nearer to Gentiles, i.e. quia, etc., ut Abel, Seth, Enoch, Noah.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem unus est Deus, qui iustificauit circumcisionem ex fide et praeputium per fidem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciasbiursa [GLat]deus iudeorum et deus gentium unus est deus[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. ciasbiursa deus iudeorum et deus gentium unus est deus rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciasbiursa deus iudeorum et deus gentium unus est deus rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I say Deus, etc.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem unus est Deus, qui iustificauit circumcisionem ex fide et praeputium per fidem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of him who believes without material circumcision.

glosses.latin: Legem ergo destruimus per fidem? Absit; sed legem statuimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. do we destroy? i.e. quando, etc.

glosses.latin: Legem ergo destruimus per fidem? Absit; sed legem statuimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we destroy not.

glosses.latin: Legem ergo destruimus per fidem? Absit; sed legem statuimus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]dum probamus uerum esse quod promissit ut dabo uobís [Res]cor[/Res] carnium[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] tarési [GLat]lapidei[/GLat][b] condid imdibe spir[Con]tálde[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] [c]ni[/c] ... coscrad [GLat]legis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. dum probamus uerum esse quod promissit ut dabo uobís (cor) carnium .i. tarési lapidei condid imdibe spirtálde et ni ... coscrad legis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dum probamus uerum esse quod promissit ut dabo uobís (cor) carnium .i. tarési lapideib condid imdibe spirtálde et nic ... coscrad legis
footnotes: b: Cf. Ezekiel xxxvi. 26: et auferam cor lapideum de carne uestra, et dabo uobis cor carneum
c: MS. seems in
e: The glossator refers to the flint knives with which circumcision was performed. See Exodus iv. 25; Joshua v. 2–3, and Fel. Oeng. p. xxx. in cloch de quo facta est circumcisio
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. instead of the stony<sup>e</sup> so that it is a spiritual circumcision and not destruction of (the) Law.

glosses.latin: Abracham, patrem nostrum, secundum carnem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]secundum circumcisionem carnis[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ishé arnathir iarcolinn [GLat]quia de genere abrachae fuerunt[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. secundum circumcisionem carnis ɫ. ishé arnathir iarcolinn quia de genere abrachae fuerunt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. secundum circumcisionem carnis ɫ. ishé arnathir iarcolinn quia de genere abrachae fuerunt
glosses.glossTrans: he is our father according to the flesh, quia, etc.

glosses.latin: Credidit Abracham Deo; et reputatum [est] illi ad iustitiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is through faith that he has been justified, not through deeds of the Law.

glosses.latin: Ei autem qui operatur mercis non inputatur secundum gratiam sed secundum debitum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ei autem qui operatur mercis non inputatur secundum gratiam sed secundum debitum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mad fochricc som nípa deoladacht acht bid fiach istrideoladacht didiu ronóibad ní archomalnad recto
glosses.glossText: .i. mad fochricc som nípa deoladacht acht bid fiach istrideoladacht didiu ronóibad ní archomalnad recto
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mad fochricc som nípa deoladacht acht bid fiach istrideoladacht didiu ronóibad ní archomalnad recto
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is a payment it will not be grace, but it will be a debt: it is through grace, then, that he has been sanctified, not for fulfilling (the) Law.

glosses.latin: credenti. reputatur fides eius ad iustitiam.
glosses.glossTrans: to him that believes.

glosses.latin: credenti. reputatur fides eius ad iustitiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. his faith justifies him.

glosses.latin: sine operibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is gratis, not per opera.

glosses.latin: Beati quorum remisae sunt iniquitates.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. blessed is their life.

glosses.latin: Beatitudo ergo haec in circumcisione tantum manet? Dicimus enim, quia reputata est Abarchae fides ad iustitiam;
footnotes: f: cf. alled friss fadesin, Wb. 6c, 18: al-led fri-spirut (the spiritual side, as regards the spirit), Wb. 8b, 16. allethe rissan ingraim Ml. 30b 2
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it abides not, i.e. as regards Abraham<sup>f</sup>

glosses.latin: Quomodo ergo reputata est? in circumcisione an in praeputio?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cain ronóibad abracha[Con]m[/Con] trihiris intree ǽm didiu fanacc
glosses.glossText: .i. cain ronóibad abracham trihiris intree ǽm didiu fanacc
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cain ronóibad abracham trihiris intree ǽm didiu fanacc
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. hath not Abraham been sanctified through faith? is it through it then indeed or not?

glosses.latin: Quomodo ergo reputata est? in circumcisione an in praeputio?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it when he has been in circumcisione?

glosses.latin: Quomodo ergo reputata est? in circumcisione an in praeputio?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] inintain ro[Con]m[/Con]bói [GLat]in praeputio[/GLat] [Com]in marg.[/Com] Isderb linn is ní nim[Con]dibiu[/Con][d] atruirmed hiresche do
glosses.glossText: .i. inintain rombói in praeputio [in marg.] Isderb linn is ní nimdibiu atruirmed hiresche do
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inintain rombói in praeputio [in marg.] Isderb linn is ní nimdibiud atruirmed hiresche do
footnotes: d: leg. Isderb linn is in praeputio ní in imdibiu, Sarauw.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it when he has been in praeputio? We are sure that it is not in circumcision that faith has been imputed to him.

glosses.latin: Et signum accipit circumcisionis, signaculum iustitiae fidei, quae est in praeputio.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄrobad innachorp ní inchoissised tóbe [GLat]uitiorum[/GLat] assa anmin
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄrobad innachorp ní inchoissised tóbe uitiorum assa anmin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄrobad innachorp ní inchoissised tóbe uitiorum assa anmin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that there might be in his body something to signify (the) excision of vitia from his soul.

glosses.latin: Et signum accipit circumcisionis, signaculum iustitiae fidei, quae est in praeputio.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]recapitulatio de signo[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] inroimdibed intain rofirianiged ahíress[a]
glosses.glossText: .i. recapitulatio de signo .i. inroimdibed intain rofirianiged ahíress
glosses.glossFNs: .i. recapitulatio de signo .i. inroimdibed intain rofirianiged ahíressa
footnotes: a: The accent may be meant for a
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. has he been circumcised when his faith has been counted as righteousness?

glosses.latin: Et signum accipit circumcisionis, signaculum iustitiae fidei, quae est in praeputio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through noncircumcision.

glosses.latin: Et sit pater circumcisionis, non hiis tantum qui ex circumcisione, sed et hiis qui sectantur uestigia fidei, quae est in praeputio patris nostri Abrachae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nidunaibhí fodaimet animdibe colnide [GLat]tantum[/GLat] manicomol[Con]natar[/Con] anim[Con]dibe[/Con] rúnde [GLat]uitiorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nidunaibhí fodaimet animdibe colnide tantum manicomolnatar animdibe rúnde uitiorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nidunaibhí fodaimet animdibe colnide tantum manicomolnatar animdibe rúnde uitiorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not unto those who suffer the carnal circumcision tantum unless they fulfil the mystical circumcision of vitia.

glosses.latin: Et sit pater circumcisionis, non hiis tantum qui ex circumcisione, sed et hiis qui sectantur uestigia fidei, quae est in praeputio patris nostri Abrachae.
glosses.glossFullTags: acht is athir som innaní techte foirbthetith [GLat]fidei ut habuit abracha[Con]m[/Con][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: acht is athir som innaní techte foirbthetith fidei ut habuit abracham
glosses.glossFNs: acht is athir som innaní techte foirbthetith fidei ut habuit abracham
glosses.glossTrans: but he is father of them that possess perfection fidei ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Non enim per legem promisio facta est Abrachae aut semeni eius ut heres esset mundi, sed per iustitiam fidei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dorairngred da[Con]no[/Con] ro[Con]m[/Con]bad oirdnide achland [GLat]ut in semine tuo[/GLat][b] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. dorairngred dano rombad oirdnide achland ut in semine tuo rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dorairngred dano rombad oirdnide achland ut in semine tuob rl.
footnotes: b: Gen. xxii. 18
f: lit. ordained
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it has been foretold, then, that his children would be distinguishedf, ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Non enim per legem promisio facta est Abrachae aut semeni eius ut heres esset mundi, sed per iustitiam fidei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is through his faith that he has had every good.

glosses.latin: Si enim qui ex lege, heredes sunt, exinanita est fides, abolita est promissio.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]iudei filii abra[Con]chae[/Con][/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] matuhé ata horpamin indí rochomalnisset recht
glosses.glossText: .i. iudei filii abrachae .i. matuhé ata horpamin indí rochomalnisset recht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iudei filii abrachae .i. matuhé ata horpamin indí rochomalnisset recht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if they are heirs who have fulfilled (the) Law.

glosses.latin: Si enim qui ex lege, heredes sunt, exinanita est fides, abolita est promissio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which Abraham had before fulfilling (the) Law.

glosses.latin: Si enim qui ex lege, heredes sunt, exinanita est fides, abolita est promissio.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] duroilged [GLat]quod promisum est abrachae[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]possui té patrem[/GLat][c] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. duroilged quod promisum est abrachae .i. possui té patrem rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. duroilged quod promisum est abrachae .i. possui té patremc rl.
footnotes: c: Gen. xvii. 5; where the Vulgate has constitui
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. quod promissum has been abolished, etc.

glosses.latin: Lex enim iram operatur, ubi enim lex non est, nec praeuaricatio.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnibiad rath dílgotho [GLat]et[/GLat] nibiad [d][GLat]p[Con]ro[/Con]misio[/GLat][/d] dosom madtrerecht duairngerthe arisdígal arisdígal[e] manicomollnither side
glosses.glossText: .i. arnibiad rath dílgotho et nibiad promisio dosom madtrerecht duairngerthe arisdígal arisdígal manicomollnither side
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnibiad rath dílgotho et nibiad promisiod dosom madtrerecht duairngerthe arisdígal arisdígale manicomollnither side
footnotes: d: MS. premisio
e: Sic in codice vitiose dupliciter scriptum, Zimmer
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for there would not have been grace of forgiveness and there would not have been promissio to him if it was through (the) Law that the promise was given, for it (the Law) is vengeance, for it is vengeance, unless it be fulfilled.

glosses.latin: Lex enim iram operatur, ubi enim lex non est, nec praeuaricatio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is no transgression of (the) Law unless (the) Law forbid.

glosses.latin: Ideo ex fide, ut secundum gratiam firma sit promisio omni semini,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non ei qui ex lege[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] óre isdeolid bid fír atairngire
glosses.glossText: .i. non ei qui ex lege .i. óre isdeolid bid fír atairngire
glosses.glossFNs: .i. non ei qui ex lege .i. óre isdeolid bid fír atairngire
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is a grace the promise will be true.

glosses.latin: non ei qui ex lege est solum, sed éi, qui ex fide est Abrachae. qui est pater omnium nostrorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if his faith be like unto Abraham’s faith.

glosses.latin: non ei qui ex lege est solum, sed éi, qui ex fide est Abrachae. qui est pater omnium nostrorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ataat danorpe rogab abra[Con]cham[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] orpe col[Con]nide[/Con] [GLat]per circumcisionem[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] tír tairngiri [GLat]et[/GLat] ished rogab isaác [GLat]et[/GLat]is [GLat]pater[/GLat]so[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]omnis gentis[/GLat] trisódin [GLat]et[/GLat] orpe spir[Con]tálde[/Con] trihiriss [Res][GLat]et[/GLat][/Res] is [GLat]pater[/GLat] som [GLat]multarum gentium[/GLat] triso[Res]d[/Res]in
glosses.glossText: .i. ataat danorpe rogab abracham .i. orpe colnide per circumcisionem .i. tír tairngiri et ished rogab isaác etis patersom omnis gentis trisódin et orpe spirtálde trihiriss (et) is pater som multarum gentium triso(d)in
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ataat danorpe rogab abracham .i. orpe colnide per circumcisionem .i. tír tairngiri et ished rogab isaác etis patersom omnis gentis trisódin et orpe spirtálde trihiriss (et) is pater som multarum gentium triso(d)in
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there are two heritages which Abraham has obtained, to wit, a carnal heritage per circumcisionem, that is, the Land of Promise,–and it is this that Isaac has obtained, and thereby he is pater omnis gentis–and a spiritual heritage through faith, and thereby he is pater multarum gentium.

glosses.latin: Quia patrem multarum gentium possui te.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat][b]: [GLat]non gentis israhelis tantum sed omnium[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] hiressach [GLat]mundi[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: non gentis israhelis tantum sed omnium .i. hiressach mundi
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagiusb: non gentis israhelis tantum sed omnium .i. hiressach mundi
footnotes: b: Not in Migne, col. 690
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of (the) faithful ones mundi.

glosses.latin: Qui contra spem in spe credidit, ut fieret pater multarum gentium.
footnotes: d: lit. conception to Sara
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that Sara would conceive<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Qui contra spem in spe credidit, ut fieret pater multarum gentium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ba [GLat]contra spem[/GLat] dó epe[Con]r[/Con]t friss ro[Con]m[/Con]bad [GLat]pater multarum gentium et difficerunt muliebria sarre et ipse ualde senex fuit sed tamen credidit ut fieret[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ba contra spem dó epert friss rombad pater multarum gentium et difficerunt muliebria sarre et ipse ualde senex fuit sed tamen credidit ut fieret
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ba contra spem dó epert friss rombad pater multarum gentium et difficerunt muliebria sarre et ipse ualde senex fuit sed tamen credidit ut fieret
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was contra spem to him that it should be said to him that he should be pater, etc.

glosses.latin: non infirmatus est in fide, nec considerauit corpus suum emortuum, cum iam fere centum annorum esset.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nipo lobur ahires cepu friaicned [GLat]quod dictum est[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nipo lobur ahires cepu friaicned quod dictum est
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nipo lobur ahires cepu friaicned quod dictum est
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. his faith was not weak, though quod dictum est was contrary to nature.

glosses.latin: non infirmatus est in fide, nec considerauit corpus suum emortuum, cum iam fere centum annorum esset.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: non infirmatus est in fide, nec considerauit corpus suum emortuum, cum iam fere centum annorum esset.
glosses.glossTrans: this I deem his temptation.

glosses.latin: non hesitauit defedentia;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: non hesitauit defedentia;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: sed confortatus est in fide.
footnotes: c: MS. arnert
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for his faith strengthened him to believe.

glosses.latin: Non est autem scriptum tantum propter ipsum quia reputatum est illi ad iustitiam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niarabra[Con]cham[/Con] [GLat]tantum scriptum est hoc testimonium in genessi[/GLat] acht isdiar foirbthetuni roscríbad
glosses.glossText: .i. niarabracham tantum scriptum est hoc testimonium in genessi acht isdiar foirbthetuni roscríbad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niarabracham tantum scriptum est hoc testimonium in genessi acht isdiar foirbthetuni roscríbad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for Abraham tantum, etc.; but it is to perfect us that it has been written.

glosses.latin: Non est autem scriptum tantum propter ipsum quia reputatum est illi ad iustitiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the scriptum.

glosses.latin: Sed et propter nos, quibus, reputabitur credentibus in eum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we may follow his customs in fide.

glosses.latin: Sed et propter nos, quibus, reputabitur credentibus in eum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is to us.

glosses.latin: Sed et propter nos, quibus, reputabitur credentibus in eum.
glosses.glossTrans: it is to believe in His Godhead.

glosses.latin: Sed et propter nos, quibus, reputabitur credentibus in eum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what has been counted unto Abraham, even righteousness through faith.

glosses.latin: resurrexit propter iustificationem nostram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]a persona credentium ut institiam credentium confirmaret[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] isfollus dunni triahesséirgesom asfirdia
glosses.glossText: .i. a persona credentium ut institiam credentium confirmaret .i. isfollus dunni triahesséirgesom asfirdia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. a persona credentium ut institiam credentium confirmaret .i. isfollus dunni triahesséirgesom asfirdia
footnotes: g: Rom. i. 4
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is manifest to us through His resurrection that He is very God<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: gloriamur.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut quid autem .... pro impis mortus est?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut quid autem .... pro impis mortus est?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] robtar [GLat]impii omnes ut non est qui faciat bonum[/GLat][b] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. robtar impii omnes ut non est qui faciat bonum rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. robtar impii omnes ut non est qui faciat bonumb rl.
footnotes: b: Rom. iii. 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have been impii omnes, etc.

glosses.latin: Uix enim pro iusto quis moritur; nam pro bono forsitan quis audeat mori.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is vix I say and not non.

glosses.latin: Commendat autem Deus suam caritatem in nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] frisaig [ie].i.[/ie] attroilli dúnn [GLat]delegi a nobís[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]dum ausus est quod nullus alius[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]tam facile né illi iniuria sit cum enim aliquid indebite praestatur tunc maxime caritas commendatur ut qualiter sé exhibere debiant recognoscant[/GLat][c]
glosses.glossText: .i. frisaig .i. attroilli dúnn delegi a nobís .i. dum ausus est quod nullus alius .i. tam facile né illi iniuria sit cum enim aliquid indebite praestatur tunc maxime caritas commendatur ut qualiter sé exhibere debiant recognoscant
glosses.glossFNs: .i. frisaig .i. attroilli dúnn delegi a nobís .i. dum ausus est quod nullus alius .i. tam facile né illi iniuria sit cum enim aliquid indebite praestatur tunc maxime caritas commendatur ut qualiter sé exhibere debiant recognoscantc
footnotes: c: This gloss is composed of portions of two comments from Pelagius (Olden, p. 11)
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He commends, i.e. He deserves of us diligi a nobis.

glosses.latin: Multo igitur magis iustificati nunc, in sanguine ipsius, salui erimus ab ira superuentura per ipsum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]multo magis suos scire non patitur qui semet ipsum pro impio dedit[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] hóre ronsóirni [GLat]híc a peccatis nostris[/GLat] condanfírianichthi úadib mór ní besnadblamu foir arsóirad [GLat]ab ira futura[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. multo magis suos scire non patitur qui semet ipsum pro impio dedit .i. hóre ronsóirni híc a peccatis nostris condanfírianichthi úadib mór ní besnadblamu foir arsóirad ab ira futura
glosses.glossFNs: .i. multo magis suos scire non patitur qui semet ipsum pro impio dedit .i. hóre ronsóirni híc a peccatis nostris condanfírianichthi úadib mór ní besnadblamu foir arsóirad ab ira futura
footnotes: h: lit. a great thing that our salvation will be readier on Him: cf. cia fíu .i. mór ní (gl. quam) Ml. 17b 12, 146d
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since He saved us híc a peccatis nostris, so that we are justified from them, how much readierh will He be to save us ab ira futura.

glosses.latin: gloriamur in Deo per ... Iesum Christum, per quem reconciliationem accepimus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: gloriamur in Deo per ... Iesum Christum, per quem reconciliationem accepimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. peace with God per, etc.

glosses.latin: Usque ad legem enim peccatum erat in mundo;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without warning and without perception.

glosses.latin: peccatum autem non inputabatur, cum lex non esset.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nipoirgnae ↄtanic [GLat]lex[/GLat] arba [GLat]habens[/GLat][d] [GLat]humanum genus sub suo dominatu[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nipoirgnae ↄtanic lex arba habens humanum genus sub suo dominatu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nipoirgnae ↄtanic lex arba habensd humanum genus sub suo dominatu
footnotes: d: Before habens, which begins a line, stands the contraction for Pelagius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was not evident till (the) Law came, for it was habens etc.

glosses.latin: Sed regnauit mors ab Adam usque ad Moisen etiam in eos qui non peccauerunt in similitudinem praeuaricationis Adae.
footnotes: e: MS. imputebatur
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I say non, etc.

glosses.latin: si enim unius dilicto multi mortui sunt, multo magis ... donum in gratia unius hominis, Iesu Christi, in plures abundauit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] frecre inso [GLat]mentibus heriticorum[/GLat][f] [GLat]dicentium sí adæ dilictum non peccantibus nocuit ergo christi iustitia non credentibus prodest[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. frecre inso mentibus heriticorum dicentium sí adæ dilictum non peccantibus nocuit ergo christi iustitia non credentibus prodest
glosses.glossFNs: .i. frecre inso mentibus heriticorumf dicentium sí adæ dilictum non peccantibus nocuit ergo christi iustitia non credentibus prodest
footnotes: f: i.e. the Pelagians
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is an answer mentibus, etc.

glosses.latin: si enim unius dilicto multi mortui sunt, multo magis ... donum in gratia unius hominis, Iesu Christi, in plures abundauit.
glosses.glossTrans: innumerable.

glosses.latin: nam iudicium ex uno in condempnationem; gratia autem ex multís dilectís in iustificationem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]iudicium[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] tri óenpheccad la adam [GLat]gratia ex multís dilictís[/GLat] la í[Con]s[/Con]u dodóinib
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] iudicium .i. tri óenpheccad la adam gratia ex multís dilictís la ísu dodóinib
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] iudicium .i. tri óenpheccad la adam gratia ex multís dilictís la ísu dodóinib
glosses.glossTrans: iudicium, i.e. (came) through one sin by Adam, gratia ex multis delictis (came) by Jesus for human beings.

glosses.latin: Lex ... subintrauit ... ubi habundauit delictum, superhabundauit gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Lex ... subintrauit ... ubi habundauit delictum, superhabundauit gratia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hodesid[b] forlán triafoilsigud tri recht tanicc iarum [GLat]gratia iesu christi eo quod lex neminem ad perfectum[/GLat][c] [etc]rl.[/etc] [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]Non inputabatur[/GLat] so[Con]m[/Con] ria[Con]m[/Con] fullus fiadchách indectsa
glosses.glossText: .i. hodesid forlán triafoilsigud tri recht tanicc iarum gratia iesu christi eo quod lex neminem ad perfectum rl. [in marg.] Non inputabatur som riam fullus fiadchách indectsa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hodesidb forlán triafoilsigud tri recht tanicc iarum gratia iesu christi eo quod lex neminem ad perfectumc rl. [in marg.] Non inputabatur som riam fullus fiadchách indectsa
footnotes: b: cf. O desid iarom ógi na cretmi la firu Herenn. L.U. 117b 24
c: Heb. vii. 19, where for neminem the Vulgate has nihil
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when it (sin) had been superabundantly established through its manifestation by (the) Law, then came gratia, etc. it non imputabatur previously: (it is) manifest before every one now.

glosses.latin: Ut sicut regnauit peccatum in mortem, ita et gratia regnet per iustitiam in uitam aeternam, per Iesum Christum, Dominum nostrum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was in mortem poenae, etc.

glosses.latin: Ut sicut regnauit peccatum in mortem, ita et gratia regnet per iustitiam in uitam aeternam, per Iesum Christum, Dominum nostrum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be in vitam.

glosses.latin: Ut sicut regnauit peccatum in mortem, ita et gratia regnet per iustitiam in uitam aeternam, per Iesum Christum, Dominum nostrum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] istriit [d]atá[/d] [GLat]gratia et ueritas et uita aeterna[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. istriit atá gratia et ueritas et uita aeterna
glosses.glossFNs: .i. istriit atád gratia et ueritas et uita aeterna
footnotes: d: MS. áta
glosses.glossTrans: it is through Him is gratia, etc.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus? ... ut gratia habundet.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus? ... ut gratia habundet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it may be the more abundant to us.

glosses.latin: Fratres. quicumque babtizati sumus in Christo Iesu, in morte ipsius babtizati sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. O Jews and O faithful Gentiles!

glosses.latin: Fratres. quicumque babtizati sumus in Christo Iesu, in morte ipsius babtizati sumus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iar cosmilius abáis som arincorp marbde frissaroscarso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]in passione[/GLat] nifil taidchur do dochum inchoirpsin acht isicorp spir[Con]táldae[/Con] indeséirgi cenfrescsin báis na hirchri nabíd taidchur dúnni da[Con]no[/Con] donchorp marbdu [GLat]peccati sicut enim corpus constat ex membrís ita peccatum constat ex uitiis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. iar cosmilius abáis som arincorp marbde frissaroscarsom in passione nifil taidchur do dochum inchoirpsin acht isicorp spirtáldae indeséirgi cenfrescsin báis na hirchri nabíd taidchur dúnni dano donchorp marbdu peccati sicut enim corpus constat ex membrís ita peccatum constat ex uitiis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iar cosmilius abáis som arincorp marbde frissaroscarsom in passione nifil taidchur do dochum inchoirpsin acht isicorp spirtáldae indeséirgi cenfrescsin báis na hirchri nabíd taidchur dúnni dano donchorp marbdu peccati sicut enim corpus constat ex membrís ita peccatum constat ex uitiis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. according to the resemblance of His death. For (as to) the mortal body from which He has parted in Passione, there is no return for Him to that body, but it is into the spiritual body of the Resurrection without expectation of death or decay. Let there not, then, be a return for us to the mortal body of peccatam, etc.

glosses.latin: Consepulti enim sumus cum illo per babtismum in mortem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intain diagmani fobaithis iscosmulius aadnacuil acus abáis dúnni
glosses.glossText: .i. intain diagmani fobaithis iscosmulius aadnacuil acus abáis dúnni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intain diagmani fobaithis iscosmulius aadnacuil acus abáis dúnni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when we undergo baptism it is a similitude to us of His burial and His death.

glosses.latin: uetus homo noster simul crucifixus est cum illo, ut distruatur corpus peccati, ut ultra non seruiamus peccato.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is therefore that it has been overcome.

glosses.latin: iam non moritur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but He will be ever-living.

glosses.latin: Quod enim mortuus est peccato, mortuus est semel; quod autem uiuit, uiuit Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] oinecht appec[Con]ad[/Con] am[Con]al[/Con] noinect[e] ro[Con]m[/Con]bebe colinn cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. oinecht appecad amal noinect rombebe colinn crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. oinecht appecad amal noinect<sup>e</sup> rombebe colinn crist
footnotes: e: leg. amal as noinect
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. once out of sin as once Christ’s flesh has died.

glosses.latin: Quod enim mortuus est peccato, mortuus est semel; quod autem uiuit, uiuit Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isbithbeo corp cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]post resurrectionem in gloria dietatis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isbithbeo corp crist post resurrectionem in gloria dietatis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isbithbeo corp crist post resurrectionem in gloria dietatis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Christ’s body is ever-living post, etc.

glosses.latin: existimate, uos mortuos quidem esse peccato, uiuentes autem Deo in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: existimate, uos mortuos quidem esse peccato, uiuentes autem Deo in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] adib mairb arainn pecctha badbii im[Con]murgu[/Con] iní[Con]s[/Con]u cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. adib mairb arainn pecctha badbii immurgu inísu crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. adib mairb arainn pecctha badbii immurgu inísu crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are dead as regards sin: be ye alive, however, in Jesus Christ.

glosses.latin: existimate, uos mortuos quidem esse peccato, uiuentes autem Deo in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] badbithbíi iní[Con]s[/Con]u cr[Con]ist[/Con] hore adabaill doso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]quia ipse uiuus est semper[/GLat][a]
glosses.glossText: .i. badbithbíi inísu crist hore adabaill dosom quia ipse uiuus est semper
glosses.glossFNs: .i. badbithbíi inísu crist hore adabaill dosom quia ipse uiuus est sempera
footnotes: a: Hebr. vii. 25
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye ever-living in Jesus Christ because ye are members of His, quia, etc.

glosses.latin: Non ergo regnet peccatum in uestro mortali corpore, ut oboediatis concupiscentis eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in your mortal desires which cause death unto you.

glosses.latin: Non ergo regnet peccatum in uestro mortali corpore, ut oboediatis concupiscentis eius.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non ergo regnet peccatum in uestro mortali corpore, ut oboediatis concupiscentis eius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] co[Con]m[/Con]bed hed nobed and [GLat]ubi praedicit qui mortui sumus peccato quomodo iterum uiuemus[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. combed hed nobed and ubi praedicit qui mortui sumus peccato quomodo iterum uiuemus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. combed hed nobed and ubi praedicit qui mortui sumus peccato quomodo iterum uiuemusb
footnotes: b: Rom. vi. 2, where for ‘iterum’ the Vulgate has ‘adhuc’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that that should be there.

glosses.latin: Sed neque exhibeatis membra uestra arma iniquitatis peccato.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye shall not display your members in conflict before the Devil.

glosses.latin: non enim sub lege estis, sed sub gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. pardon has been given you per gratiam.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam cui exhibetis uos seruos ad oboediendum, serui estis eius cui oboeditis, siue peccati in mortem, siue oboeditionis, ad iustitiani in iiitain aeternam.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam cui exhibetis uos seruos ad oboediendum, serui estis eius cui oboeditis, siue peccati in mortem, siue oboeditionis, ad iustitiani in iiitain aeternam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] sechiphé imdodia imdopheccad madudia [ie].i.[/ie] doirladugud adibmogæ indísin
glosses.glossText: .i. sechiphé imdodia imdopheccad madudia .i. doirladugud adibmogæ indísin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sechiphé imdodia imdopheccad madudia .i. doirladugud adibmogæ indísin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whosoever it be, whether to God or to sin, if to God, i.e. to obey, ye are servants of Him.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam cui exhibetis uos seruos ad oboediendum, serui estis eius cui oboeditis, siue peccati in mortem, siue oboeditionis, ad iustitiani in iiitain aeternam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of poena: that is its reward.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam cui exhibetis uos seruos ad oboediendum, serui estis eius cui oboeditis, siue peccati in mortem, siue oboeditionis, ad iustitiani in iiitain aeternam.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam cui exhibetis uos seruos ad oboediendum, serui estis eius cui oboeditis, siue peccati in mortem, siue oboeditionis, ad iustitiani in iiitain aeternam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. life eternal, this is its reward.

glosses.latin: Gratias ago autem Deo, quod fuistis serui peccati, oboedistis autem ex corde in eam formam doctrinae, in quam traditi estis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I give thanks to God, that though ye were under sin, ye are not.

glosses.latin: Gratias ago autem Deo, quod fuistis serui peccati, oboedistis autem ex corde in eam formam doctrinae, in quam traditi estis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cibcenél t[Con]ra[/Con] diaroscribad indepistil so doadbadar fomáam [GLat]quoniam dicit serui[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. cibcenél tra diaroscribad indepistil so doadbadar fomáam quoniam dicit serui rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cibcenél tra diaroscribad indepistil so doadbadar fomáam quoniam dicit serui rl.
footnotes: d: The main body of this epistle was sent to different churches, and its termination varied accordingly, Farrar, Messages of the Books, p. 251
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whatever be (the) nation to which this epistle has been writtend, it is shewn (to have been) under a yoke quoniam, etc.

glosses.latin: Gratias ago autem Deo, quod fuistis serui peccati, oboedistis autem ex corde in eam formam doctrinae, in quam traditi estis.
footnotes: c: MS. achis
e: In do-b-im-chom-artt, as in do-mm-im-chom-art, Ml. 39c 32, the com is a perfective prefix
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not necessity that has constrained you<sup>e</sup>, but it is your desire.

glosses.latin: Liberati autem a peccato.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]gratia dei[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ni triib fadéisne [GLat]sed per deum et per gratiam suam[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. gratia dei .i. ni triib fadéisne sed per deum et per gratiam suam
glosses.glossFNs: .i. gratia dei .i. ni triib fadéisne sed per deum et per gratiam suam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not through yourselves, sed, etc.

glosses.latin: Humanum uerbum dico propter infirmitatem carnis uestrae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]quasi dixiset[/GLat] ní dochumacht dúib aforcital forndobcanar [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: quasi dixiset ní dochumacht dúib aforcital forndobcanar rl.
glosses.glossFNs: quasi dixiset ní dochumacht dúib aforcital forndobcanar rl.
footnotes: f: dochumacht, the opposite of sochumacht
glosses.glossTrans: not feeble<sup>f</sup> to you is the teaching by which ye are taught.

glosses.latin: ... exhibuistis membra uestra inmunditiae et iniquitati ... nunc exhibete membra uestra seruire iustitiae in iustificationem.
footnotes: a: MS. docachceneolu, with a curved mark over the e of eo
b: In the MS. the dot is over the initial a
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to every kind of impurity.

glosses.latin: ... exhibuistis membra uestra inmunditiae et iniquitati ... nunc exhibete membra uestra seruire iustitiae in iustificationem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to every kind of iniquity.

glosses.latin: ... exhibuistis membra uestra inmunditiae et iniquitati ... nunc exhibete membra uestra seruire iustitiae in iustificationem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all your members.

glosses.latin: ... exhibuistis membra uestra inmunditiae et iniquitati ... nunc exhibete membra uestra seruire iustitiae in iustificationem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to justify yourselves.

glosses.latin: ... exhibuistis membra uestra inmunditiae et iniquitati ... nunc exhibete membra uestra seruire iustitiae in iustificationem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ced ed t[Con]ra[/Con] fodeud amal foruigensid dopeccad fognid dofírinni [GLat]et[/GLat] beded noibde
glosses.glossText: .i. ced ed tra fodeud amal foruigensid dopeccad fognid dofírinni et beded noibde
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ced ed tra fodeud amal foruigensid dopeccad fognid dofírinni et beded noibde
footnotes: e: leg. bed nóib de, ‘be holy therefrom’? J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is it then finally? As ye have served sin serve righteousness, and be sanctified<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Quern ergo fructum habuistis? nam finis illorum mors est.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quern ergo fructum habuistis? nam finis illorum mors est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdedbir dúib cidmebul lib ataidmet [GLat]nam finis[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. isdedbir dúib cidmebul lib ataidmet nam finis rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdedbir dúib cidmebul lib ataidmet nam finis rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is reasonable that ye should be ashamed to call them to remembrance, nam, etc.

glosses.latin: habetis fructum uestrum in sanctificationem; finem uero uitam aeternam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that will be unto sanctification to you.

glosses.latin: Stipendia enim peccati mors; gratia autem [Dei] uita aeterna in Christo Iesu Domino nostro.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]In summo marg.[/Com] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] fochricci [GLat]et[/GLat] ni cumme són ... fri ...... firinne [GLat]stipendium[/GLat] didiu ainm indlóge doberr domiledaib armílte
glosses.glossText: [In summo marg.] ɫ. fochricci et ni cumme són ... fri ...... firinne stipendium didiu ainm indlóge doberr domiledaib armílte
glosses.glossFNs: [In summo marg.] ɫ. fochricci et ni cumme són ... fri ...... firinne stipendium didiu ainm indlóge doberr domiledaib armílte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. wages, and not the same (is) that ... righteousness. Stipendium, then, is the name of the pay that is given to soldiers for military service.

glosses.latin: Stipendia enim peccati mors; gratia autem [Dei] uita aeterna in Christo Iesu Domino nostro.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] trichretim iní[Con]s[/Con]u [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isinbeothu itáa í[Con]s[/Con]u iarnesséirgu
glosses.glossText: .i. trichretim inísu ɫ. isinbeothu itáa ísu iarnesséirgu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. trichretim inísu ɫ. isinbeothu itáa ísu iarnesséirgu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through belief in Jesus, or in the life wherein Jesus is after resurrection.

glosses.latin: An ignor͘atis? scientibus enim legem loquor. lex in homine dominatus quanto tempore uiuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. do ye doubt this?

glosses.latin: An ignor͘atis? scientibus enim legem loquor. lex in homine dominatus quanto tempore uiuit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] accaldam auctor indrecto inso [ie].i.[/ie] ismaith intóis éula doaccalda[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. accaldam auctor indrecto inso .i. ismaith intóis éula doaccaldam
glosses.glossFNs: .i. accaldam auctor indrecto inso .i. ismaith intóis éula doaccaldam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this (is) an address to the teachers of the Law, i.e. it is good to address the wise folk.

glosses.latin: An ignor͘atis? scientibus enim legem loquor. lex in homine dominatus quanto tempore uiuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be it it long, be it it short.

glosses.latin: Nam quae sub uiro est mulier.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is to him (the husband) I compare it (the Law).

glosses.latin: uiuente uiro. cum alio uiro. ut non sit adultera si fuerit cum alio uiro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. her lawful husband.

glosses.latin: uiuente uiro. cum alio uiro. ut non sit adultera si fuerit cum alio uiro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to an unlawful husband.

glosses.latin: uiuente uiro. cum alio uiro. ut non sit adultera si fuerit cum alio uiro.
glosses.glossTrans: so that she should be adultera.

glosses.latin: uiuente uiro. cum alio uiro. ut non sit adultera si fuerit cum alio uiro.
footnotes: c: = ciabeid, cf. Wb. 12b 10, Cod. Cam. 37d
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though she be.

glosses.latin: mortificati estis legi per corpus Christi, ut sitis altirius, qui ex mortuis resurrexit, ut fructificemus Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of service.

glosses.latin: mortificati estis legi per corpus Christi, ut sitis altirius, qui ex mortuis resurrexit, ut fructificemus Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not adultery for you.

glosses.latin: mortificati estis legi per corpus Christi, ut sitis altirius, qui ex mortuis resurrexit, ut fructificemus Deo.
footnotes: d: = ad-d-comla
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he joins Himself to them now.

glosses.latin: passioues peccatorum, quae per legem erant, operabantur in membris nostris, ut fructificarent morti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] robtar hesid[a] aidmi oipretho pectho intainsin
glosses.glossText: .i. robtar hesid aidmi oipretho pectho intainsin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. robtar hesid<sup>a</sup> aidmi oipretho pectho intainsin
footnotes: a: leg. hésidi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have been instruments of committing sin then.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem soluti sumus a lege mortis, in qua detenbamur; ita ut seruiamus in nouitate spiritus, et non iu uetustate literae
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in nouo[/GLat] hore nádmair peccad diaforgénsa[Con]m[/Con] cose is heside dorárricc báas dúnni
glosses.glossText: .i. in nouo hore nádmair peccad diaforgénsam cose is heside dorárricc báas dúnni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in nouo hore nádmair peccad diaforgénsam cose is heside dorárricc báas dúnni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in novo, since sin which we have served hitherto remains not: it is this that has caused death to us.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem soluti sumus a lege mortis, in qua detenbamur; ita ut seruiamus in nouitate spiritus, et non iu uetustate literae
footnotes: c: comairbirt for comairbirt biuth consuetudo. See Tur. 4a. Z2. 918
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in a new way of life<sup>c</sup>, after confession of faith, without sin.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem soluti sumus a lege mortis, in qua detenbamur; ita ut seruiamus in nouitate spiritus, et non iu uetustate literae
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not in the old way of life under sin.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo? Lex peccatum est? Absit. Sed peccatum non cognoui nisi per legem. Nam concupiscentiam nesciebam nisi léx diceret: non concupisces.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo? Lex peccatum est? Absit. Sed peccatum non cognoui nisi per legem. Nam concupiscentiam nesciebam nisi léx diceret: non concupisces.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it sin? non.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo? Lex peccatum est? Absit. Sed peccatum non cognoui nisi per legem. Nam concupiscentiam nesciebam nisi léx diceret: non concupisces.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it be sin.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo? Lex peccatum est? Absit. Sed peccatum non cognoui nisi per legem. Nam concupiscentiam nesciebam nisi léx diceret: non concupisces.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isairi asberar [GLat]lex peccati[/GLat] hóre donadbat pecthu [GLat]ex persona uiuentis sub lege dicit pelagius peccatum esse non sensi[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. isairi asberar lex peccati hóre donadbat pecthu ex persona uiuentis sub lege dicit pelagius peccatum esse non sensi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isairi asberar lex peccati hóre donadbat pecthu ex persona uiuentis sub lege dicit pelagius peccatum esse non sensib
footnotes: b: Not in Migne
