glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore lex peccati is said, because it manifests sins ex persona, etc.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo? Lex peccatum est? Absit. Sed peccatum non cognoui nisi per legem. Nam concupiscentiam nesciebam nisi léx diceret: non concupisces.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isindectsa rafetarsa aspeccad comaccobor hore adrograd
glosses.glossText: .i. isindectsa rafetarsa aspeccad comaccobor hore adrograd
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isindectsa rafetarsa aspeccad comaccobor hore adrograd
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is now I know it, that concupiscence is sin because it has been forbidden.

glosses.latin: Occasione uero accepta, peccatum per mandatum operatum IO est in ine omnem concupiscentiam; sine lege enim peccatum mortuum erat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the prohibition has been the cause of the doing by sin.

glosses.latin: Occasione uero accepta, peccatum per mandatum operatum IO est in ine omnem concupiscentiam; sine lege enim peccatum mortuum erat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the mandatum has been violated in it.

glosses.latin: Occasione uero accepta, peccatum per mandatum operatum IO est in ine omnem concupiscentiam; sine lege enim peccatum mortuum erat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ishé inpeccad rogéni anuile comaccobor [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] na co[Con]m[/Con]accobor ararograd irect ragéni peccad [GLat]in mé et[/GLat] rosariged [GLat]mandatum legis[/GLat] occa
glosses.glossText: .i. ishé inpeccad rogéni anuile comaccobor [in marg.] .i. na comaccobor ararograd irect ragéni peccad in mé et rosariged mandatum legis occa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishé inpeccad rogéni anuile comaccobor [in marg.] .i. na comaccobor ararograd irect ragéni peccad in mé et rosariged mandatum legis occa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is sin which has wrought every concupiscence, i.e. any concupiscence which had been forbidden in (the) Law sin has wrought it in me, and the mundatum Legis has been violated in it.

glosses.latin: Occasione uero accepta, peccatum per mandatum operatum IO est in ine omnem concupiscentiam; sine lege enim peccatum mortuum erat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doménarsa ba marb peccad hore nán rairigsiur
glosses.glossText: .i. doménarsa ba marb peccad hore nán rairigsiur
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doménarsa ba marb peccad hore nán rairigsiur
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I thought that sin was dead because I had not perceived it.

glosses.latin: Ego autem uiuebam sine lege aliquando.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doménarsa ropsa beo intain nádrairigsiur peccad ↄdanicc recht
glosses.glossText: .i. doménarsa ropsa beo intain nádrairigsiur peccad ↄdanicc recht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doménarsa ropsa beo intain nádrairigsiur peccad ↄdanicc recht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I thought that I was alive when I had not perceived sin, till (the) Law came.

glosses.latin: inuentum est mihi mandatum, quod erat ad uitam, hoc esse ad mortem.
footnotes: d: díanchomalninn = dían-d-chomalninn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it would have been life to me if I fulfilled it<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: inuentum est mihi mandatum, quod erat ad uitam, hoc esse ad mortem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. transgressing it has caused death to me.

glosses.latin: Nam peccatum, occasone accepta per mandatum, seduxit me.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I do it after it has been forbidden, i.e. non, etc.

glosses.latin: Itaque lex quidem sancta, et mandatum sanctum, et iustum, et bonum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] brithemnact inso [GLat]et[/GLat]frecre dondi asrobrad [GLat]quid ergo dicemus[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. brithemnact inso etfrecre dondi asrobrad quid ergo dicemus rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. brithemnact inso etfrecre dondi asrobrad quid ergo dicemus rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a judgment, this, and an answer to that which has been said quid ergo, etc. [c. vii, v. 7].

glosses.latin: Quod ergo bonum est, mihi factum est mors? Absit. Sed peccatum ut apareat peccatum per bonum mihi operatum est mortem; ut fiat supra modum peccans peccatum per mandatum legis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it?

glosses.latin: Quod ergo bonum est, mihi factum est mors? Absit. Sed peccatum ut apareat peccatum per bonum mihi operatum est mortem; ut fiat supra modum peccans peccatum per mandatum legis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ined fodera báas do[Con]m[/Con]sa atimne sainemail sin
glosses.glossText: .i. ined fodera báas domsa atimne sainemail sin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ined fodera báas domsa atimne sainemail sin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is what causes death to me that excellent commandment?

glosses.latin: Quod ergo bonum est, mihi factum est mors? Absit. Sed peccatum ut apareat peccatum per bonum mihi operatum est mortem; ut fiat supra modum peccans peccatum per mandatum legis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. non mandatum which causes death to me.

glosses.latin: Quod ergo bonum est, mihi factum est mors? Absit. Sed peccatum ut apareat peccatum per bonum mihi operatum est mortem; ut fiat supra modum peccans peccatum per mandatum legis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is more after being perceived quam ante.

glosses.latin: Quod ergo bonum est, mihi factum est mors? Absit. Sed peccatum ut apareat peccatum per bonum mihi operatum est mortem; ut fiat supra modum peccans peccatum per mandatum legis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in transgression of the commandment of (the) Law sin is committed.

glosses.latin: ego autem carnalis sum, uenundatus sub peccato.
footnotes: c: Migne, col. 703
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since Adam transgressed (God’s) will.

glosses.latin: ego autem carnalis sum, uenundatus sub peccato.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ab adam[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] romrir mothol cholnide condu[Con]m[/Con]fel fomám pectho
glosses.glossText: .i. ab adam ɫ. romrir mothol cholnide condumfel fomám pectho
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ab adam ɫ. romrir mothol cholnide condumfel fomám pectho
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from Adam: or my carnal desire has sold me, so that I am under the yoke of sin.

glosses.latin: Quod enim operor non intellego.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from desire of my flesh.

glosses.latin: Si autem quod nolo illud facio.
footnotes: d: cf. Ml. 68d 15, Sg. 40a 21
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though if I do it.

glosses.latin: Scio enim quia non habitat in me, hoc est in carne mea, bonum. Nam uoluntas bene faciendi adiacet mihi: perfecere autem bonum, non inuenio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not the flesh that he censures, but it is the longing.

glosses.latin: Scio enim quia non habitat in me, hoc est in carne mea, bonum. Nam uoluntas bene faciendi adiacet mihi: perfecere autem bonum, non inuenio.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni síratrab act is cuit fresligi
glosses.glossText: .i. ni síratrab act is cuit fresligi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni síratrab act is cuit fresligi
footnotes: g: cf. Wb. 13a 23
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not a continual dwelling, but a mere adjacence<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Scio enim quia non habitat in me, hoc est in carne mea, bonum. Nam uoluntas bene faciendi adiacet mihi: perfecere autem bonum, non inuenio.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished a[GLat]perficire[/GLat] lesso[Con]m[/Con] forbe indagimrata centetarcor drogimrato
glosses.glossText: .i. ished aperficire lessom forbe indagimrata centetarcor drogimrato
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished aperficire lessom forbe indagimrata centetarcor drogimrato
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this he deems perficere, the completion of the good intention without interposing an evil intention.

glosses.latin: sed quod nolo malum, hoc ago.
footnotes: e: cf. Ml. 128d 11
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. opus of transgression, but it is with respect to meditation and not to completing it.

glosses.latin: Si autem quod nolo illud facio.
footnotes: f: It is not certain to what words this gloss refers
glosses.glossTrans: the deed carne, etc.

glosses.latin: Inuenio igitur legem resistentem uolenti mihi facere bonum quoniam mihi malum adiacet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a mere finding however; it gets not leadership.

glosses.latin: Condilector enim legi Dei secundum interiorem hominem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Condilector enim legi Dei secundum interiorem hominem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is suaichnid sund t[Con]ra[/Con] asrect maid asmbeir do airiuc túas
glosses.glossText: .i. is suaichnid sund tra asrect maid asmbeir do airiuc túas
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is suaichnid sund tra asrect maid asmbeir do airiuc túas
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is obvious here, then, that it is a good law, which he says above he has found.

glosses.latin: Condilector enim legi Dei secundum interiorem hominem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issí indainim asairlam[b] dochomalnad recto dé ní incorpp
glosses.glossText: .i. issí indainim asairlam dochomalnad recto dé ní incorpp
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issí indainim asairlam<sup>b</sup> dochomalnad recto dé ní incorpp
footnotes: b: MS. aslam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is the soul that is ready to fulfil God’s law, not the body.

glosses.latin: Uideo autem aliam legem in membrís meís, repugnantem legi mentis meae, et captiuantem me in lege peccati, quae est in membrís meís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ready to do evil.

glosses.latin: Uideo autem aliam legem in membrís meís, repugnantem legi mentis meae, et captiuantem me in lege peccati, quae est in membrís meís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] accobor lammenmuin maid doimradud act nandléicci[c] [GLat]concupiscentia carnalis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. accobor lammenmuin maid doimradud act nandléicci concupiscentia carnalis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. accobor lammenmuin maid doimradud act nandléiccic concupiscentia carnalis
footnotes: c: For act ná cf. LU. 134a 11, YBL. 278c 30, Laws, IV. 36
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. my mind has a longing to intend good, only that concupiscentia carnalis does not allow it.

glosses.latin: Uideo autem aliam legem in membrís meís, repugnantem legi mentis meae, et captiuantem me in lege peccati, quae est in membrís meís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]is[Con]idorus[/Con] quasi dixiset in lege sua[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] hirect fognamo dopheccad
glosses.glossText: .i. isidorus quasi dixiset in lege sua .i. hirect fognamo dopheccad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isidorus quasi dixiset in lege sua .i. hirect fognamo dopheccad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Isidorus: quasi, etc., i.e. in (the) law of service to sin.

glosses.latin: Uideo autem aliam legem in membrís meís, repugnantem legi mentis meae, et captiuantem me in lege peccati, quae est in membrís meís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is it (the law of sin) that gets leadership in membris meis.

glosses.latin: Infelex ego homo! quis me liberabit de corpore mortis huius? 25. Gratia Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (no power,) unless God’s grace should help me: it will do it, however.

glosses.latin: Nihil ergo nunc dampnationis est hiis qui sunt in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. here nor there (i.e. beyond the grave).

glosses.latin: Nihil ergo nunc dampnationis est hiis qui sunt in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is they who believe in Jesus.

glosses.latin: Lex enim spiritus uitae in Christo Iesu liberabit me a lege peccati et mortis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]spiritalis léx[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] doáirci bethid dúnni trichreti[Con]m[/Con] iní[Con]s[/Con]u cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. spiritalis léx .i. doáirci bethid dúnni trichretim inísu crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. spiritalis léx .i. doáirci bethid dúnni trichretim inísu crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it causes life to us through belief in Jesus Christ.

glosses.latin: Lex enim spiritus uitae in Christo Iesu liberabit me a lege peccati et mortis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the law of the spirit has delivered me from the law of sin.

glosses.latin: Lex enim spiritus uitae in Christo Iesu liberabit me a lege peccati et mortis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (the law) of Moses: ’tis through it has been shown sin through which is death.

glosses.latin: Nam quod inpossibile erat legi, in similitudinem carnis peccatí, et de peccato damnauit peccatum in carne.
footnotes: d: Hanc glossam ab alia manu ac scribae codicis glossatorisque scriptam esse ex ductu atque atramento apparet.–Zimmer, who omits sin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. complete accomplishment of that justification.

glosses.latin: Nam quod inpossibile erat legi, in similitudinem carnis peccatí, et de peccato damnauit peccatum in carne.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. into likeness of flesh wherein has been sin.

glosses.latin: Nam quod inpossibile erat legi, in similitudinem carnis peccatí, et de peccato damnauit peccatum in carne.
footnotes: e: leg. fodite ‘endurance,’ Sarauw; but the meaning seems to be: in the confession which consisted in the suffering of His flesh.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in confession of suffering by His flesh.

glosses.latin: Ut iustificatio legis inpleretur in nobis. Secundum ambulamus spiritum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. any justification which was made in the Law.

glosses.latin: Ut iustificatio legis inpleretur in nobis. Secundum ambulamus spiritum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it might be fulfilled in us.

glosses.latin: Ut iustificatio legis inpleretur in nobis. Secundum ambulamus spiritum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is in that wise we shall be holy.

glosses.latin: Qui enim secundum carnem sunt, quae carni sunt sapiunt. Qui uero secundum spiritum [sunt], quae sunt spiritus sapiunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for not easy is it (to make) saints of them.

glosses.latin: Qui enim secundum carnem sunt, quae carni sunt sapiunt. Qui uero secundum spiritum [sunt], quae sunt spiritus sapiunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is they, however, who shall be saved.

glosses.latin: Nam prudentia carnis mors est; prudentia autem spiritus uita et pax.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]mali uicem reddere[/GLat] issí didiu trebaire chollno cecha dethidnea domundi doimradud cen imradud nanemde
glosses.glossText: .i. mali uicem reddere issí didiu trebaire chollno cecha dethidnea domundi doimradud cen imradud nanemde
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mali uicem reddere issí didiu trebaire chollno cecha dethidnea domundi doimradud cen imradud nanemde
footnotes: f: φρόνημα σαρκός, the ‘carnal mind’ of the A. V.
glosses.glossTrans: this then is ‘prudence of the flesh<sup>f</sup>,’ to consider all mundane cares without considering the heavenly.

glosses.latin: Nam prudentia carnis mors est; prudentia autem spiritus uita et pax.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be life.

glosses.latin: Nam prudentia carnis mors est; prudentia autem spiritus uita et pax.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be peace towards God.

glosses.latin: Quoniam sapientia carnis inimica est Deo, legi enim Dei non est subiecta, nec enim potest.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is hatred to God.

glosses.latin: Quoniam sapientia carnis inimica est Deo, legi enim Dei non est subiecta, nec enim potest.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] atá dethiden fuiri cene [ie].i.[/ie] imradud inna réte domunde[a]
glosses.glossText: .i. atá dethiden fuiri cene .i. imradud inna réte domunde
glosses.glossFNs: .i. atá dethiden fuiri cene .i. imradud inna réte domunde<sup>a</sup>
footnotes: a: leg. ndomunde
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is care on it, besides, to wit, consideration of the mundane things.

glosses.latin: Uos autem in carne non estis, sed in spiritu; si tamen Spiritus Dei habitat in uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Uos autem in carne non estis, sed in spiritu; si tamen Spiritus Dei habitat in uobis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] fobésad cech dachp[Con]re[/Con]cep[Con]toro[/Con] molid [GLat]et[/GLat] álgenigid resíu rocúrsacha
glosses.glossText: .i. fobésad cech dachpreceptoro molid et álgenigid resíu rocúrsacha
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fobésad cech dachpreceptoro molid et álgenigid resíu rocúrsacha
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. according to the practice of every good preceptor, he praises and soothes before he reprimands.

glosses.latin: Uos autem in carne non estis, sed in spiritu; si tamen Spiritus Dei habitat in uobis.
footnotes: b: Cf. barafie duib Wb. 11d 5 (ad 1 Corinth. xi. 22), isarafie dúnn Wb. 25c 9 (ad 1 Thessalon. v. 9). is arafia dom, Pal. 68 (supra, p. 3, where it is mistranslated), is arafiad duitsi, Lismore Lives, 1. 2180
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is in your power, not base is your life.

glosses.latin: Uos autem in carne non estis, sed in spiritu; si tamen Spiritus Dei habitat in uobis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isamlid cammaib ataidsi [GLat]in spiritu et[/GLat] isasse dúib maid do denu[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. isamlid cammaib ataidsi in spiritu et isasse dúib maid do denum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isamlid cammaib ataidsi in spiritu et isasse dúib maid do denum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus, however, that ye are, in spiritu, and it is easy for you to do good.

glosses.latin: Si autem Christus in uobis est, corpus quidem mortuum est propter peccatum, spiritus uero uiuit propter iustificationem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it may not commit sin.

glosses.latin: Si autem Christus in uobis est, corpus quidem mortuum est propter peccatum, spiritus uero uiuit propter iustificationem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciabeid cr[Con]ist[/Con] indibsi trefóisitin hirisse [GLat]in babtismo et[/GLat] isbeo[c] indanim trisodin is marb incorp im[Con]murgu[/Con] trisnasen[d]pecthu[/d] cerudglanta[e] tribathis níta cumacc do cháingním condid diusgea inspirut nóib
glosses.glossText: .i. ciabeid crist indibsi trefóisitin hirisse in babtismo et isbeo indanim trisodin is marb incorp immurgu trisnasenpecthu cerudglanta tribathis níta cumacc do cháingním condid diusgea inspirut nóib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciabeid crist indibsi trefóisitin hirisse in babtismo et isbeoc indanim trisodin is marb incorp immurgu trisnasenpecthud cerudglantae tribathis níta cumacc do cháingním condid diusgea inspirut nóib
footnotes: c: For the subjunctive followed by the indicative in the conditional sentence, cf. 13 a 12
d: MS. -pectu
e: leg. -glante?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though Christ be in you through confession of faith in baptismo, and the soul is thereby alive, the body nevertheless is dead through the old sins. Though it should have been cleansed through baptism, it is not able to do well until the Holy Spirit awake it.

glosses.latin: qui suscitauit Iesum a mortuis, habitat in uobís ... uiuificabit et corpora uestra mortalia propter inhabitantem Spiritum eius in uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for that guest-house of the Spirit will not be base.

glosses.latin: Ergo, fratres, debetores sumus non carni, ut secundum carnem uiuamus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nitat pecthi collnidi híccatar and indechtso cebtar hé ria[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. nitat pecthi collnidi híccatar and indechtso cebtar hé riam
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nitat pecthi collnidi híccatar and indechtso cebtar hé riam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not fleshly sins which are paid for there now, though it was they before.

glosses.latin: Ergo, fratres, debetores sumus non carni, ut secundum carnem uiuamus.
glosses.glossTrans: that we should do the deeds of flesh ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Ergo, fratres, debetores sumus non carni, ut secundum carnem uiuamus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cenutad suíre dlegtir féich dúib [GLat]et[/GLat] dún huili atco[Con]m[/Con]lasom friu ardislemnethu[a] de dohícc innafíach
glosses.glossText: .i. cenutad suíre dlegtir féich dúib et dún huili atcomlasom friu ardislemnethu de dohícc innafíach
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cenutad suíre dlegtir féich dúib et dún huili atcomlasom friu ardislemnethua de dohícc innafíach
footnotes: a: leg. ardis slemnethu or lemnethu, Pedersen
g: cf. suir .i. erasa, Gorm. Mart. Sept. 2, .i. urasa, ibid. Dec. 20.
glosses.glossTrans: though ye are at ease(?)<sup>g</sup>, debts are owed by you and by us all. He adds himself to them that they may be the willinger to pay the debts.

glosses.latin: Si enim secundum carnem uixeritis, moriemini: si autem spiritu facta carnis mortificaueritis uiuetis.
footnotes: h: Pelagius is said to have held that the death of the body was not penal, and that Adam would have died whether he had sinned or not
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a penal death<sup>h</sup>.

glosses.latin: Si enim secundum carnem uixeritis, moriemini: si autem spiritu facta carnis mortificaueritis uiuetis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. killing them therefore were not regrettable.

glosses.latin: Si enim secundum carnem uixeritis, moriemini: si autem spiritu facta carnis mortificaueritis uiuetis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]uita aeterna[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] bidsamlid bid bidbethu mamarbitir [GLat]facta carnis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. uita aeterna .i. bidsamlid bid bidbethu mamarbitir facta carnis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. uita aeterna .i. bidsamlid bid bidbethu mamarbitir facta carnis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thus it will be life eternal if facta carnis be slain.

glosses.latin: Quicumque enim Spiritu Dei aguntur ii sunt filii Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conirchloit[Con]er[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] madhé áluum [GLat]ut di filio dicitur agebatur a spiritu[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. conirchloiter .i. madhé áluum ut di filio dicitur agebatur a spiritu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conirchloiter .i. madhé áluum ut di filio dicitur agebatur a spiritu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. are driven, i.e. if He be their pilot, ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Ipse enim Spiritus testimonium reddit spiritui nostro, quod sumus filii Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this then is the testimonium, etc.

glosses.latin: coheredes autem Christi, si tamen compatimur ut et simul glorificemur.
footnotes: b: In the MS. cororannam comes after erimus in gl. 17
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may part His heritage with Christ.

glosses.latin: coheredes autem Christi, si tamen compatimur ut et simul glorificemur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]qui similis ei erimus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] isamlid bami[GLat]coeheredes[/GLat] [c]máconfodmam[/c] am[Con]al[/Con] cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]uel cum Christo uel inuicem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. qui similis ei erimus .i. isamlid bamicoeheredes máconfodmam amal crist uel cum Christo uel inuicem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. qui similis ei erimus .i. isamlid bamicoeheredes máconfodmamc amal crist uel cum Christo uel inuicem
footnotes: c: MS. máconfodma
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus we shall be co-heirs if we suffer together like Christ, vel, etc.

glosses.latin: coheredes autem Christi, si tamen compatimur ut et simul glorificemur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indindocbál doratad docr[Con]ist[/Con] condartar dúnni less [GLat]ut scimus quoniam cum apparuerit similis ei erimus[/GLat][d]
glosses.glossText: .i. indindocbál doratad docrist condartar dúnni less ut scimus quoniam cum apparuerit similis ei erimus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indindocbál doratad docrist condartar dúnni less ut scimus quoniam cum apparuerit similis ei erimusd
footnotes: d: 1 John iii. 2
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the glory which has been given to Christ that it may be given to us by Him. ut, etc.

glosses.latin: expectatio creaturae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it is expectation in which it (the creature) is.

glosses.latin: subiecta est non uolens.
footnotes: e: In codice legitur mainbǽicin cum d supra a ante accentum acutum scripto, Zimmer
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless for necessity.

glosses.latin: in libertatem gloriae filiorum Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to serve filiis Dei.

glosses.latin: omnis creatura congemescit.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: nos ingemescimus
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Spes autem quae uidetur, non est spes, nam quod uidet quis, quid sperat?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is in invisible things that spes is wont to be.

glosses.latin: Spes autem quae uidetur, non est spes, nam quod uidet quis, quid sperat?
footnotes: f: MS. anifrescsiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for that which the eye sees is not hope.

glosses.latin: per patientiam expectamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. needful is patience in it.

glosses.latin: Similiter autem et Spiritus adiuuat infirmitatem nostram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] isand didiu fortéit [GLat]spiritus[/GLat] arnénirtini intain bes ninun accobor lenn [ie].i.[/ie] lacorp [GLat]et[/GLat] anim [GLat]et[/GLat] laspirut. coir irnigde t[Con]ra[/Con] inso act níchumcamni ón mani thinib inspirut. isamlid t[Con]ra[/Con] islobur arnirnigde ni matréte frecndirci gesme [GLat]et[/GLat] ninfortéitni inspirut ocsuidiu ished didiu forthéit inspirut intain guidmeni inducbáil diarcorp [GLat]et[/GLat] diarnanimm iarnesséirgiu
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] isand didiu fortéit spiritus arnénirtini intain bes ninun accobor lenn .i. lacorp et anim et laspirut. coir irnigde tra inso act níchumcamni ón mani thinib inspirut. isamlid tra islobur arnirnigde ni matréte frecndirci gesme et ninfortéitni inspirut ocsuidiu ished didiu forthéit inspirut intain guidmeni inducbáil diarcorp et diarnanimm iarnesséirgiu
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] isand didiu fortéit spiritus arnénirtini intain bes ninun accobor lenn .i. lacorp et anim et laspirut. coir irnigde tra inso act níchumcamni ón mani thinib inspirut. isamlid tra islobur arnirnigde ni matréte frecndirci gesme et ninfortéitni inspirut ocsuidiu ished didiu forthéit inspirut intain guidmeni inducbáil diarcorp et diarnanimm iarnesséirgiu
footnotes: e: see 1 Thess. v. 23
glosses.glossTrans: so it is then that Spiritus helps our weakness when we have the same desire, to wit, body and soul and spirite. This, then, is the right way of prayer, but we cannot do that unless the Spirit inspire it: thus then our prayer is feeble if they be present things which we ask, and the Spirit helps us not herein: then doth the Spirit help when we beseech glory for our body and for our soul after resurrection.

glosses.latin: sed ipse spiritus postulat pro nobís gemitibus inenarrabilibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [Res]ferid inne[a][/Res]tirchorsa inspirut nóib is heside as eola
glosses.glossText: .i. (ferid inne)tirchorsa inspirut nóib is heside as eola
glosses.glossFNs: .i. (ferid inne<sup>a</sup>)tirchorsa inspirut nóib is heside as eola
footnotes: a: suppl. W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Holy Spirit makes this intercession, it is He that knows.

glosses.latin: sed ipse spiritus postulat pro nobís gemitibus inenarrabilibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]qui enarrari non possunt[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nád ↄtagad inaisndis [GLat]sed occulta [Con]con[/Con]pungtione cordis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. qui enarrari non possunt .i. nád ↄtagad inaisndis sed occulta conpungtione cordis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. qui enarrari non possunt .i. nád ↄtagad inaisndis sed occulta conpungtione cordis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which ...... in speech sed, etc.

glosses.latin: Qui autem scrutatur corda, scit quid desiderat Spiritus, quia secundum Deum postulat pro sanctis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] asbeirso[Con]m[/Con] anaccobor donspirut hóre doninfet anaccobor donduini
glosses.glossText: .i. asbeirsom anaccobor donspirut hóre doninfet anaccobor donduini
glosses.glossFNs: .i. asbeirsom anaccobor donspirut hóre doninfet anaccobor donduini
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he ascribes the desire to the Spirit, because It inspires the desire to man.

glosses.latin: Qui autem scrutatur corda, scit quid desiderat Spiritus, quia secundum Deum postulat pro sanctis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aní asmaith ladia doguidi ished tinfetso[Con]m[/Con] dianóibaib
glosses.glossText: .i. aní asmaith ladia doguidi ished tinfetsom dianóibaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aní asmaith ladia doguidi ished tinfetsom dianóibaib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that which God would have (us) pray for is that with which He inspires His saints.

glosses.latin: Scimus enim quoniam diligentibus Deum omnia concurrunt in bonum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quaecumque fecerimus propter dilectionem dei[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] dí sóinmechaib [GLat]et[/GLat] dóinmechaib
glosses.glossText: .i. quaecumque fecerimus propter dilectionem dei .i. dí sóinmechaib et dóinmechaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. quaecumque fecerimus propter dilectionem dei .i. dí sóinmechaib et dóinmechaib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of prosperous things and calamitous.

glosses.latin: Scimus enim quoniam diligentibus Deum omnia concurrunt in bonum.
footnotes: b: leg., with Thurneysen, ronbia, which is translated
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we shall have glory for it.

glosses.latin: Nam quos ... praedistinauit conformes fieri imaginis Filii sui, ut sit ipse primogenitus in multís fratribus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these whom.

glosses.latin: Nam quos ... praedistinauit conformes fieri imaginis Filii sui, ut sit ipse primogenitus in multís fratribus.
footnotes: c: leg., with Thurneysen, remirérchóil
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nam quos ... praedistinauit conformes fieri imaginis Filii sui, ut sit ipse primogenitus in multís fratribus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]primogenitus ex mortuis[/GLat][d] [GLat]et in gloria[/GLat] p[Con]ri[/Con]mgeinde so[Con]m[/Con] dohireschaib inheséirgiu [GLat]et[/GLat] ináiritiu indocbále
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: primogenitus ex mortuis et in gloria primgeinde som dohireschaib inheséirgiu et ináiritiu indocbále
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: primogenitus ex mortuisd et in gloria primgeinde som dohireschaib inheséirgiu et ináiritiu indocbále
footnotes: d: Coloss. i. 18
f: see 1 Pet. i. 21
glosses.glossTrans: first-born (is) He of the faithful in resurrection and in the reception of glory<sup>f</sup>

glosses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus ad haec? Si Deus pro nobis, quis contra nos?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isuisse asercc dorat mór dimaid duún
glosses.glossText: .i. isuisse asercc dorat mór dimaid duún
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isuisse asercc dorat mór dimaid duún
footnotes: g: 1 John iv. 19
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is just to love Him: He has given us much of good<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus ad haec? Si Deus pro nobis, quis contra nos?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre attá innarleid cia conicc ní dúun isfollus is[GLat]pro nobís[/GLat] ní [GLat]contra[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre attá innarleid cia conicc ní dúun isfollus ispro nobís ní contra
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre attá innarleid cia conicc ní dúun isfollus ispro nobís ní contra
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because He is with us, who can do aught unto us? It is manifest He is pro nobis not contra.

glosses.latin: Qui etiam proprio Filio non pepercit, sed pro nobis omnibus tradidit illum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He was not dear to Him in our case(?).

glosses.latin: Qui etiam proprio Filio non pepercit, sed pro nobis omnibus tradidit illum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni ar oénfer na diis rocess [GLat]s[Con]ed[/Con] pro omnibus[/GLat] cerudbói [GLat]iudas et[/GLat]cerudbatar [GLat]iudei[/GLat] occathindnaculso[Con]m[/Con] nímariccfed manitindnised intathir nemde
glosses.glossText: .i. ni ar oénfer na diis rocess sed pro omnibus cerudbói iudas etcerudbatar iudei occathindnaculsom nímariccfed manitindnised intathir nemde
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni ar oénfer na diis rocess sed pro omnibus cerudbói iudas etcerudbatar iudei occathindnaculsom nímariccfed manitindnised intathir nemde
footnotes: d: see Acts ii. 23, John xix. 11.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for one man or two did He suffer, but pro omnibus. Though Judas was, and though Iudaei were, delivering Him up, it would not have succeeded had not the heavenly Father given Himd.

glosses.latin: Quis accussabit aduersus electos Dei? Deus qui iustificat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] india indoichside do náde nídoich ar [GLat]qui iustificat[/GLat] isdochu do [GLat]quam contempnere[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. india indoichside do náde nídoich ar qui iustificat isdochu do quam contempnere
glosses.glossFNs: .i. india indoichside do náde nídoich ar qui iustificat isdochu do quam contempnere
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it God? is it likely of Him? nay, (it is) not likely, for qui iustificat is more likely to do that (iustificare) quam contemnere.

glosses.latin: Quis est qui contempnet? Simul autem Iesus Christus qui mortuus est, immo qui resurrexit, qui est in dextera Dei, qui etiam interpellat pro nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who will contemn God’s elect?

glosses.latin: Quis est qui contempnet? Simul autem Iesus Christus qui mortuus est, immo qui resurrexit, qui est in dextera Dei, qui etiam interpellat pro nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iní[Con]s[/Con]u cr[Con]ist[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] imba immalei do [a]occartaithchricc[/a] [GLat]et[/GLat] occarnáinsem náte níbahed nisí arsercc less
glosses.glossText: .i. inísu crist .i. imba immalei do occartaithchricc et occarnáinsem náte níbahed nisí arsercc less
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inísu crist .i. imba immalei do occartaithchricca et occarnáinsem náte níbahed nisí arsercc less
footnotes: a: MS. occataithchricc
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it Jesus Christ? i.e. will He be at the same time redeeming us and accusing us? Not so: it will not be that: that is not the love He hath for us.

glosses.latin: Quis est qui contempnet? Simul autem Iesus Christus qui mortuus est, immo qui resurrexit, qui est in dextera Dei, qui etiam interpellat pro nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isnessa doinni lemm oldaas bidarnáinsem [ie].i.[/ie] díarfírianugudni són ní [b]diarnáinsem[/b]
glosses.glossText: .i. isnessa doinni lemm oldaas bidarnáinsem .i. díarfírianugudni són ní diarnáinsem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isnessa doinni lemm oldaas bidarnáinsem .i. díarfírianugudni són ní diarnáinsem<sup>b</sup>
footnotes: b: MS. dianáinsem
e: Ascoli compares Ml. 46c 18, 54a 11
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I deem it nearer to the meaning<sup>e</sup> than should be our accusation, i.e. to our justification (is) that, not to our accusation.

glosses.latin: Quis est qui contempnet? Simul autem Iesus Christus qui mortuus est, immo qui resurrexit, qui est in dextera Dei, qui etiam interpellat pro nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He hath taken his station.

glosses.latin: Quis est qui contempnet? Simul autem Iesus Christus qui mortuus est, immo qui resurrexit, qui est in dextera Dei, qui etiam interpellat pro nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doetarcuirethar [ie].i.[/ie] indóinecht araróit som ónni ferid itge frissindeacht arnachérbalamni
glosses.glossText: .i. doetarcuirethar .i. indóinecht araróit som ónni ferid itge frissindeacht arnachérbalamni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doetarcuirethar .i. indóinecht araróit som ónni ferid itge frissindeacht arnachérbalamni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. intercedes, i.e. the Manhood which He hath assumed from us makes prayer to the Godhead that we perish not.

glosses.latin: Quis ergo nos separabit? .... án gladius?
footnotes: f: The reference is to Paul’s death by the sword: Lánn cladib do márbad Póil · rob aidid anfáil écóir, Harl. 1802, fol. 9b
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as he (Paul) has proved it<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Quia propter te mortificamur tota die, aestimati sumus ut oues occisionis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ammi irlaim hicachláo do dul martre
glosses.glossText: .i. ammi irlaim hicachláo do dul martre
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ammi irlaim hicachláo do dul martre
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we are ready every day to go to martyrdom.

glosses.latin: Quia propter te mortificamur tota die, aestimati sumus ut oues occisionis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quia propter te mortificamur tota die, aestimati sumus ut oues occisionis.
footnotes: c: nosmetipsos, Migne, col. 712
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one thinks himself free to slay us.

glosses.latin: neque Angelus, neque Principatus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]praesens nobís promísa[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]angelus mentiri quam separatio mea[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] isdochu indalanái oldaas anaill
glosses.glossText: .i. praesens nobís promísa .i. angelus mentiri quam separatio mea .i. isdochu indalanái oldaas anaill
glosses.glossFNs: .i. praesens nobís promísa .i. angelus mentiri quam separatio mea .i. isdochu indalanái oldaas anaill
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. one of the two (an angel lying, my separation from Christ) is likelier than the other.

glosses.latin: neque Angelus, neque Principatus.
footnotes: g: Cf. Saltair na Rann 661 seq.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the rank that is lower than angels<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Veritatem dico in Christo Iesu; non mentior, testimonium mihi perhibente conscientia mea in Spiritu sancto.
glosses.glossFullTags: [b]issruith[/b] indairm indid epiur [GLat]q[Con]uia[/Con] membrum christi sum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: issruith indairm indid epiur quia membrum christi sum
glosses.glossFNs: issruithb indairm indid epiur quia membrum christi sum
footnotes: b: MS. isruith: corr. Ascoli, who also would change airm to airmitiu
glosses.glossTrans: venerable is the place wherein I say it, quia, etc.

glosses.latin: Veritatem dico in Christo Iesu; non mentior, testimonium mihi perhibente conscientia mea in Spiritu sancto.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. my conscience deceives me not, for it is in the Holy Spirit that I attest it.

glosses.latin: tristitia est mihi magna, est et continus dolor cordi meo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I grieve that you are without belief.

glosses.latin: tristitia est mihi magna, est et continus dolor cordi meo.
glosses.glossText: .i. ishósiun conuie dam farsercc obtabam enim rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishósiun conuie dam farsercc obtabam enim rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is from old to new that I have had love for you, optabam, etc.

glosses.latin: anathema esse a Christo pro fratribus meis.
footnotes: i: The captive was ἀνάθεμα when slain as an offering to the gods. As to cimbid cf. LU. 82b 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a captive<sup>i</sup>.

glosses.latin: Qui sunt Israhelitae, quorum adoptio est filiorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]israhelitarum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] doróigu dia immaccu do [GLat]ut est primogenitus meus israhel[/GLat][c]
glosses.glossText: .i. israhelitarum .i. doróigu dia immaccu do ut est primogenitus meus israhel
glosses.glossFNs: .i. israhelitarum .i. doróigu dia immaccu do ut est primogenitus meus israhelc
footnotes: c: Exod. iv. 22
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whom God hath chosen as sons of His, ut est, etc.

glosses.latin: Quorum patres, et ex quibus [est] Christus secundum carnem, qui est super omnia Deus benedictus in secula.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of whom are the fathers of the men who are nunc.

glosses.latin: Quorum patres, et ex quibus [est] Christus secundum carnem, qui est super omnia Deus benedictus in secula.
footnotes: k: See Pedersen KZ. 37, 236, and cf. Ml. 36a 34, 91a 1
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is impossible to contemn<sup>k</sup> them, (for) Christ is (sprung) from them.

glosses.latin: Quorum patres, et ex quibus [est] Christus secundum carnem, qui est super omnia Deus benedictus in secula.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is He who is the chief of all.

glosses.latin: Quorum patres, et ex quibus [est] Christus secundum carnem, qui est super omnia Deus benedictus in secula.
footnotes: d: MS. isnabidṭhu, the punctum delens being wrongly placed under t
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He is God, blessed for ever.

glosses.latin: non enim omnes qui ex Israhel sunt, hii sunt Israhelitae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the whole of them are not Israelites.

glosses.latin: Neque qui semen sunt Abrachae, omnes filii: sed in Isac uocabitur tibi semen.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] innahí[e] rochinset hosíl abrache nitat huili itmaicc tairngiri
glosses.glossText: .i. innahí rochinset hosíl abrache nitat huili itmaicc tairngiri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. innahí<sup>e</sup> rochinset hosíl abrache nitat huili itmaicc tairngiri
footnotes: e: this seems to be used for indí
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. those who have descended from Abraham’s seed, the whole of them are not children of (the) promise.

glosses.latin: Neque qui semen sunt Abrachae, omnes filii: sed in Isac uocabitur tibi semen.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is ho isaác dofuisémthar asíl nairegde [GLat]non[/GLat] inismaíl
glosses.glossText: .i. is ho isaác dofuisémthar asíl nairegde non inismaíl
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is ho isaác dofuisémthar asíl nairegde non inismaíl
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is from Isaac will be begotten the chief seed, not in Ishmael.

glosses.latin: Id est, non qui filii carnis, hi filii Dei, aestimantur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ut ismáil et increduli israhelite[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nigebat incomarbus hóre nandat [GLat]filii promisionis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ut ismáil et increduli israhelite .i. nigebat incomarbus hóre nandat filii promisionis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ut ismáil et increduli israhelite .i. nigebat incomarbus hóre nandat filii promisionis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they will not take the inheritance because they are not filii promissionis.

glosses.latin: Id est, non qui filii carnis, hi filii Dei, aestimantur.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Promisionis enim uerbum hoc est: secundum hoc tempus ueniam.
footnotes: f: Ir. briathar ‘uerbum’ is fem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Promisionis enim uerbum hoc est: secundum hoc tempus ueniam.
footnotes: g: the h inserted to avoid hiatus, or to shew that the gen. sing. of ré is disyllabic
l: i.e. after a time
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. at the end of a space<sup>l</sup>.

glosses.latin: Rebecca ex uno concubitu habens, Isac patris nostri.
footnotes: h: leg. rogénatar J. S., but see Zimmer, KZ. xxx. 225, W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of one seed have been born two sons of him.

glosses.latin: Cum enim nondum nati fuissent, aut aliquid egissent bonum aut malum, ut secundum electionem propositum Dei maneret.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg. [vel]ɫ.[/vel][/Com] [GLat]propossitum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] intairdérgud arrudérgestar dia togu indalanái [GLat]per misericordiam[/GLat] damnad alaili [GLat]per debitum iudicium[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg. ɫ.] propossitum .i. intairdérgud arrudérgestar dia togu indalanái per misericordiam damnad alaili per debitum iudicium
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg. ɫ.] propossitum .i. intairdérgud arrudérgestar dia togu indalanái per misericordiam damnad alaili per debitum iudicium
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the purpose which God hath purposed, to choose one of the twain per misericordiam, to condemn the other per debitum iudicium.

glosses.latin: Quia maior seruiet minori, sicut scriptum est: Iacob dilexi, Esau autem hodio habui.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he who is elder, i.e. Esau.

glosses.latin: Quia maior seruiet minori, sicut scriptum est: Iacob dilexi, Esau autem hodio habui.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]per debitum iudicium[/GLat] ar ba miscuis atroillisset diblínaib manithised trocaire [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non natura hodit[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. per debitum iudicium ar ba miscuis atroillisset diblínaib manithised trocaire .i. non natura hodit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. per debitum iudicium ar ba miscuis atroillisset diblínaib manithised trocaire .i. non natura hodit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. per debitum iudicium, for it was hatred which they both had deserved if mercy had not come thereto.

glosses.latin: numquid iniquitas apud Deum? Absit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre doroigu indalafer cenairilliud [GLat]et[/GLat] romiscsigestar alaile, indoich bid indirge dodia insin
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre doroigu indalafer cenairilliud et romiscsigestar alaile, indoich bid indirge dodia insin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre doroigu indalafer cenairilliud et romiscsigestar alaile, indoich bid indirge dodia insin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because He hath chosen one of the two men without desert and hath hated the other, is it likely that that would be unrighteousness to God?

glosses.latin: numquid iniquitas apud Deum? Absit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. nay, He is not unjust!

glosses.latin: Moysi enim dicit: miserebor cui[us] miserior, et misericordiam praestabo cuius miserebor.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I shall be free as regards my word.

glosses.latin: Igitur non uolentis, neque currentis, sed miserentis est Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He pities whomsoever He pleases.

glosses.latin: Igitur non uolentis, neque currentis, sed miserentis est Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] nitorbe doneuch anaccobor manithobrea dia do anaccobor [GLat]similiter neque currentis[/GLat] intí dianairchissi dia isdo istorbe
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. nitorbe doneuch anaccobor manithobrea dia do anaccobor similiter neque currentis intí dianairchissi dia isdo istorbe
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. nitorbe doneuch anaccobor manithobrea dia do anaccobor similiter neque currentis intí dianairchissi dia isdo istorbe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the desire is no profit to any one unless God give him the desire: similiter, etc., he whom God spareth, to him is profit.

glosses.latin: Dicit enim scriptura Pharaoni: Quia . . excitaui te ut ... anuntietur nomen meum in uniuersa terra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dothabairt díglae foir nípo dia airchissecht
glosses.glossText: .i. dothabairt díglae foir nípo dia airchissecht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dothabairt díglae foir nípo dia airchissecht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to inflict punishment upon him, it was not to spare him.

glosses.latin: Dicit enim scriptura Pharaoni: Quia . . excitaui te ut ... anuntietur nomen meum in uniuersa terra.
footnotes: a: MS. tribairt
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through inflicting punishment upon him.

glosses.latin: Dicis itaque mihi; quid adhuc queritur? uoluntati enim eius qui resistet?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ap[Con]er[/Con]sin innaní asbeirtis ni neich inpeccad ni dlig dígail arní asse tuidecht fritoil dé [ie].i.[/ie] hóre is [GLat]cui uult[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] ni linni didiu atá
glosses.glossText: .i. apersin innaní asbeirtis ni neich inpeccad ni dlig dígail arní asse tuidecht fritoil dé .i. hóre is cui uult rl. ni linni didiu atá
glosses.glossFNs: .i. apersin innaní asbeirtis ni neich inpeccad ni dlig dígail arní asse tuidecht fritoil dé .i. hóre is cui uult rl. ni linni didiu atá
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the person of those who used to say sin is no one’s: he deserves not punishment, for resistance to God’s will is not easy, that is, because it is cui vult, etc., not with us then is it.

glosses.latin: O homo, tú quis és, qui respondeas Deo? Numquid dicit figmentum ei qui sé finxit: Quid me fecisti síc?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cia tussu díxnigedar [ie].i.[/ie] cid no[Con]m[/Con]betha im etarceirt amessa imdia
glosses.glossText: .i. cia tussu díxnigedar .i. cid nombetha im etarceirt amessa imdia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cia tussu díxnigedar .i. cid nombetha im etarceirt amessa imdia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who art thou? i.e. on what account shouldst thou be about disputing his judgment with God?

glosses.latin: O homo, tú quis és, qui respondeas Deo? Numquid dicit figmentum ei qui sé finxit: Quid me fecisti síc?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: O homo, tú quis és, qui respondeas Deo? Numquid dicit figmentum ei qui sé finxit: Quid me fecisti síc?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to him who has formed it.

glosses.latin: O homo, tú quis és, qui respondeas Deo? Numquid dicit figmentum ei qui sé finxit: Quid me fecisti síc?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not well hast thou made me.

glosses.latin: An non habet potestatem figulus luti, ex eadem massa facere aliud quidem uas in honorem, aliud uero in contumiliam?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: An non habet potestatem figulus luti, ex eadem massa facere aliud quidem uas in honorem, aliud uero in contumiliam?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: An non habet potestatem figulus luti, ex eadem massa facere aliud quidem uas in honorem, aliud uero in contumiliam?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: An non habet potestatem figulus luti, ex eadem massa facere aliud quidem uas in honorem, aliud uero in contumiliam?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: An non habet potestatem figulus luti, ex eadem massa facere aliud quidem uas in honorem, aliud uero in contumiliam?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is carefully he has made one of the two vessels.

glosses.latin: An non habet potestatem figulus luti, ex eadem massa facere aliud quidem uas in honorem, aliud uero in contumiliam?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is more carelessly that he makes the other.

glosses.latin: Quod si uolens Deus ostendere iram ... sustenuit in multa patientia uasa irae apta in interitum.
glosses.glossTrans: though He be desirous.

glosses.latin: Quod si uolens Deus ostendere iram ... sustenuit in multa patientia uasa irae apta in interitum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] adroneestar[a] [ie].i.[/ie] [b]nifochetóir[/b] dorat digail foraib cepued adroilliset
glosses.glossText: .i. adroneestar .i. nifochetóir dorat digail foraib cepued adroilliset
glosses.glossFNs: .i. adroneestar<sup>a</sup> .i. nifochetóir<sup>b</sup> dorat digail foraib cepued adroilliset
footnotes: a: cf. arruneastar Ml. 50b 8
b: MS. nipo hetóir, corr. Thurneysen
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He has endured, i.e. it is not at once that He hath inflicted punishment upon them, although they had deserved it.

glosses.latin: Quod si uolens Deus ostendere iram ... sustenuit in multa patientia uasa irae apta in interitum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (they were) proper to have punishment (inflicted) upon them.

glosses.latin: Ut ostenderet diuitias gloriae suae in uassa misericordiae, quae praeparauit in gloriam suam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] níarmaith friu arforchelta act is corpad mithig lesso[Con]m[/Con] inducbál dianóibaib
glosses.glossText: .i. níarmaith friu arforchelta act is corpad mithig lessom inducbál dianóibaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. níarmaith friu arforchelta act is corpad mithig lessom inducbál dianóibaib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not for good to them that they have been cared for, but it is until He should deem timely (the) glory for His saints.

glosses.latin: Ut ostenderet diuitias gloriae suae in uassa misericordiae, quae praeparauit in gloriam suam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. those for whom He has intended mercy.

glosses.latin: Ut ostenderet diuitias gloriae suae in uassa misericordiae, quae praeparauit in gloriam suam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their salvation, though they deserved it not.

glosses.latin: Quos et uocauit nos non solum ex Iudeís, sed etiam ex gentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nípat hé indíi betathuicsi diiudeib nammá beite isindinducbáil sin acht bieit cit geinti hiressich. tairchechuin [c]farmbráthir[/c] fadisin ossæ áiudeiu airitiu[d] [GLat]et[/GLat] togu geinte
glosses.glossText: .i. nípat hé indíi betathuicsi diiudeib nammá beite isindinducbáil sin acht bieit cit geinti hiressich. tairchechuin farmbráthir fadisin ossæ áiudeiu airitiu et togu geinte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nípat hé indíi betathuicsi diiudeib nammá beite isindinducbáil sin acht bieit cit geinti hiressich. tairchechuin farmbráthirc fadisin ossæ áiudeiu airitiud et togu geinte
footnotes: c: MS. farmbratir
d: recte airitin
f: Hosea ii. 23
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be they who shall be chosen from the Jews only who will be in that glory: but there will be even faithful Gentiles. Your own brother Hosea, O (ye) Jews, foretold (the) reception and election of (the) Gentiles<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Vocabo non meam plebem, plebem meam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dogéntar [Res]toich[/Res] diétoich and [ie].i.[/ie] bid tuad do[Con]m[/Con]sa monebthuad
glosses.glossText: .i. dogéntar (toich) diétoich and .i. bid tuad domsa monebthuad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dogéntar (toich) diétoich and .i. bid tuad domsa monebthuad
footnotes: g: cf. Wb. 9a 13, 29d 13, and Ascoli Celtica p. 118 n. (toich ‘di legittima spettanza’)
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. rightful<sup>g</sup> shall be made there of unrightful, that is, my non-people shall be a people unto me.

glosses.latin: in loco, ubi dictum est eís: Non plebs mea uos, ibi uocabuntur filii Dei uiui.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isindairmm [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]scripturae[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]uocabitur[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nipa farnainmsi bias forib [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]plebs dei[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isindairmm .i. scripturae ɫ. uocabitur ɫ. nipa farnainmsi bias forib .i. plebs dei
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isindairmm .i. scripturae ɫ. uocabitur ɫ. nipa farnainmsi bias forib .i. plebs dei
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the place, i.e. etc., it will not be your name that shall be upon them, i.e. plebs Dei.

glosses.latin: in loco, ubi dictum est eís: Non plebs mea uos, ibi uocabuntur filii Dei uiui.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] geinti narbo [GLat]pleps dei[/GLat] cosse bit [GLat]filii dei[/GLat] anainm indectso ní dígu anme[e] són ǽm
glosses.glossText: .i. geinti narbo pleps dei cosse bit filii dei anainm indectso ní dígu anme són ǽm
glosses.glossFNs: .i. geinti narbo pleps dei cosse bit filii dei anainm indectso ní dígu anmee són ǽm
footnotes: e: cf. dígu selga Ac. na Senórach 5475
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. gentiles who were not plebs Dei hitherto: their name now will be filii Dei: that, truly, is not an unchoice name.

glosses.latin: Essaias autem clamat pro Israhel: Si fuerit numerus
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] acaltam geinte inso [ie].i.[/ie] doarchet do [GLat]israhel[/GLat] húathad ṅdóine dochretim diib cit sochudi
glosses.glossText: .i. acaltam geinte inso .i. doarchet do israhel húathad ṅdóine dochretim diib cit sochudi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. acaltam geinte inso .i. doarchet do israhel húathad ṅdóine dochretim diib cit sochudi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is an address to gentiles, i.e. it had been foretold to Israel that of them, though they are multitudes, few persons would believe.

glosses.latin: filiorum. Israhel tamquam arena maris, reliquae saluae fient.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cit sochudi bid huathad creitfes diib
glosses.glossText: .i. cit sochudi bid huathad creitfes diib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cit sochudi bid huathad creitfes diib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though they are multitudes, it will be few of them that will believe.

glosses.latin: filiorum. Israhel tamquam arena maris, reliquae saluae fient.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bieid nach dréct diib hícfider cinbathuili articfea indso[Con]m[/Con] briathar foirbthigedar induine indírgi cáingníma
glosses.glossText: .i. bieid nach dréct diib hícfider cinbathuili articfea indsom briathar foirbthigedar induine indírgi cáingníma
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bieid nach dréct diib hícfider cinbathuili articfea indsom briathar foirbthigedar induine indírgi cáingníma
glosses.glossTrans: i.e there will be some portion of them that will be saved, though it be not all, for into it will come the Word which perfects man in righteousness of well-doing.

glosses.latin: Verbum enim consummans et breuians in aequitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they who shall so believe, it will be in righteousness (that they shall believe).

glosses.latin: Et sicut praedixit Essaias: . . sicut Sodoma facit essemus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he prophesied before it came to pass.

glosses.latin: Et sicut praedixit Essaias: . . sicut Sodoma facit essemus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we should perish and none of us should remain(?).

glosses.latin: Quod gentes, quae non sectabantur iustitiam, adprehenderunt iustitiam, iustitiam autem quae ex fide est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] níarilset geinti afírianugud tadbat som t[Con]ra[/Con] darect [GLat]et[/GLat] difírinni [GLat]infra[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. níarilset geinti afírianugud tadbat som tra darect et difírinni infra
glosses.glossFNs: .i. níarilset geinti afírianugud tadbat som tra darect et difírinni infra
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Gentiles have not deserved to be justified: he shows forth, then, two laws and two righteousnesses infra.

glosses.latin: Quod gentes, quae non sectabantur iustitiam, adprehenderunt iustitiam, iustitiam autem quae ex fide est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not (the) righteousness of (the) Law.

glosses.latin: Quare? Quia non ex fide, sed quasi ex operibus: offenderunt enim in lapidem offensionis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the works of the Law they deem enough to justify them.

glosses.latin: Quare? Quia non ex fide, sed quasi ex operibus: offenderunt enim in lapidem offensionis.
glosses.glossTrans: they struck many blows against it.

glosses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: Ecce pono in Sión lapidem offensionis, et petram scandali; et omnis qui credit in eum non confundetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that lapis offensionis is a nomen for Christ.

glosses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: Ecce pono in Sión lapidem offensionis, et petram scandali; et omnis qui credit in eum non confundetur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] in belzefuth [Com]in marg.[/Com] isbéss didu indliacc berir[a] ilbeim friss [GLat]et[/GLat] intí dothuit foir ↄboing achnámi intí foratuitsom im[Con]murgu[/Con] atbail side [GLat]síc christus lapis angu[Con]laris[/Con][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. in belzefuth [in marg.] isbéss didu indliacc berir ilbeim friss et intí dothuit foir ↄboing achnámi intí foratuitsom immurgu atbail side síc christus lapis angularis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in belzefuth [in marg.] isbéss didu indliacc berira ilbeim friss et intí dothuit foir ↄboing achnámi intí foratuitsom immurgu atbail side síc christus lapis angularis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Belzebub: it is the manner, then, of the stone that many blows are given to it, and he who falls upon it breaks his bones: he, however, on whom it falls, he perishes: sic Christus, etc.

glosses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: Ecce pono in Sión lapidem offensionis, et petram scandali; et omnis qui credit in eum non confundetur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] níceilso[Con]m[/Con] t[Con]ra[/Con] asné cr[Con]ist[/Con] inlie asrubart
glosses.glossText: .i. níceilsom tra asné crist inlie asrubart
glosses.glossFNs: .i. níceilsom tra asné crist inlie asrubart
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so he conceals not that Christ is the stone he has mentioned.

glosses.latin: Fratres, uoluntas quidem cordis mei, et obsecratio ad Deum, fit pro illís in salutem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] frigenti asbeir som anisiu arnatomnitis nád carad som iudeiu [GLat]et[/GLat]nad duthrised anícc
glosses.glossText: .i. frigenti asbeir som anisiu arnatomnitis nád carad som iudeiu etnad duthrised anícc
glosses.glossFNs: .i. frigenti asbeir som anisiu arnatomnitis nád carad som iudeiu etnad duthrised anícc
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unto the Gentiles he says this, lest they should think that he did not love Jews and did not desire their salvation.

glosses.latin: Fratres, uoluntas quidem cordis mei, et obsecratio ad Deum, fit pro illís in salutem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is my prayer unto God.

glosses.latin: Fratres, uoluntas quidem cordis mei, et obsecratio ad Deum, fit pro illís in salutem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that God might save them.

glosses.latin: Testimonium enim perhibeo illís, quod et emulationem Dei habent, sed non secundum scientiam.
footnotes: b: rectius -epeltu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. proper were prayer for them: piteous were their perishing.

glosses.latin: Finis enim legis, Christus, ad iustitiam omni credenti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bid fírian cach oén creitfess hí cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. bid fírian cach oén creitfess hí crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bid fírian cach oén creitfess hí crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. just will every one be who shall believe in Christ.

glosses.latin: Moyses enim scripsit: Quoniam iustitiam quae ex lege est, qui fecerit homo, uiuet in ea.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. guilty under (the) Law.

glosses.latin: Quae autem ex fide est iustitia, síc dicit: Ne dixeris in corde tuo: Quis ascendet in caelum? id est, Christum deducere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he says, what may be the righteousness (which is) of faith?

glosses.latin: Quae autem ex fide est iustitia, síc dicit: Ne dixeris in corde tuo: Quis ascendet in caelum? id est, Christum deducere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to ask for other testaments.

glosses.latin: Quae autem ex fide est iustitia, síc dicit: Ne dixeris in corde tuo: Quis ascendet in caelum? id est, Christum deducere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]proprium pauli[/GLat][a] [ie].i.[/ie] dobeir pól gluáis fortestimin nafetarlicce
glosses.glossText: .i. proprium pauli .i. dobeir pól gluáis fortestimin nafetarlicce
glosses.glossFNs: .i. proprium paulia .i. dobeir pól gluáis fortestimin nafetarlicce
footnotes: a: The Latin part of this gloss seems to refer to Paul’s privilege of ascending to heaven; see 2 Corinth. xii. 2–4
c: Deut. xxx. 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Paul puts a gloss on the text of the Old Law<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Quae autem ex fide est iustitia, síc dicit: Ne dixeris in corde tuo: Quis ascendet in caelum? id est, Christum deducere.
footnotes: b: leg. cene
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not necessary: He hath come already.

glosses.latin: Aut quis descendet in abisum? hoc est, Christum a mortuis reuocare.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní ecen athodiusgud asreracht cene [GLat]a mortuis[/GLat], islour dún didiu creite[Con]m[/Con] incholnichtho [GLat]et[/GLat] esséirgi
glosses.glossText: .i. ní ecen athodiusgud asreracht cene a mortuis, islour dún didiu creitem incholnichtho et esséirgi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní ecen athodiusgud asreracht cene a mortuis, islour dún didiu creitem incholnichtho et esséirgi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not necessary to arouse Him: He has already arisen a mortuis: it is enough for us, then, to believe in Incarnation and Resurrection.

glosses.latin: Sed quid dicit Scriptura? Prope est uerbum in ore tuo et in corde tuo. Hoc est uerbum fidei, quod praedicamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is quis ascendit? i.e. if it is a doubt.

glosses.latin: Sed quid dicit Scriptura? Prope est uerbum in ore tuo et in corde tuo. Hoc est uerbum fidei, quod praedicamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Christ is at hand with His gospel.

glosses.latin: Sed quid dicit Scriptura? Prope est uerbum in ore tuo et in corde tuo. Hoc est uerbum fidei, quod praedicamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to Gentiles after His coming.

glosses.latin: Quia si confitearis ... Dominum Iesum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore it is prope.

glosses.latin: Corde enim creditur ad iustitiam, ore autem confessio fit ad salutem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. belief in the heart maketh a man righteous (or, a righteous man).

glosses.latin: Corde enim creditur ad iustitiam, ore autem confessio fit ad salutem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indfoisitiu ingiun imfolngi induine slán istrissandedesin biid duine slán [GLat]et[/GLat]fírian combi bidslán [GLat]et[/GLat] bidfírian
glosses.glossText: .i. indfoisitiu ingiun imfolngi induine slán istrissandedesin biid duine slán etfírian combi bidslán et bidfírian
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indfoisitiu ingiun imfolngi induine slán istrissandedesin biid duine slán etfírian combi bidslán et bidfírian
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the confession in the mouth maketh the man sound (or, a sound man). Through those twain it is that a man is sound and righteous (or, that there is a man sound and righteous), so ever-sound and ever-righteous.

glosses.latin: Quomodo ergo inuocabunt, in quem non crediderunt?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ap[Con]er[/Con]sin indiudidi asbeirso[Con]m[/Con] anisiu magthad lasuidiu cretem do geintib hóre nadtairchechnatar fáthi doib
glosses.glossText: .i. apersin indiudidi asbeirsom anisiu magthad lasuidiu cretem do geintib hóre nadtairchechnatar fáthi doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. apersin indiudidi asbeirsom anisiu magthad lasuidiu cretem do geintib hóre nadtairchechnatar fáthi doib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the person of the Jew he saith this: they marvel that the Gentiles believed, because prophets have not prophesied to them.

glosses.latin: Quomodo uero praedicabunt nisi mittantur? sicut scriptum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the teachers.

glosses.latin: Quomodo uero praedicabunt nisi mittantur? sicut scriptum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have not been sent to them at all.

glosses.latin: est: Quam speciosi pedes euangelizantium pacem, euangelizantium bona!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is of those teachers it has been said.

glosses.latin: est: Quam speciosi pedes euangelizantium pacem, euangelizantium bona!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is hecen sainecoscc leosom for accrannaib innaní p[Con]re[/Con]chite [GLat]pacem et[/GLat] immechuretar cori horígaib aranep[Con]er[/Con]tar isdoimmarchor chóre dotíagat indfirso [GLat]signum[/GLat] són araroib saingné fornaib gnímaib inna p[Con]re[/Con]ceptore
glosses.glossText: .i. is hecen sainecoscc leosom for accrannaib innaní prechite pacem et immechuretar cori horígaib aranepertar isdoimmarchor chóre dotíagat indfirso signum són araroib saingné fornaib gnímaib inna preceptore
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is hecen sainecoscc leosom for accrannaib innaní prechite pacem et immechuretar cori horígaib aranepertar isdoimmarchor chóre dotíagat indfirso signum són araroib saingné fornaib gnímaib inna preceptore
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they deem it necessary (to have) a special appearance on the sandals of those that preach pacem and carry peace from kings, so that it may be said: ‘it is on an errand of peace that these men come.’ That is a signum that there should be a special form on the deeds of the teachers.

glosses.latin: est: Quam speciosi pedes euangelizantium pacem, euangelizantium bona!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of those who preach mysteria divina.

glosses.latin: Essaias dicit: Domine, quis credidit auditui nostro?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní sochude rochretti doneuch rochualammarni huaitsiu adé sechra pridchaisem dochách [GLat]alit[Con]er[/Con][/GLat] doneuch rochuale cách huanni
glosses.glossText: .i. ní sochude rochretti doneuch rochualammarni huaitsiu adé sechra pridchaisem dochách aliter doneuch rochuale cách huanni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní sochude rochretti doneuch rochualammarni huaitsiu adé sechra pridchaisem dochách aliter doneuch rochuale cách huanni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not many have believed what we have heard from Thee, O God, although we have preached it to every one; aliter, what every one has heard from us.

glosses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid non audierunt?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] canigóo dúib si anasberid aiudeu conicloitis geinti tairchital cr[Con]ist[/Con] nate rachualatar
glosses.glossText: .i. canigóo dúib si anasberid aiudeu conicloitis geinti tairchital crist nate rachualatar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. canigóo dúib si anasberid aiudeu conicloitis geinti tairchital crist nate rachualatar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it not a lie of yours what ye say, O Jews? that (the) Gentiles could not hear prophesying of Christ? Nay, they have heard it!

glosses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid Israhel non cognouit? Primus Moyses dicit: Ego in emulationem uos adducam in non gentem.
footnotes: d: cf. Windisch Wb. s. v. acht, Saltair na Rann 4735
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. save that (Israel) conceals it<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid Israhel non cognouit? Primus Moyses dicit: Ego in emulationem uos adducam in non gentem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]gentes esse uocandas ad fidem[/GLat][a] [ie].i.[/ie] isáiniu dúibsi anasbiursa rafitir cid israhel creti[Con]m[/Con] dogeintib
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: gentes esse uocandas ad fidem .i. isáiniu dúibsi anasbiursa rafitir cid israhel cretim dogeintib
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: gentes esse uocandas ad fidema .i. isáiniu dúibsi anasbiursa rafitir cid israhel cretim dogeintib
footnotes: a: Migne, col. 721
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is nobler for you what I say, Israel knows it also, that the Gentiles would believe.

glosses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid Israhel non cognouit? Primus Moyses dicit: Ego in emulationem uos adducam in non gentem.
footnotes: b: = ad-d-beir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. your own leader says it at first.

glosses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid Israhel non cognouit? Primus Moyses dicit: Ego in emulationem uos adducam in non gentem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. O Jews!

glosses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid Israhel non cognouit? Primus Moyses dicit: Ego in emulationem uos adducam in non gentem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] in hétt [ie].i.[/ie] bid héet libsi geinti dobith inhiris [vel]ɫ.[/vel] do intamil [ie].i.[/ie] atasamlibid[c] si ináiritiu hirisse
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] in hétt .i. bid héet libsi geinti dobith inhiris ɫ. do intamil .i. atasamlibid si ináiritiu hirisse
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] in hétt .i. bid héet libsi geinti dobith inhiris ɫ. do intamil .i. atasamlibid<sup>c</sup> si ináiritiu hirisse
footnotes: c: ex ad-da-s, from intamil (ind-samil) ‘imitari,’ the prefixes ind and in being replaced by ad when a pronoun is infixed. So in atobsegatsi Wb. 14d 37, from in-sag and atomsnassar Wb. 5b 30 from ind-sn.
glosses.glossTrans: into jealousy, i.e. ye will be jealous that (the) Gentiles are in (the) faith. Or to imitate, that is, ye will imitate them in receiving (the) faith.

glosses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid Israhel non cognouit? Primus Moyses dicit: Ego in emulationem uos adducam in non gentem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hinephchenéil [ie].i.[/ie] napochenéel do[Con]m[/Con]sa cosse [GLat]ante quam crederet[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hinephchenéil .i. napochenéel domsa cosse ante quam crederet
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hinephchenéil .i. napochenéel domsa cosse ante quam crederet
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. into a no-kindred, that is, which was not a kindred of mine hitherto ante quam crederet.

glosses.latin: Essaias autem audet, et dicit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ro laimetharside ep[Con]ir[/Con]t neich [GLat]quia non timet populum iudeorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ro laimetharside epirt neich quia non timet populum iudeorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ro laimetharside epirt neich quia non timet populum iudeorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he (Esaias) ventures to say anything, quia, etc.

glosses.latin: Ad Israhel autem dicit: Tota die expandi manus meas ad populum non credentem et contradicentem
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dochoscc innanisr[Con]ah[/Con]élde asbeir som aní siu arnachamóidet cid doib doarrchet
glosses.glossText: .i. dochoscc innanisrahélde asbeir som aní siu arnachamóidet cid doib doarrchet
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dochoscc innanisrahélde asbeir som aní siu arnachamóidet cid doib doarrchet
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to correct the Israelites he says this, that they may not boast though they were prophesied unto.

glosses.latin: Ad Israhel autem dicit: Tota die expandi manus meas ad populum non credentem et contradicentem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is your name.

glosses.latin: Numquid repulit Deus populum suum? Absit; Nam et ego Israhelita sum, ex semine Abracham.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isfollus isindí nachimrindarpai se noch ǽm amísrahélde
glosses.glossText: .i. isfollus isindí nachimrindarpai se noch ǽm amísrahélde
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isfollus isindí nachimrindarpai se noch ǽm amísrahélde
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is manifest in that He has not cast me away, although indeed I am an Israelite.

glosses.latin: Numquid repulit Deus populum suum? Absit; Nam et ego Israhelita sum, ex semine Abracham.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is my clan’s stock.

glosses.latin: Non repulit Deus plebem suam, quam praesciuit. An nescitis in Helia quid dicit Scriptura, quemadmodum interpellat Deum aduersus Israhel?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he of them who should believe.

glosses.latin: Non repulit Deus plebem suam, quam praesciuit. An nescitis in Helia quid dicit Scriptura, quemadmodum interpellat Deum aduersus Israhel?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] innádcualaidsi ageinti [GLat]in librís regum ubi scriptum est de helia[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. innádcualaidsi ageinti in librís regum ubi scriptum est de helia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. innádcualaidsi ageinti in librís regum ubi scriptum est de helia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. have ye not heard, O Gentiles! in libris, etc?

glosses.latin: Non repulit Deus plebem suam, quam praesciuit. An nescitis in Helia quid dicit Scriptura, quemadmodum interpellat Deum aduersus Israhel?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to inflict punishment upon them.

glosses.latin: Domine, prophetas tuos occiderunt, altaria tua suffuderunt; et ego relictus sum solus, et querunt animam meam.
footnotes: e: ‘a setting of God against His people’ J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: this is a slandering of his folk to God<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Domine, prophetas tuos occiderunt, altaria tua suffuderunt; et ego relictus sum solus, et querunt animam meam.
glosses.glossText: .i. rumúgsat ɫ. rocechladatar etdorigéensat adrad hídal and
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rumúgsat ɫ. rocechladatar etdorigéensat adrad hídal and
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have smothered, or they have dug, and they have worshipt idols there.

glosses.latin: Domine, prophetas tuos occiderunt, altaria tua suffuderunt; et ego relictus sum solus, et querunt animam meam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nifil nech and occtadrad so acht meisse móinur
glosses.glossText: .i. nifil nech and occtadrad so acht meisse móinur
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nifil nech and occtadrad so acht meisse móinur
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is no one therein a-worshipping Thee save me alone.

glosses.latin: Domine, prophetas tuos occiderunt, altaria tua suffuderunt; et ego relictus sum solus, et querunt animam meam.
footnotes: f: lit. singularitas
g: i.e. worshipping God
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that even this one<sup>f</sup> should not he at it<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Reliqui mihi septem milia uirorum, qui non curuauerunt genua ante Bachal.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to worship me.

glosses.latin: Reliqui mihi septem milia uirorum, qui non curuauerunt genua ante Bachal.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Reliqui mihi septem milia uirorum, qui non curuauerunt genua ante Bachal.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not thou alone, though thou say it.

glosses.latin: Reliqui mihi septem milia uirorum, qui non curuauerunt genua ante Bachal.
footnotes: a: cf. amail bachal, Sg. 229
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to worship Baal.

glosses.latin: Si autem iam non ex operibus alioquin gratia; alioquin gratia iam non est gratia.
footnotes: h: i.e. grace does not depend on works
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is grace, works have not preceded<sup>h</sup>.

glosses.latin: Si autem iam non ex operibus alioquin gratia; alioquin gratia iam non est gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye say, why do I say it to thee?

glosses.latin: Si autem iam non ex operibus alioquin gratia; alioquin gratia iam non est gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if works go before it, sed drbitum.

glosses.latin: quod quaerebat Israhel, hoc non est consecutus; electio autem consecuta est, cæteri uero excaecati sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intí[b] dorroigu dia [GLat]per gratiam non per opera legis ut gentes[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. intí dorroigu dia per gratiam non per opera legis ut gentes
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intíb dorroigu dia per gratiam non per opera legis ut gentes
footnotes: b: leg. indí Sarauw
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He whom God has elected per gratiam, etc.

glosses.latin: quod quaerebat Israhel, hoc non est consecutus; electio autem consecuta est, cæteri uero excaecati sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they attained not truth through grace.

glosses.latin: Dedit illis Deus spiritum conpunctionis, oculos ut non uideant .... usque in hodiernum diem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]interioris hominis[/GLat][c] [ie].i.[/ie] roléiced anintliucht foaréir fadésne [GLat]et[/GLat] nifarmaid[d] rosnuicc
glosses.glossText: .i. interioris hominis .i. roléiced anintliucht foaréir fadésne et nifarmaid rosnuicc
glosses.glossFNs: .i. interioris hominisc .i. roléiced anintliucht foaréir fadésne et nifarmaidd rosnuicc
footnotes: c: see Isaiah vi. 10; xxix. 10
d: MS. seems niparmaid, but Zimmer read nifarmaid, and cf. Wb. 21b 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their reason has been left under their own control, and it has not brought them to good.

glosses.latin: Dedit illis Deus spiritum conpunctionis, oculos ut non uideant .... usque in hodiernum diem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to (the) day of Paul or to (the) day of their death.

glosses.latin: Et Dauid dicit: Fiat mensa eorum .... in scandalum et in retributionem illis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even David conceals it not.

glosses.latin: Et Dauid dicit: Fiat mensa eorum .... in scandalum et in retributionem illis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the altar whereon offering is made to idols.

glosses.latin: Et Dauid dicit: Fiat mensa eorum .... in scandalum et in retributionem illis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et Dauid dicit: Fiat mensa eorum .... in scandalum et in retributionem illis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of punishment.

glosses.latin: dorsum eorum semper iucurua.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. bow (dorsum) down, O God!

glosses.latin: Dico ergo: Nunquid síc offenderunt ut caderent? Absit; sed illorum dilecto salus [est] gentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] co[Con]m[/Con]bad tothim cen éirge nobed and [GLat]absit[/GLat] ni tha diaméit
glosses.glossText: .i. combad tothim cen éirge nobed and absit ni tha diaméit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. combad tothim cen éirge nobed and absit ni tha diaméit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that falling without rising should be there? absit: it is not so great.

glosses.latin: Dico ergo: Nunquid síc offenderunt ut caderent? Absit; sed illorum dilecto salus [est] gentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cair insí ameit friscomartatar condositis[a] huili [GLat]a fide christi[/GLat]? [GLat]non[/GLat]; donertad iude t[Con]ra[/Con] in so lessom
glosses.glossText: .i. cair insí ameit friscomartatar condositis huili a fide christi? non; donertad iude tra in so lessom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cair insí ameit friscomartatar condositisa huili a fide christi? non; donertad iude tra in so lessom
footnotes: a: leg. with Thurneysen condodsitis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. query, have they offended so greatly that all should fall a fide Christi? Non: to strengthen the Jews, then, this he hath.

glosses.latin: Dico ergo: Nunquid síc offenderunt ut caderent? Absit; sed illorum dilecto salus [est] gentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isairi doroigu dia geinti hore nárbubae laiudeu creitem act doroigatar ancretim
glosses.glossText: .i. isairi doroigu dia geinti hore nárbubae laiudeu creitem act doroigatar ancretim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isairi doroigu dia geinti hore nárbubae laiudeu creitem act doroigatar ancretim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore hath God chosen the Gentiles because the Jews liked not belief but chose unbelief.

glosses.latin: Quod si dilictum illorum diuitiae sunt mundi, et deminutio eorum diuitiae gentium, quanto magis plenitudo eorum!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the people of the Gentiles.

glosses.latin: Quod si dilictum illorum diuitiae sunt mundi, et deminutio eorum diuitiae gentium, quanto magis plenitudo eorum!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are the mundus above (mentioned).

glosses.latin: Quod si dilictum illorum diuitiae sunt mundi, et deminutio eorum diuitiae gentium, quanto magis plenitudo eorum!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it were all (the Jews) and not the apostles only.

glosses.latin: Vobís enim dico gentibus: Quamdiu quidem ego sum gentium apostolus, ministerium meum honorificabo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is to you I preach.

glosses.latin: Vobís enim dico gentibus: Quamdiu quidem ego sum gentium apostolus, ministerium meum honorificabo.
