glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is I that am (the) apostle of (the) Gentiles.

glosses.latin: Si quomodo ad emutandum prouocem carnem meam, et saluos faciam aliquos ex illís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in whatsoever manner I may be able to do it.

glosses.latin: Si quomodo ad emutandum prouocem carnem meam, et saluos faciam aliquos ex illís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. my fleshly kindred.

glosses.latin: Si quomodo ad emutandum prouocem carnem meam, et saluos faciam aliquos ex illís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] trisinintamail sin [ie].i.[/ie] combad ǽt leu buid do[Con]m[/Con]sa iniriss [GLat]et[/GLat] duús in intamlitis
glosses.glossText: .i. trisinintamail sin .i. combad ǽt leu buid domsa iniriss et duús in intamlitis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. trisinintamail sin .i. combad ǽt leu buid domsa iniriss et duús in intamlitis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through that imitation, that is, so that they may have emulation of my being in (the) faith, and if perchance they might imitate.

glosses.latin: Si quomodo ad emutandum prouocem carnem meam, et saluos faciam aliquos ex illís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it has wrought (the) salvation of the few of them that believed ab illis.

glosses.latin: Si enim amisio eorum reconciliatio est mundi, quae asumptio, nisi uita ex mortuis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]uita[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] bíi in hiris [GLat]ex mortuis[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in peccato antea[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: ɫ. uita .i. bíi in hiris ex mortuis .i. in peccato antea
glosses.glossFNs: ɫ. uita .i. bíi in hiris ex mortuis .i. in peccato antea
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. alive in faith ex, etc.

glosses.latin: Quod si diliuatio sancta est, et masa.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the first-fruit.

glosses.latin: Quod si diliuatio sancta est, et masa.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the whole folk.

glosses.latin: socius radicis et pinguitudinis olibae.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: socius radicis et pinguitudinis olibae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the fruitful olive-tree.

glosses.latin: Noli gloriari aduersus ramos. Quod si gloriaris, non tu radicem portas, sed radix té.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ó gentiles[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]nolí gaudere quod illi fracti sunt in perditione[/GLat] hore isnanaicci atái
glosses.glossText: .i. ó gentiles .i. nolí gaudere quod illi fracti sunt in perditione hore isnanaicci atái
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ó gentiles .i. nolí gaudere quod illi fracti sunt in perditione hore isnanaicci atái
glosses.glossTrans: since it is near them that thou art.

glosses.latin: Noli gloriari aduersus ramos. Quod si gloriaris, non tu radicem portas, sed radix té.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is inse ṅduit nitú nodnai[Res]l[/Res] acht ishé not ail
glosses.glossText: .i. is inse ṅduit nitú nodnai(l) acht ishé not ail
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is inse ṅduit nitú nodnai(l) acht ishé not ail
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is impossible for thee; it is not thou that nourishest it, but it that nourishes thee.

glosses.latin: Dicis ergo: Fracti sunt rami ut ego inserer.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]adsumit persona gentilis[/GLat] indoich ep[Con]er[/Con]t detsiu isairi ↄnabrúi[Res]thea[/Res] ingésci . . dag dula det . . taranési[a]
glosses.glossText: .i. adsumit persona gentilis indoich epert detsiu isairi ↄnabrúi(thea) ingésci . . dag dula det . . taranési
glosses.glossFNs: .i. adsumit persona gentilis indoich epert detsiu isairi ↄnabrúi(thea) ingésci . . dag dula det . . taranésia
footnotes: a: Before dag is a mark like an inverted c. leg. conabruithea ingésci dag dula detsu taranesi which is translated; cf. Ml. 36d 27 and Sarauw, Irske Studier, p. 136
f: cf. Ml. 36d 27
glosses.glossTrans: perchance thou mayest say, that therefore the branches have been broken<sup>f</sup> that thou mayest go in their place.

glosses.latin: Dicis ergo: Fracti sunt rami ut ego inserer.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Bene, propter incredulitatem fracti sunt: tu autem fide sta: noli altum sapere, sed time.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cani airi [ie].i.[/ie] badochu lem són is[Res]hed[/Res] rombod doib[b]
glosses.glossText: .i. cani airi .i. badochu lem són is(hed) rombod doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cani airi .i. badochu lem són is(hed) rombod doib<sup>b</sup>
footnotes: b: cf. Pedersen, KZ. xxxv. 391.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it not for this? i.e. that seems to me more likely, that is why it was ill with them.

glosses.latin: Bene, propter incredulitatem fracti sunt: tu autem fide sta: noli altum sapere, sed time.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quia gratis et non secundum meritum insertus es[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] bacoscc carat limm dit agentlidi níptha labar [GLat]et[/GLat] nípadro[Res]mór[/Res] notbocctha [GLat]et[/GLat] armtairismech[c] inhiris
glosses.glossText: .i. quia gratis et non secundum meritum insertus es .i. bacoscc carat limm dit agentlidi níptha labar et nípadro(mór) notbocctha et armtairismech inhiris
glosses.glossFNs: .i. quia gratis et non secundum meritum insertus es .i. bacoscc carat limm dit agentlidi níptha labar et nípadro(mór) notbocctha et armtairismechc inhiris
footnotes: c: leg. armthatairismech
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were a friend’s advice for thee, O Gentile, thou shouldst not be talkative(?), and thou shouldst not boast overmuch, and that thou shouldst be constant in faith.

glosses.latin: Bene, propter incredulitatem fracti sunt: tu autem fide sta: noli altum sapere, sed time.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnachitrindarpither frisinfírini [GLat]per superbiam[/GLat] am[Con]al[/Con] indclaínn[d] bunid
glosses.glossText: .i. arnachitrindarpither frisinfírini per superbiam amal indclaínn bunid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnachitrindarpither frisinfírini per superbiam amal indclaínnd bunid
footnotes: d: recte inclainnd, cf. scribinnd, Wb. 15a 30
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest thou be cast away from the righteousness per superbiam, like the original clan.

glosses.latin: Si enim Deus naturalibus ramís non pepercit, ne forte nec tibi parcat.
footnotes: g: cf. Pedersen, Celt. Zeitsohr. II. 380
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who are(?)g Iudaei who have separated from Abraham’s faith.

glosses.latin: Si enim Deus naturalibus ramís non pepercit, ne forte nec tibi parcat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cani doich [vel]ɫ.[/vel] coníecmi nádnairchissa act iscoarcessea
glosses.glossText: .i. cani doich ɫ. coníecmi nádnairchissa act iscoarcessea
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cani doich ɫ. coníecmi nádnairchissa act iscoarcessea
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it not likely? or that it may not happen that He spare not, but it is that He may spare?

glosses.latin: in té bonitatem Dei si permanseris in bonitate; alioquin autem et tú excideris.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: in té bonitatem Dei si permanseris in bonitate; alioquin autem et tú excideris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus that it will be bonitas tibi.

glosses.latin: in té bonitatem Dei si permanseris in bonitate; alioquin autem et tú excideris.
footnotes: e: This seems to be some idiomatic expression translating alioquin J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. better is (thy) mind towards Him.

glosses.latin: in té bonitatem Dei si permanseris in bonitate; alioquin autem et tú excideris.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nipadíless duit aní hitái mani cáinairlither
glosses.glossText: .i. nipadíless duit aní hitái mani cáinairlither
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nipadíless duit aní hitái mani cáinairlither
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that in which thou art will not belong to thee, unless thou take good heed.

glosses.latin: Sed et illi, si non permanserint in incredulitate, inserentur, potens est enim Deus iterum inserere illos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. maybe they may attain that out of which they have been cut.

glosses.latin: Sed et illi, si non permanserint in incredulitate, inserentur, potens est enim Deus iterum inserere illos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for God can do it.

glosses.latin: Sed et illi, si non permanserint in incredulitate, inserentur, potens est enim Deus iterum inserere illos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. after their severance.

glosses.latin: Nam si tu ex naturali excisus és oleuastro, et contra naturam
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: insertus es in bonam olibam, quanto rnagis hii qui secundum naturam inserentur suae olibae!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cosmulius t[Con]ra[/Con] dombeir som [GLat]híc[/GLat] aris bésad leuso[Con]m[/Con] infid dothóbu [GLat]et[/GLat]fid aile do esnid[a] and
glosses.glossText: .i. cosmulius tra dombeir som híc aris bésad leusom infid dothóbu etfid aile do esnid and
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cosmulius tra dombeir som híc aris bésad leusom infid dothóbu etfid aile do esnida and
footnotes: a: esnid from en-sn.. cf. insnadat (gl. ingerunt) Sg. 14b 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a similitude, then, which he puts here, for they have a custom to cut a tree and to insert another tree therein.

glosses.latin: insertus es in bonam olibam, quanto rnagis hii qui secundum naturam inserentur suae olibae!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were more natural for them to be there.

glosses.latin: insertus es in bonam olibam, quanto rnagis hii qui secundum naturam inserentur suae olibae!
footnotes: f: lit. they have taught it to themselves: cf. LL. 400b 38: ni romunset arside doib beith i cathib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have learned<sup>f</sup> to be there.

glosses.latin: Nolo autem uos ignorare, fratres, misterium hoc, ut non sitis uobismet ipsis sapientes, quia cecitas ex parte contegit Israhel, donec plenitudo gentium intraret.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in summo marg.[/Com] .... nu dubgoithesi ... bad ... ba[b] inárpitissom
glosses.glossText: [in summo marg.] .... nu dubgoithesi ... bad ... ba inárpitissom
glosses.glossFNs: [in summo marg.] .... nu dubgoithesi ... bad ... ba<sup>b</sup> inárpitissom
footnotes: b: leg. ... nundubgoithesi combad asanorbu inarpitissom ‘ ... that ye should deceive yourselves that they were cast out of their inheritance’? J. S.

glosses.latin: Nolo autem uos ignorare, fratres, misterium hoc, ut non sitis uobismet ipsis sapientes, quia cecitas ex parte contegit Israhel, donec plenitudo gentium intraret.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdreecht díib nadrochreit [GLat]et[/GLat]muscreitfet cithésidi. [GLat]Aliter cecitas[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] burpe [GLat]ex parte[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] o aimsir bicc [GLat]ex parte contigit[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]tempore tantum ut Pelagius[/GLat][c]
glosses.glossText: .i. isdreecht díib nadrochreit etmuscreitfet cithésidi. Aliter cecitas .i. burpe ex parte .i. o aimsir bicc ex parte contigit .i. tempore tantum ut Pelagius
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdreecht díib nadrochreit etmuscreitfet cithésidi. Aliter cecitas .i. burpe ex parte .i. o aimsir bicc ex parte contigit .i. tempore tantum ut Pelagiusc
footnotes: c: Not in Migne, col. 726
g: cf. Ml. 21d 4, o chéin Atkinson, Passions and Homilies 1. 3890
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a portion of them that have not believed, and even they will soon believe. Aliter caecitas, i.e. stupidity, ex parte, i.e. for a little timeg.

glosses.latin: Nolo autem uos ignorare, fratres, misterium hoc, ut non sitis uobismet ipsis sapientes, quia cecitas ex parte contegit Israhel, donec plenitudo gentium intraret.
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄríctar huili genti ɫ. drécht caichceniúil
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄríctar huili genti ɫ. drécht caichceniúil
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. till all the Gentiles are saved, or a portion of every nation.

glosses.latin: Et síc omnis Israhel saluus fieret, sicut scriptum est: Veniet ex Sión qui eripiat, et auertat inpietatem ab Iacob.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that Israel will be saved.

glosses.latin: Et síc omnis Israhel saluus fieret, sicut scriptum est: Veniet ex Sión qui eripiat, et auertat inpietatem ab Iacob.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et síc omnis Israhel saluus fieret, sicut scriptum est: Veniet ex Sión qui eripiat, et auertat inpietatem ab Iacob.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dosnicfa cobir cidmall bithmaith im[Con]mu[/Con]r[Con]gu[/Con] intain dondiccfa
glosses.glossText: .i. dosnicfa cobir cidmall bithmaith immurgu intain dondiccfa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dosnicfa cobir cidmall bithmaith immurgu intain dondiccfa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. help will come to them, though it be slow: it will, however, be good when it will so come.

glosses.latin: Fratres secundum euangelium quidem inimici propter uos; secundum electionem autem, carisimi propter patres.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]gentiles[/GLat] nímcharatsa indfir hore p[Con]ri[/Con]dchim soscele dogentib
glosses.glossText: .i. gentiles nímcharatsa indfir hore pridchim soscele dogentib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. gentiles nímcharatsa indfir hore pridchim soscele dogentib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. gentiles. The men love me not because I preach (the) gospel to Gentiles.

glosses.latin: Fratres secundum euangelium quidem inimici propter uos; secundum electionem autem, carisimi propter patres.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] itcarit domsa im[Con]murgu[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] noscarimse iscland tuicse dodia
glosses.glossText: .i. itcarit domsa immurgu .i. noscarimse iscland tuicse dodia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. itcarit domsa immurgu .i. noscarimse iscland tuicse dodia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are friends of mine, however, that is, I love them, it is a clan chosen unto God.

glosses.latin: Sine penitentia enim sunt dona et uncationes Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. forgiveness of sin.

glosses.latin: Sine penitentia enim sunt dona et uncationes Dei.
footnotes: d: cf. issidnaithrech Ml. 90d 12, nibadambeó LL. 276a 41
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what He has promised He will not repent of.

glosses.latin: Sicut enim aliquando et uos non credidistis Deo, . . misericordiam consecuti estis propter illorum incredulitatem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there was a time that ye have not believed, until misericordia Dei came unto you.

glosses.latin: Sicut enim aliquando et uos non credidistis Deo, . . misericordiam consecuti estis propter illorum incredulitatem.
footnotes: e: rectius rocrochsat
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have denied and have crucified Christ.

glosses.latin: ut et ipsi misericordiam consequantur
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bid [GLat]missericordia[/GLat] dano dodaessarrso[Con]m[/Con] nípa [GLat]meritum[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]opus legis[/GLat] intain creitfite
glosses.glossText: .i. bid missericordia dano dodaessarrsom nípa meritum ɫ. opus legis intain creitfite
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bid missericordia dano dodaessarrsom nípa meritum ɫ. opus legis intain creitfite
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be misericordia then that will save them when they shall believe: it will not be meritum or opus Legis.

glosses.latin: Conclusit enim Deus omnia in incredulitate.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]conclusit Pelagius inuenit omnia in increduli[Con]tate[/Con] Pelagius non uí sed ratione[/GLat][b] [ie].i.[/ie] arduetarrid [ie].i.[/ie] nitella doneuch and moide[Con]m[/Con] aarilte ↄdarícc [GLat]missericordia dei[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] conclusit Pelagius inuenit omnia in incredulitate Pelagius non uí sed ratione .i. arduetarrid .i. nitella doneuch and moidem aarilte ↄdarícc missericordia dei
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] conclusit Pelagius inuenit omnia in incredulitate Pelagius non uí sed rationeb .i. arduetarrid .i. nitella doneuch and moidem aarilte ↄdarícc missericordia dei
footnotes: b: ‘Nou vi conclusit, sed ratione conclusit, quos inuenit in incredulitate,’ Migne, coi. 727
d: cf. Bev. Celt. xxi. 176, Saranw, Irske Studier, p. 48.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for He seized, i.e. there is no room for any oned there to boast of his merits, so that misericordia Dei has saved them.

glosses.latin: O altitudo diuitiarum sapientiae et scientiae Dei! quam incomprehensibilia sunt iudicia eius, et inuestigabiles uiae eius!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isfudumuin indrúnso ícc indomuin [GLat]et omnium hominum per misericordiam[/GLat] iarsindí batir inricci dubáas huili
glosses.glossText: .i. isfudumuin indrúnso ícc indomuin et omnium hominum per misericordiam iarsindí batir inricci dubáas huili
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isfudumuin indrúnso ícc indomuin et omnium hominum per misericordiam iarsindí batir inricci dubáas huili
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. profound is this mystery, the salvation of the world et omnium, etc., after they all were worthy of death.

glosses.latin: O altitudo diuitiarum sapientiae et scientiae Dei! quam incomprehensibilia sunt iudicia eius, et inuestigabiles uiae eius!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no one knows them.

glosses.latin: O altitudo diuitiarum sapientiae et scientiae Dei! quam incomprehensibilia sunt iudicia eius, et inuestigabiles uiae eius!
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] C[Con]ei[/Con]s[Con]t[/Con] cateet [GLat]diuitiae[/GLat] sund [GLat]et sapientiae et scientiae et[/GLat] cateet [GLat]inscrutabilia iudicia et[/GLat] cateet [GLat]inuestigabiles uiae et[/GLat] cate [GLat]sensus Domini[/GLat]; ni[Con]anse[/Con] isdo tiagait indrétaisin huili dont lathur diasndísiu robói hirúnaib innadeacte octuiste dúile hitossuch. ní asse linn ǽm léim dindbéstatu [GLat]et[/GLat]dind tinchosc innandóine foraisṅdíis di thuiste dúile ismenand isdindinsci ria[Con]m[/Con] lenid [GLat]et[/GLat]ished ada[Con]m[/Con]rigethar [GLat]híc[/GLat] fudu[Con]m[/Con]ne indfiss hoarícc dia ácenele ṅdoine [GLat]per misericordiam[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Ceist cateet diuitiae sund et sapientiae et scientiae et cateet inscrutabilia iudicia et cateet inuestigabiles uiae et cate sensus Domini; nianse isdo tiagait indrétaisin huili dont lathur diasndísiu robói hirúnaib innadeacte octuiste dúile hitossuch. ní asse linn ǽm léim dindbéstatu etdind tinchosc innandóine foraisṅdíis di thuiste dúile ismenand isdindinsci riam lenid etished adamrigethar híc fudumne indfiss hoarícc dia ácenele ṅdoine per misericordiam
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Ceist cateet diuitiae sund et sapientiae et scientiae et cateet inscrutabilia iudicia et cateet inuestigabiles uiae et cate sensus Domini; nianse isdo tiagait indrétaisin huili dont lathur diasndísiu robói hirúnaib innadeacte octuiste dúile hitossuch. ní asse linn ǽm léim dindbéstatu etdind tinchosc innandóine foraisṅdíis di thuiste dúile ismenand isdindinsci riam lenid etished adamrigethar híc fudumne indfiss hoarícc dia ácenele ṅdoine per misericordiam
footnotes: e: láthar .i. gach ciall inchleithe O’Cl.
glosses.glossTrans: Question: what are divitiae here, and sapientiae and scientiae, and what are inscrutabilia iudicia, and what are investigabiles viae, and what is sensus Domini? Easy (to answer): to this apply all those things, to the unspeakable plane which was in the mysteries of the Godhead in creating (the) elements at (the) beginning. It does not seem to us easy, indeed, to leap from the morality and from the teaching of human beings to a declaration of (the) creation of (the) elements. It is clear that he adheres to the previous utterance, and it is this that he admires híc, the depth of the knowledge whereby God has saved the race of men per misericordiam.

glosses.latin: Obsecro itaque uos, fratres, per misericordiam Dei, ut exhibeatis corpora uesbra hostiam uiuam, sanctam, Deo placentem, rationabile sit obsequium uestrum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nímchubandom attach trócaire frib istree rob hícad
glosses.glossText: .i. nímchubandom attach trócaire frib istree rob hícad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nímchubandom attach trócaire frib istree rob hícad
footnotes: f: Reading ní-im-chuba n-dom, and taking cuba to be = cumha: but this is a mere guess. W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (it is) not much trouble to me<sup>f</sup> to entreat mercy from you(?): it is through it that ye have been saved.

glosses.latin: Obsecro itaque uos, fratres, per misericordiam Dei, ut exhibeatis corpora uesbra hostiam uiuam, sanctam, Deo placentem, rationabile sit obsequium uestrum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]castam et alienam a peccato[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ab omnibus uitiís[/GLat] aris irlam indanim do thuil dée todiusgadar dana indanim dodénum maith
glosses.glossText: .i. castam et alienam a peccato .i. ab omnibus uitiís aris irlam indanim do thuil dée todiusgadar dana indanim dodénum maith
glosses.glossFNs: .i. castam et alienam a peccato .i. ab omnibus uitiís aris irlam indanim do thuil dée todiusgadar dana indanim dodénum maith
glosses.glossTrans: for the soul is ready to (do) God’s will: let the soul, then, be roused to do good.

glosses.latin: Obsecro itaque uos, fratres, per misericordiam Dei, ut exhibeatis corpora uesbra hostiam uiuam, sanctam, Deo placentem, rationabile sit obsequium uestrum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ut [Res]o[/Res]pperabatur[/GLat][c] [GLat]in lege ante ostium templi[/GLat] cenchaile nachdatho cenchaile pectho
glosses.glossText: .i. ut (o)pperabatur in lege ante ostium templi cenchaile nachdatho cenchaile pectho
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ut (o)pperabaturc in lege ante ostium templi cenchaile nachdatho cenchaile pectho
footnotes: c: leg. offerebatur
g: cf. cen gain (leg. chaili) ṅ-duib nó temein (of the paschal lamb), Saltair na Rann 3902
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ut, etc., without a spot of any colour, without a spot of sin<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Obsecro itaque uos, fratres, per misericordiam Dei, ut exhibeatis corpora uesbra hostiam uiuam, sanctam, Deo placentem, rationabile sit obsequium uestrum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every prayer that ye make in God’s will be lawful (rationabile).

glosses.latin: sed [re]formamini in nouitate sensus uestri, ut probetis quae sit uoluntas Dei bona, [et] placens, et perfecta.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]renouate sensum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] padglicc far nintliucht [GLat]non ut fuit ante[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. renouate sensum .i. padglicc far nintliucht non ut fuit ante
glosses.glossFNs: .i. renouate sensum .i. padglicc far nintliucht non ut fuit ante
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let your mind be astute, non, etc. i.e. God’s will, then, is this, that is this triad, i.e. bona, etc., and it is the same as the triad which he has mentioned before, i.e. hostia, etc.

glosses.latin: sed [re]formamini in nouitate sensus uestri, ut probetis quae sit uoluntas Dei bona, [et] placens, et perfecta.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issí thol dée didiú anísiu [ie].i.[/ie] átredeso [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]bona et placens et perfecta et[/GLat] isinunn [GLat]et[/GLat] atréde remiérbart [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]hostia uiua et sancta et placabilis[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. issí thol dée didiú anísiu .i. átredeso .i. bona et placens et perfecta et isinunn et atréde remiérbart .i. hostia uiua et sancta et placabilis rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issí thol dée didiú anísiu .i. átredeso .i. bona et placens et perfecta et isinunn et atréde remiérbart .i. hostia uiua et sancta et placabilis rl.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Dico . . omnibus . . non plus sapere quam oportet sapere; sed sapere ad prudentiam, et unicuique sicut Deus diuisit mensuram fidei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished a[GLat]plús sapere[/GLat] lessom na ní ararogarts[Con]om[/Con] madugnether ished im[Con]murgu[/Con] a[GLat]sapere ad prudentiam[/GLat] cach réit ararogartsom donebdénum [GLat]et[/GLat] aforchongair dochomalnad
glosses.glossText: .i. ished aplús sapere lessom na ní ararogartsom madugnether ished immurgu asapere ad prudentiam cach réit ararogartsom donebdénum et aforchongair dochomalnad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished aplús sapere lessom na ní ararogartsom madugnether ished immurgu asapere ad prudentiam cach réit ararogartsom donebdénum et aforchongair dochomalnad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the plus sapere according to him, if anything which he has forbidden should be done: this, however, is the sapere ad prudentiam, to avoid doing anything which he has forbidden and to fulfil what he orders.

glosses.latin: Dico . . omnibus . . non plus sapere quam oportet sapere; sed sapere ad prudentiam, et unicuique sicut Deus diuisit mensuram fidei.
footnotes: a: rectius dochách
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as He gives it to every one according to his faith.

glosses.latin: omnia autem membra non eundem actum habent.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]Non potest enim uisus nisi in occulís fieri et[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [ie].i.[/ie] óingním im[Con]murgu[/Con] immefolngat [GLat]omnia membra[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] óintimthrecht
glosses.glossText: .i. Non potest enim uisus nisi in occulís fieri et rl. .i. óingním immurgu immefolngat omnia membra .i. óintimthrecht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. Non potest enim uisus nisi in occulís fieri et rl. .i. óingním immurgu immefolngat omnia membra .i. óintimthrecht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a single work, however, omnia membra perform, that is, a single service.

glosses.latin: Ita multi unum corpus sumus in Christo, singuli autem alter altirius membra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we are a body to Christ, and He is a head to us.

glosses.latin: Ita multi unum corpus sumus in Christo, singuli autem alter altirius membra.
footnotes: b: cf. Matth, xi. 13
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. sunt, i.e. every one severally.

glosses.latin: Ita multi unum corpus sumus in Christo, singuli autem alter altirius membra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. est, i.e. every one is a member to another.

glosses.latin: Habentes autem donations secundum gratiam quae data est nobís, diferentes; siue prophetiam secundum rationem fidei,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished fodera in inchongna[Con]m[/Con][c] sin huaire issain dán cáich
glosses.glossText: .i. ished fodera in inchongnam sin huaire issain dán cáich
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished fodera in inchongnam<sup>c</sup> sin huaire issain dán cáich
footnotes: c: leg. inn imchongnam, which is translated
d: 1 Cor. vii. 20
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that causes that mutual co-operation<sup>d</sup>, because every one’s gift is different.

glosses.latin: Habentes autem donations secundum gratiam quae data est nobís, diferentes; siue prophetiam secundum rationem fidei,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] rombói cuit cáich dinrath diadu
glosses.glossText: .i. amal rombói cuit cáich dinrath diadu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal rombói cuit cáich dinrath diadu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as has been each one’s portion of the divine grace.

glosses.latin: Habentes autem donations secundum gratiam quae data est nobís, diferentes; siue prophetiam secundum rationem fidei,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. different (is) every one’s gift.

glosses.latin: Habentes autem donations secundum gratiam quae data est nobís, diferentes; siue prophetiam secundum rationem fidei,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bad iárṅdligud hirisse [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ut non seodoprofete qui trans fidem profetabant[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. bad iárṅdligud hirisse .i. ut non seodoprofete qui trans fidem profetabant
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bad iárṅdligud hirisse .i. ut non seodoprofete qui trans fidem profetabant
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be it according to (the) rule of faith, non ut etc.

glosses.latin: Siue ministerium in ministrando, siue qui docet in doctrina.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be in ministry, that is, in oboedientia to every one.

glosses.latin: Siue ministerium in ministrando, siue qui docet in doctrina.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] robo intí forchain [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]unusquisque in quo uoca[Res]tus est[/Res][/GLat][d] [etc]rl.[/etc] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] p[Con]re[/Con]cept dochách [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]hominibus post babtisma[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] bad hiforcitul[e] [ie].i.[/ie] achomalnad condib desimrecht dochách
glosses.glossText: .i. robo intí forchain .i. unusquisque in quo uoca(tus est) rl. ɫ. precept dochách .i. hominibus post babtisma .i. bad hiforcitul .i. achomalnad condib desimrecht dochách
glosses.glossFNs: .i. robo intí forchain .i. unusquisque in quo uoca(tus est)d rl. ɫ. precept dochách .i. hominibus post babtisma .i. bad hiforcitule .i. achomalnad condib desimrecht dochách
footnotes: d: 1 Cor. vii. 20
e: The glossator takes the Latin as: qui docet, sit in doctrina
glosses.glossTrans: either he that teaches, i.e. unusquisque, etc., or preaching to every one, i.e. hominibus post baptisma, i.e. let it be in teaching, that is, to fulfil it so that he may be an example to every one.

glosses.latin: Qui exoriatur in exortando, qui tribuit in semplicitate, ... qui miseretur in hilaritate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him encourage every one.

glosses.latin: Qui exoriatur in exortando, qui tribuit in semplicitate, ... qui miseretur in hilaritate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be it in simplicity.

glosses.latin: Qui exoriatur in exortando, qui tribuit in semplicitate, ... qui miseretur in hilaritate.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bad iroithinchi [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]hilarem enim datorem delegit deus[/GLat][d]
glosses.glossText: .i. bad iroithinchi .i. hilarem enim datorem delegit deus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bad iroithinchi .i. hilarem enim datorem delegit deusd
footnotes: d: 2 Cor. ix. 7
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be it in cheerfulness.

glosses.latin: Dilectio sine simulatione.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] censectti [ie].i.[/ie] níp sain anasberthar hogiun [GLat]et[/GLat] ambess hicridiu
glosses.glossText: .i. censectti .i. níp sain anasberthar hogiun et ambess hicridiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. censectti .i. níp sain anasberthar hogiun et ambess hicridiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without simulation, that is, what is uttered by mouth and what is in heart must not be different.

glosses.latin: Caritate fraternitatis inuicem diligentes. Honore inuicem praeuenientes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bad fuairrech cách frialaile ondesercc brathardi
glosses.glossText: .i. bad fuairrech cách frialaile ondesercc brathardi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bad fuairrech cách frialaile ondesercc brathardi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every one be gentle to the other from brotherly love.

glosses.latin: Caritate fraternitatis inuicem diligentes. Honore inuicem praeuenientes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] taibred cách airmitin dialailiu [GLat]et[/GLat] nách taibred[e] do feisin
glosses.glossText: .i. taibred cách airmitin dialailiu et nách taibred do feisin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. taibred cách airmitin dialailiu et nách taibrede do feisin
footnotes: e: leg. thaibred? cf. KZ xxxv 361, 412
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every one give honour to the other and not give it to himself.

glosses.latin: Sollicitudine non pigri. Spiritu feruentes. Domino seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Sollicitudine non pigri. Spiritu feruentes. Domino seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that the ardour of the love of the Spirit may be in us.

glosses.latin: Sollicitudine non pigri. Spiritu feruentes. Domino seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be God whom we serve.

glosses.latin: Spe gaudentes. In tribulatione patientes. Orationi instantes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. gloria futura strengthens our hope.

glosses.latin: Spe gaudentes. In tribulatione patientes. Orationi instantes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye patient.

glosses.latin: Spe gaudentes. In tribulatione patientes. Orationi instantes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] baán tairismich doirnigdi [GLat]ut tribulatio possit tolerari[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. baán tairismich doirnigdi ut tribulatio possit tolerari
glosses.glossFNs: .i. baán tairismich doirnigdi ut tribulatio possit tolerari
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let us be constant in prayer, ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Bene[dicite] persequentibus uos, benedicite, et nolite maledicer.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní lour inbendachad diammaldachae, ní lour dano innebmaldachad manibendachae
glosses.glossText: .i. ní lour inbendachad diammaldachae, ní lour dano innebmaldachad manibendachae
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní lour inbendachad diammaldachae, ní lour dano innebmaldachad manibendachae
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not enough is the blessing if thou curse: not enough, also, is the non-cursing if thou bless not.

glosses.latin: Gaudete cum gaudentibus, flete cum flentibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every one’s joy be a joy unto you.

glosses.latin: Gaudete cum gaudentibus, flete cum flentibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every one’s grief be a grief unto you.

glosses.latin: Id ipsum inuicem de uobis sentientes .... humilibus consentientes. Nolite esse prudentes aput semet ipsos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] infáilti sin [vel]ɫ.[/vel] inbrón am[Con]al[/Con] bid dúib doecmoised
glosses.glossText: .i. infáilti sin ɫ. inbrón amal bid dúib doecmoised
glosses.glossFNs: .i. infáilti sin ɫ. inbrón amal bid dúib doecmoised
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that joy or the grief as if unto you it had happened.

glosses.latin: Id ipsum inuicem de uobis sentientes .... humilibus consentientes. Nolite esse prudentes aput semet ipsos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every lowly deed, let it be it that ye do.

glosses.latin: Nulli malum pro malo reddentes; prouidentes bona non tantum coram Deo, sed etiam coram hominibus omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. evil for evil.

glosses.latin: Nulli malum pro malo reddentes; prouidentes bona non tantum coram Deo, sed etiam coram hominibus omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for that is the true prudence.

glosses.latin: Nulli malum pro malo reddentes; prouidentes bona non tantum coram Deo, sed etiam coram hominibus omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whatever good there is let it be it which ye do.

glosses.latin: Nulli malum pro malo reddentes; prouidentes bona non tantum coram Deo, sed etiam coram hominibus omnibus.
glosses.glossText: .i. ut uideant opera uestra rl. .i. cáingním doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ut uideant opera uestraf rl. .i. cáingním doib
footnotes: f: Matth. v. 39
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a well-doing by them.

glosses.latin: Si potest fieri quod ex uobis est, cum omnibus hominibus pacem habentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it be in your power.

glosses.latin: Si potest fieri quod ex uobis est, cum omnibus hominibus pacem habentes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cipcruth bíid [GLat]páx[/GLat] libsi fricách ciabethir ocfar ningrim
glosses.glossText: .i. cipcruth bíid páx libsi fricách ciabethir ocfar ningrim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cipcruth bíid páx libsi fricách ciabethir ocfar ningrim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. howsoever it be, let there be pax with you towards every one, though they be a-persecuting you.

glosses.latin: Non uosmet ipsos defendentes, carissimi, ... Scriptum est enim: Mih uendictam, ego reddam, dicit Dominus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ná bad fornert dofema [GLat]né uós ira deprechendat uel sí quis té percusserit[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. ná bad fornert dofema né uós ira deprechendat uel sí quis té percusserit rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ná bad fornert dofema né uós ira deprechendat uel sí quis té percusserit rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it not be your strength that defends you, ne uos, etc.

glosses.latin: Non uosmet ipsos defendentes, carissimi, ... Scriptum est enim: Mih uendictam, ego reddam, dicit Dominus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non uosmet ipsos defendentes, carissimi, ... Scriptum est enim: Mih uendictam, ego reddam, dicit Dominus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] farṅdígalsi [ie].i.[/ie] bid adas farmbáich rosmbia alóg
glosses.glossText: .i. farṅdígalsi .i. bid adas farmbáich rosmbia alóg
glosses.glossFNs: .i. farṅdígalsi .i. bid adas farmbáich rosmbia alóg
footnotes: e: the meaning seems to be that their payment will be proportionate to their fighting you: cf. Pedersen, Aspirationen, p. 95. Can fri have been omitted before far-?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. vengeance for you, that is, ...<sup>e</sup> they shall have payment for it.

glosses.latin: Non uosmet ipsos defendentes, carissimi, ... Scriptum est enim: Mih uendictam, ego reddam, dicit Dominus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (it is) likely that it will be true.

glosses.latin: Sed si essurit inimicus tuus, ciba illum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] commarí[a] farṅdígal huaimse iscoru dúib si ón [GLat]quam uindictam reddere[/GLat].
glosses.glossText: .i. commarí farṅdígal huaimse iscoru dúib si ón quam uindictam reddere.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. commaría farṅdígal huaimse iscoru dúib si ón quam uindictam reddere.
footnotes: a: = co’mma-rí, cf. commaairic = co’mma-air-ic Ml 133c 4, commaterchomla = co’mma-ter-chomla Wb. 14a 2
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in order that vengeance for you may happen from me, that is meeter for you quam, etc.

glosses.latin: Noli uinci á malo; sed uince in bono malum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní dene comrud friss inulcc arnabad huilcc[b] diblínaib
glosses.glossText: .i. ní dene comrud friss inulcc arnabad huilcc diblínaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní dene comrud friss inulcc arnabad huilcc<sup>b</sup> diblínaib
footnotes: b: MS. huicc
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou shouldst not make contest(?) with him in evil lest both of you become evil.

glosses.latin: Noli uinci á malo; sed uince in bono malum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]ille uicisse[/GLat][c] [GLat]dicitur qui alterum ad suam duxit partem[/GLat][d] [ie].i.[/ie] dognésu maith frisso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] bid maidsom iarum
glosses.glossText: .i. Pelagius: ille uicisse dicitur qui alterum ad suam duxit partem .i. dognésu maith frissom et bid maidsom iarum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. Pelagius: ille uicissec dicitur qui alterum ad suam duxit partemd .i. dognésu maith frissom et bid maidsom iarum
footnotes: c: MS. uincisse
d: Ille dicitur uicisse alterum, qui eum ad suam duxerit partem, Migne, col. 732
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou shouldst do good to him, and he will be good afterwards.

glosses.latin: non est potestas nisi a Deo; quae autem sunt, a Deo ordinatae sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for the wicked power he counteth not for a power.

glosses.latin: non est potestas nisi a Deo; quae autem sunt, a Deo ordinatae sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless it be of God.

glosses.latin: non est potestas nisi a Deo; quae autem sunt, a Deo ordinatae sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nacumactte is dia rodordigestar [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nacumachte file [GLat]a deo[/GLat] itordigthi
glosses.glossText: .i. nacumactte is dia rodordigestar ɫ. nacumachte file a deo itordigthi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nacumactte is dia rodordigestar ɫ. nacumachte file a deo itordigthi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. each power, it is God that has ordained it, or the powers that are a Deo they are ordained.

glosses.latin: Itaque qui resistit potestati, Dei ordinationi resistit; qui autem resistunt, ipsi sibi dampnationem adquirunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre ronortigestar dia cedono tuidecht friss
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre ronortigestar dia cedono tuidecht friss
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre ronortigestar dia cedono tuidecht friss
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since God has ordained, why then go against Him?

glosses.latin: Itaque qui resistit potestati, Dei ordinationi resistit; qui autem resistunt, ipsi sibi dampnationem adquirunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ros mbia lóg asithichtho is dianimortun fésine nimathi nech doib
glosses.glossText: .i. ros mbia lóg asithichtho is dianimortun fésine nimathi nech doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ros mbia lóg asithichtho is dianimortun fésine nimathi nech doib
footnotes: f: sithichtho seems gen. sing. of sithugud, which occurs in Celt. Zeitschr. III. 449: sithugud fri cursagad ‘resistance to reproof’
g: imortun is obscure and probably corrupt: read diam míortun ‘it is to their own disgrace; no one forgives them it’? J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they shall have (the) reward of their resistance(?)<sup>f</sup>: it is to their own disgrace(?)<sup>g</sup> that He does not forgive any of them.

glosses.latin: Itaque qui resistit potestati, Dei ordinationi resistit; qui autem resistunt, ipsi sibi dampnationem adquirunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. punishment, that is, they receive.

glosses.latin: Nam principes non sunt timori boni operis, sed mali. Vís autem non timere potestatem? bonum fác, et habebis laudem ex illa.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. bomim opus fears them not, i.e. its fear.

glosses.latin: Nam principes non sunt timori boni operis, sed mali. Vís autem non timere potestatem? bonum fác, et habebis laudem ex illa.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] badeidbiriu dodrogníim [Com]in marg.[/Com] hóre ismórad daggnímo dogní [GLat]et[/GLat]troethath droggnímo
glosses.glossText: .i. badeidbiriu dodrogníim [in marg.] hóre ismórad daggnímo dogní ettroethath droggnímo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. badeidbiriu dodrogníim [in marg.] hóre ismórad daggnímo dogní ettroethath droggnímo
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were more reasonable for an evil deed (to fear them), because it is a magnifying of well-doing which he doth, and an abating of ill-doing.

glosses.latin: Nam principes non sunt timori boni operis, sed mali. Vís autem non timere potestatem? bonum fác, et habebis laudem ex illa.
glosses.glossFullTags: assindet sunt t[Con]ra[/Con] citné cumacte diandid cóir infogna[Con]m[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] indí ↄsechat hulcu [GLat]et[/GLat]mórate mathi
glosses.glossText: assindet sunt tra citné cumacte diandid cóir infognam .i. indí ↄsechat hulcu etmórate mathi
glosses.glossFNs: assindet sunt tra citné cumacte diandid cóir infognam .i. indí ↄsechat hulcu etmórate mathi
glosses.glossTrans: he (Paul) declares here, then, what are the powers unto which the service is proper, to wit, they that correct the evil and magnify the good.

glosses.latin: Nam principes non sunt timori boni operis, sed mali. Vís autem non timere potestatem? bonum fác, et habebis laudem ex illa.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nam principes non sunt timori boni operis, sed mali. Vís autem non timere potestatem? bonum fác, et habebis laudem ex illa.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rotbia less lóg dodaggníma. [GLat]Ori[Con]genes[/Con][/GLat]: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]laudem a deo accipies si sis subditus regibus propter deum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ishé dobeir lóg deit tarhési do dagnímo
glosses.glossText: .i. rotbia less lóg dodaggníma. Origenes: .i. laudem a deo accipies si sis subditus regibus propter deum .i. ishé dobeir lóg deit tarhési do dagnímo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rotbia less lóg dodaggníma. Origenes: .i. laudem a deo accipies si sis subditus regibus propter deum .i. ishé dobeir lóg deit tarhési do dagnímo
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou shalt have with Him reward of thy well-doing ... i.e. it is He that gives thee a reward for thy well-doing.

glosses.latin: Si autem malum feceris, time; non enim sine causa gladium portat. Dei enim minister est, uindex in iram éi qui malum agit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is so that is reasonable for thee to fear him.

glosses.latin: Si autem malum feceris, time; non enim sine causa gladium portat. Dei enim minister est, uindex in iram éi qui malum agit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdeidbir haáigthiu arisdothabirt díglae berid inclaideb sin
glosses.glossText: .i. isdeidbir haáigthiu arisdothabirt díglae berid inclaideb sin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdeidbir haáigthiu arisdothabirt díglae berid inclaideb sin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. reasonable it is to fear him, for it is to inflict punishment that he bears that sword.

glosses.latin: Si autem malum feceris, time; non enim sine causa gladium portat. Dei enim minister est, uindex in iram éi qui malum agit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niarichthi[a] occo arisdiráith dée dobeir dígail fort
glosses.glossText: .i. niarichthi occo arisdiráith dée dobeir dígail fort
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niarichthi<sup>a</sup> occo arisdiráith dée dobeir dígail fort
footnotes: a: leg. ni carichthi? Sarauw (cf. Wb. 28b 2), which is translated
b: cf. ráith no doráith .i. ar son O’Cl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he is not to be blamed therein, for it is for God<sup>b</sup> that he inflicts punishment upon thee.

glosses.latin: Si autem malum feceris, time; non enim sine causa gladium portat. Dei enim minister est, uindex in iram éi qui malum agit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not on any other.

glosses.latin: Ideo necessitate subditi estote, non solum propter iram, sed et propter conscientiam.
glosses.glossFullTags: i. hore dofeich cach nolcc [GLat]et[/GLat] mórid cachmaith
glosses.glossText: i. hore dofeich cach nolcc et mórid cachmaith
glosses.glossFNs: i. hore dofeich cach nolcc et mórid cachmaith
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because he punishes every evil and magnifies every good.

glosses.latin: Ideo necessitate subditi estote, non solum propter iram, sed et propter conscientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because he can punish them.

glosses.latin: Ideo necessitate subditi estote, non solum propter iram, sed et propter conscientiam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore rofitis is occ maid atáa [ie].i.[/ie] hore is[GLat]minister deo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hore rofitis is occ maid atáa .i. hore isminister deo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore rofitis is occ maid atáa .i. hore isminister deo
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because ye know that he is engaged in good, that is, because he is minister Deo.

glosses.latin: Ideo enim et tributa praestatis; ministri enim sunt Dei, in hoc ipsum seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus it is.

glosses.latin: Ideo enim et tributa praestatis; ministri enim sunt Dei, in hoc ipsum seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. give ye their due to them.

glosses.latin: Ideo enim et tributa praestatis; ministri enim sunt Dei, in hoc ipsum seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is proper to give it to them.

glosses.latin: Ideo enim et tributa praestatis; ministri enim sunt Dei, in hoc ipsum seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are not negligent therein.

glosses.latin: Reddite ergo omnibus debita.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nemini quicquam debeatis .... qui enim diligit proximum legem impleuit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nídlegar ní dúib [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]deponite debita omnia ut liberi sitis caritati[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nídlegar ní dúib .i. deponite debita omnia ut liberi sitis caritati
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nídlegar ní dúib .i. deponite debita omnia ut liberi sitis caritati
footnotes: c: leg. nádlegar = ‘let nothing be owed by you’?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. nothing is owed by you<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Nemini quicquam debeatis .... qui enim diligit proximum legem impleuit.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: et quod est aliud mandatum, in hoc uerbo instauratur: Diliges proximum tuum sicut teipsum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. besides this.

glosses.latin: et quod est aliud mandatum, in hoc uerbo instauratur: Diliges proximum tuum sicut teipsum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: 10–11. Dilectio proximi malum non operatur. Plenitudo ergo legis est dilectio; Et hoc scientes tempus, quia hora est iam nos de somno surgere.
glosses.glossText: .i. isaimser benefaciendi ɫ. noui testamenti ɫ. ascomalnad recto dilectio proximi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isaimser benefaciendi ɫ. noui testamenti ɫ. ascomalnad recto dilectio proximi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a time benefaciendi vel, etc., or that dilectio proximi is fulfilment of (the) Law.

glosses.latin: induamur arma lucis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: induamur arma lucis.
footnotes: c: As to cid ... cid see Sarauw, Irske Studier, 32
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it (induamur) is construed bothc actively and passively.

glosses.latin: Sicut in die honeste ambulemus .... non in cubilibus, non
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal isilóu badsochrud arnimthecht hore isfride imtiagam [GLat]et[/GLat] adciam arconair [Com]marg. sup.[/Com]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal isilóu badsochrud arnimthecht hore isfride imtiagam et adciam arconair [marg. sup.]
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal isilóu badsochrud arnimthecht hore isfride imtiagam et adciam arconair [marg. sup.]
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as it is in (the) day let our going be decent, because it is by day that we travel and we see our way. [in marg.]

glosses.latin: Sicut in die honeste ambulemus .... non in cubilibus, non
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in copulations.

glosses.latin: contensione et aemulatione.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every kind of strife.

glosses.latin: contensione et aemulatione.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in jealousy, i.e. in envy.

glosses.latin: Sed induite uos Dominum Iesum Christum, et carnis curam ne feceretis in desiderís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bedimthugesi [GLat]domino[/GLat] corroaitreba indiib [vel]ɫ.[/vel] bedimthuge dúibsi cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. bedimthugesi domino corroaitreba indiib ɫ. bedimthuge dúibsi crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bedimthugesi domino corroaitreba indiib ɫ. bedimthuge dúibsi crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye raiment Domino so that He may dwell in you, or let Christ be raiment unto you.

glosses.latin: Sed induite uos Dominum Iesum Christum, et carnis curam ne feceretis in desiderís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it not be subject to your flesh that ye abide.

glosses.latin: Infirmum in fide adsumite, non in discep[ta]tionibus cogitationum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it not be to judge him.

glosses.latin: Infirmum in fide adsumite, non in discep[ta]tionibus cogitationum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nabad indebthib [ie].i.[/ie] nabad hé fornimbradud nách maith aní itáa
glosses.glossText: .i. nabad indebthib .i. nabad hé fornimbradud nách maith aní itáa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nabad indebthib .i. nabad hé fornimbradud nách maith aní itáa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it not be in disputations, that is, let it not be your opinion that his state (of mind) is not good.

glosses.latin: Alius quidem credit se manducare omnia; qui autem infirmus est, holus manducet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is to them is said ‘sumite.’

glosses.latin: Alius quidem credit se manducare omnia; qui autem infirmus est, holus manducet.
footnotes: d: 1 Tim. iv. 4
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. strong is his faith: he deems every food pure<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Alius quidem credit se manducare omnia; qui autem infirmus est, holus manducet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he who is weak of faith.

glosses.latin: Alius quidem credit se manducare omnia; qui autem infirmus est, holus manducet.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bairgen [GLat]tantum et[/GLat]is ferr són lesso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]ut fuit dániel et trés pueri[/GLat][a]
glosses.glossText: .i. bairgen tantum etis ferr són lessom ut fuit dániel et trés pueri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bairgen tantum etis ferr són lessom ut fuit dániel et trés pueria
footnotes: a: Daniel i. 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. bread tantum, and he prefers that, ut fuit, etc.

glosses.latin: qui non manducat, manducantem non iudicet, Deus enim illum adsumpsit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him not put reprobation upon him.

glosses.latin: qui non manducat, manducantem non iudicet, Deus enim illum adsumpsit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quia gratia uocatus est. Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]ita illum uocábi[/GLat][b] [GLat]ut té[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ní laugi abríig less [GLat]quam[/GLat] tú
glosses.glossText: .i. quia gratia uocatus est. Pelagius: ita illum uocábi ut té .i. ní laugi abríig less quam tú
glosses.glossFNs: .i. quia gratia uocatus est. Pelagius: ita illum uocábib ut té .i. ní laugi abríig less quam tú
footnotes: b: i.e. uocauit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He cares for him not less than for thee.

glosses.latin: Tú quis és, qui iudicas alenum seruum? suo Domino stat aut cadit; stabit autem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what sort of person art thou?

glosses.latin: Tú quis és, qui iudicas alenum seruum? suo Domino stat aut cadit; stabit autem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not unto thee is he servant, it is unto God.

glosses.latin: Tú quis és, qui iudicas alenum seruum? suo Domino stat aut cadit; stabit autem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there will be a time that he will not be feeble.

glosses.latin: Nam alius iudicat diem inter diem; alius iudicat omnem diem. Unusquisque in suo sensu habundet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he is wont to have a particular day.

glosses.latin: Nam alius iudicat diem inter diem; alius iudicat omnem diem. Unusquisque in suo sensu habundet.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] níbí sainláa lasuidib act is abstanit doib [GLat]semper[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. níbí sainláa lasuidib act is abstanit doib semper
glosses.glossFNs: .i. níbí sainláa lasuidib act is abstanit doib semper
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are not wont to have a particular day, but it is abstinence for them semper.

glosses.latin: Nam alius iudicat diem inter diem; alius iudicat omnem diem. Unusquisque in suo sensu habundet.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] anas maith lacách dénad [GLat]si pro deo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. anas maith lacách dénad si pro deo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. anas maith lacách dénad si pro deo
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what each deems good let him do, si pro Deo.

glosses.latin: qui non manducat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he that fasts.

glosses.latin: Siue ergo uiuimus, siue morimur, Domini sumus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní lanech huáin alaile ammi dée huili nícol dó[a] cid less armbéo [GLat]et[/GLat] armmarb[b] isairi rocées [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. ní lanech huáin alaile ammi dée huili nícol dó cid less armbéo et armmarb isairi rocées rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní lanech huáin alaile ammi dée huili nícol dóa cid less armbéo et armmarbb isairi rocées rl.
footnotes: a: cf. Wb. 31c 15
b: cf. ragaid do beo no do marb, LL. 66a 34, robo maith lemsa fís a bíí no a mairb d’ faghbail uaitsiu, Ir. Text. IV. 126, further LU. 62b 33, 44, 111b 5
f: ‘it is not undeserved of Him’? J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not to any of us does another belong: we all belong to God. It is no crime of His<sup>f</sup> though we are His, alive and dead: it is therefore He has suffered, etc.

glosses.latin: In hoc Christus mortuus [est] ... ut et mortuorum et uiuorum dominetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we might all be His.

glosses.latin: Tú autem quid iudicas fratrem tuum in non manducando? aut quid spernis fratrem tuum in edendo? Omnes enim stabimus ante tribunal Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní latt aní ararethi [GLat]et[/GLat]ní lat incách forsammitter
glosses.glossText: .i. ní latt aní ararethi etní lat incách forsammitter
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní latt aní ararethi etní lat incách forsammitter
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not thine is that which thou assailest, and not thine is every one on whom thou passest judgment.

glosses.latin: Tú autem quid iudicas fratrem tuum in non manducando? aut quid spernis fratrem tuum in edendo? Omnes enim stabimus ante tribunal Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he may be a good man, though he eat not every food.

glosses.latin: Tú autem quid iudicas fratrem tuum in non manducando? aut quid spernis fratrem tuum in edendo? Omnes enim stabimus ante tribunal Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he may be a good man, though he eat his food.

glosses.latin: Tú autem quid iudicas fratrem tuum in non manducando? aut quid spernis fratrem tuum in edendo? Omnes enim stabimus ante tribunal Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aratá brithem and cenutsu [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]deus[/GLat] ishéside da[Con]no[/Con] aséola and ní cu[Con]m[/Con]me [GLat]et[/GLat] tuss[Res]u[/Res]
glosses.glossText: .i. aratá brithem and cenutsu .i. deus ishéside dano aséola and ní cumme et tuss(u)
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aratá brithem and cenutsu .i. deus ishéside dano aséola and ní cumme et tuss(u)
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for a judge is there apart from thee, to wit, Deus: it is He, also, that is wise therein, not even as thou.

glosses.latin: Scriptum est enim in Essaia ... omnis lingua confitebitur Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that day of judgment has been foretold.

glosses.latin: Scriptum est enim in Essaia ... omnis lingua confitebitur Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all shall give their confessions on that day.

glosses.latin: Itaque unusquisque nostrum pro sé rationem reddet Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one shall answer for himself.

glosses.latin: Non ergo amplius inuicem iudicemus; sed hoc iudicate
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] léicid [GLat]iudicium deo[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] brithemnacht bes hua[c] ... nísṅdenaith [GLat]nisi ne ponatis[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. léicid iudicium deo .i. brithemnacht bes hua ... nísṅdenaith nisi ne ponatis rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. léicid iudicium deo .i. brithemnacht bes huac ... nísṅdenaith nisi ne ponatis rl.
footnotes: c: leg. huilliu?, which is translated
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. leave ye iudicium Deo, that is, further judgment do not ye pass it nisi, etc.

glosses.latin: magis, ne ponatis offendiculum fratri, uel scandalum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that judgment will be left to you.

glosses.latin: magis, ne ponatis offendiculum fratri, uel scandalum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bad sissi coneit don ...... barfirinne bas [GLat]infirmus[/GLat][d] [GLat]quia omne quod non ex fide[/GLat] ......... [ie].i.[/ie] nitaibrid fornech ní nádaccobra
glosses.glossText: .i. bad sissi coneit don ...... barfirinne bas infirmus quia omne quod non ex fide ......... .i. nitaibrid fornech ní nádaccobra
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bad sissi coneit don ...... barfirinne bas infirmusd quia omne quod non ex fide ......... .i. nitaibrid fornech ní nádaccobra
footnotes: d: Should we read bad sissi coneit don (bráthir) bas infirmus, and regard barfirinne as a separate gloss?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be ye that shall be indulgent to the ...... your righteousness, who is infirmus, etc., i.e. force no one to what he desires not.

glosses.latin: magis, ne ponatis offendiculum fratri, uel scandalum.
footnotes: e: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: scandal, ut, etc.

glosses.latin: confido in Domino Iesu, quia nihil commone per ipsum, nisi éi qui existimat quid commune esse, illi commone est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is in Him I confide.

glosses.latin: confido in Domino Iesu, quia nihil commone per ipsum, nisi éi qui existimat quid commune esse, illi commone est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is common, however, to him.

glosses.latin: confido in Domino Iesu, quia nihil commone per ipsum, nisi éi qui existimat quid commune esse, illi commone est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is common.

glosses.latin: Si enim propter cibum frater tuus contristatur, iam non secundum caritatem ambulas. Noli cibo tuo illum perdere, pro quo Christus mortuus est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless thou be indulgent to him with his weakness.

glosses.latin: Si enim propter cibum frater tuus contristatur, iam non secundum caritatem ambulas. Noli cibo tuo illum perdere, pro quo Christus mortuus est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] léic uáit innabiada mílsi [GLat]et[/GLat]tomil innahí siu dommeil do chenél arnáphé som conéit détso
glosses.glossText: .i. léic uáit innabiada mílsi ettomil innahí siu dommeil do chenél arnáphé som conéit détso
glosses.glossFNs: .i. léic uáit innabiada mílsi ettomil innahí siu dommeil do chenél arnáphé som conéit détso
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. cast from thee the sweet foods, and consume these which thy nation consumes, so that it may not be he who is indulgent to thee.

glosses.latin: Si enim propter cibum frater tuus contristatur, iam non secundum caritatem ambulas. Noli cibo tuo illum perdere, pro quo Christus mortuus est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ismó rochéess cr[Con]ist[/Con] airi [ie].i.[/ie] báas olisamein léic uáit innatuari nocari
glosses.glossText: .i. ismó rochéess crist airi .i. báas olisamein léic uáit innatuari nocari
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ismó rochéess crist airi .i. báas olisamein léic uáit innatuari nocari
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is more that Christ has suffered for him, to wit, death: therefore cast from thee the foods which thou lovest.

glosses.latin: Non est regnum Dei in esca et potu, sed iustitia et páx et gaudium in Spiritu sancto.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not this that brings thee into heaven, that thou shouldest be a glutton.

glosses.latin: Non est regnum Dei in esca et potu, sed iustitia et páx et gaudium in Spiritu sancto.
footnotes: b: Ir. flaith, which is fem. Hence the sí
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, however, is regnumb.

glosses.latin: quae aedificationis sunt, [in] inuicem custodiamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. indulgence to the folk that consume not every food.

glosses.latin: Noli propter escam destruere opus Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. non-indulgence to it.

glosses.latin: in quo frater tuus offenditur, aut scandalizatur, aut infirmatur.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: in quo frater tuus offenditur, aut scandalizatur, aut infirmatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. makes denial.

glosses.latin: in quo frater tuus offenditur, aut scandalizatur, aut infirmatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. his abstinence is weakened.

glosses.latin: Tú fidem habes? penes temet ipsum habe coram Deo. Beatus qui non iudicat semet ipsum in eo quod probat!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rofitemmar isfoirbthetu hirisse attotaig doneoch dogní
glosses.glossText: .i. rofitemmar isfoirbthetu hirisse attotaig doneoch dogní
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rofitemmar isfoirbthetu hirisse attotaig doneoch dogní
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we know it is perfection of faith that impels thee to what thou doest.

glosses.latin: Tú fidem habes? penes temet ipsum habe coram Deo. Beatus qui non iudicat semet ipsum in eo quod probat!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not with any one who sees it, sed fide.

glosses.latin: Tú fidem habes? penes temet ipsum habe coram Deo. Beatus qui non iudicat semet ipsum in eo quod probat!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as regards himself, i.e. who does not pass it (judgment) on any other.

glosses.latin: Tú fidem habes? penes temet ipsum habe coram Deo. Beatus qui non iudicat semet ipsum in eo quod probat!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nítabarthi dímess doneoch fornach nénirt arafoirbthetu fadesin
glosses.glossText: .i. nítabarthi dímess doneoch fornach nénirt arafoirbthetu fadesin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nítabarthi dímess doneoch fornach nénirt arafoirbthetu fadesin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. contempt is not to be shewn by any one to any feeble person because of his own perfection.

glosses.latin: Qui autem discernit, si manducauerit, dampnatus est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]qui iudicat sé ipsum[/GLat] arlobri a hírisse [ie].i.[/ie] ara anfoirbthetu
glosses.glossText: .i. qui iudicat sé ipsum arlobri a hírisse .i. ara anfoirbthetu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. qui iudicat sé ipsum arlobri a hírisse .i. ara anfoirbthetu
glosses.glossTrans: for (the) weakness of his faith, i.e. for his imperfection.

glosses.latin: Qui autem discernit, si manducauerit, dampnatus est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he is guilty.

glosses.latin: Debemus autem nos firmiores imbicillitates infirmorum sustinere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we who are firmer.

glosses.latin: Debemus autem nos firmiores imbicillitates infirmorum sustinere.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Debemus autem nos firmiores imbicillitates infirmorum sustinere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to be indulgent to them.

glosses.latin: Unusquisque uestrum proximo suo placeat in bonum, ad aedificationem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that is good for you.

glosses.latin: Unusquisque uestrum proximo suo placeat in bonum, ad aedificationem.
footnotes: a: 1 Cor. viii. 1
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. dilectio proximi is the upbuilding caritatis.

glosses.latin: Etenim Christus non sibi placuit, sed sicut scriptum est: Inproperia inproperantium tibi ciciderunt super me.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]non sibi placuit quod passus est sed nobis profuit[/GLat][b] [ie].i.[/ie] ní ansu deit [GLat]quam christo[/GLat] arrocées side móor nimnith doaurlatu [GLat]patri[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: non sibi placuit quod passus est sed nobis profuit .i. ní ansu deit quam christo arrocées side móor nimnith doaurlatu patri
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: non sibi placuit quod passus est sed nobis profuitb .i. ní ansu deit quam christo arrocées side móor nimnith doaurlatu patri
footnotes: b: Not in Migne, col. 738
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not harder for thee quam Christo, for He had suffered much tribulation to obey the Father.

glosses.latin: Etenim Christus non sibi placuit, sed sicut scriptum est: Inproperia inproperantium tibi ciciderunt super me.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but it is as it hath been written.

glosses.latin: Etenim Christus non sibi placuit, sed sicut scriptum est: Inproperia inproperantium tibi ciciderunt super me.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Etenim Christus non sibi placuit, sed sicut scriptum est: Inproperia inproperantium tibi ciciderunt super me.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. saith Jesus.

glosses.latin: Quaecunque enim scripta sunt, ad nostram doctrinam scripta sunt ut ... spem habeamus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arniráncatar som less ascríbint mainbed díar nertad ni hifochidib
glosses.glossText: .i. arniráncatar som less ascríbint mainbed díar nertad ni hifochidib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arniráncatar som less ascríbint mainbed díar nertad ni hifochidib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for they have not needed to be written unless it were to strengthen us in sufferings.

glosses.latin: Deus autem patientiae et solacii det uobís id ipsum sapere in alterutrum secundum Iesum Christum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that every one may love the other.

glosses.latin: Deus autem patientiae et solacii det uobís id ipsum sapere in alterutrum secundum Iesum Christum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iar timnu í[Con]s[/Con]u [vel]ɫ.[/vel] am[Con]al[/Con] dondrigéni í[Con]s[/Con]u cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. iar timnu ísu ɫ. amal dondrigéni ísu crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iar timnu ísu ɫ. amal dondrigéni ísu crist
footnotes: e: John xiii. 35
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. according to Jesus’ commandment<sup>e</sup>; or as Jesus Christ has done it.

glosses.latin: Ut unianimes, uno ore honorificetis Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] óinmenme lib occo [GLat]et[/GLat] óingním [ie].i.[/ie] gním desercce
glosses.glossText: .i. óinmenme lib occo et óingním .i. gním desercce
glosses.glossFNs: .i. óinmenme lib occo et óingním .i. gním desercce
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. one mind with you therein, and one deed, even a deed of charity.

glosses.latin: suscipite uos inuicem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] íroimed cách achéele [GLat]per caritatem[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] domaith friss
glosses.glossText: .i. íroimed cách achéele per caritatem .i. domaith friss
glosses.glossFNs: .i. íroimed cách achéele per caritatem .i. domaith friss
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every one receive the other per caritatem, that is, for good unto him.

glosses.latin: Dico enim Iesum Christum ministrum fuisse circumcisionis propter ueritatem Dei, ad confirmandas promisiones patrum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aris tri humaldóit robói indaritiu hísin
glosses.glossText: .i. aris tri humaldóit robói indaritiu hísin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aris tri humaldóit robói indaritiu hísin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for through humility was that receiving.

glosses.latin: Dico enim Iesum Christum ministrum fuisse circumcisionis propter ueritatem Dei, ad confirmandas promisiones patrum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [c]dothaidbsiu[/c] asfírdia[d] [GLat]et[/GLat] asné tairrchet [GLat]a patriarchís[/GLat] co[Con]m[/Con]bad adramail inmacc conróbad écoscc acheneóil foir
glosses.glossText: .i. dothaidbsiu asfírdia et asné tairrchet a patriarchís combad adramail inmacc conróbad écoscc acheneóil foir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dothaidbsiuc asfírdiad et asné tairrchet a patriarchís combad adramail inmacc conróbad écoscc acheneóil foir
footnotes: c: MS. dothaibsiu
d: leg. as fír dia that God is true? (referring to the ueritatem Dei of the text)
f: Deut. xviii. 15
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to show forth that He is very God, and that it is He who had been foretold a patriarchis, that the Son would be like the Father, that the mark of His nation should be on Him<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Gentes autem super misericordiam honorare Deum, sicut scriptum est: Propterea confitebor tibi in gentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] adrat dia ismaith incho[Con]m[/Con]máin dorat doib [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]misericordia[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. adrat dia ismaith inchommáin dorat doib .i. misericordia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. adrat dia ismaith inchommáin dorat doib .i. misericordia
footnotes: g: cf. Atkinson, Three Shafts, s.v. commaoin, O’Begly, s.v. obligation
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let them worship God: good is the obligation<sup>g</sup> which He has imposed on them, to wit, misericordia.

glosses.latin: Gentes autem super misericordiam honorare Deum, sicut scriptum est: Propterea confitebor tibi in gentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doarrchet dichéin nombiad adrad dǽ lagenti
glosses.glossText: .i. doarrchet dichéin nombiad adrad dǽ lagenti
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doarrchet dichéin nombiad adrad dǽ lagenti
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it had been foretold long ago that there would be worship of God among the Gentiles.

glosses.latin: et magnificate eum, omnes populi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as it is not hard for you.

glosses.latin: Erit radix Iesse.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]christi secundum carnem uel radix[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]christus quia ipse est radix iesse secundum diuinitatem ipse iesse condidit et[/GLat] is iesse asbunad dossom im[Con]murgu[/Con] iárcolinn
glosses.glossText: .i. christi secundum carnem uel radix .i. christus quia ipse est radix iesse secundum diuinitatem ipse iesse condidit et is iesse asbunad dossom immurgu iárcolinn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. christi secundum carnem uel radix .i. christus quia ipse est radix iesse secundum diuinitatem ipse iesse condidit et is iesse asbunad dossom immurgu iárcolinn
glosses.glossTrans: it is Jesse, however, who is origin to Him according to (the) flesh.

glosses.latin: ut habundetis in spe et uirtute Spiritus sancti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] inneurt inspirto nóib [ie].i.[/ie] is hé nodonnertani cofedligmer isinfrescsin foirbthi
glosses.glossText: .i. inneurt inspirto nóib .i. is hé nodonnertani cofedligmer isinfrescsin foirbthi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inneurt inspirto nóib .i. is hé nodonnertani cofedligmer isinfrescsin foirbthi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the strength of the Holy Ghost, that is, it is He that strengthens us so that we may abide in perfect hope.

glosses.latin: pleni estis dilectione, repleti omni scientia, ita ut possitís alterutrum munere.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: pleni estis dilectione, repleti omni scientia, ita ut possitís alterutrum munere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (as) there is scientia with you.

glosses.latin: pleni estis dilectione, repleti omni scientia, ita ut possitís alterutrum munere.
footnotes: c: i.e. bad tualang; for the construction cf. Wb. 13c 15
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let each be fit to instruct another.

glosses.latin: scripsi uobis ... propter gratiam quae data est mihi.
glosses.glossText: .i. docendi ɫ. praedicandi aris do arroiéitsa gratiam doprecept dochách
glosses.glossFNs: .i. docendi ɫ. praedicandi aris do arroiéitsa gratiam doprecept dochách
glosses.glossTrans: for it is for this I have received gratia, to preach to every one.

glosses.latin: Non enim audeo aliquid loqui eorum, quae per me non efficit Christus in obaedientiam gentium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. except what Christ says per me.

glosses.latin: Non enim audeo aliquid loqui eorum, quae per me non efficit Christus in obaedientiam gentium.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: in uirtute signorum et prodigiorum, in uirtute Spiritus sancti .... usque ad Hiliricum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ipse in me loquebatur et signa faciebat[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ipse in me loquebatur et signa faciebat
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ipse in me loquebatur et signa faciebat
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: in uirtute signorum et prodigiorum, in uirtute Spiritus sancti .... usque ad Hiliricum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]hiliricum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]regio inter italiam et greciam[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] frigrecia aníar [GLat]et[/GLat] frietáil anáir
glosses.glossText: .i. hiliricum .i. regio inter italiam et greciam .i. frigrecia aníar et frietáil anáir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hiliricum .i. regio inter italiam et greciam .i. frigrecia aníar et frietáil anáir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the west of Greece and to the east of Italy.

glosses.latin: ne super alenum fundamentum aedificarem, sed sicut scriptum est: quibus non est annunciatum de eo, uidebunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. save my own labour.

glosses.latin: ne super alenum fundamentum aedificarem, sed sicut scriptum est: quibus non est annunciatum de eo, uidebunt.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: ne super alenum fundamentum aedificarem, sed sicut scriptum est: quibus non est annunciatum de eo, uidebunt.
footnotes: d: In the MS. dindí sin precedes per mé
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is of me it has been prophesied that per me Gentiles should see.

glosses.latin: ne super alenum fundamentum aedificarem, sed sicut scriptum est: quibus non est annunciatum de eo, uidebunt.
footnotes: d: In the MS. dindí sin precedes per mé
glosses.glossTrans: of Him.

glosses.latin: Cupio autem uenire ad uos ex multis iam praecedentibus annis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have long had a desire to come unto you.

glosses.latin: Cum in Hispaniam proficisci coepero, spero quod praeterens uideam uos, et á uobís deducar illuc.
footnotes: g: lit. put a circuit on you: cf. do chur cuarta, Wind. Wtb. s.v. cuairt
h: Here again something (⁊ tertius?) seems omitted
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that I may make a visitation to you<sup>g</sup> I will visit you<sup>h</sup> (and Tertius) with me.

glosses.latin: Cum in Hispaniam proficisci coepero, spero quod praeterens uideam uos, et á uobís deducar illuc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I shall be brought in Hispaniam.

glosses.latin: Probauerunt enim Macedonia et Achaia conlationem aliquam facere.
footnotes: e: fore, Migne, col. 742
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as seemed to them (ἐν τῃ̑ παῤ αὐτοι̑ς θεωρίᾳ).

glosses.latin: Probauerunt enim Macedonia et Achaia conlationem aliquam facere.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Probauerunt enim Macedonia et Achaia conlationem aliquam facere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rogabad gabáal dóib leu [Com]in marg.[/Com] túercómlássát cómtínól[f]
glosses.glossText: .i. rogabad gabáal dóib leu [in marg.] túercómlássát cómtínól
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rogabad gabáal dóib leu [in marg.] túercómlássát cómtínól<sup>f</sup>
footnotes: f: The marks over this gloss (which is a prima manu) are not signs of length
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a taking has been taken for them (the poor at Jerusalem) by them (the Macedonians and Achaians): they have put together a contribution.

glosses.latin: debent et in carnalibus ministrare eís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are under an obligation, that is, it is their duty ministrare.

glosses.latin: Hoc igitur cum consummauero, et adsignauero eis fructum hunc.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Hoc igitur cum consummauero, et adsignauero eis fructum hunc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (when) I shall assign.

glosses.latin: Scio autem quoniam ueniens ad uos, in habundantia benedictionis Christi ueniam.
footnotes: a: leg. nímirchói
b: = nach n-céin: cf. Wb. 24d 11, and nacéin Saltair na Rann 2043
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I know that I shall not be delayed with you for any long time.

glosses.latin: Obsecro ... ut adiuuetis me in orationibus pro me ad Dominum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that you may help me through beseeching for me in your prayers.

glosses.latin: Obsecro ... ut adiuuetis me in orationibus pro me ad Dominum.
glosses.glossFullTags: doadbadar [GLat]híc[/GLat] ascoir dochách guide dée liachéle
glosses.glossText: doadbadar híc ascoir dochách guide dée liachéle
glosses.glossFNs: doadbadar híc ascoir dochách guide dée liachéle
glosses.glossTrans: it is shown here that it is proper for every one to beseech God on behalf of the other.

glosses.latin: Ut liberer ab infidilibus, qui sunt in Iudea, et obsequii mei oblatio accepta fiat in Hirusolimam sanctis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ishuáichnid is[GLat]in iudeam[/GLat] ↄrodastar som techt
glosses.glossText: .i. ishuáichnid isin iudeam ↄrodastar som techt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishuáichnid isin iudeam ↄrodastar som techt
footnotes: d: cf. aconrodastar a beim fri talmain, Rev. Celt. XI. 450
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is well-known that it is in Iudaeam that he has settled(?)d to go.

glosses.latin: Ut liberer ab infidilibus, qui sunt in Iudea, et obsequii mei oblatio accepta fiat in Hirusolimam sanctis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that they may be thankful.

glosses.latin: Ut liberer ab infidilibus, qui sunt in Iudea, et obsequii mei oblatio accepta fiat in Hirusolimam sanctis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] anadchodadossa trithorad mop[GLat]re[/GLat]cepte berir [GLat]sanctis qui sunt in hierusalem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. anadchodadossa trithorad moprecepte berir sanctis qui sunt in hierusalem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. anadchodadossa trithorad moprecepte berir sanctis qui sunt in hierusalem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what I have acquired through (the) fruit of my teaching is brought sanctis, etc.

glosses.latin: Ut ueniam ad uos ... et refrigerer uobiscum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that I may stay on a visit with you.

glosses.latin: Ut eam suscipiatis in Domino digne sanctis, et adsistatis éi in quocumque negotio uestri indiguerit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] inchruth ascoir [GLat]et[/GLat] asinricc [GLat]sanctis[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] indinricc donaib nóibaib airitiu neich cuccuib is [GLat]in domino[/GLat] fein æm
glosses.glossText: .i. inchruth ascoir et asinricc sanctis .i. indinricc donaib nóibaib airitiu neich cuccuib is in domino fein æm
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inchruth ascoir et asinricc sanctis .i. indinricc donaib nóibaib airitiu neich cuccuib is in domino fein æm
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the way that is proper and worthy sanctis, that is, worthily of the saints, to receive any one unto you, it is in Domino Himself indeed.

glosses.latin: Ut eam suscipiatis in Domino digne sanctis, et adsistatis éi in quocumque negotio uestri indiguerit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] as ṅ inricc [GLat]sanctis[/GLat] fáilte frinóibu [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in domino[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal as ṅ inricc sanctis fáilte frinóibu .i. in domino
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal as ṅ inricc sanctis fáilte frinóibu .i. in domino
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as it is worthy sanctis to welcome saints.

glosses.latin: Ut eam suscipiatis in Domino digne sanctis, et adsistatis éi in quocumque negotio uestri indiguerit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whatsoever she may need, that ye should give it to her.

glosses.latin: Salutate Priscillam et Aquilam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] airde cáinchumricc [GLat]et[/GLat] chóre dogrés [GLat]ubi fit salutate[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] badchore dúib friu [GLat]et[/GLat] berar animchumarcc huáib
glosses.glossText: .i. airde cáinchumricc et chóre dogrés ubi fit salutate .i. badchore dúib friu et berar animchumarcc huáib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. airde cáinchumricc et chóre dogrés ubi fit salutate .i. badchore dúib friu et berar animchumarcc huáib
footnotes: e: lit. let it be peace to you towards them
