glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a sign of benevolence and peace always ubi, etc. that is, peace be to you from theme, and from you let a salutation to them be taken.

glosses.latin: Qui pro anima mea suas ceruices subpossuerunt, quibus non solus ego gratias ago, sed et cuncta aeclesia gentium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] forrusuidigsetar[c] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in persecutionibus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] robtar irlim dothecht martre darmchen[Res]n[/Res]
glosses.glossText: .i. forrusuidigsetar .i. in persecutionibus .i. robtar irlim dothecht martre darmchen(n)
glosses.glossFNs: .i. forrusuidigsetarc .i. in persecutionibus .i. robtar irlim dothecht martre darmchen(n)
footnotes: c: i.e. forusuidigsetar, cf. Pedersen, Aspirationen, 118
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in persecutionibus, that is, they were ready to go to martyrdom for my sake.

glosses.latin: Qui pro anima mea suas ceruices subpossuerunt, quibus non solus ego gratias ago, sed et cuncta aeclesia gentium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to Priscilla, etc.

glosses.latin: Qui pro anima mea suas ceruices subpossuerunt, quibus non solus ego gratias ago, sed et cuncta aeclesia gentium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they to whom I have preached (the) faith.

glosses.latin: domestica aeclesia eorum. Salutate [E]phenetum, ... qui est primitius Assiae in Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: domestica aeclesia eorum. Salutate [E]phenetum, ... qui est primitius Assiae in Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Priscilla and Aquila’s household.

glosses.latin: domestica aeclesia eorum. Salutate [E]phenetum, ... qui est primitius Assiae in Christo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] p[Con]ri[/Con]mit [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in credendo in assia uel in ipsa assia primisia sua in credendo dedit christo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. primit .i. in credendo in assia uel in ipsa assia primisia sua in credendo dedit christo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. primit .i. in credendo in assia uel in ipsa assia primisia sua in credendo dedit christo
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: domestica aeclesia eorum. Salutate [E]phenetum, ... qui est primitius Assiae in Christo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] óthossuch [ie].i.[/ie] is hé céetne fer cetaruchreti diáis [GLat]assiæ[/GLat] hicr[Con]ist[/Con] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]a principio[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] hóairegas [ie].i.[/ie] óin diairchinchib [GLat]assiæ[/GLat] insin rochretset hicr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. óthossuch .i. is hé céetne fer cetaruchreti diáis assiæ hicrist ɫ. a principio .i. hóairegas .i. óin diairchinchib assiæ insin rochretset hicrist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. óthossuch .i. is hé céetne fer cetaruchreti diáis assiæ hicrist ɫ. a principio .i. hóairegas .i. óin diairchinchib assiæ insin rochretset hicrist
footnotes: c: high-priests who superintended games and theatrical performances in the province of Asia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from (the) beginning, that is, he is the first man of the folk of Asia, that had first believed in Christ. Or a principio, i.e. from leadership, that is, he is one of the leaders of Asia (Asiarchsc) who have believed in Christ.

glosses.latin: Salutate Mariam, quae multum laborauit in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. confirming everything that had been preached unto you.

glosses.latin: Salutate Andronicum et Iuliam, cognatos et concaptiuos meos, qui sunt nubiles in apostolís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]genere[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] is sóir anapstalact hore donarnactar cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] hore romtar óis teglig nicumme [GLat]et[/GLat] messe [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]adiuuantes apostolos[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. genere ɫ. is sóir anapstalact hore donarnactar crist et hore romtar óis teglig nicumme et messe ɫ. adiuuantes apostolos
glosses.glossFNs: .i. genere ɫ. is sóir anapstalact hore donarnactar crist et hore romtar óis teglig nicumme et messe ɫ. adiuuantes apostolos
glosses.glossTrans: noble is their apostolate because they had approached Christ, and because they had been folk of (His) family; not the same as I.

glosses.latin: Salutate Ampliatum, dilectum mihi in Domino.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bad chore dúib friu huili [GLat]et[/GLat] gaibid desimrect diacáingnímaib
glosses.glossText: .i. bad chore dúib friu huili et gaibid desimrect diacáingnímaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bad chore dúib friu huili et gaibid desimrect diacáingnímaib
footnotes: d: lit. let it be peace to you towards them
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let there be peace to you from them all<sup>d</sup>, and take example from their beautiful deeds.

glosses.latin: Salutate Ampliatum, dilectum mihi in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because he preaches well and fulfils the gospel.

glosses.latin: Salutate Urbanum, adiutorem nostrum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in every tribulation.

glosses.latin: Salutate Appellen, probum in Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. proven in faith.

glosses.latin: Salutate eos qui sunt ex Aristoboli ciuitate uel domu.
footnotes: d: lit. let it be peace to you towards them
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Aristobulus’ household, let there be peace to you from them<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: quae laborant in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. fulfilling (the) gospel.

glosses.latin: et omnes qui cum eís sunt sanctos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all their household, that is, of Philologus and Julia.

glosses.latin: Salutant uos omnes aeclesiae Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they beseech you, that is, they bless you.

glosses.latin: Rogo, autem, fratres, ut obseruetis eos qui dessensiones et offendicula, praeter doctrinam quam uos dedicistis, faciunt.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Rogo, autem, fratres, ut obseruetis eos qui dessensiones et offendicula, praeter doctrinam quam uos dedicistis, faciunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is not what ye have studied in Euangelio.

glosses.latin: per dulces sermones et benedictiones seducunt corda innocentium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]per blandimenta et adolationes compossita sermone[/GLat][b] [ie].i.[/ie] alind áóiph inforcitil nemnech im[Con]murgu[/Con] ainne
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: per blandimenta et adolationes compossita sermone .i. alind áóiph inforcitil nemnech immurgu ainne
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: per blandimenta et adolationes compossita sermoneb .i. alind áóiph inforcitil nemnech immurgu ainne
footnotes: b: . . adulationes compto sermone compositas, Migne, col. 744
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. delightful (is) the beauty of the teaching: poisonous, however, (is) its quality.

glosses.latin: Uestra enim obaedientia in omnem locum deuulgata est; gaudeo igitur in uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Obaedentia[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] is irdircc dúibsi irlatu domaith [GLat]et[/GLat]ulcc [GLat]pro qua causa conantur uós subiecire in suam doctrinam[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isirdircc farnirlatusi dohiris [GLat]et[/GLat] sos[Con]célu[/Con] [GLat]ideo rogo uós[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: Obaedentia .i. is irdircc dúibsi irlatu domaith etulcc pro qua causa conantur uós subiecire in suam doctrinam ɫ. isirdircc farnirlatusi dohiris et soscélu ideo rogo uós
glosses.glossFNs: Obaedentia .i. is irdircc dúibsi irlatu domaith etulcc pro qua causa conantur uós subiecire in suam doctrinam ɫ. isirdircc farnirlatusi dohiris et soscélu ideo rogo uós
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. conspicuous for you is (your) obedience to good and evil, pro qua, etc., or evident is your obedience to faith and (the) Gospel, ideo, etc.

glosses.latin: Uestra enim obaedientia in omnem locum deuulgata est; gaudeo igitur in uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre is irdircc farclúu [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]hoc dicit ne offenderet eos quod dixit eos obidentes id est uolubiles ad seductionem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre is irdircc farclúu ɫ. hoc dicit ne offenderet eos quod dixit eos obidentes id est uolubiles ad seductionem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre is irdircc farclúu ɫ. hoc dicit ne offenderet eos quod dixit eos obidentes id est uolubiles ad seductionem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because your renown is conspicuous.

glosses.latin: Deus autem pacis conterat Satanam sub pedibus uestrís uelociter!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] brist[Con]er[/Con] immairecc fairso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] maided fair lib lase dombeir dia cobrith[b] nocco
glosses.glossText: .i. brister immairecc fairsom et maided fair lib lase dombeir dia cobrith nocco
glosses.glossFNs: .i. brister immairecc fairsom et maided fair lib lase dombeir dia cobrithb nocco
footnotes: b: cf. cobraid Fél. Oct. 18, gen. sing. cobartha LL. 275b 41
e: lit. let a conflict be crushed on him
f: lit. let it break on him
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him (Satan) be crushed in conflict<sup>e</sup>, and let him be routed<sup>f</sup> by you, when God gives help therein.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Timotheus, ... et Sosipater, cognati mei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, now, (is) his household.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Timotheus, ... et Sosipater, cognati mei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in preaching (the) gospel.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Gaius, hospes meus, et æclesia uniuersa Christi. Salutat uos Erastus, arcarius ciuitatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nuie tanicc cuccumsa [GLat]uel fuit in hospitio cum illo paulus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nuie tanicc cuccumsa uel fuit in hospitio cum illo paulus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nuie tanicc cuccumsa uel fuit in hospitio cum illo paulus
footnotes: g: Acts xx. 4
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he has newly come to meg, uel, etc.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Gaius, hospes meus, et æclesia uniuersa Christi. Salutat uos Erastus, arcarius ciuitatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intuile comthirchomracc [GLat]sanctorum[/GLat] hitalam [ie].i.[/ie] inchatlach innafer asrubart [GLat]et[/GLat] intoéntu inna ǽccalsa déde insin [GLat]et[/GLat] hésom triuss
glosses.glossText: .i. intuile comthirchomracc sanctorum hitalam .i. inchatlach innafer asrubart et intoéntu inna ǽccalsa déde insin et hésom triuss
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intuile comthirchomracc sanctorum hitalam .i. inchatlach innafer asrubart et intoéntu inna ǽccalsa déde insin et hésom triuss
footnotes: h: A translation of the proper name Tertius, Rom. xvi. 22, or a misunderstanding of Tertius as tertius; for the construction cf. Celt. Zeitschr. II. 379
glosses.glossTrans: the whole congregation sanctorum on earth: that is, the universe of the men he has mentioned (v. 21) and the unity of the church, that is two, and he himself as the thirdh

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Gaius, hospes meus, et æclesia uniuersa Christi. Salutat uos Erastus, arcarius ciuitatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] scrinire [vel]ɫ.[/vel] fer tige sǽt [GLat]qui facit árcas[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]qui custodit[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]dispensator ciuitatis prius, non nunc, sed fidem custodit[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. scrinire ɫ. fer tige sǽt qui facit árcas ɫ. qui custodit ɫ. dispensator ciuitatis prius, non nunc, sed fidem custodit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. scrinire ɫ. fer tige sǽt qui facit árcas ɫ. qui custodit ɫ. dispensator ciuitatis prius, non nunc, sed fidem custodit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a treasurer, or a man of a treasure-house, qui, etc.

glosses.latin: Ei autem, qui potens est uos confirmare iuxta euangelium meum, et praedicationem Iesu Christi, secundum reuelationem misterii.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye may fulfil what is preached unto you.

glosses.latin: Ei autem, qui potens est uos confirmare iuxta euangelium meum, et praedicationem Iesu Christi, secundum reuelationem misterii.
footnotes: c: a prima manu. leg. .i. sech? quo vocabulo glossator iudicare voluit, ante praedicationem verbum ‘juxta’ esse supplendum, Zimmer
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ei autem, qui potens est uos confirmare iuxta euangelium meum, et praedicationem Iesu Christi, secundum reuelationem misterii.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [d]farnícce[/d] si [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]incarnatio Christi[/GLat]. [Com]marg.[/Com] [GLat][Res]qu[/Res]osdam ad fidem prosilitos admit[Res]ten[/Res]dos[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ailithir[Res]ge[/Res]nti [GLat]in fide[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. farnícce si ɫ. incarnatio Christi. [marg.] (qu)osdam ad fidem prosilitos admit(ten)dos .i. ailithir(ge)nti in fide
glosses.glossFNs: .i. farnícced si ɫ. incarnatio Christi. [marg.] (qu)osdam ad fidem prosilitos admit(ten)dos .i. ailithir(ge)nti in fide
footnotes: d: MS. fanícce
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of your salvation, i.e. foreign Gentiles (proselytes) in fide.

glosses.latin: Quod nunc patefactum [est] per scripturas prophetarum, secundum praeceptum aeterni Dei, ad obæditionem fidei in cunctis gentibus cogniti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] airitiu colno dond macc do hícc inchéneli dóine
glosses.glossText: .i. airitiu colno dond macc do hícc inchéneli dóine
glosses.glossFNs: .i. airitiu colno dond macc do hícc inchéneli dóine
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Son’s taking of flesh to save the race of men.

glosses.latin: Quod nunc patefactum [est] per scripturas prophetarum, secundum praeceptum aeterni Dei, ad obæditionem fidei in cunctis gentibus cogniti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that (the) Gentiles may be obedient to (the) faith.

glosses.latin: Solo sapienti Deo, per Iesum Christum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ishé rofitir aurlatu [GLat]et[/GLat] hiriss cáich [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isdo indocbáal aris húad cach necne
glosses.glossText: .i. ishé rofitir aurlatu et hiriss cáich ɫ. isdo indocbáal aris húad cach necne
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishé rofitir aurlatu et hiriss cáich ɫ. isdo indocbáal aris húad cach necne
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He it is that knows every one’s obedience and faith, or unto Him glory is proper, for from Him proceeds every wisdom.

glosses.latin: Solo sapienti Deo, per Iesum Christum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]per incarnationem Christi[/GLat] roirladigsetar genti do hiriss
glosses.glossText: .i. per incarnationem Christi roirladigsetar genti do hiriss
glosses.glossFNs: .i. per incarnationem Christi roirladigsetar genti do hiriss
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. per incarnationem Christi the Gentiles have become obedient to (the) faith.

glosses.latLine: 1 Cor. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Corintii sunt Achaiae et hii similiter ab apostolís audierunt uerbum ueritatis. Et subuer[si] sunt multifarie á falsís ápostolís quidam ad pilosophiae uerbosam eloquentiam. Alii ad sectam legis iudaicae inducti sunt. Hos reuocat apostolus ad ueram euangelicam fidem et euangelicam sapientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latLine: 1 Cor. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Corintii sunt Achaiae et hii similiter ab apostolís audierunt uerbum ueritatis. Et subuer[si] sunt multifarie á falsís ápostolís quidam ad pilosophiae uerbosam eloquentiam. Alii ad sectam legis iudaicae inducti sunt. Hos reuocat apostolus ad ueram euangelicam fidem et euangelicam sapientiam.
footnotes: a: ‘the Corinthians’? cf. Pedersen, Celt. Zeitschr. II. 379, J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of Corinthians: this is the multifarie which he has said.

glosses.latLine: 1 Cor. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Corintii sunt Achaiae et hii similiter ab apostolís audierunt uerbum ueritatis. Et subuer[si] sunt multifarie á falsís ápostolís quidam ad pilosophiae uerbosam eloquentiam. Alii ad sectam legis iudaicae inducti sunt. Hos reuocat apostolus ad ueram euangelicam fidem et euangelicam sapientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. superstitions of (the) Law.

glosses.latin: cum omnibus qui inuocant nomen Domini nostri Iesu Christi, in omni loco ipsorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]absque corinto uel[/GLat] iccach lucc imbet cristidi olchene
glosses.glossText: .i. absque corinto uel iccach lucc imbet cristidi olchene
glosses.glossFNs: .i. absque corinto uel iccach lucc imbet cristidi olchene
glosses.glossTrans: in every place besides wherein are Christians.

glosses.latin: Gratia uobis et pax á Deo, Patre nostro, et á Domino Iesu Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Gratia uobis et pax á Deo, Patre nostro, et á Domino Iesu Christo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]precamur[/GLat] ished aridlabrathar[b] hóre isdias rodfóidi [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]paulus et sus[Con]thenes[/Con][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: precamur ished aridlabrathar hóre isdias rodfóidi .i. paulus et susthenes
glosses.glossFNs: precamur ished aridlabratharb hóre isdias rodfóidi .i. paulus et susthenes
footnotes: b: leg. arindlabrathar?
c: the first epistle to the Corinthians (Sommer, CZ. I. 205, § 57); grace, rath (Pedersen, KZ. xxxv. 403)
glosses.glossTrans: precamur: this is why he saith it, because it is two persons that had sent itc, i.e. Paulus et Sosthenes.

glosses.latin: in gratia Dei, quae data est in uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is amre lim rad ṅdé lib
glosses.glossText: .i. is amre lim rad ṅdé lib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is amre lim rad ṅdé lib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. marvellous to me is the grace of God that ye have.

glosses.latin: Sicut testimonium Christi confirmatum est in uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]per praedicationem[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] rop[Con]ri[/Con]dchad dúib cotdóith si
glosses.glossText: .i. per praedicationem .i. amal ropridchad dúib cotdóith si
glosses.glossFNs: .i. per praedicationem .i. amal ropridchad dúib cotdóith si
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as hath been preached unto you preserve it.

glosses.latin: Ita ut nihil uobís desit in ulla gratia, exspectantibus reuelationem Iesu Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is all with you.

glosses.latin: Ita ut nihil uobís desit in ulla gratia, exspectantibus reuelationem Iesu Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rofitid [GLat]primum aduentum per euangelium[/GLat], rofessid [GLat]secundum aduentum per reuelationem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. rofitid primum aduentum per euangelium, rofessid secundum aduentum per reuelationem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rofitid primum aduentum per euangelium, rofessid secundum aduentum per reuelationem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye know primum aduentum, etc., ye will know secundum, etc.

glosses.latin: uocati estis in societate Fili eius Iesu Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] inóentid coirp cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]ut sitis fili Dei et uós[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. inóentid coirp crist ut sitis fili Dei et uós
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inóentid coirp crist ut sitis fili Dei et uós
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in unity of Christ’s Body, ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Obsecro autem uos, fratres ... ut id ipsum dicatis omnes ... sitis autem perfecti in eodem sensu et in eadem sententia.
glosses.glossFullTags: dobeirso[Con]m[/Con] ainm bráthre doib arnaepret isara miscuis incúrsachad act isaraseircc
glosses.glossText: dobeirsom ainm bráthre doib arnaepret isara miscuis incúrsachad act isaraseircc
glosses.glossFNs: dobeirsom ainm bráthre doib arnaepret isara miscuis incúrsachad act isaraseircc
glosses.glossTrans: He gives (the) name of ‘brothers’ to them lest they should say the reproving is out of hatred of them, but it is out of love of them.

glosses.latin: Obsecro autem uos, fratres ... ut id ipsum dicatis omnes ... sitis autem perfecti in eodem sensu et in eadem sententia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ut unam fidem[/GLat] [a][GLat]habeatis[/GLat][/a] his[Con]un[/Con]t t[Con]ra[/Con] ↄricc frissalind serb inchúrsactha lase foruillecta beóil inchalich dimil cosse anall [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]uerba lenia et amicalia[/GLat] rurádi friu
glosses.glossText: .i. ut unam fidem habeatis hisunt tra ↄricc frissalind serb inchúrsactha lase foruillecta beóil inchalich dimil cosse anall .i. uerba lenia et amicalia rurádi friu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ut unam fidem habeatisa hisunt tra ↄricc frissalind serb inchúrsactha lase foruillecta beóil inchalich dimil cosse anall .i. uerba lenia et amicalia rurádi friu
footnotes: a: MS. habeates
glosses.glossTrans: Herein, then, he comes into contact with the bitter drink of the reproval, when the lips of the chalice have hitherto been smeared with honey, that is, uerba lenia et amicalia which he had spoken to them.

glosses.latin: Obsecro autem uos, fratres ... ut id ipsum dicatis omnes ... sitis autem perfecti in eodem sensu et in eadem sententia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄrop inonn crete[Con]m[/Con] bes hifar cridiu [GLat]et[/GLat] anasberaid hó bélib [Com]over v. 11[/Com] doadbadar sund t[Con]ra[/Con] [GLat]causa pro qua scripta est æpistola[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] irbága robatar leoso[Con]m[/Con] et[Con]er[/Con] desciplu [GLat]et[/GLat] debe óentu im[Con]murgu[/Con] et[Con]er[/Con] amagistru mógisidi uili do dia act dorigénsat indescipuil dechor etarru [GLat]et[/GLat]deu diib ished on ↄsecha so[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]hic[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄrop inonn cretem bes hifar cridiu et anasberaid hó bélib [over v. 11] doadbadar sund tra causa pro qua scripta est æpistola .i. irbága robatar leosom eter desciplu et debe óentu immurgu eter amagistru mógisidi uili do dia act dorigénsat indescipuil dechor etarru etdeu diib ished on ↄsecha som hic
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄrop inonn cretem bes hifar cridiu et anasberaid hó bélib [over v. 11] doadbadar sund tra causa pro qua scripta est æpistola .i. irbága robatar leosom eter desciplu et debe óentu immurgu eter amagistru mógisidi uili do dia act dorigénsat indescipuil dechor etarru etdeu diib ished on ↄsecha som hic
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that the belief which is in your heart, and what ye utter with (your) lips may be the same. Here, then, is shown causa, etc., i.e. they had had contentions and discord among the disciples; unity, however, among their masters. They are all servants of God; but the disciples had made a distinction between them and (made) gods of them: that is what he (Paul) corrects híc.

glosses.latin: Significatum est enim mihi ... quia contensiones inter uos sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. another thing has been signified(?) to me.

glosses.latin: Significatum est enim mihi ... quia contensiones inter uos sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are not worldly contentions.

glosses.latin: Hoc autem dico, quod unusquisque uestrurn dicit: Ego quidem sum Pauli; ego autem Apollo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are the contentions that are among you.

glosses.latin: Diuisus est Christus? Numquid Paulus crucifixus est pro uobís? aut in nomine Pauli babtizati estis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]diuiditur corpus ubi membra desensiunt[/GLat][b] [ie].i.[/ie] airmitiu féid inchinn dothabirt donaib ballaib
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: diuiditur corpus ubi membra desensiunt .i. airmitiu féid inchinn dothabirt donaib ballaib
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: diuiditur corpus ubi membra desensiuntb .i. airmitiu féid inchinn dothabirt donaib ballaib
footnotes: b: cum membra dissentiunt, Migne, col. 748
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in giving to the members the respect due to the head.

glosses.latin: Diuisus est Christus? Numquid Paulus crucifixus est pro uobís? aut in nomine Pauli babtizati estis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is on myself I will touch at first.

glosses.latin: Diuisus est Christus? Numquid Paulus crucifixus est pro uobís? aut in nomine Pauli babtizati estis?
glosses.glossFullTags: cepudono adrad dǽ dothabirt dopool inchruthsin
glosses.glossText: cepudono adrad dǽ dothabirt dopool inchruthsin
glosses.glossFNs: cepudono adrad dǽ dothabirt dopool inchruthsin
glosses.glossTrans: why, then, was the worship due to God to be given to Paul in that wise?

glosses.latin: Gratias ago Deo quod neminem uestrurn baptizaui, nisi Crispum et Gaium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]qui sé non dicunt in nomine meo babtizatos[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nihed for nindassi insin
glosses.glossText: .i. qui sé non dicunt in nomine meo babtizatos .i. nihed for nindassi insin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. qui sé non dicunt in nomine meo babtizatos .i. nihed for nindassi insin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is not your manner.

glosses.latin: Ne quis dicat quod in nomine meo baptizati estis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if I baptize you.

glosses.latin: caeterum nescio si quem alium babtizauerim.
glosses.glossTrans: besides this.

glosses.latin: caeterum nescio si quem alium babtizauerim.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní cuman lim marud baitsius nachnaile
glosses.glossText: .i. ní cuman lim marud baitsius nachnaile
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní cuman lim marud baitsius nachnaile
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I remember not if I have baptized any other.

glosses.latin: Non enim misit me Christus babtizare, sed euangelizare, non in sapientia uerbi ut non euacuetur crux Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ut dixit ut portas nomen nostrum coram gentibus[/GLat][a] p[Con]re[/Con]cept dosom didiu [GLat]et[/GLat]todiuschud co[Con]m[/Con]bad aurla[Con]m[/Con] cách diabathis [GLat]et[/GLat] a descipul so[Con]m[/Con] donbathis iarom arnach naurchoissed som friníi duronad nachaile
glosses.glossText: .i. ut dixit ut portas nomen nostrum coram gentibus precept dosom didiu ettodiuschud combad aurlam cách diabathis et a descipul som donbathis iarom arnach naurchoissed som friníi duronad nachaile
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ut dixit ut portas nomen nostrum coram gentibusa precept dosom didiu ettodiuschud combad aurlam cách diabathis et a descipul som donbathis iarom arnach naurchoissed som friníi duronad nachaile
footnotes: a: Acts ix. 15
f: For similar impersonal expressions see Wb. 5c 13, 7a 11, Rev. Celt. XII. 442, LL. 70b 15, 73a 32
glosses.glossTrans: that he should preach then and arouse, so that every one should be ready for his baptism, and that his (Paul’s) disciple should perform the baptism afterwards, so that he might not be hindered at (i.e. by doing) anything which any other could do<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Non enim misit me Christus babtizare, sed euangelizare, non in sapientia uerbi ut non euacuetur crux Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in qua uos gloriamini[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nipu nachderninnse ǽm act nítuccfither rún inna cruche mad sulbair [GLat]et[/GLat] mad án inp[Con]re[/Con]cept, [GLat]crúx[/GLat] didu ainm dogním inchrochtho acht tremiberar disuidiu ↄid[b]ainm[/b] dunchrunn
glosses.glossText: .i. in qua uos gloriamini .i. nipu nachderninnse ǽm act nítuccfither rún inna cruche mad sulbair et mad án inprecept, crúx didu ainm dogním inchrochtho acht tremiberar disuidiu ↄidainm dunchrunn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in qua uos gloriamini .i. nipu nachderninnse ǽm act nítuccfither rún inna cruche mad sulbair et mad án inprecept, crúx didu ainm dogním inchrochtho acht tremiberar disuidiu ↄidainmb dunchrunn
footnotes: b: MS. -aimm
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not that I could not have done it indeed, but the mystery of the Cross will not be understood if the preaching be eloquent and brilliant. Crux, then, (is) a name for the act of crucifixion, but it is transferred from that, so that it is a name for the tree.

glosses.latin: Verbum enim crucis, pereuntibus quidem stultitia est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní date leu incoimdiu dochrochad [GLat]et[/GLat] isburbe
glosses.glossText: .i. ní date leu incoimdiu dochrochad et isburbe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní date leu incoimdiu dochrochad et isburbe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not agreeable to them that the Lord was crucified, and it is foolishness.

glosses.latin: Ubi sapiens? ... Nonne stultam fecit Deus sapientiam huius mundi?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]apparebit[/GLat] [c][GLat]gentilis[/GLat][/c] [GLat]de grecís[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] bid cuingid rochuingid argebaid inscol foraréli
glosses.glossText: .i. apparebit gentilis de grecís .i. bid cuingid rochuingid argebaid inscol foraréli
glosses.glossFNs: .i. apparebit gentilisc de grecís .i. bid cuingid rochuingid argebaid inscol foraréli
footnotes: c: MS. gentiles
g: Sarauw compares adcoda faiscre rofaisere, O’Cl., but the construction there is different
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. apparebit gentilis de Graecis? i.e. it will be a great questiong, for one school will attack the other.

glosses.latin: Ubi sapiens? ... Nonne stultam fecit Deus sapientiam huius mundi?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is manifest quod, etc.

glosses.latin: Nam quia in Dei sapientia non cognouit mundus per sapientiam Deum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is therefore I say to thee stultam.

glosses.latin: Nam quia in Dei sapientia non cognouit mundus per sapientiam Deum.
glosses.glossText: .i. elimentís ɫ. iccach æcnu as æcne dodia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. elimentís ɫ. iccach æcnu as æcne dodia
glosses.glossTrans: in every wisdom that is wisdom unto God

glosses.latin: Nam quia in Dei sapientia non cognouit mundus per sapientiam Deum.
glosses.glossTrans: they understood it not per, etc.

glosses.latin: Iudaei signa petunt, et Greci sapientiam querunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nítorbe lasuidiu p[Con]re[/Con]cept doib manidénatar ferte occa
glosses.glossText: .i. nítorbe lasuidiu precept doib manidénatar ferte occa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nítorbe lasuidiu precept doib manidénatar ferte occa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they deem preaching to them no profit unless miracles be wrought thereat.

glosses.latin: Iudaei signa petunt, et Greci sapientiam querunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they deem it no profit unless it be eloquent.

glosses.latin: Nos autem praedicamus Christum crucifixum, Iudeís quidem scandalum, gentibus autem stultitiam.
glosses.glossText: .i. praedicamus .i. ní mebol limsa isstultitia leusom ón et isscandalum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. praedicamus .i. ní mebol limsa isstultitiad leusom ón et isscandalume
footnotes: d: MS. istultitia
e: MS. iscandalum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I deem it no shame: they deem it stultitia and scandalum.

glosses.latin: Quia quod stultum est Dei, sapientius est hominibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aní nad comnactar dóini trianecne cotánic so[Con]m[/Con] triachroich [ie].i.[/ie] aní ↄoitechtatar [GLat]iudei et greci[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]uirtutem et sapientiam[/GLat] fagebtis [GLat]sí credidisent[/GLat] am[Con]al[/Con] donducet [GLat]uocati[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. aní nad comnactar dóini trianecne cotánic som triachroich .i. aní ↄoitechtatar iudei et greci .i. uirtutem et sapientiam fagebtis sí credidisent amal donducet uocati rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aní nad comnactar dóini trianecne cotánic som triachroich .i. aní ↄoitechtatar iudei et greci .i. uirtutem et sapientiam fagebtis sí credidisent amal donducet uocati rl.
footnotes: h: cot-ánic perf. sg. 3 of con-icim, with infixed pron.
i: 2 Pet. i. 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that which men could not do by their wisdom, He could do ith by His cross, i.e. that which Iudaei et Graeci have sought, i.e. uirtutem et sapientiam, they would have found it si credidissent, as uocati, etc., understand iti.

glosses.latin: Videte ... , fratres, quia non multi sapientes secundum carnem, non multi potentes, non multi nubiles.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. O all (ye) faithful!

glosses.latin: Videte ... , fratres, quia non multi sapientes secundum carnem, non multi potentes, non multi nubiles.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he will not be sapiens if it be secundum carnem.

glosses.latin: Videte ... , fratres, quia non multi sapientes secundum carnem, non multi potentes, non multi nubiles.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]uocati sunt[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nitat æcni huili [ie].i.[/ie] ni sochude diib ataat and [Com]in marg. l.[/Com] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ní sochude as [GLat]potens[/GLat] mad [GLat]secundum carnem[/GLat] arishé as[GLat]sapiens et[/GLat] as[GLat]potens et[/GLat] as[GLat]fortis et[/GLat] as[GLat]nobilis qui credit in iesum christum et quod docet ipse[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. uocati sunt .i. nitat æcni huili .i. ni sochude diib ataat and [in marg. l.] ɫ. ní sochude as potens mad secundum carnem arishé assapiens et aspotens et asfortis et asnobilis qui credit in iesum christum et quod docet ipse
glosses.glossFNs: .i. uocati sunt .i. nitat æcni huili .i. ni sochude diib ataat and [in marg. l.] ɫ. ní sochude as potens mad secundum carnem arishé assapiens et aspotens et asfortis et asnobilis qui credit in iesum christum et quod docet ipse
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all are not wise, that is, it is not a multitude of them; there are some, however. Or it is not a multitude that is potens if it be secundum carnem, for it is he who is sapiens, and who is potens, and who is fortis, and who is nobilis, qui credit, etc.

glosses.latin: et [ea] quae non sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]elegit[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] indí[a] nád ní libsi [GLat]in sapientia homana[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. elegit .i. indí nád ní libsi in sapientia homana
glosses.glossFNs: .i. elegit .i. indía nád ní libsi in sapientia homana
footnotes: a: The glossator seems to have taken ea as fem. sg.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that which ye deem nothing in, etc.

glosses.latin: Ex [eo] ipso autem uos estis.
glosses.glossTrans: not from any other.

glosses.latin: Ut, quemadmodum scriptum est. Qui gloriatur, in Domino glorietur.
glosses.glossFullTags: asé[b] [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]in heremia uel in libro hoc[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: asé [in marg.] in heremia uel in libro hoc
glosses.glossFNs: aséb [in marg.] in heremia uel in libro hoc
footnotes: b: leg. .i. sé?, cf., however, Pedersen, Aspirationen, p. 94
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et ego in infirmitate, et timore, et tremore multo fui apud uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] comadas lobre [GLat]et[/GLat] immomon forsin mug céin ṁbíis ocfogna[Con]m[/Con] diachoimdid
glosses.glossText: .i. comadas lobre et immomon forsin mug céin ṁbíis ocfognam diachoimdid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. comadas lobre et immomon forsin mug céin ṁbíis ocfognam diachoimdid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. meet (is) weakness and great fear on the slave so long as he is serving his master.

glosses.latin: Ut fides uestra non sit in sapientia hominum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not therein shall ye trust, i.e. in philosophia.

glosses.latin: sapientiam uero non huius seculi, neque principum huius seculi, qui destruntur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]cum sapientia sua per nostrum euangelium[/GLat][c] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] et[Con]er[/Con]scértar acoirp [GLat]et[/GLat]ananmin friu [vel]ɫ.[/vel] eter[Con]scérthar[/Con] anecne friu
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: cum sapientia sua per nostrum euangelium ɫ. eterscértar acoirp etananmin friu ɫ. eterscérthar anecne friu
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: cum sapientia sua per nostrum euangeliumc ɫ. eterscértar acoirp etananmin friu ɫ. eterscérthar anecne friu
footnotes: c: destruuntur, Migne, col. 752
glosses.glossTrans: their bodies and their souls will be separated from them, or their wisdom will be separated from them.

glosses.latin: Sed loquimur Dei sapientiam in misterio, quae abscondita est.
footnotes: d: Not in Migne
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that none of the wise men of the world knoweth.

glosses.latin: quae praeparauit Deus hís qui diligunt illum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what are they which He has prepared?

glosses.latin: Spiritus enim omnia scrutatur, etiam profunda Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quis enim scit hominum quae sunt hominis, nisi spiritus hominis, qui in ipso est. Ita et quae Dei sunt nemo cognouit, nisi Spiritus Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a similitude this.

glosses.latin: Quis enim scit hominum quae sunt hominis, nisi spiritus hominis, qui in ipso est. Ita et quae Dei sunt nemo cognouit, nisi Spiritus Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. save the man himself.

glosses.latin: Quis enim scit hominum quae sunt hominis, nisi spiritus hominis, qui in ipso est. Ita et quae Dei sunt nemo cognouit, nisi Spiritus Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. homine who considers it.

glosses.latin: Quis enim scit hominum quae sunt hominis, nisi spiritus hominis, qui in ipso est. Ita et quae Dei sunt nemo cognouit, nisi Spiritus Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isinchrud sin rofitir intí imbíi inspirut nóib rúna dée
glosses.glossText: .i. isinchrud sin rofitir intí imbíi inspirut nóib rúna dée
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isinchrud sin rofitir intí imbíi inspirut nóib rúna dée
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus that he in whom is the Holy Spirit knoweth God’s mysteries.

glosses.latin: Nos antem non spiritum huius mundi accepimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. faithful ones.

glosses.latin: loquimur .... in doctrina spiritus, spiritalibus sp[ir]italia conparantes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we preach.

glosses.latin: loquimur .... in doctrina spiritus, spiritalibus sp[ir]italia conparantes.
footnotes: a: = ḟorcital
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when we provide (comparamus), i.e. his suitable teaching to each.

glosses.latin: Animalis autem homo non percipit ea quae sunt Spiritus Dei ... non potest intelligere, quia spiritaliter examinatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. like unto a beast.

glosses.latin: Animalis autem homo non percipit ea quae sunt Spiritus Dei ... non potest intelligere, quia spiritaliter examinatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not proper to this is a spirituale documentum.

glosses.latin: Animalis autem homo non percipit ea quae sunt Spiritus Dei ... non potest intelligere, quia spiritaliter examinatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dimeccither alled frispirut [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]a deo uel a spiritali homine[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. dimeccither alled frispirut .i. a deo uel a spiritali homine
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dimeccither alled frispirut .i. a deo uel a spiritali homine
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he is reprobated as regards the spirit.

glosses.latin: ipse a nemine iudicatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no one sets reprobation upon him.

glosses.latin: Nos autem sensum habemus Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is the sensus, which teaches knowledge Domini to every one.

glosses.latin: Et ego, fratres, non potui uobís [loqui] quasi spiritalibus, sed quasi carnalibus; tamquam paruulís in Christo,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]hominibus perfectís in fide[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] niforcital óisa foirbthi forchanim dúib arnifulngidsi ón
glosses.glossText: .i. hominibus perfectís in fide .i. niforcital óisa foirbthi forchanim dúib arnifulngidsi ón
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hominibus perfectís in fide .i. niforcital óisa foirbthi forchanim dúib arnifulngidsi ón
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not the teaching of perfect folk do I teach unto you, for ye endure not that.

glosses.latin: Et ego, fratres, non potui uobís [loqui] quasi spiritalibus, sed quasi carnalibus; tamquam paruulís in Christo,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] gluass for a[GLat]ccarnalibus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nitad foirbthi forṅ gnímai hicr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. gluass for accarnalibus .i. nitad foirbthi forṅ gnímai hicrist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. gluass for accarnalibus .i. nitad foirbthi forṅ gnímai hicrist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a gloss on the ‘carnalibus,’ that is, your deeds in Christ are not perfect.

glosses.latin: Lac uobís potum dedi, non escam, nondum enim poteratis; sed nec nunc quidem potestis, adhuc enim estis carnales.
footnotes: b: cf. Wb. 33c 15
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not strong teaching<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Lac uobís potum dedi, non escam, nondum enim poteratis; sed nec nunc quidem potestis, adhuc enim estis carnales.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore it is not food that I have given you.

glosses.latin: Lac uobís potum dedi, non escam, nondum enim poteratis; sed nec nunc quidem potestis, adhuc enim estis carnales.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for ye are not better than at first.

glosses.latin: Lac uobís potum dedi, non escam, nondum enim poteratis; sed nec nunc quidem potestis, adhuc enim estis carnales.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the carnal desire still weighs you down.

glosses.latin: Cum enim sint inter uos zelus et contentio nonne carnales estis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that makes carnal men of you.

glosses.latin: Cum enim quis dicit: Ego quidem sum Pauli .... quid uero Paulus?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are ‘contentiones et emulationes.’

glosses.latin: Cum enim quis dicit: Ego quidem sum Pauli .... quid uero Paulus?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cindas fer diandenid si deu [ie].i.[/ie] mogæ [GLat]et[/GLat] timthirthidi indí diaruchretsidsi
glosses.glossText: .i. cindas fer diandenid si deu .i. mogæ et timthirthidi indí diaruchretsidsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cindas fer diandenid si deu .i. mogæ et timthirthidi indí diaruchretsidsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of what sort of men do ye make gods? i.e. slaves and servants of Him in whom ye have believed.

glosses.latin: Ministri eius cui credidistis, et unicuique sicut Dominus dedit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as they have been entrusted to him.

glosses.latin: Itaque, neque ciccam qui plantat, est aliquid .... sed, qui incremendum dat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is not to be counted as anything.

glosses.latin: Itaque, neque ciccam qui plantat, est aliquid .... sed, qui incremendum dat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is He that is somewhat.

glosses.latin: unusquisque autem propriam mercidem accipiet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is well-known, they are labourers.

glosses.latin: Dei agricultura estis, Dei aedificatio estis, secundum gratiam Dei quae data est mihi, ut sapiens architectus fundamentum possui; alius autem superaedificat; unusquisque autem uideat, quomodo superaedificat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]non secundum meam uirtutem[/GLat][b] [ie].i.[/ie] is [GLat]per gratiam[/GLat] [c]cotofutaincsi[/c] da[Con]no[/Con]
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: non secundum meam uirtutem .i. is per gratiam cotofutaincsi dano
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: non secundum meam uirtutemb .i. is per gratiam cotofutaincsic dano
footnotes: b: Migne, col. 754
c: = cotobutaincsi, cf. dofema Wb. 5d 34: MS. cotofutaircsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is per gratiam that he upbuilds you then.

glosses.latin: Dei agricultura estis, Dei aedificatio estis, secundum gratiam Dei quae data est mihi, ut sapiens architectus fundamentum possui; alius autem superaedificat; unusquisque autem uideat, quomodo superaedificat.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Dei agricultura estis, Dei aedificatio estis, secundum gratiam Dei quae data est mihi, ut sapiens architectus fundamentum possui; alius autem superaedificat; unusquisque autem uideat, quomodo superaedificat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg. l.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] intí diarup[Con]ri[/Con]dchad [GLat]superedificat[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ni limsa [GLat][Res]supere[/Res]dificare sed fundamentum ponere[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg. l.] .i. intí diarupridchad superedificat .i. ni limsa (supere)dificare sed fundamentum ponere
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg. l.] .i. intí diarupridchad superedificat .i. ni limsa (supere)dificare sed fundamentum ponere
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he to whom it has been preached superaedificat: it is not mine superaedificare, sed, etc.

glosses.latin: Dei agricultura estis, Dei aedificatio estis, secundum gratiam Dei quae data est mihi, ut sapiens architectus fundamentum possui; alius autem superaedificat; unusquisque autem uideat, quomodo superaedificat.
footnotes: i: cf. dolár Ml. 120d 9
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is proper to build to the foundation<sup>i</sup>.

glosses.latin: Fundamentum enim aliud nemo potest ponere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though false apostles should attempt it.

glosses.latin: Uniuscuiusque opus manifestum erit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. both good and evil.

glosses.latin: Si cuius opus manserit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if he be steadfast in tribulations, and if his work be good.

glosses.latin: Si cuius opus arserit, detrimentum patietur; ipse autem saluus erit.
footnotes: d: leg. conutuing
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he that builds up minor sins.

glosses.latin: Si cuius opus arserit, detrimentum patietur; ipse autem saluus erit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] díith [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]mercedis dum non bene custodit gregem[/GLat]. [Com]in marg.[/Com] dernum[e]
glosses.glossText: .i. díith .i. mercedis dum non bene custodit gregem. [in marg.] dernum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. díith .i. mercedis dum non bene custodit gregem. [in marg.] dernume
footnotes: e: a prima manu, from di-ess-ro-sním? see Sarauw, Irske Studier, p. 73
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. loss ....

glosses.latin: Si cuius opus arserit, detrimentum patietur; ipse autem saluus erit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] besslán [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]solus euadet separatus a grege suo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. besslán .i. solus euadet separatus a grege suo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. besslán .i. solus euadet separatus a grege suo
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who will be saved.

glosses.latin: Nescitis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. are ye ignorant?

glosses.latin: Templum enim Dei sanctum est, quod estis uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were not proper to pollute it.

glosses.latin: Templum enim Dei sanctum est, quod estis uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are that temple.

glosses.latin: stultus fiat ut sit sapiens.
footnotes: f: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: stultus fiat ut sit sapiens.
footnotes: g: MS. dangíid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him become, that is, let him make himself stupid.

glosses.latin: stultus fiat ut sit sapiens.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdiliu dó intí lasmbi æcne [ie].i.[/ie] ladia
glosses.glossText: .i. isdiliu dó intí lasmbi æcne .i. ladia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdiliu dó intí lasmbi æcne .i. ladia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. dearer to him is He in whose opinion he is wise, that is, in God’s.

glosses.latin: Sapientia enim huius mundi stultitia est apud Deum .... Comprehendam sapientes in astutia eorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not usual is good through it.

glosses.latin: Sapientia enim huius mundi stultitia est apud Deum .... Comprehendam sapientes in astutia eorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I will reproach ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Sapientia enim huius mundi stultitia est apud Deum .... Comprehendam sapientes in astutia eorum.
footnotes: h: a prima manu. leg. ifoilli, Ml. 28b 16
glosses.glossTrans: in craftiness, that is, in cunning or in cleverness.

glosses.latin: Omnia enim uestra sunt, ... siue uita, siue mors, sive praesentia, siue futura.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]nos uestri sumus ministri uos autem pleps solius christi[/GLat] ithé [GLat]omnia[/GLat][b] inso asmbeirso[Con]m[/Con] sís
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: nos uestri sumus ministri uos autem pleps solius christi ithé omnia inso asmbeirsom sís
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: nos uestri sumus ministri uos autem pleps solius christi ithé omniab inso asmbeirsom sís
footnotes: b: Not in Migne
glosses.glossTrans: these are the omnia which he mentions below.

glosses.latin: Omnia enim uestra sunt, ... siue uita, siue mors, sive praesentia, siue futura.
footnotes: c: cf. Ml. 25a 5, rigne celide LL. 344c 57, rigne labartha LL. 345e 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what, then, is the good of prolixity in it? they all are yours.

glosses.latin: Omnia enim uestra sunt, ... siue uita, siue mors, sive praesentia, siue futura.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is the same as ‘uita.’

glosses.latin: Omnia enim uestra sunt, ... siue uita, siue mors, sive praesentia, siue futura.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is the same as ‘mors.’

glosses.latin: Síc nos existimet homo ut ministros Christi ut dispensatores ministeriorum Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let this be the judgment that is passed upon us.

glosses.latin: Síc nos existimet homo ut ministros Christi ut dispensatores ministeriorum Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we set forth the divine mysteries.

glosses.latin: Híc queritur inter dispensatores, ut fidelis quis inueniatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ishé didiu intecttaire maith condaig indocbáil diathigerni[d] [GLat]et non sibi ipsi[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] is hed insin ↄdegar and
glosses.glossText: .i. ishé didiu intecttaire maith condaig indocbáil diathigerni et non sibi ipsi .i. is hed insin ↄdegar and
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishé didiu intecttaire maith condaig indocbáil diathigernid et non sibi ipsi .i. is hed insin ↄdegar and
footnotes: d: cf. ceneoli 3b 25, duini 4b 3, aili 13a 26
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he, then, is the good messenger who seeks glory for his lord et non sibi ipsi, i.e. that is what is sought in him.

glosses.latin: Mihi autem pro minimo est ut a uobís deiudicer, aut ab humano die; sed neque me ipsum iudico.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isbeic[e] lim inbrígsin cedmolad cedtatháir dom beraidsi domsa isbeicc limsa abríg
glosses.glossText: .i. isbeic lim inbrígsin cedmolad cedtatháir dom beraidsi domsa isbeicc limsa abríg
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isbeic<sup>e</sup> lim inbrígsin cedmolad cedtatháir dom beraidsi domsa isbeicc limsa abríg
footnotes: e: for the genitive cf. ba méite Wb. 29d 8, ba meiti LL. 403a 54. ní méti LU. 92b 30, YBL. 92d 38
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. little do I care: though it be praise, though it be blame that ye give me, little do I care.

glosses.latin: Mihi autem pro minimo est ut a uobís deiudicer, aut ab humano die; sed neque me ipsum iudico.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] samaltir inmolad dóinde frilaithe aragairti ṁbís [GLat]ut profeta dicit diem hominum non concupiui[/GLat][f] [GLat]id est laudem eorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. samaltir inmolad dóinde frilaithe aragairti ṁbís ut profeta dicit diem hominum non concupiui id est laudem eorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. samaltir inmolad dóinde frilaithe aragairti ṁbís ut profeta dicit diem hominum non concupiuif id est laudem eorum
footnotes: f: see Jer. xvii. 16
g: For the proleptic a (a gairti) cf. KZ. xxxv. 449, further a threte Wb. 18c 6, a thraite LU. 58a 44, a thrice LL. 406a 32, a mall Wb. 24c 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. human praise is likened to a day because of the short time that it abides<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Mihi autem pro minimo est ut a uobís deiudicer, aut ab humano die; sed neque me ipsum iudico.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]iudicat mé in bono[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]in malo dominus est[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ishé dia aseola indium sa
glosses.glossText: .i. iudicat mé in bono ɫ. in malo dominus est .i. ishé dia aseola indium sa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iudicat mé in bono ɫ. in malo dominus est .i. ishé dia aseola indium sa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is God who is knowing in me.

glosses.latin: sed non in hoc iustificatus sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am not righteous as to it.

glosses.latin: Itaque nolite ante tempus iudicare, quoadusque ueniat Dominus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. until the true Judge shall come.

glosses.latin: Haec autem, fratres, transfiguraui in me.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] comalnid annup[Con]ri[/Con]dchim niepur brithe[Con]m[/Con]nact fornech naform féin [GLat]quasi[/GLat] [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]dixisset[/GLat] isairi trimirothorṅdiussa indium inna huilisa asrubartmar ánáll [ie].i.[/ie] arcor hifarselbadsi [GLat]et[/GLat] ep[Con]er[/Con]t ammi mogæ dúibsi [GLat]et[/GLat] arnebmóidem himagistrib [GLat]ut gamalial[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [GLat]et[/GLat] nebmes for nech ↄdid messed in coimdiu ↄsechide humaldóit huáimse [ie].i.[/ie] fornebmóidem himagistru [GLat]et[/GLat] nebmess fornech immaid fa olcc ↄdidmessed dia
glosses.glossText: .i. comalnid annupridchim niepur brithemnact fornech naform féin quasi [in marg.] dixisset isairi trimirothorṅdiussa indium inna huilisa asrubartmar ánáll .i. arcor hifarselbadsi et epert ammi mogæ dúibsi et arnebmóidem himagistrib ut gamalial rl. et nebmes for nech ↄdid messed in coimdiu ↄsechide humaldóit huáimse .i. fornebmóidem himagistru et nebmess fornech immaid fa olcc ↄdidmessed dia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. comalnid annupridchim niepur brithemnact fornech naform féin quasi [in marg.] dixisset isairi trimirothorṅdiussa indium inna huilisa asrubartmar ánáll .i. arcor hifarselbadsi et epert ammi mogæ dúibsi et arnebmóidem himagistrib ut gamalial rl. et nebmes for nech ↄdid messed in coimdiu ↄsechide humaldóit huáimse .i. fornebmóidem himagistru et nebmess fornech immaid fa olcc ↄdidmessed dia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. fulfil ye what I preach. I do not pronounce judgment on any one nor (even) on myself: quasi dixisset: it is therefore I have in a figure transferred into myself all these things we have mentioned above, putting ourselves into your possession and saying ‘we are servants of yours,’ and our not boasting as to masters ut Gamaliel, etc., and not judging any one until the Lord shall judge him; so that ye might follow humility from me, that is, your not boasting as to masters, and not judging of any one, whether he be good or evil, until God should have judged him.

glosses.latin: Quis euim té discernit? ... si autem accipisti, quid gloriaris, quasi non acceperis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it not thou thyself?

glosses.latin: Quis euim té discernit? ... si autem accipisti, quid gloriaris, quasi non acceperis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciarfemtha so [GLat]iudicium quasi a té ipso susciperis[/GLat] nipo móiti [b]cenmánom[/b] [GLat]accipisti[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ciarfemtha so iudicium quasi a té ipso susciperis nipo móiti cenmánom accipisti
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciarfemtha so iudicium quasi a té ipso susciperis nipo móiti cenmánomb accipisti
footnotes: b: MS. cenmá non; cf. Wb. 16b 6, Ml. 88d 13
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though thou shouldst receive iudicium, etc., it were nothing to boast of : besides accepisti.

glosses.latin: sine nobis regnatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not under our yoke are ye.

glosses.latin: Puto enim quod Deus nos apostolos nonissimos ostendit, tamquam morti destinatos, quia spectaculum facti sumus et angelís et hominibus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Puto enim quod Deus nos apostolos nonissimos ostendit, tamquam morti destinatos, quia spectaculum facti sumus et angelís et hominibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] nombemmis érchóilti [ie].i.[/ie] fo béesad fir téte dochath argaibidside céil forbáas intain téte donchath
glosses.glossText: .i. amal nombemmis érchóilti .i. fo béesad fir téte dochath argaibidside céil forbáas intain téte donchath
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal nombemmis érchóilti .i. fo béesad fir téte dochath argaibidside céil forbáas intain téte donchath
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as though we were destined, that is, after the manner of a man who goes to battle, for he expects death when he goes to the battle.

glosses.latin: Puto enim quod Deus nos apostolos nonissimos ostendit, tamquam morti destinatos, quia spectaculum facti sumus et angelís et hominibus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Puto enim quod Deus nos apostolos nonissimos ostendit, tamquam morti destinatos, quia spectaculum facti sumus et angelís et hominibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a multitude’s eye beholds us.

glosses.latin: Et laboramus operantes manibus nostrís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] p[Con]re[/Con]cept doso[Con]m[/Con] fridei [GLat]et[/GLat]saithar ho lámaib [GLat]in nocte[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. precept dosom fridei etsaithar ho lámaib in nocte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. precept dosom fridei etsaithar ho lámaib in nocte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to him (there is) teaching by day and labour with hands in nocte.

glosses.latin: Et laboramus operantes manibus nostrís.
footnotes: c: MS. dodcoisged
glosses.glossTrans: i.e it is (the) fruit of his hands that used to support him.

glosses.latin: tamquam purgamenta huius mundi facti sumus, omnium peripsima usque adhuc.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] bimmis octarche [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quod enim iecitur foras purgatur síc apostoli ab hominibus ieciuntur[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal bimmis octarche .i. quod enim iecitur foras purgatur síc apostoli ab hominibus ieciuntur
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal bimmis octarche .i. quod enim iecitur foras purgatur síc apostoli ab hominibus ieciuntur
footnotes: e: octarche pl. of ochtrach (Ml. 129c 2) later otrach
glosses.glossTrans: as if we were dregs<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: tamquam purgamenta huius mundi facti sumus, omnium peripsima usque adhuc.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] escart [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]perditio[/GLat]: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]peripsima graecum est et pessimi interpretatur[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]dispecti[/GLat][d]
glosses.glossText: .i. escart ɫ. perditio: Pelagius: peripsima graecum est et pessimi interpretatur ɫ. dispecti
glosses.glossFNs: .i. escart ɫ. perditio: Pelagius: peripsima graecum est et pessimi interpretatur ɫ. dispectid
footnotes: d: Not in Migne, col. 758
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: tamquam purgamenta huius mundi facti sumus, omnium peripsima usque adhuc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. until this, i.e. until the time in which we are.

glosses.latin: Nam si decem milia pedagogorum habeatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a perfect (number) for an imperfect.

glosses.latin: Nam si decem milia pedagogorum habeatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] innacoschométide [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]puer[Sup]or[/Sup]um custodes[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] óis foirbthe bíte ocbaithius [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]podos graecum pés latinum, gogos graecum tectum latinum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] costigthith [GLat]qui secitur doctorem[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]custos pedum interpretatur[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. innacoschométide .i. puer[or]um custodes .i. óis foirbthe bíte ocbaithius [in marg.] podos graecum pés latinum, gogos graecum tectum latinum .i. costigthith qui secitur doctorem ɫ. custos pedum interpretatur
glosses.glossFNs: .i. innacoschométide .i. puer[or]um custodes .i. óis foirbthe bíte ocbaithius [in marg.] podos graecum pés latinum, gogos graecum tectum latinum .i. costigthith qui secitur doctorem ɫ. custos pedum interpretatur
footnotes: f: οἱ τέλειοι or sponsors, Olden
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the foot-protectors, i.e. puerorum custodes, that is the perfect folkf who are at baptism ....

glosses.latin: Nam si decem milia pedagogorum habeatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though your teachers be abundant.

glosses.latin: Rogo ergo uos, imitatores mei estote.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] istoich dom farṅguide hóre adimmaicc [GLat]m[Con]ihi[/Con] et[/GLat] amathirse [GLat]uobís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. istoich dom farṅguide hóre adimmaicc mihi et amathirse uobís
glosses.glossFNs: .i. istoich dom farṅguide hóre adimmaicc mihi et amathirse uobís
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a natural right for me to ask you, for ye are sons mihi, and I am a father uobis.

glosses.latin: Rogo ergo uos, imitatores mei estote.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bedadthramli [ie].i.[/ie] gaibid comarbus for nathar [GLat]et[/GLat] intamlid abéssu
glosses.glossText: .i. bedadthramli .i. gaibid comarbus for nathar et intamlid abéssu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bedadthramli .i. gaibid comarbus for nathar et intamlid abéssu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye father-like, that is, take your father’s succession and imitate his manners.

glosses.latin: misi ad uos Timotheum, qui est filius meus carissimus ....
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he imitates my manners.

glosses.latin: qui uos commonefaciat uias meas, quae sunt in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who shall teach you.

glosses.latin: qui uos commonefaciat uias meas, quae sunt in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he shall declare to you what are my manners.

glosses.latin: qui uos commonefaciat uias meas, quae sunt in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: qui uos commonefaciat uias meas, quae sunt in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is in Christ those ways are.

glosses.latin: Tamquam non uenturus sim ad uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] nirisinse do barcoscsi riccubsa ǽm
glosses.glossText: .i. amal nirisinse do barcoscsi riccubsa ǽm
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal nirisinse do barcoscsi riccubsa ǽm
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as though I were not coming to correct you. I will come indeed.

glosses.latin: Veniam cito ad uos .... et cognoscam non sermonem eorum qui inflati sunt, sed uirtutem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]ut de aduentu terreret eos[/GLat][a] [ie].i.[/ie] doimmarr anúail diarrísa
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: ut de aduentu terreret eos .i. doimmarr anúail diarrísa
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: ut de aduentu terreret eosa .i. doimmarr anúail diarrísa
footnotes: a: Not in Migne, col. 759
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I will restrain their pride if I come.

glosses.latin: Veniam cito ad uos .... et cognoscam non sermonem eorum qui inflati sunt, sed uirtutem.
footnotes: b: leg. rombiedsi?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I shall know how ye are.

glosses.latin: Veniam cito ad uos .... et cognoscam non sermonem eorum qui inflati sunt, sed uirtutem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. bonum opus, this is what I shall praise.

glosses.latin: Quid uultis? in uirga ueniam ad uos? án in caritate et spiritu mansuetudinis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is lib atá arogu t[Con]ra[/Con] mad ferr cotob sechfider dichosscc alailiu aithirgid bésu diandaithirsid ón isindeseircc [GLat]et[/GLat]spirut rigthir cuccuib
glosses.glossText: .i. is lib atá arogu tra mad ferr cotob sechfider dichosscc alailiu aithirgid bésu diandaithirsid ón isindeseircc etspirut rigthir cuccuib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is lib atá arogu tra mad ferr cotob sechfider dichosscc alailiu aithirgid bésu diandaithirsid ón isindeseircc etspirut rigthir cuccuib
footnotes: e: cf. Pedersen, KZ. xxxv. 405
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is you, then, that have the choice: if it be better ye will be corrected by another correction. Emend (your) manners: if ye emend them<sup>e</sup>, it is in love and in a spirit (of meekness) that one will go to you.

glosses.latin: Et uos inflati estis; et non magnum luctum habuistis, ut tollatur de medio uestrum qui hoc opus fecit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that were meeter quam inflatio.

glosses.latin: Et uos inflati estis; et non magnum luctum habuistis, ut tollatur de medio uestrum qui hoc opus fecit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conibé eter [GLat]in peccato[/GLat] act cobeid [GLat]in pænitentia[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. conibé eter in peccato act cobeid in pænitentia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conibé eter in peccato act cobeid in pænitentia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that he may not be at all in peccato but that he may be in poenitentia.

glosses.latin: Ego quidem, absens corpore, praesens autem spiritu, iam iudicaui ut praesens eum qui sic operatus est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he is present, then, when his word is read out.

glosses.latin: Ego quidem, absens corpore, praesens autem spiritu, iam iudicaui ut praesens eum qui sic operatus est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as I am present.

glosses.latin: In nomine Domini nostri Iesu Christi, congregatis uobís et meo spiritu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not in my own authority have I judged him.

glosses.latin: In nomine Domini nostri Iesu Christi, congregatis uobís et meo spiritu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in earum literarum iudicio[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isónspirut rouiccius brith
glosses.glossText: .i. in earum literarum iudicio ɫ. isónspirut rouiccius brith
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in earum literarum iudicio ɫ. isónspirut rouiccius brith
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is from the Spirit I have passed judgment.

glosses.latin: Tradere huius modi Satanae in interitum carnis, ut spiritus saluus sit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg. ad v. 4[/Com] [GLat]iudicaui[/GLat] ǽm [GLat]tradere[/GLat] dondnindinsinse [vel]ɫ.[/vel] dodnindnastise[c] [GLat]uós. Aliter[/GLat] isdo dásact asberar athindnaculsa[d] istresodin bidslán á animsom [GLat]in die domini[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: [in marg. ad v. 4] iudicaui ǽm tradere dondnindinsinse ɫ. dodnindnastise uós. Aliter isdo dásact asberar athindnaculsa istresodin bidslán á animsom in die domini rl.
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg. ad v. 4] iudicaui ǽm tradere dondnindinsinse ɫ. dodnindnastisec uós. Aliter isdo dásact asberar athindnaculsad istresodin bidslán á animsom in die domini rl.
footnotes: c: leg. dondnindnaste J. S.
d: leg. atindnaculsa or athindnaculsom
f: The dondnindinsinse of the MS. may be a scribal error for dondnindnisinse, as the G.C.2 469 has it: but cf. Ml. 78b 18. W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: iudicaui indeed tradere, that I should deliver himf; or that ye should deliver him. Aliter, to madness it is said that he is given up: through this will his soul be saved in die Domini, etc.

glosses.latin: Tradere huius modi Satanae in interitum carnis, ut spiritus saluus sit.
footnotes: g: See the tract on the deadly sins and the corresponding virtues, Rawl. B. 512, printed in Celt. Zeitschr. III. 24–28
glosses.glossTrans: Satanae, i.e. to the adversary, i.e. poenitentiae, i.e. opposed to the vice is the virtue which takes its placeg.

glosses.latin: Tradere huius modi Satanae in interitum carnis, ut spiritus saluus sit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that his soul may be saved.

glosses.latin: Non [est] bona gloriatio uestra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye could not pass judgment on this crime.

glosses.latin: ut sitis noua consparsio, sicut estis adzimi. Etenim pasca nostrum immolatus est Christus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a lump of dough.

glosses.latin: ut sitis noua consparsio, sicut estis adzimi. Etenim pasca nostrum immolatus est Christus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unsoured, that is, without sourness of sin.

glosses.latin: ut sitis noua consparsio, sicut estis adzimi. Etenim pasca nostrum immolatus est Christus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] arrograd descad fobairgin isollumun [GLat]agni síc[/GLat] nicoir descad pectho do buith isollummun [GLat]agni[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]christi[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal arrograd descad fobairgin isollumun agni síc nicoir descad pectho do buith isollummun agni .i. christi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal arrograd descad fobairgin isollumun agni síc nicoir descad pectho do buith isollummun agni .i. christi
footnotes: e: the Passover
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as leaven in bread had been forbidden at the solemnity agnie, sic it is not proper for the leaven of sin to be at the solemnity Agni, i.e. Christi.

glosses.latin: Itaque epulemur, non in fermento ... nequitiae, sed in adzimís sinceritatis et ueritatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. at Christ’s feast.

glosses.latin: Itaque epulemur, non in fermento ... nequitiae, sed in adzimís sinceritatis et ueritatis.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: uselessness.

glosses.latin: Itaque epulemur, non in fermento ... nequitiae, sed in adzimís sinceritatis et ueritatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] díuitte linn [GLat]et[/GLat] fírinne [GLat]ut fuit ada[Con]m[/Con][/GLat] rénimmarmus
glosses.glossText: .i. díuitte linn et fírinne ut fuit adam rénimmarmus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. díuitte linn et fírinne ut fuit adam rénimmarmus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. simplicity with us and righteousness, ut fuit Adam before sinning.

glosses.latin: Non utique fornicarís huius mundi, aut auarís, aut rapacibus, aut idolís seruientibus; alioquin deburatis de hoc mundo exisse.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]non utique forni[Con]cariis[/Con][/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] isirdurcu ep[Con]ir[/Con]t lim són airrofetar ní biedsi hicobodlus lasuidiu [GLat]alioquín debue[Con]ratis[/Con][/GLat] arnitaat cosmuli ambésasa fribsi ished astécte dúib nébeth immalle
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] non utique fornicariis .i. isirdurcu epirt lim són airrofetar ní biedsi hicobodlus lasuidiu alioquín debueratis arnitaat cosmuli ambésasa fribsi ished astécte dúib nébeth immalle
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] non utique fornicariis .i. isirdurcu epirt lim són airrofetar ní biedsi hicobodlus lasuidiu alioquín debueratis arnitaat cosmuli ambésasa fribsi ished astécte dúib nébeth immalle
footnotes: f: lit. ‘I deem it too clear for speech,’ cf. Wb. 28b 32, 31b 4, Sg. 23b 3, Ml. 122d 7
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I need not sayf (non utique), for I know that ye will not be in communion with them, alioquin debueratis, for their customs are not like unto you. This is right for you, not to be along (with them).

glosses.latin: Non utique fornicarís huius mundi, aut auarís, aut rapacibus, aut idolís seruientibus; alioquin deburatis de hoc mundo exisse.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isairi [GLat]scripsi. Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]melius nobís fuerat de hác luce migrare quam indigne per commonionem gentium consortio separari[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. isairi scripsi. Pelagius: melius nobís fuerat de hác luce migrare quam indigne per commonionem gentium consortio separari
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isairi scripsi. Pelagius: melius nobís fuerat de hác luce migrare quam indigne per commonionem gentium consortio separarib
footnotes: b: sin autem, melius uobis fuerat de hac luce migrasse, quam indigere per commonitionem a gentium consortio separari, Migne, col. 760
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is therefore scripsi.

glosses.latin: Non utique fornicarís huius mundi, aut auarís, aut rapacibus, aut idolís seruientibus; alioquin deburatis de hoc mundo exisse.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni hedón [GLat]scripsi uobís[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non [Con]com[/Con]miscemini[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ni epur frib etarscarad frisuidiu [ie].i.[/ie] frigenti fobíith p[Con]re[/Con]cepte dóib duús induccatar fo hiris [GLat]alioquín[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] armain bed accuiss nap[Con]re[/Con]ceptesin [GLat]debueritis[/GLat][c] nótresstæ[d] dithír [GLat]et[/GLat]talam nání sin cotobárrig t[Con]ra[/Con] ort p[Con]re[/Con]cepte ↄnachdigtith
glosses.glossText: .i. ni hedón scripsi uobís .i. non commiscemini .i. ni epur frib etarscarad frisuidiu .i. frigenti fobíith precepte dóib duús induccatar fo hiris alioquín .i. armain bed accuiss napreceptesin debueritis nótresstæ dithír ettalam nání sin cotobárrig tra ort precepte ↄnachdigtith
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni hedón scripsi uobís .i. non commiscemini .i. ni epur frib etarscarad frisuidiu .i. frigenti fobíith precepte dóib duús induccatar fo hiris alioquín .i. armain bed accuiss napreceptesin debueritisc nótresstæd dithír ettalam nání sin cotobárrig tra ort precepte ↄnachdigtith
footnotes: c: leg. debueratis
d: leg. with Sarauw notésstæ
g: cotobárrig = co-tob-ad-reraig, where the ad is a perfective prefix
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (it is) not this scripsi uobis, i.e. non commiscemini, that is, I say not to you to separate from them, that is, from the Gentiles, because of teaching them, if perchance they may be brought under (the) faith alioquin. For if it were not because of that teaching, ye should have gone from the country and land of those (people). The office of teaching, then, has constrained youg, so that ye have not so gone.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem scripsi uobís non commisceri: ... si is qui frater nominatur est ... maledicus ... cum huiusmodi nec cibum quidem sumere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] infectsa [ie].i.[/ie] ní aidrech limm [GLat]quod scripsi[/GLat] atbiur beos
glosses.glossText: .i. infectsa .i. ní aidrech limm quod scripsi atbiur beos
glosses.glossFNs: .i. infectsa .i. ní aidrech limm quod scripsi atbiur beos
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this time, that is, I regret not quod scripsi: I say it still.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem scripsi uobís non commisceri: ... si is qui frater nominatur est ... maledicus ... cum huiusmodi nec cibum quidem sumere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a reviler or condemner.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem scripsi uobís non commisceri: ... si is qui frater nominatur est ... maledicus ... cum huiusmodi nec cibum quidem sumere.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: it is so.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem scripsi uobís non commisceri: ... si is qui frater nominatur est ... maledicus ... cum huiusmodi nec cibum quidem sumere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. eating with him in a house, or receiving his food.

glosses.latin: Quid enim mihi de his qui foris sunt iudicare?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what profits? i.e. it profits nothing.

glosses.latin: Quid enim mihi de his qui foris sunt iudicare?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is frater that I say quid enim, etc.

glosses.latin: Nam eos qui foris sunt Deus iudicabit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] beim foris lemm [Res]in[/Res]so forsaní asrubart riam [vel]ɫ.[/vel] istitul dondí dodiármo[Res]rat[/Res]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] beim foris lemm (in)so forsaní asrubart riam ɫ. istitul dondí dodiármo(rat)
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] beim foris lemm (in)so forsaní asrubart riam ɫ. istitul dondí dodiármo(rat)
glosses.glossTrans: This seems to me a recapitulation of what he had said before; or it is a title to that which follows it.

glosses.latin: Nam eos qui foris sunt Deus iudicabit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have a judge without you, even Christ.

glosses.latin: Audet aliquis uestrum habens negotium aduersus alterum, iudicari apud iniquos et non apud sanctos?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. dares: i.e. there is another evil among you.

glosses.latin: Audet aliquis uestrum habens negotium aduersus alterum, iudicari apud iniquos et non apud sanctos?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a suit or a judgment.

glosses.latin: Audet aliquis uestrum habens negotium aduersus alterum, iudicari apud iniquos et non apud sanctos?
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: a judgment.

glosses.latin: Audet aliquis uestrum habens negotium aduersus alterum, iudicari apud iniquos et non apud sanctos?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that he be judged.

glosses.latin: Audet aliquis uestrum habens negotium aduersus alterum, iudicari apud iniquos et non apud sanctos?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not churchfolk who are judges among you.

glosses.latin: Án nescitis, quoniam sancti de hoc mundo iudicabunt? Et si in uobis iudicabitur mundus indigni estis qui de minimis iudicatis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye had known, ye would not snatch the petty judgments from them.

glosses.latin: Án nescitis, quoniam sancti de hoc mundo iudicabunt? Et si in uobis iudicabitur mundus indigni estis qui de minimis iudicatis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]per uós siue uestro exemplo[/GLat][b] [ie].i.[/ie] bid ibarcumactusi miastir indomunso
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: per uós siue uestro exemplo .i. bid ibarcumactusi miastir indomunso
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: per uós siue uestro exemplob .i. bid ibarcumactusi miastir indomunso
footnotes: b: Siue per uos, uel uestro exemplo, Migne, col. 761
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be in your power that this world will be judged.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam angelos iudicabimus?
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]iudicabimus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] hireschaib [GLat]angelos[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]demones[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] fobíith ba deidbiriu dúnni immormus assinfolud app[Con]ri[/Con]scc inna colno araróitmar ceimroimsimmis ol ṁ bói dosom asinfolud tanidiu araróit isairi da[Con]no[/Con] messimmirni forrusom [etc]rl.[/etc] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] messimmir innafíraingliu [ie].i.[/ie] ishé cruth inso ǽm nosmessa[Con]m[/Con]mar[c] [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] bete som inimpudiu inna brithemnacte bemmini dano [GLat]ut dicit uocabit[/GLat][d] [GLat]caelum desusum et terram discernere populum suum[/GLat][e] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]de crísto dicitur qui in nostra homana natura angelos iudicabit[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]sancti excelsiores iudicabunt inferiores[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] iudicabimus .i. hireschaib angelos .i. demones .i. fobíith ba deidbiriu dúnni immormus assinfolud appriscc inna colno araróitmar ceimroimsimmis ol ṁ bói dosom asinfolud tanidiu araróit isairi dano messimmirni forrusom rl. ɫ. messimmir innafíraingliu .i. ishé cruth inso ǽm nosmessammar .i. amal bete som inimpudiu inna brithemnacte bemmini dano ut dicit uocabit caelum desusum et terram discernere populum suum ɫ. de crísto dicitur qui in nostra homana natura angelos iudicabit ɫ. sancti excelsiores iudicabunt inferiores
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] iudicabimus .i. hireschaib angelos .i. demones .i. fobíith ba deidbiriu dúnni immormus assinfolud appriscc inna colno araróitmar ceimroimsimmis ol ṁ bói dosom asinfolud tanidiu araróit isairi dano messimmirni forrusom rl. ɫ. messimmir innafíraingliu .i. ishé cruth inso ǽm nosmessammarc .i. amal bete som inimpudiu inna brithemnacte bemmini dano ut dicit uocabitd caelum desusum et terram discernere populum suume ɫ. de crísto dicitur qui in nostra homana natura angelos iudicabit ɫ. sancti excelsiores iudicabunt inferiores
footnotes: c: leg. nommessammar?
d: MS. uocauit
e: Ps. xlix. 4
h: impudiu dat. sg. of impṡuide (gl. obsessio) Ml. 43b
glosses.glossTrans: iudicabimus i.e. we faithful, angelos, i.e. demones, i.e. because it were more reasonable for us to sin out of the brittle substance of the flesh which we have received, if we should sin, than it was for him (to sin) out of the subtle substance which he has received. It is therefore, then, that we shall pass judgment on them, etc. Or we shall judge the very angels, i.e. this, truly, is the way we shall judge them, that is, as they will be in the encompassmenth of the Doom we shall be also.

glosses.latin: contemptibiles qui sunt in aeclesia, illos constituite ad iudicandum.
footnotes: i: i.e. laymen who have become monks in their old age, dotards: athláich S. R. 4386: cf. the Pâli vuddhapabbajito, which also connotes contempt, KZ. xxxv. 150
glosses.glossTrans: ex-laymeni who are at penance in ecclesiis.

glosses.latin: contemptibiles qui sunt in aeclesia, illos constituite ad iudicandum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be them who give judgments among you.

glosses.latin: Ad uerecondiam uestram dico. Sic non est inter uos sapiens quisquam qui possit iudicare inter fratrem suum?
footnotes: f: MS. erubescates
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unto your shame.

glosses.latin: Ad uerecondiam uestram dico. Sic non est inter uos sapiens quisquam qui possit iudicare inter fratrem suum?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isnaddixnigedar[g] nach æcne hóre isamne dognither
glosses.glossText: .i. isnaddixnigedar nach æcne hóre isamne dognither
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isnaddixnigedar<sup>g</sup> nach æcne hóre isamne dognither
footnotes: g: leg. innaddixnigedar, is there? Sarauw, but see is co arcessea Wb. 5b 35, is co dugnem Ml. 23c 6, is huare rongnith 31b 20, etc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is that there is no wise man, seeing that it is thus done.

glosses.latin: Sed frater cum fratre iudicio contendit, et hoc apud infidiles.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this, however, which ye do.

glosses.latin: Sed frater cum fratre iudicio contendit, et hoc apud infidiles.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Sed frater cum fratre iudicio contendit, et hoc apud infidiles.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nípu libsi intórdso act ba laamiresschu
glosses.glossText: .i. nípu libsi intórdso act ba laamiresschu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nípu libsi intórdso act ba laamiresschu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this practice should not be yours, but should be left to unbelievers.

glosses.latin: Iam quidem omnino delictum est in uobís, quod iudicia habetis inter uos. Quare non magis iniuriam accipistis? quare non magis frudem patiemini?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even assuredly.

glosses.latin: Iam quidem omnino delictum est in uobís, quod iudicia habetis inter uos. Quare non magis iniuriam accipistis? quare non magis frudem patiemini?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issí in so intargabáal ishé inpeccath forarele [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]fornicatio prius et iudicia[/GLat] [Com]in marg. l.[/Com] [GLat]qui semper habere pacem[/GLat] [b][GLat]debueratis[/GLat][/b] [GLat]etiam cum detrimento rerum temporalium[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. issí in so intargabáal ishé inpeccath forarele .i. fornicatio prius et iudicia [in marg. l.] qui semper habere pacem debueratis etiam cum detrimento rerum temporalium
