glosses.glossFNs: .i. issí in so intargabáal ishé inpeccath forarele .i. fornicatio prius et iudicia [in marg. l.] qui semper habere pacem debueratisb etiam cum detrimento rerum temporalium
footnotes: b: MS. debuerates
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the trespass; this is the sin upon another.

glosses.latin: Iam quidem omnino delictum est in uobís, quod iudicia habetis inter uos. Quare non magis iniuriam accipistis? quare non magis frudem patiemini?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cid atobaich cendílgud cech ancridi dognethe frib [GLat]et[/GLat] níbethe fria acre
glosses.glossText: .i. cid atobaich cendílgud cech ancridi dognethe frib et níbethe fria acre
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cid atobaich cendílgud cech ancridi dognethe frib et níbethe fria acre
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what impels you not to forgive every injury that may have been done to you, and that ye should not be complaining of it?

glosses.latin: Iam quidem omnino delictum est in uobís, quod iudicia habetis inter uos. Quare non magis iniuriam accipistis? quare non magis frudem patiemini?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were better than to avenge it.

glosses.latin: Sed uos iniuriam facitis, et fraudatis, et hoc fratri.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní dilgaid anancride dogníther frib act atgairith
glosses.glossText: .i. ní dilgaid anancride dogníther frib act atgairith
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní dilgaid anancride dogníther frib act atgairith
footnotes: e: i.e. make it a cause of action
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye forgive not the injury that is done you, but ye complain of it<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Sed uos iniuriam facitis, et fraudatis, et hoc fratri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye take away from every one, and ye defraud every one.

glosses.latin: Sed uos iniuriam facitis, et fraudatis, et hoc fratri.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]opus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nibu chumme dúib ce bad hé frisandénte
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. opus .i. nibu chumme dúib ce bad hé frisandénte
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. opus .i. nibu chumme dúib ce bad hé frisandénte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were not the same for you that ye should do it to him.

glosses.latin: iniqui regnum Dei non possidebunt .... neque idolís seruientes, neque adulteri.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ithé [GLat]inimici[/GLat] lessom [GLat]qui fraudant et qui iniuriam faciunt[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ithé inimici lessom qui fraudant et qui iniuriam faciunt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ithé inimici lessom qui fraudant et qui iniuriam faciunt
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these he deems inimici qui, etc.

glosses.latin: iniqui regnum Dei non possidebunt .... neque idolís seruientes, neque adulteri.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: iniqui regnum Dei non possidebunt .... neque idolís seruientes, neque adulteri.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]adultor est qui ultra terminum statum matrimonii graditur[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: adultor est qui ultra terminum statum matrimonii graditur
glosses.glossFNs: adultor est qui ultra terminum statum matrimonii graditur
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: neque masculorum concubitores, ... neque maledici, ... regnum Dei non possedebunt.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: neque masculorum concubitores, ... neque maledici, ... regnum Dei non possedebunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the sodomites.

glosses.latin: neque masculorum concubitores, ... neque maledici, ... regnum Dei non possedebunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. folk who are reviling.

glosses.latin: neque masculorum concubitores, ... neque maledici, ... regnum Dei non possedebunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] asenud uille t[Con]ra[/Con] nibiat inóentu muintire nime
glosses.glossText: .i. asenud uille tra nibiat inóentu muintire nime
glosses.glossFNs: .i. asenud uille tra nibiat inóentu muintire nime
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the whole synod of them, then, will not be in the unity of heaven’s household.

glosses.latin: Et haec quidem fuistis, sed abluti estis, sed sanctificati estis, sed iustificati estis in nomine Domini nostri Iesu Christi et in Spiritu Dei nostri.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]nomina[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]opera[/GLat] ropo ainm dúibsi t[Con]ra[/Con] inso uile [vel]ɫ.[/vel] darigensi[c] inso uile
glosses.glossText: .i. nomina ɫ. opera ropo ainm dúibsi tra inso uile ɫ. darigensi inso uile
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nomina ɫ. opera ropo ainm dúibsi tra inso uile ɫ. darigensic inso uile
footnotes: c: leg. darigénsid or darigénsidsi W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: all this, then, has been a name of yours: or ye have done all this.

glosses.latin: Et haec quidem fuistis, sed abluti estis, sed sanctificati estis, sed iustificati estis in nomine Domini nostri Iesu Christi et in Spiritu Dei nostri.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] inglaine sin [GLat]et[/GLat] indnóibe [GLat]et[/GLat]infírinne isinanmim inchoimded ísu cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] insp[Con]ir[/Con]uto nóib dúibsi atrédesin [Com]in marg.[/Com] taidmenadar sund t[Con]ra[/Con] nateora [d]p[Con]er[/Con]sana[/d] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]pater et filius et spiritus sanctus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. inglaine sin et indnóibe etinfírinne isinanmim inchoimded ísu crist et inspiruto nóib dúibsi atrédesin [in marg.] taidmenadar sund tra nateora persana .i. pater et filius et spiritus sanctus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inglaine sin et indnóibe etinfírinne isinanmim inchoimded ísu crist et inspiruto nóib dúibsi atrédesin [in marg.] taidmenadar sund tra nateora persanad .i. pater et filius et spiritus sanctus
footnotes: d: MS. perana
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that purity and the holiness and the righteousness in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and of the Holy Ghost, unto you (are) those three things. Here, then, he recalls the three Persons (of the Trinity), i.e. Pater, etc.

glosses.latin: ego sub nullius redigar potestate.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: ego sub nullius redigar potestate.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nimtharberar fochumactu nach sásta diib [GLat]ut ebriosi redigantur a uino et similia[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nimtharberar fochumactu nach sásta diib ut ebriosi redigantur a uino et similia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nimtharberar fochumactu nach sásta diib ut ebriosi redigantur a uino et similia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am not brought under the power of any food of them, ut ebriosi, etc.

glosses.latin: Esca uentri, et uenter escís. Deus autem hunc et hanc distruet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. near is their kinship.

glosses.latin: Esca uentri, et uenter escís. Deus autem hunc et hanc distruet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. escam: but it is the man that worships those two things.

glosses.latin: Esca uentri, et uenter escís. Deus autem hunc et hanc distruet.
footnotes: a: leg. bid mennand, cf. ismenand Wb. 5c, 16
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be clear to them.

glosses.latin: Corpus autem non fornicationi, sed Domino, et Dominus corpori.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dubrú ... assom[b] t[Con]ra[/Con] [GLat]híc[/GLat] aratairchela natúari [ie].i.[/ie] doirgairiu étrith arminibed cróis nibíad étrad
glosses.glossText: .i. dubrú ... assom tra híc aratairchela natúari .i. doirgairiu étrith arminibed cróis nibíad étrad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dubrú ... assomb tra híc aratairchela natúari .i. doirgairiu étrith arminibed cróis nibíad étrad
footnotes: b: Three letters, cti (cti vel ctr Zimmer), seem to come between ú and a. leg. dubrú atriassom? J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the belly ... that he may restrict the viands, that is, to forbid lust, for if gluttony were not, lust would not exist.

glosses.latin: Corpus autem non fornicationi, sed Domino, et Dominus corpori.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄdid flaith do incoimdiu is bésad inna flatho [c]doem [GLat]et[/GLat] dofich[/c]
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄdid flaith do incoimdiu is bésad inna flatho doem et dofich
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄdid flaith do incoimdiu is bésad inna flatho doem et dofichc
footnotes: c: MS. doeme dofich
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that the Lord is a prince to it: it is the usage of the prince that he protects and he punishes.

glosses.latin: Deus uero et Dominum suscitauit, et nos suscitabit per uirtutem suam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quia membra eius sumus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] incorp imbaflaith in coimdiu dodíusgibther side, trinert innadeacte am[Con]al[/Con] dorodiusgud arcoimdiu ísu
glosses.glossText: .i. quia membra eius sumus .i. incorp imbaflaith in coimdiu dodíusgibther side, trinert innadeacte amal dorodiusgud arcoimdiu ísu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. quia membra eius sumus .i. incorp imbaflaith in coimdiu dodíusgibther side, trinert innadeacte amal dorodiusgud arcoimdiu ísu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the body wherein the Lord shall be prince, it will be roused through the might of the Godhead, even as our Lord Jesus has been roused.

glosses.latin: Tollens ergo membra Christi, faciam membra meretricis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ingét abullu arcr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat]indigén bullu mertrige diib [GLat]absit[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ingét abullu arcrist etindigén bullu mertrige diib absit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ingét abullu arcrist etindigén bullu mertrige diib absit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. shall I snatch His members from Christ, and shall I make of them a harlot’s members? absit!

glosses.latin: Án nescitis, quoniam qui adheret meritrici, unum corpus efficitur? erunt enim, inquid, duo in carne una.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ardoecmalla inmertrech cuicce pecthu indlína dodaaidlea combi óinchorp pectho asṁberar [GLat]et[/GLat] asberar corp dondlúim máirsin innapecthach intí im[Con]murgu[/Con] téte adochu[Con]m[/Con]si doecmallaside foir indlúim máir inchoirpsin [GLat]et[/GLat]inphecthasin bís forsin mertrich [GLat]et[/GLat] nísṅderigsi da[Con]no[/Con] act atballat diblínaib
glosses.glossText: .i. ardoecmalla inmertrech cuicce pecthu indlína dodaaidlea combi óinchorp pectho asṁberar et asberar corp dondlúim máirsin innapecthach intí immurgu téte adochumsi doecmallaside foir indlúim máir inchoirpsin etinphecthasin bís forsin mertrich et nísṅderigsi dano act atballat diblínaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ardoecmalla inmertrech cuicce pecthu indlína dodaaidlea combi óinchorp pectho asṁberar et asberar corp dondlúim máirsin innapecthach intí immurgu téte adochumsi doecmallaside foir indlúim máir inchoirpsin etinphecthasin bís forsin mertrich et nísṅderigsi dano act atballat diblínaib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for the harlot gathers unto her the sins of those that visit her, so that it is said to be one body of sin, and that great mass of sinners is called ‘body.’ Now he that goes to her gathers on him the great mass of that body and of that sin which is on the harlot, and it does not leave her, but they both perish.

glosses.latin: Fornicationem fugite. Omne peccatum quodeumque fecerit homo, extra corpus est: qui autem fornicatur, in corpus suum peccat.
footnotes: d: cf. a threte Wb. 18c 6, traitiu Ml. 92b 9, trait Ml. 104b 5, traid .i. luath O’Cl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. shun ye and let it be quickly, for it is proper to shun it.

glosses.latin: Fornicationem fugite. Omne peccatum quodeumque fecerit homo, extra corpus est: qui autem fornicatur, in corpus suum peccat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. except lust.

glosses.latin: Fornicationem fugite. Omne peccatum quodeumque fecerit homo, extra corpus est: qui autem fornicatur, in corpus suum peccat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] imfolngi corp dosso[Con]m[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] corp innapecthe bíte for sinmertrich
glosses.glossText: .i. imfolngi corp dossom .i. corp innapecthe bíte for sinmertrich
glosses.glossFNs: .i. imfolngi corp dossom .i. corp innapecthe bíte for sinmertrich
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he makes to him a body, that is, the body of the sins which are on the harlot.

glosses.latin: Án nescitis quoniam membra uestra templum Spiritus est sancti .... quem habetis á Deo, et non estis uestri?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isglé limm niↄdigénte étrad marufeste inso
glosses.glossText: .i. isglé limm niↄdigénte étrad marufeste inso
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isglé limm niↄdigénte étrad marufeste inso
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is clear to me that ye would not commit fornication if ye knew this.

glosses.latin: Án nescitis quoniam membra uestra templum Spiritus est sancti .... quem habetis á Deo, et non estis uestri?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from the Godhead.

glosses.latin: Án nescitis quoniam membra uestra templum Spiritus est sancti .... quem habetis á Deo, et non estis uestri?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are not your own.

glosses.latin: portate Dominum in corpore uestro.
glosses.glossTrans: let Him be your burden.

glosses.latin: portate Dominum in corpore uestro.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ba uissiu dúib oldáte pecthe dobuid and
glosses.glossText: .i. ba uissiu dúib oldáte pecthe dobuid and
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ba uissiu dúib oldáte pecthe dobuid and
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were more proper for you than for sins to be therein.

glosses.latin: De quibus autem scripsistis mihi, Bonum est homini mulierem non tangere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]questionibus[/GLat] arrufoitea epistli uaidib som conaidchomarcaib cuciso[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. questionibus arrufoitea epistli uaidib som conaidchomarcaib cucisom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. questionibus arrufoitea epistli uaidib som conaidchomarcaib cucisom
glosses.glossTrans: for letters had been sent from them with questions to him.

glosses.latin: De quibus autem scripsistis mihi, Bonum est homini mulierem non tangere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the answer which ye take from me.

glosses.latin: Mulier sui corporis non habet potestatem, sed uir: similiter et uir sui corporis non habet potestatem, sed mulier.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni cumuing imfogbaidetith nalanamnas maniptol lasinfer
glosses.glossText: .i. ni cumuing imfogbaidetith nalanamnas maniptol lasinfer
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni cumuing imfogbaidetith nalanamnas maniptol lasinfer
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. she cannot practise continence or copulate unless the husband pleases.

glosses.latin: Mulier sui corporis non habet potestatem, sed uir: similiter et uir sui corporis non habet potestatem, sed mulier.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless it be agreeable to the husband.

glosses.latin: Mulier sui corporis non habet potestatem, sed uir: similiter et uir sui corporis non habet potestatem, sed mulier.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nach moided da[Con]no[/Con] infer infectso hicumactu arnicumuingside da[Con]no[/Con] imfogbaidetid nálana[Con]m[/Con]nas maniptol [GLat]apud mulierem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nach moided dano infer infectso hicumactu arnicumuingside dano imfogbaidetid nálanamnas maniptol apud mulierem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nach moided dano infer infectso hicumactu arnicumuingside dano imfogbaidetid nálanamnas maniptol apud mulierem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let then the husband not boast this time in (his) power, for he, too, cannot practise continence or copulate unless mulier pleases.

glosses.latin: Nolite frudare inuicem, nisi forte ex consensu ad tempus .... né temptet uos Satanas propter incontinentiam uestram.
footnotes: a: a manu prima; Pedersen compares Wb. 10c 22, Sg. 190b 3, but leg. probably dindiboiprid, which is translated
glosses.glossTrans: to defraud yourselves.

glosses.latin: Nolite frudare inuicem, nisi forte ex consensu ad tempus .... né temptet uos Satanas propter incontinentiam uestram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] na tiubrad cách achéle [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ex ratione coniugii[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. na tiubrad cách achéle .i. ex ratione coniugii
glosses.glossFNs: .i. na tiubrad cách achéle .i. ex ratione coniugii
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not each defraud the other.

glosses.latin: Nolite frudare inuicem, nisi forte ex consensu ad tempus .... né temptet uos Satanas propter incontinentiam uestram.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. save only.

glosses.latin: Nolite frudare inuicem, nisi forte ex consensu ad tempus .... né temptet uos Satanas propter incontinentiam uestram.
footnotes: c: lit. except if it be unity to you
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. except ye be at one<sup>c</sup> as to it.

glosses.latin: Nolite frudare inuicem, nisi forte ex consensu ad tempus .... né temptet uos Satanas propter incontinentiam uestram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in quadragensimis et in temporibus partús et menstrualis doloris[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. in quadragensimis et in temporibus partús et menstrualis doloris
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in quadragensimis et in temporibus partús et menstrualis doloris
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nolite frudare inuicem, nisi forte ex consensu ad tempus .... né temptet uos Satanas propter incontinentiam uestram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arna dich cách assadligud inadaltras trilathar demuin [GLat]et[/GLat] tribarnebcongabthetitsi
glosses.glossText: .i. arna dich cách assadligud inadaltras trilathar demuin et tribarnebcongabthetitsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arna dich cách assadligud inadaltras trilathar demuin et tribarnebcongabthetitsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest every one go out of his duty into adultery through the Devil’s influence and through your incontinence.

glosses.latin: Uolo autem omnes homones esse sicut me ipsum; sed unusquisque proprium habet donum ex Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mad moríarsa dognethe and issa[Con]m[/Con]lid inso nobiad chách am[Con]al[/Con] rongabusa [ie].i.[/ie] inógi [GLat]híc ostenditur[/GLat] [b][GLat]uirginitás[/GLat][/b]
glosses.glossText: .i. mad moríarsa dognethe and issamlid inso nobiad chách amal rongabusa .i. inógi híc ostenditur uirginitás
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mad moríarsa dognethe and issamlid inso nobiad chách amal rongabusa .i. inógi híc ostenditur uirginitásb
footnotes: b: MS. uirgitás
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it were my will that ye did therein, it is thus that every one would be, as I am, that is, in celibacy hic, etc.

glosses.latin: Uolo autem omnes homones esse sicut me ipsum; sed unusquisque proprium habet donum ex Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. both celibacy and matrimony.

glosses.latin: Uolo autem omnes homones esse sicut me ipsum; sed unusquisque proprium habet donum ex Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]etsi uolo[/GLat] bés nibatchutrummi huili act cinibetso[Con]m[/Con] sa[Con]m[/Con]lu[Con]m[/Con]sa inógi bith ítuil dée biet huili
glosses.glossText: .i. etsi uolo bés nibatchutrummi huili act cinibetsom samlumsa inógi bith ítuil dée biet huili
glosses.glossFNs: .i. etsi uolo bés nibatchutrummi huili act cinibetsom samlumsa inógi bith ítuil dée biet huili
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. etsi uolo, peradventure all may not be equal; but though they be not like me in celibacy, it will be in God’s will that they all will be, [that is, whether in celibacy or matrimony].

glosses.latin: Dico autem non nuptís et uidnís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]incipit alia causa de uiduís[/GLat][a] [ie].i.[/ie] bíte iṅgenas
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: incipit alia causa de uiduís .i. bíte iṅgenas
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: incipit alia causa de uiduísa .i. bíte iṅgenas
footnotes: a: Incipit aliam causam de innuptis, Migne, col. 766
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who are in chastity.

glosses.latin: melius est enim nubere quam úri.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Hieronymus[/GLat]: [GLat]ideo melius nubere quam peius úri[/GLat] olcc asferr ulcc inso
glosses.glossText: Hieronymus: ideo melius nubere quam peius úri olcc asferr ulcc inso
glosses.glossFNs: Hieronymus: ideo melius nubere quam peius úri olcc asferr ulcc inso
glosses.glossTrans: an evil that is better than an evil, this.

glosses.latin: praecipio ... uxorem á uiro non discedere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that I enjoin.

glosses.latin: Quod si discesserit, manere innuptam, aut uiro suo reconciliari.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ma eterróscra friafer nítéit[b] cofer ṅaile act bed[c] ingenas
glosses.glossText: .i. ma eterróscra friafer nítéit cofer ṅaile act bed ingenas
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ma eterróscra friafer nítéit<sup>b</sup> cofer ṅaile act bed<sup>c</sup> ingenas
footnotes: b: leg. nátéit? or, with Thurneysen, nítéi?
c: = beid; for the subjunctive cf. Wb. 20b 13
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if she should separate from her husband, she goes not to another husband, but shall be in chastity.

glosses.latin: Quod si discesserit, manere innuptam, aut uiro suo reconciliari.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] madcotecht di[d] cofer bad hé afer incétne
glosses.glossText: .i. madcotecht di cofer bad hé afer incétne
glosses.glossFNs: .i. madcotecht di<sup>d</sup> cofer bad hé afer incétne
footnotes: d: cf. uare is co dul neich dó, Ir. Texte II.2 208
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it (comes) to her going to a husband, let the first one be her husband.

glosses.latin: Nam ceterís ego dico, non Dominus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni liim for suide is [GLat]dominus[/GLat] im[Con]murgu[/Con] [GLat]dicit uxorem a uiro non descedere[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ni liim for suide is dominus immurgu dicit uxorem a uiro non descedere
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni liim for suide is dominus immurgu dicit uxorem a uiro non descedere
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I do not make Him responsible. It is Dominus, however, (who) dicit, etc.

glosses.latin: Et si qua mulier fidelis habet uirum infidelem, et hic consentit habitare cum illa, non dimittat uirum.
footnotes: e: The mark of length is over the g
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he likes her companionship.

glosses.latin: Et si qua mulier fidelis habet uirum infidelem, et hic consentit habitare cum illa, non dimittat uirum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] na scarad frisinfer dús inríctar[f] triagnáissi
glosses.glossText: .i. na scarad frisinfer dús inríctar triagnáissi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. na scarad frisinfer dús inríctar<sup>f</sup> triagnáissi
footnotes: f: leg. -rícthar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let her not part from the husband, if perchance he may be saved through her companionship.

glosses.latin: Sanctificatus est enim uir infidilis per mulierem fidilemt .... alioquin filii uestri inmundi essent, nunc autem sancti sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] teccomnocuir inso is airi didiu asbiursa ambuith immallei dús inríctar[f] indalanái trialaile
glosses.glossText: .i. teccomnocuir inso is airi didiu asbiursa ambuith immallei dús inríctar indalanái trialaile
glosses.glossFNs: .i. teccomnocuir inso is airi didiu asbiursa ambuith immallei dús inríctar<sup>f</sup> indalanái trialaile
footnotes: f: leg. -rícthar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this has happened. Therefore, then, I say that they should be together if perchance one of the twain be saved through the other.

glosses.latin: Sanctificatus est enim uir infidilis per mulierem fidilemt .... alioquin filii uestri inmundi essent, nunc autem sancti sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]alioquin[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] mainip inchrudso bid anglan for cland [ie].i.[/ie] alliles dind ancretmiuch bid ancretmech
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] alioquin .i. mainip inchrudso bid anglan for cland .i. alliles dind ancretmiuch bid ancretmech
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] alioquin .i. mainip inchrudso bid anglan for cland .i. alliles dind ancretmiuch bid ancretmech
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless it be in this wise, your children will be unclean, that is, what shall cleave to the unbelieving will be unbelieving.

glosses.latin: Sanctificatus est enim uir infidilis per mulierem fidilemt .... alioquin filii uestri inmundi essent, nunc autem sancti sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]filii[/GLat] hore ataaithsi immelei [GLat]et[/GLat] adibcretmich in fectsa cretmech da[Con]no[/Con] forcland
glosses.glossText: .i. filii hore ataaithsi immelei et adibcretmich in fectsa cretmech dano forcland
glosses.glossFNs: .i. filii hore ataaithsi immelei et adibcretmich in fectsa cretmech dano forcland
glosses.glossTrans: because ye are together and are now believing, your children also (will be) believing.

glosses.latin: Quod si infidilis discedit, discedat .... in pace autem uocauit nos Deus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nach nastad incretmech [GLat]et[/GLat] na coméitged dó
glosses.glossText: .i. nach nastad incretmech et na coméitged dó
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nach nastad incretmech et na coméitged dó
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not the believer detain him, and let him (the believer) not be indulgent to him.

glosses.latin: Quod si infidilis discedit, discedat .... in pace autem uocauit nos Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let us not have strife with any one.

glosses.latin: Unde enim scis, mulier, si uirum saluum facies? aut unde scis, uir, si mulierem saluam facies?
footnotes: g: for ad-d-sode
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou wilt save the man though thou keep him with thee perforce.

glosses.latin: Unde enim scis, mulier, si uirum saluum facies? aut unde scis, uir, si mulierem saluam facies?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] áfir can rofestasu íccfe inmnái [h]ciatasode[/h] lat arécin
glosses.glossText: .i. áfir can rofestasu íccfe inmnái ciatasode lat arécin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. áfir can rofestasu íccfe inmnái ciatasode<sup>h</sup> lat arécin
footnotes: h: MS. ciata sode; from adsuidim, enclitic astaim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. O man, whence shouldst thou know that thou wilt save the woman though thou keep her with thee perforce?

glosses.latin: Nisi unicuique sicut diuisit Dominus, unumquemque sicut uocauit Deus, ita ambulet; et sicut in omnibus æclesís doceo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] fondrodil incoimdiu dochách [GLat]siue cum coiuge[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]in uirginitate[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal fondrodil incoimdiu dochách siue cum coiuge ɫ. in uirginitate
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal fondrodil incoimdiu dochách siue cum coiuge ɫ. in uirginitate
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as the Lord hath distributed it to every one.

glosses.latin: Nisi unicuique sicut diuisit Dominus, unumquemque sicut uocauit Deus, ita ambulet; et sicut in omnibus æclesís doceo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] imbinógi imbilánamnas am[Con]al[/Con] dorograd bíd samlid [Com]in marg.[/Com] ishé inso titul indligid archinn ciasberthar co[Con]m[/Con]bad béim foris indligid remep[Con]er[/Con]thi
glosses.glossText: .i. imbinógi imbilánamnas amal dorograd bíd samlid [in marg.] ishé inso titul indligid archinn ciasberthar combad béim foris indligid remeperthi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. imbinógi imbilánamnas amal dorograd bíd samlid [in marg.] ishé inso titul indligid archinn ciasberthar combad béim foris indligid remeperthi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whether in celibacy or in marriage, as he hath been called, let him be so. This is the title of the dictum that follows, though it is said that it is a recapitulation of the dictum aforesaid.

glosses.latin: Nisi unicuique sicut diuisit Dominus, unumquemque sicut uocauit Deus, ita ambulet; et sicut in omnibus æclesís doceo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is what I teach to every one.

glosses.latin: Circumcisus aliquis uocatus est? non adducat praeputium. In praeputio aliquis uocatus est? non circumcidatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]uirginitas[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] imdibthe ólana[Con]m[/Con]nas [a]ar ni dond imdibu[/a] colnidiu lessom inso [GLat]ut uirginitas circumcidit uitia[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. uirginitas .i. imdibthe ólanamnas ar ni dond imdibu colnidiu lessom inso ut uirginitas circumcidit uitia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. uirginitas .i. imdibthe ólanamnas ar ni dond imdibua colnidiu lessom inso ut uirginitas circumcidit uitia
footnotes: a: MS. ar nidon dimdibu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. circumcised from marriage; for he is not here speaking of the fleshly circumcision.

glosses.latin: Circumcisus aliquis uocatus est? non adducat praeputium. In praeputio aliquis uocatus est? non circumcidatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] na téit illánamnas issuáichnid [GLat]híc[/GLat] náich doimdibu colnidu ání thúas [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nacuinged amenme [GLat]praeputium[/GLat] mad imdibthe
glosses.glossText: .i. na téit illánamnas issuáichnid híc náich doimdibu colnidu ání thúas ɫ. nacuinged amenme praeputium mad imdibthe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. na téit illánamnas issuáichnid híc náich doimdibu colnidu ání thúas ɫ. nacuinged amenme praeputium mad imdibthe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him not enter matrimony: it is obvious híc that what is above is not of the fleshly circumcision: or let not his mind seek praeputium if it be circumcised.

glosses.latin: Circumcisus aliquis uocatus est? non adducat praeputium. In praeputio aliquis uocatus est? non circumcidatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non demittat uxorem[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] naepred amenme armbad ferr són
glosses.glossText: .i. non demittat uxorem ɫ. naepred amenme armbad ferr són
glosses.glossFNs: .i. non demittat uxorem ɫ. naepred amenme armbad ferr són
glosses.glossTrans: let not his mind say that that would be better.

glosses.latin: Circumcisio nihil est, et praeputium nihil est; sed obseruatio mandatorum Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni lour deit buid censétchi mani déne dagnímu
glosses.glossText: .i. ni lour deit buid censétchi mani déne dagnímu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni lour deit buid censétchi mani déne dagnímu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not enough for thee to be without a wife, unless thou do good works.

glosses.latin: Circumcisio nihil est, et praeputium nihil est; sed obseruatio mandatorum Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] sechib grád imbether and impóge falánamnas istaschide timne dée dochomalnad and
glosses.glossText: .i. sechib grád imbether and impóge falánamnas istaschide timne dée dochomalnad and
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sechib grád imbether and impóge falánamnas istaschide timne dée dochomalnad and
footnotes: c: lit. grade
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whatsoever the condition<sup>c</sup> in which one is, whether it be celibacy or matrimony, it is necessary to fulfil God’s commandments therein.

glosses.latin: Unusquisque in qua uocatione uocatus est, in ea permaneat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without any changing.

glosses.latin: non sit tibi cura de libertate; sed et si potes liber fieri, magis utere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. seek not celibacy.

glosses.latin: non sit tibi cura de libertate; sed et si potes liber fieri, magis utere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cechoníis cor dosétche uáit níiscoirther[b] act indnite dús imcomchétbuid dúib
glosses.glossText: .i. cechoníis cor dosétche uáit níiscoirther act indnite dús imcomchétbuid dúib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cechoníis cor dosétche uáit níiscoirther<sup>b</sup> act indnite dús imcomchétbuid dúib
footnotes: b: rectius níscoirther, but cf. Wb. 7a 11
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though thou may be able to put thy wife away from thee, thou shalt not put her away; but wait to see if ye can agree.

glosses.latin: Qui enim in Domino uocatus est seruus, libertus est Domini; similiter qui liber uocatus est, seruus est Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is illánamnas dorograd dochu[Con]m[/Con] ṅ dée
glosses.glossText: .i. is illánamnas dorograd dochum ṅ dée
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is illánamnas dorograd dochum ṅ dée
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is in matrimony he has been called unto God.

glosses.latin: Qui enim in Domino uocatus est seruus, libertus est Domini; similiter qui liber uocatus est, seruus est Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a free-slave, that is, he is a freedman unto God, not Him tantum seruit.

glosses.latin: Qui enim in Domino uocatus est seruus, libertus est Domini; similiter qui liber uocatus est, seruus est Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without half service coniugio.

glosses.latin: Unusquisque in quo uocatus est frater, in hoc maneat apud Deum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Unusquisque in quo uocatus est frater, in hoc maneat apud Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bíth and beos act ropo ituil dée
glosses.glossText: .i. bíth and beos act ropo ituil dée
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bíth and beos act ropo ituil dée
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him still abide therein provided it be in God’s will.

glosses.latin: De uirginibus antem praeceptum Domini non habeo; consilium autem dó, tamquam misericordiam consecutus sum á Domino, ut sim fidilis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] níhed asrúbart side bíth nech inógi cidsochumact nodochumact do c[Con]ei[/Con]st cid asrubart incoimdiu ni[Con]anse[/Con] [GLat]qui potest capere capiat[/GLat][a]
glosses.glossText: .i. níhed asrúbart side bíth nech inógi cidsochumact nodochumact do ceist cid asrubart incoimdiu nianse qui potest capere capiat
glosses.glossFNs: .i. níhed asrúbart side bíth nech inógi cidsochumact nodochumact do ceist cid asrubart incoimdiu nianse qui potest capere capiata
footnotes: a: Matth. xix. 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is not what He had said, let any one abide in celibacy whether he be well-able or ill-able thereto. Question, what hath the Lord said? Easy (to answer): qui potest, etc.

glosses.latin: De uirginibus antem praeceptum Domini non habeo; consilium autem dó, tamquam misericordiam consecutus sum á Domino, ut sim fidilis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ar mad forṅgaire dognein docoischifed pían athairmthecht
glosses.glossText: .i. ar mad forṅgaire dognein docoischifed pían athairmthecht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ar mad forṅgaire dognein docoischifed pían athairmthecht
footnotes: d: lit. made
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for if it were a command that I gave<sup>d</sup>, punishment would follow transgression thereof.

glosses.latin: De uirginibus antem praeceptum Domini non habeo; consilium autem dó, tamquam misericordiam consecutus sum á Domino, ut sim fidilis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as I am trustworthy at the mission to which I have come.

glosses.latin: Alligatus és uxori? noli querere solutionem. Solutus és ab uxore? noli querere uxorem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] massu cut séitchi rocretis na scarad frit iarcretim
glosses.glossText: .i. massu cut séitchi rocretis na scarad frit iarcretim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. massu cut séitchi rocretis na scarad frit iarcretim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if thou hast believed with thy wife, let her not part from thee after believing.

glosses.latin: Alligatus és uxori? noli querere solutionem. Solutus és ab uxore? noli querere uxorem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] manid coséitchi rocretis natuic séitchi iarcretim
glosses.glossText: .i. manid coséitchi rocretis natuic séitchi iarcretim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. manid coséitchi rocretis natuic séitchi iarcretim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if thou hast not believed with a wife, take not a wife after believing.

glosses.latin: Si autem accperis uxorem, non peccabis; et si nubserit uirgo, non peccabit. Tribulationem tamen carnis habebunt huiusmodi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nígatda[b] diib cammaif imnetha inbetho [ie].i.[/ie] breth [GLat]et[/GLat] altram [GLat]et[/GLat] anasansa[Con]m[/Con] diib díth fochricce
glosses.glossText: .i. nígatda diib cammaif imnetha inbetho .i. breth et altram et anasansam diib díth fochricce
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nígatdab diib cammaif imnetha inbetho .i. breth et altram et anasansam diib díth fochricce
footnotes: b: leg. nígata
e: cf. Wb. 10b 14, perhaps following the Lamb, Apoc. xiv. 4: or cf. Luc. viii. 8, 14, 15
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the troubles of the world, however, it takes not from them, to wit, bearing children and nursing, and what is hardest of them, loss of reward<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Hoc itaque dico, fratres: Tempus breve est; reliquum est ut et qui habent uxores tamquam non habentes sint;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that you should be in celibacy.

glosses.latin: Hoc itaque dico, fratres: Tempus breve est; reliquum est ut et qui habent uxores tamquam non habentes sint;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdered ṁbetho inso nifíu sercc do thabairt do [Com]in left marg.[/Com] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isfurgrad inso [GLat]ut qui habent[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ished inso arathá [GLat]ut qui[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. isdered ṁbetho inso nifíu sercc do thabairt do [in left marg.] ɫ. isfurgrad inso ut qui habent .i. ished inso arathá ut qui rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdered ṁbetho inso nifíu sercc do thabairt do [in left marg.] ɫ. isfurgrad inso ut qui habent .i. ished inso arathá ut qui rl.
footnotes: f: lit. a remainder: cf. Ml. 48d 23, 57d 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the end of the world, it is not worth while to love it: or this is what remaineth overf, ut, etc., i.e. this is what awaiteth, ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Hoc itaque dico, fratres: Tempus breve est; reliquum est ut et qui habent uxores tamquam non habentes sint;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] ṁbís ingen [GLat]et[/GLat] athir siur [GLat]et[/GLat] brathir
glosses.glossText: .i. amal ṁbís ingen et athir siur et brathir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal ṁbís ingen et athir siur et brathir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as is daughter and father, sister and brother.

glosses.latin: Hoc itaque dico, fratres: Tempus breve est; reliquum est ut et qui habent uxores tamquam non habentes sint;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] nístectitis [vel]ɫ.[/vel] co beit am[Con]al[/Con] innahí nadtectat sétchi
glosses.glossText: .i. amal nístectitis ɫ. co beit amal innahí nadtectat sétchi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal nístectitis ɫ. co beit amal innahí nadtectat sétchi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as if they had them not, or that they may be as those that have not wives.

glosses.latin: Et qui flent tamquam non flentes; ... et qui emunt, tamquam non possedentes;
glosses.glossText: .i. amal nahí nádchiat ɫ. amal nícetis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal nahí nádchiat ɫ. amal nícetis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as those that weep not, or as if they wept not.

glosses.latin: Et qui flent tamquam non flentes; ... et qui emunt, tamquam non possedentes;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. like those that buy not.

glosses.latin: Et qui utuntur hoc mundo, tamquam non utantur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as if they used not.

glosses.latin: Qui sine uxore est, sollicitus est quae Domini sunt, quomodo placeat Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nibí nach dethiden foir act fognam dodia noch ba hedón bachóir[c]
glosses.glossText: .i. nibí nach dethiden foir act fognam dodia noch ba hedón bachóir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nibí nach dethiden foir act fognam dodia noch ba hedón bachóir<sup>c</sup>
footnotes: c: The mark of length is uncertain; for the aspiration cf. KZ. xxxv. 332
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is no care upon him save service unto God, but that were proper.

glosses.latin: Qui autem cum uxore est, sollicitus est, quae sunt mundi, quomodo placeat uxori; et diuisus est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. his only care is to serve uxori.

glosses.latin: Qui autem cum uxore est, sollicitus est, quae sunt mundi, quomodo placeat uxori; et diuisus est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issain [GLat]ordo[/GLat] dogní cechtar nái [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]mulier et innubta[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. issain ordo dogní cechtar nái .i. mulier et innubta
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issain ordo dogní cechtar nái .i. mulier et innubta
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. different is the ordo which each of them makes.

glosses.latin: Et mulier innupta, et uirgo cogitat quae Domini sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is, the uirgo.

glosses.latin: Et mulier innupta, et uirgo cogitat quae Domini sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these things are what he mentions below.

glosses.latin: Porro autem ad utilitatem uestram dico, non ut laqueum uobís ineiciam, sed ad id quod honestum est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]non impono necessitatem inuitís[/GLat][b] [ie].i.[/ie] niarfarnastud inógi manip artháircud fochricce dúib
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: non impono necessitatem inuitís .i. niarfarnastud inógi manip artháircud fochricce dúib
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: non impono necessitatem inuitísb .i. niarfarnastud inógi manip artháircud fochricce dúib
footnotes: b: Not in Migne, col. 770
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not to detain you in celibacy unless it be for the purpose of preparing a reward for you.

glosses.latin: Porro autem ad utilitatem uestram dico, non ut laqueum uobís ineiciam, sed ad id quod honestum est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished didiu an[GLat]honestum[/GLat] guide dée cen nachtairmescc ódethidin inbetho [ie].i.[/ie] ósétchi
glosses.glossText: .i. ished didiu anhonestum guide dée cen nachtairmescc ódethidin inbetho .i. ósétchi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished didiu anhonestum guide dée cen nachtairmescc ódethidin inbetho .i. ósétchi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, then, is the honestum, to pray God without any interruption from the care of the world, that is, from a wife.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem turpem sé uideri existimat super uirginem suam, quod sit superadulta, et ita oportet fieri, quod uult faciat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is unseemly per, etc.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem turpem sé uideri existimat super uirginem suam, quod sit superadulta, et ita oportet fieri, quod uult faciat.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem turpem sé uideri existimat super uirginem suam, quod sit superadulta, et ita oportet fieri, quod uult faciat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as the daughter desires it.

glosses.latin: Nam qui statuit in corde suo firmus, non habens necessitatem, potestatem autem habens suae uoluntatis . . et hoc iudicauit in corde suo seruare uirginem suam, bene facit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. those two things (non habens necessitatem and potestatem habens suae uoluntatis) then, are carried through this text.

glosses.latin: Nam qui statuit in corde suo firmus, non habens necessitatem, potestatem autem habens suae uoluntatis . . et hoc iudicauit in corde suo seruare uirginem suam, bene facit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] asrochoili inna chridiu buid dondingin inógi [vel]ɫ.[/vel] diacholin fondul toisech
glosses.glossText: .i. asrochoili inna chridiu buid dondingin inógi ɫ. diacholin fondul toisech
glosses.glossFNs: .i. asrochoili inna chridiu buid dondingin inógi ɫ. diacholin fondul toisech
footnotes: c: Lit. a being to the daughter
d: Cf. fun dul n-isiu (hac vice), G. C.2 xiii. n., Sarauw, Irske Studier, p. 99
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he determines in his heart that the daughter should be<sup>c</sup> in virginity, or in the first way (of explaining it) that his flesh shall<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Igitur qui matrimonio iungit uirginem suam, bene facit; et qui non iungit melius facit.
glosses.glossFullTags: tadbat so[Con]m[/Con] sund t[Con]ra[/Con] dechur fil eterlanamnas [GLat]et[/GLat] ógi intain asṁberar [GLat]non peccare coiugio et benefacere[/GLat] dondógi [GLat]et[/GLat] intain asṁberar [GLat]benefacere coiugio[/GLat] is [GLat]melius facere uirginitatem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: tadbat som sund tra dechur fil eterlanamnas et ógi intain asṁberar non peccare coiugio et benefacere dondógi et intain asṁberar benefacere coiugio is melius facere uirginitatem
glosses.glossFNs: tadbat som sund tra dechur fil eterlanamnas et ógi intain asṁberar non peccare coiugio et benefacere dondógi et intain asṁberar benefacere coiugio is melius facere uirginitatem
footnotes: e: = Ir. nephpeccad dondlanamnas
glosses.glossTrans: he manifests here the difference which there is between matrimony and virginity, when it is said non peccare coniugioe (that wedlock sins not), it is likewise (said) that virginity benefacere, and when it is said benefacere coniugio (that wedlock doeth well), it is melius facere uirginitatem.

glosses.latin: Mulier alligata est legi quanto tempore uir eius uiuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to (the) law of service to (the) husband.

glosses.latin: Mulier alligata est legi quanto tempore uir eius uiuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so long as the husband is alive.

glosses.latin: Beatior autem erit si síc permanserit, secundum meum consilium; puto autem quod et ego Spiritum Dei habeo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] baferr limm im[Con]murgu[/Con] buith di inógi
glosses.glossText: .i. baferr limm immurgu buith di inógi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. baferr limm immurgu buith di inógi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I had rather, however, that she were in virginity.

glosses.latin: Beatior autem erit si síc permanserit, secundum meum consilium; puto autem quod et ego Spiritum Dei habeo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] atá spirut dée indiu[Con]m[/Con]m baferr mochomairle dodénu[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. atá spirut dée indiumm baferr mochomairle dodénum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. atá spirut dée indiumm baferr mochomairle dodénum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God’s spirit is in me: it were better that my counsel should be followed.

glosses.latin: De hís autem quae idolís sacrificantur, scimus quia omnes scientiam habemus; scientia inflat, caritas uero aedificat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nant ní ídol [GLat]et[/GLat] nád nescona ní
glosses.glossText: .i. nant ní ídol et nád nescona ní
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nant ní ídol et nád nescona ní
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that an idol is naught, and that it makes nothing unclean.

glosses.latin: De hís autem quae idolís sacrificantur, scimus quia omnes scientiam habemus; scientia inflat, caritas uero aedificat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] afiussin im[Con]murgu[/Con] bamaithsón act ní bed uall and atá són and t[Con]ra[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] ní béo de
glosses.glossText: .i. afiussin immurgu bamaithsón act ní bed uall and atá són and tra et ní béo de
glosses.glossFNs: .i. afiussin immurgu bamaithsón act ní bed uall and atá són and tra et ní béo de
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that knowledge, however, were good, provided there were no pride therein. That, now, is therein, and it (knowledge) is not alive therefrom.

glosses.latin: De hís autem quae idolís sacrificantur, scimus quia omnes scientiam habemus; scientia inflat, caritas uero aedificat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] comaitecht don brathir enirt hiniriss conutuinc inniriss
glosses.glossText: .i. comaitecht don brathir enirt hiniriss conutuinc inniriss
glosses.glossFNs: .i. comaitecht don brathir enirt hiniriss conutuinc inniriss
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. indulgence to the weak brother in faith upbuilds the faith.

glosses.latin: quemadmodum oporteat eum scire.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg. inf.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] isamlid ba coir do fiuss inna nídol act ní arbarat biuth innatúari adopartar dondídol arná coscrad indeseircc ṁbráthardi [a]trifrithorcuin[/a] donbráthir hiressach as énirt menme
glosses.glossText: [in marg. inf.] .i. isamlid ba coir do fiuss inna nídol act ní arbarat biuth innatúari adopartar dondídol arná coscrad indeseircc ṁbráthardi trifrithorcuin donbráthir hiressach as énirt menme
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg. inf.] .i. isamlid ba coir do fiuss inna nídol act ní arbarat biuth innatúari adopartar dondídol arná coscrad indeseircc ṁbráthardi trifrithorcuin<sup>a</sup> donbráthir hiressach as énirt menme
footnotes: a: MS. trifithorcuin
c: This obscure marginal gloss perhaps belongs to v. 4 (De escis autem quae idolis immolantur, etc.), or to v. 13
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus that it were right for him to know the idols, provided they do not eat the meats that are offered to the idol, lest (this) should destroy the brotherly love through offence to the faithful brother who is weak of mind<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem diligit Deum, hic cognitus est ab eo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is [Res]an[/Res]d [Res]is[/Res] fius[b] dodia trichomaitect donbráthir ǽnirt
glosses.glossText: .i. is (an)d (is) fius dodia trichomaitect donbráthir ǽnirt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is (an)d (is) fius<sup>b</sup> dodia trichomaitect donbráthir ǽnirt
footnotes: b: restored after 25a 11, 25c 31: cf. is fis dún LL. 66a 32
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therein is he known to God, through indulgence to the feeble brother.

glosses.latin: Sed non in omnibus est scientia; quidam hautem in conscientia usque nunc idoli, quasi idolothitum manducant.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]In conscientia[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] énirt acocubusso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] is escon leu anadobarar do ídlaib act nosnerta insonirt doairbirt biuth inna túare sin [GLat]et[/GLat] iscu[Con]m[/Con]me doib bid idalte domeltis hóre nitrisonirti nirisse damelat
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] In conscientia .i. énirt acocubussom et is escon leu anadobarar do ídlaib act nosnerta insonirt doairbirt biuth inna túare sin et iscumme doib bid idalte domeltis hóre nitrisonirti nirisse damelat
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] In conscientia .i. énirt acocubussom et is escon leu anadobarar do ídlaib act nosnerta insonirt doairbirt biuth inna túare sin et iscumme doib bid idalte domeltis hóre nitrisonirti nirisse damelat
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. feeble is their conscience, and they deem unclean what is offered to idols; but the firm (one) encourages them to eat those meats; and it is the same to them as though they ate an idol-offering, because it is not through firmness of faith that they consume it.

glosses.latin: Sed non in omnibus est scientia; quidam hautem in conscientia usque nunc idoli, quasi idolothitum manducant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is the same to them as though it were an idol-offering.

glosses.latin: Uidete autem ne forte haec licentia uestra offendiculum fiat infirmís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]Offendiculum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] is frithorcon leu athabairt forru [vel]ɫ.[/vel] adénu[Con]m[/Con] fiadib
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Offendiculum .i. is frithorcon leu athabairt forru ɫ. adénum fiadib
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Offendiculum .i. is frithorcon leu athabairt forru ɫ. adénum fiadib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they deem it an offence to force them to it or to do it before them.

glosses.latin: recumbentem, nonne conscientia eius, cum sit infirma, aedificabitur ad manducandum idolothita?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he eats what is on the altar of the idol.

glosses.latin: recumbentem, nonne conscientia eius, cum sit infirma, aedificabitur ad manducandum idolothita?
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: recumbentem, nonne conscientia eius, cum sit infirma, aedificabitur ad manducandum idolothita?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. conscientious.

glosses.latin: recumbentem, nonne conscientia eius, cum sit infirma, aedificabitur ad manducandum idolothita?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: recumbentem, nonne conscientia eius, cum sit infirma, aedificabitur ad manducandum idolothita?
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] nertfidir [GLat]nonné dicet manducabo idolathitum dum illud manducat qui est melior mé[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. nertfidir nonné dicet manducabo idolathitum dum illud manducat qui est melior mé
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. nertfidir nonné dicet manducabo idolathitum dum illud manducat qui est melior mé
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be encouraged.

glosses.latin: Et peribit infirmus in tua conscientia frater, propter quem Christus mortuus est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] babecc duitsiu cometecht dosso[Con]m[/Con] isairiso[Con]m[/Con] rocéss cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. babecc duitsiu cometecht dossom isairisom rocéss crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. babecc duitsiu cometecht dossom isairisom rocéss crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were little for you to be indulgent to him: it is for him that Christ hath suffered.

glosses.latin: Síc autem peccantes in fratres, et percutientes conscientiam eorum infirmam, in Christo peccatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre rombebe cr[Con]ist[/Con] darcenn indóesa lobuir [GLat]et[/GLat] itbóill docr[Con]ist[/Con] iaru[Con]m[/Con] intimmormus dognither friuso[Con]m[/Con] isfricr[Con]ist[/Con] dogníther
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre rombebe crist darcenn indóesa lobuir et itbóill docrist iarum intimmormus dognither friusom isfricrist dogníther
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre rombebe crist darcenn indóesa lobuir et itbóill docrist iarum intimmormus dognither friusom isfricrist dogníther
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since Christ has died for sake of the feeble folk, and they, then, are members of Christ’s, the sin that is committed against them, is committed against Christ.

glosses.latin: Síc autem peccantes in fratres, et percutientes conscientiam eorum infirmam, in Christo peccatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is amal bid fri cr[Con]ist[/Con] frisorthe
glosses.glossText: .i. is amal bid fri crist frisorthe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is amal bid fri crist frisorthe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is as though ye offended against Christ.

glosses.latin: Quapropter si esca scandalizat fratrem meum, non manducabo carnem in aeternum, ne fratrem meum scandalizem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore isimmarmus hí cr[Con]ist[/Con] anas olcc lasin brathir [ie].i.[/ie] maimfolṅgi díltud dunbráthir
glosses.glossText: .i. hore isimmarmus hí crist anas olcc lasin brathir .i. maimfolṅgi díltud dunbráthir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore isimmarmus hí crist anas olcc lasin brathir .i. maimfolṅgi díltud dunbráthir
footnotes: e: lit. ‘denial,’ ‘refusal’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because what seems evil to the brother is a sin in Christ, that is, if it causes scandal<sup>e</sup> to the brother.

glosses.latin: Quapropter si esca scandalizat fratrem meum, non manducabo carnem in aeternum, ne fratrem meum scandalizem.
footnotes: b: leg. arnarimfolṅga ‘that it may not cause’? J. S.; Thurneysen KZ. xxxvii. 105 would take the word as deponent ‘that I may not cause’
e: lit. ‘denial,’ ‘refusal’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest I should scandalize (him), i.e. lest scandal<sup>e</sup> be caused to him.

glosses.latin: Non sum liber? non sum apostolus? Nonne Iesum Christum Dominum [nostrum] uidi? Nonne opus meum uos estis in Domino?
glosses.glossTrans: is not?

glosses.latin: Non sum liber? non sum apostolus? Nonne Iesum Christum Dominum [nostrum] uidi? Nonne opus meum uos estis in Domino?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore amabstal [GLat]et[/GLat] amforcitlid dochách cainipsa sóir cedugnén cachṅgním
glosses.glossText: .i. hore amabstal et amforcitlid dochách cainipsa sóir cedugnén cachṅgním
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore amabstal et amforcitlid dochách cainipsa sóir cedugnén cachṅgním
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since I am an apostle and I am a teacher to every one, should I not be free though I did every deed?

glosses.latin: Non sum liber? non sum apostolus? Nonne Iesum Christum Dominum [nostrum] uidi? Nonne opus meum uos estis in Domino?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. good is my soul-friend.

glosses.latin: Non sum liber? non sum apostolus? Nonne Iesum Christum Dominum [nostrum] uidi? Nonne opus meum uos estis in Domino?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ó corinti[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] cani messe immoforling cretim dúibsi [GLat]in domino[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ó corinti .i. cani messe immoforling cretim dúibsi in domino
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ó corinti .i. cani messe immoforling cretim dúibsi in domino
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it not I that have caused belief to you in Domino?

glosses.latin: nam signaculum apostolatus mei uos estis in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: nam signaculum apostolatus mei uos estis in Domino.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indaapstal apho[Res]pui[/Res]l décce lat corintiu [GLat]et[/GLat] genti canirochretset isgním abstil ǽm immidforlingsón [GLat]et[/GLat] is messe rophroidech doib
glosses.glossText: .i. indaapstal apho(pui)l décce lat corintiu et genti canirochretset isgním abstil ǽm immidforlingsón et is messe rophroidech doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indaapstal apho(pui)l décce lat corintiu et genti canirochretset isgním abstil ǽm immidforlingsón et is messe rophroidech doib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. am I an apostle, O people? Look thou at (the) Corinthians and Gentiles; have not they believed? Truly it is an apostle’s work that has caused that, and it is I who have preached to them.

glosses.latin: Numquid non habemus potestatem manducandi et bibendi?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] batorad [c]saithir[/c] dúun inchrudso cedumelmis cechtuari [GLat]et[/GLat] cedugnemmis andugniat ar céli act ní bad nertad nambraithre [GLat]et[/GLat] frescsiu fogchricce[d] asmóo
glosses.glossText: .i. batorad saithir dúun inchrudso cedumelmis cechtuari et cedugnemmis andugniat ar céli act ní bad nertad nambraithre et frescsiu fogchricce asmóo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. batorad saithirc dúun inchrudso cedumelmis cechtuari et cedugnemmis andugniat ar céli act ní bad nertad nambraithre et frescsiu fogchricced asmóo
footnotes: c: MS. sathir
d: for fochrícce
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were a fruit of our labour in this wise, if we consumed every food and if we did what our fellows do; but it would not be a strengthening of the brethren and a hope of a greater reward.

glosses.latin: Numquid non habemns [potestatem] mulierem sororem circumducendi?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bete banscala occar timthirect nidunachoipred ailiu im[Con]murgu[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. bete banscala occar timthirect nidunachoipred ailiu immurgu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bete banscala occar timthirect nidunachoipred ailiu immurgu
footnotes: f: in sensu obscaeno: cf. oc ind oipred Sg. 190b 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that there should be females attending us; not, however, for any other operation<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Aut solus ego, et Barnabas, non habemus potestatem hoc operandi?
footnotes: a: MS. saidóire
b: For this idiom cf. Cymr. brodyrion ym ni ar gwr y buost neithwyr yn y ty , The Red Book, p. 203, and see Kuhn u. Schleicher Beitr. II. 375, KZ. xxxii. 153
glosses.glossTrans: i.e is it likely that it should be a special slavery for me and Barnabas?

glosses.latin: Aut solus ego, et Barnabas, non habemus potestatem hoc operandi?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] atrede asrubart anúas amae attá linn [GLat]potestas[/GLat] ar [GLat]quis militat[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. atrede asrubart anúas amae attá linn potestas ar quis militat
glosses.glossFNs: .i. atrede asrubart anúas amae attá linn potestas ar quis militat
footnotes: g: eating, drinking , and leading about a ‘sister’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the three thingsg which he has mentioned above. Surely we have potestas, for quis militat (without his pay)?

glosses.latin: Quis militat sine suís stipendís? ... Quis pascit gregem, et de lacte gregis non manducat?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quis militat sine suís stipendís? ... Quis pascit gregem, et de lacte gregis non manducat?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it (feeding a flock) were a labour to him though he consume it (the milk).

glosses.latin: Numquid secundum hominem haec dico? Án et lex haec non dicit?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] it dóindi t[Con]ra[/Con] [GLat]haec exempla[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]non carnalia et non secundum hominem dico sed secundum spiritalem sensum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non per hominem sed per iesum christum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. it dóindi tra haec exempla ɫ. non carnalia et non secundum hominem dico sed secundum spiritalem sensum .i. non per hominem sed per iesum christum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. it dóindi tra haec exempla ɫ. non carnalia et non secundum hominem dico sed secundum spiritalem sensum .i. non per hominem sed per iesum christum
footnotes: h: i.e. after the manner of men
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. humanh then are haec exempla.

glosses.latin: Numquid secundum hominem haec dico? Án et lex haec non dicit?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. does it not say it? Nay, it saith it.

glosses.latin: Non alligabis ós boui trituranti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dofuáircc [ie].i.[/ie] arisbés leoso[Con]m[/Con] indaim dothúarcuin indarbe[c]
glosses.glossText: .i. dofuáircc .i. arisbés leosom indaim dothúarcuin indarbe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dofuáircc .i. arisbés leosom indaim dothúarcuin indarbe<sup>c</sup>
footnotes: c: indarbe a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which treads out, i.e. for it is a custom among them (for) the oxen to tread out the corn.

glosses.latin: Án propter nós hoc dicit? Nam propter nos scripta sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ba dochu són [ie].i.[/ie] is [d]snisni[/d] ata [GLat]bobes qui aramus terram cordium hominum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ba dochu són .i. is snisni ata bobes qui aramus terram cordium hominum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ba dochu són .i. is snisnid ata bobes qui aramus terram cordium hominum
footnotes: d: MS. snissi: cf. supra p. 313, note a
i: Cf. Secundinus’ hymn, The Irish Liber Hymnorum, i. 12: ‘quorumque corda ac mentes Sancto arat Spiritu’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that were likelier, i.e. it is we who are boues qui, etc.i

glosses.latin: Án propter nós hoc dicit? Nam propter nos scripta sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quae dicit léx non alligabis[/GLat][e] [etc]rl.[/etc] [ie].i.[/ie] ní dondaum storidiu actis dínni p[Con]re[/Con]ceptorib aris díin asrobrad andedeso [GLat]quoniam in spé[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. quae dicit léx non alligabis rl. .i. ní dondaum storidiu actis dínni preceptorib aris díin asrobrad andedeso quoniam in spé rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. quae dicit léx non alligabise rl. .i. ní dondaum storidiu actis dínni preceptorib aris díin asrobrad andedeso quoniam in spé rl.
footnotes: e: Deut. xxv. 4
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not of the natural ox, but of us preachers; for it is of us these two things have been said, quoniam etc.

glosses.latin: Si nos uobís spiritalia seminauimus, magnum est si [nos] uestra carnalia metamus?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if we have preached.

glosses.latin: Si nos uobís spiritalia seminauimus, magnum est si [nos] uestra carnalia metamus?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it much? that is, is it too much?

glosses.latin: Si nos uobís spiritalia seminauimus, magnum est si [nos] uestra carnalia metamus?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní dúibsi is sóibud [GLat]spiritalia[/GLat] uainni dúibsi [GLat]et carnalia[/GLat] uáibsi dúnni
glosses.glossText: .i. ní dúibsi is sóibud spiritalia uainni dúibsi et carnalia uáibsi dúnni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní dúibsi is sóibud spiritalia uainni dúibsi et carnalia uáibsi dúnni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not imposition to you: spiritualia (given) by us to you and carnalia by you to us.

glosses.latin: Si alii potestatis uestrae participes sunt, quare non potius nos?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. were it not juster to give it to us?

glosses.latin: Sed non usi sumus hac potestate; sed omnia sustinemus, ne quod offendiculum demus euangelio Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arná érbarthar isp[Con]re[/Con]cept arbiad na[Con]m[/Con]má [GLat]et[/GLat] arnadergaba línn cretmech [GLat]et[/GLat] arṅ dom roibse fochricc
glosses.glossText: .i. arná érbarthar isprecept arbiad nammá et arnadergaba línn cretmech et arṅ dom roibse fochricc
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arná érbarthar isprecept arbiad nammá et arnadergaba línn cretmech et arṅ dom roibse fochricc
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it may not be said, it is teaching for food only, and that it may not diminish the multitude of believers, and that I may have a reward.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam qui in sacrario operantur quae de sacrario sunt, aedunt; et qui altario deseruiunt, cum altario participantur?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cosmuilius aile lesso[Con]m[/Con] inso ba ṅdílmain dosso[Con]m[/Con] airbert biuth dithorud ap[Con]re[/Con]cepte
glosses.glossText: .i. cosmuilius aile lessom inso ba ṅdílmain dossom airbert biuth dithorud aprecepte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cosmuilius aile lessom inso ba ṅdílmain dossom airbert biuth dithorud aprecepte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this (is) another simile which he has: to shew that he were free to eat of the fruit of his teaching.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam qui in sacrario operantur quae de sacrario sunt, aedunt; et qui altario deseruiunt, cum altario participantur?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] locc imbítis p[Con]ri[/Con]msacairt ocirnigdi [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]inter sancta sanctorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. locc imbítis primsacairt ocirnigdi .i. inter sancta sanctorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. locc imbítis primsacairt ocirnigdi .i. inter sancta sanctorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a place wherein the chief-priests used to be a-praying.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam qui in sacrario operantur quae de sacrario sunt, aedunt; et qui altario deseruiunt, cum altario participantur?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dlíged sacairt itempul is doib doberthe
glosses.glossText: .i. dlíged sacairt itempul is doib doberthe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dlíged sacairt itempul is doib doberthe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a priest’s right in the temple, it is to them it used to be given.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam qui in sacrario operantur quae de sacrario sunt, aedunt; et qui altario deseruiunt, cum altario participantur?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ithé són leuiti olchene nobítis octimthirecht innanidbart
glosses.glossText: .i. ithé són leuiti olchene nobítis octimthirecht innanidbart
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ithé són leuiti olchene nobítis octimthirecht innanidbart
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. those are the Levites besides who used to be attending to the offerings.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quoniam qui in sacrario operantur quae de sacrario sunt, aedunt; et qui altario deseruiunt, cum altario participantur?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rann do loscud foraltóir [GLat]et[/GLat] rann aile doairbirt bith doibso[Con]m[/Con] ar ished roerbad friatoschid
glosses.glossText: .i. rann do loscud foraltóir et rann aile doairbirt bith doibsom ar ished roerbad friatoschid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rann do loscud foraltóir et rann aile doairbirt bith doibsom ar ished roerbad friatoschid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a part to be burnt on the altar and another part to be eaten by them, for this has been devoted for their sustenance.

glosses.latin: Ita et Dominus ordinauit hís qui euangelium annuntiant, de euangelio uiuere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] rombói andlíged sin ifetarlicci atá anísiu ínúiethnissiu
glosses.glossText: .i. amal rombói andlíged sin ifetarlicci atá anísiu ínúiethnissiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal rombói andlíged sin ifetarlicci atá anísiu ínúiethnissiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as that right has been in (the) Old Law, this is in (the) New Testament.

glosses.latin: Ego autem nullo horum usus sum .... bonum est mihi magis mori quam ut gloriam meam quis euacuet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. honorum which are given for teaching the gospel.

glosses.latin: Ego autem nullo horum usus sum .... bonum est mihi magis mori quam ut gloriam meam quis euacuet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the glory which will be given to me in heaven.

glosses.latin: Ego autem nullo horum usus sum .... bonum est mihi magis mori quam ut gloriam meam quis euacuet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. by giving me pay for my teaching.

glosses.latin: Nam si euangelizauero, non est mihi gloria, necessitas mihi incumbit; uae enim mihi est, si non euangelizauero!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] madarlóg p[Con]ri[/Con]dchasa [ie].i.[/ie] armetiuth [GLat]et[/GLat] mothoschith nímbia fochricc dar hési mop[Con]re[/Con]cepte
glosses.glossText: .i. madarlóg pridchasa .i. armetiuth et mothoschith nímbia fochricc dar hési moprecepte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. madarlóg pridchasa .i. armetiuth et mothoschith nímbia fochricc dar hési moprecepte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if I preach for pay, that is, for my raiment and my sustenance, I shall not have a reward for my teaching.

glosses.latin: Nam si euangelizauero, non est mihi gloria, necessitas mihi incumbit; uae enim mihi est, si non euangelizauero!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issumecen p[Con]re[/Con]cept armetiuth [GLat]et[/GLat] mothoschid manip[Con]ri[/Con]dag atbél arócht [GLat]et[/GLat] gorti
glosses.glossText: .i. issumecen precept armetiuth et mothoschid manipridag atbél arócht et gorti
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issumecen precept armetiuth et mothoschid manipridag atbél arócht et gorti
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is necessary for me to teach for my raiment and my sustenance: unless I preach I shall perish of cold and hunger.

glosses.latin: Nam si euangelizauero, non est mihi gloria, necessitas mihi incumbit; uae enim mihi est, si non euangelizauero!
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]nisi adnuntiaueris iniquo iniquitatem suam[/GLat][a] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] bith moircc domsa arócht [GLat]et[/GLat] gorti manip[Con]ri[/Con]dach
glosses.glossText: nisi adnuntiaueris iniquo iniquitatem suam ɫ. bith moircc domsa arócht et gorti manipridach
glosses.glossFNs: nisi adnuntiaueris iniquo iniquitatem suama ɫ. bith moircc domsa arócht et gorti manipridach
footnotes: a: Ezek. xxxiii. 9
glosses.glossTrans: it will be woe to me from cold and hunger unless I preach.

glosses.latin: Si enim uolens hoc ago, mercedem habeo: si autem inuitus, dispensatio mihi credita est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is desire that drives me to it: if it is not for pay.

glosses.latin: Si enim uolens hoc ago, mercedem habeo: si autem inuitus, dispensatio mihi credita est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iscennach so[Con]m[/Con] madarlóg p[Con]ri[/Con]dchidir [ie].i.[/ie] is hed roerpad do[Con]m[/Con] domthoschid
glosses.glossText: .i. iscennach som madarlóg pridchidir .i. is hed roerpad dom domthoschid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iscennach som madarlóg pridchidir .i. is hed roerpad dom domthoschid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a bargain if there be preaching for pay, i.e. this has been entrusted to me for my sustenance.

glosses.latin: Quae est ergo mercis mea? Ut euangelium praedicans, sine sumptu ponam euangelium, ut non abutar potestate mea in euangelio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is that which gives a reward to me?

glosses.latin: Quae est ergo mercis mea? Ut euangelium praedicans, sine sumptu ponam euangelium, ut non abutar potestate mea in euangelio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without pay.

glosses.latin: Quae est ergo mercis mea? Ut euangelium praedicans, sine sumptu ponam euangelium, ut non abutar potestate mea in euangelio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it be sine sumptu.

glosses.latin: Quae est ergo mercis mea? Ut euangelium praedicans, sine sumptu ponam euangelium, ut non abutar potestate mea in euangelio.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] airitiu lóge armop[Con]re[/Con]cept arbói són [GLat]in potestate mea[/GLat] madagnenn
glosses.glossText: .i. airitiu lóge armoprecept arbói són in potestate mea madagnenn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. airitiu lóge armoprecept arbói són in potestate mea madagnenn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to receive pay for my teaching, for that were in potestate mea, if I should do it.

glosses.latin: omnium me seruum feci, ut plures lucrificarem.
footnotes: b: MS. oprecept
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. teaching every one sine uitio.

glosses.latin: omnium me seruum feci, ut plures lucrificarem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] comtis indbaid iniris [vel]ɫ.[/vel] co[Con]m[/Con]betis inindiub fochricce do[Con]m[/Con]sa
glosses.glossText: .i. comtis indbaid iniris ɫ. combetis inindiub fochricce domsa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. comtis indbaid iniris ɫ. combetis inindiub fochricce domsa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they might be rich in faith, or so that they might be in gain of (the) reward to me.

glosses.latin: Et factus sum Iudeus tanquam Iudeus ... , hís qui sub lege sunt, quasi sub lege essem, cum ipse sub lege non essem, ut eos qui sub lege erant, lucrificarem. Hís qui sine lege erant, tamquam sine lege essem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in circumcisione discipuli[/GLat][c] [ie].i.[/ie] basa iudide ó écosc
glosses.glossText: .i. in circumcisione discipuli .i. basa iudide ó écosc
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in circumcisione discipulic .i. basa iudide ó écosc
footnotes: c: Acts xvi. 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I was a Jew in appearance.

glosses.latin: Et factus sum Iudeus tanquam Iudeus ... , hís qui sub lege sunt, quasi sub lege essem, cum ipse sub lege non essem, ut eos qui sub lege erant, lucrificarem. Hís qui sine lege erant, tamquam sine lege essem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et factus sum Iudeus tanquam Iudeus ... , hís qui sub lege sunt, quasi sub lege essem, cum ipse sub lege non essem, ut eos qui sub lege erant, lucrificarem. Hís qui sine lege erant, tamquam sine lege essem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I was not a Jew in customs.

glosses.latin: Et factus sum Iudeus tanquam Iudeus ... , hís qui sub lege sunt, quasi sub lege essem, cum ipse sub lege non essem, ut eos qui sub lege erant, lucrificarem. Hís qui sine lege erant, tamquam sine lege essem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that I might bring them unto faith.

glosses.latin: Et factus sum Iudeus tanquam Iudeus ... , hís qui sub lege sunt, quasi sub lege essem, cum ipse sub lege non essem, ut eos qui sub lege erant, lucrificarem. Hís qui sine lege erant, tamquam sine lege essem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal donuic testimni ó altorib innanídol dothaidbsiu indæe infolngithi[d] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ueri dei ut dixit uidi áram in qua scriptum erat ignóto deo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal donuic testimni ó altorib innanídol dothaidbsiu indæe infolngithi .i. ueri dei ut dixit uidi áram in qua scriptum erat ignóto deo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal donuic testimni ó altorib innanídol dothaidbsiu indæe infolngithid .i. ueri dei ut dixit uidi áram in qua scriptum erat ignóto deo
footnotes: d: = infolgithi, cf. Wb. 21c 22, Ml. 51d 8
f: Acts xvii. 23
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as he has brought testimonies from the altars of the idols to manifest the hidden God<sup>f</sup>

glosses.latin: Factus sum infirmis infirmus, ut infirmos lucrificarem: omnibus omnia factus sum, ut omnes facerem saluos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through indulgence to them.

glosses.latin: Factus sum infirmis infirmus, ut infirmos lucrificarem: omnibus omnia factus sum, ut omnes facerem saluos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for this I have been omnia in omnibus.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quod hii qui in stadio currunt, omnes quidem currunt, sed unus accipit  bradium? Síc currite ut omnes conprehendatis.
footnotes: e: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: in a race.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quod hii qui in stadio currunt, omnes quidem currunt, sed unus accipit  bradium? Síc currite ut omnes conprehendatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rethit huili [GLat]et[/GLat] isóinfer gaibes buáid diib innachomalnad
glosses.glossText: .i. rethit huili et isóinfer gaibes buáid diib innachomalnad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rethit huili et isóinfer gaibes buáid diib innachomalnad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all run, and it is one man of them that gets victory for completing it.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quod hii qui in stadio currunt, omnes quidem currunt, sed unus accipit  bradium? Síc currite ut omnes conprehendatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] lann segar and issi ede dulchinne inmílti
glosses.glossText: .i. lann segar and issi ede dulchinne inmílti
glosses.glossFNs: .i. lann segar and issi ede dulchinne inmílti
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the crown which is sought therein, is the remuneration of the soldier’s service.

glosses.latin: Nescitis quod hii qui in stadio currunt, omnes quidem currunt, sed unus accipit  bradium? Síc currite ut omnes conprehendatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]non priuabitur quisque suo labore[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ní ba [GLat]unus[/GLat] gebas ambuáid huáibsi
glosses.glossText: non priuabitur quisque suo labore .i. ní ba unus gebas ambuáid huáibsi
glosses.glossFNs: non priuabitur quisque suo labore .i. ní ba unus gebas ambuáid huáibsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be (merely) unus of you that will gain the victory.

glosses.latin: Omnis autem, qui in agone contendit, ab omnibus sé abstinet; et illi quidem, ut corruptibilem coronam accipiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that he might be the readier for the victory.

glosses.latin: Omnis autem, qui in agone contendit, ab omnibus sé abstinet; et illi quidem, ut corruptibilem coronam accipiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the crown.

glosses.latin: Omnis autem, qui in agone contendit, ab omnibus sé abstinet; et illi quidem, ut corruptibilem coronam accipiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. little is the value for which that labour is performed.

glosses.latin: Ego igitur síc curro, non quasi in incertum. Síc pugno, non quasi aërem uerberans.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isglé limsa ro[Con]m[/Con]bia buáid is[GLat]incertum[/GLat] im[Con]murgu[/Con] ambuáid inna[Con]m[/Con]míled talmande hore as ṅ [GLat]unus accipit palmam[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isglé limsa rombia buáid isincertum immurgu ambuáid innammíled talmande hore as ṅ unus accipit palmam
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isglé limsa rombia buáid isincertum immurgu ambuáid innammíled talmande hore as ṅ unus accipit palmam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is clear to me that I shall have victory: incertum, however, is the victory of the earthly soldiers, because it is (only) unus accipit palmam.

glosses.latin: Ego igitur síc curro, non quasi in incertum. Síc pugno, non quasi aërem uerberans.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non ut illi[/GLat] ní am[Con]al[/Con] inní asóircc [ie].i.[/ie] nifás asaithar dogniusa
glosses.glossText: .i. non ut illi ní amal inní asóircc .i. nifás asaithar dogniusa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. non ut illi ní amal inní asóircc .i. nifás asaithar dogniusa
glosses.glossTrans: not like him who beats (the air), that is, not void is the labour which I perform.

glosses.latin: Sed castigo corpus meum, et in seruitutem redigo. ne forte, cum aliis praedicauerim, ipse reprobus efficiar.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through teaching and not accepting pay.

glosses.latin: Sed castigo corpus meum, et in seruitutem redigo. ne forte, cum aliis praedicauerim, ipse reprobus efficiar.
glosses.glossTrans: to fulfil the gospel.

glosses.latin: Sed castigo corpus meum, et in seruitutem redigo. ne forte, cum aliis praedicauerim, ipse reprobus efficiar.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I myself.

glosses.latin: Sed castigo corpus meum, et in seruitutem redigo. ne forte, cum aliis praedicauerim, ipse reprobus efficiar.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so as not to fulfil that which I preach.

glosses.latin: Nolo enim uos ignorare, fratres.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tomad t[Con]ra[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] faitgugud anisiu arna imromastar néch
glosses.glossText: .i. tomad tra et faitgugud anisiu arna imromastar néch
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tomad tra et faitgugud anisiu arna imromastar néch
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a threatening, then, and a cautioning (is) this, lest any one should sin.

glosses.latin: bibebant autem de spiritali, consequenti eos, petra: petra autem erat Christus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] an ail innandead [vel]ɫ.[/vel] intuisq[Con]ue[/Con] iarsinganim [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ishé cr[Con]ist[/Con] rogenir [GLat]post[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. an ail innandead ɫ. intuisque iarsinganim ɫ. ishé crist rogenir post
glosses.glossFNs: .i. an ail innandead ɫ. intuisque iarsinganim ɫ. ishé crist rogenir post
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their rock behind them: or the water along the sand: or it is Christ who was born post.

glosses.latin: bibebant autem de spiritali, consequenti eos, petra: petra autem erat Christus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he declares the meaning of it in this.

glosses.latin: bibebant autem de spiritali, consequenti eos, petra: petra autem erat Christus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] C[Con]ei[/Con]st cid armbad [GLat]spiritalis[/GLat] indail. ni[Con]anse[/Con] [GLat]eo quod figurat christum lapidem ángularem[/GLat] isiede indail rúnde asatoróimed asrúaim mór iudforcitil spirdáldi arrodibaid ítith indisrahel spiurdalti innanóib indiththrub in beotho ocascnam tíre tairṅgiri innambéo
