glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Ceist cid armbad spiritalis indail. nianse eo quod figurat christum lapidem ángularem isiede indail rúnde asatoróimed asrúaim mór iudforcitil spirdáldi arrodibaid ítith indisrahel spiurdalti innanóib indiththrub in beotho ocascnam tíre tairṅgiri innambéo
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Ceist cid armbad spiritalis indail. nianse eo quod figurat christum lapidem ángularem isiede indail rúnde asatoróimed asrúaim mór iudforcitil spirdáldi arrodibaid ítith indisrahel spiurdalti innanóib indiththrub in beotho ocascnam tíre tairṅgiri innambéo
glosses.glossTrans: Question, why should the rock be spiritualis? Easy (to answer): eo quod etc. this is the mystical rock out of which has broken the mighty stream of spiritual doctrine, which has quenched the thirst of the spiritual Israel of the saints in the desert of Life, journeying to the Land of Promise of the Living.

glosses.latin: Sed non in pluribus eorum bene placitum est Deo, nam prostrati sunt in deserto.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though God has done much of good for them.

glosses.latin: Sed non in pluribus eorum bene placitum est Deo, nam prostrati sunt in deserto.
footnotes: a: i.e. they were not all elect
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are not all who have been elect<sup>a</sup>.

glosses.latin: Sed non in pluribus eorum bene placitum est Deo, nam prostrati sunt in deserto.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] docoith dígal forru matis tuicsi ní rígad
glosses.glossText: .i. docoith dígal forru matis tuicsi ní rígad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. docoith dígal forru matis tuicsi ní rígad
footnotes: b: lit. went
c: lit. gone
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. vengeance fell<sup>b</sup> upon them: if they had been elect it would not have fallen<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Neque idolatriae efficiamini, sicut quidam ex ipsís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all filii Israhel have not been evil.

glosses.latin: Neque tentemus Christum, sicut quidam eorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we should pray for nothing that is opposed to our salvation.

glosses.latin: quidam eorum mormorauerunt, et perierunt ab exterminatore.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] fridia [GLat]et moysi et aarón ut melius nobis seruire in ægipto quam mori in hoc deserto[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. fridia et moysi et aarón ut melius nobis seruire in ægipto quam mori in hoc deserto
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fridia et moysi et aarón ut melius nobis seruire in ægipto quam mori in hoc deserto
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. against God and Moses etc.

glosses.latin: quidam eorum mormorauerunt, et perierunt ab exterminatore.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for their murmuring.

glosses.latin: quidam eorum mormorauerunt, et perierunt ab exterminatore.
footnotes: a: for for-da-ror-cenn, where da is the infixed pron. of pl. 3, and ror is = Gr. προπρό, Skr. prapra: the verb is forcennaim. W. S. Cf. Trans. Philolog. Soc. 1895–98, p. 179 and Sarauw, Irske Studier, 56, J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who exterminated them in uindicta.

glosses.latin: Haec autem omnia in figura contingebant illis: scripta
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. mirabilia which God has wrought for (the) Children of Israel.

glosses.latin: Haec autem omnia in figura contingebant illis: scripta
footnotes: e: ‘their deprivation of them is transitory’? J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is vain to take them from them<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: sunt autem ad correptionem nostram, in quos finis seculorum deuenit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] innahí dorigeni día armaccu isr[Con]ahe[/Con]l [GLat]et[/GLat] na hí dorigénsatsom
glosses.glossText: .i. innahí dorigeni día armaccu israhel et na hí dorigénsatsom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. innahí dorigeni día armaccu israhel et na hí dorigénsatsom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the things that God has done for the Children of Israel and the things which they have done.

glosses.latin: sunt autem ad correptionem nostram, in quos finis seculorum deuenit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for our admonition.

glosses.latin: sunt autem ad correptionem nostram, in quos finis seculorum deuenit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg. sup.[/Com] isindcinn[b] ... chumme [GLat]et[/GLat] iniairch ... [GLat]perfectio detur[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg. sup.] isindcinn ... chumme et iniairch ... perfectio detur
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg. sup.] isindcinnb ... chumme et iniairch ... perfectio detur
footnotes: b: So Zimmer. W. S. could not read this with any certainty. Perhaps it should be isindforciunn ... et ní inairchiunn W. S.

glosses.latin: Itaque qui sé existemat stare uideat ne cadat.
footnotes: c: So Zimmer, Supplementum, p. 6. W. S. did not see this gloss, which should be fomnad
glosses.glossTrans: let him beware.

glosses.latin: Temptatio nos non adprehendat nisi humana .... faciet etiam cum temptatione prouentum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not a suffering that ye could not endure.

glosses.latin: Temptatio nos non adprehendat nisi humana .... faciet etiam cum temptatione prouentum.
footnotes: d: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: profit or increase.

glosses.latin: Propter quod, carissimi mihi, fugite ab idolorum cultura.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nobsóirfasi dia dinab fochidib bíith da[Con]no[/Con] farcuitsi occa
glosses.glossText: .i. nobsóirfasi dia dinab fochidib bíith dano farcuitsi occa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nobsóirfasi dia dinab fochidib bíith dano farcuitsi occa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God will liberate you from the sufferings: let then your part be in it<sup>f</sup> (the liberation).

glosses.latin: Propter quod, carissimi mihi, fugite ab idolorum cultura.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issí t[Con]ra[/Con] [GLat]temptatio homana[/GLat] asrubart túas freccor céil ídol [GLat]et[/GLat] accobor á túare
glosses.glossText: .i. issí tra temptatio homana asrubart túas freccor céil ídol et accobor á túare
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issí tra temptatio homana asrubart túas freccor céil ídol et accobor á túare
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, then, is the temptatio humana which he had mentioned above, cultus of idols and desire of their food.

glosses.latin: Ut prudentibus loquor; uos [ipsi] iudicate quod dico.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isbées t[Con]ra[/Con] donaib dagforcitlidib molad ingni innanétside aracarat anrochlúinetar
glosses.glossText: .i. isbées tra donaib dagforcitlidib molad ingni innanétside aracarat anrochlúinetar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isbées tra donaib dagforcitlidib molad ingni innanétside aracarat anrochlúinetar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a custom, then, of good teachers to praise the understanding of the hearers that they may love what they hear.

glosses.latin: Calix benedictionis, cui benedicimus, nonne communicatio sanguinis Christi est?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it blesses us.

glosses.latin: Quoniam unus panis, unum corpus multi sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that bread.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo? dico quod idolís immolatum sit aliquid, aut quod idolum sit aliquid?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the idol cannot pollute it.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo? dico quod idolís immolatum sit aliquid, aut quod idolum sit aliquid?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it is anything.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo? dico quod idolís immolatum sit aliquid, aut quod idolum sit aliquid?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the idol, then, is not anything.

glosses.latin: Nolo autem uos socios fieri demoniorum.  Non potestis calicem Domini bibere et calicem daemoniorum bibere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] trithomailt neich adobarar doib [GLat]eo quod demonís immolat[/GLat].
glosses.glossText: .i. trithomailt neich adobarar doib eo quod demonís immolat.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. trithomailt neich adobarar doib eo quod demonís immolat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through consuming aught that is offered to them, eo quod, etc.

glosses.latin: Nolo autem uos socios fieri demoniorum.  Non potestis calicem Domini bibere et calicem daemoniorum bibere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which is filled full of wine on an altar of demons.

glosses.latin: Non potestis mensae Domini participes esse et mensae demoniorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in partaking of Christ’s Body.

glosses.latin: Non potestis mensae Domini participes esse et mensae demoniorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ocairbirt biuth neich adoparar do ídlib
glosses.glossText: .i. ocairbirt biuth neich adoparar do ídlib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ocairbirt biuth neich adoparar do ídlib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in partaking of what is offered to idols.

glosses.latin: Án aemulamur Dominum? Numquid fortiores illo sumus? Omnia [mihi] licent, sed non omnia expediunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. do we imitate?

glosses.latin: Án aemulamur Dominum? Numquid fortiores illo sumus? Omnia [mihi] licent, sed non omnia expediunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] coforchongra[Con]m[/Con]ni[b] [GLat]manducare idolo[Con]thyta[/Con] quae ipse non imperauit[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. coforchongramni manducare idolothyta quae ipse non imperauit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. coforchongramnib manducare idolothyta quae ipse non imperauit
footnotes: b: one would expect forcon- without aspiration
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we should order manducare etc.

glosses.latin: Án aemulamur Dominum? Numquid fortiores illo sumus? Omnia [mihi] licent, sed non omnia expediunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in God’s will.

glosses.latin: Án aemulamur Dominum? Numquid fortiores illo sumus? Omnia [mihi] licent, sed non omnia expediunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nitattorbi fritoil dée is diliu lemm didiu aní astorbæ oldaas aní as dílmain
glosses.glossText: .i. nitattorbi fritoil dée is diliu lemm didiu aní astorbæ oldaas aní as dílmain
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nitattorbi fritoil dée is diliu lemm didiu aní astorbæ oldaas aní as dílmain
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are not profitable against God’s will: dearer to me, then, is that which is profitable than that which is lawful.

glosses.latin: Nemo quod suum est querat, sed quod alterius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nacuinged athoil fessin [ie].i.[/ie] cid tol dó airbert biuth innatúare nach thoi[Con]m[/Con]led arna tarta amiris [GLat]et[/GLat] frithorcuin dondlobur hiressach
glosses.glossText: .i. nacuinged athoil fessin .i. cid tol dó airbert biuth innatúare nach thoimled arna tarta amiris et frithorcuin dondlobur hiressach
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nacuinged athoil fessin .i. cid tol dó airbert biuth innatúare nach thoimled arna tarta amiris et frithorcuin dondlobur hiressach
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him not seek his own desire, that is, though he have a desire to partake of the foods let him not so partake lest he bring unfaith and offence to the weak believer.

glosses.latin: Omne quod uenit in macello manducate, nihil interrogantes propter conscientiam.
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Omne quod uenit in macello manducate, nihil interrogantes propter conscientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is free to you.

glosses.latin: Omne quod uenit in macello manducate, nihil interrogantes propter conscientiam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni áil dúib áiarfigid arnarala forcubus áiri
glosses.glossText: .i. ni áil dúib áiarfigid arnarala forcubus áiri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni áil dúib áiarfigid arnarala forcubus áiri
footnotes: e: The idiom is obscure; for seems to be the preposition as in Wb. 30a 16
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not proper for you to ask it, lest your conscience should suffer<sup>e</sup> because of it(?).

glosses.latin: Si quis uocat uos infidelium et uultis ire.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] maadced torbe innathect[d] [ie].i.[/ie] torbe athabarte dochu[Con]m[/Con] nirisse
glosses.glossText: .i. maadced torbe innathect .i. torbe athabarte dochum nirisse
glosses.glossFNs: .i. maadced torbe innathect<sup>d</sup> .i. torbe athabarte dochum nirisse
footnotes: d: With inna thect ‘in so going’ cf. a techt LU. 63a 7, 100a 10, a tuidecht Ml. 53d 9, a dul LU. 85a 11
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye should see profit in so going, that is, profit of bringing him to (the) faith.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem dixerit: immolaticium est, nolite manducare, propter illum qui indicauit, et propter conscientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem dixerit: immolaticium est, nolite manducare, propter illum qui indicauit, et propter conscientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is an unfaithful one who proclaims it.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem dixerit: immolaticium est, nolite manducare, propter illum qui indicauit, et propter conscientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye should not partake of it.

glosses.latin: ut quid enim libertas mea iudicatur ab alia conscientia?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. judgment of reprobation.

glosses.latin: Si ego cum gratia participo, quid blasfemor pro eo quod gratias ago?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] manud fel i[Con]n[/Con]spirut nóib indiu[Con]m[/Con]sa ná bith fochunn uaimm fein domæcṅduch [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]per fortitudinem fidei[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. manud fel inspirut nóib indiumsa ná bith fochunn uaimm fein domæcṅduch .i. per fortitudinem fidei
glosses.glossFNs: .i. manud fel inspirut nóib indiumsa ná bith fochunn uaimm fein domæcṅduch .i. per fortitudinem fidei
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if there is the Holy Spirit within me let me give no cause to speak evil of me.

glosses.latin: Si ego cum gratia participo, quid blasfemor pro eo quod gratias ago?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for consuming the food.

glosses.latin: Siue ergo manducatis, siue bibatis, ... omnia in gloriam Dei facite.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, then, (is) a recapitulation.

glosses.latin: Siue ergo manducatis, siue bibatis, ... omnia in gloriam Dei facite.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isinducbál dodia [GLat]et[/GLat] isnert nirisse cometecht dondlobur iniriss
glosses.glossText: .i. isinducbál dodia et isnert nirisse cometecht dondlobur iniriss
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isinducbál dodia et isnert nirisse cometecht dondlobur iniriss
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. indulgence to the feeble in faith is glory to God and strength of faith.

glosses.latin: Sine offensione estote Iudeís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cometecht dianécoscaib cenchometecht diambésib mainbet mathi
glosses.glossText: .i. cometecht dianécoscaib cenchometecht diambésib mainbet mathi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cometecht dianécoscaib cenchometecht diambésib mainbet mathi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. indulgence to their habits without indulgence to their customs, unless they be good.

glosses.latin: non querens quod mihi utile est, sed quod multís, ut salui fiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is profit to many, to save them.

glosses.latin: Emitatores mei estote, sicut ego Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: arnábad rómár leosom intsamil cr[Con]ist[/Con] fochetóir
glosses.glossText: arnábad rómár leosom intsamil crist fochetóir
glosses.glossFNs: arnábad rómár leosom intsamil crist fochetóir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest they might deem it too much to imitate Christ (all) at once.

glosses.latin: Omnis autem mulier orans aut profetans non uelato capite, deturpat caput suum; unum est enim ac si decaluetur.
glosses.glossText: .i. apridchas diaclaind ɫ. diammuintir ɫ. aliís mulieribus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. apridchas diaclaind ɫ. diammuintir ɫ. aliís mulieribus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when she preaches to her children, or to her household, uel etc.

glosses.latin: Omnis autem mulier orans aut profetans non uelato capite, deturpat caput suum; unum est enim ac si decaluetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without a veil on her head.

glosses.latin: Omnis autem mulier orans aut profetans non uelato capite, deturpat caput suum; unum est enim ac si decaluetur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]uelato capite[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]moris erat eís uelare capita in orationibus et in p[Con]re[/Con]dicationibus[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ambith cenchorin ished an[GLat]uelare[/GLat][a] asbeirsom
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] uelato capite .i. moris erat eís uelare capita in orationibus et in predicationibus ɫ. ambith cenchorin ished anuelare asbeirsom
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] uelato capite .i. moris erat eís uelare capita in orationibus et in predicationibus ɫ. ambith cenchorin ished anuelarea asbeirsom
footnotes: a: leg. anonuelare
glosses.glossTrans: their being without a (bridal) crown(?), this is the non uelare which he mentions.

glosses.latin: Omnis autem mulier orans aut profetans non uelato capite, deturpat caput suum; unum est enim ac si decaluetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. uirum suum, that is, it is a sign of evading the (marriage-)bond.

glosses.latin: Omnis autem mulier orans aut profetans non uelato capite, deturpat caput suum; unum est enim ac si decaluetur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arisinunn [ie].i.[/ie] buith nochtchenn [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] doberrthe [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]a uiro suo[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ófolt
glosses.glossText: .i. arisinunn .i. buith nochtchenn .i. amal doberrthe .i. a uiro suo ɫ. ófolt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arisinunn .i. buith nochtchenn .i. amal doberrthe .i. a uiro suo ɫ. ófolt
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is the same, i.e. to be bareheaded, i.e. as though she were shorn, i.e. a uiro suo or from hair.

glosses.latin: Nam si non uelatur mulier, et tondeatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] berrthar [GLat]non tam imperat tondéri quam detestat[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] is cu[Con]m[/Con]me dí noberrthe
glosses.glossText: .i. berrthar non tam imperat tondéri quam detestat ɫ. is cumme dí noberrthe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. berrthar non tam imperat tondéri quam detestat ɫ. is cumme dí noberrthe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let her be shorn, non tam etc., or it is the same to her as if she had been shorn.

glosses.latin: Uir quidem non debet uelare caput suum, quoniam imago et gloria est Dei: mulier autem gloria uiri est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] ascenn cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]uiri[/GLat] iscenn [GLat]uir mulieris[/GLat] am[Con]al[/Con] dombeir in ben airmitin féith donfiur [GLat]síc uir christo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal ascenn crist uiri iscenn uir mulieris amal dombeir in ben airmitin féith donfiur síc uir christo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal ascenn crist uiri iscenn uir mulieris amal dombeir in ben airmitin féith donfiur síc uir christo
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as Christ is head uiri, uir is head mulieris: as the woman gives due respect to the man, sic uir Christo.

glosses.latin: Etenim non est creatus uir propter mulierem, sed mulier propter uirum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but it is the woman who was made to help uir.

glosses.latin: Ideo debet mulier potestatem habere supra caput.
footnotes: c: an imitation of the Irish idiom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is propter uirum creata (est)c.

glosses.latin: Uerumtamen neque uir sine muliere, neque mulier sine uiro, in Domino.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciasu airegdu infer arachuit sidi nirubi nechtar de cenalail[b]
glosses.glossText: .i. ciasu airegdu infer arachuit sidi nirubi nechtar de cenalail
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciasu airegdu infer arachuit sidi nirubi nechtar de cenalail<sup>b</sup>
footnotes: b: leg. alaile?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. although for his part the man is nobler neither of them can be without the other.

glosses.latin: mulierem non uelatam.
footnotes: a: MS. seems nochit, the i written under the h
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. bareheaded.

glosses.latin: Nec ipsa natura docet uos quod uir quidem si comam nutriat ignominia est illi.
footnotes: k: or ‘something which nature teaches’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lex naturae, i.e. nature teaches notk.

glosses.latin: Nec ipsa natura docet uos quod uir quidem si comam nutriat ignominia est illi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not seemly.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem uidetur contentiosus esse, nos talem consuetudinem non habemus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nifil linn inbéesso [ie].i.[/ie] tuidecht friaicned [GLat]et[/GLat] cosna[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] imbressan
glosses.glossText: .i. nifil linn inbéesso .i. tuidecht friaicned et cosnam et imbressan
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nifil linn inbéesso .i. tuidecht friaicned et cosnam et imbressan
glosses.glossTrans: i.e we have not this custom, i.e. contravening nature, and quarrelling, and contention.

glosses.latin: Primum quidem conuenientibus uobis in Ecclesiam, audio scisuras esse [inter uos], et ex parte credo.
footnotes: b: Here, as in no adumrugur Wb. 16c 3, no guidimm 21a 8, no implies relativity, Celt. Zeitschr. III. 246
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this which I reprimand at first.

glosses.latin: Primum quidem conuenientibus uobis in Ecclesiam, audio scisuras esse [inter uos], et ex parte credo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] fil ní de asfír [vel]ɫ.[/vel] indrécht[c] uáibsi as debthach [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]fidei[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] isindrecht dindhiris adib debthichsi
glosses.glossText: .i. fil ní de asfír ɫ. indrécht uáibsi as debthach ɫ. fidei .i. isindrecht dindhiris adib debthichsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fil ní de asfír ɫ. indréchtc uáibsi as debthach ɫ. fidei .i. isindrecht dindhiris adib debthichsi
footnotes: c: leg. isdrécht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that there is something of it that is true, or it is a section of you that is contentious, uel fidei, i.e. it is as to part of the faith that ye are contentious.

glosses.latin: Nam oportet [et] heresses esse, ut qui probati sunt, manifesti fiant in uobís.
glosses.glossText: .i. isairchen á buid et ished foirfea scismata rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isairchen á buid et ished foirfea scismata rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is certain that it is, and it is this which will produce schismata etc.

glosses.latin: Conuenientibus ergo uobis in unum, iam non est Dominicam cenam manducare.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní bái lib [GLat]mandu[Con]care[/Con] domini[Con]cam[/Con] cenam sed cenam uestram[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ní bái lib manducare dominicam cenam sed cenam uestram
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní bái lib manducare dominicam cenam sed cenam uestram
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye deem it not profitable manducare etc.

glosses.latin: Numquid domús non habetis ad manducandum et bibendum? aut aeclesiam Dei contempnitis?
glosses.glossFullTags: barafie dúib darígente cene cenimmormus nachmór[d]
glosses.glossText: barafie dúib darígente cene cenimmormus nachmór
glosses.glossFNs: barafie dúib darígente cene cenimmormus nachmór<sup>d</sup>
footnotes: d: cf. Ml. 64d 3. In modern Irish nach mór means ‘almost’
glosses.glossTrans: ye had it in your power to do it, besides, without sin to any great extent.

glosses.latin: Numquid domús non habetis ad manducandum et bibendum? aut aeclesiam Dei contempnitis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] no indochomainsem[e] ecolsa dagníith. [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]facientes eam triclinium æpularum[/GLat][f].
glosses.glossText: .i. no indochomainsem ecolsa dagníith. Pelagius: facientes eam triclinium æpularum.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. no indochomainseme ecolsa dagníith. Pelagius: facientes eam triclinium æpularumf.
footnotes: e: for com-nessam: cf. áinsem (ad-ness-), Wb. 14b 16, 17
f: Migne, col. 783
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. or is it to bring contempt on the Church that ye do it?

glosses.latin: quicunque manducauerit panem hunc, uel biberit calicem Domini indigne, reus erit corporis et sanguinis Domini.
glosses.glossFullTags: [g][GLat]Gregorius[/GLat][/g]: [GLat]né putarent corpus domini panem esse commonem indigne eum sumentibus uechimenter comminatur[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] isaidchrochad cr[Con]ist[/Con] hóre déte dochorp cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]indigne[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: Gregorius: né putarent corpus domini panem esse commonem indigne eum sumentibus uechimenter comminatur .i. isaidchrochad crist hóre déte dochorp crist indigne
glosses.glossFNs: Gregoriusg: né putarent corpus domini panem esse commonem indigne eum sumentibus uechimenter comminatur .i. isaidchrochad crist hóre déte dochorp crist indigne
footnotes: g: MS. gg
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a re-crucifixion of Christ when one goes to Christ’s Body indigne.

glosses.latin: Probet autem sé ipsum homo; et sic de pane illo aedat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]perscrutanda est conscientia sí in nullo nós reprechendit[/GLat][h] [ie].i.[/ie] nanglanad[i] triaithirgi ↄnabǽ níi indid ningaba áchocubus
glosses.glossText: .i. Pelagius: perscrutanda est conscientia sí in nullo nós reprechendit .i. nanglanad triaithirgi ↄnabǽ níi indid ningaba áchocubus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. Pelagius: perscrutanda est conscientia sí in nullo nós reprechendith .i. nanglanadi triaithirgi ↄnabǽ níi indid ningaba áchocubus
footnotes: h: Not in Migne, col. 784
i: The first n is written over the g
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him purify himself through penance, so that there be nothing for which his conscience may reprehend him.

glosses.latin: Probet autem sé ipsum homo; et sic de pane illo aedat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided he have no sins.

glosses.latin: Ideo inter uos multi infirmi et inbiciles, et dormiunt multi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. weak are all their bodies.

glosses.latin: Ideo inter uos multi infirmi et inbiciles, et dormiunt multi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indenmi [ie].i.[/ie] tesbanat boíll aíriu [vel]ɫ.[/vel] itmoírb inboillsin cia beit innacorp
glosses.glossText: .i. indenmi .i. tesbanat boíll aíriu ɫ. itmoírb inboillsin cia beit innacorp
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indenmi .i. tesbanat boíll aíriu ɫ. itmoírb inboillsin cia beit innacorp
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. feeble, that is, members are wanting to them, or those limbs are dead though they be in their body.

glosses.latin: Ideo inter uos multi infirmi et inbiciles, et dormiunt multi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they go to premature death, that is, shortness of life.

glosses.latin: Dum autem iudicamur, á Domino corripimur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to castigate us.

glosses.latin: inuicem expectate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every one wait for the other.

glosses.latin: Si quis essurit, domi manducet, ut non in iudicium conueniatis
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnipalour do intsacarbaicc act ci nip lour nabad [GLat]in æclesia[/GLat] [a][GLat]manducet[/GLat][/a] [GLat]sed domi[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. arnipalour do intsacarbaicc act ci nip lour nabad in æclesia manducet sed domi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnipalour do intsacarbaicc act ci nip lour nabad in æclesia manduceta sed domi
footnotes: a: MS. maducet
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for the eucharist will not be enough for him; but though it be not enough, let it not be in ecclesia manducet, sed domi.

glosses.latin: Si quis essurit, domi manducet, ut non in iudicium conueniatis
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] madfleteg led magtach dogneid dind æclis
glosses.glossText: .i. madfleteg led magtach dogneid dind æclis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. madfleteg led magtach dogneid dind æclis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye make of the church a .......(?) banqueting-house.

glosses.latin: De spiritalibus autem nolo uos ignorare.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I prefer that ye should know it even now.

glosses.latin: Scitis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is clear to you.

glosses.latin: Ideo notum uobís facio, quod nemo in spiritu Dei loquiens, dicit anathema Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]eo quod eratis similes simulacrorum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] arnitucsidsi issuidiu etargne cr[Con]ist[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] arindfessid
glosses.glossText: .i. eo quod eratis similes simulacrorum .i. arnitucsidsi issuidiu etargne crist .i. arindfessid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. eo quod eratis similes simulacrorum .i. arnitucsidsi issuidiu etargne crist .i. arindfessid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for at this (time) ye did not understand the knowledge of Christ, i.e. that ye may know it.

glosses.latin: Ideo notum uobís facio, quod nemo in spiritu Dei loquiens, dicit anathema Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be in the spirit of God although he say it.

glosses.latin: Diuisiones uero gratiarum sunt, idem autem Spiritus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] itíli imm[Con]urgu[/Con] [GLat]dona gratiae spiritus sancti[/GLat] ciasu óende inspirut
glosses.glossText: .i. itíli immurgu dona gratiae spiritus sancti ciasu óende inspirut
glosses.glossFNs: .i. itíli immurgu dona gratiae spiritus sancti ciasu óende inspirut
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. many, however, are dona etc. though the Spirit is single.

glosses.latin: ... idem uero Deus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] trianman dobeirso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]híc spiritui[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]spiritus et dominus et deus ostenditur híc[/GLat] nách neich ingním [GLat]sed spiritus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] trianman dobeirsom híc spiritui .i. spiritus et dominus et deus ostenditur híc nách neich ingním sed spiritus
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] trianman dobeirsom híc spiritui .i. spiritus et dominus et deus ostenditur híc nách neich ingním sed spiritus
glosses.glossTrans: three names he gives híc Spiritui, etc. Ostenditur híc that the work belongs to no one sed Spiritus.

glosses.latin: Unicuique autem datur manifestatio Spiritus ad utilitatem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] foilsigthi inspirut andso[Con]m[/Con] arrath dobeir do
glosses.glossText: .i. foilsigthi inspirut andsom arrath dobeir do
glosses.glossFNs: .i. foilsigthi inspirut andsom arrath dobeir do
footnotes: d: foilsigthi = foilsigith + i, where -i anticipates the acc. rath
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Spirit manifests<sup>d</sup> in him the grace which it gives him.

glosses.latin: ... secundum eundem Spiritum.
footnotes: b: = fo-d-dáli
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is, one Spirit distributes it.

glosses.latin: ... alii gratia sanitatum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]ut curat egrótos ut sunt medici[/GLat][c] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] dénom ferto
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: ut curat egrótos ut sunt medici ɫ. dénom ferto
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: ut curat egrótos ut sunt medicic ɫ. dénom ferto
footnotes: c: Ut curet ægrotos, Migne, col. 786
glosses.glossTrans: working a miracle (of healing).

glosses.latin: ... alii interpretatio sermonum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tintuúth bélri innaláil [GLat]ut hi[Con]eronimus[/Con] et LXX.[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] rúna dothabairt á óensonaib [GLat]et[/GLat] p[Con]re[/Con]cept essib iaru[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]ut mós est p[Con]re[/Con]dicatoribus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. tintuúth bélri innaláil ut hieronimus et LXX. ɫ. rúna dothabairt á óensonaib et precept essib iarum ut mós est predicatoribus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tintuúth bélri innaláil ut hieronimus et LXX. ɫ. rúna dothabairt á óensonaib et precept essib iarum ut mós est predicatoribus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. translation of (one) language into another like Jerome and the Septuagint, or to bring hidden meanings out of single words, and then to preach from them, ut etc.

glosses.latin: Haec omnia operatur unus atque idem Spiritus diuidiens singulis prout uult.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Haec omnia operatur unus atque idem Spiritus diuidiens singulis prout uult.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]spiritus[/GLat] doadbadar sunt atánili dána inspirto [GLat]et[/GLat] asnóindæ inspirut
glosses.glossText: .i. spiritus doadbadar sunt atánili dána inspirto et asnóindæ inspirut
glosses.glossFNs: .i. spiritus doadbadar sunt atánili dána inspirto et asnóindæ inspirut
glosses.glossTrans: here is shewn that the Spirit’s gifts are many and that the Spirit is single.

glosses.latin: ... omnia membra corporis cum sint multa, unum corpus sunt, ita et Christus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [a]cosmulius[/a] t[Con]ra[/Con] anísiu lesso[Con]m[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] fongní cach ball dialailiu isinchorp arafogna talland cáich uanni dialailiu arammi óinchórp hí cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: cosmulius tra anísiu lessom .i. amal fongní cach ball dialailiu isinchorp arafogna talland cáich uanni dialailiu arammi óinchórp hí crist
glosses.glossFNs: cosmulius<sup>a</sup> tra anísiu lessom .i. amal fongní cach ball dialailiu isinchorp arafogna talland cáich uanni dialailiu arammi óinchórp hí crist
footnotes: a: MS. commulus
glosses.glossTrans: this, then, is a simile of his, that is: as every member serves the other in the body, that the talent of every one of us should serve the other, for we are one body in Christ.

glosses.latin: ... omnia membra corporis cum sint multa, unum corpus sunt, ita et Christus.
glosses.glossTrans: those members, though they be many, are (one) body.

glosses.latin: ... omnia membra corporis cum sint multa, unum corpus sunt, ita et Christus.
footnotes: c: i.e. sancti et justi, cf. 12b 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is one body with Christ<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Etenim in uno Spiritu omnes nos in unum corpus babtizati sumus, siue Iudei, siue gentiles .... et omnes unum Spiritum potati sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have been massed into one body by baptism.

glosses.latin: Etenim in uno Spiritu omnes nos in unum corpus babtizati sumus, siue Iudei, siue gentiles .... et omnes unum Spiritum potati sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all are in that body.

glosses.latin: Etenim in uno Spiritu omnes nos in unum corpus babtizati sumus, siue Iudei, siue gentiles .... et omnes unum Spiritum potati sumus.
footnotes: b: MS. seems assib semimróol
d: In ass-ibsem, the pretonic ass (from ess) is here a perfective particle
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have drunk<sup>d</sup> a great draught of the grace of the Holy Spirit.

glosses.latin: Nam et corpus non est unum membrum, sed multa.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the one member is not a body.

glosses.latin: Nam et corpus non est unum membrum, sed multa.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is members that make up the body.

glosses.latin: Et si dexerit pes: quoniam non sum manus, non sum de corpore, num ideo non est de corpore?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et si dexerit pes: quoniam non sum manus, non sum de corpore, num ideo non est de corpore?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issochrudiu láam oldósa olcoss nidichorp atóosa hóre nimthalaám
glosses.glossText: .i. issochrudiu láam oldósa olcoss nidichorp atóosa hóre nimthalaám
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issochrudiu láam oldósa olcoss nidichorp atóosa hóre nimthalaám
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ‘Hand is comelier than I,’ says Foot. ‘I am not of the body because I am not Hand.’

glosses.latin: Et si dexerit pes: quoniam non sum manus, non sum de corpore, num ideo non est de corpore?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní nád ṁ bed arse dichorp act atá de
glosses.glossText: .i. ní nád ṁ bed arse dichorp act atá de
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní nád ṁ bed arse dichorp act atá de
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not that it is not therefore of the body, but it is of it.

glosses.latin: Et si dexerit pes: quoniam non sum manus, non sum de corpore, num ideo non est de corpore?
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] Mad inæclis t[Con]ra[/Con] inchoss ishé óis achtáil [GLat]et[/GLat] indlaám ishé óis achtáil asmáa alailiu
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Mad inæclis tra inchoss ishé óis achtáil et indlaám ishé óis achtáil asmáa alailiu
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Mad inæclis tra inchoss ishé óis achtáil et indlaám ishé óis achtáil asmáa alailiu
glosses.glossTrans: if, then, it be in the Church, the foot is the practical folk, and the hand is the practical folk who are more than the others.

glosses.latin: Et si dixerit auris: quia non sum oculus, non sum de corpore, num ideo non est de corpore?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the contemplative folk.

glosses.latin: Et si dixerit auris: quia non sum oculus, non sum de corpore, num ideo non est de corpore?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the field which the eye has taken in is more delightful than I am.

glosses.latin: Et si dixerit auris: quia non sum oculus, non sum de corpore, num ideo non est de corpore?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as regards it: it is de corpore.

glosses.latin: Si totum corpus oculus, ubi auditus?
glosses.glossTrans: that, too, will be body.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem possuit Deus membra, unumquodque eorum in corpore sicut uoluit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. posuit verily membrum.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem possuit Deus membra, unumquodque eorum in corpore sicut uoluit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isamlid dorígeni dia corp duini ó ilballaib
glosses.glossText: .i. isamlid dorígeni dia corp duini ó ilballaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isamlid dorígeni dia corp duini ó ilballaib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus that God hath made man’s body of many members.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem multa quidem membra, unum autem corpus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. verily He hath established one body of many members.

glosses.latin: Non potest autem oculus dicere manui: Opera tua non indigeo; aut iterum caput pedibus: non estis mihi necesarii.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non potest autem oculus dicere manui: Opera tua non indigeo; aut iterum caput pedibus: non estis mihi necesarii.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non potest autem oculus dicere manui: Opera tua non indigeo; aut iterum caput pedibus: non estis mihi necesarii.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I need you not, O feet!

glosses.latin: Sed multo magis quae uidentur membra corporis infirmiora esse necessariora sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] níhed améit nádricc less cachball aláili [GLat]sed multo[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. níhed améit nádricc less cachball aláili sed multo rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. níhed améit nádricc less cachball aláili sed multo rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not only cannot any member dispense with the other, sed multo, etc.

glosses.latin: Sed multo magis quae uidentur membra corporis infirmiora esse necessariora sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ata lobru am[Con]al[/Con] rongab cride [GLat]et[/GLat] óa [GLat]et[/GLat] inmedóncha áili [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]uirilia et feminina[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ata lobru amal rongab cride et óa et inmedóncha áili ɫ. uirilia et feminina
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ata lobru amal rongab cride et óa et inmedóncha áili ɫ. uirilia et feminina
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which are weaker, such as the heart and liver and other internal organs.

glosses.latin: Et quae putamus ignobiliora membra [esse] corporis, hiis honorem habundantiorem circumdamus, et quae inhonesta sunt habundantiorem honestatem habent.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et quae putamus ignobiliora membra [esse] corporis, hiis honorem habundantiorem circumdamus, et quae inhonesta sunt habundantiorem honestatem habent.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] andíten issairiu doib fogna[Con]m[/Con] donaballaib ailib doib oldaas cidafogna[Con]m[/Con] féisne cianubed leu
glosses.glossText: .i. andíten issairiu doib fognam donaballaib ailib doib oldaas cidafognam féisne cianubed leu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. andíten issairiu doib fognam donaballaib ailib doib oldaas cidafognam féisne cianubed leu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of protecting them: it is nobler for them to serve the other members than even to serve themselves, though it should be in their power.

glosses.latin: Et quae putamus ignobiliora membra [esse] corporis, hiis honorem habundantiorem circumdamus, et quae inhonesta sunt habundantiorem honestatem habent.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et quae putamus ignobiliora membra [esse] corporis, hiis honorem habundantiorem circumdamus, et quae inhonesta sunt habundantiorem honestatem habent.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tri fognam innamball naile doib [ie].i.[/ie] dothinóol ǽtig impu [GLat]et[/GLat] biith doib
glosses.glossText: .i. tri fognam innamball naile doib .i. dothinóol ǽtig impu et biith doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tri fognam innamball naile doib .i. dothinóol ǽtig impu et biith doib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through the service of the other members to them, that is, in gathering raiment round them and food for them.

glosses.latin: Honesta autem nostra nullius egent; sed Deus temperauit corpus, éi cui deerat habundantiorem tribuendo honorem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. face and hands and feet.

glosses.latin: Honesta autem nostra nullius egent; sed Deus temperauit corpus, éi cui deerat habundantiorem tribuendo honorem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]honestatis[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] andudæsta airisom [ie].i.[/ie] líi [GLat]et[/GLat] sonirte immefolṅgi incorp uile andso[Con]m[/Con] ón
glosses.glossText: .i. honestatis .i. andudæsta airisom .i. líi et sonirte immefolṅgi incorp uile andsom ón
glosses.glossFNs: .i. honestatis .i. andudæsta airisom .i. líi et sonirte immefolṅgi incorp uile andsom ón
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is lacking unto it, i.e. colour and firmness, that makes up the whole body therein.

glosses.latin: Ut non sit scisma in corpore, sed id ipsum pro inuicem sollicita sint membra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄderna cechball anastoisc dialailiu hore isin oínchorp ataat badmaith anóintu
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄderna cechball anastoisc dialailiu hore isin oínchorp ataat badmaith anóintu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄderna cechball anastoisc dialailiu hore isin oínchorp ataat badmaith anóintu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that each member may do what the other desires: because they are in one body let their unity be good.

glosses.latin: Ut non sit scisma in corpore, sed id ipsum pro inuicem sollicita sint membra.
footnotes: a: In the MS. the mark of length is over the n
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as they exist.

glosses.latin: Ut non sit scisma in corpore, sed id ipsum pro inuicem sollicita sint membra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore is oín chorp cobrad cachball alaile
glosses.glossText: .i. hore is oín chorp cobrad cachball alaile
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore is oín chorp cobrad cachball alaile
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is one body let each member help the other.

glosses.latin: Et si quid patitur unum membrum, conpatiuntur omnia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though ye do not deem that union close.

glosses.latin: membra; siue gloriatur unum membrum, congaudent omnia membra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isgalar leu uili mabed[a] galar issindoínbull
glosses.glossText: .i. isgalar leu uili mabed galar issindoínbull
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isgalar leu uili mabed<sup>a</sup> galar issindoínbull
footnotes: a: cf. Wb. 3c 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they all deem themselves sick if sickness should be in the one member.

glosses.latin: membra; siue gloriatur unum membrum, congaudent omnia membra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mad slaán in ball iar nagalar isdidnad donaib ballaib ailib
glosses.glossText: .i. mad slaán in ball iar nagalar isdidnad donaib ballaib ailib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mad slaán in ball iar nagalar isdidnad donaib ballaib ailib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if the member be whole after its sickness it is a consolation to the other members.

glosses.latin: Vos autem estis corpus Christi, et membra de membro.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issuaichnid t[Con]ra[/Con] cid diatuiced incosmuilius cosse [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] file óentid eterbaullu coirp duini conroib oíntu etrunni da[Con]no[/Con] hore ammicorp cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] ammiboill coirp cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. issuaichnid tra cid diatuiced incosmuilius cosse .i. amal file óentid eterbaullu coirp duini conroib oíntu etrunni dano hore ammicorp crist et ammiboill coirp crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issuaichnid tra cid diatuiced incosmuilius cosse .i. amal file óentid eterbaullu coirp duini conroib oíntu etrunni dano hore ammicorp crist et ammiboill coirp crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is apparent, then, for what the similitude has been put hitherto, to wit, as there is unity among the members of a human being’s body, that there be union among us also, because we are Christ’s body and we are members of Christ’s body.

glosses.latin: Et quosdam quidem possuit Deus in eclesia primum apostolos, secundo profetas, tertio doctores: deinde uirtutes, exinde gratias curationum, opitulationes, gubernationes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ithé rogabsat airegas [GLat]quia uiderunt apostoli quae profetae profetauerunt[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. ithé rogabsat airegas quia uiderunt apostoli quae profetae profetauerunt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ithé rogabsat airegas quia uiderunt apostoli quae profetae profetaueruntb
footnotes: b: Matth. xiii. 17
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is they (the apostles) that have received precedence quia etc.

glosses.latin: Et quosdam quidem possuit Deus in eclesia primum apostolos, secundo profetas, tertio doctores: deinde uirtutes, exinde gratias curationum, opitulationes, gubernationes.
footnotes: d: lit. ‘folk of soul-friendship’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the spiritual directorsd in praesenti etc.

glosses.latin: Et quosdam quidem possuit Deus in eclesia primum apostolos, secundo profetas, tertio doctores: deinde uirtutes, exinde gratias curationum, opitulationes, gubernationes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indíi gnite gnímu sainemli [vel]ɫ.[/vel] denu[Con]m[/Con] ferte
glosses.glossText: .i. indíi gnite gnímu sainemli ɫ. denum ferte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indíi gnite gnímu sainemli ɫ. denum ferte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they that do excellent deeds, or working miracles.

glosses.latin: Et quosdam quidem possuit Deus in eclesia primum apostolos, secundo profetas, tertio doctores: deinde uirtutes, exinde gratias curationum, opitulationes, gubernationes.
glosses.glossText: .i. fortactidi .i. in doctrína et oratióne ɫ. in elimoisinis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fortactidi .i. in doctrína et oratióne ɫ. in elimoisinis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. helpers.

glosses.latin: Et quosdam quidem possuit Deus in eclesia primum apostolos, secundo profetas, tertio doctores: deinde uirtutes, exinde gratias curationum, opitulationes, gubernationes.
glosses.glossTrans: vice-abbots.

glosses.latin: Numquid omnes apostoli? . . numquid omnes doctores?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]abnegatiue[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nítat apstil huili luct inna æcolsa
glosses.glossText: .i. abnegatiue .i. nítat apstil huili luct inna æcolsa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. abnegatiue .i. nítat apstil huili luct inna æcolsa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the church-folk are not all apostles.

glosses.latin: Numquid omnes apostoli? . . numquid omnes doctores?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all are not teachers.

glosses.latin: Numquid omnes uirtutes? num[quid] omnes gratiam habent curationum? numquid omnes linguis loquntur? numquid omnes interpredantur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all do not work miracles.

glosses.latin: Numquid omnes uirtutes? num[quid] omnes gratiam habent curationum? numquid omnes linguis loquntur? numquid omnes interpredantur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all have not the grace of working miracles.

glosses.latin: Numquid omnes uirtutes? num[quid] omnes gratiam habent curationum? numquid omnes linguis loquntur? numquid omnes interpredantur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all do not speak with many tongues.

glosses.latin: Numquid omnes uirtutes? num[quid] omnes gratiam habent curationum? numquid omnes linguis loquntur? numquid omnes interpredantur?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nitatsoír[c] huili oc tintuúth abélru innalaill [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ocsaigid forsunu [vel]ɫ.[/vel] octabairt ruún essib
glosses.glossText: .i. nitatsoír huili oc tintuúth abélru innalaill ɫ. ocsaigid forsunu ɫ. octabairt ruún essib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nitatsoír<sup>c</sup> huili oc tintuúth abélru innalaill ɫ. ocsaigid forsunu ɫ. octabairt ruún essib
footnotes: c: cf. Ml. 145c 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all are not skilled in translating from one language into another, or in disputing as to words, or in bringing hidden meanings out of them.

glosses.latin: Aemulamini autem charismata meliora. Et adhuc excellentiorem uiam uobis demonstrabo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quam[/GLat] labrath ó ilbélrib, [GLat]et adhuc excellentiorem uiam uobís demonstro[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. quam labrath ó ilbélrib, et adhuc excellentiorem uiam uobís demonstro
glosses.glossFNs: .i. quam labrath ó ilbélrib, et adhuc excellentiorem uiam uobís demonstro
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. than speaking in many languages.

glosses.latin: Si linguís hominum loquar et angelorum, caritatem autem non habeam, factus sum uelut aes sonans, aut cimbalum tinniens.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the demonstrabo.

glosses.latin: Si linguís hominum loquar et angelorum, caritatem autem non habeam, factus sum uelut aes sonans, aut cimbalum tinniens.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a suitable love for God.

glosses.latin: Si linguís hominum loquar et angelorum, caritatem autem non habeam, factus sum uelut aes sonans, aut cimbalum tinniens.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. brass that soundeth, i.e. even devotion without charity.

glosses.latin: Si linguís hominum loquar et angelorum, caritatem autem non habeam, factus sum uelut aes sonans, aut cimbalum tinniens.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which shines or sounds.

glosses.latin: Et si habuerim prophetiam, et nouerim ... omnem scientiam; et si habuero omnem fidem ita ut montes transferam, caritatem [autem] non habeam, nihil sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. grace of preaching.

glosses.latin: Et si habuerim prophetiam, et nouerim ... omnem scientiam; et si habuero omnem fidem ita ut montes transferam, caritatem [autem] non habeam, nihil sum.
footnotes: a: MS. rol–̇gníith
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of what has been done and will be done.

glosses.latin: Et si habuerim prophetiam, et nouerim ... omnem scientiam; et si habuero omnem fidem ita ut montes transferam, caritatem [autem] non habeam, nihil sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of working miracles.

glosses.latin: Et si habuerim prophetiam, et nouerim ... omnem scientiam; et si habuero omnem fidem ita ut montes transferam, caritatem [autem] non habeam, nihil sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. nothing of that profits me.

glosses.latin: Et si habuerim prophetiam, et nouerim ... omnem scientiam; et si habuero omnem fidem ita ut montes transferam, caritatem [autem] non habeam, nihil sum.
glosses.glossFullTags: tairchella [GLat]híc[/GLat] t[Con]ra[/Con] huili dánu inspirito [GLat]et[/GLat] nitorban na áe manihǽ desercc
glosses.glossText: tairchella híc tra huili dánu inspirito et nitorban na áe manihǽ desercc
glosses.glossFNs: tairchella híc tra huili dánu inspirito et nitorban na áe manihǽ desercc
glosses.glossTrans: he collects(?) híc, then, all the gifts of the Spirit, and none of them profiteth unless there be charity.

glosses.latin: et si tradidero corpus meum ut ardeam, caritatem autem non habuero, nihil mihi prodest.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in mortem, for many a one dies for his friend.

glosses.latin: et si tradidero corpus meum ut ardeam, caritatem autem non habuero, nihil mihi prodest.
glosses.glossTrans: nearer and nearer, until he (Paul) has come to himself.

glosses.latin: et si tradidero corpus meum ut ardeam, caritatem autem non habuero, nihil mihi prodest.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. better is charity than all things are.

glosses.latin: Caritas ... non agit perperam.
footnotes: b: Some letters may have become illegible before this. Zeuss read: perperam: cf. forcrid Wb. 14a 33
d: ‘superfluity’ J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. wrongly<sup>d</sup>(?).

glosses.latin: non quaerit quae sua sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. save God’s love tantum.

glosses.latin: Caritas nunquam excidit, siue prophetiae euacuabuntur, siue linguae cessabunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. study is not needed there.

glosses.latin: Caritas nunquam excidit, siue prophetiae euacuabuntur, siue linguae cessabunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we shall not speak, that is, his caritas, however, will accompany him beyond.

glosses.latin: Ex parte enim cognoscimus, et ex parte prophetamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is little we know in God’s mysteries.

glosses.latin: Ex parte enim cognoscimus, et ex parte prophetamus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isbecc p[Con]ri[/Con]dchimmeni dirúnaib dǽe ar nisfitemmar
glosses.glossText: .i. isbecc pridchimmeni dirúnaib dǽe ar nisfitemmar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isbecc pridchimmeni dirúnaib dǽe ar nisfitemmar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is little we preach of God’s mysteries, for we know them not.

glosses.latin: Cum autem uenerit quod perfectum est.
glosses.glossText: .i. buíth dunni issintodochidiu .i. uita futura ɫ. plena scientia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. buíth dunni issintodochidiu .i. uita futura ɫ. plena scientia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we should be in the future.

glosses.latin: sapiebam ut paruulus .... quando factus sum uir, euacuaui quae erant paruuli.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I used to feel.

glosses.latin: sapiebam ut paruulus .... quando factus sum uir, euacuaui quae erant paruuli.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: sapiebam ut paruulus .... quando factus sum uir, euacuaui quae erant paruuli.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ó domanicc foirbthetu ní denim gnímu macthi act [c]rísam nem[/c] bimmi æcni [GLat]et[/GLat] bimmi foirbthi uili
glosses.glossText: .i. ó domanicc foirbthetu ní denim gnímu macthi act rísam nem bimmi æcni et bimmi foirbthi uili
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ó domanicc foirbthetu ní denim gnímu macthi act rísam nemc bimmi æcni et bimmi foirbthi uili
footnotes: c: Sic GC.2 704, MS. seems rísa innem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since perfection has come to me, I do no childish deeds; if only we get to heaven we shall be wise, and we shall all be perfect.

glosses.latin: Videmus nunc per speculum in enigmate ... Nunc cognosco ex parte; tunc autem cognoscam, sicut et cognitus sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he has here a similitude of an eye.

glosses.latin: Videmus nunc per speculum in enigmate ... Nunc cognosco ex parte; tunc autem cognoscam, sicut et cognitus sum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iscumme adciamni narúna diadi [GLat]et[/GLat] adcíi nech ní triscáath céin ṁbimme [GLat]in corpore[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. iscumme adciamni narúna diadi et adcíi nech ní triscáath céin ṁbimme in corpore
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iscumme adciamni narúna diadi et adcíi nech ní triscáath céin ṁbimme in corpore
footnotes: e: scáath for scathderc?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so long as we are in corpore, we see the divine mysteries just as one sees something through a mirrore.

glosses.latin: Videmus nunc per speculum in enigmate ... Nunc cognosco ex parte; tunc autem cognoscam, sicut et cognitus sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for what is seen through darkness is not clear, and is not quite certain.

glosses.latin: Videmus nunc per speculum in enigmate ... Nunc cognosco ex parte; tunc autem cognoscam, sicut et cognitus sum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isrándindeacht[a] adgénsa [vel]ɫ.[/vel] is ran[b] indiumsa adgeuín indeacht [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]anima tantum[/GLat] adidgeúin
glosses.glossText: .i. isrándindeacht adgénsa ɫ. is ran indiumsa adgeuín indeacht .i. anima tantum adidgeúin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isrándindeachta adgénsa ɫ. is ranb indiumsa adgeuín indeacht .i. anima tantum adidgeúin
footnotes: a: leg. is rann din deacht
b: leg. rann
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is (only) a part of the Godhead which I know, or it is a part in me that knows the Godhead, that is, anima tantum has this knowledge.

glosses.latin: Videmus nunc per speculum in enigmate ... Nunc cognosco ex parte; tunc autem cognoscam, sicut et cognitus sum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bid [GLat]ex toto[/GLat] són im[Con]murgu[/Con] nipa [GLat]ex parte[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. bid ex toto són immurgu nipa ex parte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bid ex toto són immurgu nipa ex parte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that, however, will be ex toto: it will not be ex parte.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem manet fides, spes, caritas, trea haec; maior autem est hís caritas.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is their number.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem manet fides, spes, caritas, trea haec; maior autem est hís caritas.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even in the present world.

glosses.latin: Sectámini caritatem; aemulamini spiritalia, magis autem ut prophetetis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the three things above, spes, fides etc.

glosses.latin: Sectámini caritatem; aemulamini spiritalia, magis autem ut prophetetis.
footnotes: c: a prima manu: leg. forcanith and cf. Thurneysen C.Z. III. 49
glosses.glossTrans: (that) ye may teach.

glosses.latin: Qui enim loquitur lingua, non hominibus, sed deo loquitur; nemo enim audit, spiritu enim loquitur misteria.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he who speaks many languages.

glosses.latin: Qui enim loquitur lingua, non hominibus, sed deo loquitur; nemo enim audit, spiritu enim loquitur misteria.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for they understand it not.

glosses.latin: Qui enim loquitur lingua, non hominibus, sed deo loquitur; nemo enim audit, spiritu enim loquitur misteria.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he understands it.

glosses.latin: Qui enim loquitur lingua, non hominibus, sed deo loquitur; nemo enim audit, spiritu enim loquitur misteria.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rocluinethar cách infogur [GLat]et[/GLat] níↄfitir cid asbeir
glosses.glossText: .i. rocluinethar cách infogur et níↄfitir cid asbeir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rocluinethar cách infogur et níↄfitir cid asbeir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one hears the sound and knows not what he says.

glosses.latin: Nam qui profetat, hominibus loquitur ad aedificationem et exhortationem et consolationem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who preaches.

glosses.latin: Nam qui profetat, hominibus loquitur ad aedificationem et exhortationem et consolationem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is profit.

glosses.latin: Qui loquitur lingua semet ipsum aedificat; qui autem profetat, aeclesiam Dei aedificat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is his own profit only.

glosses.latin: Qui loquitur lingua semet ipsum aedificat; qui autem profetat, aeclesiam Dei aedificat.
glosses.glossText: .i. tuicci feissin ɫ. doáircci molad dó
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tuicci feissin ɫ. doáircci molad dó
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he himself understands, or it produces praise for him.

glosses.latin: Qui loquitur lingua semet ipsum aedificat; qui autem profetat, aeclesiam Dei aedificat.
footnotes: d: a prima mana
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who preaches.

glosses.latin: Qui loquitur lingua semet ipsum aedificat; qui autem profetat, aeclesiam Dei aedificat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is (the) profit of many.

glosses.latin: Volo autem omnes uos loqui linguís, magis autem profetare, nam maior est qui profetat, quam qui loquitur
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niarformut fribsi asbiursa inso arropad maith limsa labrad ilbelre dúibsi
glosses.glossText: .i. niarformut fribsi asbiursa inso arropad maith limsa labrad ilbelre dúibsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niarformut fribsi asbiursa inso arropad maith limsa labrad ilbelre dúibsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I say this not because of envy towards you, for I should like you to speak many tongues.

glosses.latin: Volo autem omnes uos loqui linguís, magis autem profetare, nam maior est qui profetat, quam qui loquitur
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that, however, I should prefer.

glosses.latin: Volo autem omnes uos loqui linguís, magis autem profetare, nam maior est qui profetat, quam qui loquitur
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isferr limsa didiu aní tairci inbríg móir sin duibsi
glosses.glossText: .i. isferr limsa didiu aní tairci inbríg móir sin duibsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isferr limsa didiu aní tairci inbríg móir sin duibsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I prefer, then, that which produces that great privilege to you.

glosses.latin: linguis, nisi forte ut interpretetur, ut aeclesia aedificationem accipiat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] Acht na[Con]m[/Con]máa issa[Con]m[/Con]lid istorbe són co et[Con]er[/Con]certa anasbera [GLat]et[/GLat] conrucca inætarcne cáich
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Acht nammáa issamlid istorbe són co etercerta anasbera et conrucca inætarcne cáich
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Acht nammáa issamlid istorbe són co etercerta anasbera et conrucca inætarcne cáich
glosses.glossTrans: only thus that is profitable, provided he interpret what he says and bring (it) into every one’s understanding.

glosses.latin: linguis, nisi forte ut interpretetur, ut aeclesia aedificationem accipiat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that many may believe through him.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem, fratres, si uenero ad uos linguis loquens, quid uobís prodero, nisi uobís loquar aut in reuelatione, aut scientia, aut profetia, aut doctrina?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through many languages.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem, fratres, si uenero ad uos linguis loquens, quid uobís prodero, nisi uobís loquar aut in reuelatione, aut scientia, aut profetia, aut doctrina?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dobéer desemmrecht dúib indorsa frissaco[Con]m[/Con]ricfea farnaire
glosses.glossText: .i. dobéer desemmrecht dúib indorsa frissacomricfea farnaire
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dobéer desemmrecht dúib indorsa frissacomricfea farnaire
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I will now give you an example which your attention will attain to.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem, fratres, si uenero ad uos linguis loquens, quid uobís prodero, nisi uobís loquar aut in reuelatione, aut scientia, aut profetia, aut doctrina?
footnotes: b: MS. madmne
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is my profit to you if I speak thus?

glosses.latin: Nunc autem, fratres, si uenero ad uos linguis loquens, quid uobís prodero, nisi uobís loquar aut in reuelatione, aut scientia, aut profetia, aut doctrina?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it may be manifest to every one.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem, fratres, si uenero ad uos linguis loquens, quid uobís prodero, nisi uobís loquar aut in reuelatione, aut scientia, aut profetia, aut doctrina?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that every one may know.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem, fratres, si uenero ad uos linguis loquens, quid uobís prodero, nisi uobís loquar aut in reuelatione, aut scientia, aut profetia, aut doctrina?
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]Aut profetia[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] hip[Con]re[/Con]cept [ie].i.[/ie] todiusgud neích dochretim condip irlam do baithius
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Aut profetia .i. hiprecept .i. todiusgud neích dochretim condip irlam do baithius
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Aut profetia .i. hiprecept .i. todiusgud neích dochretim condip irlam do baithius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in preaching, that is, rousing any one to believe so that he may be ready for baptism.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem, fratres, si uenero ad uos linguis loquens, quid uobís prodero, nisi uobís loquar aut in reuelatione, aut scientia, aut profetia, aut doctrina?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. teaching any one after his baptism.

glosses.latin: quae sine anima uocem dantia, siue tibia, siue cithara, nisi distinctionem sonituum dederint, quomodo scietur id quod canitur, aut quod citharizatur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. pipe.

glosses.latin: quae sine anima uocem dantia, siue tibia, siue cithara, nisi distinctionem sonituum dederint, quomodo scietur id quod canitur, aut quod citharizatur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. harp.

glosses.latin: quae sine anima uocem dantia, siue tibia, siue cithara, nisi distinctionem sonituum dederint, quomodo scietur id quod canitur, aut quod citharizatur?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] manibée dechur isint senmuim nítucatar innarríara
glosses.glossText: .i. manibée dechur isint senmuim nítucatar innarríara
glosses.glossFNs: .i. manibée dechur isint senmuim nítucatar innarríara
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless there be a difference in the sound, the notes are not understood.

glosses.latin: quae sine anima uocem dantia, siue tibia, siue cithara, nisi distinctionem sonituum dederint, quomodo scietur id quod canitur, aut quod citharizatur?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is played on the pipe or harp.

glosses.latin: quae sine anima uocem dantia, siue tibia, siue cithara, nisi distinctionem sonituum dederint, quomodo scietur id quod canitur, aut quod citharizatur?
glosses.glossTrans: or what is harped.

glosses.latin: Etenim si incertam uocem det tuba, quis praeparabit sé ad bellum?
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] cosmulius aile lesso[Con]m[/Con] inso [ie].i.[/ie] cosmulius tuib arataat ilsenman dosuidiu [GLat]et[/GLat] issain cach næ [ie].i.[/ie] issain fricath sain friscor [vel]ɫ.[/vel] fri imthect [vel]ɫ.[/vel] frisuan[c] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] comairli mani dechrigedar [Res]i[/Res]nfer nodseinn [ie].i.[/ie] mad óinríar dogné nítucthar cid frissasennar isamlid da[Con]no[/Con] maní dechrigther [GLat]et[/GLat] manitintither [Sup]am[/Sup]bélre nechtrann nithucci incách rod chluinethar
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] cosmulius aile lessom inso .i. cosmulius tuib arataat ilsenman dosuidiu et issain cach næ .i. issain fricath sain friscor ɫ. fri imthect ɫ. frisuan ɫ. comairli mani dechrigedar (i)nfer nodseinn .i. mad óinríar dogné nítucthar cid frissasennar isamlid dano maní dechrigther et manitintither [am]bélre nechtrann nithucci incách rod chluinethar
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] cosmulius aile lessom inso .i. cosmulius tuib arataat ilsenman dosuidiu et issain cach næ .i. issain fricath sain friscor ɫ. fri imthect ɫ. frisuanc ɫ. comairli mani dechrigedar (i)nfer nodseinn .i. mad óinríar dogné nítucthar cid frissasennar isamlid dano maní dechrigther et manitintither [am]bélre nechtrann nithucci incách rod chluinethar
footnotes: c: The last three letters are doubtful
d: ríar, pl. riára 12c 43, riaraib Trip. 142, 1. 12. Ríar-bind, LU. 88b 10. Cogn. with A. S. rárian
glosses.glossTrans: this is another similitude which he has, even a similitude of a trumpet: for it hath many sounds, and different is each of them, to wit, it is different for battle, different for unyoking, or for marching, or for sleep, or for council. Unless the man who sounds it distinguish – that is, if he make but one note<sup>d</sup> – what it is sounded for is not understood. Thus, then, unless the foreign language be distinguished and unless it be translated, no one who hears it understands it.

glosses.latin: Ita et uos per linguam nisi manifestum sermonem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. like to you are these two things.

glosses.latin: dederitis, quomodo scietur id quod dicitur? eritis enim in aëræ loquentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless ye translate.

glosses.latin: dederitis, quomodo scietur id quod dicitur? eritis enim in aëræ loquentes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ináer [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]accus[Con]atiuus[/Con] g[Con]re[/Con]cus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] bid essarcon aiéir dúib arnitucfa nech anasberith
glosses.glossText: .i. ináer .i. accusatiuus grecus .i. bid essarcon aiéir dúib arnitucfa nech anasberith
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ináer .i. accusatiuus grecus .i. bid essarcon aiéir dúib arnitucfa nech anasberith
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. into air, i.e. it will be a beating of the air by you, for no one will understand what ye will say.

glosses.latin: Tam multa ut potes genera lingarum sunt in hoc mundo, et nihil sine uoce est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciniglé lib ataat ilchenéle bérli isinbiuthso
glosses.glossText: .i. ciniglé lib ataat ilchenéle bérli isinbiuthso
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciniglé lib ataat ilchenéle bérli isinbiuthso
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it not clear to you that there are in this world many kinds of language?

glosses.latin: Tam multa ut potes genera lingarum sunt in hoc mundo, et nihil sine uoce est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni ↄfil t[Con]ra[/Con] belre issin[b] cenfogur [ie].i.[/ie] cetorbe[c] dúibsi di[Con]diu[/Con] infogur [d]sin[/d] mani fessid inni bess fonfogursin
glosses.glossText: .i. ni ↄfil tra belre issin cenfogur .i. cetorbe dúibsi didiu infogur sin mani fessid inni bess fonfogursin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni ↄfil tra belre issin<sup>b</sup> cenfogur .i. cetorbe<sup>c</sup> dúibsi didiu infogur sin<sup>d</sup> mani fessid inni bess fonfogursin
footnotes: b: leg. issin biuth so, which is translated
c: = ced torbe, cf. Wb. 13c 6, 19c 8
d: MS. si
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is not, then, a language in this world without sound, that is, what profit to you then (is) this sound unless ye know the sense which is under that sound?

glosses.latin: Si ergo nesciero uirtutem uocis, ero ei, cui loquor, barbarus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnitucci ambéelre asbiur ishe[e] asbéra iaru[Con]m[/Con] barbár inso
glosses.glossText: .i. arnitucci ambéelre asbiur ishe asbéra iarum barbár inso
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnitucci ambéelre asbiur ishe<sup>e</sup> asbéra iarum barbár inso
footnotes: e: leg. with Windisch ished, ‘it is this that he will say’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for he understands not the language I speak. It is he, then, that will say: ‘this is a barbarian.’

glosses.latin: Síc et uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre isamne atáa t[Con]ra[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] isferr p[Con]re[/Con]cept oldaas labrad ilbéelre bad hed dogneithsi
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre isamne atáa tra .i. isferr precept oldaas labrad ilbéelre bad hed dogneithsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre isamne atáa tra .i. isferr precept oldaas labrad ilbéelre bad hed dogneithsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since then it is thus, i.e. better is preaching than speaking many languages, be it this that ye do.

glosses.latin: Et ideo qui loquitur lingua, oret ut interpretetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be thus that ye speak well with an interpretation.

glosses.latin: Et ideo qui loquitur lingua, oret ut interpretetur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] sulbairiged [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]oret deum ut interpretetur[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ut possit [Res]inte[/Res]llegi sensus[/GLat].
glosses.glossText: .i. sulbairiged ɫ. oret deum ut interpretetur .i. ut possit (inte)llegi sensus.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sulbairiged ɫ. oret deum ut interpretetur .i. ut possit (inte)llegi sensus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him speak well.

glosses.latin: Nam si orem lingua, spiritus meus orat, mens autem mea sine fructu est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I speak well.

glosses.latin: Nam si orem lingua, spiritus meus orat, mens autem mea sine fructu est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] níthucci momenme im[Con]murgu[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quia non intellego quod loquor[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. níthucci momenme immurgu .i. quia non intellego quod loquor
glosses.glossFNs: .i. níthucci momenme immurgu .i. quia non intellego quod loquor
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. my mind, however, understands it not.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo est? orabo spiritu, orabo et mente.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cid asmaith dis[Con]un[/Con]t t[Con]ra[/Con] ni[Con]anse[/Con] sul[Con]birigfer[/Con] [GLat]spiritu et mente[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] tucfa momenme anasbérat mo beiúil
glosses.glossText: .i. cid asmaith disunt tra nianse sulbirigfer spiritu et mente .i. tucfa momenme anasbérat mo beiúil
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cid asmaith disunt tra nianse sulbirigfer spiritu et mente .i. tucfa momenme anasbérat mo beiúil
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what then is good therefrom? Easy (to answer); I will speak well spiritu et mente, i.e. my mind will understand what my lips will utter.

glosses.latin: Caeterum si benedixeris spiritu, quis suplet locum idiotae,
footnotes: f: This seems to be a gloss on quid dicas
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what thou shalt say with the sound tantum.

glosses.latin: Caeterum si benedixeris spiritu, quis suplet locum idiotae,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who shall fill?

glosses.latin: Caeterum si benedixeris spiritu, quis suplet locum idiotae,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cóor [vel]ɫ.[/vel] locc rélto [GLat]et[/GLat] foilsichtho ar nitorbe do maniréltar do
glosses.glossText: .i. cóor ɫ. locc rélto et foilsichtho ar nitorbe do maniréltar do
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cóor ɫ. locc rélto et foilsichtho ar nitorbe do maniréltar do
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. place, or locality of explaining and manifesting; for it is no profit to him unless it is explained to him.

glosses.latin: Caeterum si benedixeris spiritu, quis suplet locum idiotae,
footnotes: g: i.e. dond oscar: osgar .i. aineolach O’Dav. 109
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the simpleton or to the ignorant one.

glosses.latin: quomodo dicet ‘amen’ super tuam benedictionem, quoniam quid dicas nescit?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. on the abundance of the teaching which thou utterest.

glosses.latin: quomodo dicet ‘amen’ super tuam benedictionem, quoniam quid dicas nescit?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nifiastar som cia airm indid immaircide do ep[Con]er[/Con]t [GLat]amén[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nifiastar som cia airm indid immaircide do epert amén
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nifiastar som cia airm indid immaircide do epert amén
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he will not know at what place in it it is fitting for him to say amen.

glosses.latin: quomodo dicet ‘amen’ super tuam benedictionem, quoniam quid dicas nescit?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not easy for him to say amen in that wise.

glosses.latin: Nam tú quidem bene gratias agis, sed alter non aedificatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doadbadar im[Con]murgu[/Con] trisincainaisṅdíis file rath dée latso act nitorbe donach ailiu
glosses.glossText: .i. doadbadar immurgu trisincainaisṅdíis file rath dée latso act nitorbe donach ailiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doadbadar immurgu trisincainaisṅdíis file rath dée latso act nitorbe donach ailiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is, however, shewn by the fair statement that God’s grace is in thee; but it is no profit to any one else.

glosses.latin: Gratias ago Deo meo, quod omnium uestrum linga loquor.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arna tomontis da[Con]no[/Con] na[Con]m[/Con]badrath spirito labrad ilbéelre asbeirso[Con]m[/Con] anísiu
glosses.glossText: .i. arna tomontis dano nambadrath spirito labrad ilbéelre asbeirsom anísiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arna tomontis dano nambadrath spirito labrad ilbéelre asbeirsom anísiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he says this lest they should suppose then that speaking many tongues is not a grace of the Spirit.

glosses.latin: Gratias ago Deo meo, quod omnium uestrum linga loquor.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I, indeed, am fit to interpret it.

glosses.latin: Sed in aeclesiá uolo quinque uerba sensu meo loqui, ut et alios instruam, quam decem milia uerborum in lingua.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] insians ondid accobor limsa ícc cáich
glosses.glossText: .i. insians ondid accobor limsa ícc cáich
glosses.glossFNs: .i. insians ondid accobor limsa ícc cáich
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the understanding from which I desire to save every one.

glosses.latin: Sed in aeclesiá uolo quinque uerba sensu meo loqui, ut et alios instruam, quam decem milia uerborum in lingua.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cipcruth t[Con]ra[/Con] olse irmith[b] [GLat]sed in æclesia[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. cipcruth tra olse irmith sed in æclesia rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cipcruth tra olse irmithb sed in æclesia rl.
footnotes: b: leg. is maith ‘however it be, it is good’? J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ‘howsoever, then, it is,’ says he, ‘ .... ’

glosses.latin: Sed in aeclesiá uolo quinque uerba sensu meo loqui, ut et alios instruam, quam decem milia uerborum in lingua.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] foirbthe aranfoirbthiu[c] inso [ie].i.[/ie] deich míli briathar ar labrad ilbélre [GLat]et[/GLat] nistuccin [GLat]ut p[Con]re[/Con]dicarem ea[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. foirbthe aranfoirbthiu inso .i. deich míli briathar ar labrad ilbélre et nistuccin ut predicarem ea
glosses.glossFNs: .i. foirbthe aranfoirbthiuc inso .i. deich míli briathar ar labrad ilbélre et nistuccin ut predicarem ea
footnotes: c: cf. 9a 10 supra
d: cf. Sg. 207b 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ‘perfect for imperfectd’ (is) this, that is, ‘ten thousand words’ for ‘speaking many tongues’; and I should not understand them ut praedicarem ea.

glosses.latin: In lege scriptum est: quoniam in alís linguis et alís labís loquar populo huic; et nec síc exaudient me, dicit Dominus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] do óis anfoirbthiu t[Con]ra[/Con] asrobrad insin nabad anfoirbthisi da[Con]no[/Con] arnáp immaircide dúib
glosses.glossText: .i. do óis anfoirbthiu tra asrobrad insin nabad anfoirbthisi dano arnáp immaircide dúib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. do óis anfoirbthiu tra asrobrad insin nabad anfoirbthisi dano arnáp immaircide dúib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to imperfect folk that, now, has been said. Be ye not imperfect, then, lest it be appropriate to you.

glosses.latin: In lege scriptum est: quoniam in alís linguis et alís labís loquar populo huic; et nec síc exaudient me, dicit Dominus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it (the Jewish people) will know every language when it shall be carried into captivity.

glosses.latin: In lege scriptum est: quoniam in alís linguis et alís labís loquar populo huic; et nec síc exaudient me, dicit Dominus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciarud chualatar ilbélre [GLat]et[/GLat] cenuslabratar nipat ferr de isfollus di[Con]diu[/Con] nanmáar bríg labrad ilbélre
glosses.glossText: .i. ciarud chualatar ilbélre et cenuslabratar nipat ferr de isfollus didiu nanmáar bríg labrad ilbélre
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciarud chualatar ilbélre et cenuslabratar nipat ferr de isfollus didiu nanmáar bríg labrad ilbélre
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though they have heard many languages, and though they speak them, they will not be the better for it. It is manifest, then, that speaking many languages is not of great value.

glosses.latin: Itaque linguae in signum sunt non fidelibus sed infidelibus; profetae autem non infidelibus sed fidélibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished torbe na[Con]m[/Con]máa t[Con]ra[/Con] aratobarr labrad ilbelre conroadamrigther dia triit [GLat]et[/GLat] combat irlamude indancreitmich dochretim
glosses.glossText: .i. ished torbe nammáa tra aratobarr labrad ilbelre conroadamrigther dia triit et combat irlamude indancreitmich dochretim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished torbe nammáa tra aratobarr labrad ilbelre conroadamrigther dia triit et combat irlamude indancreitmich dochretim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, then, is the only profit for which speaking many tongues is given, that God may be glorified thereby and that unbelievers may be the readier to believe.

glosses.latin: Itaque linguae in signum sunt non fidelibus sed infidelibus; profetae autem non infidelibus sed fidélibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. preceptors.

glosses.latin: Itaque linguae in signum sunt non fidelibus sed infidelibus; profetae autem non infidelibus sed fidélibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. teaching, however, it is to the faithful folk.

glosses.latin: Si ergo conueniat uniuersa aeclesia in unum, et omnes
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. also to forbid greed.

glosses.latin: linguís loquantur, intrent autem idiotae aut infidiles, nonne dicent, quod insanitis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without profitableness of teaching.

glosses.latin: linguís loquantur, intrent autem idiotae aut infidiles, nonne dicent, quod insanitis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. simpletons or unfaithful men.

glosses.latin: linguís loquantur, intrent autem idiotae aut infidiles, nonne dicent, quod insanitis?
footnotes: a: a manu prima
glosses.glossTrans: or the simpletons.

glosses.latin: linguís loquantur, intrent autem idiotae aut infidiles, nonne dicent, quod insanitis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is what they will say: ‘these men are mad.’

glosses.latin: Si autem omnes profetant, intret autem quis infidelis ... deiudicatur ab omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if they preach.

glosses.latin: Si autem omnes profetant, intret autem quis infidelis ... deiudicatur ab omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. judgment is passed upon him.

glosses.latin: Si autem omnes profetant, intret autem quis infidelis ... deiudicatur ab omnibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] trissinp[Con]re[/Con]cept bésti [b]ituisemar[/b] bestatu cáich [GLat]et[/GLat] ní fristait inbéstatid nisin [ie].i.[/ie] gním [GLat]et[/GLat] briathar [GLat]et[/GLat] imbrádud
glosses.glossText: .i. trissinprecept bésti ituisemar bestatu cáich et ní fristait inbéstatid nisin .i. gním et briathar et imbrádud
