glosses.glossFNs: .i. trissinprecept bésti ituisemarb bestatu cáich et ní fristait inbéstatid nisin .i. gním et briathar et imbrádud
footnotes: b: MS. seems ituiremar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through the moral teaching in which every one’s morality is generated; and what opposes(?) that morality, to wit, deed and word and cogitation.

glosses.latin: adorabit Deum, pronuntians quod uere Deus in uobís sit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (that) every one of these men is a prophet.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo [est,] fratres? Cum conuenitis, unusquisque uestrum psalmum habet, doctrinam habet, apocalipsin habet, linguam
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cid asdénti frisin t[Con]ra[/Con] ni[Con]anse[/Con] gaibed cách ásalmu [GLat]et[/GLat] forcanad [GLat]et[/GLat] foilsiged ciped techtas nech bad [GLat]ad edificationem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. cid asdénti frisin tra nianse gaibed cách ásalmu et forcanad et foilsiged ciped techtas nech bad ad edificationem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cid asdénti frisin tra nianse gaibed cách ásalmu et forcanad et foilsiged ciped techtas nech bad ad edificationem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what then is to be done with reference to that? Easy (to answer): let every one sing his psalms, and teach and set forth: whatever it is that any one has, let it be ad aedificationem.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo [est,] fratres? Cum conuenitis, unusquisque uestrum psalmum habet, doctrinam habet, apocalipsin habet, linguam
footnotes: c: Hoc est, intelligit psalmum, Migne, col. 793
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he understands what the psalm says.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo [est,] fratres? Cum conuenitis, unusquisque uestrum psalmum habet, doctrinam habet, apocalipsin habet, linguam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. after baptism.

glosses.latin: Quid ergo [est,] fratres? Cum conuenitis, unusquisque uestrum psalmum habet, doctrinam habet, apocalipsin habet, linguam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. manifestation of mysteries.

glosses.latin: habet, interpretationem habet omnia ad aedificationem fiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. speaking many languages, with their translation into another language.

glosses.latin: habet, interpretationem habet omnia ad aedificationem fiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. out of a language into a language.

glosses.latin: habet, interpretationem habet omnia ad aedificationem fiant.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] sechiphé dán t[Con]ra[/Con] doberthar doneuch bad fricu[Con]m[/Con]tach necolso immabera [ie].i.[/ie] cu[Con]m[/Con]tach sochuide inhiris
glosses.glossText: .i. sechiphé dán tra doberthar doneuch bad fricumtach necolso immabera .i. cumtach sochuide inhiris
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sechiphé dán tra doberthar doneuch bad fricumtach necolso immabera .i. cumtach sochuide inhiris
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whatever, then, be the gift that shall be bestowed on any one, let it be for the edification of the Church that he employs it, even edification of a multitude in faith.

glosses.latin: Siue lingua quis loquitur, secundum duos, aut [ut] multum tres, et per partes, et unus interpretatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mabeith nech and t[Con]ra[/Con] labrathar ilbélre nabad lia diis nothriur da[Con]no[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. mabeith nech and tra labrathar ilbélre nabad lia diis nothriur dano
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mabeith nech and tra labrathar ilbélre nabad lia diis nothriur dano
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if there be any one, then, who speaks many languages, let it not be more than two or three persons then,

glosses.latin: Siue lingua quis loquitur, secundum duos, aut [ut] multum tres, et per partes, et unus interpretatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]loquantur[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] act badchách darési áréli [ie].i.[/ie] nabad immalle labritir
glosses.glossText: .i. loquantur .i. act badchách darési áréli .i. nabad immalle labritir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. loquantur .i. act badchách darési áréli .i. nabad immalle labritir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but let it be each one after the other, that is, let them not speak at the same time.

glosses.latin: Siue lingua quis loquitur, secundum duos, aut [ut] multum tres, et per partes, et unus interpretatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] badóinfeir[d] nodp[Con]ri[/Con]dcha arisdochruth comirsire nadesse [vel]ɫ.[/vel] intríir etarcertar oinfer inchrud sin
glosses.glossText: .i. badóinfeir nodpridcha arisdochruth comirsire nadesse ɫ. intríir etarcertar oinfer inchrud sin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. badóinfeir<sup>d</sup> nodpridcha arisdochruth comirsire nadesse ɫ. intríir etarcertar oinfer inchrud sin
footnotes: d: cf. lassin feir Wb. 13a 20
e: cf. aursaire O’Mulc. Gl. 202 (Celt. Archiv i. 243, 280), Ersaire LL. 28a 11
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be one man who preaches it, for unseemly is the barking<sup>e</sup>(?) of two or three at the same time. One man is interpreted in that manner.

glosses.latin: Si autem non fuerit interpres, taceat in aeclesia, sibi autem loquatur et Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it will not understand it.

glosses.latin: Si autem non fuerit interpres, taceat in aeclesia, sibi autem loquatur et Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he himself understands it tantum.

glosses.latin: Profétae [autem] duo aut tris dicant, et queteri diiudicent.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] islour dap[Con]re[/Con]ceptóir inæclis nothíi descipuil olchene [GLat]et[/GLat] foglimthidi cách darhési álaili
glosses.glossText: .i. islour dapreceptóir inæclis nothíi descipuil olchene et foglimthidi cách darhési álaili
glosses.glossFNs: .i. islour dapreceptóir inæclis nothíi descipuil olchene et foglimthidi cách darhési álaili
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. enough are two teachers in a church or three: disciples besides and students, each after the other.

glosses.latin: Profétae [autem] duo aut tris dicant, et queteri diiudicent.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] conicfidsi bede p[Con]re[/Con]ceptori uili trisanimthanadsa[a] [b]diacoitsea[/b] cách frialaile
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. conicfidsi bede preceptori uili trisanimthanadsa diacoitsea cách frialaile
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. conicfidsi bede preceptori uili trisanimthanadsa<sup>a</sup> diacoitsea<sup>b</sup> cách frialaile
footnotes: a: Hence, and from Ml. 93c 7, Wb. 21a 13, we see that there is a neuter imthanad by imthanu
b: MS. dicoitsea
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye will all be able to be teachers through this alternation if each listen to the other.

glosses.latin: Profétae [autem] duo aut tris dicant, et queteri diiudicent.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] éitset frisinp[Con]re[/Con]cept [GLat]et[/GLat] berat brith fuiri [GLat]quia mos est apud illos[/GLat] freisṅdis [GLat]p[Con]re[/Con]dicatorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. éitset frisinprecept et berat brith fuiri quia mos est apud illos freisṅdis predicatorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. éitset frisinprecept et berat brith fuiri quia mos est apud illos freisṅdis predicatorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let them listen to the teaching and pass judgment upon it, quia mos est apud illos confutation praedicatorum.

glosses.latin: Quod si ali reuelatum fuerit sedenti, prior taceat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mabeidní dirúnaib dothéi armenmuin indfir bíis innasuidiu [GLat]et[/GLat] adreig[c]
glosses.glossText: .i. mabeidní dirúnaib dothéi armenmuin indfir bíis innasuidiu et adreig
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mabeidní dirúnaib dothéi armenmuin indfir bíis innasuidiu et adreigc
footnotes: c: = ad-d-reig
h: Literally, ‘if there should be anything of mysteries that should come upon’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if aught of the mysteries should come<sup>h</sup> into the mind of the man who is sitting, and he rises.

glosses.latin: Quod si ali reuelatum fuerit sedenti, prior taceat.
footnotes: i: Hitherto glosses 12 and 12a have been printed as one
glosses.glossTrans: his fellow, i.e. he that was master prius, so that he becomes disciple posti.

glosses.latin: Potestis enim omnes per singulos profetare, ut omnes discant, et omnes exortentur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] Frecre lesso[Con]m[/Con] inso [GLat]mentibus illorum[/GLat] ma asberad nech intain asṁbeirso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]potestis enim per singulos[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [ie].i.[/ie] bid [Res]p[Con]re[/Con]c[/Res]eptóir cách and [Res]ol[/Res]isamein conicfedsi[d] [GLat]profetare[/GLat] mad [GLat]per singulos[/GLat] C[Con]ei[/Con]st t[Con]ra[/Con] [GLat]et mulieres[/GLat] cid dogénat sidi hip[Con]ri[/Con]dchabat[e] nathó olpol [GLat]taceant[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc][f]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Frecre lessom inso mentibus illorum ma asberad nech intain asṁbeirsom potestis enim per singulos rl. .i. bid (prec)eptóir cách and (ol)isamein conicfedsi profetare mad per singulos Ceist tra et mulieres cid dogénat sidi hipridchabat nathó olpol taceant rl.
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Frecre lessom inso mentibus illorum ma asberad nech intain asṁbeirsom potestis enim per singulos rl. .i. bid (prec)eptóir cách and (ol)isamein conicfedsid profetare mad per singulos Ceist tra et mulieres cid dogénat sidi hipridchabate nathó olpol taceant rl.f
footnotes: d: recte conicfidsi: cf. cretfed Wb. 1a 3, sóirfed 32d 13
e: leg. inpridchabat?
f: This marginal gloss seems to refer to v. 34
glosses.glossTrans: This an answer of his mentibus illorum, if, when he says potestis etc., i.e., ‘every one will be a teacher there. For it is thus that ye will be able prophetare, if it be per singulos,’ any one should say: ‘Question, then, et mulieres? what will these do? will they preach?’ ‘No,’ says Paul, ‘taceant’ etc.

glosses.latin: Potestis enim omnes per singulos profetare, ut omnes discant, et omnes exortentur.
footnotes: g: MS. taceat
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. taceant indeed, that is, all who are listening.

glosses.latin: Potestis enim omnes per singulos profetare, ut omnes discant, et omnes exortentur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all who preach.

glosses.latin: Et spiritus profetarum profetis subiecti sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bertit alaili t[Con]ra[/Con] co[Con]m[/Con]bad spirut nóib robói [GLat]in profetís ueteris[/GLat] co[Con]m[/Con]badhé bad foammamigthe [GLat]profetís noui[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]apostolis, quod non uerum[/GLat] air ní díib attáa briathar less [GLat]híc sed de p[Con]re[/Con]dicatoribus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. bertit alaili tra combad spirut nóib robói in profetís ueteris combadhé bad foammamigthe profetís noui .i. apostolis, quod non uerum air ní díib attáa briathar less híc sed de predicatoribus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bertit alaili tra combad spirut nóib robói in profetís ueteris combadhé bad foammamigthe profetís noui .i. apostolis, quod non uerum air ní díib attáa briathar less híc sed de predicatoribus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. some take it that it was the Holy Spirit who was in prophetis Veteris (Testamenti), who was subjected prophetis Novi (Testamenti), i.e. apostolis; quod non uerum, for it is not of them (the prophets of the O.T.) that he (Paul) speaks hic, sed de praedicatoribus.

glosses.latin: Non enim est dissentionis Deus, sed pacis; sicut [et] in omnibus aeclesís sanctorum doceo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. attention to another is due from every one.

glosses.latin: Non enim est dissentionis Deus, sed pacis; sicut [et] in omnibus aeclesís sanctorum doceo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that He is a God of peace and is of concord.

glosses.latin: Mulieres in aeclesís taceant.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]sí sint uiri in p[Con]re[/Con]sentia[/GLat] arisinsæ inball [a]dothinchosc[/a] neich asberad cenn
glosses.glossText: .i. sí sint uiri in presentia arisinsæ inball dothinchosc neich asberad cenn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sí sint uiri in presentia arisinsæ inball dothinchosca neich asberad cenn
footnotes: a: MS. dothinchos
glosses.glossTrans: for it is impossible that the member should correct what the head might utter.

glosses.latin: Án á uobís sermo Dei processit? Aut in uos solos peruenit?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issuaícnid t[Con]ra[/Con] nipo accobor lassinfeir nop[Con]ri[/Con]dchad suide [GLat]et[/GLat] acheile dothuidect darahési amæ ǽm nípo uáib act ba o apsatalib
glosses.glossText: .i. issuaícnid tra nipo accobor lassinfeir nopridchad suide et acheile dothuidect darahési amæ ǽm nípo uáib act ba o apsatalib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issuaícnid tra nipo accobor lassinfeir nopridchad suide et acheile dothuidect darahési amæ ǽm nípo uáib act ba o apsatalib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is obvious, then, that the man who used to preach had no desire to sit down, and his fellow to come in his place. Verily, indeed, it was not from you, but from (the) apostles.

glosses.latin: Án á uobís sermo Dei processit? Aut in uos solos peruenit?
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] indúib nammá rop[Con]ri[/Con]dchad amae ni dúib [GLat]sed omnibus gentibus[/GLat]. [GLat]Án a uobís[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nitacair denu[Con]m[/Con] domuin dind soscélu
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. indúib nammá ropridchad amae ni dúib sed omnibus gentibus. Án a uobís .i. nitacair denum domuin dind soscélu
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. indúib nammá ropridchad amae ni dúib sed omnibus gentibus. Án a uobís .i. nitacair denum domuin dind soscélu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it to you only that there has been preaching? Verily not to you (alone), sed omnibus gentibus. It is not meet to make (aught) profound of the Gospel.

glosses.latin: Si quis uidetur profeta esse, aut spiritualis, cognoscat quae scribo uobís, quia Domini sunt mandata.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bíith amenme frisso[b] bad sa[Con]m[/Con]lid p[Con]ri[/Con]dchaid
glosses.glossText: .i. bíith amenme frisso bad samlid pridchaid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bíith amenme frisso<sup>b</sup> bad samlid pridchaid
footnotes: b: leg. frissom, cf. Sg. 209a
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let his mind be to this: let him preach thus.

glosses.latin: Si quis uidetur profeta esse, aut spiritualis, cognoscat quae scribo uobís, quia Domini sunt mandata.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] act cuit ascribint domsa it [GLat]domini[/GLat] som im[Con]murgu[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. act cuit ascribint domsa it domini som immurgu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. act cuit ascribint domsa it domini som immurgu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. except in their having been written by me; they are the Lord’s, however.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem ignorat, ignorabitur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a Deo in bestowal of grace.

glosses.latin: Itaque, fratres, aemulamini profetare, et loqui linguis nolite prohibere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but let it be as I say it.

glosses.latin: Itaque, fratres, aemulamini profetare, et loqui linguis nolite prohibere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided it be with interpretation of those languages.

glosses.latin: Itaque, fratres, aemulamini profetare, et loqui linguis nolite prohibere.
footnotes: f: di is used here as the Irish ar-gar- ‘forbid’ is followed by di
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (to forbid) you yourselves or any one else<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Itaque, fratres, aemulamini profetare, et loqui linguis nolite prohibere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] Far[Con]con[/Con]gair so[Con]m[/Con] t[Con]ra[/Con] s[Con]un[/Con]t indsamuil[c] p[Con]re[/Con]cepte [GLat]et[/GLat] labrad ilbélre act ropochotorbu æcolsa
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Farcongair som tra sunt indsamuil precepte et labrad ilbélre act ropochotorbu æcolsa
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Farcongair som tra sunt indsamuilc precepte et labrad ilbélre act ropochotorbu æcolsa
footnotes: c: recte intamuil
glosses.glossTrans: Here, then, he orders (them) to imitate (his) preaching and to speak many languages, provided it be with profit to the Church.

glosses.latin: Omnia autem uestra honeste et secundum ordinem fiant.
footnotes: d: Cf. ni cumaing foruacrae firinnde inna techta, and an taun mbis a cridhe ina techta, Celt. Zeitschr. III. 450, 451
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every act be in its proper order.

glosses.latin: Omnia autem uestra honeste et secundum ordinem fiant.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] badféal [GLat]et[/GLat] bad[e]fedte[/e] dogneid cachréit cid p[Con]re[/Con]cept cid labrad ilbélre bed am[Con]al[/Con] asinbiursa dogneither [GLat]et[/GLat] is béim foris inso forsnadlígetha remep[Con]er[/Con]thi [vel]ɫ.[/vel] istitul indligid archiunn
glosses.glossText: .i. badféal et badfedte dogneid cachréit cid precept cid labrad ilbélre bed amal asinbiursa dogneither et is béim foris inso forsnadlígetha remeperthi ɫ. istitul indligid archiunn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. badféal et badfedtee dogneid cachréit cid precept cid labrad ilbélre bed amal asinbiursa dogneither et is béim foris inso forsnadlígetha remeperthi ɫ. istitul indligid archiunn
footnotes: e: MS. fete with a mark above the d and a similar mark below the t. Féal may be borrowed from O. Fr. feal (*fedalis), W. S. fedte (fédte) derived from 2. fíad (Ehre, Wind. Wtb.), Thurneysen
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be faithfully and let it be honorably that ye do everything. Whether it be preaching, whether it be speaking many languages, let it be done as I say it. And this is a recapitulation of the aforesaid dicta. Or it is the title of the dictum ahead.

glosses.latin: Notum autem facio uobís, fratres, euangelium quod praedicaui uobís, quod et accipistis, in quo [et] státis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye have indeed received my teaching.

glosses.latin: Notum autem facio uobís, fratres, euangelium quod praedicaui uobís, quod et accipistis, in quo [et] státis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is a praise to them.

glosses.latin: Per quod et saluamini qua ratione praedicauerim uobís, si tenetis, nisi frustra credidistis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as hath been preached to you, let it he thus that ye fulfil it.

glosses.latin: Per quod et saluamini qua ratione praedicauerim uobís, si tenetis, nisi frustra credidistis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bacoir cenachomalnithe rop[Con]ri[/Con]dchad mór namri dúib
glosses.glossText: .i. bacoir cenachomalnithe ropridchad mór namri dúib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bacoir cenachomalnithe ropridchad mór namri dúib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were fitting that ye should fulfil it: much of marvel has been preached unto you.

glosses.latin: Per quod et saluamini qua ratione praedicauerim uobís, si tenetis, nisi frustra credidistis.
footnotes: a: leg. rochretsid, which is translated
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. except the belief which ye have believed is vain.

glosses.latin: Tradidi enim uobís inprimís, quod et accipi: quoniam Christus mortuus est pro peccatis nostris, secundum Scripturas.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aní itáa cuntubart libsi [ie].i.[/ie] esséirge ished rorélus dúib recachréit
glosses.glossText: .i. aní itáa cuntubart libsi .i. esséirge ished rorélus dúib recachréit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aní itáa cuntubart libsi .i. esséirge ished rorélus dúib recachréit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that as to which there is doubt among you, to wit, resurrection, this is what I have set forth to you before everything.

glosses.latin: Tradidi enim uobís inprimís, quod et accipi: quoniam Christus mortuus est pro peccatis nostris, secundum Scripturas.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] donairchet hífáithib [GLat]et[/GLat] rofiugrad irrect [GLat]et[/GLat] am[Con]al[/Con] asṅindedar issoscélu
glosses.glossText: .i. amal donairchet hífáithib et rofiugrad irrect et amal asṅindedar issoscélu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal donairchet hífáithib et rofiugrad irrect et amal asṅindedar issoscélu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as hath been foretold in the Prophets and hath been figured in the Law, and as is declared in the Gospel.

glosses.latin: Et quia uisus est Cephae et post hoc undecim.
glosses.glossTrans: of Zion.

glosses.latin: Deinde uisus est plus quam quincentís fratribus [simul], ex quibus multi manent usque adhuc.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in summo marg.[/Com] ... [Res]doadb[/Res]adar intaidbsiu hi siu t[Con]ra[/Con] do[Res]naib[/Res] coic cetaib ...... robói isinchaithir isindaimsirsin
glosses.glossText: [in summo marg.] ... (doadb)adar intaidbsiu hi siu tra do(naib) coic cetaib ...... robói isinchaithir isindaimsirsin
glosses.glossFNs: [in summo marg.] ... (doadb)adar intaidbsiu hi siu tra do(naib) coic cetaib ...... robói isinchaithir isindaimsirsin
glosses.glossTrans: this appearance, then, is manifested to the five hundred ...... that was in the city at that time.

glosses.latin: Deinde uisus est plus quam quincentís fratribus [simul], ex quibus multi manent usque adhuc.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] oillu oldate cóiccét fer dodemnigud t[Con]ra[/Con] [GLat]resurrectionis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. oillu oldate cóiccét fer dodemnigud tra resurrectionis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. oillu oldate cóiccét fer dodemnigud tra resurrectionis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. more than five hundred men; for certifying resurrectionis then.

glosses.latin: Deinde uisus est plus quam quincentís fratribus [simul], ex quibus multi manent usque adhuc.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in uita[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] mad aill duib cid accalda[Con]m[/Con] neich diib darigente
glosses.glossText: .i. in uita .i. mad aill duib cid accaldam neich diib darigente
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in uita .i. mad aill duib cid accaldam neich diib darigente
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye desired even to converse with any of them, ye could do it.

glosses.latin: Ego enim sum minimus apostolorum, qui non sum dignus uocari apostolus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. youngest.

glosses.latin: Ego enim sum minimus apostolorum, qui non sum dignus uocari apostolus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arismiad mór indapstalacht [ie].i.[/ie] buid fortectairecht hó ísu
glosses.glossText: .i. arismiad mór indapstalacht .i. buid fortectairecht hó ísu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arismiad mór indapstalacht .i. buid fortectairecht hó ísu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for a great honour is the apostleship, even to be on an embassy from Jesus.

glosses.latin: Gratia Dei sum id quod sum, et gratia eius in me uacua non fuit; sed abundantius illís omnibus laboraui.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] israd dée immu[Con]m[/Con]forling conda aps[Con]tal[/Con] liussa[b]
glosses.glossText: .i. israd dée immumforling conda apstal liussa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. israd dée immumforling conda apstal liussa<sup>b</sup>
footnotes: b: ‘a loathsome apostle’? Perhaps liussa is the gen. sg. of liuss fastidium, Ascoli Gloss. pal. hib. clxv. So Windisch suggests. W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God’s grace has caused me to be an apostle ....

glosses.latin: Gratia Dei sum id quod sum, et gratia eius in me uacua non fuit; sed abundantius illís omnibus laboraui.
footnotes: c: lit. servivit, has served
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not void has been his service<sup>c</sup>,

glosses.latin: Gratia Dei sum id quod sum, et gratia eius in me uacua non fuit; sed abundantius illís omnibus laboraui.
glosses.glossTrans: though he was minimus and though he was abortiuus.

glosses.latin: Siue enim ego, siue illi, síc praedicamus, et síc credidistis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isoéntu forcitil linn hóre isóenrad fíl linn
glosses.glossText: .i. isoéntu forcitil linn hóre isóenrad fíl linn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isoéntu forcitil linn hóre isóenrad fíl linn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is unity of teaching to us because it is one grace that we have.

glosses.latin: Siue enim ego, siue illi, síc praedicamus, et síc credidistis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as we have preached it, ye have believed it.

glosses.latin: quomodo quidam dicunt in uobís, quoniam resurrectio mortuorum non est?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isaithiss doibso[Con]m[/Con] cid anísiu [ie].i.[/ie] cenp[Con]re[/Con]cept dondais anfiss
glosses.glossText: .i. isaithiss doibsom cid anísiu .i. cenprecept dondais anfiss
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isaithiss doibsom cid anísiu .i. cenprecept dondais anfiss
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even this is a disgrace to them, that is, not to preach to the ignorant folk.

glosses.latin: quomodo quidam dicunt in uobís, quoniam resurrectio mortuorum non est?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] masuglé lib t[Con]ra[/Con] inp[Con]re[/Con]cept rop[Con]ri[/Con]dchussa [ie].i.[/ie] asréracht cr[Con]ist[/Con] hómarbaib cid dialeícid cundubairt fordrecht uáib [GLat]de resurrectione hominum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. masuglé lib tra inprecept ropridchussa .i. asréracht crist hómarbaib cid dialeícid cundubairt fordrecht uáib de resurrectione hominum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. masuglé lib tra inprecept ropridchussa .i. asréracht crist hómarbaib cid dialeícid cundubairt fordrecht uáib de resurrectione hominum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if, then, the doctrine which I have preached is clear to you, to wit, that Christ hath arisen from the dead, why do ye leave doubt on a section of you de resurrectione hominum?

glosses.latin: Si autem resurrectio mortuorum non est, neque Christus resurrexit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isgnáth t[Con]ra[/Con] inso dond óis glicc dolleicet forru indáil [GLat]et[/GLat] fobenat iaru[Con]m[/Con] innadeud hórogaibther cíall forriuth[a] combi remib rethith iarum[b]
glosses.glossText: .i. isgnáth tra inso dond óis glicc dolleicet forru indáil et fobenat iarum innadeud hórogaibther cíall forriuth combi remib rethith iarum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isgnáth tra inso dond óis glicc dolleicet forru indáil et fobenat iarum innadeud hórogaibther cíall forriutha combi remib rethith iarumb
footnotes: a: After this seems to come s and then three illegible letters
b: This gloss is obscure, and the meaning ascribed to fobenat ( = subveniunt?) is doubtful
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, then, is usual for the cunning folk, (that) they let the crowd pass them and then steal up(?) after it when they are intent on running, so that afterwards he runs before them<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Si autem Christus non resurrexit, inanis est ergo praedicatio nostra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isuabar [GLat]et[/GLat] isfass dúnni ap[Con]ri[/Con]dchimme manidfír [GLat]ut dicunt illi[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isuabar et isfass dúnni apridchimme manidfír ut dicunt illi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isuabar et isfass dúnni apridchimme manidfír ut dicunt illi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. vanity and void for us is what we preach unless it is true ut etc.

glosses.latin: Inuenimur autem et falsi testes Dei, quoniam testimonium diximus aduersus Deum, quod suscitauerit Christum quem non suscitauit, si mortui non resurgunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is false testimony which we give of God in that case.

glosses.latin: Inuenimur autem et falsi testes Dei, quoniam testimonium diximus aduersus Deum, quod suscitauerit Christum quem non suscitauit, si mortui non resurgunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that witness is against Godhead.

glosses.latin: Inuenimur autem et falsi testes Dei, quoniam testimonium diximus aduersus Deum, quod suscitauerit Christum quem non suscitauit, si mortui non resurgunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] límmi fordia ní nád deirgéni inchruthsin [ie].i.[/ie] todiusgud cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. límmi fordia ní nád deirgéni inchruthsin .i. todiusgud crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. límmi fordia ní nád deirgéni inchruthsin .i. todiusgud crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we impute to God a thing which He has not done in that wise, to wit, the raising of Christ.

glosses.latin: Nam si mortui non resurgunt neque Christus resurrexit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isairi ǽm liimse forruso[Con]m[/Con] díltud eisséirgi cr[Con]ist[/Con] hóre disluindet [GLat]resurrectionem mortuorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isairi ǽm liimse forrusom díltud eisséirgi crist hóre disluindet resurrectionem mortuorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isairi ǽm liimse forrusom díltud eisséirgi crist hóre disluindet resurrectionem mortuorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore do I accuse them of denying Christ’s resurrection, because they deny resurrectionem mortuorum.

glosses.latin: Quod si Christus non resurrexit, uana est fides uestra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issuáichnid manidchretid esséirge cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]et mortuorum[/GLat] nibnóibfea for nires inchruthsin [GLat]et[/GLat] níbscara fribarpecthu
glosses.glossText: .i. issuáichnid manidchretid esséirge crist et mortuorum nibnóibfea for nires inchruthsin et níbscara fribarpecthu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issuáichnid manidchretid esséirge crist et mortuorum nibnóibfea for nires inchruthsin et níbscara fribarpecthu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is manifest (that) unless ye believe the resurrection of Christ et mortuorum, your faith will not sanctify you in that wise, and doth not sever you from your sins.

glosses.latin: Ergo et qui dormierunt in Christo, perierunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is perishing to them unless they have life eternal.

glosses.latin: Si in hac uita tantum in Christo sperantes sumus, misserabiliores sumus omnibus hominibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] massu bethu cr[Con]ist[/Con] na[Con]m[/Con]má cretmeni issiu [vel]ɫ.[/vel] massu armbethuni siu na[Con]m[/Con]má
glosses.glossText: .i. massu bethu crist nammá cretmeni issiu ɫ. massu armbethuni siu nammá
glosses.glossFNs: .i. massu bethu crist nammá cretmeni issiu ɫ. massu armbethuni siu nammá
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is Christ’s life only that we believe here, or if it is our life here only.

glosses.latin: Si in hac uita tantum in Christo sperantes sumus, misserabiliores sumus omnibus hominibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. beyond every one.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem Christus resurrexit a mortuis, primitiae dormientium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished ón im[Con]murgu[/Con] as fír [GLat]et[/GLat] isfír da[Con]no[/Con] esséirge [GLat]omnium post sé[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ished ón immurgu as fír et isfír dano esséirge omnium post sé
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished ón immurgu as fír et isfír dano esséirge omnium post sé
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is that, however, which is true, and true, moreover, is resurrection omnium post sé.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem Christus resurrexit a mortuis, primitiae dormientium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] it p[Con]ri[/Con]miti [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]nomen plur[Con]ale[/Con][/GLat] isp[Con]ri[/Con]mitso[Con]m[/Con] mor[Con]ad[/Con] in[Res]esseir[/Res]giu [GLat]et[/GLat] a[Res]i[/Res]ritiu indocbále[c]
glosses.glossText: .i. it primiti .i. nomen plurale isprimitsom morad in(esseir)giu et a(i)ritiu indocbále
glosses.glossFNs: .i. it primiti .i. nomen plurale isprimitsom morad in(esseir)giu et a(i)ritiu indocbálec
footnotes: c: This gloss is confusedly arranged: mórad and airitiu seem to go with itprimiti
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are first-fruits i.e. nomen plurale, He is first-fruit, magnifying in resurrection and receiving glory.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem per hominem mors, ita et per hominem resurrectio mortuorum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem per hominem mors, ita et per hominem resurrectio mortuorum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem per hominem mors, ita et per hominem resurrectio mortuorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a similitude with dissimilitude then (is) this.

glosses.latin: Unusquisque autem in suo ordine.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]resurget[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ní dodechur úirt in esséirgu inso arbid immalle asseírset [GLat]omnes mortui[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. resurget .i. ní dodechur úirt in esséirgu inso arbid immalle asseírset omnes mortui
glosses.glossFNs: .i. resurget .i. ní dodechur úirt in esséirgu inso arbid immalle asseírset omnes mortui
footnotes: e: temporis vel honoris, Primasius, Migne, Patr. Lat. lxviii. 545
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not to distinguish ordere in resurrection (is) this, for it will be together that omnes mortui will arise.

glosses.latin: Unusquisque autem in suo ordine.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] inúrt airiten fochricce do fíríanaib [GLat]et[/GLat] inurt airiten pían dophecthachaib
glosses.glossText: .i. inúrt airiten fochricce do fíríanaib et inurt airiten pían dophecthachaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inúrt airiten fochricce do fíríanaib et inurt airiten pían dophecthachaib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in order of receiving reward by the righteous and in order of receiving punishments by the sinners.

glosses.latin: Deinde finis, cum tradiderit regnum Deo et Patri, cum euacuauerit omnem principatum et potestatem et uirtutem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bieid crich fortimtherecht cacha dúlo arniricfider alless [GLat]postea[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. bieid crich fortimtherecht cacha dúlo arniricfider alless postea
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bieid crich fortimtherecht cacha dúlo arniricfider alless postea
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there will be an end to the service of every creature, for postea it will not be needed.

glosses.latin: Deinde finis, cum tradiderit regnum Deo et Patri, cum euacuauerit omnem principatum et potestatem et uirtutem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isand ǽm bieid [GLat]finis[/GLat] lasse donindin inmacc dondathir innahíi irrufollnastar siú
glosses.glossText: .i. isand ǽm bieid finis lasse donindin inmacc dondathir innahíi irrufollnastar siú
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isand ǽm bieid finis lasse donindin inmacc dondathir innahíi irrufollnastar siú
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. then indeed will be finis when the Son shall deliver to the Father these things wherein He has reigned here.

glosses.latin: Deinde finis, cum tradiderit regnum Deo et Patri, cum euacuauerit omnem principatum et potestatem et uirtutem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Deinde finis, cum tradiderit regnum Deo et Patri, cum euacuauerit omnem principatum et potestatem et uirtutem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He will put them under the power of the Son.

glosses.latin: Deinde finis, cum tradiderit regnum Deo et Patri, cum euacuauerit omnem principatum et potestatem et uirtutem.
glosses.glossTrans: for every grade hath sinned therein.

glosses.latin: Nouissima autem inimica distruetur mors.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] sechihed bás són imbás etarscartha coirp [GLat]et[/GLat] anme [GLat]et[/GLat] bás pǽne [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. sechihed bás són imbás etarscartha coirp et anme et bás pǽne rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sechihed bás són imbás etarscartha coirp et anme et bás pǽne rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whatsoever death that maybe, whether death of separation of body and soul and (leg. or) penal death.

glosses.latin: Omnia subiecta sunt éi; sine dubio praeter eum qui subiecit éi omnia.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Omnia subiecta sunt éi; sine dubio praeter eum qui subiecit éi omnia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest it should be supposed that (the) Godhead is subject to the Manhood.

glosses.latin: Cum autem subiecta fuerintilli omnia tunc ipse Filius subiectus erit illi qui subiecit sibi omnia, ut sit Deus omnia in omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Cum autem subiecta fuerintilli omnia tunc ipse Filius subiectus erit illi qui subiecit sibi omnia, ut sit Deus omnia in omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Cum autem subiecta fuerintilli omnia tunc ipse Filius subiectus erit illi qui subiecit sibi omnia, ut sit Deus omnia in omnibus.
footnotes: d: MS. rega
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Cum autem subiecta fuerintilli omnia tunc ipse Filius subiectus erit illi qui subiecit sibi omnia, ut sit Deus omnia in omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Cum autem subiecta fuerintilli omnia tunc ipse Filius subiectus erit illi qui subiecit sibi omnia, ut sit Deus omnia in omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Cum autem subiecta fuerintilli omnia tunc ipse Filius subiectus erit illi qui subiecit sibi omnia, ut sit Deus omnia in omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is He alone who will be aught.

glosses.latin: Alioquin quid facient, qui babtizantur pro mortuis, si omnino mortui non resurgunt? ut quid et babtizantur pro illís?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]pecca[Con]tis[/Con][/GLat] immefohṅget bás [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [Sup][GLat]peccatoribus qui ante mortem habebant baptismi[/GLat][/Sup] [GLat]uolun[Con]tatem[/Con][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. peccatis immefohṅget bás ɫ. [peccatoribus qui ante mortem habebant baptismi] uoluntatem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. peccatis immefohṅget bás ɫ. [peccatoribus qui ante mortem habebant baptismi] uoluntatem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. peccatis which cause death, uel etc.

glosses.latin: Alioquin quid facient, qui babtizantur pro mortuis, si omnino mortui non resurgunt? ut quid et babtizantur pro illís?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Alioquin quid facient, qui babtizantur pro mortuis, si omnino mortui non resurgunt? ut quid et babtizantur pro illís?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cedtorbe doib etarscarad etir friatola [GLat]et[/GLat] a pecthu
glosses.glossText: .i. cedtorbe doib etarscarad etir friatola et a pecthu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cedtorbe doib etarscarad etir friatola et a pecthu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what profit is it to them to separate at all from their desires and their sins?

glosses.latin: ut quid et nos periclitamur omni hora?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cedtorbe dúnni acésme dicachimniud [GLat]et[/GLat] dicachgúassacht inbetho
glosses.glossText: .i. cedtorbe dúnni acésme dicachimniud et dicachgúassacht inbetho
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cedtorbe dúnni acésme dicachimniud et dicachgúassacht inbetho
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what profit to us is what we suffer of every tribulation and of every danger of the world?

glosses.latin: Cotidie morior propter uestram gloriam, fratres.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am ready to go to martyrdom every day.

glosses.latin: Cotidie morior propter uestram gloriam, fratres.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for bringing you into glory.

glosses.latin: Si, secundum hominem, ad bestias pugnaui Ephessi, quid mihi prodest, si mortui non resurgunt? Manducemus et bibamus, cras enim moriemur.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Si, secundum hominem, ad bestias pugnaui Ephessi, quid mihi prodest, si mortui non resurgunt? Manducemus et bibamus, cras enim moriemur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [Res]ma[/Res]ssu dóinecht [Res]cr[Con]ist[/Con][/Res] nocretim [Res]ma[/Res]nid chretim [Res]aess[/Res]éirge [GLat]et[/GLat] mo[Res]esséir[/Res]ge féinn [Res][ie].i.[/ie] mas[/Res]su bethu frecṅ[Res]dirc[/Res] [GLat]tantum[/GLat] nomthá
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] (ma)ssu dóinecht (crist) nocretim (ma)nid chretim (aess)éirge et mo(esséir)ge féinn (.i. mas)su bethu frecṅ(dirc) tantum nomthá
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] (ma)ssu dóinecht (crist) nocretim (ma)nid chretim (aess)éirge et mo(esséir)ge féinn (.i. mas)su bethu frecṅ(dirc) tantum nomthá
glosses.glossTrans: if it is (only) Christ’s Manhood I believe (and) if I believe not in His resurrection and my own resurrection, that is, if it is a present life tantum that I have.

glosses.latin: Si, secundum hominem, ad bestias pugnaui Ephessi, quid mihi prodest, si mortui non resurgunt? Manducemus et bibamus, cras enim moriemur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is for the present life tantum that I do it.

glosses.latin: Si, secundum hominem, ad bestias pugnaui Ephessi, quid mihi prodest, si mortui non resurgunt? Manducemus et bibamus, cras enim moriemur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is hed aslinn andumela[Con]m[/Con] [Res]mass[/Res]uamnin ataam ammicosmili frisincethir dianérbart [GLat][Sup]ies[/Sup]ias[/GLat][c] inninsci so
glosses.glossText: .i. is hed aslinn andumelam (mass)uamnin ataam ammicosmili frisincethir dianérbart [ies]ias inninsci so
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is hed aslinn andumelam (mass)uamnin ataam ammicosmili frisincethir dianérbart [ies]iasc inninsci so
footnotes: c: Isa. xxii. 13, lvi. 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this (only) is ours, what we consume. If it is thus that we are, we are like unto the beast of which Isaiah hath uttered this saying.

glosses.latin: Nolite seduci. Corrumpunt mores bonos conloquia mala.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]a seodoprofe[Con]tis[/Con][/GLat] niérbarid [GLat]autem uerba[/GLat] asb[Con]eir[/Con] intóis anfoirbthe
glosses.glossText: .i. a seodoprofetis niérbarid autem uerba asbeir intóis anfoirbthe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. a seodoprofetis niérbarid autem uerba asbeir intóis anfoirbthe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a pseudoprophetis: ye should not utter autem uerba which the imperfect folk utters.

glosses.latin: Nolite seduci. Corrumpunt mores bonos conloquia mala.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Mininder comicus dixit hoc testimonium[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]poeta de corintís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: Mininder comicus dixit hoc testimonium .i. poeta de corintís
glosses.glossFNs: Mininder comicus dixit hoc testimonium .i. poeta de corintís
glosses.glossTrans: Menander etc.

glosses.latin: nolite peccare; ignorantiam enim Dei quidam habent; ad reuerentiam uobís loquor.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] astualang deacht todiusgud cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]et omnium mortuorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. astualang deacht todiusgud crist et omnium mortuorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. astualang deacht todiusgud crist et omnium mortuorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that the Godhead is able to raise up Christ et etc.

glosses.latin: nolite peccare; ignorantiam enim Dei quidam habent; ad reuerentiam uobís loquor.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is unworthy to indulge them.

glosses.latin: nolite peccare; ignorantiam enim Dei quidam habent; ad reuerentiam uobís loquor.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat][Res]reu[/Res]erantiam[/GLat] [Res][ie].i.[/ie] corop[/Res] occu [ie].i.[/ie] canim[Res]ebol[/Res] lib ambuid [Res]li[/Res]b cenp[Con]re[/Con]cept doib [Res]rúne[/Res] ind hesséirgi [Res][ie].i.[/ie] ar[/Res] imprucæ [GLat]et[/GLat] ar ... gid [GLat]ignorare dicitur[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] (reu)erantiam (.i. corop) occu .i. canim(ebol) lib ambuid (li)b cenprecept doib (rúne) ind hesséirgi (.i. ar) imprucæ et ar ... gid ignorare dicitur
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] (reu)erantiam (.i. corop) occu .i. canim(ebol) lib ambuid (li)b cenprecept doib (rúne) ind hesséirgi (.i. ar) imprucæ et ar ... gid ignorare dicitur
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it be with them, i.e. have ye not shame that they are with you without teaching to them the mystery of the resurrection, that is, that it may be a shame et ... etc.

glosses.latin: Sed dicet aliquis: Quomodo resurgunt mortui? Quali autem corpore ueniunt?
footnotes: d: leg. in doich do neuch? J. S. Thurneysen, Sarauw and Windisch suggest indoich nech, but what then is the construction of inso?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it likely that any of you should say this?

glosses.latin: Sed dicet aliquis: Quomodo resurgunt mortui? Quali autem corpore ueniunt?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. an unbelieving question, this.

glosses.latin: Sed dicet aliquis: Quomodo resurgunt mortui? Quali autem corpore ueniunt?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in what kind of body will they arise?

glosses.latin: Et quod seminas, non corpus quod futurum est, seminas, sed nudum granum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nindías[e] biis archiunn focheirt [GLat]in terram sed[/GLat] granne [f]désse[/f] [GLat]tantum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nindías biis archiunn focheirt in terram sed granne désse tantum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nindíase biis archiunn focheirt in terram sed granne déssef tantum
footnotes: e: = ní ind días
f: MS. esse
g: lit. ahead
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not the ear which is to comeg thou castest in terram, but a grain of an ear tantum.

glosses.latin: Et quod seminas, non corpus quod futurum est, seminas, sed nudum granum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. clean or bare.

glosses.latin: Deus autem dat illi corpus sicut uult, et unicuique seminum proprium corpus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that the single grain becomes a great ear.

glosses.latin: Deus autem dat illi corpus sicut uult, et unicuique seminum proprium corpus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isachorp fessin arafoím cachsíl [ie].i.[/ie] madgrainne cruithnechte foceirr isdiass cruithnechte [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. isachorp fessin arafoím cachsíl .i. madgrainne cruithnechte foceirr isdiass cruithnechte rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isachorp fessin arafoím cachsíl .i. madgrainne cruithnechte foceirr isdiass cruithnechte rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is its own body which every seed receives, that is, if thou cast a grain of wheat, it is an ear of wheat etc.

glosses.latin: non omnis caro, eadem caro.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et corpora caelestia et corpora terrestria; sed alia quidem caelestium gloria, alia autem terrestrium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] Ata tréde tadbatso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]híc[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] dechur eter corpu nemdi [GLat]et[/GLat] corpu tal[Con]mandi[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] dechur eter corpu nemdi immanetar [GLat]et[/GLat] dechur eter corpu tal[Con]mandi[/Con] immanetar andechor feil etercorpu nemdi [GLat][Res]s[/Res]ignificat[/GLat] andechur [Res]et[/Res]er indocbáil inna nóib innim andechor [Res]in[/Res]na corp tal[Con]mande[/Con] [GLat]significat[/GLat] dechor inna pían bete donaib pecthachaib inifurnn
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Ata tréde tadbatsom híc .i. dechur eter corpu nemdi et corpu talmandi et dechur eter corpu nemdi immanetar et dechur eter corpu talmandi immanetar andechor feil etercorpu nemdi (s)ignificat andechur (et)er indocbáil inna nóib innim andechor (in)na corp talmande significat dechor inna pían bete donaib pecthachaib inifurnn
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Ata tréde tadbatsom híc .i. dechur eter corpu nemdi et corpu talmandi et dechur eter corpu nemdi immanetar et dechur eter corpu talmandi immanetar andechor feil etercorpu nemdi (s)ignificat andechur (et)er indocbáil inna nóib innim andechor (in)na corp talmande significat dechor inna pían bete donaib pecthachaib inifurnn
footnotes: d: i.e. the respective glories
glosses.glossTrans: There are three things which he sets forth híc, that is, a difference between heavenly bodies and earthly bodies, and a difference between heavenly bodies among themselves, and a difference between earthly bodies among themselves. The difference there is between heavenly bodies signifcat the difference between the gloryd of the saints in heaven: the difference of the earthly bodies significat the difference of the punishments which will be (awarded) to the sinful in hell.

glosses.latin: Alia claritas solis, alia claritas lunae, alia claritas stellarum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. different.

glosses.latin: Alia claritas solis, alia claritas lunae, alia claritas stellarum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. different.

glosses.latin: Alia claritas solis, alia claritas lunae, alia claritas stellarum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. different.

glosses.latin: Seminatur in corruptione, surget in incorruptione.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in decaying and dissolving.

glosses.latin: Seminatur in corruptione, surget in incorruptione.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without decaying, without dissolving afterwards.

glosses.latin: Seminatur in ignobilitate, surgit in gloria.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. baseness of their being mixed with mould.

glosses.latin: Seminatur in ignobilitate, surgit in gloria.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ataat t[Con]ra[/Con][a] réte [GLat]híc[/GLat] niréid ambrith fricorpu [GLat]pecca[Con]torum[/Con] sed iustor[Con]um[/Con][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ataat tra réte híc niréid ambrith fricorpu peccatorum sed iustorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ataat traa réte híc niréid ambrith fricorpu peccatorum sed iustorum
footnotes: a: leg. trí
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there are three things here (glory, power, spirituality) which it is not easy to refer to the bodies peccatorum etc.

glosses.latin: Seminatur corpus animale.
footnotes: b: cf. LL. 280a, b, where Elijah and Enoch in heaven are said to be unable to move owing to the heaviness of their bodies
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. animal.

glosses.latin: Factus est primus Adam in animam uiuentem; nouissimus Adam in spiritu uiuificantem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. its soul (is) alive tantum.

glosses.latin: Factus est primus Adam in animam uiuentem; nouissimus Adam in spiritu uiuificantem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the spirit now quickens the body.

glosses.latin: Sed non prius quod spiritale est, sed quod animale, deinde quod spiritale.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is perishable has been put first.

glosses.latin: Sed non prius quod spiritale est, sed quod animale, deinde quod spiritale.
footnotes: c: leg. fodeud
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what, however, is perennial has been placed last.

glosses.latin: Primus homo de terra, terrenus; secundus homo de caelo, caelestis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Primus homo de terra, terrenus; secundus homo de caelo, caelestis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the son (is) like (his) mother.

glosses.latin: Primus homo de terra, terrenus; secundus homo de caelo, caelestis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Primus homo de terra, terrenus; secundus homo de caelo, caelestis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he (is) like (his) Father, a Son, however.

glosses.latin: Qualis terrenus, tales et terreni; et qualis caelestis, tales et caelestes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. like unto Adam in works and desires.

glosses.latin: Qualis terrenus, tales et terreni; et qualis caelestis, tales et caelestes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. like unto Christ himself (is) His heavenly Father.

glosses.latin: Qualis terrenus, tales et terreni; et qualis caelestis, tales et caelestes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e like to Christ in operibus etc.

glosses.latin: Igitur, sicut portauimus imaginem terreni, portemus et imaginem caelestis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indleire doratsam frisechim gníme adim hipecdib taibrem frisechim gníme cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]in iustitia et[/GLat] bemmi [GLat]caelestis[/GLat] iaru[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. indleire doratsam frisechim gníme adim hipecdib taibrem frisechim gníme crist in iustitia et bemmi caelestis iarum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indleire doratsam frisechim gníme adim hipecdib taibrem frisechim gníme crist in iustitia et bemmi caelestis iarum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the diligence we have bestowed on following Adam’s works in sins, let us give to following Christ’s deeds in iustitia, and we shall be caelestes then.

glosses.latin: Ecce misterium uobís dico: omnes quidem resurgemus, sed non omnes inmotabimur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isí inso indrún inso[b] [ie].i.[/ie] esseírge innanuile marb
glosses.glossText: .i. isí inso indrún inso .i. esseírge innanuile marb
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isí inso indrún inso<sup>b</sup> .i. esseírge innanuile marb
footnotes: b: cf. Ml. 86c 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the mystery, to wit, the resurrection of all the dead.

glosses.latin: Ecce misterium uobís dico: omnes quidem resurgemus, sed non omnes inmotabimur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní nádmbia cid cu[Con]m[/Con]scugud donaib pecthachaib ni áirmiso[Con]m[/Con] ón archu[Con]m[/Con]scugud arisabás imbás dosuidib comscugud im[Con]murgu[/Con] [GLat]iustorum[/GLat] abás imbethith són adindrímiso[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. ní nádmbia cid cumscugud donaib pecthachaib ni áirmisom ón archumscugud arisabás imbás dosuidib comscugud immurgu iustorum abás imbethith són adindrímisom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní nádmbia cid cumscugud donaib pecthachaib ni áirmisom ón archumscugud arisabás imbás dosuidib comscugud immurgu iustorum abás imbethith són adindrímisom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not that there will not be even a change for the sinners; but he (Paul) does not count that as a change, for in their case it is out of death into death. (It is) the change, however, iustorum out of death into life that he so reckons.

glosses.latin: in nouissima tuba ... mortui resurgent incorrupti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isintsenmim dedenach arnibia senim terchomric iarsin [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]praedica[Con]tione[/Con] nouissima[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]uoce archan[Con]geli[/Con][/GLat][c]
glosses.glossText: .i. isintsenmim dedenach arnibia senim terchomric iarsin ɫ. praedicatione nouissima ɫ. uoce archangeli
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isintsenmim dedenach arnibia senim terchomric iarsin ɫ. praedicatione nouissima ɫ. uoce archangelic
footnotes: c: Olden refers to Theodore of Mopsuestia, ed. Swete, vol. II. p. 30
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the last call, for there will not be (any) call to assembly after that.

glosses.latin: in nouissima tuba ... mortui resurgent incorrupti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nibia lobad na legad doib iarsin
glosses.glossText: .i. nibia lobad na legad doib iarsin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nibia lobad na legad doib iarsin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there will not be decaying or dissolution to them after that.

glosses.latin: Oportet enim corruptibile hoc induere incorruptionem, et mortale hoc induere inmortalitatem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isuisse intoichther andruailnitheso honnebdru[Con]ailnithiu[/Con] nibu degming donetadsom[d] achorp fadesin issuidiu
glosses.glossText: .i. isuisse intoichther andruailnitheso honnebdruailnithiu nibu degming donetadsom achorp fadesin issuidiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isuisse intoichther andruailnitheso honnebdruailnithiu nibu degming donetadsom<sup>d</sup> achorp fadesin issuidiu
footnotes: d: leg. do-n-ethad-som, which is translated
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is just that this corruptible should be clothed with the incorruptible. It were not difficult for him to go to his own body then.

glosses.latin: Oportet enim corruptibile hoc induere incorruptionem, et mortale hoc induere inmortalitatem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cid fogním cid fochésad dorróntar [GLat]in hoc uerbo dicit enim con[Con]sen[/Con]tius[/GLat] cid fo ó. cid fo .r. iscésad[e]
glosses.glossText: .i. cid fogním cid fochésad dorróntar in hoc uerbo dicit enim consentius cid fo ó. cid fo .r. iscésad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cid fogním cid fochésad dorróntar in hoc uerbo dicit enim consentius cid fo ó. cid fo .r. iscésade
footnotes: e: Sarauw, Irske Studier 31, 32
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in hoc uerbo one can express oneself both in the active and the passive, dicit enim Consentius that whether it be (i.e. whether induo ends) in o or in r it is passive.

glosses.latin: Cum autem mortale hoc induerit inmortalitatem, tunc fiat sermo qui scriptus est: Absorpta est mors in uictoria.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when he puts on him.

glosses.latin: Cum autem mortale hoc induerit inmortalitatem, tunc fiat sermo qui scriptus est: Absorpta est mors in uictoria.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what the prophet hath said will be verified.

glosses.latin: Cum autem mortale hoc induerit inmortalitatem, tunc fiat sermo qui scriptus est: Absorpta est mors in uictoria.
footnotes: f: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ubi est, mors, aculeus tuus?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. where is the sting wherewith thou hast struck uitam etc.?

glosses.latin: uirtus uero peccati lex.
footnotes: b: MS. rofollsiged
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is through transgression of (the) Law that sin has been manifested.

glosses.latin: uirtus uero peccati lex.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]léx[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] inrect comaccobuir file imballaib caích doaccobor pectho doforchossol cách inrecht sin ho adam
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] ɫ. léx .i. inrect comaccobuir file imballaib caích doaccobor pectho doforchossol cách inrecht sin ho adam
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] ɫ. léx .i. inrect comaccobuir file imballaib caích doaccobor pectho doforchossol cách inrecht sin ho adam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the law of concupiscence which is in every one’s members, to desire sin, every one since Adam has overstepped that law.

glosses.latin: dedit nobis uictoriam per Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum.
footnotes: c: leg. trechretim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through belief in Jesus Christ.

glosses.latin: stabiles estote et immobiles; abundantes in opere Domini semper, scientes quod labor uester non est inanis in Domino.
footnotes: d: cf. Ml. 71c 1 and Laws IV. 10: it gairdi ar gach inbaidhi cach modh dobeir saethar furra
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that your deeds may be more and more perfect.

glosses.latin: stabiles estote et immobiles; abundantes in opere Domini semper, scientes quod labor uester non est inanis in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye may do the deeds which Christ hath done.

glosses.latin: stabiles estote et immobiles; abundantes in opere Domini semper, scientes quod labor uester non est inanis in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are sure.

glosses.latin: stabiles estote et immobiles; abundantes in opere Domini semper, scientes quod labor uester non est inanis in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye will have glory for it.

glosses.latin: De collectis autem, quae fiunt in sanctos.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: De collectis autem, quae fiunt in sanctos.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Per unam sabbati unusquisque uestrum aput sé seponat, recondens quod éi bene placuerit.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Per unam sabbati unusquisque uestrum aput sé seponat, recondens quod éi bene placuerit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tecmallid dia domnich beos arnaptrom lib atecmallad
glosses.glossText: .i. tecmallid dia domnich beos arnaptrom lib atecmallad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tecmallid dia domnich beos arnaptrom lib atecmallad
footnotes: f: i.e. continue to collect on Sunday
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. collect ye on Sunday still<sup>f</sup> so that their collection may not seem to you onerous.

glosses.latin: Per unam sabbati unusquisque uestrum aput sé seponat, recondens quod éi bene placuerit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that he may collect them.

glosses.latin: Per unam sabbati unusquisque uestrum aput sé seponat, recondens quod éi bene placuerit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that its amount may seem appropriate to him.

glosses.latin: Quod si dignum fuerit ut et ego eam, mecum ibunt.
footnotes: g: literally, faciem vel personam meam, Sarauw: cf. Wb. 15c 25
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye think fit to bring me<sup>g</sup> with him.

glosses.latin: Quod si dignum fuerit ut et ego eam, mecum ibunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. my own household and some one of you.

glosses.latin: Veniam autem ad uos, cum Macedoniam pertransibo, nam Macedoniam pertransibo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when I shall visit.

glosses.latin: Veniam autem ad uos, cum Macedoniam pertransibo, nam Macedoniam pertransibo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I will visit.

glosses.latin: Apud uos autem forsitan manebo, uel etiam hiemabo ut uos me deducatis quocumque iero.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní ba cuit adíll cucuibsi acht ainfa lib arnidad foirbthisi, it foir[Con]bthi[/Con] im[Con]murgu[/Con] [e][GLat]macidonii[/GLat][/e]
glosses.glossText: .i. ní ba cuit adíll cucuibsi acht ainfa lib arnidad foirbthisi, it foirbthi immurgu macidonii
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní ba cuit adíll cucuibsi acht ainfa lib arnidad foirbthisi, it foirbthi immurgu macidoniie
footnotes: e: MS. macidonsi, or is macidonsi based on Macedonenses?
h: cf. Ml. 102a 15
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be merely a passing visit<sup>h</sup> to you, but I will tarry with you, for ye are not perfect. The Macedonians, however, are perfect.

glosses.latin: Apud uos autem forsitan manebo, uel etiam hiemabo ut uos me deducatis quocumque iero.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Apud uos autem forsitan manebo, uel etiam hiemabo ut uos me deducatis quocumque iero.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Apud uos autem forsitan manebo, uel etiam hiemabo ut uos me deducatis quocumque iero.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: spero enim me aliquantulum temporis manere apud uos, si Dominus permiserit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this I intend.

glosses.latin: spero enim me aliquantulum temporis manere apud uos, si Dominus permiserit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it please God.

glosses.latin: Ostium enim mihi apertum est magnum et euidens; et aduersari multi.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ostium enim mihi apertum est magnum et euidens; et aduersari multi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] fristait sochuide domsa and [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]heretici et seodoapos[Con]toli[/Con][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. fristait sochuide domsa and .i. heretici et seodoapostoli
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fristait sochuide domsa and .i. heretici et seodoapostoli
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a multitude opposes me therein.

glosses.latin: Si autem uenerit Timatheus, uidete, ut sine timore sit apud uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if he go to you before me.

glosses.latin: Si autem uenerit Timatheus, uidete, ut sine timore sit apud uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of sin or of nonfulfilment of this epistle.

glosses.latin: Ne quis [ergo] illum spernat; deducite autem illum in pace, ut ueniat ad me, exspecto enim illum cum fratribus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in not being subject to his control.

glosses.latin: Ne quis [ergo] illum spernat; deducite autem illum in pace, ut ueniat ad me, exspecto enim illum cum fratribus.
footnotes: b: leg., with Sommer, dafóidid, unless deducite is translated as an indicative
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. send ye him hither before I go.

glosses.latin: Ne quis [ergo] illum spernat; deducite autem illum in pace, ut ueniat ad me, exspecto enim illum cum fratribus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ne quis [ergo] illum spernat; deducite autem illum in pace, ut ueniat ad me, exspecto enim illum cum fratribus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with his household, who have gone with him.

glosses.latin: De Appollo autem fratre, notum uobís facio quoniam multum rogaui eum [ut] ueniret ad uos cum fratribus; et utique non fuit uoluntas ut nunc ueniret; ueniet autem cum éi uacuum fuerit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I give testimony for him.

glosses.latin: De Appollo autem fratre, notum uobís facio quoniam multum rogaui eum [ut] ueniret ad uos cum fratribus; et utique non fuit uoluntas ut nunc ueniret; ueniet autem cum éi uacuum fuerit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it should not be alone.

glosses.latin: De Appollo autem fratre, notum uobís facio quoniam multum rogaui eum [ut] ueniret ad uos cum fratribus; et utique non fuit uoluntas ut nunc ueniret; ueniet autem cum éi uacuum fuerit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he did not desire.

glosses.latin: De Appollo autem fratre, notum uobís facio quoniam multum rogaui eum [ut] ueniret ad uos cum fratribus; et utique non fuit uoluntas ut nunc ueniret; ueniet autem cum éi uacuum fuerit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this time.

glosses.latin: De Appollo autem fratre, notum uobís facio quoniam multum rogaui eum [ut] ueniret ad uos cum fratribus; et utique non fuit uoluntas ut nunc ueniret; ueniet autem cum éi uacuum fuerit.
footnotes: c: in marg. a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: free.

glosses.latin: De Appollo autem fratre, notum uobís facio quoniam multum rogaui eum [ut] ueniret ad uos cum fratribus; et utique non fuit uoluntas ut nunc ueniret; ueniet autem cum éi uacuum fuerit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] lasse bas nuáin do [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nípa ainmithiu[d] intain ronicfea
glosses.glossText: .i. lasse bas nuáin do ɫ. nípa ainmithiu intain ronicfea
glosses.glossFNs: .i. lasse bas nuáin do ɫ. nípa ainmithiu<sup>d</sup> intain ronicfea
footnotes: d: leg. ainmithchiu J. S., ainmithig Sarauw
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when he shall have leisure, or it will not be unseasonable(?) when he shall come.

glosses.latin: confortamini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. each the other.

glosses.latin: Omnia uestra in caritate fiant.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Omnia uestra in caritate fiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let no one offend against another and God.

glosses.latin: Obsecro autem uos, fratres, nostis domum Stiphanae et Fortunati et Achaici; quoniam sunt primitiae Achaiae, et in ministerium sanctorum ordinauerunt sé ipsos.
glosses.glossTrans: why do ye not imitate it?

glosses.latin: Obsecro autem uos, fratres, nostis domum Stiphanae et Fortunati et Achaici; quoniam sunt primitiae Achaiae, et in ministerium sanctorum ordinauerunt sé ipsos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is they who first of them have believed.

glosses.latin: Obsecro autem uos, fratres, nostis domum Stiphanae et Fortunati et Achaici; quoniam sunt primitiae Achaiae, et in ministerium sanctorum ordinauerunt sé ipsos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are a-serving Apostolorum Dei, not like you.

glosses.latin: Ut et uos subditi sitis eiusmodi, et omni cooperanti, et laboranti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to obey them.

glosses.latin: Ut et uos subditi sitis eiusmodi, et omni cooperanti, et laboranti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to your teachers and to your soul-friends.

glosses.latin: id quod uobís deerat ipsi subpleuerunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have as excess what is wanting to you.

glosses.latin: Refecerunt enim et meum spiritum, et uestrum. Cognoscite ergo qui huiusmodi sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it seems marvellous to me.

glosses.latin: Refecerunt enim et meum spiritum, et uestrum. Cognoscite ergo qui huiusmodi sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. profit, however, to you.

glosses.latin: Refecerunt enim et meum spiritum, et uestrum. Cognoscite ergo qui huiusmodi sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to do whatever they say.

glosses.latin: Salutant uos in Domino multum Aquila et Prescella.
footnotes: e: In MS. this gloss is on Prescella
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Salutant uos in Domino multum Aquila et Prescella.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it seems dear to her that ye should do good.

glosses.latin: Caritas mea cum omnibus uobis in Christo Iesu.
footnotes: f: Sarauw would correct and complete to amal nocarimse Ísu caritas uestra dano sit, ‘as I love Jesus’ etc.
g: cf. Ml. 79d 1
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. sit indeed caritas wherewith I love Jesus; then sit caritas.

glosses.latin: Paulus, apostolus Iesu Christi per uoluntatem Dei, et Timotheus frater, aeclesiae Dei quae est Corinthi, cum sanctis omnibus qui sunt in uniuersa Achaia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] augtortas apstalachte inso t[Con]ra[/Con] aainm fessin dosuidigud itossoc[Res]h[/Res] naepistle
glosses.glossText: .i. augtortas apstalachte inso tra aainm fessin dosuidigud itossoc(h) naepistle
glosses.glossFNs: .i. augtortas apstalachte inso tra aainm fessin dosuidigud itossoc(h) naepistle
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this then is the authority of apostleship to put his own name at the beginning of the epistle.

glosses.latin: Paulus, apostolus Iesu Christi per uoluntatem Dei, et Timotheus frater, aeclesiae Dei quae est Corinthi, cum sanctis omnibus qui sunt in uniuersa Achaia.
footnotes: b: The edge of the MS. has here broken off, and with it the final t. Cf. infra, 26c 2, Sarauw 94
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to send me was the Father’s will.

glosses.latin: Paulus, apostolus Iesu Christi per uoluntatem Dei, et Timotheus frater, aeclesiae Dei quae est Corinthi, cum sanctis omnibus qui sunt in uniuersa Achaia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] p[Con]re[/Con]ceptóir [GLat]et[/GLat] forcetlid doib som [GLat]Timotheus et[/GLat] bráthir inhiris nípu decming cid i coli[Res]nn[/Res]
glosses.glossText: .i. preceptóir et forcetlid doib som Timotheus et bráthir inhiris nípu decming cid i coli(nn)
glosses.glossFNs: .i. preceptóir et forcetlid doib som Timotheus et bráthir inhiris nípu decming cid i coli(nn)
footnotes: e: As Timothy’s father was a Greek, Acts xvi. 1, 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a preacher and teacher of theirs (was) Timothy, and a brother in the faith–it were not impossible even in flesh<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Paulus, apostolus Iesu Christi per uoluntatem Dei, et Timotheus frater, aeclesiae Dei quae est Corinthi, cum sanctis omnibus qui sunt in uniuersa Achaia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the holy congregation which is in Corinth.

glosses.latin: Paulus, apostolus Iesu Christi per uoluntatem Dei, et Timotheus frater, aeclesiae Dei quae est Corinthi, cum sanctis omnibus qui sunt in uniuersa Achaia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni luct corint nammá dianduthraccarsa amaithsi[c] acht daduthraccar donaib huilib nóibaib file [GLat]in achaia[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ni luct corint nammá dianduthraccarsa amaithsi acht daduthraccar donaib huilib nóibaib file in achaia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni luct corint nammá dianduthraccarsa amaithsic acht daduthraccar donaib huilib nóibaib file in achaia
footnotes: c: leg. amaithain, which is translated
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not only to the folk of Corinth that I wish this good; but I wish it to all the saints who are in Achaia.

glosses.latin: Gratia uobís et páx a Deo Patre nostro et a Domino Iesu Christo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]precamur ego et Timo[Con]theus[/Con] multiplicet[Con]er[/Con][/GLat] is hed fodlína
glosses.glossText: .i. precamur ego et Timotheus multipliceter is hed fodlína
glosses.glossFNs: .i. precamur ego et Timotheus multipliceter is hed fodlína
glosses.glossTrans: it is this that supplies it (the sentence).

glosses.latin: Benedictus Dominus et Pater .... et Deus totius consulationis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Godhead.

glosses.latin: Benedictus Dominus et Pater .... et Deus totius consulationis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is, the Father.

glosses.latin: Qui consulatur nos in omni tribulatione nostra, ut possimus et ipsi consulari eos qui in omni presura sunt, per exortationem qua exortamur et ipsi a Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] eter imnetha inbetho frecṅdirc [GLat]et[/GLat] pæna todóchidi
glosses.glossText: .i. eter imnetha inbetho frecṅdirc et pæna todóchidi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. eter imnetha inbetho frecṅdirc et pæna todóchidi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. both troubles of the present world and (fear of) future punishments.

glosses.latin: Qui consulatur nos in omni tribulatione nostra, ut possimus et ipsi consulari eos qui in omni presura sunt, per exortationem qua exortamur et ipsi a Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tre p[Con]re[/Con]cept doib [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isdessimrecht co[Con]m[/Con]díthnatha [GLat]et[/GLat]sóire dochách arsóireni
glosses.glossText: .i. tre precept doib ɫ. isdessimrecht comdíthnatha etsóire dochách arsóireni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tre precept doib ɫ. isdessimrecht comdíthnatha etsóire dochách arsóireni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through instruction to them; or our freedom is an example of consolation and of freedom to every one.

glosses.latin: Qui consulatur nos in omni tribulatione nostra, ut possimus et ipsi consulari eos qui in omni presura sunt, per exortationem qua exortamur et ipsi a Deo.
footnotes: d: a prima manu: cf. Ml. 38d 21, 45c 5
glosses.glossTrans: from the oppression.

glosses.latin: Qui consulatur nos in omni tribulatione nostra, ut possimus et ipsi consulari eos qui in omni presura sunt, per exortationem qua exortamur et ipsi a Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] corronertamni cách hifoditin fochide am[Con]al[/Con] nonnertarni hodia
glosses.glossText: .i. corronertamni cách hifoditin fochide amal nonnertarni hodia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. corronertamni cách hifoditin fochide amal nonnertarni hodia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may strengthen every one in enduring sufferings even as we are strengthened by God.

glosses.latin: Qui consulatur nos in omni tribulatione nostra, ut possimus et ipsi consulari eos qui in omni presura sunt, per exortationem qua exortamur et ipsi a Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even we ourselves.

glosses.latin: Quoniam sicut abundant pasiones Christi in nobís, ita et per Christum abundat consulatio nostra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] méit donindnagar fornni fochith issí méit insin donindnagar indíthnad nitabir dia fornni di[Con]diu[/Con] fochith nádfochomolsam cid indfochith follongam dob[Con]er[/Con] díthnad darahéssi
glosses.glossText: .i. méit donindnagar fornni fochith issí méit insin donindnagar indíthnad nitabir dia fornni didiu fochith nádfochomolsam cid indfochith follongam dober díthnad darahéssi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. méit donindnagar fornni fochith issí méit insin donindnagar indíthnad nitabir dia fornni didiu fochith nádfochomolsam cid indfochith follongam dober díthnad darahéssi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in proportion as suffering is bestowed upon us, so is the consolation that is bestowed. God, then, putteth not upon us suffering which we cannot endure. Even the suffering which we endure, He giveth consolation for it.

glosses.latin: Siue autem tribulamur pro uestra exortatione ... siue exortamur pro uestra exortatione et salute, quae in tollerantia operatur harumdem passionum quas et nos patimur.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Siue autem tribulamur pro uestra exortatione ... siue exortamur pro uestra exortatione et salute, quae in tollerantia operatur harumdem passionum quas et nos patimur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arimp díthnad [GLat]et[/GLat] hícc dúibsi foditiu fochide dúnni [ie].i.[/ie] andugníat ar magistir isferr dún adénu[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. arimp díthnad et hícc dúibsi foditiu fochide dúnni .i. andugníat ar magistir isferr dún adénum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arimp díthnad et hícc dúibsi foditiu fochide dúnni .i. andugníat ar magistir isferr dún adénum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that our endurance of afflictions may be a consolation and salvation to you: that is, what our masters do it is better for us to do it.

glosses.latin: Siue autem tribulamur pro uestra exortatione ... siue exortamur pro uestra exortatione et salute, quae in tollerantia operatur harumdem passionum quas et nos patimur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the salvation will be through the endurance of the sufferings.

glosses.latin: ut spes nostra firma [sit] pro uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we know that your faith will be firm in the sufferings.

glosses.latin: Non enim uolumus ignorare uos, fratres, de tribulatione nostra . . quoniam supra modum grauáti sumus supra uirtutem, ita ut tederet nos etiam uiuere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I wish that ye should know it.

glosses.latin: Non enim uolumus ignorare uos, fratres, de tribulatione nostra . . quoniam supra modum grauáti sumus supra uirtutem, ita ut tederet nos etiam uiuere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. greatly.

glosses.latin: Non enim uolumus ignorare uos, fratres, de tribulatione nostra . . quoniam supra modum grauáti sumus supra uirtutem, ita ut tederet nos etiam uiuere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tuárgabad fornn aire fochide nádtuárgabar nert[a]
glosses.glossText: .i. tuárgabad fornn aire fochide nádtuárgabar nert
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tuárgabad fornn aire fochide nádtuárgabar nert<sup>a</sup>
footnotes: a: leg. nád tuárgab ar nert, Sarauw
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a burden of sufferings has been raised upon us, so that (proportionate) strength is not raised up.

glosses.latin: Non enim uolumus ignorare uos, fratres, de tribulatione nostra . . quoniam supra modum grauáti sumus supra uirtutem, ita ut tederet nos etiam uiuere.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non enim uolumus ignorare uos, fratres, de tribulatione nostra . . quoniam supra modum grauáti sumus supra uirtutem, ita ut tederet nos etiam uiuere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ropo tochomracht[c] linn buid imbethu [GLat]ut mori omni disiderio cuperemus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ropo tochomracht linn buid imbethu ut mori omni disiderio cuperemus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ropo tochomrachtc linn buid imbethu ut mori omni disiderio cuperemus
footnotes: c: rectius thochomracht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it seemed to us a weariness to be in life, ut etc.

glosses.latin: Sed ipsi in nobísmet ipsís responsum mortis habuimus, ut non simus fidentes in nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for our nearness to death.

glosses.latin: Sed ipsi in nobísmet ipsís responsum mortis habuimus, ut non simus fidentes in nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bás cr[Con]ist[/Con] dop[Con]re[/Con]cept [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]parati sumus morti pro Christo[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] fis scél ó bás. [GLat]Alit[Con]er[/Con][/GLat] roposcíth linn [GLat]uiuere[/GLat] c[Con]ei[/Con]st cid dorigénsa[Con]m[/Con] ni[Con]anse[/Con] [GLat]sed respon[Con]sum[/Con] mortis[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [ie].i.[/ie] guide [GLat]et[/GLat] tomoltód[d] armbáis is hed dorigénsam [GLat]sed non inuenimus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. bás crist doprecept ɫ. parati sumus morti pro Christo ɫ. fis scél ó bás. Aliter roposcíth linn uiuere ceist cid dorigénsam nianse sed responsum mortis rl. .i. guide et tomoltód armbáis is hed dorigénsam sed non inuenimus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bás crist doprecept ɫ. parati sumus morti pro Christo ɫ. fis scél ó bás. Aliter roposcíth linn uiuere ceist cid dorigénsam nianse sed responsum mortis rl. .i. guide et tomoltódd armbáis is hed dorigénsam sed non inuenimus
footnotes: d: cf. Wb. 20d 4, Lib. Ardm. 176b 1, supra p. 496
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to teach Christ’s death, uel parati etc., or tidings from death. Aliter, we were weary of life. Question, what have we done? Easy (to answer), sed etc., that is, praying and urging (?) for our death, this is what we have done, sed etc.

glosses.latin: Sed ipsi in nobísmet ipsís responsum mortis habuimus, ut non simus fidentes in nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. confident in nobis etc.

glosses.latin: in quem speramus, quoniam adhuc eripiet nós.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. His help will still be with us.

glosses.latin: Adiuuantibus et uobís in oratione pro nobis, ut ex multarum facierum personis, eius quae in nobis est donationis, per multos gratiae agantur pro nobis.
footnotes: e: This seems corrupt. Leg. afortégidsi, Zimmer: aforregidsi, Sarauw 93
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when ye help.

glosses.latin: Adiuuantibus et uobís in oratione pro nobis, ut ex multarum facierum personis, eius quae in nobis est donationis, per multos gratiae agantur pro nobis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] gigestesi dia linn arafulsa[Con]m[/Con] ar fochidi
glosses.glossText: .i. gigestesi dia linn arafulsam ar fochidi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. gigestesi dia linn arafulsam ar fochidi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye will beseech God for us that we may endure our sufferings.

glosses.latin: Adiuuantibus et uobís in oratione pro nobis, ut ex multarum facierum personis, eius quae in nobis est donationis, per multos gratiae agantur pro nobis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when ye assist indeed ut etc.

glosses.latin: Adiuuantibus et uobís in oratione pro nobis, ut ex multarum facierum personis, eius quae in nobis est donationis, per multos gratiae agantur pro nobis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who will believe in us.

glosses.latin: Adiuuantibus et uobís in oratione pro nobis, ut ex multarum facierum personis, eius quae in nobis est donationis, per multos gratiae agantur pro nobis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Adiuuantibus et uobís in oratione pro nobis, ut ex multarum facierum personis, eius quae in nobis est donationis, per multos gratiae agantur pro nobis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they may be driven.

glosses.latin: Nam gloria nostra haec est, testimonium conscientiae nostrae, quod in simplicitate [cordis] et sinceritate Dei, et non in sapientia carnal, sed in gratiá Dei conuersati sumus.
footnotes: a: MS. iarnasoirad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to save a multitude through teaching after our deliverance.

glosses.latin: Nam gloria nostra haec est, testimonium conscientiae nostrae, quod in simplicitate [cordis] et sinceritate Dei, et non in sapientia carnal, sed in gratiá Dei conuersati sumus.
