glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nigóo dún friarcub[Con]us[/Con] ní arlóg na aithi p[Con]ri[/Con]dchimmi soscéle
glosses.glossText: .i. nigóo dún friarcubus ní arlóg na aithi pridchimmi soscéle
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nigóo dún friarcubus ní arlóg na aithi pridchimmi soscéle
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not false for us as to our conscience; not for reward or recompense do we preach the Gospel.

glosses.latin: Nam gloria nostra haec est, testimonium conscientiae nostrae, quod in simplicitate [cordis] et sinceritate Dei, et non in sapientia carnal, sed in gratiá Dei conuersati sumus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat][Res]in[/Res] semplicitate[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ní ar [Res]ló[/Res]g na aithi dun [Res]fési[/Res]ne acht is [Res]art[/Res]hairciud sochuide [GLat]in gloriam [Res]cum[/Res] deo in pasionibus gloriamur [Res]non[/Res] lucri causa [Res]praedi[/Res]camus[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] (in) semplicitate .i. ní ar (ló)g na aithi dun (fési)ne acht is (art)hairciud sochuide in gloriam (cum) deo in pasionibus gloriamur (non) lucri causa (praedi)camus
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] (in) semplicitate .i. ní ar (ló)g na aithi dun (fési)ne acht is (art)hairciud sochuide in gloriam (cum) deo in pasionibus gloriamur (non) lucri causa (praedi)camusb
footnotes: b: Conscientia mea non reprehendit me lucri uel gloriae causa praedicare, Primasius, Migne, Patrologia Latina lxviii. 556
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for reward or recompense to ourselves, but it is for bringing a multitude in etc.

glosses.latin: Nam gloria nostra haec est, testimonium conscientiae nostrae, quod in simplicitate [cordis] et sinceritate Dei, et non in sapientia carnal, sed in gratiá Dei conuersati sumus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issí diuitte dǽ p[Con]re[/Con]cept sos[Con]céli[/Con] cenlóg cenaithi
glosses.glossText: .i. issí diuitte dǽ precept soscéli cenlóg cenaithi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issí diuitte dǽ precept soscéli cenlóg cenaithi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is ‘simplicity of God’ to teach the Gospel without reward, without recompense.

glosses.latin: Nam gloria nostra haec est, testimonium conscientiae nostrae, quod in simplicitate [cordis] et sinceritate Dei, et non in sapientia carnal, sed in gratiá Dei conuersati sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for this reward is sought and glory.

glosses.latin: Non enim alia scripsimus uobís, spero autem quod usque in finem cognoscetis,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rofitis mobésgnese frib [ie].i.[/ie] nád cuintgim lóg armop[Con]re[/Con]cept
glosses.glossText: .i. rofitis mobésgnese frib .i. nád cuintgim lóg armoprecept
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rofitis mobésgnese frib .i. nád cuintgim lóg armoprecept
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye know my habit as regards you, that is, that I seek no reward for my teaching.

glosses.latin: Non enim alia scripsimus uobís, spero autem quod usque in finem cognoscetis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am certain.

glosses.latin: Non enim alia scripsimus uobís, spero autem quod usque in finem cognoscetis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the end of perfection.

glosses.latin: Sicut et cognuistis nos ex parte, quod gloria uestra sumus, sicut et uos nostra in die Domini nostri Iesu Christi.
glosses.glossText: .i. rann uáibsi ɫ. rann diar forcitulni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rann uáibsi ɫ. rann diar forcitulni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a part of you or a part of our teaching.

glosses.latin: Sicut et cognuistis nos ex parte, quod gloria uestra sumus, sicut et uos nostra in die Domini nostri Iesu Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is triunni dúibsi indindocbál nobtá [GLat]in futuro[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. is triunni dúibsi indindocbál nobtá in futuro
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is triunni dúibsi indindocbál nobtá in futuro
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is through us that ye have the glory which is in store for you in futuro.

glosses.latin: Sicut et cognuistis nos ex parte, quod gloria uestra sumus, sicut et uos nostra in die Domini nostri Iesu Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] istrebartabirtsi dochum nirisse ronbiani indocbál [GLat]in die domini nostri[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal istrebartabirtsi dochum nirisse ronbiani indocbál in die domini nostri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal istrebartabirtsi dochum nirisse ronbiani indocbál in die domini nostri
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as it is through bringing you to the faith we shall have glory in die, etc.

glosses.latin: Et hac confidentia, uolui prius uenire ad uos, ut secundam gratiam haberetis;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because I praise you and boast myself in you.

glosses.latin: Et hac confidentia, uolui prius uenire ad uos, ut secundam gratiam haberetis;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]pænitentiam[/GLat].: [Res]C[Con]ei[/Con][/Res]s[Con]t[/Con] cote [GLat]prima gra[Sup]tia[/Sup][/GLat] ni[Con]anse[/Con] rad dilgutha [Res]pe[/Res]cthe tre baithis [Res]is[/Res]hed arrath ta[Res]n[/Res]ise dilgud pectho [Res]t[/Res]re aithirgi
glosses.glossText: .i. pænitentiam.: (Cei)st cote prima gra[tia] nianse rad dilgutha (pe)cthe tre baithis (is)hed arrath ta(n)ise dilgud pectho (t)re aithirgi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. pænitentiam.: (Cei)st cote prima gra[tia] nianse rad dilgutha (pe)cthe tre baithis (is)hed arrath ta(n)ise dilgud pectho (t)re aithirgi
glosses.glossTrans: Question: what is prima gratia? Easy (to answer: the) grace of forgiveness of sins through baptism. This is the second grace: forgiveness of sin through repentance.

glosses.latin: et a uobis deduci in Iudeam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ato[Con]m[/Con]anaste [ie].i.[/ie] cachled dochoidso[Con]m[/Con] sund isdop[Con]re[/Con]cept [GLat]et[/GLat] forcitul
glosses.glossText: .i. atomanaste .i. cachled dochoidsom sund isdoprecept et forcitul
glosses.glossFNs: .i. atomanaste .i. cachled dochoidsom sund isdoprecept et forcitul
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that I should be brought, that is, every side that he went here it is to instruct and teach.

glosses.latin: Cum ergo hoc uoluissem, numquid leuitate ussus sum?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arisbés uáilbe[c] issain aní asb[Con]er[/Con]ar indi [GLat]et[/GLat] dogníther
glosses.glossText: .i. arisbés uáilbe issain aní asberar indi et dogníther
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arisbés uáilbec issain aní asberar indi et dogníther
footnotes: c: leg. úaille? Cf. Ml. 33b 17. But uailbe also in Wb. 30b 21, and cf. Thurneysen KZ. xxviii. 147
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is a usage of pride, that what is said in it and what is done are different.

glosses.latin: Aut quae cogito, secundum carnem cogito ut sit apud me Est et Non?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] araní immeraither[a] iarcolinn isgnáth gáo [GLat]et[/GLat] fír nand ni íar colinn didiu moimradudsa [GLat]sed secundum deum et non est mendacium in illo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. araní immeraither iarcolinn isgnáth gáo et fír nand ni íar colinn didiu moimradudsa sed secundum deum et non est mendacium in illo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. araní immeraithera iarcolinn isgnáth gáo et fír nand ni íar colinn didiu moimradudsa sed secundum deum et non est mendacium in illo
footnotes: a: recte immeraiter
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for that which is cogitated according to the flesh, false and true are usual therein. Not, then, according to the flesh is my cogitation, sed etc.

glosses.latin: Aut quae cogito, secundum carnem cogito ut sit apud me Est et Non?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cobeid [ie].i.[/ie] combed andedesin imlabradsa [ie].i.[/ie] gáu [GLat]et[/GLat] fír [ie].i.[/ie] combad sain anasberin obélib [GLat]et[/GLat] aní immeradin óchridiu
glosses.glossText: .i. cobeid .i. combed andedesin imlabradsa .i. gáu et fír .i. combad sain anasberin obélib et aní immeradin óchridiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cobeid .i. combed andedesin imlabradsa .i. gáu et fír .i. combad sain anasberin obélib et aní immeradin óchridiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that there may be, i.e. so that those two things should be in my speech, even false and true, that is, so that what I say with lips and what I think with heart might be different.

glosses.latin: Aut quae cogito, secundum carnem cogito ut sit apud me Est et Non?
glosses.glossFullTags: fochenéle[b] lugi [Res]i[/Res]ssiu rodbo chosmi[Res]liu[/Res]s [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] nafil india [Res]an[/Res]isiu [ie].i.[/ie] fír [GLat]et[/GLat] gáu [Res]acht[/Res] isfír [GLat]tantum[/GLat] fil [Res]an[/Res]d isamlid isfír fil indiunni
glosses.glossText: fochenéle lugi (i)ssiu rodbo chosmi(liu)s .i. amal nafil india (an)isiu .i. fír et gáu (acht) isfír tantum fil (an)d isamlid isfír fil indiunni
glosses.glossFNs: fochenéleb lugi (i)ssiu rodbo chosmi(liu)s .i. amal nafil india (an)isiu .i. fír et gáu (acht) isfír tantum fil (an)d isamlid isfír fil indiunni
footnotes: b: Cf. Wb. 6a 29, Ml. 101c 7, 106c 3, Sarauw, Irske Studier 137
glosses.glossTrans: as a kind of oath herein it (is used), or a similitude, to wit, as this is not in God, even True and False, but it is True tantum that there is in Him, so it is True that there is in us.

glosses.latin: Fidilis autem Deus, quia sermo noster, qui fit apud uos, non est in illo Est et Non; sed Est in illo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. True tantum, it is this which is in us.

glosses.latin: Fidilis autem Deus, quia sermo noster, qui fit apud uos, non est in illo Est et Non; sed Est in illo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which is preached to you.

glosses.latin: Fidilis autem Deus, quia sermo noster, qui fit apud uos, non est in illo Est et Non; sed Est in illo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. False and True simul.

glosses.latin: Fidilis autem Deus, quia sermo noster, qui fit apud uos, non est in illo Est et Non; sed Est in illo.
footnotes: d: Exodus iii. 14
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who is Est, i.e. Trued.

glosses.latin: Dei enim Filius, [Iesus] Christus, qui in uobís per nos praedicatus est, per me et Silvanum .... non fuit Est et Non, sed Est in illo fuit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bainse[c] dún ep[Con]er[/Con]t gue airintí labrathar indiunni [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]iesus cristus[/GLat] is firíon side
glosses.glossText: .i. bainse dún epert gue airintí labrathar indiunni .i. iesus cristus is firíon side
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bainsec dún epert gue airintí labrathar indiunni .i. iesus cristus is firíon side
footnotes: c: Cf. Thurneysen, Celt. Zeitschr. I. 6
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were hard for us to utter falsehood, for He that speaketh in us, even Jesus Christus, He is Just.

glosses.latin: Dei enim Filius, [Iesus] Christus, qui in uobís per nos praedicatus est, per me et Silvanum .... non fuit Est et Non, sed Est in illo fuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is myself I mention first.

glosses.latin: Dei enim Filius, [Iesus] Christus, qui in uobís per nos praedicatus est, per me et Silvanum .... non fuit Est et Non, sed Est in illo fuit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nírrobe in[GLat]iesu christo est et non[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] fír [GLat]et[/GLat] gáu acht is [GLat]est[/GLat] na[Con]m[/Con]má robói and [ie].i.[/ie] fír [ie].i.[/ie] biddixnugud fírinne
glosses.glossText: .i. nírrobe iniesu christo est et non .i. fír et gáu acht is est nammá robói and .i. fír .i. biddixnugud fírinne
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nírrobe iniesu christo est et non .i. fír et gáu acht is est nammá robói and .i. fír .i. biddixnugud fírinne
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in Iesu Christo there were not Est and Non, that is, the True and the False, but it is Est only that was in Him, that is the True, even eternal existence of truth.

glosses.latin: ideo et per ipsum Amen Deo ad gloriam nostram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indfír [ie].i.[/ie] dorairngert dia rofírtha hi cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. indfír .i. dorairngert dia rofírtha hi crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indfír .i. dorairngert dia rofírtha hi crist
footnotes: e: Omnis ueritas promissionum in Christo est, Primasius, Migne l.c. 557
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. truly, i.e. God has promised: they have been verified in Christ<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: ideo et per ipsum Amen Deo ad gloriam nostram.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: ideo et per ipsum Amen Deo ad gloriam nostram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]iesum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] istriit doécomnacht dúnni [GLat]gratia uirtutum et doctrina[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. iesum .i. istriit doécomnacht dúnni gratia uirtutum et doctrina
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iesum .i. istriit doécomnacht dúnni gratia uirtutum et doctrina
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through Him has been imparted to us gratia etc.

glosses.latin: ideo et per ipsum Amen Deo ad gloriam nostram.
glosses.glossFullTags: . . indocbal dún . . rlin nop[Con]ri[/Con]dch .... inna fil acht .... mi andso[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: . . indocbal dún . . rlin nopridch .... inna fil acht .... mi andsom
glosses.glossFNs: . . indocbal dún . . rlin nopridch .... inna fil acht .... mi andsom
glosses.glossTrans: ... glory to us ...

glosses.latin: Qui autem confirmat nos uobiscum in Christo, et qui unxit nos, Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is He that stablisheth us with you.

glosses.latin: Qui autem confirmat nos uobiscum in Christo, et qui unxit nos, Deus.
footnotes: f: Spiritu sancto uel chrismate, Primasius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with the Holy Spirit<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Et qui signauit nos; et dedit pignus Spiritus in cordibus nostrís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ishe dia .... [ie].i.[/ie] icosmuilius fris ignímaib[a] [GLat]et[/GLat] béssaib
glosses.glossText: .i. ishe dia .... .i. icosmuilius fris ignímaib et béssaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishe dia .... .i. icosmuilius fris ignímaiba et béssaib
footnotes: a: rectius ingnímaib
f: Cf. Wb. 15c 17
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is God<sup>f</sup> (who has sealed us) i.e. in likeness to Him in deeds and morals.

glosses.latin: Et qui signauit nos; et dedit pignus Spiritus in cordibus nostrís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [Res][ie].i.[/ie] do[/Res]rrat gell [Res][ie].i.[/ie] fo[/Res]rgell asfíu .... intain [GLat]dicit[/GLat] ... derin fíach [GLat][Res]uita[/Res] æterna et reg[Res]num[/Res] caeleste[/GLat] tri... bieid arngell ... fiach linn ... [GLat]christus et[/GLat] inspi[Res]ru[/Res]t nóib
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] (.i. do)rrat gell (.i. fo)rgell asfíu .... intain dicit ... derin fíach (uita) æterna et reg(num) caeleste tri... bieid arngell ... fiach linn ... christus et inspi(ru)t nóib
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] (.i. do)rrat gell (.i. fo)rgell asfíu .... intain dicit ... derin fíach (uita) æterna et reg(num) caeleste tri... bieid arngell ... fiach linn ... christus et inspi(ru)t nóib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He has given a pledge, even a testimony worthy ... when dicit .... debt uita etc. through ... our pledge will be .... a debt with us ... Christus and the Holy Spirit.

glosses.latin: Ego autem testem Deum inuoco in animam meam, quod parcens uobis, non ueni ultra Corinthum; non quia dominamur fidei uestrae, sed adiutores sumus gaudi uestri, nam fide statis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have here an oath.

glosses.latin: Ego autem testem Deum inuoco in animam meam, quod parcens uobis, non ueni ultra Corinthum; non quia dominamur fidei uestrae, sed adiutores sumus gaudi uestri, nam fide statis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is ar airchíssecht dúibsi nidechudsa cucuib [GLat]statim[/GLat] dothabirt dígle [GLat]et[/GLat] doaidbiur foirib sech cotaneccarsa són [GLat]ut petrus ....annaniam et saphiram[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. is ar airchíssecht dúibsi nidechudsa cucuib statim dothabirt dígle et doaidbiur foirib sech cotaneccarsa són ut petrus ....annaniam et saphiram
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is ar airchíssecht dúibsi nidechudsa cucuib statim dothabirt dígle et doaidbiur foirib sech cotaneccarsa són ut petrus ....annaniam et saphiramb
footnotes: b: Acts v. 1–10
g: aidbiur is here the dat. sg. of aidber, aithber
h: Ne in uobis acrius uindicarem, Primasius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for the sake of sparing you that I went not to you statim, to punish and to reprimandg youh, though I had power (to do) that, ut Petrus etc.

glosses.latin: Ego autem testem Deum inuoco in animam meam, quod parcens uobis, non ueni ultra Corinthum; non quia dominamur fidei uestrae, sed adiutores sumus gaudi uestri, nam fide statis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we are not potent over your faith.

glosses.latin: Ego autem testem Deum inuoco in animam meam, quod parcens uobis, non ueni ultra Corinthum; non quia dominamur fidei uestrae, sed adiutores sumus gaudi uestri, nam fide statis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] congnia[Con]m[/Con] fribsi octáircud raith spirito dúib [c]conid[/c] hed fodera fáilti dúibsi [GLat]et[/GLat] dúnni
glosses.glossText: .i. congniam fribsi octáircud raith spirito dúib conid hed fodera fáilti dúibsi et dúnni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. congniam fribsi octáircud raith spirito dúib conidc hed fodera fáilti dúibsi et dúnni
footnotes: c: MS. coni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we work with you in preparing spiritual grace for you: so that this causes joy unto you and to us.

glosses.latin: Ego autem testem Deum inuoco in animam meam, quod parcens uobis, non ueni ultra Corinthum; non quia dominamur fidei uestrae, sed adiutores sumus gaudi uestri, nam fide statis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ego autem testem Deum inuoco in animam meam, quod parcens uobis, non ueni ultra Corinthum; non quia dominamur fidei uestrae, sed adiutores sumus gaudi uestri, nam fide statis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished ǽm foruar fáilti dúnni formbuithsi iniriss [GLat]et[/GLat] intairisse[Con]m[/Con] donairissid indi
glosses.glossText: .i. ished ǽm foruar fáilti dúnni formbuithsi iniriss et intairissem donairissid indi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished ǽm foruar fáilti dúnni formbuithsi iniriss et intairissem donairissid indi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this verily has caused joy to us, your being in faith and the steadfastness with which ye abide in it.

glosses.latin: Statui autem hoc ipse apud me, ne iterum in tristitiam uenirem ad uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] na badécen forcúrsagad infechtsa cúrsagad [GLat]et[/GLat] taidbsiu pectho isindepistil tóisich dilgud [GLat]et[/GLat] comdídnad isindedenich
glosses.glossText: .i. na badécen forcúrsagad infechtsa cúrsagad et taidbsiu pectho isindepistil tóisich dilgud et comdídnad isindedenich
glosses.glossFNs: .i. na badécen forcúrsagad infechtsa cúrsagad et taidbsiu pectho isindepistil tóisich dilgud et comdídnad isindedenich
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it should not be needful to reprove you this time. Reproval and setting forth of sin in the first Epistle: forgiveness and consolation in the last.

glosses.latin: Statui autem hoc ipse apud me, ne iterum in tristitiam uenirem ad uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tíchtin inna epistle adrímiso[Con]m[/Con] arathíchtin fessin
glosses.glossText: .i. tíchtin inna epistle adrímisom arathíchtin fessin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tíchtin inna epistle adrímisom arathíchtin fessin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the coming of the Epistle he counts as the coming of himself.

glosses.latin: Statui autem hoc ipse apud me, ne iterum in tristitiam uenirem ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest I should cause grief to you on the second coming.

glosses.latin: Si enim ego contristo uos, et quis est, qui me laetificet, nisi qui contristatur á me?
footnotes: d: rectius trechúrsagad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e through reproving your sin.

glosses.latin: Si enim ego contristo uos, et quis est, qui me laetificet, nisi qui contristatur á me?
footnotes: d: rectius trechúrsagad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through reproof from me.

glosses.latin: Hoc ipsum scripsi uobís, ut non cum uenero, tristitiam
footnotes: e: rectius inchúrsagthaso
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. uerbum uel opus of the reproof above.

glosses.latin: Hoc ipsum scripsi uobís, ut non cum uenero, tristitiam
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Hoc ipsum scripsi uobís, ut non cum uenero, tristitiam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of your being in sin.

glosses.latin: super tristitiam habeam, de quibus oportuerat me gaudere; confidens in omnibus uobís, quia gaudium meum omnium uestrum est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the tribulations which I suffer in Asia.

glosses.latin: super tristitiam habeam, de quibus oportuerat me gaudere; confidens in omnibus uobís, quia gaudium meum omnium uestrum est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is of you.

glosses.latin: super tristitiam habeam, de quibus oportuerat me gaudere; confidens in omnibus uobís, quia gaudium meum omnium uestrum est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ba uissiu fáilte domsa úaibsi oldaas brón
glosses.glossText: .i. ba uissiu fáilte domsa úaibsi oldaas brón
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ba uissiu fáilte domsa úaibsi oldaas brón
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. joy from you to me were more fitting than grief.

glosses.latin: super tristitiam habeam, de quibus oportuerat me gaudere; confidens in omnibus uobís, quia gaudium meum omnium uestrum est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isderb limsa mofáiltese bid fáilte dúibsi
glosses.glossText: .i. isderb limsa mofáiltese bid fáilte dúibsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isderb limsa mofáiltese bid fáilte dúibsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am sure that my joy will be your joy.

glosses.latin: super tristitiam habeam, de quibus oportuerat me gaudere; confidens in omnibus uobís, quia gaudium meum omnium uestrum est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for your joy is joy to me.

glosses.latin: Nam ex multa tribulatione et angustia cordis scripsi uobís, per multas lacrymas; non ut contristemini, sed ut sciatis quam caritatem habeam habundantius in uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cia rodbatar tirbithi aili fornn robodiliu linn dethiden díbsi
glosses.glossText: .i. cia rodbatar tirbithi aili fornn robodiliu linn dethiden díbsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cia rodbatar tirbithi aili fornn robodiliu linn dethiden díbsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though there have been other troubles upon us, dearer to us was care for you.

glosses.latin: Nam ex multa tribulatione et angustia cordis scripsi uobís, per multas lacrymas; non ut contristemini, sed ut sciatis quam caritatem habeam habundantius in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not to put sadness upon you is this.

glosses.latin: Nam ex multa tribulatione et angustia cordis scripsi uobís, per multas lacrymas; non ut contristemini, sed ut sciatis quam caritatem habeam habundantius in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nam ex multa tribulatione et angustia cordis scripsi uobís, per multas lacrymas; non ut contristemini, sed ut sciatis quam caritatem habeam habundantius in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye might know the greatness of the love for you that I have.

glosses.latin: ut non honerem omnes uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] coníarimse[b] peccad libsi uili [vel]ɫ.[/vel] aratartsa fortacht dúibsi arnap trom fuirib fornóinur
glosses.glossText: .i. coníarimse peccad libsi uili ɫ. aratartsa fortacht dúibsi arnap trom fuirib fornóinur
glosses.glossFNs: .i. coníarimse<sup>b</sup> peccad libsi uili ɫ. aratartsa fortacht dúibsi arnap trom fuirib fornóinur
footnotes: b: 1 sg. pres. subj., cf. Wb. 10c 14, 23d 1, Ml. 29d 2, 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that I may not count sin with you all, or so that I may give aid to you lest it be heavy on you alone (by yourselves).

glosses.latin: obiurgatio autem quae fit a pluribus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a multitude that has inflicted the reproof.

glosses.latin: Ita ut e contrario magis donetis, et consulemini, ne forte abundantiori tristitia absorbeatur qui huiusmodi est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] act bahé cúrsagad maid madachoisged dílgud ní maid dúibsi di[Con]diu[/Con] cendílgud [GLat]post increpationem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. act bahé cúrsagad maid madachoisged dílgud ní maid dúibsi didiu cendílgud post increpationem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. act bahé cúrsagad maid madachoisged dílgud ní maid dúibsi didiu cendílgud post increpationem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but that were a good reproof if forgiveness should follow it. It is not good for you, then, not to forgive post increpationem.

glosses.latin: Ita ut e contrario magis donetis, et consulemini, ne forte abundantiori tristitia absorbeatur qui huiusmodi est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with despair.

glosses.latin: Ita ut e contrario magis donetis, et consulemini, ne forte abundantiori tristitia absorbeatur qui huiusmodi est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnách róllca derchoiniud dílgid dó [GLat]et[/GLat] dandonid
glosses.glossText: .i. arnách róllca derchoiniud dílgid dó et dandonid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnách róllca derchoiniud dílgid dó et dandonid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest despair swallow him up, forgive him and console him.

glosses.latin: Propter quod obsecro uos ut confirmetis in illum caritatem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. show your charity towards him.

glosses.latin: scripsi, ut cognoscam experimentum uestrum, án in omnibus oboedientes sitis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] duús incomalnid arrup[Con]ri[/Con]dchad dúib isos[Con]célu[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] dílgud dochách
glosses.glossText: .i. duús incomalnid arrupridchad dúib isoscélu .i. dílgud dochách
glosses.glossFNs: .i. duús incomalnid arrupridchad dúib isoscélu .i. dílgud dochách
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if perchance ye fulfil what has been preached to you in the Gospel, even forgiveness to every one.

glosses.latin: Cui autem aliquid donastis, et ego; nam et ego quod donaui, si quid donaui, propter uos in persona Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to him to whom ye forgive it, I also will forgive it.

glosses.latin: Cui autem aliquid donastis, et ego; nam et ego quod donaui, si quid donaui, propter uos in persona Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aní doluigimse airibsi iscr[Con]ist[/Con] dodlugi lim
glosses.glossText: .i. aní doluigimse airibsi iscrist dodlugi lim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aní doluigimse airibsi iscrist dodlugi lim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what I forgive for you, it is Christ that forgives it with me.

glosses.latin: Cui autem aliquid donastis, et ego; nam et ego quod donaui, si quid donaui, propter uos in persona Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is in Christ’s person I do that.

glosses.latin: Ut non circumueniamur a Satana; non enim ignoramus cogitationes eius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conintorgáitar [ie].i.[/ie] tre dérchóiniud arisgliccso[Con]m[/Con] ocaslug inphectho ↄforbanar adslig derchóiniud iárna forbu
glosses.glossText: .i. conintorgáitar .i. tre dérchóiniud arisgliccsom ocaslug inphectho ↄforbanar adslig derchóiniud iárna forbu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conintorgáitar .i. tre dérchóiniud arisgliccsom ocaslug inphectho ↄforbanar adslig derchóiniud iárna forbu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we be not deceived, that is, through despair: for he (Satan) is cunning in tempting to sin till it is completed: after its completion, he persuades (the sinner to) despair.

glosses.latin: Ut non circumueniamur a Satana; non enim ignoramus cogitationes eius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amminéulig and t[Con]ra[/Con] indorsa adgenammar aséis sechip hé nodap[Con]ri[/Con]dcha [GLat]et[/GLat] lassambé
glosses.glossText: .i. amminéulig and tra indorsa adgenammar aséis sechip hé nodapridcha et lassambé
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amminéulig and tra indorsa adgenammar aséis sechip hé nodapridcha et lassambé
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so we are acquainted with him now, we know his meaning, whosoever he be that preaches it and with whom he may be.

glosses.latin: Cum uenissem autem Troeadem propter euangelium Christi, et hostium mihi apertum esset in Domino.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ropo irlam sochuide and dochreti[Con]m[/Con] níruanus fris[a] im[Con]murgu[/Con] hóre nád robe tit armochiunn
glosses.glossText: .i. ropo irlam sochuide and dochretim níruanus fris immurgu hóre nád robe tit armochiunn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ropo irlam sochuide and dochretim níruanus fris<sup>a</sup> immurgu hóre nád robe tit armochiunn
footnotes: a: cf. Ml. 27b 16
c: literally ‘ahead of me’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a multitude was ready therein to believe: however, I have not remained for that, because Titus was not (there) when I came<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Non habui requiem spiritui meo .... sed ualefaciens eis, profectus sum in Macedoniam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doadbadar s[Con]un[/Con]t furóil serce hopool doibsom issindí nadran ocp[Con]re[/Con]cept dondsochuidi arlainni fesso scel ontechtairiu dochoid cuccuso[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. doadbadar sunt furóil serce hopool doibsom issindí nadran ocprecept dondsochuidi arlainni fesso scel ontechtairiu dochoid cuccusom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doadbadar sunt furóil serce hopool doibsom issindí nadran ocprecept dondsochuidi arlainni fesso scel ontechtairiu dochoid cuccusom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. here is shown the abundance of love from Paul to them, in that he remained not preaching to the multitude, because of the eagerness for tidings from the messenger who had gone to them.

glosses.latin: Non habui requiem spiritui meo .... sed ualefaciens eis, profectus sum in Macedoniam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when I had bidden farewell.

glosses.latin: Quia Christi bonus odor sumus Deo, in hís qui salui fiunt, et in hís qui pereunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because we inspire the knowledge of Christ in every one.

glosses.latin: Quia Christi bonus odor sumus Deo, in hís qui salui fiunt, et in hís qui pereunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through knowledge of the faith.

glosses.latin: Quia Christi bonus odor sumus Deo, in hís qui salui fiunt, et in hís qui pereunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niboltigetarside bolad [GLat]fidei per nos et[/GLat] p[Con]ri[/Con]dchidir doib cibcruth
glosses.glossText: .i. niboltigetarside bolad fidei per nos et pridchidir doib cibcruth
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niboltigetarside bolad fidei per nos et pridchidir doib cibcruth
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the savour fidei they savour not per nos, and, howbeit, it is preached unto them.

glosses.latin: Aliis quidem odor mortis in mortem; aliis autem odor uitae in uitam. Et ad haec quis tam idoneus?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] condid [GLat]odor uitae in uitam et[/GLat] ↄdid [GLat]odor mortis in mortem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. condid odor uitae in uitam et ↄdid odor mortis in mortem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. condid odor uitae in uitam et ↄdid odor mortis in mortem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it is odor uitae in uitam, and so that it is odor mortis in mortem.

glosses.latin: Aliis quidem odor mortis in mortem; aliis autem odor uitae in uitam. Et ad haec quis tam idoneus?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not every one.

glosses.latin: Non enim sumus sicut plurimi, adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed ex sinceritate, sed sicut ex Deo, coram Deo, in Christo loquimur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nidan chosmili frisna p[Con]re[/Con]ceptori atobsegatsi[b] artimchellni nidiamóidem doso[Con]m[/Con] act arna arroímatso[Con]m[/Con] nach naile
glosses.glossText: .i. nidan chosmili frisna preceptori atobsegatsi artimchellni nidiamóidem dosom act arna arroímatsom nach naile
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nidan chosmili frisna preceptori atobsegatsi<sup>b</sup> artimchellni nidiamóidem dosom act arna arroímatsom nach naile
footnotes: b: See note on atasamlibid Wb. 5a 13
d: cf. timcheall na macraidhe .i. a n-écmais na macraidhe, O’Cl. fri cach ae timchell araile LU. 102a, Zimmer Gött. Gel. Anz. 1900, p. 374, Pedersen Aspirationen 114
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we are not like the preachers who go to you behind our backs<sup>d</sup>. This is not to boast of himself, but lest they should receive any one else.

glosses.latin: Non enim sumus sicut plurimi, adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed ex sinceritate, sed sicut ex Deo, coram Deo, in Christo loquimur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non aliud corde aliud ore loquimur[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nicuingem lóg arp[Con]re[/Con]cepte
glosses.glossText: .i. non aliud corde aliud ore loquimur .i. nicuingem lóg arprecepte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. non aliud corde aliud ore loquimur .i. nicuingem lóg arprecepte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we seek no pay for our teaching.

glosses.latin: Non enim sumus sicut plurimi, adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed ex sinceritate, sed sicut ex Deo, coram Deo, in Christo loquimur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to us, the teaching which we preach.

glosses.latin: Non enim sumus sicut plurimi, adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed ex sinceritate, sed sicut ex Deo, coram Deo, in Christo loquimur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is Christ that we preach.

glosses.latin: Incipimus iterum nosmet ipsos commendare? aut numquid egemus (sicut quidam) commendaticís epistolis ad uos aut ex uobís?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intinscanfa[Con]m[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] inbia[Con]m[/Con] fris t[Con]ra[/Con] iár narnetargnu dúib itossuch caníralsid súil torunn
glosses.glossText: .i. intinscanfam .i. inbiam fris tra iár narnetargnu dúib itossuch caníralsid súil torunn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intinscanfam .i. inbiam fris tra iár narnetargnu dúib itossuch caníralsid súil torunn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. shall we begin? i.e. shall we be at that, then, after our being known by you at first? have ye not cast an eye over us?

glosses.latin: Incipimus iterum nosmet ipsos commendare? aut numquid egemus (sicut quidam) commendaticís epistolis ad uos aut ex uobís?
glosses.glossTrans: I affirm: we need not.

glosses.latin: Incipimus iterum nosmet ipsos commendare? aut numquid egemus (sicut quidam) commendaticís epistolis ad uos aut ex uobís?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] inbértar epistli uaín dothabirt testassa dínn
glosses.glossText: .i. inbértar epistli uaín dothabirt testassa dínn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inbértar epistli uaín dothabirt testassa dínn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. shall epistles be brought from us to bear testimony of us?

glosses.latin: Incipimus iterum nosmet ipsos commendare? aut numquid egemus (sicut quidam) commendaticís epistolis ad uos aut ex uobís?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we ourselves shall, then, be able to name ourselves without it.

glosses.latin: Incipimus iterum nosmet ipsos commendare? aut numquid egemus (sicut quidam) commendaticís epistolis ad uos aut ex uobís?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni reccar ales da[Con]no[/Con] epis[Con]tle[/Con] uáibsi arrofitemmar cene
glosses.glossText: .i. ni reccar ales dano epistle uáibsi arrofitemmar cene
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni reccar ales dano epistle uáibsi arrofitemmar cene
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is no need, then, of a letter from you, for we know without it.

glosses.latin: Epistola nostra uos estis, scripta in cordibus nostrís, quae scitur et legitur ab omnibus hominibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. your believing bears witness of us.

glosses.latin: Epistola nostra uos estis, scripta in cordibus nostrís, quae scitur et legitur ab omnibus hominibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is in our heart ye fulfil it.

glosses.latin: Epistola nostra uos estis, scripta in cordibus nostrís, quae scitur et legitur ab omnibus hominibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ronfitirni cach trechretim dúibsi [ie].i.[/ie] dobeir teist hore adibcretmigsi
glosses.glossText: .i. ronfitirni cach trechretim dúibsi .i. dobeir teist hore adibcretmigsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ronfitirni cach trechretim dúibsi .i. dobeir teist hore adibcretmigsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one knows us through your belief, that is, the fact that ye are believers bears testimony.

glosses.latin: Manifesta quia epistola estis Christi, ministrata á nobís, et scripta non atramento, . . sed in tabulís cordis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore nocomalnid timne cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]dum christus est in cordibus uestrís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hore nocomalnid timne crist dum christus est in cordibus uestrís
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore nocomalnid timne crist dum christus est in cordibus uestrís
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because ye fulfil Christ’s commandments dum etc.

glosses.latin: Manifesta quia epistola estis Christi, ministrata á nobís, et scripta non atramento, . . sed in tabulís cordis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Manifesta quia epistola estis Christi, ministrata á nobís, et scripta non atramento, . . sed in tabulís cordis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in (the) table of (the) heart.

glosses.latin: Fiduciam autem talem habemus ad Deum per Christum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ep[Con]er[/Con]t adibscripthisi ón spirut inoentid fri cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. epert adibscripthisi ón spirut inoentid fri crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. epert adibscripthisi ón spirut inoentid fri crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to say, ye are written by the Spirit in unity with Christ.

glosses.latin: Non quod suficientes simus cogitare aliquid á nobís, quasi ex nobis; sed sufficientia nostra ex Deo est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not from ourselves that we are messengers to you.

glosses.latin: Non quod suficientes simus cogitare aliquid á nobís, quasi ex nobis; sed sufficientia nostra ex Deo est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. our sufficiency to teach and instruct every one.

glosses.latin: Qui et idoneos nos fecit ministros noui testamenti .... litera enim occidit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] torisse leis arfóit fortechtairechta [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ishé fodruar
glosses.glossText: .i. torisse leis arfóit fortechtairechta ɫ. ishé fodruar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. torisse leis arfóit fortechtairechta ɫ. ishé fodruar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he deems it meet to send us on missions: or it is He that has caused it.

glosses.latin: Qui et idoneos nos fecit ministros noui testamenti .... litera enim occidit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isindí dofich apeccad forcách [GLat]et[/GLat] bís pén [GLat]in futuro[/GLat] trethairmthecht isairi di[Con]diu[/Con] asbeirso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]litera occidit[/GLat] hore is hed robói indi [GLat]morte moriatur[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. isindí dofich apeccad forcách et bís pén in futuro trethairmthecht isairi didiu asbeirsom litera occidit hore is hed robói indi morte moriatur
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isindí dofich apeccad forcách et bís pén in futuro trethairmthecht isairi didiu asbeirsom litera occidit hore is hed robói indi morte moriaturb
footnotes: b: Matth. xv. 4
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in that it punishes every one for his sin and there is punishment in futuro through transgression. Therefore, then, does he say littera occidit, because it is this that has been in it: morte moriatur.

glosses.latin: Quod si ministratio mortis, literís deformata in lapidibus,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. punishment.

glosses.latin: fuit in gloria, ita ut non possent intendere filii Israel in faciem Moysi, propter gloriam uultus eius.
glosses.glossText: .i. dogníthe anasbered moysi ɫ. doárbas gloria octindnacul legis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dogníthe anasbered moysi ɫ. doárbas gloria octindnacul legis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what Moses used to say used to be done: or gloria has been displayed in giving Lex.

glosses.latin: fuit in gloria, ita ut non possent intendere filii Israel in faciem Moysi, propter gloriam uultus eius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is hed asbeirso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]híc[/GLat] aratartar airmitiu féid donaib p[Con]re[/Con]ceptorib [ie].i.[/ie] aracomalnither [GLat]quod dicunt[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. is hed asbeirsom híc aratartar airmitiu féid donaib preceptorib .i. aracomalnither quod dicunt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is hed asbeirsom híc aratartar airmitiu féid donaib preceptorib .i. aracomalnither quod dicunt
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this he says híc, that honour be given to the teachers, i.e. that quod dicunt be fulfilled.

glosses.latin: fuit in gloria, ita ut non possent intendere filii Israel in faciem Moysi, propter gloriam uultus eius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [a]nifoílsitis[/a] deícsin agnúsa iar mbid dó ocaccaldim dé octindnacul recto dó
glosses.glossText: .i. nifoílsitis deícsin agnúsa iar mbid dó ocaccaldim dé octindnacul recto dó
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nifoílsitis<sup>a</sup> deícsin agnúsa iar mbid dó ocaccaldim dé octindnacul recto dó
footnotes: a: MS. nifoísitis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they would not have endured to behold his face after he had been conversing with God, when the Law was given to him.

glosses.latin: fuit in gloria, ita ut non possent intendere filii Israel in faciem Moysi, propter gloriam uultus eius.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quomodo non magis ministratio spiritus erit in gloria?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is hed dosaig anúas óthá [GLat]quod sí ministratio[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. is hed dosaig anúas óthá quod sí ministratio rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is hed dosaig anúas óthá quod sí ministratio rl.
footnotes: d: see above, p. 509, note h
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this goes with it (adit) from aboved, from quod si etc.

glosses.latin: Quomodo non magis ministratio spiritus erit in gloria?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] p[Con]re[/Con]ceptori nuiadnissi mór ní as dénti ní airriu
glosses.glossText: .i. preceptori nuiadnissi mór ní as dénti ní airriu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. preceptori nuiadnissi mór ní as dénti ní airriu
footnotes: e: see above, p. 447, note g
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. teachers of the New Testament, how much the more<sup>e</sup> is somewhat to be done for them.

glosses.latin: Nam si ministratio dampnationis gloria est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to Moses.

glosses.latin: Si enim quod euacuatur per gloriam est, multo magis quod manet, in gloria est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the glory of the whole Old Testament.

glosses.latin: Si enim quod euacuatur per gloriam est, multo magis quod manet, in gloria est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to do aught that the Law orders. i.e. the glory of the whole New Testament.

glosses.latin: Si enim quod euacuatur per gloriam est, multo magis quod manet, in gloria est.
footnotes: b: leg. nuíednissi uili
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: multa fiducia utimur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in teaching.

glosses.latin: Et non sicut Moyses ponebat uelamen super faciem suam, ut non intenderent fili Israel [in] faciem eius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] do inchosc nadtuicset [GLat]filii isr[Con]ae[/Con]l[/GLat] rúna [GLat]et[/GLat] rombói fíal amirisse eteracride
glosses.glossText: .i. do inchosc nadtuicset filii israel rúna et rombói fíal amirisse eteracride
glosses.glossFNs: .i. do inchosc nadtuicset filii israel rúna et rombói fíal amirisse eteracride
footnotes: f: for the ellipsis cf. Sg. 217b, and for a similar ellipsis in Greek cf. e.g. Aristoph. Ach. 431
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to signify that filii Israel understood not mysteries, and that there was a veil of unbelief between their hearts (and him)f.

glosses.latin: usque in hodiernum diem id ipsum uelamen in lectione ueteris Testamenti manet non reuelatum, quoniam in Christo euacuatur.
footnotes: c: recte indlibuirso
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (the day) of writing this book.

glosses.latin: usque in hodiernum diem id ipsum uelamen in lectione ueteris Testamenti manet non reuelatum, quoniam in Christo euacuatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isindí nádcrette cr[Con]ist[/Con] am[Con]al[/Con] rofiugrad irrúnaib recto
glosses.glossText: .i. isindí nádcrette crist amal rofiugrad irrúnaib recto
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isindí nádcrette crist amal rofiugrad irrúnaib recto
footnotes: g: So the Irish might be translated, but leg. nád cretet ‘in that they do not believe’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in that Christ used not to be believed<sup>g</sup> as He had been figured in the mysteries of the Law.

glosses.latin: usque in hodiernum diem id ipsum uelamen in lectione ueteris Testamenti manet non reuelatum, quoniam in Christo euacuatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]nobís[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nifil fiál etronn [GLat]et[/GLat] cr[Con]ist[/Con] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]non reuelatum est[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]illís iudeis[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nitucsat [GLat]quoniam in christo[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. nobís .i. nifil fiál etronn et crist ɫ. non reuelatum est .i. illís iudeis .i. nitucsat quoniam in christo rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nobís .i. nifil fiál etronn et crist ɫ. non reuelatum est .i. illís iudeis .i. nitucsat quoniam in christo rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is no veil between us and Christ: uel non reuelatum est, i.e. illis Iudaeis, i.e. they understood not quoniam etc.

glosses.latin: usque in hodiernum diem id ipsum uelamen in lectione ueteris Testamenti manet non reuelatum, quoniam in Christo euacuatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ol rofásiged [GLat]uelamen litere[/GLat] trechretim hicr[Con]ist[/Con] c[Con]ei[/Con]s[Con]t[/Con] cid doronad friu ni[Con]anse[/Con] [GLat]sed usque in hodiernum diem[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. ol rofásiged uelamen litere trechretim hicrist ceist cid doronad friu nianse sed usque in hodiernum diem rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ol rofásiged uelamen litere trechretim hicrist ceist cid doronad friu nianse sed usque in hodiernum diem rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since uelamen litterae has been done away with through belief in Christ. Question, what hath been done to them? Easy (to answer): sed usque etc.

glosses.latin: usque in hodiernum diem id ipsum uelamen in lectione ueteris Testamenti manet non reuelatum, quoniam in Christo euacuatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through belief in Christ.

glosses.latin: Sed usque in hodiernum diem, cum legitur Moyses, uelamen est possitum super cór eorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nithucat beos ruín[a] indrechto [ie].i.[/ie] atairchet [GLat]et[/GLat]anrofiugrad[b] dicríst
glosses.glossText: .i. nithucat beos ruín indrechto .i. atairchet etanrofiugrad dicríst
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nithucat beos ruína indrechto .i. atairchet etanrofiugradb dicríst
footnotes: a: cf. Pedersen KZ. xxxv. p. 359, 1. 6
b: Perhaps arrofiugrad, cf. Trans. Phil. Soc. 1895–8, p. 81
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they do not yet understand the mystery of the Law, i.e. what has been prophesied and what has been figured of Christ.

glosses.latin: Cum autem conuersus fuerit quis ad Dominum, auferetur uelamen.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg. sup.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] isr[Res]l. [vel]ɫ.[/vel] induili[/Res] cretfite dimíli déec [GLat]di illis[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] sechié cretes [GLat]de illis[/GLat] [Res]tucfa[/Res] rúna [GLat]legis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg. sup.] .i. isr(l. ɫ. induili) cretfite dimíli déec di illis rl. ɫ. sechié cretes de illis (tucfa) rúna legis
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg. sup.] .i. isr(l. ɫ. induili) cretfite dimíli déec di illis rl. ɫ. sechié cretes de illis (tucfa) rúna legis
footnotes: f: Rev. vii. 5
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Israelites, or all who will believe, twelve thousand de illisf. Or whosoever de illis believes will understand (the) mysteries Legis.

glosses.latin: Dominus autem Spiritus est; ubi autem Spiritus Domini, ibi libertas.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quasi dix[Con]isset[/Con][/GLat] fricorpthadid [GLat]et[/GLat] stoir[Con]idetid[/Con] dob[Con]er[/Con]at [GLat]iudei[/GLat] tóib [GLat]tantum[/GLat] noche[c] . . ispirtálde [GLat]dominus et[/GLat] isspirdide annuiedniss[d] uile
glosses.glossText: .i. quasi dixisset fricorpthadid et stoiridetid doberat iudei tóib tantum noche . . ispirtálde dominus et isspirdide annuiedniss uile
glosses.glossFNs: .i. quasi dixisset fricorpthadid et stoiridetid doberat iudei tóib tantum nochec . . ispirtálde dominus et isspirdide annuiednissd uile
footnotes: c: leg. perhaps nochem, GC2. 701
d: leg. annuiednisse
g: John iv. 24: vi. 24
glosses.glossTrans: to corporeality and materiality Iudaei trust tantumg, however Dominus is spiritual and the whole New Testament is spiritualized.

glosses.latin: Dominus autem Spiritus est; ubi autem Spiritus Domini, ibi libertas.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without serving (the) Law.

glosses.latin: Nos uero omnes reuelata facie gloriam Domini speculantes, in eandem imaginem transformamur, a claritate in claritatem, tamquam a Domini Spiritu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unveiled, i.e. we put a veil from us.

glosses.latin: Nos uero omnes reuelata facie gloriam Domini speculantes, in eandem imaginem transformamur, a claritate in claritatem, tamquam a Domini Spiritu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. knowledge of the Godhead.

glosses.latin: Nos uero omnes reuelata facie gloriam Domini speculantes, in eandem imaginem transformamur, a claritate in claritatem, tamquam a Domini Spiritu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]similiter christo in moribus[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]imago[/GLat] intairmchrutto isléib tabór
glosses.glossText: .i. similiter christo in moribus ɫ. imago intairmchrutto isléib tabór
glosses.glossFNs: .i. similiter christo in moribus ɫ. imago intairmchrutto isléib tabór
glosses.glossTrans: or, imago of the Transfiguration on Mount Tabor.

glosses.latin: Nos uero omnes reuelata facie gloriam Domini speculantes, in eandem imaginem transformamur, a claritate in claritatem, tamquam a Domini Spiritu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as from the Spirit.

glosses.latin: Quod misericordiam consecuti sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God’s mercy has caused faith unto us.

glosses.latin: Sed abdicamus occulta dedecoris, non ambulantes in astutiá, neque adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed in manifestatione ueritatis, commendantes nosmet ipsos ad omnem conscientiam hominum coram Deo.
footnotes: h: The original of this gloss is intended for abdicamus, which the glossator mistakes for abcidamus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let us cut off<sup>h</sup>.

glosses.latin: Sed abdicamus occulta dedecoris, non ambulantes in astutiá, neque adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed in manifestatione ueritatis, commendantes nosmet ipsos ad omnem conscientiam hominum coram Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in craftiness ut alii etc.

glosses.latin: Sed abdicamus occulta dedecoris, non ambulantes in astutiá, neque adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed in manifestatione ueritatis, commendantes nosmet ipsos ad omnem conscientiam hominum coram Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for pay or wage do we preach.

glosses.latin: Sed abdicamus occulta dedecoris, non ambulantes in astutiá, neque adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed in manifestatione ueritatis, commendantes nosmet ipsos ad omnem conscientiam hominum coram Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the manifestation.

glosses.latin: Sed abdicamus occulta dedecoris, non ambulantes in astutiá, neque adulterantes uerbum Dei; sed in manifestatione ueritatis, commendantes nosmet ipsos ad omnem conscientiam hominum coram Deo.
footnotes: e: The first stroke of the n of -ni is visible
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one’s conscience knows our kind.

glosses.latin: Quod si etiam opertum est euangelium nostrum, in hís qui pereunt est opertum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] maso dorchide lanech ap[Con]ri[/Con]dchimmeni nilanech nodchomalnadar act islanech nadid chreti
glosses.glossText: .i. maso dorchide lanech apridchimmeni nilanech nodchomalnadar act islanech nadid chreti
glosses.glossFNs: .i. maso dorchide lanech apridchimmeni nilanech nodchomalnadar act islanech nadid chreti
footnotes: i: John vii. 17
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if what we preach seems dark to any one, it is not so to one that fulfils it, but to one that does not believe it<sup>i</sup>.

glosses.latin: illuminatio euangeli gloriae Christi, qui est imago Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in which gloria Christi is preached

glosses.latin: illuminatio euangeli gloriae Christi, qui est imago Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a natural image secundum diuinitatem.

glosses.latin: Non enim nosmet ipsos praedicamus, sed Iesum Christum Dominum nostrum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isairi is indocbál cr[Con]ist[/Con] p[Con]ri[/Con]dchimme arnip[Con]ri[/Con]dcha[Con]m[/Con] arnindocbáil fanisin
glosses.glossText: .i. isairi is indocbál crist pridchimme arnipridcham arnindocbáil fanisin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isairi is indocbál crist pridchimme arnipridcham arnindocbáil fanisin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore it is Christ’s glory we preach, for we preach not our own glory.

glosses.latin: Quoniam Deus, qui dixit de tenebrís lucem splendescere, ipse inluxit in cordibus nostrís, ad inluminationem scientiae claritatis Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore truly we preach to you.

glosses.latin: Quoniam Deus, qui dixit de tenebrís lucem splendescere, ipse inluxit in cordibus nostrís, ad inluminationem scientiae claritatis Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ignis spiritus sancti[/GLat] condan éolich irrúnaib deachte
glosses.glossText: .i. ignis spiritus sancti condan éolich irrúnaib deachte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ignis spiritus sancti condan éolich irrúnaib deachte
glosses.glossTrans: so that we are skilled in mysteries of the Godhead.

glosses.latin: Habemus autem thesaurum istum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. knowledge of the Godhead and of the grace of the Spirit.

glosses.latin: patimur sed non angustiamur: aporiamur, sed non destituimur.
footnotes: a: a prima manu: toirsech for toirsich
glosses.glossTrans: we are not sad.

glosses.latin: patimur sed non angustiamur: aporiamur, sed non destituimur.
footnotes: c: literal and unidiomatic translation of the Latin deponent
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we refuse<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: patimur sed non angustiamur: aporiamur, sed non destituimur.
footnotes: b: The ni eter (?) is written under the rge of derge. The gloss is a prima manu
d: a similar translation of the Latin passive
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we are not at all forsaken<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: deiicimur, sed non perimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because quod dicimus is true.

glosses.latin: Semper mortificationem Iesu in corpore nostro circumferentes, ut uita Iesu in corporibus nostrís manifestetur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]crucem[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] am[Con]al[/Con] rombo marb ísu donbiuthso [GLat]sic et nós[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. crucem ɫ. amal rombo marb ísu donbiuthso sic et nós
glosses.glossFNs: .i. crucem ɫ. amal rombo marb ísu donbiuthso sic et nós
glosses.glossTrans: as Jesus was dead to this world, sic etc.

glosses.latin: Semper mortificationem Iesu in corpore nostro circumferentes, ut uita Iesu in corporibus nostrís manifestetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when we lead.

glosses.latin: Semper mortificationem Iesu in corpore nostro circumferentes, ut uita Iesu in corporibus nostrís manifestetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may have the glory wherein Christ is in heaven.

glosses.latin: Ergo mors in nobís operatur, uita autem in uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ambás tiagmeni doáirci bethid dúibsi [ie].i.[/ie] is arbethid dúibsi tiágmini bás
glosses.glossText: .i. ambás tiagmeni doáirci bethid dúibsi .i. is arbethid dúibsi tiágmini bás
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ambás tiagmeni doáirci bethid dúibsi .i. is arbethid dúibsi tiágmini bás
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the death to which we go causes life unto you; that is, it is for the sake of life to you that we go to death.

glosses.latin: Omnia enim propter uos, ut gratia habundans propter multos in gratiarum actione, abundet in gloriam Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for your sakes.

glosses.latin: Omnia enim propter uos, ut gratia habundans propter multos in gratiarum actione, abundet in gloriam Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the variety of the gifts which are bestowed on every one.

glosses.latin: Omnia enim propter uos, ut gratia habundans propter multos in gratiarum actione, abundet in gloriam Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the graces.

glosses.latin: Omnia enim propter uos, ut gratia habundans propter multos in gratiarum actione, abundet in gloriam Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that all be to the magnifying of God.

glosses.latin: is qui intus est renouatur de die in diem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. better and better.

glosses.latin: Id enim, quod in praesenti est momentaneum et leue
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the momentary.

glosses.latin: tribulationis nostrae, suprá modum in sublimitate aeternum gloriae pondus operatur in nobís;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. greatly

glosses.latin: tribulationis nostrae, suprá modum in sublimitate aeternum gloriae pondus operatur in nobís;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: tribulationis nostrae, suprá modum in sublimitate aeternum gloriae pondus operatur in nobís;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of reward to us.

glosses.latin: Non contemplantibus nobís quae uidentur, sed quae non uidentur; quae enim uidentur, temporalia sunt, quae autem non uidentur, aeterna sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we love not things present.

glosses.latin: Non contemplantibus nobís quae uidentur, sed quae non uidentur; quae enim uidentur, temporalia sunt, quae autem non uidentur, aeterna sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not worth while to love them.

glosses.latin: Non contemplantibus nobís quae uidentur, sed quae non uidentur; quae enim uidentur, temporalia sunt, quae autem non uidentur, aeterna sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. proper, however, is attention to these.

glosses.latin: Nam et in hoc ingemiscimus, habitationem nostram, quae de caelo est, superindui cupientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it irks us the severance of body and of soul.

glosses.latin: Nam et in hoc ingemiscimus, habitationem nostram, quae de caelo est, superindui cupientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that a house of immortality be let down around us from heaven.

glosses.latin: Nam et qui sumus in hoc tabernaculo, ingemiscimus grauati .... ut absorbeatur quod mortale est a uita.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. after the eternal life.

glosses.latin: Nam et qui sumus in hoc tabernaculo, ingemiscimus grauati .... ut absorbeatur quod mortale est a uita.
glosses.glossTrans: sore seems to us the severance of body and of soul.

glosses.latin: Nam et qui sumus in hoc tabernaculo, ingemiscimus grauati .... ut absorbeatur quod mortale est a uita.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that Vita might come over that body.

glosses.latin: Qui autem efficit nos ... Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is God.

glosses.latin: Per fidem enim ambulamus, et non per spiciem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not knowledge to us.

glosses.latin: Audemus autem, et bonam uoluntatem habemus magis peregrinari de corpore, et praesentes esse ad Dominum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Audemus autem, et bonam uoluntatem habemus magis peregrinari de corpore, et praesentes esse ad Dominum.
footnotes: a: a prima manu: leg. laimimmir-sni ‘we dare’?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Audemus autem, et bonam uoluntatem habemus magis peregrinari de corpore, et praesentes esse ad Dominum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we consent to it.

glosses.latin: Audemus autem, et bonam uoluntatem habemus magis peregrinari de corpore, et praesentes esse ad Dominum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is assu linn scarad friarcorp massudiing anrogada[Con]m[/Con]mar[b] [ie].i.[/ie] techt innar corp fornem
glosses.glossText: .i. is assu linn scarad friarcorp massudiing anrogadammar .i. techt innar corp fornem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is assu linn scarad friarcorp massudiing anrogadammar<sup>b</sup> .i. techt innar corp fornem
footnotes: b: The second letter may be r
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it seems easier to us to separate from our body if what we have prayed for is exceeding difficult, that is, to go in our bodies to heaven.

glosses.latin: Et ideo contendimus, siue absentes, siue praesentes, placere illi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore iscuci rigmi isferr dún [GLat]placere illi[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hore iscuci rigmi isferr dún placere illi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore iscuci rigmi isferr dún placere illi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since it is to Him we shall go, it is better for us placere illi.

glosses.latin: Omnes enim nos manifestari ante tribunal Christi oportet, ut refferat unusquisque propria corporis sui, prout gessit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. meet for us is its fair wage out of our body.

glosses.latin: Omnes enim nos manifestari ante tribunal Christi oportet, ut refferat unusquisque propria corporis sui, prout gessit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]opera[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ni imdidnibter[c] ainech and octabirt coibsen allae[d] sin
glosses.glossText: .i. opera .i. ni imdidnibter ainech and octabirt coibsen allae sin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. opera .i. ni imdidnibterc ainech and octabirt coibsen allaed sin
footnotes: c: leg. imdidnibther
d: There is a stroke before the e
e: cf. 14a 4 supra, and Gal. ii. 6, Sarauw
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no person<sup>e</sup> will be protected there in giving confession on that day.

glosses.latin: autem manifesti sumus; spero autem et in conscientís uestrís manifestos nos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He knows us quod etc.

glosses.latin: autem manifesti sumus; spero autem et in conscientís uestrís manifestos nos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am certain.

glosses.latin: autem manifesti sumus; spero autem et in conscientís uestrís manifestos nos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that even you also know us.

glosses.latin: Non iterum nos commendamus uobís, sed occassionem damus uobis gloriandi pro nobís ut habeatis ad eos, qui in faciem gloriantur, et non in corde.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni reca[Con]m[/Con] ales rolasid súil torunn itossich[a]
glosses.glossText: .i. ni recam ales rolasid súil torunn itossich
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni recam ales rolasid súil torunn itossich<sup>a</sup>
footnotes: a: leg. itossuch
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we need it not, ye have cast an eye over us at first.

glosses.latin: Non iterum nos commendamus uobís, sed occassionem damus uobis gloriandi pro nobís ut habeatis ad eos, qui in faciem gloriantur, et non in corde.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non iterum nos commendamus uobís, sed occassionem damus uobis gloriandi pro nobís ut habeatis ad eos, qui in faciem gloriantur, et non in corde.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we cause it to you.

glosses.latin: Non iterum nos commendamus uobís, sed occassionem damus uobis gloriandi pro nobís ut habeatis ad eos, qui in faciem gloriantur, et non in corde.
footnotes: e: cf. 13b 13 supra
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let them not pass you<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Non iterum nos commendamus uobís, sed occassionem damus uobis gloriandi pro nobís ut habeatis ad eos, qui in faciem gloriantur, et non in corde.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non iterum nos commendamus uobís, sed occassionem damus uobis gloriandi pro nobís ut habeatis ad eos, qui in faciem gloriantur, et non in corde.
glosses.glossTrans: in word.

glosses.latin: Non iterum nos commendamus uobís, sed occassionem damus uobis gloriandi pro nobís ut habeatis ad eos, qui in faciem gloriantur, et non in corde.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] co[Con]m[/Con]badsníni formoidemsi [ie].i.[/ie] ↄérbaridsi anatdenat [b]armagistir[/b] nidignemni cena p[Con]ri[/Con]dchidsi
glosses.glossText: .i. combadsníni formoidemsi .i. ↄérbaridsi anatdenat armagistir nidignemni cena pridchidsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. combadsníni formoidemsi .i. ↄérbaridsi anatdenat armagistir<sup>b</sup> nidignemni cena pridchidsi
footnotes: b: MS. armgistir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we might be your boast, that is, so that ye may say: ‘what our masters do not, we will not do, though ye preach it.’

glosses.latin: Siue enim mente excedimus, Deo; siue sobrii sumus, uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from meditating on God.

glosses.latin: Siue enim mente excedimus, Deo; siue sobrii sumus, uobís.
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to you.

glosses.latin: Siue enim mente excedimus, Deo; siue sobrii sumus, uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: isdúibsi [GLat]proficit[/GLat] bacoir dúibsi ciado berthe testas dinni
glosses.glossText: isdúibsi proficit bacoir dúibsi ciado berthe testas dinni
glosses.glossFNs: isdúibsi proficit bacoir dúibsi ciado berthe testas dinni
glosses.glossTrans: it is to you proficit. It were proper for you to give testimony of us.

glosses.latin: Caritas enim Christi urget nos; estimantes hoc, quoniam si unus pro omnibus mortuus est, ergo omnes mortui sunt;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]excedere[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]non cogitare[/GLat] tola [GLat]et[/GLat] accobra inbetha act cach lasel dún for imrádud dé insel aile forp[Con]re[/Con]cept ar seirc dǽ dogníam cechtarde
glosses.glossText: .i. excedere ɫ. non cogitare tola et accobra inbetha act cach lasel dún for imrádud dé insel aile forprecept ar seirc dǽ dogníam cechtarde
glosses.glossFNs: .i. excedere ɫ. non cogitare tola et accobra inbetha act cach lasel dún for imrádud dé insel aile forprecept ar seirc dǽ dogníam cechtarde
glosses.glossTrans: or non cogitare the wishes and desires of the world, but that we should be at one time meditating on God, at another time preaching. For love of God we do each of the twain.

glosses.latin: Caritas enim Christi urget nos; estimantes hoc, quoniam si unus pro omnibus mortuus est, ergo omnes mortui sunt;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we are certain.

glosses.latin: Et pro omnibus mortuus est [Christus], ut et qui uiuunt, iam non sibi uiuant, sed ei qui pro ipsís mortuus est et resurrexit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non disiderio carna[Con]li[/Con][/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] arnaconroib dethiden forneuch act tol dǽ dodénum
glosses.glossText: .i. non disiderio carnali .i. arnaconroib dethiden forneuch act tol dǽ dodénum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. non disiderio carnali .i. arnaconroib dethiden forneuch act tol dǽ dodénum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that no care be on any one save to do God’s will.

glosses.latin: Et pro omnibus mortuus est [Christus], ut et qui uiuunt, iam non sibi uiuant, sed ei qui pro ipsís mortuus est et resurrexit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni aírmithi ar aithis ambás nisin arasreracht
glosses.glossText: .i. ni aírmithi ar aithis ambás nisin arasreracht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni aírmithi ar aithis ambás nisin arasreracht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that death is not to be counted as a reproach, for He has risen again.

glosses.latin: Itaque nos ex hoc neminem nouimus secundum carnem. Et si cognouimus secundum carnem Christum sed nunc iam non nouimus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre dorrigeni cr[Con]ist[/Con] anuileso erunn ni uisse doneuch iaru[Con]m[/Con] buith inaccobor colnidiu [GLat]Aliter neminem nouimus christum móri iterum pro pecatoribus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre dorrigeni crist anuileso erunn ni uisse doneuch iarum buith inaccobor colnidiu Aliter neminem nouimus christum móri iterum pro pecatoribus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre dorrigeni crist anuileso erunn ni uisse doneuch iarum buith inaccobor colnidiu Aliter neminem nouimus christum móri iterum pro pecatoribus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since Christ has done all this for us, it is not just for any one consequently to be in carnal desire.

glosses.latin: Itaque nos ex hoc neminem nouimus secundum carnem. Et si cognouimus secundum carnem Christum sed nunc iam non nouimus.
footnotes: d: leg. rombói Críst ‘that Christ was’?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Christ has been in (the) flesh.

glosses.latin: Itaque nos ex hoc neminem nouimus secundum carnem. Et si cognouimus secundum carnem Christum sed nunc iam non nouimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is resurrexit etc.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem Deus erat in Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Godhead, i.e. it was not Manhood without Godhead.

glosses.latin: Pro Christo ergo legatione fungimur .... obsecramus pro Christo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] techtairecht [GLat]ut sicut misit me pater et ego[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. techtairecht ut sicut misit me pater et ego rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. techtairecht ut sicut misit me pater et ego rl.b
footnotes: b: mitto uos, John xx. 21
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ambassage ut etc.

glosses.latin: Pro Christo ergo legatione fungimur .... obsecramus pro Christo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niar nert indomuin guidmit act isarchrist
glosses.glossText: .i. niar nert indomuin guidmit act isarchrist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niar nert indomuin guidmit act isarchrist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for the sake of the might of the world do we pray, but it is for the sake of Christ.

glosses.latin: Eum qui non nouerat peccatum, pro nobís peccatum fecit, ut nos efficeremur iustitia [Dei] in ipso.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he who.

glosses.latin: Eum qui non nouerat peccatum, pro nobís peccatum fecit, ut nos efficeremur iustitia [Dei] in ipso.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] idbart ar ba ainm leoso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]peccatum[/GLat] dundidbairt adoparthe dar cenn [GLat]peccati[/GLat] darcenn [GLat]pecca[Con]ti[/Con][/GLat] didiu síl adim adropredso[Con]m[/Con] combouisse ciasb[Con]er[/Con]the [GLat]peccatum[/GLat] di
glosses.glossText: .i. idbart ar ba ainm leosom peccatum dundidbairt adoparthe dar cenn peccati darcenn peccati didiu síl adim adropredsom combouisse ciasberthe peccatum di
glosses.glossFNs: .i. idbart ar ba ainm leosom peccatum dundidbairt adoparthe dar cenn peccati darcenn peccati didiu síl adim adropredsom combouisse ciasberthe peccatum di
footnotes: d: The glossator means that peccatum, like Hebr. chattáth and Gr. ἁμαρτία, was
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. an offering: for ‘peccatum’ was a name among them for the offering that used to be offered because of sin. Because therefore of the peccatum of Adam’s seed He has been offered, wherefore it is just that it (Christ’s sacrifice) should be called ‘peccatumd.’

glosses.latin: Eum qui non nouerat peccatum, pro nobís peccatum fecit, ut nos efficeremur iustitia [Dei] in ipso.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. much of marvel has been wrought therefrom.

glosses.latin: Ecce nunc tempus acceptabile, ecce nunc dies salutis.
footnotes: c: cf. Wb. 20c 16
glosses.glossTrans: every one’s life-time.

glosses.latin: Ecce nunc tempus acceptabile, ecce nunc dies salutis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] airiten irisse dochách [GLat]et[/GLat] airiten caich ódia
glosses.glossText: .i. airiten irisse dochách et airiten caich ódia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. airiten irisse dochách et airiten caich ódia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (the time) of acceptance of faith by every one and of every one’s acceptance by God.

glosses.latin: Ecce nunc tempus acceptabile, ecce nunc dies salutis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of salvation of every one through faith.

glosses.latin: Nemini dantes ullam offensionem, ut non uituperetur ministerium nostrum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when we give not to any one.

glosses.latin: Nemini dantes ullam offensionem, ut non uituperetur ministerium nostrum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. meet for us ut etc.

glosses.latin: Nemini dantes ullam offensionem, ut non uituperetur ministerium nostrum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if we fulfil what we preach, we shall not be blamed afterwards.

glosses.latin: Sed in omnibus exhibeamus nosmet ipsos sicut Dei ministros ... in necessitatibus .... in angustís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in dangers.

glosses.latin: Sed in omnibus exhibeamus nosmet ipsos sicut Dei ministros ... in necessitatibus .... in angustís.
glosses.glossTrans: cold and hunger.

glosses.latin: In plagís, in carceribus, ...in laboribus, in uigilis, in ieiuniis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: In plagís, in carceribus, ...in laboribus, in uigilis, in ieiuniis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: In plagís, in carceribus, ...in laboribus, in uigilis, in ieiuniis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. going from country to country.

glosses.latin: In plagís, in carceribus, ...in laboribus, in uigilis, in ieiuniis.
glosses.glossFullTags: fochidi arécin cossin fochidi othuil anisiu sis
glosses.glossText: fochidi arécin cossin fochidi othuil anisiu sis
glosses.glossFNs: fochidi arécin cossin fochidi othuil anisiu sis
glosses.glossTrans: so far it is compulsory tribulations: what follows is voluntary tribulations.

glosses.latin: In scientia, in longanimitate, in suauitate, in Spiritu sancto, in caritate non ficta.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in knowledge without pride(?).

glosses.latin: In scientia, in longanimitate, in suauitate, in Spiritu sancto, in caritate non ficta.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in affability.

glosses.latin: In scientia, in longanimitate, in suauitate, in Spiritu sancto, in caritate non ficta.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]sine simulatione quia spiritus sanctus efugit fictum[/GLat] atá di[Con]diu[/Con] [GLat]spiritus sanctus in nobís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. sine simulatione quia spiritus sanctus efugit fictum atá didiu spiritus sanctus in nobís
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sine simulatione quia spiritus sanctus efugit fictum atá didiu spiritus sanctus in nobís
glosses.glossTrans: Spiritus Sanctus, then, is in nobis.

glosses.latin: In scientia, in longanimitate, in suauitate, in Spiritu sancto, in caritate non ficta.
glosses.glossTrans: on lips tantum.

glosses.latin: ... in uirtute Dei, per arma iustitiae a dextrís, et a sinistris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of working miracles.

glosses.latin: ... in uirtute Dei, per arma iustitiae a dextrís, et a sinistris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. arms of righteousness to defend us.

glosses.latin: ... in uirtute Dei, per arma iustitiae a dextrís, et a sinistris.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nachin rogba úall [GLat]de prosperís[/GLat] nachinrogba derchoíniud [GLat]in aduersís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nachin rogba úall de prosperís nachinrogba derchoíniud in aduersís
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nachin rogba úall de prosperís nachinrogba derchoíniud in aduersís
footnotes: d: dexter = prosper (‘dextra auspicia prospera’ Festus): sinister = adversus (Verg. Georg. i. 444). “Ut ne prosperis elevemur, nec turbemur adversis, aut desperemus,” St Anselm
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that pride de prosperis may not seize us: that despair in aduersis may not seize usd.

glosses.latin: Per gloriam et ignobilitatem .... sicut qui ignoti, et cognoti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]generis[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] cenonmolid cenon airid nitabir uáil nataris fornn
glosses.glossText: .i. generis .i. cenonmolid cenon airid nitabir uáil nataris fornn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. generis .i. cenonmolid cenon airid nitabir uáil nataris fornn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whether ye praise us, whether ye blame us, brings neither pride nor sadness upon us.

glosses.latin: Per gloriam et ignobilitatem .... sicut qui ignoti, et cognoti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] ninfessed cách [GLat]et[/GLat] ronfitir calléic [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]ignoti ab hominibus et cognoti apud deum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal ninfessed cách et ronfitir calléic ɫ. ignoti ab hominibus et cognoti apud deum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal ninfessed cách et ronfitir calléic ɫ. ignoti ab hominibus et cognoti apud deum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as though every one knew us not, and yet he knows us.

glosses.latin: Quasi morientes, et ecce uiuimus; ut castigati, et non mortificati.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ready to go to death every day.

glosses.latin: Quasi morientes, et ecce uiuimus; ut castigati, et non mortificati.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God protects us from every tribulation.

glosses.latin: Quasi morientes, et ecce uiuimus; ut castigati, et non mortificati.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God protects us still.

glosses.latin: Quasi tristes, semper autem gaudentes; sicut egentes, ... et omnia possedentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. nevertheless verily we are joyful even in tribulationibus.

glosses.latin: Quasi tristes, semper autem gaudentes; sicut egentes, ... et omnia possedentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. truly.

glosses.latin: Quasi tristes, semper autem gaudentes; sicut egentes, ... et omnia possedentes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]misteria spiritalia[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]alimenta per operationem nostram[/GLat] ↄnabia[Con]m[/Con] ingorti nanochti [GLat]ut est totus mundus uiri fidelis est[/GLat][a]
glosses.glossText: .i. misteria spiritalia ɫ. alimenta per operationem nostram ↄnabiam ingorti nanochti ut est totus mundus uiri fidelis est
glosses.glossFNs: .i. misteria spiritalia ɫ. alimenta per operationem nostram ↄnabiam ingorti nanochti ut est totus mundus uiri fidelis esta
footnotes: a: Pelagius (Migne xxx. 822) has: Sicut ait Salomon: Eius qui fidelis est, est totus mundus diuitiarum, et v. Prov. xx. 6 (uirum autem fidelem quis inueniet?) and 1 Cor. iii. 22 (omnia enim uestra sunt)
glosses.glossTrans: so that we shall not be in hunger or in nakedness.

glosses.latin: Os nostrum patet ad uos, ó Chorinti! cór nostrum dilatatum est.
footnotes: b: leg. ↄnabiam, which is translated
e: Matth. xxv. 35, 36
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we shall not be in hunger or in nakedness<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Os nostrum patet ad uos, ó Chorinti! cór nostrum dilatatum est.
footnotes: c: This word seems to be out of place
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have a desire to teach you.

glosses.latin: Non angustiamini in nobís, angustiamini in uisceribus uestrís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not straitly is it that our teaching is given to you.

glosses.latin: Non angustiamini in nobís, angustiamini in uisceribus uestrís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iscumung fuiribsi im[Con]murgu[/Con] occanairitin naforcetal sin
glosses.glossText: .i. iscumung fuiribsi immurgu occanairitin naforcetal sin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iscumung fuiribsi immurgu occanairitin naforcetal sin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. straitened, however, are ye in receiving those teachings.

glosses.latin: Eandem [autem] habentes remunerationem, tamquam filís dico, dilatamini et uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] diambad mathi ropia indfochricc dobérthar dúnni
glosses.glossText: .i. diambad mathi ropia indfochricc dobérthar dúnni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. diambad mathi ropia indfochricc dobérthar dúnni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye be good, ye shall have the reward which will be given to us.

glosses.latin: Eandem [autem] habentes remunerationem, tamquam filís dico, dilatamini et uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as unto children: that is, according to teaching.

glosses.latin: Eandem [autem] habentes remunerationem, tamquam filís dico, dilatamini et uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] badlethan formenme [GLat]et[/GLat] forcride ocairitin indforcitil sa
glosses.glossText: .i. badlethan formenme et forcride ocairitin indforcitil sa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. badlethan formenme et forcride ocairitin indforcitil sa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let your mind and your heart be enlarged in receiving this teaching.

glosses.latin: Nolite iugum ducere cum infidilibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not the yoke in which ye are be the same.

glosses.latin: Uos enim estis templum Dei uiui.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] istempul asb[Con]er[/Con]ar doib hóre isóendia atreba indib
glosses.glossText: .i. istempul asberar doib hóre isóendia atreba indib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. istempul asberar doib hóre isóendia atreba indib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are called a ‘temple,’ since it is one God that dwells in them.

glosses.latin: . . carisimi, mundemus nos ab omni inquinamento carnis et spiritus, perficientes sanctificationem in timore Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] trianman t[Con]ra[/Con] dob[Con]eir[/Con] doib [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]templum dei et filii et carissi[Sup]mi[/Sup][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. trianman tra dobeir doib .i. templum dei et filii et carissi[mi]
glosses.glossFNs: .i. trianman tra dobeir doib .i. templum dei et filii et carissi[mi]
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. three names, then, he gives to them.

glosses.latin: . . carisimi, mundemus nos ab omni inquinamento carnis et spiritus, perficientes sanctificationem in timore Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] atcomla friu [GLat]ut mós est bonís doctoribus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. atcomla friu ut mós est bonís doctoribus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. atcomla friu ut mós est bonís doctoribus
