glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he joins himself to them ut etc.

glosses.latin: . . carisimi, mundemus nos ab omni inquinamento carnis et spiritus, perficientes sanctificationem in timore Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that your body and your soul be clean.

glosses.latin: . . carisimi, mundemus nos ab omni inquinamento carnis et spiritus, perficientes sanctificationem in timore Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] corrop nóib fornanim in hómun dǽ
glosses.glossText: .i. corrop nóib fornanim in hómun dǽ
glosses.glossFNs: .i. corrop nóib fornanim in hómun dǽ
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that your soul be holy in fear of God.

glosses.latin: . . neminem circumuenimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have deceived no one.

glosses.latin: Non ad condempnationem uestram dico, praedixi[mus] enim quod in cordibus nostrís estis.
glosses.glossText: .i. ni arindí doróntæ si anísiu .i. lessionem rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni arindí doróntæ si anísiu .i. lessionem rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not that ye should have done this.

glosses.latin: Non ad condempnationem uestram dico, praedixi[mus] enim quod in cordibus nostrís estis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] niáir doneuch molad alaili ciasb[Con]er[/Con]sa inso nitobartatháir si act is do bar tinchosc arandernaid andogniam ni [GLat]et[/GLat] arnadernaid annad denamni
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] niáir doneuch molad alaili ciasbersa inso nitobartatháir si act is do bar tinchosc arandernaid andogniam ni et arnadernaid annad denamni
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] niáir doneuch molad alaili ciasbersa inso nitobartatháir si act is do bar tinchosc arandernaid andogniam ni et arnadernaid annad denamni
glosses.glossTrans: no reproach to one is praise of another. Though I say this, it is not to reprimand you, but to instruct you, that ye may do what we do, and that ye may not do what we do not.

glosses.latin: Non ad condempnationem uestram dico, praedixi[mus] enim quod in cordibus nostrís estis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through fulfilment and imitation of whatever we do.

glosses.latin: Multa mihi fiducia est apud uos, multa mihi gloriatio pro uobís .... superabundo gaudio in omni tribulatione nostra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am bold to give evidence for you.

glosses.latin: Multa mihi fiducia est apud uos, multa mihi gloriatio pro uobís .... superabundo gaudio in omni tribulatione nostra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore dongniithsi arnintsamil ni hi cacha bésaib [GLat]de uera bonitate[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hore dongniithsi arnintsamil ni hi cacha bésaib de uera bonitate
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore dongniithsi arnintsamil ni hi cacha bésaib de uera bonitate
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because ye do imitate us in all usages de etc.

glosses.latin: Multa mihi fiducia est apud uos, multa mihi gloriatio pro uobís .... superabundo gaudio in omni tribulatione nostra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore adib foirbthisi ni ↄairigursa na imned
glosses.glossText: .i. hore adib foirbthisi ni ↄairigursa na imned
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore adib foirbthisi ni ↄairigursa na imned
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. seeing that ye are perfect, I feel not any tribulation.

glosses.latin: nulam requiem habuit caro nostra, sed omnem tribulationem passi sumus; foris pugnae, intus timores.
footnotes: a: MS. fis, with v written over i
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since we know not tidings from you.

glosses.latin: nulam requiem habuit caro nostra, sed omnem tribulationem passi sumus; foris pugnae, intus timores.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: nulam requiem habuit caro nostra, sed omnem tribulationem passi sumus; foris pugnae, intus timores.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]hereticorum et aliorum[/GLat] bite im muntaras [GLat]et[/GLat] nístabir acride
glosses.glossText: .i. hereticorum et aliorum bite im muntaras et nístabir acride
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hereticorum et aliorum bite im muntaras et nístabir acride
glosses.glossTrans: who are in my communion–and (yet) their heart brings them not (to me).

glosses.latin: Sed qui consulatur humiles, consulatus est nos Deus in aduentu Titi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isgnáth do cobir cach lobir hifochidib
glosses.glossText: .i. isgnáth do cobir cach lobir hifochidib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isgnáth do cobir cach lobir hifochidib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He is wont to help every feeble one in tribulations.

glosses.latin: Sed qui consulatur humiles, consulatus est nos Deus in aduentu Titi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with tidings from you.

glosses.latin: consulatus est in uobís; referens nobis ... uestram aemulationem pro me.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indfáilte robói dó libsi [ie].i.[/ie] hore fonairnicc arachiunn [GLat]disiderium et merorem et emulationem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. indfáilte robói dó libsi .i. hore fonairnicc arachiunn disiderium et merorem et emulationem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indfáilte robói dó libsi .i. hore fonairnicc arachiunn disiderium et merorem et emulationem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the joy that he had with you, that is, because he found when he came desiderium etc.

glosses.latin: consulatus est in uobís; referens nobis ... uestram aemulationem pro me.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Titus.

glosses.latin: consulatus est in uobís; referens nobis ... uestram aemulationem pro me.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. your zeal against false apostles for my sake.

glosses.latin: non me penitet, et si peniteret, uidens quod aepistola ilia (etsi ad horam) uos contristauit.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: non me penitet, et si peniteret, uidens quod aepistola ilia (etsi ad horam) uos contristauit.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: non me penitet, et si peniteret, uidens quod aepistola ilia (etsi ad horam) uos contristauit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though it be for a season, that is, merely an hour.

glosses.latin: non me penitet, et si peniteret, uidens quod aepistola ilia (etsi ad horam) uos contristauit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. besides I had no regret.

glosses.latin: Nunc gaudeo, non quia contristati estis, contristati enim estis secundum Deum, ut in nullo detrimentum patiemini ex nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nunc gaudeo, non quia contristati estis, contristati enim estis secundum Deum, ut in nullo detrimentum patiemini ex nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not your grief that causes joy to me.

glosses.latin: Nunc gaudeo, non quia contristati estis, contristati enim estis secundum Deum, ut in nullo detrimentum patiemini ex nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni indráigne dúib cininfil lib aridibmaithi cene
glosses.glossText: .i. ni indráigne dúib cininfil lib aridibmaithi cene
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni indráigne dúib cininfil lib aridibmaithi cene
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is no detriment to you, though we are not with you, for ye are good already.

glosses.latin: Quae enim secundum Deum tristitia est, penitentiam in salutem stabilem operatur; saeculi autem tristitia mortem operatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that tristitia worketh salutem.

glosses.latin: Quae enim secundum Deum tristitia est, penitentiam in salutem stabilem operatur; saeculi autem tristitia mortem operatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] imdethidnea [GLat]sæculi[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] doguilse dineuch adbaill[a] [GLat]et[/GLat] dineuch nád etar [GLat]et[/GLat] dineuch bís la nech nad bí lat so
glosses.glossText: .i. imdethidnea sæculi .i. doguilse dineuch adbaill et dineuch nád etar et dineuch bís la nech nad bí lat so
glosses.glossFNs: .i. imdethidnea sæculi .i. doguilse dineuch adbailla et dineuch nád etar et dineuch bís la nech nad bí lat so
footnotes: a: For the form cf. Ml. 108a 3, LU. 20a 34
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. concerning (the) anxieties saeculi, even grief for what perishes, and for what is unattained, and for what some one hath which thou hast not.

glosses.latin: Ecce enim hoc ipsum ... quantam in uobís operatur sollicitudinem; ... sed uendictam. In omnibus exhibuistis uos, incontaminatos esse negotio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. greatly.

glosses.latin: Ecce enim hoc ipsum ... quantam in uobís operatur sollicitudinem; ... sed uendictam. In omnibus exhibuistis uos, incontaminatos esse negotio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. on Devil and desires, i.e. bonum opus after it.

glosses.latin: Ecce enim hoc ipsum ... quantam in uobís operatur sollicitudinem; ... sed uendictam. In omnibus exhibuistis uos, incontaminatos esse negotio.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ecce enim hoc ipsum ... quantam in uobís operatur sollicitudinem; ... sed uendictam. In omnibus exhibuistis uos, incontaminatos esse negotio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with anxiety.

glosses.latin: . . scripsi uobis . . ad manifestandam sollicitudinem nostram, quam pro uobis habemus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for thinking of you.

glosses.latin: Ideo consulati sumus; ... abundantius magis gauisi sumus super gaudio Titi, quia refectus est spiritus eius ab omnibus uobis.
footnotes: b: There is a stroke high above the first o; recte donrodonadni, but cf. conromíccad Wb. 28a 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have been comforted quod etc.

glosses.latin: Ideo consulati sumus; ... abundantius magis gauisi sumus super gaudio Titi, quia refectus est spiritus eius ab omnibus uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ideo consulati sumus; ... abundantius magis gauisi sumus super gaudio Titi, quia refectus est spiritus eius ab omnibus uobis.
footnotes: c: donintarrái seems = do-n-ind-to-ro-ṡói, the perf. sg. 3 of the verb dointáim, with the prefix ro, and the relative infixed. So -tintarrad, Fiac l. 18 = do-ind-to-ro-ṡóad. Only in the former case the verb is intransitive, in the latter it is transitive (‘converteret’). W. S. But see Trans. Phil. Soc. 1895–8, p. 180, and Sarauw p. 84 note, who brings do intarrai from to-ind-ro-ṡói
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not sadly that he has returned.

glosses.latin: confussus; ... gloriatio nostra, quae fuit ad Titum, ueritas facta est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nirbomebul domsa ep[Con]er[/Con]t frisso[Con]m[/Con] rondbiad fáilte libsi [GLat]et[/GLat]robtismaithi formbésasi arachiunn
glosses.glossText: .i. nirbomebul domsa epert frissom rondbiad fáilte libsi etrobtismaithi formbésasi arachiunn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nirbomebul domsa epert frissom rondbiad fáilte libsi etrobtismaithi formbésasi arachiunn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was no shame to me to say to him that he would have welcome with you and that he would find your morals good.

glosses.latin: confussus; ... gloriatio nostra, quae fuit ad Titum, ueritas facta est.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: confussus; ... gloriatio nostra, quae fuit ad Titum, ueritas facta est.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: confussus; ... gloriatio nostra, quae fuit ad Titum, ueritas facta est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all true sicut dixi.

glosses.latin: Et uiscera eius abundantius, in uobis sunt, reminiscentis omnium uestrum obedientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. beyond every one.

glosses.latin: Et uiscera eius abundantius, in uobis sunt, reminiscentis omnium uestrum obedientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who remembers.

glosses.latin: et altisima paupertas eorum habundauit in diuitibus semplicitatis eorum.
footnotes: a: rectius cenchessacht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. desire without grudging.

glosses.latin: et altisima paupertas eorum habundauit in diuitibus semplicitatis eorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their paupertas and their simplicitas have produced riches for us.

glosses.latin: Quia secundum uirtutem testimonium illís reddo, et supra uirtutem uoluntarii fuerunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this I marvel at.

glosses.latin: Quia secundum uirtutem testimonium illís reddo, et supra uirtutem uoluntarii fuerunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isde dobiur forcell dineurt innadeserce robói indibso[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. isde dobiur forcell dineurt innadeserce robói indibsom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isde dobiur forcell dineurt innadeserce robói indibsom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. hereof I bear witness, of the strength of the charity which was in them.

glosses.latin: Cum multa exortatione obsecrantes nos gratiam, et commonicationem ministerii.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]elimoy[Con]sin[/Con]am quae per nós sanctis datur[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] conrobad cuit doibso[Con]m[/Con] occatimthirecht
glosses.glossText: .i. elimoysinam quae per nós sanctis datur ɫ. conrobad cuit doibsom occatimthirecht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. elimoysinam quae per nós sanctis datur ɫ. conrobad cuit doibsom occatimthirecht
glosses.glossTrans: so that there be a share for them in ministering to them.

glosses.latin: semet ipsos dederunt primum Domino.
footnotes: b: leg. resindalmsinsin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. before that alms.

glosses.latin: Ita ut rogaremus Titum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isuáichnid t[Con]ra[/Con] cid diandechuith tit [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]querere elimoysinam[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isuáichnid tra cid diandechuith tit .i. querere elimoysinam
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isuáichnid tra cid diandechuith tit .i. querere elimoysinam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is obvious, therefore, why Titus went.

glosses.latin: Sed sicut in omnibus habundatis fide et sermone, ... ut in hac gratia abundetis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye have all this.

glosses.latin: Sed sicut in omnibus habundatis fide et sermone, ... ut in hac gratia abundetis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that you may give it better than any one (else).

glosses.latin: uestrae caritatis ingenium bonum conprobans.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to prove your charity.

glosses.latin: Scitis enim gratiam Domini nostri Iesu Christi, quoniam propter uos egenus factus est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] istoich ciadorattid si ní diamuintir itmaithi aarilti frib
glosses.glossText: .i. istoich ciadorattid si ní diamuintir itmaithi aarilti frib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. istoich ciadorattid si ní diamuintir itmaithi aarilti frib
footnotes: d: literally: good are His merits as to you
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is right that ye should give somewhat to His (Christ’s) household, He deserves well of you<sup>d</sup>

glosses.latin: Et consilium in hoc do, hoc enim uobis utile est, qui non solum facere, sed et uelle cœpistis ab anno priore.
glosses.glossTrans: this is my advice, to give it.

glosses.latin: Et consilium in hoc do, hoc enim uobis utile est, qui non solum facere, sed et uelle cœpistis ab anno priore.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because ye desire it.

glosses.latin: Et consilium in hoc do, hoc enim uobis utile est, qui non solum facere, sed et uelle cœpistis ab anno priore.
footnotes: c: Possibly on hurid
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nunc uero et facto perficite, ut quemadmodum promptus est animus uoluntatis, ita sit et perficiendi ex eo quod habetis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that uelle.

glosses.latin: Nunc uero et facto perficite, ut quemadmodum promptus est animus uoluntatis, ita sit et perficiendi ex eo quod habetis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the desire.

glosses.latin: Nunc uero et facto perficite, ut quemadmodum promptus est animus uoluntatis, ita sit et perficiendi ex eo quod habetis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nunc uero et facto perficite, ut quemadmodum promptus est animus uoluntatis, ita sit et perficiendi ex eo quod habetis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] níbécen lóg na airlicud act taibrid afil lib
glosses.glossText: .i. níbécen lóg na airlicud act taibrid afil lib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. níbécen lóg na airlicud act taibrid afil lib
footnotes: e: lit. price
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. buying<sup>e</sup> or borrowing should not be necessary: but give what ye have.

glosses.latin: Si enim uoluntas prumpta est, secundum id quod habet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is desired.

glosses.latin: Si enim uoluntas prumpta est, secundum id quod habet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. according to the power that ye have.

glosses.latin: Non enim ut alís [sit] remissio, uobís autem tribulatio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not right that the one set should be consoled and that the other set should fast.

glosses.latin: In praesenti tempore, uestra habundantia illorum inopiam suppleat, ut et illorum abundantia uestrae inopiae sit supplimentum, ut fiat aequalitas, sicut scriptum est:
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the giving of the alms.

glosses.latin: In praesenti tempore, uestra habundantia illorum inopiam suppleat, ut et illorum abundantia uestrae inopiae sit supplimentum, ut fiat aequalitas, sicut scriptum est:
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the superabundance that ye have of the riches.

glosses.latin: In praesenti tempore, uestra habundantia illorum inopiam suppleat, ut et illorum abundantia uestrae inopiae sit supplimentum, ut fiat aequalitas, sicut scriptum est:
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they may beseech God for you.

glosses.latin: In praesenti tempore, uestra habundantia illorum inopiam suppleat, ut et illorum abundantia uestrae inopiae sit supplimentum, ut fiat aequalitas, sicut scriptum est:
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that there may be no defrauding of one by another.

glosses.latin: Qui multum habuit, non abundauit; et qui modicum, non rainorauit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni pu imdu do inmann cidtrén octecmallad
glosses.glossText: .i. ni pu imdu do inmann cidtrén octecmallad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni pu imdu do inmann cidtrén octecmallad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the manna was not more plentiful to him though he were mighty at gathering (it).

glosses.latin: Qui multum habuit, non abundauit; et qui modicum, non rainorauit.
footnotes: f: Exod. xvi. 18
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not less was his portion, though he was weak at gathering<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Misimus etiam cum illo fratrem, cuius laus in euangelio per omnes æclesias.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. teaching the gospel so that every one praises him.

glosses.latin: ... ordinatus est ab aeclesís comes perigrinationis nostrae, in hac gratia, quae ministratur a nobís ad Domini gloriam, et destinatam uoluntatem nostram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] istorise lacách abuith ocailli a almsine [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isuisse abuith icoimthecht dagdóine
glosses.glossText: .i. istorise lacách abuith ocailli a almsine ɫ. isuisse abuith icoimthecht dagdóine
glosses.glossFNs: .i. istorise lacách abuith ocailli a almsine ɫ. isuisse abuith icoimthecht dagdóine
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one deems it proper for him to be blessing his alms, or it is just for him to be in the society of good men.

glosses.latin: ... ordinatus est ab aeclesís comes perigrinationis nostrae, in hac gratia, quae ministratur a nobís ad Domini gloriam, et destinatam uoluntatem nostram.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we desire, then, that it should be done by you.

glosses.latin: ne quis [nos] uituperaret in hac plenitudine, quae ministratur a nobis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] itecht mudu[b] [GLat]elimoy[/GLat]. [vel]ɫ.[/vel] itoimtiu nábad do hierúsale[Con]m[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] [c][GLat]opes[/GLat][/c] nob[Con]er[/Con]tis [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ingabál[d] lóge ar p[Con]re[/Con]cepte am[Con]al[/Con] náṅgabimmse di[Con]diu[/Con] nigaib [GLat]lucas[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. itecht mudu elimoy. ɫ. itoimtiu nábad do hierúsalem .i. opes nobertis ɫ. ingabál lóge ar precepte amal náṅgabimmse didiu nigaib lucas
glosses.glossFNs: .i. itecht mudub elimoy. ɫ. itoimtiu nábad do hierúsalem .i. opesc nobertis ɫ. ingabáld lóge ar precepte amal náṅgabimmse didiu nigaib lucas
footnotes: b: leg. immudu?
c: MS. opus
d: rectius ingabáil
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for the loss of the alms, or for thinking that it was not to Jerusalem that they were brought, to wit, opes, or for taking pay for our preaching. As I do not take it then, Luke does not take it.

glosses.latin: apostoli aeclesiarum in gloria Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who preach God’s glory in etc.

glosses.latin: Ostensionem ergo ... in illos ostendite in facie aeclesiarum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ostensionem ergo ... in illos ostendite in facie aeclesiarum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that every church may see it.

glosses.latin: Nam de ministerio, quod fit in sanctos, ex abundantia est mihi scribere uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] gaibthir t[Con]ra[/Con] déde isintestiminse sís [ie].i.[/ie] rodbo isp[Con]re[/Con]cept béstatad dochorintib uilib arniepur frib innalmsin berar dohierus[Con]alem[/Con] arrofetar isirla[Con]m[/Con] lib ade. [GLat]Alit[Con]er[/Con][/GLat] isindalmsan arafocair anúas actisfor óis tuaithe arfocarar archuit indóissa gráid [GLat]et[/GLat] ind áissa foirbthi ní écen airócre
glosses.glossText: .i. gaibthir tra déde isintestiminse sís .i. rodbo isprecept béstatad dochorintib uilib arniepur frib innalmsin berar dohierusalem arrofetar isirlam lib ade. Aliter isindalmsan arafocair anúas actisfor óis tuaithe arfocarar archuit indóissa gráid et ind áissa foirbthi ní écen airócre
glosses.glossFNs: .i. gaibthir tra déde isintestiminse sís .i. rodbo isprecept béstatad dochorintib uilib arniepur frib innalmsin berar dohierusalem arrofetar isirlam lib ade. Aliter isindalmsan arafocair anúas actisfor óis tuaithe arfocarar archuit indóissa gráid et ind áissa foirbthi ní écen airócre
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. two things, then, are treated of in this text below, or it is the teaching of morality to all the Corinthians–for I do not mention to you the alms that is taken to Jerusalem, for I know that this is ready with you.–Aliter, it is the alms that he suggests above, but it is to the laity it is announced: as regards those in orders and the perfect folk it is needless to suggest it.

glosses.latin: de uobis glorior apud Macedonas, quoniam et Achaia parata est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am glorying on your behalf to (the) Macedonians.

glosses.latin: de uobis glorior apud Macedonas, quoniam et Achaia parata est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is what I glory.

glosses.latin: Misimus autem fratres, ut ne quod gloriamur de uobís, euacuetur in hac parte, ut, quemadmodum dixi, parati sitis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a warning reached you before me.

glosses.latin: Misimus autem fratres, ut ne quod gloriamur de uobís, euacuetur in hac parte, ut, quemadmodum dixi, parati sitis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest my glorying be a shame to me.

glosses.latin: Ne cum uenerint Macedones mecum, et inuenerint uos imparatos, erubescamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it seems to me more grievous that the outland folk should know it.

glosses.latin: Necessarium ergo existimaui rogare fratres, ut praeueniant ad uos, et praeparent repromissam benedictionem hanc paratam esse, sic quasi benedictionem, non tanquam auaritiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it may not be a shame to you and to us.

glosses.latin: Necessarium ergo existimaui rogare fratres, ut praeueniant ad uos, et praeparent repromissam benedictionem hanc paratam esse, sic quasi benedictionem, non tanquam auaritiam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dob[Con]eir[/Con]so[Con]m[/Con] [a]ainm[/a] bendachtan dondalmsin hóre islabendachtin doindnagar
glosses.glossText: .i. dobeirsom ainm bendachtan dondalmsin hóre islabendachtin doindnagar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dobeirsom ainm<sup>a</sup> bendachtan dondalmsin hóre islabendachtin doindnagar
footnotes: a: MS. aim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he gives the name of ‘benison’ to the alms, because it is given with a benison.

glosses.latin: Necessarium ergo existimaui rogare fratres, ut praeueniant ad uos, et praeparent repromissam benedictionem hanc paratam esse, sic quasi benedictionem, non tanquam auaritiam.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut in omnibus locupletati habundetis in omnem semplicitatem, quae operatur per nos gratiarum actionem Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when they enrich you.

glosses.latin: Ut in omnibus locupletati habundetis in omnem semplicitatem, quae operatur per nos gratiarum actionem Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: mad condiuiti doindnasatar atluchfa[Con]m[/Con] buidi dodia darahéssi
glosses.glossText: mad condiuiti doindnasatar atluchfam buidi dodia darahéssi
glosses.glossFNs: mad condiuiti doindnasatar atluchfam buidi dodia darahéssi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if they be given with sincerity, we will give thanks to God for it.

glosses.latin: Quoniam ministerium huius officii ... abundat per multas gratiarum actiones.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tre atlogud buide donaib nóibaib diatabarr indalmsan
glosses.glossText: .i. tre atlogud buide donaib nóibaib diatabarr indalmsan
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tre atlogud buide donaib nóibaib diatabarr indalmsan
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through thanksgiving by the saints unto whom the alms is given.

glosses.latin: glorificantes Deum in obaedientia confessionis uestrae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. good (is) your confession.

glosses.latin: Et ipsorum obsecrationem pro uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. frequent is their supplication on your behalf.

glosses.latin: absens autem confido in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have believed that ye will do it.

glosses.latin: Rogo autem uos ne praesens audeam, per eam confidentiam qua existimor audere, in quosdam, qui arbitrantur nos tanquam secundum carnem ambulemus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through confidence of power.

glosses.latin: Rogo autem uos ne praesens audeam, per eam confidentiam qua existimor audere, in quosdam, qui arbitrantur nos tanquam secundum carnem ambulemus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that I dare.

glosses.latin: Rogo autem uos ne praesens audeam, per eam confidentiam qua existimor audere, in quosdam, qui arbitrantur nos tanquam secundum carnem ambulemus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who have deserved it.

glosses.latin: Et in prumptu habentes ulcisci omnem inobedientiam, cum inpleta fuerit uestra obaedientia.
footnotes: a: leg. adígail
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we should have been able to punish it.

glosses.latin: Et in prumptu habentes ulcisci omnem inobedientiam, cum inpleta fuerit uestra obaedientia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. primum to any one who sent to you.

glosses.latin: Si quis confidit sibi Christi se esse, hoc cogitet iterum apud sé.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre ro[Con]m[/Con]moidiso[Con]m[/Con] cumachte less cosse asb[Con]eir[/Con] infect so asmug [GLat]et[/GLat] nancoimdiu
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre rommoidisom cumachte less cosse asbeir infect so asmug et nancoimdiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre rommoidisom cumachte less cosse asbeir infect so asmug et nancoimdiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since he has boasted hitherto that he had power, he now says that he is a servant and not a lord.

glosses.latin: Si quis confidit sibi Christi se esse, hoc cogitet iterum apud sé.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] asb[Con]eir[/Con] itossug asmug imrádi [GLat]iterum[/GLat] [Con]con[/Con]derna gnímu moga [ie].i.[/ie] [Com]in marg.[/Com] natomnathar nech nibes[b] mó [GLat]quam serui et[/GLat] cid intain ronmoitsem ní bo arseirc móidme act ↄrobad torbe dúibsi triit [ie].i.[/ie] ↄrochretesi [GLat]et[/GLat] ↄro intsamlithe mobésusa [GLat]et[/GLat] ↄná ruchrete si doneuch act nech dogned nagnimusin
glosses.glossText: .i. asbeir itossug asmug imrádi iterum conderna gnímu moga .i. [in marg.] natomnathar nech nibes mó quam serui et cid intain ronmoitsem ní bo arseirc móidme act ↄrobad torbe dúibsi triit .i. ↄrochretesi et ↄro intsamlithe mobésusa et ↄná ruchrete si doneuch act nech dogned nagnimusin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. asbeir itossug asmug imrádi iterum conderna gnímu moga .i. [in marg.] natomnathar nech nibesb mó quam serui et cid intain ronmoitsem ní bo arseirc móidme act ↄrobad torbe dúibsi triit .i. ↄrochretesi et ↄro intsamlithe mobésusa et ↄná ruchrete si doneuch act nech dogned nagnimusin
footnotes: b: leg. ní bes
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he says at first that he is a servant: he considers iterum that he should do a servant’s works, that is, let no one think aught that is more quam serui, and that even when we have boasted it was not for love of boasting, but that ye might have profit thereby, that is, that ye might believe, and imitate my morals, and that ye might not believe in any one save one who did those deeds.

glosses.latin: Ut non existimemur tamquam terrere uos per epistolas.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] ni cuimsin hifrecṅdirc anasberinn [GLat]per epi[Con]stolas[/Con][/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal ni cuimsin hifrecṅdirc anasberinn per epistolas
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal ni cuimsin hifrecṅdirc anasberinn per epistolas
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as though I could not do in (your) presence what I said per epistolas.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem aepistolae, inquiunt, graues sunt et fortes; praesentia autem corporis infirma, et sermo contemptibilis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem aepistolae, inquiunt, graues sunt et fortes; praesentia autem corporis infirma, et sermo contemptibilis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. important are the judgments which are written therein, in epistolis.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem aepistolae, inquiunt, graues sunt et fortes; praesentia autem corporis infirma, et sermo contemptibilis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he is weak, however, when he is here.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem aepistolae, inquiunt, graues sunt et fortes; praesentia autem corporis infirma, et sermo contemptibilis.
glosses.glossFullTags: deroil[c] [ie].i.[/ie] nisulbir inbríathar [ie].i.[/ie] ní dron act is diuit [GLat]et[/GLat]isglé
glosses.glossText: deroil .i. nisulbir inbríathar .i. ní dron act is diuit etisglé
glosses.glossFNs: deroilc .i. nisulbir inbríathar .i. ní dron act is diuit etisglé
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: of no account, that is, the word is not eloquent, i.e. it is not strong, but it is simple, and it is clear.

glosses.latin: Hoc cogitet qui eiusmodi est, quia quales sumus uerbo per aepistolas absentes, tales et praesentes in facto.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we are potent in our word.

glosses.latin: Hoc cogitet qui eiusmodi est, quia quales sumus uerbo per aepistolas absentes, tales et praesentes in facto.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni irbágam náderna[Con]m[/Con] iarríchte ní barscéuil si[d]
glosses.glossText: .i. ni irbágam nádernam iarríchte ní barscéuil si
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni irbágam nádernam iarríchte ní barscéuil si<sup>d</sup>
footnotes: d: In G. C.2 54, Ebel takes ní here to be the negative particle. ‘After the arrival of some tidings of you,’ W. S. hoc ideo dico ne quis me putet illud comminari quod implere non possum, sicut de me uestri iactitant deceptores, Primasius on v. 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we boast not what we cannot do after arriving......<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Hoc cogitet qui eiusmodi est, quia quales sumus uerbo per aepistolas absentes, tales et praesentes in facto.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be proved in our work after arriving.

glosses.latin: Non enim audemus, inserere, aut comparare nos quibusdam, qui sé ipsos commendant; sed ipsi in nobis nosmet ipsos metientes, et conparantes nosmet ipsos nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we dare not.

glosses.latin: Non enim audemus, inserere, aut comparare nos quibusdam, qui sé ipsos commendant; sed ipsi in nobis nosmet ipsos metientes, et conparantes nosmet ipsos nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niáil dún arcondelc friú[e] [ie].i.[/ie] ni digne[Con]m[/Con] andogniat som
glosses.glossText: .i. niáil dún arcondelc friú .i. ni dignem andogniat som
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niáil dún arcondelc friú<sup>e</sup> .i. ni dignem andogniat som
footnotes: e: The mark of length is not quite certain
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not proper for us to compare ourselves with them, that is, we will not do what they do.

glosses.latin: Non enim audemus, inserere, aut comparare nos quibusdam, qui sé ipsos commendant; sed ipsi in nobis nosmet ipsos metientes, et conparantes nosmet ipsos nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: frinn fanisin cotondelcfa[Con]m[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] doncoisin nínmóidfem inneuch nád denam [GLat]ut uós facitis ó seodoapostoli[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: frinn fanisin cotondelcfam .i. amal doncoisin nínmóidfem inneuch nád denam ut uós facitis ó seodoapostoli
glosses.glossFNs: frinn fanisin cotondelcfam .i. amal doncoisin nínmóidfem inneuch nád denam ut uós facitis ó seodoapostoli
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with ourselves we will compare ourselves, that is, as we are. We will not boast in aught that we do not, ut etc.

glosses.latin: Nos autem non inmensum gloriabimur, sed secundum mensuram regulae, quam mensus est nobís Deus, mensuram pertinguentis usque ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. exceeding greatly, or in measure with any one.

glosses.latin: Nos autem non inmensum gloriabimur, sed secundum mensuram regulae, quam mensus est nobís Deus, mensuram pertinguentis usque ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we will liken ourselves to ourselves.

glosses.latin: Nos autem non inmensum gloriabimur, sed secundum mensuram regulae, quam mensus est nobís Deus, mensuram pertinguentis usque ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which He has granted to us.

glosses.latin: Nos autem non inmensum gloriabimur, sed secundum mensuram regulae, quam mensus est nobís Deus, mensuram pertinguentis usque ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in equality to you.

glosses.latin: Nos autem non inmensum gloriabimur, sed secundum mensuram regulae, quam mensus est nobís Deus, mensuram pertinguentis usque ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we are apostles to you.

glosses.latin: Non enim quasi non pertinguentes ad uos, superextendimus nos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as if we were not equal to you.

glosses.latin: Non enim quasi non pertinguentes ad uos, superextendimus nos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we do not exalt (ourselves).

glosses.latin: Non in immensum gloriantes in alienís laboribus.
footnotes: f: i.e. ní far torad, so in Wb. 17b 20 bar saithar
g: The translation is conjectural; we have no other example of the phrase téit for
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not the fruit of any other’s teaching that I appropriate(?)<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Etiam in illa, quae ultra uos sunt, euangelizare, non in aliena regula in iis quae praeparata sunt gloriari.
glosses.glossTrans: around you on every side.

glosses.latin: Etiam in illa, quae ultra uos sunt, euangelizare, non in aliena regula in iis quae praeparata sunt gloriari.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bithé nap[Con]re[/Con]cepta cétni nop[Con]ri[/Con]dchob doib [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nibarsaithar nachaili tiagu.
glosses.glossText: .i. bithé naprecepta cétni nopridchob doib ɫ. nibarsaithar nachaili tiagu.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bithé naprecepta cétni nopridchob doib ɫ. nibarsaithar nachaili tiagu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are the same teachings which I shall preach to them; or it is not any other’s labour that I appropriate(?).

glosses.latin: Non enim qui sé ipsum conmendat, ille probatus est; sed quem Dominus commendat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who praises himself.

glosses.latin: Non enim qui sé ipsum conmendat, ille probatus est; sed quem Dominus commendat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whom He cares for or magnifies.

glosses.latin: Subportate me.
footnotes: a: The noun folog (a prima manu) glosses a verb, as in Wb. 17b 25, 34, 24c 11
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Subportate me.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye bear with one who is worse for you, even pseudoapostolos.

glosses.latin: Aemulor enim uos Dei aemulatione, dispondi enim uos uni uiro uirginem kastam exhibere Christo.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: jealousy.

glosses.latin: Aemulor enim uos Dei aemulatione, dispondi enim uos uni uiro uirginem kastam exhibere Christo.
footnotes: c: For the brachylogy cf. Wb. 9b 17, 12a 25, Ml. 115d 7, 8, 146a 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. our jealousy concerning you is the same as God’s.

glosses.latin: Aemulor enim uos Dei aemulatione, dispondi enim uos uni uiro uirginem kastam exhibere Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have betrothed you.

glosses.latin: Aemulor enim uos Dei aemulatione, dispondi enim uos uni uiro uirginem kastam exhibere Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without thinking of any other nisi Christi.

glosses.latin: Timeo autem, ne sicut serpens Euam seduxit astutia sua, ita corrumpantur sensus uestri, et excidant a simplicitate.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isco [GLat]eua[Con]m[/Con][/GLat] dodechuid [GLat]serpens[/GLat] níco[GLat]ada[Con]m[/Con][/GLat] hóre as lobro [GLat]mulier quam uir[/GLat] nia[Con]m[/Con]re limsa di[Con]diu[/Con] aís lobor dodénum diibsi
glosses.glossText: .i. isco euam dodechuid serpens nícoadam hóre as lobro mulier quam uir niamre limsa didiu aís lobor dodénum diibsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isco euam dodechuid serpens nícoadam hóre as lobro mulier quam uir niamre limsa didiu aís lobor dodénum diibsi
footnotes: e: i.e. that you should be treated as weak people, cf. Wb. 2a 10, 8c 11, ferthaigis dognidsi dimsa, Ir. Texte, II. 178
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is to Eve not to Adam that serpens has gone, because mulier is weaker than uir: I wonder not, then, that feeble folk were made of youe.

glosses.latin: Timeo autem, ne sicut serpens Euam seduxit astutia sua, ita corrumpantur sensus uestri, et excidant a simplicitate.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
f: The glossator mistook excĭdant for excīdant
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a cutting-off<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Nam si is, qui uenit ... aliud euangelium praedicat, quod non recipistis, recte pateremini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which we have not preached to you.

glosses.latin: Nam si is, qui uenit ... aliud euangelium praedicat, quod non recipistis, recte pateremini.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdíriug dúib crete[Con]m[/Con] do am[Con]al[/Con] sodain [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]pateremini nós recte exaudire[/GLat] manidinnonn forcital linn [GLat]et[/GLat] manid niméte dúibsi nicoitsi frinni
glosses.glossText: .i. isdíriug dúib cretem do amal sodain ɫ. pateremini nós recte exaudire manidinnonn forcital linn et manid niméte dúibsi nicoitsi frinni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdíriug dúib cretem do amal sodain ɫ. pateremini nós recte exaudire manidinnonn forcital linn et manid niméte dúibsi nicoitsi frinni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in that case it is right for you to believe in him: or pateremini etc., unless our teaching is the same, and unless it is, it is not much to you that ye listen not to us.

glosses.latin: me ipsum humilians, ut uos exaltemini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. by imitating me.

glosses.latin: Alias aeclesias exspoliaui, accipiens stipendium ad ministerium uestrum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so long as I have preached to them the Macedonians have sustained me.

glosses.latin: cum essem apud uos, et egerem, nulli honerosus fui. nam quod mihi deerat suppleuerunt fratres qui uenerunt a Macedonia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I was not burthensome to any one.

glosses.latin: quoniam haec gloria non [in]fringetur in me.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of not receiving aught a uobis.

glosses.latin: quoniam haec gloria non [in]fringetur in me.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not go back.

glosses.latin: quoniam haec gloria non [in]fringetur in me.
footnotes: d: a prima manu, Zimmer. But W. S. thinks that manam (literally ‘my soul’) ends the preceding gloss, is the nom. to terga, and should be translated ‘myself’ (cf. Sk. ātman)
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: ut in quo gloriantur, tales inueniantur sicut et nos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since they boast in preaching, let them be like unto us.

glosses.latin: Nam eiusmodi seudoapostoli [sunt operarii] subdoli, transfigurantes sé in apostolos Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who say they are apostles of Christ.

glosses.latin: Et non mirum, ipse enim Satanas transfigurat sé in angelum lucis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not difficult is transfiguratio etc.

glosses.latin: Et non mirum, ipse enim Satanas transfigurat sé in angelum lucis.
footnotes: d: The allusion is to Isaiah xiv. 14 (Olden)
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he (Lucifer) attempts even equality with God<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Non est ergo magnum, si ministri eius transfigurentur.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: a marvel.

glosses.latin: ne quis me putet insipientem esse, alioquin velud insipientem accipite me, ut et ego modicum quid glorier.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mainba æcne lib act conda anecne
glosses.glossText: .i. mainba æcne lib act conda anecne
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mainba æcne lib act conda anecne
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if I be not wise in your opinion, but so that I am unwise.

glosses.latin: ne quis me putet insipientem esse, alioquin velud insipientem accipite me, ut et ego modicum quid glorier.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] nát anse dúib arisgním anecni dogníu [ie].i.[/ie] móidem
glosses.glossText: .i. amal nát anse dúib arisgním anecni dogníu .i. móidem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal nát anse dúib arisgním anecni dogníu .i. móidem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as is not hard for you, for it is a work of an unwise man which I do, even boasting.

glosses.latin: ne quis me putet insipientem esse, alioquin velud insipientem accipite me, ut et ego modicum quid glorier.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: ne quis me putet insipientem esse, alioquin velud insipientem accipite me, ut et ego modicum quid glorier.
footnotes: e: Cf. dinetán Trip. Life 142, 11

glosses.latin: Quod loquor, non loquor secundum Deum, sed quasi in insipientia, in hac substantia gloriae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnitacair lasuide móidmiche do neuch innachthallond [GLat]non de uirtutibus dei gloriabor[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. arnitacair lasuide móidmiche do neuch innachthallond non de uirtutibus dei gloriabor
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnitacair lasuide móidmiche do neuch innachthallond non de uirtutibus dei gloriabor
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for boastfulness to any one in any talent he deems unmeet.

glosses.latin: Quod loquor, non loquor secundum Deum, sed quasi in insipientia, in hac substantia gloriae.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: boasting.

glosses.latin: Quoniam multi gloriantur secundum carnem, et ego gloriabor.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in nobility of race.

glosses.latin: Quoniam multi gloriantur secundum carnem, et ego gloriabor.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]secundum carnem[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] niansu do[Con]m[/Con]sa adenu[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]quam illís quia de una gente sumus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. secundum carnem .i. niansu domsa adenum quam illís quia de una gente sumus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. secundum carnem .i. niansu domsa adenum quam illís quia de una gente sumus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not harder for us to do it quam illis etc.

glosses.latin: Secundum ignobilitatem dico, quasi [nos] infirmi fuerimus in hac parte. In quo quis audet (in insipientia dico) audeo et ego.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is baseness to you to endure all this.

glosses.latin: Secundum ignobilitatem dico, quasi [nos] infirmi fuerimus in hac parte. In quo quis audet (in insipientia dico) audeo et ego.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as if we should not have been able to do it.

glosses.latin: Secundum ignobilitatem dico, quasi [nos] infirmi fuerimus in hac parte. In quo quis audet (in insipientia dico) audeo et ego.
footnotes: c: leg. isindí ‘it is in that’–a gloss on in quo–and ralaimedar ‘he dares it’? J. S.
f: 1. as Hebraeus, 2. as minister Christi. Or if for isindé we read isindi, ‘in that he dares tolerare se’ W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is ... doublyf he dares tolerare se.

glosses.latin: Secundum ignobilitatem dico, quasi [nos] infirmi fuerimus in hac parte. In quo quis audet (in insipientia dico) audeo et ego.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is foolishness for me that I make boast.

glosses.latin: Secundum ignobilitatem dico, quasi [nos] infirmi fuerimus in hac parte. In quo quis audet (in insipientia dico) audeo et ego.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Hebraei sunt, et ego.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is true, however.

glosses.latin: Ministri Christi sunt, ut minus sapiens dico, plus ego; . . in carceribus abundantius, in plagís supra modum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre isco burpi asbéram naaill diarṅgnímaib
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre isco burpi asbéram naaill diarṅgnímaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre isco burpi asbéram naaill diarṅgnímaib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is unto stupidity that we shall say something else of our deeds.

glosses.latin: Ministri Christi sunt, ut minus sapiens dico, plus ego; . . in carceribus abundantius, in plagís supra modum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. great is their frequency.

glosses.latin: Ministri Christi sunt, ut minus sapiens dico, plus ego; . . in carceribus abundantius, in plagís supra modum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ministri Christi sunt, ut minus sapiens dico, plus ego; . . in carceribus abundantius, in plagís supra modum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for their greatness; or I had to tolerate them.

glosses.latin: Á Iudeís quinquies quadragenas, una minus, accipi.
footnotes: d: cetarcoti (a prima manu) seems for cetharchoti, pi. acc. of an adj. derived from cetharcha, like óinde from óin
glosses.glossTrans: forty each<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Á Iudeís quinquies quadragenas, una minus, accipi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]minus una[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]lora[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] tesarbæ oínloman de madaessoir[a] [GLat]et[/GLat] is [GLat]una minus[/GLat] am[Con]al[/Con] sodin. [GLat]Aliter quadra[Con]genas[/Con][/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] inna builnni [ie].i.[/ie] bémen dígle [GLat]minus una[/GLat] nímmalle act iscachæ foleith [ie].i.[/ie] coiccethorchuit béimmen
glosses.glossText: .i. minus una .i. lora .i. tesarbæ oínloman de madaessoir et is una minus amal sodin. Aliter quadragenas .i. inna builnni .i. bémen dígle minus una nímmalle act iscachæ foleith .i. coiccethorchuit béimmen
glosses.glossFNs: .i. minus una .i. lora .i. tesarbæ oínloman de madaessoira et is una minus amal sodin. Aliter quadragenas .i. inna builnni .i. bémen dígle minus una nímmalle act iscachæ foleith .i. coiccethorchuit béimmen
footnotes: a: leg. mad du stóir (Nigra), opposed to mad du rúin ‘according to the mystical exposition.’ Olden took -essoir to be from assorgim

e: tes-ar-bae, here and in Ml. 34c 16, is, according to Sarauw, p. 46, the perfective preterite of tessbuith ‘deesse.’ J. S. considers it to be an irregular development of to-ess-ro-bói, cf. Trans. Philolog. Soc. 1895-98, p. 180.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. one cord was wantinge from it according to the natural exposition, and it is una minus in that case. Aliter quadragenas, i.e. the stripes, i.e. blows of punishment minus unâ, not at the same time, but each of them separately, i.e. five forties of blows.

glosses.latin: Á Iudeís quinquies quadragenas, una minus, accipi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a special kind of scourge wherein are forty thongs.

glosses.latin: ter naufragium feci, nocte et die in profundo maris fui.
footnotes: f: fomlámas, perhaps 3d sg. s-pret. of fo-lmasaim 21a 2, with infixed pron. W. S., but cf. confolmaissiur Ml. 50d 8, arafolmathar Sg. 147b 4, folámaim Windisch, Wb. folamur Trip. Life Index, arfolmaim, Meyer, Contrib. Should fomlamastar be read? J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. drowning threatened<sup>f</sup> me thrice.

glosses.latin: ter naufragium feci, nocte et die in profundo maris fui.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: ter naufragium feci, nocte et die in profundo maris fui.
glosses.glossText: .i. inter fluctus ɫ. secundum ueritatem et rananacht dia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. inter fluctus ɫ. secundum ueritatem et rananacht dia
glosses.glossTrans: God saved him.

glosses.latin: periculís in ciuitate, periculis in solitudine.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. tribulation to me to whatever side I went.

glosses.latin: in fame.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Praeter illa quae extrinsecus sunt, instantia mea quotidiana, sollicitudo omnium aeclessiarum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thinking of the fratres fideles.

glosses.latin: Praeter illa quae extrinsecus sunt, instantia mea quotidiana, sollicitudo omnium aeclessiarum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest false apostles should come to them (the churches).

glosses.latin: quis scandalizatur, et ego non uror?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he saith not that he should deny (the faith) along with them, sed etc.

glosses.latin: Deus .... scit quod non mentior.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is hé rofitir[b] inneuch rochéssusa náchgáo dom anasbiur
glosses.glossText: .i. is hé rofitir inneuch rochéssusa náchgáo dom anasbiur
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is hé rofitir<sup>b</sup> inneuch rochéssusa náchgáo dom anasbiur
footnotes: b: wanting in MS.
g: Cf. the Anglo-Irish, It’s thrue for you
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is he that knows in what I have suffered, that what I say is not untrue for me<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Damasci praepossitus gentis Arathae regis, custodiebat ciuitatem Damascenorum ut me comprehenderet.
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the steward of the king Aretas.

glosses.latin: Damasci praepossitus gentis Arathae regis, custodiebat ciuitatem Damascenorum ut me comprehenderet.
footnotes: h: Acts ix. 24
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that he might take me<sup>h</sup>.

glosses.latin: per fenestram in sportam, dimissus sum per murum, et síc effugi manus eius.
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: a basket: a hamper.

glosses.latin: per fenestram in sportam, dimissus sum per murum, et síc effugi manus eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus that I have escaped from him.

glosses.latin: Si gloriari oportet non expedit quidem mihi, ueniam autem ad uisiones et reuelationes Domini.

glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I should have desired to boast, there were no cause híc.

glosses.latin: Si gloriari oportet non expedit quidem mihi, ueniam autem ad uisiones et reuelationes Domini.
footnotes: a: leg. torban and
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is no profit therein.

glosses.latin: Si gloriari oportet non expedit quidem mihi, ueniam autem ad uisiones et reuelationes Domini.

glosses.glossText: .i. isdeidbir móidem disuidib mad comoidim etir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdeidbir móidem disuidib mad comoidim etir
footnotes: f: co-moidim. In the G. C.2 641 this is regarded as the prep. co(n) ‘with’ and the dat. sg. of móidem, but cf. Wb. 9d 32, 17c 23, 19b 8, 25a 27, where co means ‘up to’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is meet to boast of them if it be unto boasting<sup>f</sup> at all.

glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because quod dicam will be true.

glosses.latin: Nam, et si uoluero gloriari, non ero insipiens, ueritatem enim dico; parco autem, ne quis me existimet supra id quod uidet in mé,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a gloss on what is before.

glosses.latin: Nam, et si uoluero gloriari, non ero insipiens, ueritatem enim dico; parco autem, ne quis me existimet supra id quod uidet in mé,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] no[Con]m[/Con]isligur [vel]ɫ.[/vel] doimdibnim [GLat]né insipiens sum quia quae uidi non in totum nume[Res]ra[/Res]ui ne auditores mé honorent[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nomisligur ɫ. doimdibnim né insipiens sum quia quae uidi non in totum nume(ra)ui ne auditores mé honorent
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nomisligur ɫ. doimdibnim né insipiens sum quia quae uidi non in totum nume(ra)ui ne auditores mé honorent
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I abase myself, or I abridge (my story).

glosses.latin: Nam, et si uoluero gloriari, non ero insipiens, ueritatem enim dico; parco autem, ne quis me existimet supra id quod uidet in mé,
footnotes: b: leg. arnatomnad or arnachimthomnad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that he should not suppose me to be a human being sed deus.

glosses.latin: Nam, et si uoluero gloriari, non ero insipiens, ueritatem enim dico; parco autem, ne quis me existimet supra id quod uidet in mé,
footnotes: c: MS. secha ní
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. beyond that which I am.

glosses.latin: datus est mihi stimulus carnis meae, angelus Satanae ut me colaphizet.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cenngalar [Com]in marg. dolor capitis[/Com] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]p[Con]er[/Con]sequtio[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]secundum is[Con]idorum[/Con] incentiua carnis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. cenngalar [in marg. dolor capitis] ɫ. persequtio ɫ. secundum isidorum incentiua carnis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cenngalar [in marg. dolor capitis] ɫ. persequtio ɫ. secundum isidorum incentiua carnis

glosses.latin: datus est mihi stimulus carnis meae, angelus Satanae ut me colaphizet.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Propter quod ter Dominum rogaui, ut discederet á me.

glosses.glossText: .i. ani tra aschotarsne frihícc nietar ciagessir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ani tra aschotarsne frihícc nietar ciagessir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what, then, is contrary to salvation is not obtained although it be prayed for.

glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Dei to endure this suffering.

glosses.latin: Propter quod placebo mihi in infirmitatibus meís .... in angustiis pro Christo. cum enim imfirmor tunc potens sum.

glosses.glossText: .i. niↄfil bas sciith lim actrop ar crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niↄfil bas sciith lim actrop ar crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is nothing which irks me, provided it be for Christ.

glosses.latin: Propter quod placebo mihi in infirmitatibus meís .... in angustiis pro Christo. cum enim imfirmor tunc potens sum.

glosses.glossTrans: brittle.

glosses.latin: Ego enim debui a uobís commendari, nihil [enim] minus fui ab hís qui sunt supra modum apostoli, tamen etsi nihil sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it may be you that bear witness of me.

glosses.latin: Ego enim debui a uobís commendari, nihil [enim] minus fui ab hís qui sunt supra modum apostoli, tamen etsi nihil sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be difficult for you.

glosses.latin: Ego enim debui a uobís commendari, nihil [enim] minus fui ab hís qui sunt supra modum apostoli, tamen etsi nihil sum.
footnotes: e: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: greatly.

glosses.latin: Ego enim debui a uobís commendari, nihil [enim] minus fui ab hís qui sunt supra modum apostoli, tamen etsi nihil sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. those who have been in praesentia Christi.

glosses.latin: Ego enim debui a uobís commendari, nihil [enim] minus fui ab hís qui sunt supra modum apostoli, tamen etsi nihil sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I seem insignificant to any one.

glosses.latin: Quid est enim, quod minus habuistis prae caeterís aeclesís, nisi quod ego [ipse] uos non grauaui? Donate mihi hanc iniuriam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of grace or of instruction.

glosses.latin: Quid est enim, quod minus habuistis prae caeterís aeclesís, nisi quod ego [ipse] uos non grauaui? Donate mihi hanc iniuriam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. except only.

glosses.latin: Quid est enim, quod minus habuistis prae caeterís aeclesís, nisi quod ego [ipse] uos non grauaui? Donate mihi hanc iniuriam.
glosses.glossTrans: is it likely that this should be an offence in your eyes?

glosses.latin: Quid est enim, quod minus habuistis prae caeterís aeclesís, nisi quod ego [ipse] uos non grauaui? Donate mihi hanc iniuriam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have not consumed your food or your raiment.

glosses.latin: Quid est enim, quod minus habuistis prae caeterís aeclesís, nisi quod ego [ipse] uos non grauaui? Donate mihi hanc iniuriam.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: forgive ye.

glosses.latin: Quid est enim, quod minus habuistis prae caeterís aeclesís, nisi quod ego [ipse] uos non grauaui? Donate mihi hanc iniuriam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] darolged dom t[Con]ra[/Con] infrithorcuin sin [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non grauare uós[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. darolged dom tra infrithorcuin sin .i. non grauare uós
glosses.glossFNs: .i. darolged dom tra infrithorcuin sin .i. non grauare uós
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye should, then, forgive it to me, that offence.

glosses.latin: non ero grauis uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be the same as before.

glosses.latin: Ego autem libentissime inpendam, et superimpendar ipse pro animabus uestris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I will expend my power for your sakes.

glosses.latin: dolo uos caepi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it likely that it would be in order to cheat you?

glosses.latin: Numquid Titus uos circumuenit? nonne eodem spiritu ambulauimus? nonne hisdem uestigís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. is it not the same rule with us?

glosses.latin: Numquid Titus uos circumuenit? nonne eodem spiritu ambulauimus? nonne hisdem uestigís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in preaching (the) gospel and in enjoining (the) faith.

glosses.latin: Ollim putatis, quod excussemus nos apud uos? ... omnia autem carissimi, propter aedificationem uestram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] diarniráil furibsi [GLat]et[/GLat] cona bad fír anasb[Con]er[/Con]mis
glosses.glossText: .i. diarniráil furibsi et cona bad fír anasbermis

glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to commend ourselves to you, although what we say is untrue.

glosses.glossTrans: i.e. opera which I do.

glosses.latin: Timeo enim ... ne forte ... animositates, desensiones, inflationes, seditiones sint inter uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. vainglories.

glosses.latin: Timeo enim ... ne forte ... animositates, desensiones, inflationes, seditiones sint inter uos.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
c: sotli seems properly to be intended for ‘inflationes,’ menmni(c)hi for ‘animositates,’ which, in ecclesiastical Latin, means ‘enmities’
glosses.glossTrans: enmities<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Timeo enim ... ne forte ... animositates, desensiones, inflationes, seditiones sint inter uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. betrayals.

glosses.latin: Ne iterum cum uenero ... lugeam multos ex iis qui ante me peccauerunt.
footnotes: b: the mark of length is over the s
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. before I came.

glosses.latin: Praedixi, et praedico, ut praesens, et nunc absens.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for he is praesens when his epistola is read out.

glosses.latin: Praedixi, et praedico, ut praesens, et nunc absens.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: An experimentum eius queritis qui in me loquitur Christus.
footnotes: d: etargne is intended for ‘experimentum’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. knowledge<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: An experimentum eius queritis qui in me loquitur Christus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is Christ.

glosses.latin: Nam et nos infirmi sumus in illo, sed uiuemus cum eo ex uirtute Dei in uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. under a resemblance to His Manhood (are) we.

glosses.latin: Nam et nos infirmi sumus in illo, sed uiuemus cum eo ex uirtute Dei in uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from the strength of the Godhead.

glosses.latin: Nam et nos infirmi sumus in illo, sed uiuemus cum eo ex uirtute Dei in uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: that resurrection in you.

glosses.latin: ipsi uos probate, ... nisi forte reprobi estis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let each look to his deeds.

glosses.latin: ipsi uos probate, ... nisi forte reprobi estis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless ye fulfil what has been preached to you.

glosses.latin: Spero autem quod cognoscetis, quia nos non sumus reprobi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are sure.

glosses.latin: Spero autem quod cognoscetis, quia nos non sumus reprobi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní uainni duib si arnitan [GLat]reprobi[/GLat]ni rafitidsi [GLat]quid[/GLat] nabisamlid dúibsi
glosses.glossText: .i. ní uainni duib si arnitan reprobini rafitidsi quid nabisamlid dúibsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní uainni duib si arnitan reprobini rafitidsi quid nabisamlid dúibsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not from us are you, for we are not reprobi: ye know it: why is it not so with you?

glosses.latin: Oramus autem Deum ut nihil mali faciatis, non ut nos probati [ap]pareamus, sed ut uos quod bonum est faciatis, nos autem ut reprobi simus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through inflicting punishment upon you.

glosses.latin: Oramus autem Deum ut nihil mali faciatis, non ut nos probati [ap]pareamus, sed ut uos quod bonum est faciatis, nos autem ut reprobi simus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. punishment will not be inflicted upon you in that case.

glosses.latin: Oramus autem Deum ut nihil mali faciatis, non ut nos probati [ap]pareamus, sed ut uos quod bonum est faciatis, nos autem ut reprobi simus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through not inflicting punishment upon you.

glosses.latin: Gaudemus enim, quando nos infirmi sumus, uos autem potentes estis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] innepthabirt dígle [GLat]super eos qui habent ueritatem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. innepthabirt dígle super eos qui habent ueritatem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. innepthabirt dígle super eos qui habent ueritatem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in not inflicting punishment super etc.

glosses.latin: Ideo haec absens scribo, ut non presens durius agam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when I myself shall come.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, gaudete perfecti estote ... pacem habete, et Deus pacis et dilectionis erit uobiscum.

glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, gaudete perfecti estote ... pacem habete, et Deus pacis et dilectionis erit uobiscum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in fulfilment of (the) gospel.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, gaudete perfecti estote ... pacem habete, et Deus pacis et dilectionis erit uobiscum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye be in that wise.

glosses.latin: Salu[ta]te inuicem, in oscolo sancto. Salutant uos sancti omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: for the salutate is a signum pacis with him.

glosses.latin: Salu[ta]te inuicem, in oscolo sancto. Salutant uos sancti omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for this shall not be in deceit.

glosses.latin: Salu[ta]te inuicem, in oscolo sancto. Salutant uos sancti omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is peace to them towards you similiter et uos.

glosses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri, Iesu Christi, et caritas Dei, et communicatio sancti Spiritus, sit cum omnibus uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of forgiveness of sin.

glosses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri, Iesu Christi, et caritas Dei, et communicatio sancti Spiritus, sit cum omnibus uobís.

glosses.glossText: .i. serc dǽ dúibsi et farserc si do dia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. serc dǽ dúibsi et farserc si do dia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God’s love to you and your love to God.

glosses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri, Iesu Christi, et caritas Dei, et communicatio sancti Spiritus, sit cum omnibus uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that the Holy Ghost may be in you.

glosses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri, Iesu Christi, et caritas Dei, et communicatio sancti Spiritus, sit cum omnibus uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. may it be given to you all.

glosses.latin: Paulus apostolus, non ab hominibus, neque per hominem,
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]neque per aliquos homines[/GLat][b] ni ó iacob na ioh[Con]ain[/Con] nida apstal apstil
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: neque per aliquos homines ni ó iacob na iohain nida apstal apstil
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: neque per aliquos hominesb ni ó iacob na iohain nida apstal apstil
footnotes: b: neque per hominem, Migne, col. 841
glosses.glossTrans: not from James or John: I am not an apostle’s apostle.

glosses.latin: æclesiae Galatiae
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the holy congregation.

glosses.latin: æclesiae Galatiae
glosses.glossTrans: which is in Galatia.

glosses.latin: Gratia uobis ... a Domino nostro Iesu Christo.
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: may there be!

glosses.latin: Cui est gloria in saecula seculorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdo isuisse [GLat]gloria[/GLat] nidodóinib ni do dulib
glosses.glossText: .i. isdo isuisse gloria nidodóinib ni do dulib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdo isuisse gloria nidodóinib ni do dulib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to Him gloria is just: not to human beings, not to creatures.

glosses.latin: Miror quod síc tam cito transferemini, ab eo qui uos uocauit in gratiam Christi, in aliud euangelium.

glosses.glossText: .i. ismachthad limm athrete dorérachtid máam firinne et sosceli .i. isuaignid nirubtar gáitha for comairli isdían dorreractid maám indsoscéli

glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I marvel at the readiness wherewith ye have abandoned the yoke of righteousness and gospel: that is, it is obvious that your counsels have not been wise: it is swiftly that ye have abandoned the yoke of the gospel.

glosses.latin: Quod non est aliud, nisi sunt aliqui, qui uos conturbant, et uolunt euertere euangelium Christi.
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: which is nothing.

glosses.latin: Quod non est aliud, nisi sunt aliqui, qui uos conturbant, et uolunt euertere euangelium Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nifil folad naill fora sernte insos[Con]céle[/Con] issin[d] act cr[Con]ist[/Con] aris heside rofiugrad irrecht [GLat]et[/GLat] adfiadar isoscelu
glosses.glossText: .i. nifil folad naill fora sernte insoscéle issin act crist aris heside rofiugrad irrecht et adfiadar isoscelu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nifil folad naill fora sernte insoscéle issind act crist aris heside rofiugrad irrecht et adfiadar isoscelu
footnotes: d: leg. hísin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there is no other substance on which that Gospel could be built save Christ; for it is He that hath been figured in the Law and is declared in the Gospel.

glosses.latin: Quod non est aliud, nisi sunt aliqui, qui uos conturbant, et uolunt euertere euangelium Christi.
footnotes: e: rectius -tabairt
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to bring you from the Gospel into the superstitions of the Law.

glosses.latin: Quod non est aliud, nisi sunt aliqui, qui uos conturbant, et uolunt euertere euangelium Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] berit insos[Con]céle[/Con] do imthrenugud [GLat]ueteris[/GLat] noch bauissiu indfigor do imthrenugud [GLat]ueritatis[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]noui[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. berit insoscéle do imthrenugud ueteris noch bauissiu indfigor do imthrenugud ueritatis .i. noui
glosses.glossFNs: .i. berit insoscéle do imthrenugud ueteris noch bauissiu indfigor do imthrenugud ueritatis .i. noui
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they bring the Gospel to confirm Vetus (Testamentum), and yet meeter were the figure to confirm Veritas, i.e. Novum (Testamentum).

glosses.latin: Sed licet nos, aut angelus de caelo euangelizet uobís, praeterquam quod euangelizauimus uobís, ánathema sit!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni fíu dúibsi insin doé[Res]it[/Res]secht [Com]in marg [/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] cid aingel di anglib nime p[Con]ri[/Con]dchas duibsi ni cretid dó nonech di[Con]apos[/Con]tolis manip innon [GLat]et[/GLat] ap[Con]ri[/Con]dchimmeni dúib arniba maith a áidlea[f] dúib anétsecte arbid [GLat]anathema[/GLat] aforcen
glosses.glossText: .i. ni fíu dúibsi insin doé(it)secht [in marg ] .i. cid aingel di anglib nime pridchas duibsi ni cretid dó nonech diapostolis manip innon et apridchimmeni dúib arniba maith a áidlea dúib anétsecte arbid anathema aforcen
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni fíu dúibsi insin doé(it)secht [in marg ] .i. cid aingel di anglib nime pridchas duibsi ni cretid dó nonech diapostolis manip innon et apridchimmeni dúib arniba maith a áidleaf dúib anétsecte arbid anathema aforcen
footnotes: f: see infra, p. 622, note a
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not worthy for you to hear that, i.e. though it be one of heaven’s angels that preaches to you, believe him not–or one of the apostles–unless it be the same as what we preach to you: for not good will be the consequence to you of listening to them, for their end will be anathema.

glosses.latin: Sicut praediximus, et nunc iterum dico.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I say it again.

glosses.latin: Aut quero hominibus placere?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that I should preach for men’s desire.

glosses.latin: Audistis enim conversationem meam aliquando in iudaismo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Hier[Con]onymus[/Con] non gratiam sed conuersationem[/GLat] nirbsa dagduine itossuch
glosses.glossText: Hieronymus non gratiam sed conuersationem nirbsa dagduine itossuch
glosses.glossFNs: Hieronymus non gratiam sed conuersationem nirbsa dagduine itossuch
glosses.glossTrans: I had not been a good man at first.

glosses.latin: Et proficiebam in iudaismo, supra multos coaetaneos meos, habundantius aemulator existens paternarum mearum traditionum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I grew, that is, I have been a leader in that science.

glosses.latin: Et proficiebam in iudaismo, supra multos coaetaneos meos, habundantius aemulator existens paternarum mearum traditionum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. beyond my coevals.

glosses.latin: Et proficiebam in iudaismo, supra multos coaetaneos meos, habundantius aemulator existens paternarum mearum traditionum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. beyond every one.

glosses.latin: Et proficiebam in iudaismo, supra multos coaetaneos meos, habundantius aemulator existens paternarum mearum traditionum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to contend for the rule.

glosses.latin: Neque ueni in Hirusalem ad antecessores meos apostolos; sed abii in Arabiam, et iterum reuersus sum Damascum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dop[Con]re[/Con]cept sos[Con]céli[/Con] isairi asb[Con]eir[/Con]so[Con]m[/Con] inso fobith inna soebapstal asrubartatar ro[Con]m[/Con]bo descipulso[Con]m[/Con] aps[Con]tal[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. doprecept soscéli isairi asbeirsom inso fobith inna soebapstal asrubartatar rombo descipulsom apstal
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doprecept soscéli isairi asbeirsom inso fobith inna soebapstal asrubartatar rombo descipulsom apstal
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to preach the gospel, therefore he saith this, because of the false apostles who had said that he was a disciple of apostles.

glosses.latin: Neque ueni in Hirusalem ad antecessores meos apostolos; sed abii in Arabiam, et iterum reuersus sum Damascum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to teach also.

glosses.latin: Eram autem ignotus facie aeclesís Iudae[ae].
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Eram autem ignotus facie aeclesís Iudae[ae].
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Eram autem ignotus facie aeclesís Iudae[ae].
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have heard of one another, we had not seen one another.

glosses.latin: Tantum autem auditum habeant; quoniam qui persequebatur nos aliquando, nunc euangelizat fidem, quam aliquando expugnabat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] attaat scela linn pól ingrentid isp[Con]re[/Con]ceptóir [GLat]nunc fidei[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. attaat scela linn pól ingrentid ispreceptóir nunc fidei
glosses.glossFNs: .i. attaat scela linn pól ingrentid ispreceptóir nunc fidei
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have tidings: Paul a persecutor is nunc a teacher fidei.

glosses.latin: Deinde post annos xiiii. iterum ascendi Hirusolimam, cum Barnaban, adsumpto et Tito.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not very near was the return.

glosses.latin: Deinde post annos xiiii. iterum ascendi Hirusolimam, cum Barnaban, adsumpto et Tito.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] de iudéib dobarnaip digeintib dothit rofitir indiassin ni do legund and docoadsa [GLat]disci[Con]puli[/Con] iesu quia simul in apos[Con]tolatum[/Con] gentium electi sunt[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. de iudéib dobarnaip digeintib dothit rofitir indiassin ni do legund and docoadsa discipuli iesu quia simul in apostolatum gentium electi sunt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. de iudéib dobarnaip digeintib dothit rofitir indiassin ni do legund and docoadsa discipuli iesu quia simul in apostolatum gentium electi sunt
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the Jews was Barnabas, of the Gentiles was Titus: those two knew that it was not to study there that I had come.

glosses.latin: et contuli cum illís euangelium, quod praedico in gentibus, seorsum autem hís qui uidebantur esse maiores.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]narraui eis[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] doairfenus[b] doib dús imbed comrorcon and [GLat]et[/GLat] ni ro be
glosses.glossText: .i. narraui eis .i. doairfenus doib dús imbed comrorcon and et ni ro be
glosses.glossFNs: .i. narraui eis .i. doairfenusb doib dús imbed comrorcon and et ni ro be
footnotes: b: from to-ad-ro-fén- (cf. asfenimm gl. testificor, Wb. 22a 10), where -fén- may come from *vet-n-. W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have declared (it) to them if perchance there might be error therein, and there was not.

glosses.latin: et contuli cum illís euangelium, quod praedico in gentibus, seorsum autem hís qui uidebantur esse maiores.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not before every one.

glosses.latin: Sed neque Titus, qui mecum erat, cum esset gentilis, conpulsus est circumcidi;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ataat dichétbuid [GLat]híc[/GLat] imdibe tit [vel]ɫ.[/vel] anebimdibe [GLat]et[/GLat] is hedón asfír [GLat]sed neque [Con]con[/Con]pulsus circumcidi[/GLat] aristiamthe immeruidbed [GLat]et[/GLat] niroimdibed tit
glosses.glossText: .i. ataat dichétbuid híc imdibe tit ɫ. anebimdibe et is hedón asfír sed neque conpulsus circumcidi aristiamthe immeruidbed et niroimdibed tit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ataat dichétbuid híc imdibe tit ɫ. anebimdibe et is hedón asfír sed neque conpulsus circumcidi aristiamthe immeruidbed et niroimdibed tit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there are two senses híc: Titus’ circumcision or his non-circumcision; and it is this that is true, sed etc., for it is Timothy who had been circumcised and Titus had not been circumcised.

glosses.latin: quibus neque ad horam cessimus subiectioni, ut ueritas euangeli permaneat apud uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nibo mór ambríg linn [vel]ɫ[/vel] cidcohóir [GLat]ut pet[Con]rus[/Con] ad horam cessit pro humili[Con]tate[/Con] sua manducans cum gentibus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nibo mór ambríg linn ɫ cidcohóir ut petrus ad horam cessit pro humilitate sua manducans cum gentibus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nibo mór ambríg linn ɫ cidcohóir ut petrus ad horam cessit pro humilitate sua manducans cum gentibus
footnotes: b: i.e. ‘we held them of little account’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we did not deem their worth muchb: or even for an hour, ut etc.

glosses.latin: quibus neque ad horam cessimus subiectioni, ut ueritas euangeli permaneat apud uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided it be steadfast with us at first.

glosses.latin: Ab hís autem, qui uidebantur esse aliquid, quales aliquando fuerint nihil mea interest; Deus personam hominis non accipit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Peter and James and John.

glosses.latin: Ab hís autem, qui uidebantur esse aliquid, quales aliquando fuerint nihil mea interest; Deus personam hominis non accipit.
footnotes: c: mea is translated as a nominative or accusative plural
glosses.glossTrans: or my own things<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Ab hís autem, qui uidebantur esse aliquid, quales aliquando fuerint nihil mea interest; Deus personam hominis non accipit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niairegdu ap[Con]er[/Con]sansom oldaas p[Con]er[/Con]san nanabstal olchene cetothóisegu iniriss [GLat]quia d[Con]eu[/Con]s p[Con]er[/Con]sonam[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quia deus personam non praeuidet[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. niairegdu apersansom oldaas persan nanabstal olchene cetothóisegu iniriss quia deus personam rl. .i. quia deus personam non praeuidet
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niairegdu apersansom oldaas persan nanabstal olchene cetothóisegu iniriss quia deus personam rl. .i. quia deus personam non praeuidet
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not more eminent are their persons than the persons of the rest of the apostles, though they are prior in faith, quia etc.

glosses.latin: quod creditum est mihi euangelium praeputii,
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: dextras dederunt mihi et Barnabae societatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nírbosár leu arcocéilsine [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]consuerunt[/GLat] [Res][ie].i.[/ie] conoígset[/Res] [GLat]nos docere debere in pace et cooperatione siue quia subscripsimus epis[Con]tolam[/Con] de questionibus[/GLat][a]
glosses.glossText: .i. nírbosár leu arcocéilsine [in marg.] Pelagius: consuerunt (.i. conoígset) nos docere debere in pace et cooperatione siue quia subscripsimus epistolam de questionibus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nírbosár leu arcocéilsine [in marg.] Pelagius: consuerunt (.i. conoígset) nos docere debere in pace et cooperatione siue quia subscripsimus epistolam de questionibusa
footnotes: a: For this Migne, col. 845, has only ‘Ita nos docere debere’
d: Here the glossator seems to have mistaken consuerunt (from consuesco) for consuerunt (from consuo)
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they did not deem our fellowship an outrage. [in marg.] they sewed<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: dextras dederunt mihi et Barnabae societatis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Tantum ut pauperum meores essemus; quod etiam sollicitus fui hoc ipsum facere.
footnotes: e: cf. 31d 1
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we teachers of the Gentiles<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Tantum ut pauperum meores essemus; quod etiam sollicitus fui hoc ipsum facere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] congabtis gabala linn dondóis foiss inhierusale[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. congabtis gabala linn dondóis foiss inhierusalem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. congabtis gabala linn dondóis foiss inhierusalem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that collections be taken by us to the folk that abide in Jerusalem.

glosses.latin: Tantum ut pauperum meores essemus; quod etiam sollicitus fui hoc ipsum facere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even though it should not be said to us.

glosses.latin: Cum autem uenisset Cephas Anteochiam, in faciem éi restiti, quia reprehensibilis erat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nilegend rollegusa lapetor act iscúrsagad rondcúrsa[Con]gusa[/Con] dichomitecht [GLat]et[/GLat] condarcilli fri iudeu
glosses.glossText: .i. nilegend rollegusa lapetor act iscúrsagad rondcúrsagusa dichomitecht et condarcilli fri iudeu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nilegend rollegusa lapetor act iscúrsagad rondcúrsagusa dichomitecht et condarcilli fri iudeu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e it is not a reading which I have read with Peter, but a reprimand with which I have reprimanded him for indulgence and connivance towards the Jews.

glosses.latin: Cum autem uenisset Cephas Anteochiam, in faciem éi restiti, quia reprehensibilis erat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to reprimand him.

glosses.latin: Cum autem uenisset Cephas Anteochiam, in faciem éi restiti, quia reprehensibilis erat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bauisse aingabail [GLat]laús sanctae humilitatis in petro et iustitiae zeli in paulo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. bauisse aingabail laús sanctae humilitatis in petro et iustitiae zeli in paulo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bauisse aingabail laús sanctae humilitatis in petro et iustitiae zeli in paulo
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was just to censure him.

glosses.latin: Prius enim quam uenirent quidam a Iacobo, cum gentibus edebat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is why they were angry with him.

glosses.latin: Et simulationi eius consenserunt caeteri Iudei, ita ut et Barnabas duceretur ab eís in illam similitudinem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of not dining with Gentiles.

glosses.latin: Et simulationi eius consenserunt caeteri Iudei, ita ut et Barnabas duceretur ab eís in illam similitudinem.
footnotes: a: foirbthea for foirbthe, as aidlea 18c 11, for aithle
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. although his faith was perfect<sup>a</sup>.

glosses.latin: Si tú, cum Iudéus sis, gentiliter et non iudaice uiuis, quomodo gentes cogis iudaizare?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through regarding them as unclean.

glosses.latin: Si tú, cum Iudéus sis, gentiliter et non iudaice uiuis, quomodo gentes cogis iudaizare?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that they judaize.
