glosses.latin: nos in Christo Iesu credimus, ut iustificemur ex fide Christi, et non ex peribus legis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciapudono dún indarpe geinte inchruthsin arisinnon iress nodonfirianigedar
glosses.glossText: .i. ciapudono dún indarpe geinte inchruthsin arisinnon iress nodonfirianigedar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciapudono dún indarpe geinte inchruthsin arisinnon iress nodonfirianigedar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. why should we then expel the Gentiles in that manner, for it is the same faith that justifies us?

glosses.latin: Quodsi querentes iustificari in Christo, inuenti sumus et ipsi peccatores.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even we credentes etc.

glosses.latin: Quodsi querentes iustificari in Christo, inuenti sumus et ipsi peccatores.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciabeimmi ni [GLat]in fide christi peccatores sumus si opera legis credamus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ciabeimmi ni in fide christi peccatores sumus si opera legis credamus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciabeimmi ni in fide christi peccatores sumus si opera legis credamus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though we be in fide etc.

glosses.latin: cum Christo confixus sum cruci.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that I am dead as to the desire of the flesh, like Christ.

glosses.latin: Uiuo autem, iam non ego; uiuit uero in me Christus. Quod autem nunc uiuo in carne, in fide uiuo Filii Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I affirm; it is not I that am alive.

glosses.latin: Uiuo autem, iam non ego; uiuit uero in me Christus. Quod autem nunc uiuo in carne, in fide uiuo Filii Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isairi ambeosa hore atá cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]in mé[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isairi ambeosa hore atá crist in mé
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isairi ambeosa hore atá crist in mé
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore I am alive because Christ is in me.

glosses.latin: Uiuo autem, iam non ego; uiuit uero in me Christus. Quod autem nunc uiuo in carne, in fide uiuo Filii Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciasu icolinn ambéosa isiress cr[Con]ist[/Con] nombeoigedar
glosses.glossText: .i. ciasu icolinn ambéosa isiress crist nombeoigedar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciasu icolinn ambéosa isiress crist nombeoigedar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though it is in the flesh I am alive, it is Christ’s faith that quickens me.

glosses.latin: Si enim per legem iustitia, ergo Christus gratis mortuus est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it is the Law that justifies every one.

glosses.latin: Si enim per legem iustitia, ergo Christus gratis mortuus est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní airic ní césad cr[Con]ist[/Con] am[Con]al[/Con] sodin
glosses.glossText: .i. ní airic ní césad crist amal sodin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní airic ní césad crist amal sodin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Christ’s Passion profiteth nought in this wise.

glosses.latin: O insensati Galatae! quis uos fascinauit non obedire ueritati, ante quorum oculos Christus praescriptus est, in uobis crucifixus.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: O insensati Galatae! quis uos fascinauit non obedire ueritati, ante quorum oculos Christus praescriptus est, in uobis crucifixus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. sad is that, O foolish Galatians!

glosses.latin: O insensati Galatae! quis uos fascinauit non obedire ueritati, ante quorum oculos Christus praescriptus est, in uobis crucifixus.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: O insensati Galatae! quis uos fascinauit non obedire ueritati, ante quorum oculos Christus praescriptus est, in uobis crucifixus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rop[Con]ri[/Con]dchad dúib céssad cr[Con]ist[/Con] am[Con]al[/Con] adcethe [vel]ɫ.[/vel] forócrad dúib am[Con]al[/Con] bid fíadib nocrochthe
glosses.glossText: .i. ropridchad dúib céssad crist amal adcethe ɫ. forócrad dúib amal bid fíadib nocrochthe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ropridchad dúib céssad crist amal adcethe ɫ. forócrad dúib amal bid fíadib nocrochthe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Christ’s Passion hath been preached to you as though it were seen; or it has been announced to you as if He had been crucified before you.

glosses.latin: Hoc solum uolo a uobís discere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a question I have for you.

glosses.latin: Síc stulti estis.
footnotes: c: Lit. unto it
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so great<sup>c</sup> is your folly.

glosses.latin: Tanta passi estis sine causa? si tamen sine causa.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in (the) beginning quando etc.

glosses.latin: Tanta passi estis sine causa? si tamen sine causa.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in vain, i.e. ye have no profit thereof.

glosses.latin: Tanta passi estis sine causa? si tamen sine causa.
footnotes: d: béso is = bésu supra 6b 23, 24
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if so, greater may be<sup>d</sup> the knowledge of it that ye have.

glosses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: credidit Abraham Deo, et reputatum est illi ad iustitiam.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: credidit Abraham Deo, et reputatum est illi ad iustitiam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] as hiress[a] ronóib abracha[Con]m[/Con] nitatgníma rechto issí da[Con]no[/Con] robnóibsi
glosses.glossText: .i. amal as hiress ronóib abracham nitatgníma rechto issí dano robnóibsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal as hiress<sup>a</sup> ronóib abracham nitatgníma rechto issí dano robnóibsi
footnotes: a: leg. n-iress?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as it is faith that has sanctified Abraham and not deeds of the Law, it also has sanctified you.

glosses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: credidit Abraham Deo, et reputatum est illi ad iustitiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. his faith has justified him quasi etc.

glosses.latin: Cognoscite ergo, quia qui ex fide sunt, hii sunt filii Abrachae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdo assindetso[Con]m[/Con] inso dothaidbsiu asniress nóibas [GLat]et non opera legis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isdo assindetsom inso dothaidbsiu asniress nóibas et non opera legis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdo assindetsom inso dothaidbsiu asniress nóibas et non opera legis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for this (purpose) he declares this, to manifest that it is faith that sanctifies et non opera Legis.

glosses.latin: Igitur qui ex fide sunt, benedicentur cum fidili Abracham.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indí ata hiressig ataella indbendacht doratad for abracha[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. indí ata hiressig ataella indbendacht doratad for abracham
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indí ata hiressig ataella indbendacht doratad for abracham
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they that are faithful, the blessing which has been bestowed on Abraham passes to them.

glosses.latin: Quicumque enim ex operibus legis sunt, sub maledicto sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through transgression of the Law.

glosses.latin: Quoniam autem in lege nemo iustificatur apud Deum, manifestum est, quia iustus ex fide uiuet.
footnotes: b: Habakkuk ii. 4
glosses.glossTrans: in Habakkuk.

glosses.latin: Lex autem non est ex fide, sed: Qui fecerit ea, uiuet in illís.
glosses.glossTrans: it is in no wise the same.

glosses.latin: Lex autem non est ex fide, sed: Qui fecerit ea, uiuet in illís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he will not be guilty of the Law.

glosses.latin: Christus nos redemit de maledicto legis, factus pro nobís maledictum;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niáil dún buith fomáam [GLat]legis[/GLat] iár tíchte cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. niáil dún buith fomáam legis iár tíchte crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niáil dún buith fomáam legis iár tíchte crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not proper for us to be under the yoke Legis after Christ’s coming.

glosses.latin: Christus nos redemit de maledicto legis, factus pro nobís maledictum;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for.

glosses.latin: Ut in gentibus benedictio Abrachae fieret in Christo Iesu, ut pollicitationem Spiritus accipiamus per fidem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that what had been promised to Abraham might be fulfilled.

glosses.latin: Ut in gentibus benedictio Abrachae fieret in Christo Iesu, ut pollicitationem Spiritus accipiamus per fidem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not (merely) one profit hath crux Christi procured for us.

glosses.latin: Fratres (secundum hominem dico).
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ismóith aforcital [ie].i.[/ie] anasbiur sís imchosmulius indfíadnissi
glosses.glossText: .i. ismóith aforcital .i. anasbiur sís imchosmulius indfíadnissi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ismóith aforcital .i. anasbiur sís imchosmulius indfíadnissi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. tender is the teaching, that is, what I say below about the likeness of the testimony.

glosses.latin: Et semini tuo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even.

glosses.latin: Hoc autem dico, testamentum confirmatum á Domino; quae post quadrigentos et trigenta annos facta est lex, non inritam facit ad euacuandam promisionem.
footnotes: b: = tairngiriu, cf. Ml. 33d 2
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Law has been made after the promise.

glosses.latin: Hoc autem dico, testamentum confirmatum á Domino; quae post quadrigentos et trigenta annos facta est lex, non inritam facit ad euacuandam promisionem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but this were its annulment, not to fulfil it.

glosses.latin: Nam si ex lege hereditas data est, iam non ex promisione, Abrachae autem per repromisionem donauit Deus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dorairngred do abracha[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]quod in semine tuo heredi[Con]tas[/Con] omnis[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. dorairngred do abracham quod in semine tuo hereditas omnis rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dorairngred do abracham quod in semine tuo hereditas omnis rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which had been promised to Abraham, quod etc.

glosses.latin: Nam si ex lege hereditas data est, iam non ex promisione, Abrachae autem per repromisionem donauit Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. yet from this it has been given.

glosses.latin: Nam si ex lege hereditas data est, iam non ex promisione, Abrachae autem per repromisionem donauit Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is He, then, that is true.

glosses.latin: Quid igitur lex? Propter transgressiones possita est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unto what profit has it been imparted?

glosses.latin: Quid igitur lex? Propter transgressiones possita est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to correct every one.

glosses.latin: Si enim data esset lex, quae possit uiuificare, uere ex lege esset iustitia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] sodin [GLat]et non ex repromisione[/GLat] arniↄchoimnucuir rect firíanugud
glosses.glossText: .i. amal sodin et non ex repromisione arniↄchoimnucuir rect firíanugud
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal sodin et non ex repromisione arniↄchoimnucuir rect firíanugud
glosses.glossTrans: i e. in that case et non ex repromissione, for (the) Law could not justify.

glosses.latin: Sed conclusit scriptura omnia sub peccato, ut promisio ex fide Iesu Christi daretur credentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doárbith rect pecthu cáich [GLat]ut non est qui faciat bonum[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] doárbuid [vel]ɫ.[/vel] doetarrid
glosses.glossText: .i. doárbith rect pecthu cáich ut non est qui faciat bonum ɫ. doárbuid ɫ. doetarrid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doárbith rect pecthu cáich ut non est qui faciat bonum ɫ. doárbuid ɫ. doetarrid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Law has displayed every one’s sins ut etc., or it has bound or grasped.

glosses.latin: Sed conclusit scriptura omnia sub peccato, ut promisio ex fide Iesu Christi daretur credentibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through belief in Jesus Christ.

glosses.latin: Prius autem quam ueniret fides, sub lege custodiebamur conclusi, in eam fidem, quae reuelanda erat.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Prius autem quam ueniret fides, sub lege custodiebamur conclusi, in eam fidem, quae reuelanda erat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have been cared for to receive the faith.

glosses.latin: Prius autem quam ueniret fides, sub lege custodiebamur conclusi, in eam fidem, quae reuelanda erat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non saluati fuimus[/GLat] acht im[Con]murgu[/Con] torbe recto [GLat]custodia tantum et reuelatio peccatorum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. non saluati fuimus acht immurgu torbe recto custodia tantum et reuelatio peccatorum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. non saluati fuimus acht immurgu torbe recto custodia tantum et reuelatio peccatorum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. non saluati fuimus, but however custodia etc. is the Law’s profit.

glosses.latin: Itaque lex pedagogue noster fuit in Christo, ut ex fide iustificemur.
footnotes: c: nacharochlat = nacha-ro-foichlet from fo-ciallim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as there is a guardian with children who cannot take care<sup>c</sup> of themselves.

glosses.latin: Itaque lex pedagogue noster fuit in Christo, ut ex fide iustificemur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from belief in Jesus Christ.

glosses.latin: Omnes enim filii Dei estis per fidem in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through belief in Jesus.

glosses.latin: Quicumque enim in Christum baptizati estis, Christum induistis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are united in Christ.

glosses.latin: Non est Iudaeus neque Graecus, non est seruus neque liber.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nisain cach hæ hicr[Con]ist[/Con] ni mó bríg cach he alailiu
glosses.glossText: .i. nisain cach hæ hicrist ni mó bríg cach he alailiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nisain cach hæ hicrist ni mó bríg cach he alailiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not different is each of them in Christ; one of them is not of more account than another.

glosses.latin: Si autem nos Christi, ergo Abrachae semen estis, secundum promisionem heredes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ma nudubfeil inellug coirp cr[Con]ist[/Con] adibcland abrache am[Con]al[/Con] sodin [GLat]et[/GLat] itsib atachomarpi abracha[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. ma nudubfeil inellug coirp crist adibcland abrache amal sodin et itsib atachomarpi abracham
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ma nudubfeil inellug coirp crist adibcland abrache amal sodin et itsib atachomarpi abracham
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye are in the union of Christ’s Body, ye are Abraham’s children in this wise, and it is ye that are Abraham’s heirs.

glosses.latin: Quanto tempore heres paruulus est, nihil defert a seruo.
footnotes: a: MS. scosc
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is correction and castigation on each of the twain.

glosses.latin: Sed sub curatoribus, et actoribus est usque ad praefinitum tempus a patré.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Sed sub curatoribus, et actoribus est usque ad praefinitum tempus a patré.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Sed sub curatoribus, et actoribus est usque ad praefinitum tempus a patré.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. until it is time for him to take the land.

glosses.latin: Sed sub curatoribus, et actoribus est usque ad praefinitum tempus a patré.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is ... (?).

glosses.latin: Ita et nos cum essemus paruuli, sub elimentís huius mundi eramus, seruientes.
glosses.glossText: .i. apgitrib .i. sub mandatís legis ɫ. sub doctoribus legis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. apgitrib .i. sub mandatís legis ɫ. sub doctoribus legis
footnotes: e: lit. alphabets
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. rudiments<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Ita et nos cum essemus paruuli, sub elimentís huius mundi eramus, seruientes.
footnotes: b: cf. Pedersen, Aspirationen 118
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have not remained.

glosses.latin: At ubi uenit plenitudo temporis, misit Deus Filium suum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when it seemed time to the heavenly Father.

glosses.latin: ut adoptionem filiorum reciperemus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we (are) sons of His adoptione non natura.

glosses.latin: missit Deus Spiritum Filii sui in corda uestra.
footnotes: f: 1 Cor. ii. 11
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is He that is wise as to the recognition of the Father<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: quomodo conuertemini iterum ad infirma et egena elimenta, quibus denuo seruire uultis?
footnotes: c: a prima manu, for cair Lat. quaere?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: quomodo conuertemini iterum ad infirma et egena elimenta, quibus denuo seruire uultis?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what impels you to it?

glosses.latin: quomodo conuertemini iterum ad infirma et egena elimenta, quibus denuo seruire uultis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciddianepirsom anísiu noch ni rabatar indfirso ria[Con]m[/Con] fo recht fetar[Con]licce[/Con] ni[Con]anse[/Con] ariscu[Con]m[/Con]me lesso[Con]m[/Con] tect fosmachtu rechto [GLat]et[/GLat] fognam doídlaib
glosses.glossText: .i. ciddianepirsom anísiu noch ni rabatar indfirso riam fo recht fetarlicce nianse ariscumme lessom tect fosmachtu rechto et fognam doídlaib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciddianepirsom anísiu noch ni rabatar indfirso riam fo recht fetarlicce nianse ariscumme lessom tect fosmachtu rechto et fognam doídlaib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. why saith he this although these men never have been under the law of the Old Testament? Easy (to answer): because he deems it the same to go under the rules of the Law as to serve idols.

glosses.latin: quomodo conuertemini iterum ad infirma et egena elimenta, quibus denuo seruire uultis?
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Dies obseruetis, et menses, et tempora, et annos
footnotes: d: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: sabbaths.

glosses.latin: Dies obseruetis, et menses, et tempora, et annos
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. calends.

glosses.latin: Dies obseruetis, et menses, et tempora, et annos
footnotes: g: trimsi pl. of tremse, (spatium) trimestre
h: σκηνοπήγια, the Jewish feast of Tabernacles
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. quartersg, uel scenopegiah.

glosses.latin: Dies obseruetis, et menses, et tempora, et annos
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Timeo uos, ne forte sine causa laborauerim in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in vain.

glosses.latin: Timeo uos, ne forte sine causa laborauerim in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in your conversion, if what I preach be useless for me.

glosses.latin: Estote síc ut ego, quia et ego sicut uos. Fratres, obsecro uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]sum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]homo[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] nipa anse dúib mo intsamil [GLat]quia ego homo sum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. sum .i. homo .i. nipa anse dúib mo intsamil quia ego homo sum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sum .i. homo .i. nipa anse dúib mo intsamil quia ego homo sum
footnotes: d: See Acts x. 26
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be hard for you to imitate me, quia etc.d

glosses.latin: Estote síc ut ego, quia et ego sicut uos. Fratres, obsecro uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye may be ut sum.

glosses.latin: Scitis autem quia per infirmitatem carnis euangelizaui uobís iampridem; et temptationem uestram in carne mea
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] forrodamar ocp[Con]re[/Con]cept dúib [GLat]ab incredulís uestrís[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]si non passi estis corpore tamen mente [Con]con[/Con]passi estis mihi[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. forrodamar ocprecept dúib ab incredulís uestrís ɫ. si non passi estis corpore tamen mente conpassi estis mihi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. forrodamar ocprecept dúib ab incredulís uestrís ɫ. si non passi estis corpore tamen mente conpassi estis mihi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which I have endured in preaching to you ab etc.

glosses.latin: Non spreuistis ... sed sicut angelum Dei excepistis me, sicut Christum Iesum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is nobler then.

glosses.latin: Ubi est ergo beatitudo uestra? Testimonium enim perhibeo uobis, quia, si fieri potuisset, oculos uestros eruesetis et dedissetis mihi.
glosses.glossFullTags: catte di[Con]diu[/Con] farfailtesin[a] frinn [GLat]ollim nobis facta[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: catte didiu farfailtesin frinn ollim nobis facta
glosses.glossFNs: catte didiu farfailtesina frinn ollim nobis facta
footnotes: a: Sic: leg. -si
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what, then, is your welcome unto us olim etc.?

glosses.latin: Ubi est ergo beatitudo uestra? Testimonium enim perhibeo uobis, quia, si fieri potuisset, oculos uestros eruesetis et dedissetis mihi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the extent of the welcome.

glosses.latin: Ubi est ergo beatitudo uestra? Testimonium enim perhibeo uobis, quia, si fieri potuisset, oculos uestros eruesetis et dedissetis mihi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I had asked for your eyes, ye would have given them to me.

glosses.latin: Ego ergo inimicus uobís factus sum, uerum dicens uobís?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when I enjoin righteousness upon you.

glosses.latin: Ego ergo inimicus uobís factus sum, uerum dicens uobís?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni nachcin aile no taid dom
glosses.glossText: .i. ni nachcin aile no taid dom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni nachcin aile no taid dom
footnotes: e: cf. p. 528 note b
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not any other fault that ails<sup>e</sup> you at me.

glosses.latin: Aemulantur uobis non bene.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are jealous of you, i.e. pseudoapostoli, i.e. they envy you, it is not for love of you.

glosses.latin: Aemulantur uobis non bene.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niarmaith frib [GLat]non ut ego zelus domus tuae[/GLat][b] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. niarmaith frib non ut ego zelus domus tuae rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niarmaith frib non ut ego zelus domus tuaeb rl.
footnotes: b: Ps. lxix. 9
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not for good to you, non etc.

glosses.latin: Bonum autem aemulamini in bono semper, et non tantum cum presens sum apud uos.
footnotes: c: leg. badsamlid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but be ye thus even in my absence.

glosses.latin: Uellim autem esse apud uos modo, et motare uocem meam, quoniam confundor in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it were possible for me.

glosses.latin: Uellim autem esse apud uos modo, et motare uocem meam, quoniam confundor in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to reprimand you.

glosses.latin: Uellim autem esse apud uos modo, et motare uocem meam, quoniam confundor in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when I am glorying for you.

glosses.latin: Dicite mihi, qui sub lege uultis esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if this is what ye have chosen.

glosses.latin: Scriptum est enim: Quoniam Abracham duos filios habuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. do ye not remember this story?

glosses.latin: Sed qui de ancella, secundum carnem natus est; qui autem de libera, secundum repromisionem est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non secundum uoluntatem carnis[/GLat] arni robatar accobra colna leoso[Con]m[/Con] issuidiu cétach [GLat]abracham[/GLat] noíchtech  [GLat]sarra[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. non secundum uoluntatem carnis arni robatar accobra colna leosom issuidiu cétach abracham noíchtech sarra
glosses.glossFNs: .i. non secundum uoluntatem carnis arni robatar accobra colna leosom issuidiu cétach abracham noíchtech sarra
glosses.glossTrans: for they had not desires of the flesh in this, Abraham (being) a centenarian, Sarah a nonagenarian.

glosses.latin: haec enim sunt duo testamenta: unum quidem a monte Sina.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (here) is made a comparison of the Law to persons and places.

glosses.latin: Illa autem quae sursum est.
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Laetare, sterilis, quae non paris; erumpe et clama.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou shalt have cause of joy.

glosses.latin: Ecce, ego Paulus dico uobis, quoniam si circumcidamini, Christus uobís nihil proderit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is no one else that saith it.

glosses.latin: Ecce, ego Paulus dico uobis, quoniam si circumcidamini, Christus uobís nihil proderit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nib íccfither trechroich cr[Con]ist[/Con] mafogneith dorecht
glosses.glossText: .i. nib íccfither trechroich crist mafogneith dorecht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nib íccfither trechroich crist mafogneith dorecht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye will not be saved through Christ’s Cross if ye serve the Law.

glosses.latin: Testificor autem rursum omni homini circumcidenti sé, quoniam debitor est uniuersae legis faciendae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intí téte forecht nimdibi dlegair docomalnad[d] ind huili rechto
glosses.glossText: .i. intí téte forecht nimdibi dlegair docomalnad ind huili rechto
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intí téte forecht nimdibi dlegair docomalnad<sup>d</sup> ind huili rechto
footnotes: d: leg. dó comalnnd
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he that goes under the law of circumcision is bound to fulfil the whole Law.

glosses.latin: Euacuati estis á Christo, qui in lege iustificamini, a gratia excidistis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye believe not in Christ.

glosses.latin: Euacuati estis á Christo, qui in lege iustificamini, a gratia excidistis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. according to your opinion.

glosses.latin: Euacuati estis á Christo, qui in lege iustificamini, a gratia excidistis.
footnotes: e: for doforbaidsi, the glossator mistaking excĭdistis for excīdistis, cf. Celt. Zeitschr. III. 55. Otherwise, doforbadsi has been taken for do-b-forbad-si ‘excisi estis’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye have cut off.

glosses.latin: Currebatis bene; quis uos inpediuit ueritati non obaedire?
footnotes: f: Palaeographically, it is possible to read forsanobith
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from the course whereon ye were.

glosses.latin: Currebatis bene; quis uos inpediuit ueritati non obaedire?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though any one tempt you.

glosses.latin: Ego confido in uobís in Domino, quod nihil aliud sapietis; qui autem conturbat uos portabit iudicium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. you in Domino.

glosses.latin: Ego confido in uobís in Domino, quod nihil aliud sapietis; qui autem conturbat uos portabit iudicium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. save what I have preached unto you.

glosses.latin: Ego confido in uobís in Domino, quod nihil aliud sapietis; qui autem conturbat uos portabit iudicium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whoever he be.

glosses.latin: Ego confido in uobís in Domino, quod nihil aliud sapietis; qui autem conturbat uos portabit iudicium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from the course whereon ye are.

glosses.latin: Ego confido in uobís in Domino, quod nihil aliud sapietis; qui autem conturbat uos portabit iudicium.
footnotes: i: cf. LL. 278a 30, Laws I. 256, Meyer Contrib. 21 s.v. adfenim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. punishment, i.e. there will be retribution<sup>i</sup> to him.

glosses.latin: Ergo euacuatum est scandalum crucis.
glosses.glossText: .i. massu ní imdibe nítorbe césad crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. massu ní imdibe nítorbe<sup>g</sup> césad crist
footnotes: g: MS. nitorb
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if circumcision is anything, Christ’s Passion is no profit.

glosses.latin: Utinam abscidantur qui uos conturbant!
footnotes: h: cf. Wb. 14b 6, 26b 1
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I should wish, that is, I should think it a lighter thing than that you should be circumcised.

glosses.latin: Uos enim in libertatem uocati estis, fratres; tantum né libertatem in occassionem carnis detis, sed per caritatem spiritus seruite inuicem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye should not desert your freedom for service.

glosses.latin: Uos enim in libertatem uocati estis, fratres; tantum né libertatem in occassionem carnis detis, sed per caritatem spiritus seruite inuicem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every one serve another.

glosses.latin: Quodsi inuicem mordetis, et comeditis, uidete ne ab inuicem consummemini.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ma beith míduthracht [GLat]et[/GLat]dígal lacách uáib dialailiu
glosses.glossText: .i. ma beith míduthracht etdígal lacách uáib dialailiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ma beith míduthracht etdígal lacách uáib dialailiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if each of you have ill-will and punishment for the other.

glosses.latin: Quodsi inuicem mordetis, et comeditis, uidete ne ab inuicem consummemini.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] beith formenme and arnafoircnea forcrabud and [ie].i.[/ie] hibarpeccad cenaithirgi
glosses.glossText: .i. beith formenme and arnafoircnea forcrabud and .i. hibarpeccad cenaithirgi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. beith formenme and arnafoircnea forcrabud and .i. hibarpeccad cenaithirgi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let your mind be there, lest it should put an end to your piety therein, i.e. in your sin without repentance.

glosses.latin: Dico autem: Spiritu ambulate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is my advice.

glosses.latin: Caro enim concupiscit aduersus spiritum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. take ye heed of that.

glosses.latin: Quod si spiritu docemini, non estis sub lege.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye are subject to the Spirit.

glosses.latin: Manifesta sunt autem opera carnis, quae sunt fornicatio, inmunditia, luxoria.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Manifesta sunt autem opera carnis, quae sunt fornicatio, inmunditia, luxoria.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Manifesta sunt autem opera carnis, quae sunt fornicatio, inmunditia, luxoria.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rofitir cách ni fiú comitecht doib
glosses.glossText: .i. rofitir cách ni fiú comitecht doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rofitir cách ni fiú comitecht doib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one knows it is not right to indulge them.

glosses.latin: Idolorum seruitus, ueneficia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. covetousness.

glosses.latin: Idolorum seruitus, ueneficia.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: commensationes.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Fructus autem spiritus est caritas, gaudium, pax, patientia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] coir cid [GLat]caritas[/GLat] no bed itossuch [GLat]sine qua uirtutes cæterae non reputantur[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. coir cid caritas no bed itossuch sine qua uirtutes cæterae non reputantur
glosses.glossFNs: .i. coir cid caritas no bed itossuch sine qua uirtutes cæterae non reputantur
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (it is) proper that caritas should be first, sine qua etc.

glosses.latin: Qui autem sunt Christi, carnem [suam] crucifixerunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conafil dualchi na accobra colnidi leu
glosses.glossText: .i. conafil dualchi na accobra colnidi leu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conafil dualchi na accobra colnidi leu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they have no vices nor carnal desires.

glosses.latin: Si uiuimus spiritu, spiritu et ambulemus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] massu spirtide armbethu bat spirtidi arṅgnímæ
glosses.glossText: .i. massu spirtide armbethu bat spirtidi arṅgnímæ
glosses.glossFNs: .i. massu spirtide armbethu bat spirtidi arṅgnímæ
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if our life is spiritual, let our deeds be spiritual.

glosses.latin: si praeoccupatus fuerit homo in aliquo delicto ... huiusmodi instruite in spiritu mansuetudinis; considerans teipsum, [ne] et tu tempteris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. meet is gentleness in teaching them.

glosses.latin: si praeoccupatus fuerit homo in aliquo delicto ... huiusmodi instruite in spiritu mansuetudinis; considerans teipsum, [ne] et tu tempteris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest thou sin.

glosses.latin: Alter alterius onera portate, et síc adinplebitis legem Christi.
footnotes: c: a prima manu, = fulṅgid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. support ye.

glosses.latin: Alter alterius onera portate, et síc adinplebitis legem Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mad cu[Con]m[/Con]me imned ácheli [GLat]et[/GLat] aimned fessin
glosses.glossText: .i. mad cumme imned ácheli et aimned fessin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mad cumme imned ácheli et aimned fessin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if his fellow’s tribulation and his own tribulation be the same.

glosses.latin: si quis existimet se aliquid esse.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that he be somewhat.

glosses.latin: Opus autem suum probet unusquisque, et síc in semet ipso tantam gloriam habebit, et non in altero.
footnotes: f: cf. Atkinson, Passions and Homilies, 7315, 7374
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it concern<sup>f</sup> his own conscience.

glosses.latin: Opus autem suum probet unusquisque, et síc in semet ipso tantam gloriam habebit, et non in altero.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat]Hi[Con]e[/Con]r[Con]onymus[/Con][/GLat]: forrochongart itossuch [GLat]spiritalibus ut indoctos bene instruerent ut alter alterius honera portaret híc e contra praecipit ut inbicelliores instructi magistrís benefaciant[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Hieronymus: forrochongart itossuch spiritalibus ut indoctos bene instruerent ut alter alterius honera portaret híc e contra praecipit ut inbicelliores instructi magistrís benefaciant
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Hieronymus: forrochongart itossuch spiritalibus ut indoctos bene instruerent ut alter alterius honera portaret híc e contra praecipit ut inbicelliores instructi magistrís benefaciant
glosses.glossTrans: he first has given orders spiritualibus ut etc.

glosses.latin: Unusquisque enim bonus suum portabit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what every one shall do, that will be an aid to him.

glosses.latin: Communicet ... ei qui se catechizat, in omnibus bonís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in everything that he may need.

glosses.latin: qui seminat de carne sua, de carne et metet corruptionem, qui autem seminat in spiritu, de spiritu metet uitam aeternam.
footnotes: b: For the doubling of the n before d cf. chlainnd Wb. 29d 23, rinnd 13d 25, scribinnd 15a 30
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the recompense is poena perpetua.

glosses.latin: qui seminat de carne sua, de carne et metet corruptionem, qui autem seminat in spiritu, de spiritu metet uitam aeternam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this will be his reward.

glosses.latin: Bonum autem facientes, non deficiamus, tempore enim suo metemus non deficientes.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Bonum autem facientes, non deficiamus, tempore enim suo metemus non deficientes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]fide operæ[/GLat] naanam didénum maith [c]condonroib[/c] [GLat]uita aeterna ut dicitur qui perseuerauerit[/GLat][d] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. fide operæ naanam didénum maith condonroib uita aeterna ut dicitur qui perseuerauerit rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fide operæ naanam didénum maith condonroibc uita aeterna ut dicitur qui perseueraueritd rl.
footnotes: c: MS. codonroib
d: Matth. xxiv. 13
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. fide operae let us not rest from doing good, so that we may have uita aeterna etc.

glosses.latin: Bonum autem facientes, non deficiamus, tempore enim suo metemus non deficientes.
footnotes: e: MS. bemithich
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when it shall be time.

glosses.latin: dum tempus habemus, operemur bonum ad omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: or life.

glosses.latin: dum tempus habemus, operemur bonum ad omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to do good to every one.

glosses.latin: Uidete qualibus litterís scripsi uobís mea manu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. see what I have written to you.

glosses.latin: Uidete qualibus litterís scripsi uobís mea manu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is no other.

glosses.latin: Quicumque [enim] uolunt placere in carne, hii cogunt uos circumcidi, tantum ut crucis Christi persecutionem non patiantur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is the will of the flesh which they teach.

glosses.latin: Quicumque [enim] uolunt placere in carne, hii cogunt uos circumcidi, tantum ut crucis Christi persecutionem non patiantur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isdo dágniat maith leu indocbál apstal doib [GLat]et[/GLat] ní fodmat ingreimm archroich cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. isdo dágniat maith leu indocbál apstal doib et ní fodmat ingreimm archroich crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isdo dágniat maith leu indocbál apstal doib et ní fodmat ingreimm archroich crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for this they do it: they like to have the glory of apostles, and they endure not persecution for the Cross of Christ.

glosses.latin: Neque enim qui circumciduntur, legem custodiunt; sed uolunt uos circumcidi, ut in carne uestra glorientur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even they themselves fulfil not the Law.

glosses.latin: Neque enim qui circumciduntur, legem custodiunt; sed uolunt uos circumcidi, ut in carne uestra glorientur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they desire that ye should be circumcised.

glosses.latin: Neque enim qui circumciduntur, legem custodiunt; sed uolunt uos circumcidi, ut in carne uestra glorientur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] condartar ainm napstil doib trep[Con]re[/Con]cept nimdibi dúibsi
glosses.glossText: .i. condartar ainm napstil doib treprecept nimdibi dúibsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. condartar ainm napstil doib treprecept nimdibi dúibsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that the name of ‘apostle’ be given to them through preaching circumcision unto you.

glosses.latin: Mihi autem absit gloriari, nisi in cruce Domini nostri Christi, per quem mihi mundus crucifixus est, et ego mundo!
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am not the same as they.

glosses.latin: Mihi autem absit gloriari, nisi in cruce Domini nostri Christi, per quem mihi mundus crucifixus est, et ego mundo!
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] damarb inadnacul marb cechtar nathar dialailiu [GLat]ego et mundus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal damarb inadnacul marb cechtar nathar dialailiu ego et mundus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal damarb inadnacul marb cechtar nathar dialailiu ego et mundus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. like two corpses in a grave, dead is each of us twain to the other, ego et mundus.

glosses.latin: Et quicumque hanc regulam secuti fuerint, pax super illos, et misericordia, et super Israhel Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ropcoræ doib fridia [GLat]et[/GLat] doíni [ie].i.[/ie] forsnahí comalnatar toil dǽ
glosses.glossText: .i. ropcoræ doib fridia et doíni .i. forsnahí comalnatar toil dǽ
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ropcoræ doib fridia et doíni .i. forsnahí comalnatar toil dǽ
footnotes: b: lit. ‘let it be peace to them towards’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. peace be with them towards<sup>b</sup> God and men, that is, on those who fulfil God’s will.

glosses.latin: Et quicumque hanc regulam secuti fuerint, pax super illos, et misericordia, et super Israhel Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]sanctos uidentes deum et[/GLat] comalnatar toil dǽ
glosses.glossText: .i. sanctos uidentes deum et comalnatar toil dǽ
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sanctos uidentes deum et comalnatar toil dǽ
footnotes: c: Cf. ‘Israhel uocatur huius anima uidens Deum,’ Secundinus’ hymn, stanza S. So Jerome cited by Todd, Liber Hymn. 20: ‘vir, aut mens, uidens Deum’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. sanctos uidentes Deumc et who fulfil God’s will.

glosses.latin: De caetero nemo mihi molestus sit; ego enim stigmata Iesu in corpore meo porto.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though ye have done it hitherto.

glosses.latin: De caetero nemo mihi molestus sit; ego enim stigmata Iesu in corpore meo porto.
footnotes: d: tomoldid, v. supra p. 592, note c, and add tomailtís na caeirigh, O’Br. s.v. bunsacha
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. do not goad me<sup>d</sup> to punish you.

glosses.latin: De caetero nemo mihi molestus sit; ego enim stigmata Iesu in corpore meo porto.
footnotes: a: a prima manu. The marks over inda and errend are not marks of length. Thurneysen, Celt. Zeitschr. III. 53, 54
glosses.glossTrans: the stigmata.

glosses.latin: De caetero nemo mihi molestus sit; ego enim stigmata Iesu in corpore meo porto.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mind nabstalacte [ie].i.[/ie] conicimm dígail [GLat]et[/GLat] cosc neich
glosses.glossText: .i. mind nabstalacte .i. conicimm dígail et cosc neich
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mind nabstalacte .i. conicimm dígail et cosc neich
footnotes: e: insigne: inna mind ‘insignia,’ Cr. 41c
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the mark<sup>e</sup> of apostleship, that is, I am able to punish and to correct any one.

glosses.latin: Benedictus Deus et Pater Domini nostri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Godhead.

glosses.latin: Benedictus Deus et Pater Domini nostri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is, the Father.

glosses.latin: Sicut elegit nos in ipso ante mundi constitutionem, ut essemus sancti.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Sicut elegit nos in ipso ante mundi constitutionem, ut essemus sancti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is to this we have been called.

glosses.latin: Qui praedistinauit nos in adoptionem filiorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from afar we have been considered so that we are sons by election, non naturae.

glosses.latin: In laudem gloriae gratiae suae, in qua gratificauit nos in dilecto Filio suo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He has gifted us and has filled us with the grace of the Spirit.

glosses.latin: In quo habemus redemptionem per sanguinem eius, remissionem peccatorum, secundum diuitias gratiae eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is in slavery we have been.

glosses.latin: In quo habemus redemptionem per sanguinem eius, remissionem peccatorum, secundum diuitias gratiae eius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tresinfuil storidi doresset assathóib intain rombói fricroich [GLat]et[/GLat] tresinfuil spirtáldi adoparar cachdia forsindaltoir
glosses.glossText: .i. tresinfuil storidi doresset assathóib intain rombói fricroich et tresinfuil spirtáldi adoparar cachdia forsindaltoir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tresinfuil storidi doresset assathóib intain rombói fricroich et tresinfuil spirtáldi adoparar cachdia forsindaltoir
footnotes: b: mad du stóir ‘in a literal sense’ is opposed to mad du rúin ‘in a mystic sense’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through the literal<sup>b</sup> blood which had been poured out of His side when He was on the Cross, and through the spiritual blood which is offered every day up on the altar.

glosses.latin: In quo habemus redemptionem per sanguinem eius, remissionem peccatorum, secundum diuitias gratiae eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for we have deserved nought save punishment.

glosses.latin: Quae superabundauit in nobís, in omni sapientia et prudentia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. abundantly it has been bestowed upon us.

glosses.latin: Quae superabundauit in nobís, in omni sapientia et prudentia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. perfection of well-doing.

glosses.latin: Ut notum faceret nobís sacramentum uoluntatis suae, secundum bonum placitum eius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we might understand it.

glosses.latin: Ut notum faceret nobís sacramentum uoluntatis suae, secundum bonum placitum eius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the mystery of our salvation.

glosses.latin: Ut notum faceret nobís sacramentum uoluntatis suae, secundum bonum placitum eius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. according to the good will.

glosses.latin: In dispensationem plenitudinis temporum,
footnotes: a: leg. bad chomadas
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. till the time had so come that was fitting to Him.

glosses.latin: nos sorte uocati sumus, praedistinati.
footnotes: c: arfolmas, v. Sommer, Celt. Zeitschr. I. 182. But the word is obscure
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is long since he destined<sup>c</sup>(?) that to us.

glosses.latin: Ut simus in laudem gloriae eius nos, qui ante sperauimus in Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. per prophetas that He would come to us.

glosses.latin: signati estis Spiritu promissionis sancto.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: signati estis Spiritu promissionis sancto.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a sign is upon you.

glosses.latin: Qui est pignus hereditatis nostrae, in redemptionem adquissitionis, in laudem gloriae ipsius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is a sign of our redemption and our salvation.

glosses.latin: Qui est pignus hereditatis nostrae, in redemptionem adquissitionis, in laudem gloriae ipsius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for any other operation.

glosses.latin: Ut Deus Domini nostri Iesu Christi, Pater gloriae, det uobis spiritum sapientiae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished inso noguidimm [ie].i.[/ie] conducaid etargne ṅ dǽ [GLat]et[/GLat] conaroib temel innatol domunde tarrosc fornanme
glosses.glossText: .i. ished inso noguidimm .i. conducaid etargne ṅ dǽ et conaroib temel innatol domunde tarrosc fornanme
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished inso noguidimm .i. conducaid etargne ṅ dǽ et conaroib temel innatol domunde tarrosc fornanme
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is what I pray, even that you may understand the knowledge of God, and that the darkness of the worldly desires may not be over the eye of your soul.

glosses.latin: Inluminatos oculos cordis uestri, ut sciatis quae sit spes uocationis eius, et quae diuitiae gloriae hereditatis eius in sanctis,
footnotes: b: Matth. vi. 22, 23
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that your soul’s eye may be keen<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Inluminatos oculos cordis uestri, ut sciatis quae sit spes uocationis eius, et quae diuitiae gloriae hereditatis eius in sanctis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. glory to us like God’s glory.

glosses.latin: suscitans illum á mortuis, et constituens ad dexteram suam in caelestibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it were not just that He should be in that household, i.e. mortuorum.

glosses.latin: suscitans illum á mortuis, et constituens ad dexteram suam in caelestibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not on a diocesan visitation hath he gone.

glosses.latin: Supra omnem principatum et potestatem et uirtutem et dominationem, super omne nomen quod nominatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] dobeir inso anrab uilib cumactib dichoissin inim [GLat]et[/GLat]tala[Con]m[/Con] arailiu isarnaib grádib nemdib [GLat]tantum et[/GLat] nibo decming rombed imthanad hisuidib combad uáisliu cachgrád alailiu [GLat]ut est in gradibus terrenís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. dobeir inso anrab uilib cumactib dichoissin inim ettalam arailiu isarnaib grádib nemdib tantum et nibo decming rombed imthanad hisuidib combad uáisliu cachgrád alailiu ut est in gradibus terrenís
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. dobeir inso anrab uilib cumactib dichoissin inim ettalam arailiu isarnaib grádib nemdib tantum et nibo decming rombed imthanad hisuidib combad uáisliu cachgrád alailiu ut est in gradibus terrenís
footnotes: c: 1 Pet. iii. 22. For arailiu ‘aliter’ cf. GC.2 609–610, alailiu chruth Ml. 98d 11, Sarauw
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he puts this for all the powers which exist in heaven and earth. Otherwisec, it is for (the) heavenly ranks only; and it were not impossible (to suppose) that there might be alternation in these, so that one rank should be nobler than another, ut etc.

glosses.latin: Supra omnem principatum et potestatem et uirtutem et dominationem, super omne nomen quod nominatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. over every name that is named.

glosses.latin: ipsum dedit caput supra omnem aeclesiam, quae est corpus ipsius et plenitudo eius qui omnia in omnibus adimplet.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]sancti et iusti[/GLat] ithé aschorp doso[Con]m[/Con] [GLat]christus[/GLat] aschenn ind nóib aschorp
glosses.glossText: .i. sancti et iusti ithé aschorp dosom christus aschenn ind nóib aschorp
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sancti et iusti ithé aschorp dosom christus aschenn ind nóib aschorp
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. sancti et iusti, they are a body to Him: (it is) Christus who is the head, the saints who are the body.

glosses.latin: ipsum dedit caput supra omnem aeclesiam, quae est corpus ipsius et plenitudo eius qui omnia in omnibus adimplet.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nítat ildáni do óenfiur [GLat]et[/GLat] ní óen dán dosochuidi
glosses.glossText: .i. nítat ildáni do óenfiur et ní óen dán dosochuidi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nítat ildáni do óenfiur et ní óen dán dosochuidi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not many gifts to one man, and it is not one gift to a multitude.

glosses.latin: Et uos, cum essetis mortui delictis et peccatis uestris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye deserved it not.

glosses.latin: spiritus qui nunc operatur in filios defidentiae.
glosses.glossFullTags: amirisse [vel]ɫ.[/vel] deirchóintea derochóinet anícc trechesad cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: amirisse ɫ. deirchóintea derochóinet anícc trechesad crist
glosses.glossFNs: amirisse ɫ. deirchóintea derochóinet anícc trechesad crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of unfaith, or of the despair wherewith they despair of their salvation through Christ’s Passion.

glosses.latin: spiritus qui nunc operatur in filios defidentiae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] gnís t[Con]ra[/Con] cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]in iustis ut paulus dicit qui operatur in nobís[/GLat][b] issamlid da[Con]no[/Con] gniith demun [GLat]in filiís defidentiae[/GLat] maic inso t[Con]ra[/Con] ógním [GLat]et non filii natura[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal gnís tra crist in iustis ut paulus dicit qui operatur in nobís issamlid dano gniith demun in filiís defidentiae maic inso tra ógním et non filii natura
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal gnís tra crist in iustis ut paulus dicit qui operatur in nobísb issamlid dano gniith demun in filiís defidentiae maic inso tra ógním et non filii natura
footnotes: b: Phil. ii. 13, where the Vulgate has uobís
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as Christ, then, worketh in iustis etc., thus, too worketh the Devil in filiis diffidentiae: sons are these, then, by deed, et non filii natura.

glosses.latin: conuersati sumus in desiderís carnis nostrae, facientes uoluntates carnis et cogitationum; et eramus natura filii irae, sicut et caeteri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. our freedom has not brought us to good.

glosses.latin: conuersati sumus in desiderís carnis nostrae, facientes uoluntates carnis et cogitationum; et eramus natura filii irae, sicut et caeteri.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni ó aicniud nacétne tuisten act is oaicniud pectho doforchosalsa[Con]m[/Con] ó adam
glosses.glossText: .i. ni ó aicniud nacétne tuisten act is oaicniud pectho doforchosalsam ó adam
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni ó aicniud nacétne tuisten act is oaicniud pectho doforchosalsam ó adam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not from the nature of (our) original creation, but it is from (our) sinful nature that we have transgressed since Adam.

glosses.latin: Misertus est nostri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he has pitied our being under (the) yoke of sin.

glosses.latin: conuiuificauit nos [in] Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as Christ has been raised from the dead.

glosses.latin: consedere fecit in coelestibus in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is in Christ we shall be after going yonder.

glosses.latin: Ut ostenderet in saeculís superuenientibus abundantes diuitias gratiae suae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is His grace that has saved us, et non merita.

glosses.latin: in operibus bonis quae praeparauit Deus ut in illis ambulemus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] itrédiu [ie].i.[/ie] rosp[Con]ri[/Con]dach roscomal[Con]nastar[/Con] rosdánigestar dún codos gnem[c]
glosses.glossText: .i. itrédiu .i. rospridach roscomalnastar rosdánigestar dún codos gnem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. itrédiu .i. rospridach roscomalnastar rosdánigestar dún codos gnem<sup>c</sup>
footnotes: c: The third down-stroke of the m has a tail, as in dom, 21c 9; but there is no final i
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in three things, to wit, He has preached them, He has fulfilled them, He has granted them to us that we may do them.

glosses.latin: circumcisio in carne, manu facta.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Israelitish.

glosses.latin: circumcisio in carne, manu facta.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niimdibe dualche robói lasuidib act is imdibe colno
glosses.glossText: .i. niimdibe dualche robói lasuidib act is imdibe colno
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niimdibe dualche robói lasuidib act is imdibe colno
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not a circumcision of vices that had been with them, but it is a circumcision of flesh.

glosses.latin: Quia eratis ... sine Christo ... et hospites testamentorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was not folk of (the) household.

glosses.latin: Quia eratis ... sine Christo ... et hospites testamentorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the Law and of the Prophets.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem in Christo Iesu, nos, qui aliquando eratis longe, facti estis prope in sanguine Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nidad óegid na æchtrinn in fechtso
glosses.glossText: .i. nidad óegid na æchtrinn in fechtso
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nidad óegid na æchtrinn in fechtso
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are not guests nor outsiders now.

glosses.latin: Ipse enim est pax nostra; qui fecit utraque unum, et medium parietem machiriae soluens, inimicitias in carne sua;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conascrad di[Con]diu[/Con] iártíchte cr[Con]ist[/Con] in[GLat]maceries[/GLat] robói et[Con]er[/Con] dia [GLat]et[/GLat] duine [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]peccatum et[/GLat] robói eter corpu [GLat]et[/GLat] anmana
glosses.glossText: .i. conascrad didiu iártíchte crist inmaceries robói eter dia et duine .i. peccatum et robói eter corpu et anmana
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conascrad didiu iártíchte crist inmaceries robói eter dia et duine .i. peccatum et robói eter corpu et anmana
footnotes: b: conascrad = con-ad-scarad, where the ad is perfective
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so then, after Christ’s coming the maceries, which had been between God and man, i.e. peccatum, and had been between bodies and souls, has been broken downb.

glosses.latin: Ipse enim est pax nostra; qui fecit utraque unum, et medium parietem machiriae soluens, inimicitias in carne sua;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so long as He had been in carne.

glosses.latin: Legem mandatorum decretis euacuans.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. superstitions of (the) Law.

glosses.latin: Et reconciliet ambos in uno corpore.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through bestowal of the gifts of the Spirit on every one.

glosses.latin: Quoniam per ipsum habemus accessum ambo in uno Spiritu ad Patrem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (the) Spirit has been given to the whole of us to unite us.

glosses.latin: estis ciues sanctorum, et domistici Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are folk of (the) household now.

glosses.latin: Superaedificati super fundamentum apostolorum et profetarum, in ipso summo angulari lapide, Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] apstil didiu cetathuidchetar issacumtach [GLat]et[/GLat]fáithi sissi iaru[Con]m[/Con] cr[Con]ist[/Con] di[Con]diu[/Con] issí inchathir indnóib ata ellachti hicr[Con]ist[/Con] ithé [GLat]ciues[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. apstil didiu cetathuidchetar issacumtach etfáithi sissi iarum crist didiu issí inchathir indnóib ata ellachti hicrist ithé ciues
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. apstil didiu cetathuidchetar issacumtach etfáithi sissi iarum crist didiu issí inchathir indnóib ata ellachti hicrist ithé ciues
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the apostles, then, first have come into the building, and the prophets; ye afterwards. Christ, then, is the city: the saints who are united in Christ they are the citizens.

glosses.latin: Superaedificati super fundamentum apostolorum et profetarum, in ipso summo angulari lapide, Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] anaslie uilnech and ísu cr[Con]ist[/Con] [ie].i.[/ie] congaibther tóib [GLat]et[/GLat] airchinn and [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. anaslie uilnech and ísu crist .i. congaibther tóib et airchinn and rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. anaslie uilnech and ísu crist .i. congaibther tóib et airchinn and rl.
footnotes: c: cf. Ml. 131c 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when Jesus Christ is the corner-stone therein, that is, side and front are held together in Him<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: In quo omnis aedificatio constructa crescit in templum sanctum Domino.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] comthinól innanóib asberr te[Con]m[/Con]pul doib hóre atreba cr[Con]ist[/Con] indib
glosses.glossText: .i. comthinól innanóib asberr tempul doib hóre atreba crist indib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. comthinól innanóib asberr tempul doib hóre atreba crist indib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the congregation of the saints, they are called ‘a temple,’ since Christ dwelleth in them.

glosses.latin: In quo omnis aedificatio constructa crescit in templum sanctum Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that God may dwell therein.

glosses.latin: In quo et uos aedificamini in habitaculum Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are a dwelling for God now.

glosses.latin: uinctus sum Christi Iesu, pro uobis gentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: hóre nopridchim dúibsi ished dathar dom
glosses.glossText: hóre nopridchim dúibsi ished dathar dom
glosses.glossFNs: hóre nopridchim dúibsi ished dathar dom
footnotes: d: dathar, also in 28d 4, is pres. indic. pass. sg. 3 of the verb subst. tá (cf. the compound attáthar), the t being ‘eclipsed’ by the n of the relative: cf. Wb. 5b 31
glosses.glossTrans: because I preach to you, therefore am I in evil plight<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Prout potestis legentes intellegere prudentiam meam, in misterio Christi,
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Prout potestis legentes intellegere prudentiam meam, in misterio Christi,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in such wise that ye may understand it.

glosses.latin: Prout potestis legentes intellegere prudentiam meam, in misterio Christi,
glosses.glossFullTags: [vel]ɫ.[/vel] cid beicc daucbaid si a[GLat]prudentia mea[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: ɫ. cid beicc daucbaid si aprudentia mea
glosses.glossFNs: ɫ. cid beicc daucbaid si aprudentia mea
footnotes: e: cf. is beicc Wb. 8d 21
glosses.glossTrans: or though it be of little worthe, ye will understand it, (i.e.) the prudentia mea.

glosses.latin: Prout potestis legentes intellegere prudentiam meam, in misterio Christi,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in teaching (the) Gospel Christi.

glosses.latin: reuelatum est sanctis apostolis eius et profetís;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to teachers.

glosses.latin: Gentes esse coheredes, et concorporales, et conparticipes promisionis eins, in Christo Iesu per euangelium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is what has been manifested to them.

glosses.latin: Gentes esse coheredes, et concorporales, et conparticipes promisionis eins, in Christo Iesu per euangelium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. united into Christ’s Body.

glosses.latin: Gentes esse coheredes, et concorporales, et conparticipes promisionis eins, in Christo Iesu per euangelium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]misteriorum[/GLat] hóre adiellachti[c] icorp cr[Con]ist[/Con] robiasi[d] indindocbál doratad dosuidiu
glosses.glossText: .i. misteriorum hóre adiellachti icorp crist robiasi indindocbál doratad dosuidiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. misteriorum hóre adiellachtic icorp crist robiasid indindocbál doratad dosuidiu
footnotes: c: leg. adibellachti, corr. Zimmer, W. S., but cf. Trans. Philol. Soc. 1899-1901 p. 63, J. S.
d: = robbiasi
glosses.glossTrans: since ye are united into Christ’s Body, ye shall have the glory which has been given to Him.

glosses.latin: Gentes esse coheredes, et concorporales, et conparticipes promisionis eins, in Christo Iesu per euangelium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through fulfilling the gospel.

glosses.latin: Cuius factus sum ego minister, secundum donum gratiae Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is teaching (the) Gospel I am.

glosses.latin: Cuius factus sum ego minister, secundum donum gratiae Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is God’s grace that has caused it to me, not my merit.

glosses.latin: Et inluminare omnes, quae sit dispensatio sacramenti absconditi a seculís, in Deo.
footnotes: e: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they might understand it.

glosses.latin: Et inluminare omnes, quae sit dispensatio sacramenti absconditi a seculís, in Deo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rún ícce incheneli dóine [GLat]et[/GLat] dánigthea inspirito nóib doib ropoinfolgithe irrúnaib [GLat]diuinitatis et[/GLat] ní fitir cid muntar nime ↄidrofoilsigsetar apstil doib [ie].i.[/ie] dochretmechaib [GLat]noui tes[Con]tamenti[/Con] et[/GLat] domuntir nime
glosses.glossText: .i. rún ícce incheneli dóine et dánigthea inspirito nóib doib ropoinfolgithe irrúnaib diuinitatis et ní fitir cid muntar nime ↄidrofoilsigsetar apstil doib .i. dochretmechaib noui testamenti et domuntir nime
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rún ícce incheneli dóine et dánigthea inspirito nóib doib ropoinfolgithe irrúnaib diuinitatis et ní fitir cid muntar nime ↄidrofoilsigsetar apstil doib .i. dochretmechaib noui testamenti et domuntir nime
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the mystery of the salvation of the race of men and of the dispensation of the Holy Spirit to them, which had been hidden in the mysteries Diuinitatis; and not even heaven’s household knew it until the apostles had manifested it to them, that is, to the believers Noui Testamenti, and to heaven’s household.

glosses.latin: Et inluminare omnes, quae sit dispensatio sacramenti absconditi a seculís, in Deo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the Godhead.

glosses.latin: Ut innotescat principatibus et potestatibus in caelestibus per æclesiam multiformis sapientiae Deí.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg. sup.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] tuicsom inda nainmso [GLat]tantum pro omnibus gradibus caelestibus[/GLat] arnietetár[f] muntar nime [GLat]mist[Con]er[/Con]ia incarnationis donec reuelata sunt per apostolos ut dictum est quis est iste rex gloriae[/GLat][g] [GLat]Aliter[/GLat] is [GLat]pro omnibus gradibus aeclesiae noui testamenti quibus apos[Con]toli[/Con] praedicauerunt[/GLat] ataat sidi
glosses.glossText: [in marg. sup.] .i. tuicsom inda nainmso tantum pro omnibus gradibus caelestibus arnietetár muntar nime misteria incarnationis donec reuelata sunt per apostolos ut dictum est quis est iste rex gloriae Aliter is pro omnibus gradibus aeclesiae noui testamenti quibus apostoli praedicauerunt ataat sidi
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg. sup.] .i. tuicsom inda nainmso tantum pro omnibus gradibus caelestibus arnietetárf muntar nime misteria incarnationis donec reuelata sunt per apostolos ut dictum est quis est iste rex gloriaeg Aliter is pro omnibus gradibus aeclesiae noui testamenti quibus apostoli praedicauerunt ataat sidi
footnotes: f: arnifitetar, Zimmer. The word is certainly obscure: cf. Pedersen, KZ. xxxv. 359
g: Ps. xxiv. 8
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he has put these two names tantum etc. for heaven’s household knew it not (i.e.) mysteria Incarnationis donec etc. Aliter it is pro omnibus gradibus etc., that these are.

glosses.latin: Ut innotescat principatibus et potestatibus in caelestibus per æclesiam multiformis sapientiae Deí.
glosses.glossText: .i. acomairbert biuth ut nostra conuersatio rl. ɫ. in donís caelestibus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. acomairbert biuth ut nostra conuersatioh rl. ɫ. in donís caelestibus
footnotes: h: Phil. iii. 20
glosses.glossTrans: that is, their way of life.

glosses.latin: Secundum praefinitionem seculorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is from long ago He has called.

glosses.latin: Propter quod quesso ne deficatis in tribulationibus meís pro uobís, quae est gloria uestra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nibadimicthese libsi cia beo hifochidib arn[GLat]gloria[/GLat][i] duibsi ón
glosses.glossText: .i. nibadimicthese libsi cia beo hifochidib arngloria duibsi ón
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nibadimicthese libsi cia beo hifochidib arngloriai duibsi ón
footnotes: i: leg. arisgloria which is translated
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I should not be despised by you though I be in sufferings: for this is gloria to you.

glosses.latin: Ex quo omnis paternitas in caelís et in terra nominatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cachdúil dianep[Con]err[/Con] ainm nathar inim [GLat]et[/GLat] itala[Con]m[/Con] isóndathir dó
glosses.glossText: .i. cachdúil dianeperr ainm nathar inim et italam isóndathir dó
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cachdúil dianeperr ainm nathar inim et italam isóndathir dó
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every creature which is called by the name of father, in heaven and on earth, it is from the Father.

glosses.latin: Ut det uobis . . uirtute roborari per Spiritum eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that the form of the Spirit may be on you.

glosses.latin: in caritate radicati et fundati.
glosses.glossText: .i. rob clandad et robfothiged dosunt [in marg.] clantai
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rob clandad et robfothiged dosunt [in marg.] clantaia
footnotes: a: MS. clan a prima manu: clantai for clandtai
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye have been planted and ye have been founded for this: [in marg.] planted.

glosses.latin: Ut possitis conprehendere cum omnibus sanctis, quae sit latitudo, et longitudo, et sublimitas, et profundum.
footnotes: b: MS. am
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as they understand it.

glosses.latin: Ut possitis conprehendere cum omnibus sanctis, quae sit latitudo, et longitudo, et sublimitas, et profundum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut possitis conprehendere cum omnibus sanctis, quae sit latitudo, et longitudo, et sublimitas, et profundum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut possitis conprehendere cum omnibus sanctis, quae sit latitudo, et longitudo, et sublimitas, et profundum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut possitis conprehendere cum omnibus sanctis, quae sit latitudo, et longitudo, et sublimitas, et profundum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] irrúnaib [GLat]diuinitatis[/GLat] acethardeso [GLat]et in cruce christi[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]quattuor uirtutes anime.[/GLat] [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]scientiae incarnationis christi uel diuinitatis eius. dextera christi saluauit sinistram mundi laeua eius saluauit dexteram partem capud orientem redemit plante occidentem[/GLat][c]
glosses.glossText: .i. irrúnaib diuinitatis acethardeso et in cruce christi ɫ. quattuor uirtutes anime. [in marg.] .i. scientiae incarnationis christi uel diuinitatis eius. dextera christi saluauit sinistram mundi laeua eius saluauit dexteram partem capud orientem redemit plante occidentem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. irrúnaib diuinitatis acethardeso et in cruce christi ɫ. quattuor uirtutes anime. [in marg.] .i. scientiae incarnationis christi uel diuinitatis eius. dextera christi saluauit sinistram mundi laeua eius saluauit dexteram partem capud orientem redemit plante occidentemc
footnotes: c: cf. Tur. 138–142, supra p. 494. Lebar Brecc 88, marg. inf. and 166b 52, and the Homilies of the Anglo-Saxon Church, ed. Thorpe II. 256
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in mysteries Divinitatis (is) this tetrad, et etc.

glosses.latin: Ei autem, qui potens est omnia facere superabundanter, quam petimus aut intellegimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He does it more than we ask it.

glosses.latin: Ei autem, qui potens est omnia facere superabundanter, quam petimus aut intellegimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even what we do not pray for.

glosses.latin: Obsecro itaque uos, ego uinctus in Domino, ut digne ambuletis uocatione qua uocati estis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] oadcuaid ruín ícce incheneli dóine [GLat]et[/GLat] andorigeni dia airriu demaid asb[Con]er[/Con] iaru[Con]m[/Con] da[Con]no[/Con] arandathidisom dimaith
glosses.glossText: .i. oadcuaid ruín ícce incheneli dóine et andorigeni dia airriu demaid asber iarum dano arandathidisom dimaith
glosses.glossFNs: .i. oadcuaid ruín ícce incheneli dóine et andorigeni dia airriu demaid asber iarum dano arandathidisom dimaith
footnotes: f: arandathidisom (rectius arindaithitissom) seems for aran-d-ath-ḟitis-som; where athḟitis is the past subj. of aithfenim, cf. p. 627 note g, the verb of which aithe ‘remuneratio’ is the infinitive. Zeuss and Zimmer have arandath disom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when he has declared the mystery of the salvation of the race of men, and what of good God had done for them, he then says also that they should requite it<sup>f</sup> with good.

glosses.latin: subportantes inuicem in caritate.
footnotes: g: Here contra = Ir. fri
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. patience to every one contrag alium.

glosses.latin: Unus Dominus, una fides, unum babtisma.
footnotes: h: i.e. though in baptism the immersion is triple: see infra at Coloss. ii. 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though the dipping is a threeness<sup>h</sup>.

glosses.latin: Unicuique autem nostrum data est gratia secundum mensuram donationis Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Unicuique autem nostrum data est gratia secundum mensuram donationis Christi.
footnotes: d: The words and letters in parentheses are taken from GC.2 787, l. 11. They are now illegible in the MS.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as seemed to God of right measure for every one.

glosses.latin: Propter quod dicit . . dedit dona hominibus.
footnotes: i: i.e. in saying ‘secundum mensuram donationis Christi,’ St Faul has this passage in view. See Sarauw, Irske Studier, p. 81
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is what he aims at<sup>i</sup>.

glosses.latin: Quod autem ascendit, quid est, nisi quia et discendit primum in inferiores partes terrae?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ascendit should be said of him.

glosses.latin: Quod autem ascendit, quid est, nisi quia et discendit primum in inferiores partes terrae?
footnotes: e: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: even.

glosses.latin: Quod autem ascendit, quid est, nisi quia et discendit primum in inferiores partes terrae?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore ascendit is said of him.

glosses.latin: et qui ascendit, super omnes caelos.
footnotes: c: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: it is even he.

glosses.latin: et qui ascendit, super omnes caelos.
footnotes: g: ‘for the many spaces’ J. S. na ree fil a terra usque ad .xii. signa, Cr. 18c
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. over the many spaces<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: ipse dedit . . alios . . doctores.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. soulfriends.

glosses.latin: Ad consummationem sanctorum in opus ministerii, in aedificationem corporis Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dofoirbthigud [ie].i.[/ie] corropfoirbthe cách [GLat]in op[Con]er[/Con]ibus minist[Con]er[/Con]ii æclesiae[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. dofoirbthigud .i. corropfoirbthe cách in operibus ministerii æclesiae
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dofoirbthigud .i. corropfoirbthe cách in operibus ministerii æclesiae
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to make perfect, i.e. so that every one may be perfect in operibus etc.

glosses.latin: Ad consummationem sanctorum in opus ministerii, in aedificationem corporis Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished dotheít de treilar nandáne inilur nap[Con]er[/Con]san
glosses.glossText: .i. ished dotheít de treilar nandáne inilur napersan
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished dotheít de treilar nandáne inilur napersan
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that comes therefrom through the multitude of the gifts in the multitude of the persons.

glosses.latin: Donec occurramus omnes in unitatem fidei, et agnationem filii Dei, in uirum perfectum, in mensuram aetatis plenitudinis Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Donec occurramus omnes in unitatem fidei, et agnationem filii Dei, in uirum perfectum, in mensuram aetatis plenitudinis Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may do what He has done.

glosses.latin: Donec occurramus omnes in unitatem fidei, et agnationem filii Dei, in uirum perfectum, in mensuram aetatis plenitudinis Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] óis foirbthe arnialind inball nádchometig donchorp
glosses.glossText: .i. óis foirbthe arnialind inball nádchometig donchorp
glosses.glossFNs: .i. óis foirbthe arnialind inball nádchometig donchorp
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. perfect folk; for not pleasant is the member that is not indulgent to the body.

glosses.latin: paruuli fluctuantes, et circumferamur omni uento doctrinae ... in astutia ad circumuentionem erroris.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: paruuli fluctuantes, et circumferamur omni uento doctrinae ... in astutia ad circumuentionem erroris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from blasts pseudoapostolorum.

glosses.latin: paruuli fluctuantes, et circumferamur omni uento doctrinae ... in astutia ad circumuentionem erroris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from every blast.

glosses.latin: paruuli fluctuantes, et circumferamur omni uento doctrinae ... in astutia ad circumuentionem erroris.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]remedium[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] isamre leu cách icomrorcuin [GLat]ut dicant[/GLat] niansu dúnni oldaas dochách
glosses.glossText: .i. remedium .i. isamre leu cách icomrorcuin ut dicant niansu dúnni oldaas dochách
glosses.glossFNs: .i. remedium .i. isamre leu cách icomrorcuin ut dicant niansu dúnni oldaas dochách
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they marvel that every one (should be) in error, ut dicant ‘not harder to us than to others.’

glosses.latin: caput Christus;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: ex quo totum corpus conpactum ... secundum operationem in mensuram uniuscuiusque membri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is proper for the members to grow from the head.

glosses.latin: ex quo totum corpus conpactum ... secundum operationem in mensuram uniuscuiusque membri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of every member to another.

glosses.latin: ex quo totum corpus conpactum ... secundum operationem in mensuram uniuscuiusque membri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. gratiae which has been given to every one.

glosses.latin: dico, et testificor in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I testify, that is, I pray.

glosses.latin: ignorantiam quae est in illis, propter caecitiam cordis ipsorum.
footnotes: d: MS. ÷
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is Est indeed.

glosses.latin: disperantes semet ipsos tradiderunt inpudicitiae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their salvation.

glosses.latin: Si tamen illum audistis, ... sicut est ueritas in Iesu.
footnotes: e: The infixed pronoun is anticipatory of the subject of the dependent clause, cf. Ml. 93d 14, Sg. 197a 2, 300b 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. although ye have heard that it is He.

glosses.latin: Si tamen illum audistis, ... sicut est ueritas in Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] badífiriáinsi[f] hóre adibellachti [GLat]in christo[/GLat] am[Con]al[/Con] asfiríanso[Con]m[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. badífiriáinsi hóre adibellachti in christo amal asfiríansom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. badífiriáinsif hóre adibellachti in christo amal asfiríansom
footnotes: f: leg. bad fíriáinsi; or perhaps, adib firiáinsi ‘ye are righteous’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye righteous, because ye are united in Christo, as He is righteous.

glosses.latin: Deponere uos ... ueterem hominem, qui corrumpitur secundum desideria erroris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the mass of the old sins.

glosses.latin: Deponere uos ... ueterem hominem, qui corrumpitur secundum desideria erroris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because ye indulge them.

glosses.latin: induite nouum hominem, qui secundum Deum creatus est in iustitia et sanctitate ueritatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the mass of the virtues.

glosses.latin: induite nouum hominem, qui secundum Deum creatus est in iustitia et sanctitate ueritatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. per Spiritum Sanctum this man is spiritual.

glosses.latin: induite nouum hominem, qui secundum Deum creatus est in iustitia et sanctitate ueritatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is his raiment. i.e. because ye are new men.

glosses.latin: Propter quod deponentes mendacium, loquemini ueritatem unusquisque cum proximo suo, quoniam sumus inuicem membra.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Propter quod deponentes mendacium, loquemini ueritatem unusquisque cum proximo suo, quoniam sumus inuicem membra.
footnotes: d: reading nach ib tascrad
glosses.glossTrans: .... not cast you down<sup>d</sup> ... because ye are members.

glosses.latin: Irascemini, et nolite peccare; sol non occidat super iracondiam uestram.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. against your sins, that they continue not with you.

glosses.latin: Irascemini, et nolite peccare; sol non occidat super iracondiam uestram.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]alit[Con]er[/Con][/GLat] is hed iaru[Con]m[/Con] torad forferce buid cenpeccad[b]
glosses.glossText: .i. aliter is hed iarum torad forferce buid cenpeccad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aliter is hed iarum torad forferce buid cenpeccadb
footnotes: b: Zeuss read this gloss (now illegible) as aliter ished iarum torad forferce bad cenpeccad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. aliter, this, then, is the fruit of your anger, to be without sin.

glosses.latin: Irascemini, et nolite peccare; sol non occidat super iracondiam uestram.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Christus, for he abides not in a vessel of wrath.

glosses.latin: Nolite locum dare diabulo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. his coming into the heart in place of God.

glosses.latin: Qui furabatur iam non furetur; magis autem laboret, operando manibus [suis] quod bonum est.
glosses.glossText: .i. nagatad dia nairi esé á deo ɫ. sempliciter
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nagatad dia nairi eséc á deo ɫ. sempliciter
footnotes: c: For es ‘and,’ see GC.2 961. Otherwise Pedersen, Aspirationen 95
e: cf. oc gait a bíd aire ar écin, LU. 85b 6, mad ro chindis t’ ógi do Dia nit getsa aire, LB. 63b 27, 28, na gat neam foirn, ol na caillecha, Fél. Oeng. p. xxxiv
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him (the Devil) not steal God from hime (the sinner) and him a Deo.

glosses.latin: Qui furabatur iam non furetur; magis autem laboret, operando manibus [suis] quod bonum est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] madudéll ní taibred ní taraéssi dobochtaib [GLat]de labore suo[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. madudéll ní taibred ní taraéssi dobochtaib de labore suo
glosses.glossFNs: .i. madudéll ní taibred ní taraéssi dobochtaib de labore suo
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if he has stolen aught, let him give something in lieu thereof to the poor de labore suo.

glosses.latin: nolite contristare Spiritum sanctum Dei, in quo signati estis in diem redemptionis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ar am[Con]al[/Con] forcomnucuir [GLat]homo ad imaginem dei[/GLat] itossug [GLat]síc[/GLat] forco[Con]m[/Con]nucuir do deilb spir[Res]to[/Res] infechtso
glosses.glossText: .i. ar amal forcomnucuir homo ad imaginem dei itossug síc forcomnucuir do deilb spir(to) infechtso
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ar amal forcomnucuir homo ad imaginem dei itossug síc forcomnucuir do deilb spir(to) infechtso
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for as homo has been made ad imaginem Dei originally, sic he has now been made in the image of the Spirit.

glosses.latin: donantes inuicem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what each may commit against another.

glosses.latin: Estote ergo emitatores Dei, sicut filii carissimi,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since ye are members of Christ, and ye are a body to Him.

glosses.latin: Et ambulate in dilectione Dei, sicut et Christus dilexit nos,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mór intserc condechuith [GLat]in cruc[Con]em[/Con] pro nobís ut d[Con]ici[/Con]t tradidit[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. mór intserc condechuith in crucem pro nobís ut dicit tradidit rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mór intserc condechuith in crucem pro nobís ut dicit tradidit rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. great (was) the love in that He went in Crucem etc.

glosses.latin: et tradidit semetipsum pro nobis oblationem et hostiam Deo in odorem suauitatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a drink-offering.

glosses.latin: et tradidit semetipsum pro nobis oblationem et hostiam Deo in odorem suauitatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rolín inbith nuile [GLat]et caelum[/GLat] bolad inna idbairtesin
glosses.glossText: .i. rolín inbith nuile et caelum bolad inna idbairtesin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rolín inbith nuile et caelum bolad inna idbairtesin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the odour of that offering has filled the whole world et caelum.

glosses.latin: omnis inmunditia, aut auaritia, nec nominetur in uobís, sicut decet sanctos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it not be only that it is not (but let it not even be named).

glosses.latin: omnis inmunditia, aut auaritia, nec nominetur in uobís, sicut decet sanctos.
