glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]cremina non cogitare[/GLat] iscomarde óisa foirbthi insin
glosses.glossText: .i. cremina non cogitare iscomarde óisa foirbthi insin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cremina non cogitare iscomarde óisa foirbthi insin
glosses.glossTrans: that is a sign of the perfect folk.

glosses.latin: Aut turpitudo, aut stultiloquium, aut scurilitas, quae ad rem non pertenet.
footnotes: c: a prima manu. Something seems lost at the end; the i may be the left hand stroke of m. Read drochgním? Zimmer proposes drochgne, but cf. Thurneysen, Celt. Zeitschr. III. 50
glosses.glossTrans: filthiness(?).

glosses.latin: Aut turpitudo, aut stultiloquium, aut scurilitas, quae ad rem non pertenet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. those are not ... of perfect folk.

glosses.latin: Aut turpitudo, aut stultiloquium, aut scurilitas, quae ad rem non pertenet.
footnotes: d: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Aut turpitudo, aut stultiloquium, aut scurilitas, quae ad rem non pertenet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to profit.

glosses.latin: omnis fornicator, aut inmundus, aut auarus, quod est idolorum seruitus, non habet hereditatem in regno Christi et Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every kind of lust.

glosses.latin: omnis fornicator, aut inmundus, aut auarus, quod est idolorum seruitus, non habet hereditatem in regno Christi et Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: omnis fornicator, aut inmundus, aut auarus, quod est idolorum seruitus, non habet hereditatem in regno Christi et Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arméit inpectho [GLat]et[/GLat] ar chosmili infognama dogníther doib
glosses.glossText: .i. arméit inpectho et ar chosmili infognama dogníther doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arméit inpectho et ar chosmili infognama dogníther doib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because of the greatness of the sin and the similarity of the service which is done to them (idols).

glosses.latin: omnis fornicator, aut inmundus, aut auarus, quod est idolorum seruitus, non habet hereditatem in regno Christi et Dei.
footnotes: e: leg. sechis ‘that is’ as a gloss on et? cf. Wb. 20d 8, J. S. In G. C.2 1006 this sech is explained as = saich
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that (is) ....

glosses.latin: Nemo uos seducat inanibus uerbís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciasbera nech ropia nem ciadugneid narétusa nipafír
glosses.glossText: .i. ciasbera nech ropia nem ciadugneid narétusa nipafír
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciasbera nech ropia nem ciadugneid narétusa nipafír
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though any one say ye shall have heaven though ye do these things, it will not be true.

glosses.latin: Probantes quid sit bene placitum Deo;
glosses.glossTrans: when ye prove.

glosses.latin: Probantes quid sit bene placitum Deo;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: nolite commonicare operibus infructuossís tenebrarum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nabith icobadlus doib aratá torad lagnímu soilse [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]praemia aeterna[/GLat] nifil im[Con]murgu[/Con] [Con]acht[/Con] [GLat]infructuosa[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nabith icobadlus doib aratá torad lagnímu soilse .i. praemia aeterna nifil immurgu acht infructuosa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nabith icobadlus doib aratá torad lagnímu soilse .i. praemia aeterna nifil immurgu acht infructuosa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye not in fellowship with them, for there is fruit with works of light, i.e. praemia aeterna. There is nought, however, save infructuosa (with works of darkness).

glosses.latin: Omnia autem quae aguntur, a lumine manifestantur, omne enim quod manifestatur, lumen est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He who has called them understands them.

glosses.latin: Omnia autem quae aguntur, a lumine manifestantur, omne enim quod manifestatur, lumen est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intí adeirrig trep[Con]re[/Con]cept do isp[Con]re[/Con]ceptóirside iarnaithirgi
glosses.glossText: .i. intí adeirrig treprecept do ispreceptóirside iarnaithirgi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intí adeirrig treprecept do ispreceptóirside iarnaithirgi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he whom he brings to repentance through teaching him, he is a teacher after repentance.

glosses.latin: Et inluminabit tibi Christus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that thou mayest be a light sicut etc.

glosses.latin: Uidete itaque, fratres, quomodo caute ambuletis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye should not walk without circumspection.

glosses.latin: nolite fieri inprudentes sed intellegentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without penitence.

glosses.latin: nolite fieri inprudentes sed intellegentes.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: nolite inæbriari uino, in quo est luxoria; sed impleamini Spiritu sancto.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. drink ye a great draught of this.

glosses.latin: Loquentes uobismet ipsís in salmís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let every one teach the other, or pray ye diligenter.

glosses.latin: Mulieres uirís suís subditae sint, sicut Domino.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arisball dicr[Con]ist[/Con] infer [GLat]et[/GLat] isball dindfiur inben
glosses.glossText: .i. arisball dicrist infer et isball dindfiur inben
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arisball dicrist infer et isball dindfiur inben
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for the husband is a member of Christ and the wife is a member of the husband.

glosses.latin: Mulieres uirís suís subditae sint, sicut Domino.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [ie].i.[/ie] isbés t[Con]ra[/Con] dosom anisiu cosc innamban [Res]ito[/Res]ssug [GLat]et[/GLat] atabairt fochumacte [Res]a[/Res]feir armbat [Res]i[/Res]rlamude indfir fochumacte dǽi combí iaru[Con]m[/Con] coscitir indfir [GLat]et[/GLat] doairbertar foréir dǽ [GLat]síc in seruís et in dominis et in filiis et in patribus facit[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. isbés tra dosom anisiu cosc innamban (ito)ssug et atabairt fochumacte (a)feir armbat (i)rlamude indfir fochumacte dǽi combí iarum coscitir indfir et doairbertar foréir dǽ síc in seruís et in dominis et in filiis et in patribus facit
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. isbés tra dosom anisiu cosc innamban (ito)ssug et atabairt fochumacte (a)feir armbat (i)rlamude indfir fochumacte dǽi combí iarum coscitir indfir et doairbertar foréir dǽ síc in seruís et in dominis et in filiis et in patribus facit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, then, is a custom of his, to correct the wives at first, and to bring them under the power of their husbands, in order that the husbands may be the readier under God’s power, so that usually afterwards the husbands are corrected and reduced under God’s will: sic etc.

glosses.latin: sicut aeclesia subiecta est Christo, ita et mulieres uirís suis in omnibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niéilnithe di[Con]diu[/Con] accomol cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]et[/GLat] naæcilso istacair arṅdip samlid dochách
glosses.glossText: .i. niéilnithe didiu accomol crist et naæcilso istacair arṅdip samlid dochách
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niéilnithe didiu accomol crist et naæcilso istacair arṅdip samlid dochách
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not defiled, then, is the junction of Christ and the Church: it is meet that it be thus to every one.

glosses.latin: Uiri, dilegite uxores uestras.
glosses.glossTrans: to the husband, however, diligere mulieres.

glosses.latin: Ita [et] uiri debent delegere uxores suas, ut corpora sua. Qui suam uxorem dilegit, sé ipsum dilegit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] ascorp do cr[Con]ist[/Con] [GLat]æclesia[/GLat] iscorp [GLat]mulier uiro[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal ascorp do crist æclesia iscorp mulier uiro
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal ascorp do crist æclesia iscorp mulier uiro
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as Ecclesia is a body to Christ, mulier is a body uiro.

glosses.latin: Ita [et] uiri debent delegere uxores suas, ut corpora sua. Qui suam uxorem dilegit, sé ipsum dilegit.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: as they are.

glosses.latin: Ita [et] uiri debent delegere uxores suas, ut corpora sua. Qui suam uxorem dilegit, sé ipsum dilegit.
footnotes: b: cf. Wb. 25a 39
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no thanks to him: (she) is his body.

glosses.latin: fouet eam, sicut et Christus æclesiam,
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: quia membra sumus corporis eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. manifest in us is that fouere.

glosses.latin: Sacramentum hoc magnum est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is fitted to Christ and to the Church.

glosses.latin: Uos singuli, unusquisque suam uxorem sicut sé ipsum diligat, uxor autem ut timiat uirum suum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for of the body is the member.

glosses.latin: Uos singuli, unusquisque suam uxorem sicut sé ipsum diligat, uxor autem ut timiat uirum suum.
glosses.glossTrans: let uir love mulier: let mulier fear uir.

glosses.latin: Filioli, obaedite parentibus uestrís in Domino, hoc enim iustum est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄsechtar[c] inmuntar uile arnaroib naeícmailt inellug inna æcaillse
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄsechtar inmuntar uile arnaroib naeícmailt inellug inna æcaillse
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄsechtar<sup>c</sup> inmuntar uile arnaroib naeícmailt inellug inna æcaillse
footnotes: c: leg. consechthar?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the whole household is corrected, lest there be aught unquiet in the communion of the Church.

glosses.latin: Filioli, obaedite parentibus uestrís in Domino, hoc enim iustum est.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: sed edocate illos in disciplina.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Serui, obædite dominís carnalibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that domini may be the more obedient mandatis Dei.

glosses.latin: Non ad oculum seruientes, quasi hominibus placentes; sed ut serui Christi, facientes uoluntatem Dei ex animo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arisfrecṅdircside diamogaib nidernat sidi ní nadfiastar side
glosses.glossText: .i. arisfrecṅdircside diamogaib nidernat sidi ní nadfiastar side
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arisfrecṅdircside diamogaib nidernat sidi ní nadfiastar side
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since He is present with his servants, they can do nothing that He does not know.

glosses.latin: Non ad oculum seruientes, quasi hominibus placentes; sed ut serui Christi, facientes uoluntatem Dei ex animo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with desire.

glosses.latin: Cum bona uoluntate seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let the service be from will.

glosses.latin: Et uos, domini, eadem facite illís, ... scientes quia et illorum et uester Dominus est in caelís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. do not trust then in your power.

glosses.latin: Et uos, domini, eadem facite illís, ... scientes quia et illorum et uester Dominus est in caelís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. one Lord have ye.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, confortamini in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: from henceforth.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, confortamini in Domino.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in exemplo et in uirtute domini[/GLat] arcongéna dia frib
glosses.glossText: .i. in exemplo et in uirtute domini arcongéna dia frib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in exemplo et in uirtute domini arcongéna dia frib
glosses.glossTrans: for God will work together with you.

glosses.latin: Induite uos armatura Dei, ut possitis stare aduersus insidias diabuli.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: weapons.

glosses.latin: Induite uos armatura Dei, ut possitis stare aduersus insidias diabuli.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] gaibid armma dǽ foirib dochathugud fridiab[Con]ol[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. gaibid armma dǽ foirib dochathugud fridiabol
glosses.glossFNs: .i. gaibid armma dǽ foirib dochathugud fridiabol
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. take God’s arms upon you to fight against the Devil.

glosses.latin: Induite uos armatura Dei, ut possitis stare aduersus insidias diabuli.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nibécen naaill act [GLat]resistere tantum ut est resistite diab[Con]ulo[/Con] et fugiet a uobís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nibécen naaill act resistere tantum ut est resistite diabulo et fugiet a uobís
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nibécen naaill act resistere tantum ut est resistite diabulo et fugiet a uobís
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. nought else should be needful save resistere tantum.

glosses.latin: Quoniam non est nobis conluctatio aduersus carnem.
footnotes: b: cf. KZ. xxxv. 433
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that the arms of (the) flesh should be with them.

glosses.latin: Propterea accipite armatura Dei, ut possitis resistere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre ataad icath [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]eo quod non est uobís [Con]con[/Con]luctatio aduersus carnem[/GLat] bad [GLat]armatura dei[/GLat] bess lib nábat nacha arm aili
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre ataad icath ɫ. eo quod non est uobís conluctatio aduersus carnem bad armatura dei bess lib nábat nacha arm aili
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre ataad icath ɫ. eo quod non est uobís conluctatio aduersus carnem bad armatura dei bess lib nábat nacha arm aili
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since ye are in battle, vel eo etc. Let armatura Dei be with you; let it not be any other arms.

glosses.latin: Propterea accipite armatura Dei, ut possitis resistere.
footnotes: c: leg. robet?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided God’s arms be on you.

glosses.latin: State ergo succincti lumbos uestros in ueritate;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a girdle of truth round you.

glosses.latin: Et calciati pedes in praeparatione euangeli pacis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et calciati pedes in praeparatione euangeli pacis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. peace between God and man, etc.

glosses.latin: In omnibus sumentes scutum fidei, in quo possitis omnia tela nequisimi ignea exstingere.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: In omnibus sumentes scutum fidei, in quo possitis omnia tela nequisimi ignea exstingere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that you may ward off, that is, a warding off.

glosses.latin: Et galeam salutis adsumite et gladium spiritus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this will be salvation to you.

glosses.latin: Per omnem orationem et obsecrationem orantes omni tempore
footnotes: d: nunc gladium portate et semper habete, Primasius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye may obtain that sword<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: in spiritu, et in ipso uigilantes in omni instantia, et obsecratione pro omnibus sanctis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let the prayer be spiritual.

glosses.latin: in spiritu, et in ipso uigilantes in omni instantia, et obsecratione pro omnibus sanctis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in every steadfastness.

glosses.latin: in spiritu, et in ipso uigilantes in omni instantia, et obsecratione pro omnibus sanctis,
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: in continuance.

glosses.latin: in spiritu, et in ipso uigilantes in omni instantia, et obsecratione pro omnibus sanctis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye may obtain that spiritual thing.

glosses.latin: in spiritu, et in ipso uigilantes in omni instantia, et obsecratione pro omnibus sanctis,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it not be for you yourselves alone.

glosses.latin: Et pro me, ut detur mihi sermo, ad apertionem oris mei
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this I deem dearest, the grace of teaching.

glosses.latin: Et pro me, ut detur mihi sermo, ad apertionem oris mei
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the opening (of the mouth) ad praedicandum.

glosses.latin: cum fiducia, notum facere mysterium Euangelii.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without connivance.

glosses.latin: Pro quo legatione fungor in catena; ita ut in ipso audeam, prout oportet me, loqui.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for teaching it that I am (now) in chains.

glosses.latin: Pro quo legatione fungor in catena; ita ut in ipso audeam, prout oportet me, loqui.
footnotes: b: = ropridched, cf. Wb. 5a 5, 7b 12
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as it hath been preached best.

glosses.latin: Ut autem et uos sciatis quae circa me sunt, quid agam, omnia uobis nota faciet Tychicus,
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut autem et uos sciatis quae circa me sunt, quid agam, omnia uobis nota faciet Tychicus,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye may know that there are bonds upon me.

glosses.latin: Ut autem et uos sciatis quae circa me sunt, quid agam, omnia uobis nota faciet Tychicus,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whether it be protection to me or no.

glosses.latin: Quem misi ad uos in hoc ipsum, ut ... consularetur corda uestra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for this he has been sent.

glosses.latin: Quem misi ad uos in hoc ipsum, ut ... consularetur corda uestra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre cretes sochuide [GLat]deo per pr[Con]ae[/Con]dicationem meam[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre cretes sochuide deo per praedicationem meam
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre cretes sochuide deo per praedicationem meam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because a multitude believe Deo etc.

glosses.latin: Pax fratribus et caritas cum fide.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are (the) treasures of pious sons.

glosses.latin: Paulus et Timotheus ... omnibus sanctis in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: ni tuicso[Con]m[/Con] s[Con]un[/Con]t t[Con]ra[/Con] ainm nabstil arisfoirbthe incách diaroscribad [GLat]et[/GLat] ni ecen acairigud
glosses.glossText: ni tuicsom sunt tra ainm nabstil arisfoirbthe incách diaroscribad et ni ecen acairigud
glosses.glossFNs: ni tuicsom sunt tra ainm nabstil arisfoirbthe incách diaroscribad et ni ecen acairigud
glosses.glossTrans: here, then, he has not put the name of apostle, for perfect is every one to whom (this epistle) hath been written, and it is not necessary to reprove them.

glosses.latin: Paulus et Timotheus ... omnibus sanctis in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: he (was) a pupil of his.

glosses.latin: Paulus et Timotheus ... omnibus sanctis in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the unity of Christ’s Body.

glosses.latin: Semper in cunctís orationibus meis pro omnibus uobís, cum gaudio,
footnotes: d: etrantach seems = etar-antach; cf. antach (gl. otiosa, gl. quieta), Goidelica2 67, 71
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is shown that his prayer is not intermittentd and that he is faithful pro fidelibus.

glosses.latin: Semper in cunctís orationibus meis pro omnibus uobís, cum gaudio,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no one is to me dearer than another.

glosses.latin: Super commonicatione uestra in euangelio [Christi], a prima die, usque nunc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because ye fulfil and preach (the) gospel sicut ego.

glosses.latin: Super commonicatione uestra in euangelio [Christi], a prima die, usque nunc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it has been preached to you.

glosses.latin: Super commonicatione uestra in euangelio [Christi], a prima die, usque nunc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unto this day.

glosses.latin: Confidens hoc ipsum, quia is, qui coepit in uobis opus bonum, perficiet usque in diem Christi Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of this I am confident.

glosses.latin: Confidens hoc ipsum, quia is, qui coepit in uobis opus bonum, perficiet usque in diem Christi Iesu.
footnotes: b: leg. bérthi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He will bear it with Him to the end.

glosses.latin: Confidens hoc ipsum, quia is, qui coepit in uobis opus bonum, perficiet usque in diem Christi Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the separation of body and soul.

glosses.latin: Sicut est mihi iustum hoc sentire pro omnibus uobís, eo quod habeam in corde uos, ... et in defensione, et confirmatione euangilii, socios gaudii mei omnes uos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as is meet for me.

glosses.latin: Sicut est mihi iustum hoc sentire pro omnibus uobís, eo quod habeam in corde uos, ... et in defensione, et confirmatione euangilii, socios gaudii mei omnes uos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a fair opinion of you.

glosses.latin: Sicut est mihi iustum hoc sentire pro omnibus uobís, eo quod habeam in corde uos, ... et in defensione, et confirmatione euangilii, socios gaudii mei omnes uos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have a wish (to have) good testimony of you.

glosses.latin: Sicut est mihi iustum hoc sentire pro omnibus uobís, eo quod habeam in corde uos, ... et in defensione, et confirmatione euangilii, socios gaudii mei omnes uos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is why I have been in evil plight.

glosses.latin: Sicut est mihi iustum hoc sentire pro omnibus uobís, eo quod habeam in corde uos, ... et in defensione, et confirmatione euangilii, socios gaudii mei omnes uos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. fulfilling it and teaching it, this is confirming (the) gospel.

glosses.latin: Sicut est mihi iustum hoc sentire pro omnibus uobís, eo quod habeam in corde uos, ... et in defensione, et confirmatione euangilii, socios gaudii mei omnes uos esse.
glosses.glossTrans: so that ye may be joined with me.

glosses.latin: Testis enim mihi est Deus, quomodo cupiam omnes uos.
footnotes: c: mere dittography
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is God that knoweth my love for you.

glosses.latin: Et hoc oro, ut caritas uestra magis ac magis abundet in scientia, et omni sensu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this to me is dearest.

glosses.latin: Et hoc oro, ut caritas uestra magis ac magis abundet in scientia, et omni sensu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] corrop mooassamoo [GLat]et[/GLat] corrop ferrassaferr [a]donimdigid desseirc[/a] dé [GLat]et[/GLat] comnessim
glosses.glossText: .i. corrop mooassamoo et corrop ferrassaferr donimdigid desseirc dé et comnessim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. corrop mooassamoo et corrop ferrassaferr donimdigid desseirca dé et comnessim
footnotes: a: MS. donimdigidesseirc
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that more and more, and so that better and better, ye may abound in love of God and of neighbour.

glosses.latin: Et hoc oro, ut caritas uestra magis ac magis abundet in scientia, et omni sensu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in every perfect sense.

glosses.latin: Ut probetis potiora, ut sitis sinceres et sine offensa.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut probetis potiora, ut sitis sinceres et sine offensa.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. simple [i.e.] desirous to fulfil (the) Gospel.

glosses.latin: Repleti fructu iustitiae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through which is life eternal.

glosses.latin: Scire autem uos uolo, fratres, quia quae circa me sunt, magis ad profectum uenerunt euangelii.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Scire autem uos uolo, fratres, quia quae circa me sunt, magis ad profectum uenerunt euangelii.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hore amessaminse p[Con]re[/Con]cepte asmochuimriug islia de creitfess
glosses.glossText: .i. hore amessaminse precepte asmochuimriug islia de creitfess
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hore amessaminse precepte asmochuimriug islia de creitfess
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since I am fearless in teaching out of my captivity, the more will believe.

glosses.latin: Ita ut uincula mea manifesta fierent in Christo in omni praetorio, et in ceteris omnibus;
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ita ut uincula mea manifesta fierent in Christo in omni praetorio, et in ceteris omnibus;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rofess cid itaig ríg am[Con]al[/Con] rofess itaig cáich
glosses.glossText: .i. rofess cid itaig ríg amal rofess itaig cáich
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rofess cid itaig ríg amal rofess itaig cáich
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is known even in the king’s house as it is known in every one’s house.

glosses.latin: Et plures e fratribus in Domino confidentes uinculís meís, abundantius auderent sine timore uerbum Dei loqui.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] istarissiu leu p[Con]re[/Con]cept sos[Con]céli[/Con] infecht so
glosses.glossText: .i. istarissiu leu precept soscéli infecht so
glosses.glossFNs: .i. istarissiu leu precept soscéli infecht so
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. more confident are they to teach the gospel now.

glosses.latin: Et plures e fratribus in Domino confidentes uinculís meís, abundantius auderent sine timore uerbum Dei loqui.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because I preach out of my bonds.

glosses.latin: Et plures e fratribus in Domino confidentes uinculís meís, abundantius auderent sine timore uerbum Dei loqui.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] itessamnu de arrofitetar is arnach nindocbáil móir fodaimim se inso
glosses.glossText: .i. itessamnu de arrofitetar is arnach nindocbáil móir fodaimim se inso
glosses.glossFNs: .i. itessamnu de arrofitetar is arnach nindocbáil móir fodaimim se inso
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are the more fearless, for they know that it is for some great glory that I endure this.

glosses.latin: Quidam quidem [et] propter inuidiam et contensionem, quidam autem et propter bonam uoluntatem Christum praedicant;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are jealous that I preach rather than they.

glosses.latin: Quidam quidem [et] propter inuidiam et contensionem, quidam autem et propter bonam uoluntatem Christum praedicant;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are good.

glosses.latin: Quidam quidem [et] propter inuidiam et contensionem, quidam autem et propter bonam uoluntatem Christum praedicant;
footnotes: c: leg. archáinduthracht
glosses.glossTrans: for good will.

glosses.latin: Quidam ex caritate, scientes quoniam in defensionem euangelii possitus sum;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are the same as qui etc.

glosses.latin: Quidam ex caritate, scientes quoniam in defensionem euangelii possitus sum;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quidam ex caritate, scientes quoniam in defensionem euangelii possitus sum;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore I endure tribulations.

glosses.latin: Quidam autem ex contentione Christum adnuntiant non sincere, existimantes presuram se suscitare uinculís meis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]contra mé[/GLat] am[Con]al[/Con] bid ǽet limsa moort dogabál[d] darmchenn ceín rongabus icarcair
glosses.glossText: .i. contra mé amal bid ǽet limsa moort dogabál darmchenn ceín rongabus icarcair
glosses.glossFNs: .i. contra mé amal bid ǽet limsa moort dogabáld darmchenn ceín rongabus icarcair
footnotes: d: leg. dogabáil, cf. Wb. 16d 4, 26b 18, 30c 22
f: cf. ordinem alicui adimere
glosses.glossTrans: as if I were jealous that my rank<sup>f</sup> should be taken for me so long as I am in prison.

glosses.latin: Quidam autem ex contentione Christum adnuntiant non sincere, existimantes presuram se suscitare uinculís meis.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quidam autem ex contentione Christum adnuntiant non sincere, existimantes presuram se suscitare uinculís meis.
footnotes: c: leg. archáinduthracht
e: This seems to be a gloss on non sincere
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not from good will to me is it done.

glosses.latin: Quidam autem ex contentione Christum adnuntiant non sincere, existimantes presuram se suscitare uinculís meis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] combad imned foraraill do[Con]m[/Con]sa [ie].i.[/ie] mobuith icarcair [GLat]et[/GLat] moort dogabál[d]
glosses.glossText: .i. combad imned foraraill domsa .i. mobuith icarcair et moort dogabál
glosses.glossFNs: .i. combad imned foraraill domsa .i. mobuith icarcair et moort dogabáld
footnotes: d: leg. dogabáil, cf. Wb. 16d 4, 26b 18, 30c 22
f: cf. ordinem alicui adimere
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it should be trouble upon trouble to me, to wit, that I should be in prison and that my rank<sup>f</sup> should be taken.

glosses.latin: Quid enim? dum omni modo, Christus siue per occassionem, siue per ueritatem, adnuntiatur.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: whatever way.

glosses.latin: Quid enim? dum omni modo, Christus siue per occassionem, siue per ueritatem, adnuntiatur.
footnotes: b: leg. im?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whether through hatred of me, ut pseudoapostoli.

glosses.latin: Quid enim? dum omni modo, Christus siue per occassionem, siue per ueritatem, adnuntiatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni imned lim act rop cr[Con]ist[/Con] p[Con]ri[/Con]dches [GLat]et[/GLat] immerada cách
glosses.glossText: .i. ni imned lim act rop crist pridches et immerada cách
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni imned lim act rop crist pridches et immerada cách
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I deem it no tribulation provided that every one preaches and meditates on Christ.

glosses.latin: Scio enim quoniam hoc mihi prouenient in salutem, per uestram orationem, et subministrationem spiritus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]significat humiliter[/GLat] folilussa na fochidi [GLat]per uestram orationem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. significat humiliter folilussa na fochidi per uestram orationem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. significat humiliter folilussa na fochidi per uestram orationem
glosses.glossTrans: I will endure the sufferings per uestram orationem.

glosses.latin: Scio enim quoniam hoc mihi prouenient in salutem, per uestram orationem, et subministrationem spiritus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through the disposition of the Spirit.

glosses.latin: Secundum exspectationem et spem meam, ... nunc magnificabitur Christus in corpore meo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. according to the expectation wherewith I expect.

glosses.latin: Secundum exspectationem et spem meam, ... nunc magnificabitur Christus in corpore meo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through fulfilling and preaching (the) Gospel.

glosses.latin: Secundum exspectationem et spem meam, ... nunc magnificabitur Christus in corpore meo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I live, it will be to preach (the) name of Christ.

glosses.latin: Quod si uiuere in carne, hic mihi fructus operis est, et quid elegam ignoro.
glosses.glossTrans: sanctification of a multitude through me.

glosses.latin: Quod si uiuere in carne, hic mihi fructus operis est, et quid elegam ignoro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even that is profit.

glosses.latin: Quod si uiuere in carne, hic mihi fructus operis est, et quid elegam ignoro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whether it will be death or life.

glosses.latin: Coartor autem e duobus: desiderium habens desolui, et cum Christo esse, multo enim melius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which of them I shall choose.

glosses.latin: Coartor autem e duobus: desiderium habens desolui, et cum Christo esse, multo enim melius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this, in the first place, that I myself desire.

glosses.latin: Coartor autem e duobus: desiderium habens desolui, et cum Christo esse, multo enim melius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this I should prefer.

glosses.latin: Permanere autem in carne, necessarium est propter uos.
footnotes: c: gobél = O’Clery’s gobél (a sea-strait) .i. bél na fairrghe; gó, gen. góa .i. fairge O’Cl. s.v. nim. Arm. cov. W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is one of the two straits<sup>c</sup> that constrain me.

glosses.latin: Permanere autem in carne, necessarium est propter uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. need of saving you by instruction and teaching.

glosses.latin: Et hoc confidiens scio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that will be there.

glosses.latin: Tantum, digne euangelio Christi conuersamini, ut siue
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. but only.

glosses.latin: Tantum, digne euangelio Christi conuersamini, ut siue
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye may fulfil and so that ye may preach the gospel.

glosses.latin: cum uenero, et uidero uos, siue absens, audiam de uobis, quia statis in uno spiritu unianimes, conlaborantes in fide euangelii;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] imb icéin fa inaccus beosa niↄchloor act forcaínscél
glosses.glossText: .i. imb icéin fa inaccus beosa niↄchloor act forcaínscél
glosses.glossFNs: .i. imb icéin fa inaccus beosa niↄchloor act forcaínscél
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whether I be far or near, may I hear nothing but good of you!

glosses.latin: cum uenero, et uidero uos, siue absens, audiam de uobis, quia statis in uno spiritu unianimes, conlaborantes in fide euangelii;
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: cum uenero, et uidero uos, siue absens, audiam de uobis, quia statis in uno spiritu unianimes, conlaborantes in fide euangelii;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ishedón asmaith lesso[Con]m[/Con] dochluas [GLat]sicut scriptum est erat illis corpus unum et anima una[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ishedón asmaith lessom dochluas sicut scriptum est erat illis corpus unum et anima una
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishedón asmaith lessom dochluas sicut scriptum est erat illis corpus unum et anima una
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that he likes to hear sicut etc.

glosses.latin: cum uenero, et uidero uos, siue absens, audiam de uobis, quia statis in uno spiritu unianimes, conlaborantes in fide euangelii;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. both fulfilling and teaching.

glosses.latin: Et in nullo terreamini ab aduersarís, quae illis [est] causa perditionis, uobís autem salutis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. yield ye not pseudoapostolis.

glosses.latin: Et in nullo terreamini ab aduersarís, quae illis [est] causa perditionis, uobís autem salutis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it causes perdition to them.

glosses.latin: Et in nullo terreamini ab aduersarís, quae illis [est] causa perditionis, uobís autem salutis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isfochunn ícce dúibsi foditiu nan ingre[Con]m[/Con]men
glosses.glossText: .i. isfochunn ícce dúibsi foditiu nan ingremmen
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isfochunn ícce dúibsi foditiu nan ingremmen
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a cause of salvation to you is the enduring of the persecutions.

glosses.latin: Quia uobis donatum est pro Christo, non solum ut in eum credatis, sed etiam ut pro illo patiamini,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nihed améit nonchretidsi act fodaimid fochidi airi
glosses.glossText: .i. nihed améit nonchretidsi act fodaimid fochidi airi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nihed améit nonchretidsi act fodaimid fochidi airi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not only do ye believe it, but ye endure sufferings therefor.

glosses.latin: si qua ergo consolatio in Christo, si quod solacium caritatis, si qua societas spiritus, si qua uiscera misericordiae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (si qua consolatio) let it be consolation of love.

glosses.latin: si qua ergo consolatio in Christo, si quod solacium caritatis, si qua societas spiritus, si qua uiscera misericordiae.
glosses.glossTrans: (si quod solacium) let it be (caritatis)

glosses.latin: si qua ergo consolatio in Christo, si quod solacium caritatis, si qua societas spiritus, si qua uiscera misericordiae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be bowels of compassion.

glosses.latin: si qua ergo consolatio in Christo, si quod solacium caritatis, si qua societas spiritus, si qua uiscera misericordiae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [Com]in marg.[/Com] [GLat][Res]Alit[/Res]er[/GLat]...t[Con]ri[/Con]a...har[b] forsintestiminso [ie].i.[/ie] abrith frisandliged remep[Con]er[/Con]the [GLat]et[/GLat] is fripol berir am[Con]al[/Con] sodin [ie].i.[/ie] ished inso sís rochlos [GLat]et[/GLat] adchess innabésaib [GLat]et[/GLat] agnímaib. [GLat]Alit[Con]er[/Con][/GLat] saigid [c][GLat]inplete[/GLat][/c] [GLat]gaudium[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] issí mofailte inso [GLat]sí qua[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [GLat]in christo[/GLat] bad hícr[Con]ist[/Con] mabeith nachfaílte dúibsi [GLat]et[/GLat] ni frissom am[Con]al[/Con] sodin. [GLat]Aliter[/GLat] foraláim[d] dogníther [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in christo[/GLat] bad ícr[Con]ist[/Con] [etc]rl.[/etc] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] manudtectid nahuilise [GLat]inplete[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] dénid anasberar frib
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] (Alit)er...tria...har forsintestiminso .i. abrith frisandliged remeperthe et is fripol berir amal sodin .i. ished inso sís rochlos et adchess innabésaib et agnímaib. Aliter saigid inplete gaudium rl. issí mofailte inso sí qua rl. in christo bad hícrist mabeith nachfaílte dúibsi et ni frissom amal sodin. Aliter foraláim dogníther .i. in christo bad ícrist rl. ɫ. manudtectid nahuilise inplete .i. dénid anasberar frib
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] (Alit)er...tria...harb forsintestiminso .i. abrith frisandliged remeperthe et is fripol berir amal sodin .i. ished inso sís rochlos et adchess innabésaib et agnímaib. Aliter saigid inpletec gaudium rl. issí mofailte inso sí qua rl. in christo bad hícrist mabeith nachfaílte dúibsi et ni frissom amal sodin. Aliter foraláimd dogníther .i. in christo bad ícrist rl. ɫ. manudtectid nahuilise inplete .i. dénid anasberar frib
footnotes: b: leg. dobertar tri lathar?, cf. Ml. 44b 10, J. S.
c: MS. inple
d: Perhaps the MS. has frialáim
f: Phil. i. 30

g: foraláim dogníther is a technical phrase, of which the precise translation is not clear, fora láim means ‘by the side of,’ LU. 56b 8, 120a 6, 40: cf. for láim n-ainsedo Ml. 23c 21, and the phrase fochetoir dognither Ml. 96c 10 with note. This is the method of exposition which is followed in glosses 8, 9 and 10
glosses.glossTrans: Aliter ... on this text, that is, its reference to the previous dictumf, and with reference to Paul it is referred in that case, that is, this below is what was heard and seen in his morals and deeds. Aliter, it goes with implete gaudium etc.: this is my joy si qua etc.: let it be in Christ if ye have any joy, and it refers not to him (Paul) in that case. Aliterg, the construction is with the adjoining words (?), that is, in Christo let it be in Christ etc.: or if ye have all these, implete i.e. do what is said to you.

glosses.latin: Inplete gaudium meum, ut idem sapiatis, eandem caritatem habentes;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye as I am in deed and morals.

glosses.latin: Inplete gaudium meum, ut idem sapiatis, eandem caritatem habentes;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] am[Con]al[/Con] nondubcairimse carad cách uaibsi alaile
glosses.glossText: .i. amal nondubcairimse carad cách uaibsi alaile
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal nondubcairimse carad cách uaibsi alaile
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as I love you, let each of you love the other.

glosses.latin: Nihil per contentionem neque per inanem gloriam, sed in humilitate superiores sibi inuicem arbitrantes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not every one procure glory for himself.

glosses.latin: Nihil per contentionem neque per inanem gloriam, sed in humilitate superiores sibi inuicem arbitrantes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him procure it for another.

glosses.latin: Nihil per contentionem neque per inanem gloriam, sed in humilitate superiores sibi inuicem arbitrantes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bad uaísliu cách lialaile oldaas fessin
glosses.glossText: .i. bad uaísliu cách lialaile oldaas fessin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bad uaísliu cách lialaile oldaas fessin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let each esteem another better than himself.

glosses.latin: Non quae sua sunt singuli querentes, sed [ea] quae aliorum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non quae sua sunt singuli querentes, sed [ea] quae aliorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nadecad indán doradad dó fessin [Con]acht[/Con] dán ácheli
glosses.glossText: .i. nadecad indán doradad dó fessin acht dán ácheli
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nadecad indán doradad dó fessin acht dán ácheli
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him not regard the gift that has been given to himself, but the gift of his fellow.

glosses.latin: Hoc enim sentite in uobís, quod et in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni do fessin doratside indocbáil [GLat]sed patri[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ni do fessin doratside indocbáil sed patri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni do fessin doratside indocbáil sed patri
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not to Himself has He given glory, sed Patri.

glosses.latin: Qui cum in forma Dei esset.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in God’s might and majesty.

glosses.latin: . . Deus ... donauit illi nomen quod est super omne nomen.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] etarcne [GLat]quod est super omne nomen[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] indocbál [GLat]patri[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. etarcne quod est super omne nomen .i. indocbál patri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. etarcne quod est super omne nomen .i. indocbál patri
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. knowledge quod etc. i.e. glory Patri.

glosses.latin: Et omnis lingua confiteatur, quia Dominus Iesus Christus in gloria est Dei Patris.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et omnis lingua confiteatur, quia Dominus Iesus Christus in gloria est Dei Patris.
footnotes: a: recte achleith
b: cf. for the omission of an, Ml. 89d 6, 92c 5, LU. 69a 44
glosses.glossTrans: it is not easy to conceal it: most of them know it.

glosses.latin: Itaque ... non est in praesentia mei tantum, sed multo magis in absentia mea, nunc cum metu et tremore uestram salutem operamini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I prefer it.

glosses.latin: Itaque ... non est in praesentia mei tantum, sed multo magis in absentia mea, nunc cum metu et tremore uestram salutem operamini.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]omnia bona[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] ished dosaig anúas arnibu anse duibsi [GLat]deus enim[/GLat]. [c][GLat]Gregorius[/GLat][/c]: [GLat]hominis[/GLat] [d][GLat]ergo[/GLat][/d] [GLat]est per diabulum quod peccat[/GLat]: [GLat]dei uero quod potest uitare peccatum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. omnia bona .i. ished dosaig anúas arnibu anse duibsi deus enim. Gregorius: hominis ergo est per diabulum quod peccat: dei uero quod potest uitare peccatum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. omnia bona .i. ished dosaig anúas arnibu anse duibsi deus enim. Gregoriusc: hominis ergod est per diabulum quod peccat: dei uero quod potest uitare peccatum
footnotes: c: MS. g͠g
d: MS. g
g: cf. Wb. 15a 22. The words are to be taken in connexion with Deus est enim etc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this extends from aboveg, for it were not hard to you: Deus enim etc.

glosses.latin: Deus est . . qui operatur in uobis ... pro bona uoluntate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Dei, not for your merit.

glosses.latin: Omnia autem facite sine mormorationibus et hessitationibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye shall have (the) reward of your labour.

glosses.latin: Omnia autem facite sine mormorationibus et hessitationibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without doubts.

glosses.latin: Ut sitis sine querela et semplices sicut filii dei ... in medio nationis prauae et peruersae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye like the Father.

glosses.latin: Ut sitis sine querela et semplices sicut filii dei ... in medio nationis prauae et peruersae.
footnotes: h: lit. friend-foes
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is among false friends<sup>h</sup> that ye are.

glosses.latin: Uerbum uitae continentes ad gloriam meam in diem Christi, quia non in uacuum cucurri.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Uerbum uitae continentes ad gloriam meam in diem Christi, quia non in uacuum cucurri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in providing glory for me on Doomsday.

glosses.latin: Uerbum uitae continentes ad gloriam meam in diem Christi, quia non in uacuum cucurri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is manifest in you.

glosses.latin: Sed etsi immolor supra sacrificium et obsequium fidei uestrae, gaudeo;
footnotes: e: cf. Trans. Phil. Soc. 1899–1902, p. 312
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I should go to martyrdom.

glosses.latin: Sed etsi immolor supra sacrificium et obsequium fidei uestrae, gaudeo;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ississi indidbart [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]post fidem uestram a mé deo immolatum[/GLat][f]
glosses.glossText: .i. ississi indidbart .i. post fidem uestram a mé deo immolatum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ississi indidbart .i. post fidem uestram a mé deo immolatumf
footnotes: f: leg. immolatam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are the offering.

glosses.latin: Spero autem in Domino Iesu Timotheum cito me mittere ad uos, ut ego bono animo sim, cognitis hís quae circa uos sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that I may send.

glosses.latin: Spero autem in Domino Iesu Timotheum cito me mittere ad uos, ut ego bono animo sim, cognitis hís quae circa uos sunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bidmaith momenmese[a] act rocloor forcáinscéil si
glosses.glossText: .i. bidmaith momenmese act rocloor forcáinscéil si
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bidmaith momenmese<sup>a</sup> act rocloor forcáinscéil si
footnotes: a: cf. LU. 16b 16
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. my mind will be glad, provided I hear good news of you.

glosses.latin: Neminem enim habeo tam unianimem, qui sincera afectione pro uobís sollicitus sit.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Neminem enim habeo tam unianimem, qui sincera afectione pro uobís sollicitus sit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for jewels or treasures hath Timothy loved you.

glosses.latin: Omnes enim, quae sua sunt, querunt, non quae sunt Iesu Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isaindocbál fessin condieig cách act tiamthe
glosses.glossText: .i. isaindocbál fessin condieig cách act tiamthe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isaindocbál fessin condieig cách act tiamthe
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one save Timothy seeks his own glory.

glosses.latin: mecum seruiuit in euangelio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a-teaching.

glosses.latin: Necessarium autem existimaui, ... conmilitionem meum, . . et ministrum necessitatis meae mittere ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for the present.

glosses.latin: Necessarium autem existimaui, ... conmilitionem meum, . . et ministrum necessitatis meae mittere ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: in fighting against (the) Devil.

glosses.latin: Necessarium autem existimaui, ... conmilitionem meum, . . et ministrum necessitatis meae mittere ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of whatever I need.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem omnes uos desiderabat, et mestus erat propterea quod audieritis illum infirmatum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he used to love you.

glosses.latin: Quoniam quidem omnes uos desiderabat, et mestus erat propterea quod audieritis illum infirmatum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] robói so[Con]m[/Con] ingalar [GLat]et[/GLat] roposáith libsi ón ansu lesso[Con]m[/Con] im[Con]murgu[/Con] fo barmbíd si [GLat]quam dolor suus proprius[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. robói som ingalar et roposáith libsi ón ansu lessom immurgu fo barmbíd si quam dolor suus proprius
glosses.glossFNs: .i. robói som ingalar et roposáith libsi ón ansu lessom immurgu fo barmbíd si quam dolor suus proprius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he lay in sickness, and this has been a grief to you: he was, however, more troubled on account of you quam etc.

glosses.latin: Nam et infirmatus est usque ad mortem; sed Deus misertus est eius ... et mei, ne tristitiam super tristitiam haberem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. death has been near to him.

glosses.latin: Nam et infirmatus est usque ad mortem; sed Deus misertus est eius ... et mei, ne tristitiam super tristitiam haberem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of his death.

glosses.latin: Nam et infirmatus est usque ad mortem; sed Deus misertus est eius ... et mei, ne tristitiam super tristitiam haberem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of your grief.

glosses.latin: Festinantius ergo missi illum, ut uisso eo iterum gaudeatis, et ego sine tristitia sim,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as you had had joy before his sickness.

glosses.latin: Festinantius ergo missi illum, ut uisso eo iterum gaudeatis, et ego sine tristitia sim,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through your joy.

glosses.latin: ut inpleret id quod ex uobis deerat erga meum obsequium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what has been wanting of your perfection.

glosses.latin: ut inpleret id quod ex uobis deerat erga meum obsequium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what I have preached.

glosses.latin: fratres mei, gaudete in Domino. Eadem uobis scribere, mihi quidem non pigrum, uobis autem necessarium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let the joy be in God.

glosses.latin: fratres mei, gaudete in Domino. Eadem uobis scribere, mihi quidem non pigrum, uobis autem necessarium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it irks me not: it is profit to you.

glosses.latin: uidete malos operarios, uidete concissionem.
glosses.glossTrans: because they do it for earthly glory.

glosses.latin: uidete malos operarios, uidete concissionem.
footnotes: b: in marg. a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: recutting carnis.

glosses.latin: uidete malos operarios, uidete concissionem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tobe asb[Con]er[/Con]so[Con]m[/Con] arimp áigthidiude arnifíu moidem and arcidsnissni nínmóidem and ciadodchommar foi innaaimsir téchti [GLat]sed in christo iesu[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. tobe asbersom arimp áigthidiude arnifíu moidem and arcidsnissni nínmóidem and ciadodchommar foi innaaimsir téchti sed in christo iesu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tobe asbersom arimp áigthidiude arnifíu moidem and arcidsnissni nínmóidem and ciadodchommar foi innaaimsir téchti sed in christo iesu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. concision he says, that it may be the more dreaded; for unworthy is boasting therein; for even we boast not therein, although we have undergone it at its legal time, sed etc.

glosses.latin: Nos enim sumus circumcissio, qui spiritu Deo seruimus et gloriamur in Christo Iesu, et non in carne fiduciam habemus.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nos enim sumus circumcissio, qui spiritu Deo seruimus et gloriamur in Christo Iesu, et non in carne fiduciam habemus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnaep[Con]er[/Con]the isairi ro bóiso[Con]m[/Con] octatháir imdibi hóre niroimdibed
glosses.glossText: .i. arnaeperthe isairi ro bóisom octatháir imdibi hóre niroimdibed
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnaeperthe isairi ro bóisom octatháir imdibi hóre niroimdibed
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest it should be said, that therefore he has been blaming circumcision because he had not been circumcised.

glosses.latin: Nos enim sumus circumcissio, qui spiritu Deo seruimus et gloriamur in Christo Iesu, et non in carne fiduciam habemus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore he says this.

glosses.latin: Nos enim sumus circumcissio, qui spiritu Deo seruimus et gloriamur in Christo Iesu, et non in carne fiduciam habemus.
glosses.glossTrans: and it will not be in circumcision.

glosses.latin: Nos enim sumus circumcissio, qui spiritu Deo seruimus et gloriamur in Christo Iesu, et non in carne fiduciam habemus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní ba in imdibu [GLat]et[/GLat] sóiri ciabo asse dom
glosses.glossText: .i. ní ba in imdibu et sóiri ciabo asse dom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní ba in imdibu et sóiri ciabo asse dom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be in circumcision and nobility, though it were easy to me.

glosses.latin: si quis alius uidetur confidere in carne.
footnotes: b: = móidid-i
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if any one boasteth him in nobility and circumcision.

glosses.latin: Circumcissus octaua die, ex genere Israel de tribu Beniamin Haebreus, ego magis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is well known that I am a true Israelite: at the proper time I have been circumcised.

glosses.latin: Circumcissus octaua die, ex genere Israel de tribu Beniamin Haebreus, ego magis.
footnotes: f: cf. leth-cholba flatha, Ultan h. 9
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. one of the two pillars of the kingdom<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Circumcissus octaua die, ex genere Israel de tribu Beniamin Haebreus, ego magis.
glosses.glossTrans: racial this.

glosses.latin: secundum iustitiam, quae in lege est, conuersatus sine querela.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. legal righteousness, that is, legal commands.

glosses.latin: secundum iustitiam, quae in lege est, conuersatus sine querela.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. against law.

glosses.latin: secundum iustitiam, quae in lege est, conuersatus sine querela.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have fought for it hitherto.

glosses.latin: Sed quae mihi fuerunt lucra, haec arbitratus sum propter Christum detrimenta.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that I should part with them.

glosses.latin: propter quem omnia detrimentum feci, et arbitror ut stercora, ut Christum lucrifaciam.
footnotes: c: ní not in MS.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not more than this I esteem them.

glosses.latin: propter quem omnia detrimentum feci, et arbitror ut stercora, ut Christum lucrifaciam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that Christ might be my gain.

glosses.latin: Et inueniar in illo, non habens meam iustitiam, quae ex lege est, sed illam quae ex fide est Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] daadbatsom[d] [GLat]híc[/GLat] asfírinne cr[Con]ist[/Con] nóibas [GLat]et[/GLat] nifírinne rechto
glosses.glossText: .i. daadbatsom híc asfírinne crist nóibas et nifírinne rechto
glosses.glossFNs: .i. daadbatsomd híc asfírinne crist nóibas et nifírinne rechto
footnotes: d: The infixed neuter pronoun anticipates the dependent clause
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. here he shows that it is Christ’s righteousness that sanctifies and not the righteousness of (the) Law.

glosses.latin: configuratus morti eius.
footnotes: e: MS. forni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. form and shape of His death on me.

glosses.latin: Si quo modo occurram ad resurrectionem, quae est ex mortuis.
footnotes: a: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: in what way.

glosses.latin: Si quo modo occurram ad resurrectionem, quae est ex mortuis.
footnotes: g: lit. if we shall be in co-death, we shall be in co-glory; si enim compatiemur, et conuiuemus, Primasius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for if we be in death with Him, we shall be in common glory with Him<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Non quod iam acceperim, aut iam perfectus sim.
footnotes: d: Perhaps christi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that I may be worthy thereunto.

glosses.latin: Fratres, ego ne non arbitror comprehendisse. Unum autem, quae quidem retro sunt obliuiscens, ad ea uero quae sunt in priora extendens meipsum.
glosses.glossTrans: it is only that little which I do of good.

glosses.latin: Fratres, ego ne non arbitror comprehendisse. Unum autem, quae quidem retro sunt obliuiscens, ad ea uero quae sunt in priora extendens meipsum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I look not behind me.

glosses.latin: Fratres, ego ne non arbitror comprehendisse. Unum autem, quae quidem retro sunt obliuiscens, ad ea uero quae sunt in priora extendens meipsum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Fratres, ego ne non arbitror comprehendisse. Unum autem, quae quidem retro sunt obliuiscens, ad ea uero quae sunt in priora extendens meipsum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the things I have not done hitherto.

glosses.latin: Ad destinatum persequor, ad bradium supernae uocationis Dei in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is before me.

glosses.latin: Ad destinatum persequor, ad bradium supernae uocationis Dei in Christo Iesu.
footnotes: e: in marg. a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ad destinatum persequor, ad bradium supernae uocationis Dei in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat][Res]frat[/Res]res ego[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] [Res]cosmui[/Res]lius lesso[Con]m[/Con] inso frimílid rethess dochu[Con]m[/Con] [Res]lainn[/Res]e buade [Res][ie].i.[/ie] ishé[/Res] a bés ade ní aírmi ambís iarnachúul dindséit [Res]act a[/Res]mbis arachiunn ↄdidtar[Res]la[f] se[/Res]chæ [GLat]et[/GLat] conrí [Res]alain[/Res]n isinchruthsin [Res]robó[/Res]i[g] pol [GLat]et[/GLat] isamlid isbuithi dochách [Res][ie].i.[/ie] im[/Res]bithphennit [Res]conco[/Res]muir fris[Res]sinlain[/Res]n [ie].i.[/ie] frisinfochricc nemdi[h]
glosses.glossText: (frat)res ego rl. (cosmui)lius lessom inso frimílid rethess dochum (lainn)e buade (.i. ishé) a bés ade ní aírmi ambís iarnachúul dindséit (act a)mbis arachiunn ↄdidtar(la se)chæ et conrí (alain)n isinchruthsin (robó)i pol et isamlid isbuithi dochách (.i. im)bithphennit (conco)muir fris(sinlain)n .i. frisinfochricc nemdi
glosses.glossFNs: (frat)res ego rl. (cosmui)lius lessom inso frimílid rethess dochum (lainn)e buade (.i. ishé) a bés ade ní aírmi ambís iarnachúul dindséit (act a)mbis arachiunn ↄdidtar(laf se)chæ et conrí (alain)n isinchruthsin (robó)ig pol et isamlid isbuithi dochách (.i. im)bithphennit (conco)muir fris(sinlain)n .i. frisinfochricc nemdih
footnotes: f: Here -did- stands for -didn-
g: cf. Wb. 3d 27, 18b 16, 24b 13, 31c 11, but hore is inchruthso rumboi dossom 33b 1
h: In this gloss, the letters in parenthesis cannot now be read, as the book is so bound that it cannot be opened wide enough
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is a similitude which he has to a soldier who runs unto the crown of victory, that is, this is his custom, he counteth not what (part) of the way lies behind him, but (only) what is before him, until he comes past it, and reaches the crown. In that wise hath Paul been, and thus ought every one to be, that is, in constant penance till he attains to the crown, that is, to the heavenly reward.

glosses.latin: si quid aliter sapitis, et hoc uobís Deus reuelabit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. besides this.

glosses.latin: si quid aliter sapitis, et hoc uobís Deus reuelabit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what I say.

glosses.latin: Uerumtamen ad quod peruenimus, ut idem sapiamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let our part be in it.

glosses.latin: Uerumtamen ad quod peruenimus, ut idem sapiamus.
footnotes: i: ad perfectionem Novi Testamenti, Primasius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to that.

glosses.latin: Uerumtamen ad quod peruenimus, ut idem sapiamus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may all understand it equally.

glosses.latin: Emitatores mei estote, fratres, et obseruate eos qui ita ambulant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. do ye what I do.

glosses.latin: Emitatores mei estote, fratres, et obseruate eos qui ita ambulant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye cautious as to that set.

glosses.latin: Emitatores mei estote, fratres, et obseruate eos qui ita ambulant.
footnotes: k: = nidénat, cf. natiubrad Wb. 9d 20, and Ml. 35e 98, where the t was wrongly explained
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a semblance of apostles on them, and they practise not their customs.

glosses.latin: Multi enim ambulant, quos sepe dicebam uobís, (nunc autem et flens dico) inimicos crucis Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have verily denounced them to you.

glosses.latin: Multi enim ambulant, quos sepe dicebam uobís, (nunc autem et flens dico) inimicos crucis Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a grief to me.

glosses.latin: Multi enim ambulant, quos sepe dicebam uobís, (nunc autem et flens dico) inimicos crucis Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intain asmberat isrecht nóibas [GLat]et[/GLat] ní croch cr[Con]ist[/Con]
glosses.glossText: .i. intain asmberat isrecht nóibas et ní croch crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intain asmberat isrecht nóibas et ní croch crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when they say it is the Law that sanctifies, and not Christ’s cross.

glosses.latin: quorum deus uenter, et gloria in confussionem ipsorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is for the sake of food they preach.

glosses.latin: quorum deus uenter, et gloria in confussionem ipsorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that in which they boast will be a shame and disgrace to them.

glosses.latin: Nostra autem conuersatio in caelís est; unde etiam Saluatorem expectamus,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not so with us.

glosses.latin: Qui reformabit corpus humilitatis nostrae, configuratum corpori claritatis suae, secundum operationem qua possit etiam subiecere sibi omnia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which He has received a nobis.

glosses.latin: Qui reformabit corpus humilitatis nostrae, configuratum corpori claritatis suae, secundum operationem qua possit etiam subiecere sibi omnia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conidfil inindocbáil [GLat]post resurrectionem[/GLat] am[Con]al[/Con] indocbaíl áchoirpsom
glosses.glossText: .i. conidfil inindocbáil post resurrectionem amal indocbaíl áchoirpsom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conidfil inindocbáil post resurrectionem amal indocbaíl áchoirpsom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it is in glory post resurrectionem like the glory of His body.

glosses.latin: Qui reformabit corpus humilitatis nostrae, configuratum corpori claritatis suae, secundum operationem qua possit etiam subiecere sibi omnia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the might of (the) Godhead has caused it.

glosses.latin: rogo et te, germane conpar, adiuua illas quae mecum laborauerunt, . . cum Clemente et caeteris . . quorum nomina sunt in libro uitae.
footnotes: a: MS. pro; some interpreters took germane to be voc. sg. of a proper name
glosses.glossTrans: or own brother.

glosses.latin: rogo et te, germane conpar, adiuua illas quae mecum laborauerunt, . . cum Clemente et caeteris . . quorum nomina sunt in libro uitae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in fulfilling, not in teaching.

glosses.latin: rogo et te, germane conpar, adiuua illas quae mecum laborauerunt, . . cum Clemente et caeteris . . quorum nomina sunt in libro uitae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Peter’s pupil: he, too, had fulfilled it.

glosses.latin: rogo et te, germane conpar, adiuua illas quae mecum laborauerunt, . . cum Clemente et caeteris . . quorum nomina sunt in libro uitae.
glosses.glossTrans: I say not their names here.

glosses.latin: Modestia uestra nota sit omnibus hominibus; Dominus prope est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be ye gentle to every one.

glosses.latin: Modestia uestra nota sit omnibus hominibus; Dominus prope est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to give you whatsoever ye may need.

glosses.latin: petitiones uestrae innotescant apud Deum;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not what ye pray for be contrary to your salvation.

glosses.latin: Et pax Christi, quae exsuperat omnem sensum, custodiat corda uestra et intellegentias uestras.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. peace is nobler than every feeling.

glosses.latin: Et pax Christi, quae exsuperat omnem sensum, custodiat corda uestra et intellegentias uestras.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nicu[Con]m[/Con]me cachcáincho[Con]m[/Con]rac arisirchride utmall cach caíncho[Con]m[/Con]rac condid ticci
glosses.glossText: .i. nicumme cachcáinchomrac arisirchride utmall cach caínchomrac condid ticci
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nicumme cachcáinchomrac arisirchride utmall cach caínchomrac condid ticci
footnotes: d: ‘bis auf ihn,’ sc. den frieden Gottes, Sarauw
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not equal is every benevolence, for perishable and unstable is every benevolence until thou comest to it<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: De coetero, ... quaecumque pudica, ... quaecumque amabilia, ... si qua uirtus, si qua laus disciplinae, haec cogitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from this onwards

glosses.latin: De coetero, ... quaecumque pudica, ... quaecumque amabilia, ... si qua uirtus, si qua laus disciplinae, haec cogitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. being without sin.

glosses.latin: De coetero, ... quaecumque pudica, ... quaecumque amabilia, ... si qua uirtus, si qua laus disciplinae, haec cogitate.
footnotes: b: a prima manu
c: added by the glossator
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. liberality.

glosses.latin: De coetero, ... quaecumque pudica, ... quaecumque amabilia, ... si qua uirtus, si qua laus disciplinae, haec cogitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it be godly if there be.

glosses.latin: De coetero, ... quaecumque pudica, ... quaecumque amabilia, ... si qua uirtus, si qua laus disciplinae, haec cogitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (si qua laus) let it be of morality.

glosses.latin: De coetero, ... quaecumque pudica, ... quaecumque amabilia, ... si qua uirtus, si qua laus disciplinae, haec cogitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not hard for you.

glosses.latin: Quae et ... audistis et uidistis in me, cogitate, et Deus pacis erit uobiscum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all the (things) that I have done in your presence do ye them.

glosses.latin: Quae et ... audistis et uidistis in me, cogitate, et Deus pacis erit uobiscum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye be in that wise.

glosses.latin: Non quasi propter pennuriam dico, ego enim dedici, in quibus sum, sufficiens esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for seeking sustenance of you.

glosses.latin: Non quasi propter pennuriam dico, ego enim dedici, in quibus sum, sufficiens esse.
footnotes: b: cf. Wb. 29b 13
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am knowing; or it is little that suffices me.

glosses.latin: Non quasi propter pennuriam dico, ego enim dedici, in quibus sum, sufficiens esse.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am sufficient as to every thing.

glosses.latin: Scio [et] humiliari, scio et habundare.
footnotes: d: lit. ‘taught myself,’ cf. Wb. 5b 44
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have learned<sup>d</sup> loss.

glosses.latin: Scio [et] humiliari, scio et habundare.
footnotes: d: lit. ‘taught myself,’ cf. Wb. 5b 44
glosses.glossTrans: I have learned<sup>d</sup> abundance.

glosses.latin: Uerumtamen bene fecistis, commonicantes tribulationi meae.
footnotes: c: MS. aconfodli doberid corr. J. S., Celt. Zeitschr. II. 212: compare Ml. 53b 18. For the singling of the dd cf. Wb. 23b 1, 24c 17
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when ye share, [i.e.] ye give offerings to us.

glosses.latin: nulla mihi aeclesia commonicauit in ratione dati et accepti, nisi uos soli.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nitartsat idbarta dúnni [ie].i.[/ie] nirogabsa[Con]m[/Con]ni anidparta hóre narbolour linn afoirbthetu sechnithartsatso[Con]m[/Con] ní comtachtmarni
glosses.glossText: .i. nitartsat idbarta dúnni .i. nirogabsamni anidparta hóre narbolour linn afoirbthetu sechnithartsatsom ní comtachtmarni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nitartsat idbarta dúnni .i. nirogabsamni anidparta hóre narbolour linn afoirbthetu sechnithartsatsom ní comtachtmarni
footnotes: e: comtachtmar = com-ad-tachtmar, where the ad is perfective, Sarauw, Irske Studier, p. 46, W. S.; but cf. Thurneysen, KZ. xxxvii. 57, J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have given us no offerings, that is, we have not accepted their offerings, because we have not deemed their perfection sufficient. They have given nothing, we have asked<sup>e</sup> for nothing.

glosses.latin: nulla mihi aeclesia commonicauit in ratione dati et accepti, nisi uos soli.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nirobe cach reít innadlígud daratsidsi im[Con]murgu[/Con] ar farfoirbthetu
glosses.glossText: .i. nirobe cach reít innadlígud daratsidsi immurgu ar farfoirbthetu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nirobe cach reít innadlígud daratsidsi immurgu ar farfoirbthetu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all this was not as a due: ye, however, have given them because of your perfection.

glosses.latin: Quia et Thessalonicam semel et bis in usum mihi missistis.
glosses.glossTrans: twice only.

glosses.latin: Quia et Thessalonicam semel et bis in usum mihi missistis.
glosses.glossTrans: when I was therein.

glosses.latin: Non quia quero datum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not now of seeking.

glosses.latin: repletus sum, acceptís ab Ephaphrodito, quae missistis, in odorem suauitatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what he has brought from you.

glosses.latin: repletus sum, acceptís ab Ephaphrodito, quae missistis, in odorem suauitatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it has been brought with joy.

glosses.latin: Deus . . impleat omne desiderium uestrum, secundum diuitias suas.
footnotes: f: lit. ‘it is abundant with him’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he hath abundance<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Salutate omnem sanctum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a sign of peace and good will.

glosses.latin: Salutant uos quicunque sunt fratres. Salutant uos omnes sancti, maxime qui de Cessaris domu sunt. AMHN explicit æpistula ad pilipenses ...
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a salutation to you from them all.

glosses.latin: Salutant uos quicunque sunt fratres. Salutant uos omnes sancti, maxime qui de Cessaris domu sunt. AMHN explicit æpistula ad pilipenses ...
glosses.glossFullTags: far nimchomarc ó chách nádfil and
glosses.glossText: far nimchomarc ó chách nádfil and
glosses.glossFNs: far nimchomarc ó chách nádfil and
glosses.glossTrans: a salutation to you from every one who is not there.

glosses.latin: Salutant uos quicunque sunt fratres. Salutant uos omnes sancti, maxime qui de Cessaris domu sunt. AMHN explicit æpistula ad pilipenses ...
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he of Caesar’s household who has believed.

glosses.latLine: 1 Thes. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Scribens eís ab Athenis per Thithicum diaconem et Honessimum acolitum.
footnotes: a: In breui argumento textui epistolae praemisso haec glossa legitur.–Zimmer

e: candlóir from candelarius. The acolythus lit the candles of the church. But perhaps the glossator meant the ceroferarius, who walked before the deacons or priests with a lighted taper in his hand. Smith’s Dictionary of Christian Antiquities, s.v. Acolytes
glosses.glossTrans: a taper-bearer<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Gratias agimus Deo semper pro omnibus uobís, memoriam uestri facientes semper in orationibus nostris sine intermisione.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because ye are faithful.

glosses.latin: Gratias agimus Deo semper pro omnibus uobís, memoriam uestri facientes semper in orationibus nostris sine intermisione.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] airde serce móre insin aforaidmetsom cenchumsanad[b] issindirnigdi cenchumsanad
glosses.glossText: .i. airde serce móre insin aforaidmetsom cenchumsanad issindirnigdi cenchumsanad
glosses.glossFNs: .i. airde serce móre insin aforaidmetsom cenchumsanad<sup>b</sup> issindirnigdi cenchumsanad
footnotes: b: This seems superfluous J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is a sign of great love, his remembering them without ceasing in the prayer without ceasing.

glosses.latin: Memores operis fidei uestri .... ante Deum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He sees it.

glosses.latin: Scientes, fratres, dilecti a Deo, electionem uestram.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whereby ye have been called, so that ye are in Christ’s Body.

glosses.latin: Quia euangelium nostrum non fuit ad uos in sermone tantum, sed et in uirtute . . in plenitudine multa, sicut scitis quales fuerimus in uobís propter uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nirbochuit eperte [GLat]tantum[/GLat] act robatar cidferte dia imthrenugud
glosses.glossText: .i. nirbochuit eperte tantum act robatar cidferte dia imthrenugud
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nirbochuit eperte tantum act robatar cidferte dia imthrenugud
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was not tantum as to speech, but there have been even miracles to confirm it.

glosses.latin: Quia euangelium nostrum non fuit ad uos in sermone tantum, sed et in uirtute . . in plenitudine multa, sicut scitis quales fuerimus in uobís propter uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in perfectione iustitiae conuersationis et uitae[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] illáni etargni deachte [GLat]et[/GLat] doinechte crist
glosses.glossText: .i. in perfectione iustitiae conuersationis et uitae ɫ. illáni etargni deachte et doinechte crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. in perfectione iustitiae conuersationis et uitae ɫ. illáni etargni deachte et doinechte crist
glosses.glossTrans: or in the fulness of knowledge of Christ’s Godhead and Manhood.

glosses.latin: Quia euangelium nostrum non fuit ad uos in sermone tantum, sed et in uirtute . . in plenitudine multa, sicut scitis quales fuerimus in uobís propter uos.
footnotes: c: leg. a thuirem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not proper to recount it to you.

glosses.latin: Quia euangelium nostrum non fuit ad uos in sermone tantum, sed et in uirtute . . in plenitudine multa, sicut scitis quales fuerimus in uobís propter uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye might take ensample from us.

glosses.latin: Et uos emitatores nostri facti estis, et Domini, excipientes, uerbum in tribulatione multa, cum gaudio Spiritus sancti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in teaching and fulfilling the gospel.

glosses.latin: Et uos emitatores nostri facti estis, et Domini, excipientes, uerbum in tribulatione multa, cum gaudio Spiritus sancti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]emitatores[/GLat] roart lessom epert friusom intsamli dæ [GLat]statim[/GLat] act cid amall ished dodechuid de
glosses.glossText: .i. emitatores roart lessom epert friusom intsamli dæ statim act cid amall ished dodechuid de
glosses.glossFNs: .i. emitatores roart lessom epert friusom intsamli dæ statim act cid amall ished dodechuid de
footnotes: f: i.e. this is the result, though it may be slow
glosses.glossTrans: he deems it too high to tell them to imitate God statim, but though slowly this is what has come of it<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Et uos emitatores nostri facti estis, et Domini, excipientes, uerbum in tribulatione multa, cum gaudio Spiritus sancti.
footnotes: d: a prima manu = frestal; the verb is glossed by a substantive as in Wb. 17b 23, 25, Thurneysen, Celt. Zeitschr. III. 49
glosses.glossTrans: waiting on.

glosses.latin: Et uos emitatores nostri facti estis, et Domini, excipientes, uerbum in tribulatione multa, cum gaudio Spiritus sancti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in abundant sufferings.

glosses.latin: Et uos emitatores nostri facti estis, et Domini, excipientes, uerbum in tribulatione multa, cum gaudio Spiritus sancti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are joyous through grace of the Spirit in receiving it.

glosses.latin: Ita ut facti sitis forma omnibus credentibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that from you every one has taken example.

glosses.latin: in Omni loco fides uestra, quae est ad Deum, profecta est, ita ut non sit nobís necesse quicquam loqui.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. conspicuous is your faith in every place.

glosses.latin: in Omni loco fides uestra, quae est ad Deum, profecta est, ita ut non sit nobís necesse quicquam loqui.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niáil dún tabart testassa dínn nadiibsi daberidsi féissne cene
glosses.glossText: .i. niáil dún tabart testassa dínn nadiibsi daberidsi féissne cene
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niáil dún tabart testassa dínn nadiibsi daberidsi féissne cene
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not proper to us to bear testimony of us or of you: ye yourselves give it without that.

glosses.latin: Ipsi enim de uobis adnuntiant qualem introitum habuerimus ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ipsi enim de uobis adnuntiant qualem introitum habuerimus ad uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iscucci alére [b]ropridchissid[/b] doibsom coneícdid[c] doib cruth ropridchissem [GLat]et[/GLat] dondechommar cucuib si itossogod
glosses.glossText: .i. iscucci alére ropridchissid doibsom coneícdid doib cruth ropridchissem et dondechommar cucuib si itossogod
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iscucci alére ropridchissidb doibsom coneícdidc doib cruth ropridchissem et dondechommar cucuib si itossogod
footnotes: b: MS. ropridchissi
c: from con-en-co-fathid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so great is the industry with which ye have preached to them that ye have declared to them how we have preached and have come to you in the beginning.

glosses.latin: Et expectare ... Iesum qui eripuit nós ab ira uentura.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et expectare ... Iesum qui eripuit nós ab ira uentura.
glosses.glossFullTags: hóre ronsoír dipeccad isderb linn nonsoírfea [GLat]in futuro[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: hóre ronsoír dipeccad isderb linn nonsoírfea in futuro
glosses.glossFNs: hóre ronsoír dipeccad isderb linn nonsoírfea in futuro
glosses.glossTrans: since He has saved us from sin we are sure He will save us in futuro.

glosses.latin: scitis . . introitum nostrum . . quia non inanis fuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was not without sufferings and tribulations.

glosses.latin: Sed . . contumilís adfecti, ... in Philipsis, fiduciam habuimus in Domino nostro, loqui ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. insults from every one.

glosses.latin: Sed . . contumilís adfecti, ... in Philipsis, fiduciam habuimus in Domino nostro, loqui ad uos.
footnotes: d: lit. Philippians
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in Philippi<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Sed . . contumilís adfecti, ... in Philipsis, fiduciam habuimus in Domino nostro, loqui ad uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ro bo dúibsi cinirbo etruib robammarni
glosses.glossText: .i. ro bo dúibsi cinirbo etruib robammarni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ro bo dúibsi cinirbo etruib robammarni
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was to you, though we have not been among you.

glosses.latin: Exortatio enim nostra non de errore, neque de immunditia, neque in dolo.
glosses.glossTrans: I preach not for pay or reward, ut pseudoapostoli.

glosses.latin: Exortatio enim nostra non de errore, neque de immunditia, neque in dolo.
footnotes: e: The glossator seems to have connected immunditia with mundus ‘world’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have not taken earthly pay<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Exortatio enim nostra non de errore, neque de immunditia, neque in dolo.
glosses.glossTrans: not for praise is what we have done.

glosses.latin: ita loquimur, non quasi hominibus placentes, sed Deo, qui probat corda nostra.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni amal rombothol dodóinib ropridchissem [GLat]ut sí hominibus placens seruus christi non essem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ni amal rombothol dodóinib ropridchissem ut sí hominibus placens seruus christi non essem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni amal rombothol dodóinib ropridchissem ut sí hominibus placens seruus christi non essem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not as men desired have we preached, ut etc.

glosses.latin: ita loquimur, non quasi hominibus placentes, sed Deo, qui probat corda nostra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is He that knows how we preach.

glosses.latin: Neque enim aliquando fuimus in sermone adolationis, ... neque in occassione auaritiae; Deus testis est.
footnotes: f: cf. ni thuilled buide fri nech LL. 217d, ni tullim budi do neoch, Ir. Texte i. 142, 302. re rig...ni derna tuillium buidhe, B. of Dún na ngéd 56, Fél. prol. 55, and LU. 62a 36, 110a 15
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have not earned thanks from any one<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Neque enim aliquando fuimus in sermone adolationis, ... neque in occassione auaritiae; Deus testis est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was not for sake of asking your treasures.

glosses.latin: Neque enim aliquando fuimus in sermone adolationis, ... neque in occassione auaritiae; Deus testis est.
glosses.glossTrans: God knows it.

glosses.latin: Cum possimus oneri esse ut Christi apostoli; sed facti
glosses.glossTrans: we are messengers of a high Person.

glosses.latin: sumus paruuli in medio uestrum, tamquam si nutrix foueat filios suos.
glosses.glossFullTags: amal dongní ade cachsián[a] domunud adalti dicachgním for(bthu) darigi . . dínn oc(mu)nud d(alte)
glosses.glossText: amal dongní ade cachsián domunud adalti dicachgním for(bthu) darigi . . dínn oc(mu)nud d(alte)
glosses.glossFNs: amal dongní ade cachsián<sup>a</sup> domunud adalti dicachgním for(bthu) darigi . . dínn oc(mu)nud d(alte)
footnotes: a: leg. -síans ‘sense’? sicut nutrix sensum perfectionis suae in paruulum uult transfundere, ut et sit similis, Primasius
glosses.glossTrans: as she makes every sound(?) to instruct her fosterling to every perfect deed ... of us instructing fosterlings.

glosses.latin: sumus paruuli in medio uestrum, tamquam si nutrix foueat filios suos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] Ceist in innonn less [GLat]parbulus et nutrix[/GLat] náde ǽm isinnon [b]arisbésad[/b] nammuimme [c]dogní[/c] deidbleán di ocmunud ádalti horbi accobur lǽ nebud dó innoidenacht nachgeín [GLat]síc fuimus uobis[/GLat] ol pol
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Ceist in innonn less parbulus et nutrix náde ǽm isinnon arisbésad nammuimme dogní deidbleán di ocmunud ádalti horbi accobur lǽ nebud dó innoidenacht nachgeín síc fuimus uobis ol pol
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Ceist in innonn less parbulus et nutrix náde ǽm isinnon arisbésadb nammuimme dogníc deidbleán di ocmunud ádalti horbi accobur lǽ nebud dó innoidenacht nachgeín síc fuimus uobis ol pol
footnotes: b: MS. arisberad, cf. Wb. 9d 2
c: The MS. has dogní with i written over, and a little to the right of, o
e: nachgéin for nach n céin as in 7a 11. nebud = neb-buith
glosses.glossTrans: Question, does he deem paruulus and nutrix the same? Verily it is the same: for it is the custom of the nurse to make a weakling of herself teaching her fosterling, since she hath a desire that he should not be in infancy for any long time<sup>e</sup>: ‘sic fuimus uobis’ saith Paul.
