glosses.latin: uolebamus tradere uobís non solum euangelium Dei, sed etiam animas nostras.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in teaching it and in fulfilling it.

glosses.latin: uolebamus tradere uobís non solum euangelium Dei, sed etiam animas nostras.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] combad innonn indocbál diar nanmanaib [vel]ɫ.[/vel] darfarcenn immartri
glosses.glossText: .i. combad innonn indocbál diar nanmanaib ɫ. darfarcenn immartri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. combad innonn indocbál diar nanmanaib ɫ. darfarcenn immartri
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it might be the same glory to our souls; or for your sake into martyrdom.

glosses.latin: Memores enim estis, fratres, laborem nostri et fatigationem; nocte ac die operantes, ... praedicauimus in uobis euangelium.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Memores enim estis, fratres, laborem nostri et fatigationem; nocte ac die operantes, ... praedicauimus in uobis euangelium.
glosses.glossFullTags: suánemuin dodénum inaidchi doreicc arbiad [GLat]et[/GLat] ǽitach diamuntir precept fridei do ícc anman sochuide
glosses.glossText: suánemuin dodénum inaidchi doreicc arbiad et ǽitach diamuntir precept fridei do ícc anman sochuide
glosses.glossFNs: suánemuin dodénum inaidchi doreicc arbiad et ǽitach diamuntir precept fridei do ícc anman sochuide
footnotes: f: Here and in 26b 17 infra, the glossographer confounded σκηναί (tents) with σχοι̑νοι (ropes). This remark is due to C. H. Tawney, C.I.E., librarian of the India Office.
glosses.glossTrans: to make ropes<sup>f</sup> at night to be sold for food and raiment for his household: to preach by day to save the souls of a multitude.

glosses.latin: Memores enim estis, fratres, laborem nostri et fatigationem; nocte ac die operantes, ... praedicauimus in uobis euangelium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without causing loss to you.

glosses.latin: Memores enim estis, fratres, laborem nostri et fatigationem; nocte ac die operantes, ... praedicauimus in uobis euangelium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as we have recounted it.

glosses.latin: Uos testis estis, et Deus, quam sancte et iuste ... uobis ... fuimus;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are sure.

glosses.latin: Uos testis estis, et Deus, quam sancte et iuste ... uobis ... fuimus;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Uos testis estis, et Deus, quam sancte et iuste ... uobis ... fuimus;
footnotes: d: Usually ciafiu
glosses.glossTrans: how worthily.

glosses.latin: tamquam pater filios.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as a father entreats his son.

glosses.latin: Deprecantes uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have entreated you.

glosses.latin: quoniam cum accepissetis a nobís uerbum auditus Dei, accepistis illud, non ut uerbum hominum, sed (sicut est uere) uerbum Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]praedicatio euangelii[/GLat] amal bid o dia rachlóithe
glosses.glossText: .i. praedicatio euangelii amal bid o dia rachlóithe
glosses.glossFNs: .i. praedicatio euangelii amal bid o dia rachlóithe
glosses.glossTrans: as if ye had beard it from God.

glosses.latin: quoniam cum accepissetis a nobís uerbum auditus Dei, accepistis illud, non ut uerbum hominum, sed (sicut est uere) uerbum Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not a false opinion of yours: it is God’s very word.

glosses.latin: Uos enim emitatores facti estis ... aeclesiarum Dei, quae sunt in Iudea in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: who have believed in the teaching of Jesus and the apostles.

glosses.latin: Prohibentes nos gentibus loqui ut saluae fiant, ut inpleant peccata sua.
footnotes: b: Irish ar-gar- ‘forbid’ is followed by de
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (forbidding) us<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Prohibentes nos gentibus loqui ut saluae fiant, ut inpleant peccata sua.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they may fulfil.

glosses.latin: Nos autem ... desoluti á uobis ad tempus horae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have parted from you for a little while.

glosses.latin: Quoniam uoluimus uenire ad uos ... sed inpediuit nos Satanas.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if we had been able.

glosses.latin: Quoniam uoluimus uenire ad uos ... sed inpediuit nos Satanas.
glosses.glossTrans: or every adversary.

glosses.latin: Quae est enim nostra spes, aut gaudium, aut corona gloriae? Nonne uos ante Dominum ... estis in aduentu eius?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tacco issíi bid dibarnágsi ronbiani [GLat]corona gloriae in die iudicii[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. tacco issíi bid dibarnágsi ronbiani corona gloriae in die iudicii
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tacco issíi bid dibarnágsi ronbiani corona gloriae in die iudicii
footnotes: c: a vestro timore, G.C.2 913. But ág means praelium
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I declare it is: it will be from your battle<sup>c</sup> that we shall have corona etc.

glosses.latin: Uos enim estis gloria nostra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. your perfection causes gloria to us.

glosses.latin: Propter quod non sustenentes amplius, placuit nobis remanere Athenís, solis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without tidings from you.

glosses.latin: Propter quod non sustenentes amplius, placuit nobis remanere Athenís, solis.
footnotes: d: ó may be a scribal error for co
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. until our household (Silas and Timothy) came with<sup>d</sup> tidings from you.

glosses.latin: Et misimus Timotheum, fratrem nostrum, et ministrum Dei in euangelio Christi, ad confirmandos uos, et exordandos pro fide uestra.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et misimus Timotheum, fratrem nostrum, et ministrum Dei in euangelio Christi, ad confirmandos uos, et exordandos pro fide uestra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a teacher.

glosses.latin: Et misimus Timotheum, fratrem nostrum, et ministrum Dei in euangelio Christi, ad confirmandos uos, et exordandos pro fide uestra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for this (purpose) he is sent.

glosses.latin: Et misimus Timotheum, fratrem nostrum, et ministrum Dei in euangelio Christi, ad confirmandos uos, et exordandos pro fide uestra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it may be stable sicut est.

glosses.latin: Ut nemo moueatur in tribulationibus istís; ipsi enim scitis, quod in hoc possiti sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut nemo moueatur in tribulationibus istís; ipsi enim scitis, quod in hoc possiti sumus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nipimned libsi mofochidise [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ciacheste aririss crist
glosses.glossText: .i. nipimned libsi mofochidise ɫ. ciacheste aririss crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nipimned libsi mofochidise ɫ. ciacheste aririss crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not my sufferings grieve you; or though ye should suffer for Christ’s faith.

glosses.latin: Ut nemo moueatur in tribulationibus istís; ipsi enim scitis, quod in hoc possiti sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye are not ignorant of it.

glosses.latin: Ut nemo moueatur in tribulationibus istís; ipsi enim scitis, quod in hoc possiti sumus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isarchenn focheda dodechommar [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]positi sumus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in solicitudine pro uobís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isarchenn focheda dodechommar ɫ. positi sumus .i. in solicitudine pro uobís
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isarchenn focheda dodechommar ɫ. positi sumus .i. in solicitudine pro uobís
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is to meet suffering that we have come.

glosses.latin: praedicebamus uobis passuros nos tribulationes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we were to be in suffering.

glosses.latin: praedicebamus uobis passuros nos tribulationes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ut christus passus est et ut praedixit apostolis suís antequam pateretur[/GLat] combad tressa de hiress apstal dofulung [GLat]tribulationum[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ut christus passus est et ut praedixit apostolis suís antequam pateretur combad tressa de hiress apstal dofulung tribulationum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ut christus passus est et ut praedixit apostolis suís antequam pateretur combad tressa de hiress apstal dofulung tribulationum
glosses.glossTrans: so that the apostles’ faith might be the stronger to endure tribulationes.

glosses.latin: ego amplius non sustinens, misi . . ne forte temptauerit uos is qui temptat, et inanis fiat labor noster.
glosses.glossTrans: beyond every one.

glosses.latin: ego amplius non sustinens, misi . . ne forte temptauerit uos is qui temptat, et inanis fiat labor noster.
footnotes: a: since fo-siag- has an s-subjunctive, leg. indobfoich and ‘if perchance he is tempting you therein’? J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: or if perchance he provoke(?) you.

glosses.latin: ego amplius non sustinens, misi . . ne forte temptauerit uos is qui temptat, et inanis fiat labor noster.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if perchance your labour is vain.

glosses.latin: memoriam nostri habetis bonam semper, desiderantes nos uidere, sicut nos quoque uos.
glosses.glossTrans: or a good testimony of us.

glosses.latin: memoriam nostri habetis bonam semper, desiderantes nos uidere, sicut nos quoque uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it be the same with you.

glosses.latin: memoriam nostri habetis bonam semper, desiderantes nos uidere, sicut nos quoque uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is like for like to you.

glosses.latin: Ideo consulati sumus, fratres, in uobís, in omni necessitate, ... per uestram fidem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]propter praedicta[/GLat] hóre dunnánic fius scél uáib [GLat]et[/GLat] ismaith forniress [GLat]et[/GLat] forṅdeserc [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. propter praedicta hóre dunnánic fius scél uáib et ismaith forniress et forṅdeserc rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. propter praedicta hóre dunnánic fius scél uáib et ismaith forniress et forṅdeserc rl.
glosses.glossTrans: because tidings of you have come to us, and good is your faith and your charity etc.

glosses.latin: Ideo consulati sumus, fratres, in uobís, in omni necessitate, ... per uestram fidem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ideo consulati sumus, fratres, in uobís, in omni necessitate, ... per uestram fidem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it is perfect.

glosses.latin: Quoniam nunc uiuimus, si uos statis in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. your perfection is our life.

glosses.latin: Quam enim gratiarum actionem possumus Deo retribuere ... in omni gaudio quo gaudemus propter uos ante Deum nostrum?
footnotes: c: quam is taken in the sense of ‘how’
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quam enim gratiarum actionem possumus Deo retribuere ... in omni gaudio quo gaudemus propter uos ante Deum nostrum?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He perceives you.

glosses.latin: Nocte et die abundantius orantes, ut uideamus faciem uestram, et conpleamus ea quae desunt fidei uestrae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so great is our love for you.

glosses.latin: Nocte et die abundantius orantes, ut uideamus faciem uestram, et conpleamus ea quae desunt fidei uestrae.
footnotes: d: secach = sech cach
glosses.glossTrans: beyond every prayer.

glosses.latin: Nocte et die abundantius orantes, ut uideamus faciem uestram, et conpleamus ea quae desunt fidei uestrae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be a sight without profit then.

glosses.latin: Nocte et die abundantius orantes, ut uideamus faciem uestram, et conpleamus ea quae desunt fidei uestrae.
glosses.glossFullTags: madudesta ní dibar niris íccfidir [GLat]per aduentum nostrum ad uós[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: madudesta ní dibar niris íccfidir per aduentum nostrum ad uós
glosses.glossFNs: madudesta ní dibar niris íccfidir per aduentum nostrum ad uós
glosses.glossTrans: if aught is lacking in your faith, it will be made good per etc.

glosses.latin: Ipse autem Deus et Pater noster, et Dominus Christus, dirigat uiam nostram ad uos.
glosses.glossTrans: may God grant it to us indeed!

glosses.latin: Uos autem Dominus multiplicet, et abundare faciat in caritate inuicem, ... quemadmodum et nos in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. another prayer.

glosses.latin: Uos autem Dominus multiplicet, et abundare faciat in caritate inuicem, ... quemadmodum et nos in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: against our coming.

glosses.latin: Uos autem Dominus multiplicet, et abundare faciat in caritate inuicem, ... quemadmodum et nos in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. each of you contra alium.

glosses.latin: Uos autem Dominus multiplicet, et abundare faciat in caritate inuicem, ... quemadmodum et nos in uobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]abundauimus caritate[/GLat] amal rondobcarsamni carad cách uáib achéile samlid
glosses.glossText: .i. abundauimus caritate amal rondobcarsamni carad cách uáib achéile samlid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. abundauimus caritate amal rondobcarsamni carad cách uáib achéile samlid
glosses.glossTrans: as we have loved you, let each of you likewise love the other.

glosses.latin: Ad confirmanda corda uestra, . . ante Deum, . . in aduentu Domini nostri Iesu Christi cum omnibus sanctis eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the exuberance in charity is for this.

glosses.latin: Ad confirmanda corda uestra, . . ante Deum, . . in aduentu Domini nostri Iesu Christi cum omnibus sanctis eius.
footnotes: e: Cf. dul ni fír andurairngert, Wb. 30b 5, Meyer Hib. Min. Glossary, in dul is gnáthu, because it is more usual, Laws i. 250
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because He perceives it.

glosses.latin: Ad confirmanda corda uestra, . . ante Deum, . . in aduentu Domini nostri Iesu Christi cum omnibus sanctis eius.
footnotes: g: cf. Archiv f. celt. Lexicographie, i. 6 note
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be with a few<sup>g</sup> that He will come.

glosses.latin: rogamus uos, . . ut quemadmodum accepistis á nobis, ... sic et ambuletis, ut habundetis magis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have a prayer to you(?).

glosses.latin: rogamus uos, . . ut quemadmodum accepistis á nobis, ... sic et ambuletis, ut habundetis magis.
footnotes: f: cf. Ml. 62b 2
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as has been preached to you.

glosses.latin: rogamus uos, . . ut quemadmodum accepistis á nobis, ... sic et ambuletis, ut habundetis magis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. quam has been preached to you.

glosses.latin: Scitis enim quae praecepta dederim uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: fulfil them because ye have knowledge.

glosses.latin: Haec est enim uoluntas Dei, sanctificatio uestra; ut abstineatis uos á fornicatione.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the sanctification.

glosses.latin: Non in passione desiderii, sicut et gentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. subject to it.

glosses.latin: Non in passione desiderii, sicut et gentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for it is thus they are.

glosses.latin: Et ne quis ... circumueniat in negotio fratrem suum, quoniam uindex est Deus de hís omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he should not defraud him in every dealing.

glosses.latin: Et ne quis ... circumueniat in negotio fratrem suum, quoniam uindex est Deus de hís omnibus.
footnotes: a: leg. daranési
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God will repay punishment for them.

glosses.latin: De caritate autem fraternitatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the fraternal charity.

glosses.latin: Rogamus autem uos, fratres, ut abundetis magis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Rogamus autem uos, fratres, ut abundetis magis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. quam mendicancy.

glosses.latin: Rogamus autem uos, fratres, ut abundetis magis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] araill tra cairigedarsom sunda [ie].i.[/ie] utmuille [GLat]et[/GLat] déess [GLat]et[/GLat] foigde nosṅguidsom didiu arnarobat leu inpecthisi[b]
glosses.glossText: .i. araill tra cairigedarsom sunda .i. utmuille et déess et foigde nosṅguidsom didiu arnarobat leu inpecthisi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. araill tra cairigedarsom sunda .i. utmuille et déess et foigde nosṅguidsom didiu arnarobat leu inpecthisib
footnotes: b: leg. inpecthisin?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (there are) other things now which he blames here, namely, unsteadiness and indolence and mendicancy; he beseeches them, then, that these sins may not be with them.

glosses.latin: Et operam detis ut quieti sitis, et ut uestrum negotium agatis, ... et ut honeste ambuletis ad eos qui foris sunt, et nullius aliquid desideretis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. an exhortation.

glosses.latin: Et operam detis ut quieti sitis, et ut uestrum negotium agatis, ... et ut honeste ambuletis ad eos qui foris sunt, et nullius aliquid desideretis.
footnotes: g: literally “that it may not be to be a-begging”; otherwise Pedersen, Aspirationen § 129
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye be not a-begging<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Et operam detis ut quieti sitis, et ut uestrum negotium agatis, ... et ut honeste ambuletis ad eos qui foris sunt, et nullius aliquid desideretis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is the honeste.

glosses.latin: Nolumus autem uos ignorare, fratres, de dormientibus, ut non contristemini, sicut et caeteri qui spem non habent.
footnotes: c: Here, and in Wb. 5c 11, from de-ro-sluindiset
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. an answer to some who had denied the resurrection mortuarum.

glosses.latin: Si enim credimus quod Iesus mortuus est, et resurrexit, ita et Deus eos qui dormierunt per Iesum adducet cum eo.
glosses.glossFullTags: ished inso afrecre donaib eriteccaib niasse tacre natairissem friss
glosses.glossText: ished inso afrecre donaib eriteccaib niasse tacre natairissem friss
glosses.glossFNs: ished inso afrecre donaib eriteccaib niasse tacre natairissem friss
footnotes: h: i.e. the Docetae. See Theodore of Mopsuestia, ed. Swete. II. 27
glosses.glossTrans: this is his answer to the heretics<sup>h</sup>: not easy is it to gainsay or withstand it.

glosses.latin: quia nos qui uiuimus, qui residui sumus in aduentum Domini, non praeueniemus eos qui dormierunt.
footnotes: d: a prima manu
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: quia nos qui uiuimus, qui residui sumus in aduentum Domini, non praeueniemus eos qui dormierunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]facit apostolus diem domini habere susceptum quasi eos in corpore inueniret[/GLat][e] [ie].i.[/ie] atcomlasom [GLat]híc[/GLat] lasnahí dofuircifea bráth imbethu [GLat]et[/GLat] bebté [GLat]et[/GLat]asseírset isind óinuáir
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: facit apostolus diem domini habere susceptum quasi eos in corpore inueniret .i. atcomlasom híc lasnahí dofuircifea bráth imbethu et bebté etasseírset isind óinuáir
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: facit apostolus diem domini habere susceptum quasi eos in corpore inuenirete .i. atcomlasom híc lasnahí dofuircifea bráth imbethu et bebté etasseírset isind óinuáir
footnotes: e: Semper Apostolus diem Domini fecit habere suspectum, quasi eos in corpore inveniret, Migne, col. 909
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he joins himself híc with those whom the Judgment will find alive, and who will die and arise in the same hour.

glosses.latin: quia nos qui uiuimus, qui residui sumus in aduentum Domini, non praeueniemus eos qui dormierunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]tam uelox erit eorum resurrectio quam nostra assumptio[/GLat][f] [ie].i.[/ie] atalat rabad assu atodiusgud ade
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: tam uelox erit eorum resurrectio quam nostra assumptio .i. atalat rabad assu atodiusgud ade
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: tam uelox erit eorum resurrectio quam nostra assumptiof .i. atalat rabad assu atodiusgud ade
footnotes: f: Migne, col. 909
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it seems to thee their awakening would be easier.

glosses.latin: Quoniam ipse Dominus in iusu, et in uoce archangili, et in tuba Dei discendet de cælo, et mortui, qui in Christo sunt, resurgent primi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be impossible for any one to sleep there.

glosses.latin: Quoniam ipse Dominus in iusu, et in uoce archangili, et in tuba Dei discendet de cælo, et mortui, qui in Christo sunt, resurgent primi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ifogur dǽ fessin [GLat]ut in monte sina[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ifogur dǽ fessin ut in monte sina
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ifogur dǽ fessin ut in monte sina
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the sound of God Himself ut etc.

glosses.latin: Quoniam ipse Dominus in iusu, et in uoce archangili, et in tuba Dei discendet de cælo, et mortui, qui in Christo sunt, resurgent primi.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quoniam ipse Dominus in iusu, et in uoce archangili, et in tuba Dei discendet de cælo, et mortui, qui in Christo sunt, resurgent primi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their resurrection will be prior.

glosses.latin: simul rapiemur cum illis in nubibus obuiam Christo in aëra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with the dead.

glosses.latin: simul rapiemur cum illis in nubibus obuiam Christo in aëra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. into the clouds.

glosses.latin: simul rapiemur cum illis in nubibus obuiam Christo in aëra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. into the air.

glosses.latin: Itaque consulamini inuicem in uerbís istis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bad nertad dúib inso asneírsid [GLat]et[/GLat] folnibthe lassincoimdid
glosses.glossText: .i. bad nertad dúib inso asneírsid et folnibthe lassincoimdid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bad nertad dúib inso asneírsid et folnibthe lassincoimdid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let this be an encouragement to you, that ye will arise and reign with the Lord.

glosses.latin: De temporibus autem, et momentis, fratres, non indigetis ut scribamus [uobis].
footnotes: e: Cf. 1 Cor. xv. 22
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be a time: it will be (but) a moment<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: De temporibus autem, et momentis, fratres, non indigetis ut scribamus [uobis].
glosses.glossFullTags: frecre inso do menmanib innaní asbertis cipadadéne indhesséirgi
glosses.glossText: frecre inso do menmanib innaní asbertis cipadadéne indhesséirgi
glosses.glossFNs: frecre inso do menmanib innaní asbertis cipadadéne indhesséirgi
footnotes: f: i.e. how speedily it would come
glosses.glossTrans: an answer, this, to the minds of those that used to say what would be the swiftness of the resurrection<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Ipsi enim diligenter scitis, quia dies Domini, sicut fúr in nocte, ita ueniet.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal dotéitside dogabáil báiguil intan nádnacastar [GLat]et[/GLat] nádforchluinter isamlid dorriga[c] dia dobráth intain nádtomnibther athíchtu[d]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal dotéitside dogabáil báiguil intan nádnacastar et nádforchluinter isamlid dorriga dia dobráth intain nádtomnibther athíchtu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal dotéitside dogabáil báiguil intan nádnacastar et nádforchluinter isamlid dorrigac dia dobráth intain nádtomnibther athíchtud
footnotes: c: Perhaps dorrega: the antepenultimate letter is not quite certain, but see Wb. 25a 38
d: At foot of this column is a half-obliterated note: Traditio iudeorum est christum media nocte uenturum ut in aegipt(o)...
g: lit. danger. Compare the phrase iar bhfagbháil baoghail fair (having found it unguarded), Four MM. ed. O’Don., A.D. 1440, note (x), and see LU. 75a 1, 75b 4, LL. 87a 12, Salt. Rann 3192
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as he comes to seize (his) opportunity<sup>g</sup>, when he is not seen and is not heard, even so God will come to judgment when His coming will not be expected.

glosses.latin: tunc repentinus eis superueniet interitus, ... et non efugient.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in l. marg.].....bera ade....duin [GLat]síc[/GLat].....rb do...ni derb cuin....
glosses.glossText: [in l. marg.].....bera ade....duin síc.....rb do...ni derb cuin....
glosses.glossFNs: [in l. marg.].....bera ade....duin síc.....rb do...ni derb cuin....
glosses.glossTrans: ..... to us .... not certain when ....

glosses.latin: tunc repentinus eis superueniet interitus, ... et non efugient.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be impossible for them.

glosses.latin: Uos autem, fratres, non estis in tenebris, ut uos dies illa tamquam fur conprehendat.
footnotes: h: For donad cf. Ml. 86d 8, Salt. Rann 1127, 1922
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is a consolation<sup>h</sup> and an encouragement.

glosses.latin: Uos autem, fratres, non estis in tenebris, ut uos dies illa tamquam fur conprehendat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without your knowing (it).

glosses.latin: uigelemus et sobrii simus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without sins.

glosses.latin: Nos autem, qui diei sumus, sobrii simus, induti luricam fidei et castitatis, et galeam spem salutis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre ammimaicc lai [GLat]et[/GLat]soilse naseichem na hí siu
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre ammimaicc lai etsoilse naseichem na hí siu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre ammimaicc lai etsoilse naseichem na hí siu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since we are children of day and of light, let us not follow these (sleep and drunkenness).

glosses.latin: Nos autem, qui diei sumus, sobrii simus, induti luricam fidei et castitatis, et galeam spem salutis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is spes.

glosses.latin: Nos autem, qui diei sumus, sobrii simus, induti luricam fidei et castitatis, et galeam spem salutis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to us.

glosses.latin: Quoniam non possuit nos Deus in iram, sed in operationem salutis per Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum.
footnotes: b: See above, p. 516, note b
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is in our power.

glosses.latin: Quoniam non possuit nos Deus in iram, sed in operationem salutis per Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may do works that effect salvation to us.

glosses.latin: Quoniam non possuit nos Deus in iram, sed in operationem salutis per Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, then, is through God’s appointment.

glosses.latin: Qui mortuus est pro nobis, ut siue uigilemus, siue dormiamus, simul cum illo uiuamus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] imbem imbethu imbem imbaás bad lessom [GLat]Aliter[/GLat] isdodiuchtrad [GLat]corporum et[/GLat] dochotlud [GLat]corporum[/GLat] arnatomnitisom biddoirgairiu cotulta [GLat]quando dixit non dormiamus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. imbem imbethu imbem imbaás bad lessom Aliter isdodiuchtrad corporum et dochotlud corporum arnatomnitisom biddoirgairiu cotulta quando dixit non dormiamus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. imbem imbethu imbem imbaás bad lessom Aliter isdodiuchtrad corporum et dochotlud corporum arnatomnitisom biddoirgairiu cotulta quando dixit non dormiamus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whether we be in life, whether we be in death, let it be with Him. Aliter: it is of the waking corporum and of the sleeping corporum, lest they should suppose that it is to prohibit sleep quando etc.

glosses.latin: Propter quod consulamini inuicem, et aedificate alterutrum, sicut et faciatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because ye have resurrection and princedom.

glosses.latin: Propter quod consulamini inuicem, et aedificate alterutrum, sicut et faciatis.
glosses.glossText: .i. ished dogniith ɫ. nataít forculu sicut facitis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished dogniith ɫ. nataít forculu sicut facitis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that ye do. Or go not back sicut facitis.

glosses.latin: eos qui ... praesunt uobís in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are before.

glosses.latin: Ut habeatis illos abundantius in caritate propter opus illorum; pacem habete cum illis.
glosses.glossTrans: beyond every one, for they are benefiting you.

glosses.latin: Ut habeatis illos abundantius in caritate propter opus illorum; pacem habete cum illis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. do what they say to you.

glosses.latin: Rogamus autem uos, fratres, corripite inquietos ... patientes estote ad omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: all this below is a recapitulation.

glosses.latin: Rogamus autem uos, fratres, corripite inquietos ... patientes estote ad omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the lazy folk that love to beg of every one.

glosses.latin: Uidete ne quis malum pro malo alicui reddat; sed semper quod bonum est sectamini.
footnotes: c: See v. 14
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the toleration which he has mentioned before.

glosses.latin: Uidete ne quis malum pro malo alicui reddat; sed semper quod bonum est sectamini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. forgiveness.

glosses.latin: Uidete ne quis malum pro malo alicui reddat; sed semper quod bonum est sectamini.
footnotes: d: leg. indéiricc?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for evil is the retaliation, good is the forgiveness.

glosses.latin: Sine intermisione orate.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] Ceist cate indirnig(d)e cen chumsanad nianse [GLat]dicunt alii[/GLat] combad (c)elebrad trátha [GLat](quod) non est uerum[/GLat] Ceist cate (nianse) intain donairber(ta)r inboill uili fri (c)aíngnimu [GLat]et[/GLat] bertar drogními essib arneigdet iarum fridia [GLat]quando bonum faciunt[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] tairbertar súili frideícsin maith [GLat](ut i)ob dicit pepigi fedus (cum) occulís meis[/GLat][a] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] Ceist cate indirnig(d)e cen chumsanad nianse dicunt alii combad (c)elebrad trátha (quod) non est uerum Ceist cate (nianse) intain donairber(ta)r inboill uili fri (c)aíngnimu et bertar drogními essib arneigdet iarum fridia quando bonum faciunt .i. tairbertar súili frideícsin maith (ut i)ob dicit pepigi fedus (cum) occulís meis rl.
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] Ceist cate indirnig(d)e cen chumsanad nianse dicunt alii combad (c)elebrad trátha (quod) non est uerum Ceist cate (nianse) intain donairber(ta)r inboill uili fri (c)aíngnimu et bertar drogními essib arneigdet iarum fridia quando bonum faciunt .i. tairbertar súili frideícsin maith (ut i)ob dicit pepigi fedus (cum) occulís meisa rl.
footnotes: a: Job xxxi. 1. The letters in parenthesis appear to have been in the margin, which has been mutilated by the bookbinder
b: See the glosses on Secundinus’ hymn, 1. 90, Todd, Lib. Hymn. p. 22
glosses.glossTrans: Question: what is prayer without ceasing? Easy (to answer): dicunt alii that it is celebration of the canonical hour<sup>b</sup>, quod non est uerum. Question, what is it? Easy to answer: when all the members (of the body) are subdued to good deeds, and evil deeds are put away from them; they pray, then, to God quando honum faciunt, that is, their eyes are inclined to see (the) good, ut Iob dicit etc.

glosses.latin: Omnia autem probate, quod bonum est tenete.
glosses.glossTrans: every good thing which he preaches fulfil ye it.

glosses.latin: Omnia autem probate, quod bonum est tenete.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. namely, in the teaching.

glosses.latin: Ipse autem Deus pacis sanctificet uos per omnia, ut intiger spiritus uester, et anima, et corpus sine querella in aduontu Domini ... seruetur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rann airegde innaanme [GLat]quo intellegamus[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]spiritus sanctus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] amal donecomnacht duún
glosses.glossText: .i. rann airegde innaanme quo intellegamus ɫ. spiritus sanctus .i. amal donecomnacht duún
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rann airegde innaanme quo intellegamus ɫ. spiritus sanctus .i. amal donecomnacht duún
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the superior part of the mind quo inlellegamus, uel Spiritus sanctus i.e. as it hath been imparted to us.

glosses.latin: Ipse autem Deus pacis sanctificet uos per omnia, ut intiger spiritus uester, et anima, et corpus sine querella in aduontu Domini ... seruetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without ... vices.

glosses.latin: Fidelis est, qui uocauit uos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God is faithful; what He has promised will be true.

glosses.latin: ... in osculo sancto.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non sanctum osculum uigelat alias aeclesias non in deo collectas[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. non sanctum osculum uigelat alias aeclesias non in deo collectas
glosses.glossFNs: .i. non sanctum osculum uigelat alias aeclesias non in deo collectas
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Adiuro uos per Dominum, ut legatur aepistola haec omnibus sanctis fratribus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Adiuro uos per Dominum, ut legatur aepistola haec omnibus sanctis fratribus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it be read out.

glosses.latin: Adiuro uos per Dominum, ut legatur aepistola haec omnibus sanctis fratribus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that they may not all be ignorant of it.

glosses.latin: Gratia Domini ... cum omnibus uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without exception.

glosses.latLine: 2 Thes. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Explicit ad Thessalonicenses epistola prima. Incipit argumentum saecundae. Ad Thessalonicenses sæcundam scripsit apostolus et notum facit eís de temporibus nouissimís, et de aduersarii deceptione; scripsit hanc æpistolam ab Athenís per Tithicum diaconem et Honessimum acolitum. Explicit argumentum. Incipit textus eiusdem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. how long (it will be) until Antichrist’s coming.

glosses.latLine: 2 Thes. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Explicit ad Thessalonicenses epistola prima. Incipit argumentum saecundae. Ad Thessalonicenses sæcundam scripsit apostolus et notum facit eís de temporibus nouissimís, et de aduersarii deceptione; scripsit hanc æpistolam ab Athenís per Tithicum diaconem et Honessimum acolitum. Explicit argumentum. Incipit textus eiusdem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latLine: 2 Thes. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Explicit ad Thessalonicenses epistola prima. Incipit argumentum saecundae. Ad Thessalonicenses sæcundam scripsit apostolus et notum facit eís de temporibus nouissimís, et de aduersarii deceptione; scripsit hanc æpistolam ab Athenís per Tithicum diaconem et Honessimum acolitum. Explicit argumentum. Incipit textus eiusdem.
footnotes: e: See above, p. 654, note e
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a man who carries a taper<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Paulus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] niepir som ainm napstalacte [GLat]híc[/GLat] aris foirbthe in cách diarroscribad
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] niepir som ainm napstalacte híc aris foirbthe in cách diarroscribad
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] niepir som ainm napstalacte híc aris foirbthe in cách diarroscribad
glosses.glossTrans: he saith not híc (the) name of apostolate, for every one to whom it has been written is perfect.

glosses.latin: abundat caritas uniuscuiusque uestrum inuicem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. each of you loves the other inuicem.

glosses.latin: Ita ut et nos ipsi in uobís gloriemur ... in omnibus persecutionibus uestrís, et in tribulationibus quas sustenetis.
glosses.glossFullTags: ibarfoirbthetusi [GLat]in fide et caritate et in patientia[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: ibarfoirbthetusi in fide et caritate et in patientia
glosses.glossFNs: ibarfoirbthetusi in fide et caritate et in patientia
glosses.glossTrans: in your perfection in fide etc.

glosses.latin: Ita ut et nos ipsi in uobís gloriemur ... in omnibus persecutionibus uestrís, et in tribulationibus quas sustenetis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. strong is your faith in the sufferings.

glosses.latin: In exemplum iusti iudicii Dei, ut digni habeamini in regno Dei, pro quo et patiemini.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] foditiu fochide duib si tresindippiat fochricci gním pectho do bar célib tresindabia pían ished andédesin didiu bias [GLat]in die iudicii praemium iustís páena peccatoribus[/GLat] adib dessimrecht si tra dosin tre foditin ingremmen
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] foditiu fochide duib si tresindippiat fochricci gním pectho do bar célib tresindabia pían ished andédesin didiu bias in die iudicii praemium iustís páena peccatoribus adib dessimrecht si tra dosin tre foditin ingremmen
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] foditiu fochide duib si tresindippiat fochricci gním pectho do bar célib tresindabia pían ished andédesin didiu bias in die iudicii praemium iustís páena peccatoribus adib dessimrecht si tra dosin tre foditin ingremmen
glosses.glossTrans: endurance of sufferings by you, through which ye will have rewards: commission of sin by your fellows, through which they will have punishment: it is those two things, then, that will be in die iudicii etc. Ye are an ensample, then, thereunto through endurance of persecutions.

glosses.latin: In exemplum iusti iudicii Dei, ut digni habeamini in regno Dei, pro quo et patiemini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye will not regret to support them.

glosses.latin: Si tamen iustum est apud Deum, retribuere tribulationem iis qui uos tribulant.
footnotes: d: leg. is fír ón
f: i.e. it is certainly just
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is certain, it is just<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: Si tamen iustum est apud Deum, retribuere tribulationem iis qui uos tribulant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. O righteous ones!

glosses.latin: Et uobis ... requiem nobiscum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. uitam aeternam as will be given to us apostles.

glosses.latin: In flamma ignis dantis uendictam hís qui non nouerunt Deum, et qui non oboediunt euangelio Domini nostri Iesu Christi;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be like unto the first coming.

glosses.latin: In flamma ignis dantis uendictam hís qui non nouerunt Deum, et qui non oboediunt euangelio Domini nostri Iesu Christi;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dosnaidlibea uili niain nechtar náii indí nachidchualatar [GLat]et[/GLat] tremitíagat
glosses.glossText: .i. dosnaidlibea uili niain nechtar náii indí nachidchualatar et tremitíagat
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dosnaidlibea uili niain nechtar náii indí nachidchualatar et tremitíagat
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He will visit them all, He will not protect either of them, (namely) those who heard it not and those who transgress it.

glosses.latin: Qui penas soluent in interitu in aeternum, a facie Domini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who will endure.

glosses.latin: Qui penas soluent in interitu in aeternum, a facie Domini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without remission of tribulation from His presence(?), but destruction.

glosses.latin: Qui penas soluent in interitu in aeternum, a facie Domini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from God’s face (is) their destruction.

glosses.latin: Cum uenerit glorificari in sanctís suís, et admirabilis fieri in omnibus qui crediderunt; quia creditum est illis testimonium nostrum super uos in die illo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through giving reward to them.

glosses.latin: Cum uenerit glorificari in sanctís suís, et admirabilis fieri in omnibus qui crediderunt; quia creditum est illis testimonium nostrum super uos in die illo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intain dombéra dígail forpecthachu [GLat]et praemia iustís[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. intain dombéra dígail forpecthachu et praemia iustís
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intain dombéra dígail forpecthachu et praemia iustís
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when He will inflict punishment on sinners and (bestow) praemia iustis.

glosses.latin: Cum uenerit glorificari in sanctís suís, et admirabilis fieri in omnibus qui crediderunt; quia creditum est illis testimonium nostrum super uos in die illo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rocreitsidsi aforcell forrogelsamni dúib dilaithiu brátho [vel]ɫ.[/vel] roerbad dúnni forcell dothabirt díbsi illaithiu bratho
glosses.glossText: .i. rocreitsidsi aforcell forrogelsamni dúib dilaithiu brátho ɫ. roerbad dúnni forcell dothabirt díbsi illaithiu bratho
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rocreitsidsi aforcell forrogelsamni dúib dilaithiu brátho ɫ. roerbad dúnni forcell dothabirt díbsi illaithiu bratho
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye have believed the testimony which we have testified unto you of doomsday. Or we have been entrusted to bear testimony of you on doomsday.

glosses.latin: In quo etiam oramus semper pro uobis, ut ... impleat omnem uoluntatem bonitatis, et opus fidei in uirtute.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we pray that the testimony which we give you may be good.

glosses.latin: In quo etiam oramus semper pro uobis, ut ... impleat omnem uoluntatem bonitatis, et opus fidei in uirtute.
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄdip atholsom dognedsi ɫ. ↄdibmaith fartolsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄdip atholsom dognedsi ɫ. ↄdibmaith fartolsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it may be His will which ye do, or that your will may be good.

glosses.latin: In quo etiam oramus semper pro uobis, ut ... impleat omnem uoluntatem bonitatis, et opus fidei in uirtute.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄroib gním irisse lib inneurt hirisse
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄroib gním irisse lib inneurt hirisse
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄroib gním irisse lib inneurt hirisse
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye may have the work of faith in the power of faith.

glosses.latin: Rogamus autem uos, fratres, per aduentum Domini nostri, ... et nostrae congregationis in ipsum.
footnotes: a: i.e. by your expectation of Christ’s coming
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for sake of, if ye expect Christ<sup>a</sup>.

glosses.latin: Rogamus autem uos, fratres, per aduentum Domini nostri, ... et nostrae congregationis in ipsum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre aruntáa uili techt archenn crist domess fornn
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre aruntáa uili techt archenn crist domess fornn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre aruntáa uili techt archenn crist domess fornn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it remains for us all to go before Christ to have judgment upon us.

glosses.latin: Ut non cito moueamini a uestro sensu, neque terreamini ...
glosses.glossFullTags: níarmad maith lessom incumscugud mall act isarnabǽ étir
glosses.glossText: níarmad maith lessom incumscugud mall act isarnabǽ étir
glosses.glossFNs: níarmad maith lessom incumscugud mall act isarnabǽ étir
glosses.glossTrans: it is not that he liked the slow movement, but that it may not be at all.

glosses.latin: Ut non cito moueamini a uestro sensu, neque terreamini ...
glosses.glossTrans: so that ye should forsake the evangelical doctrine.

glosses.latin: quasi instet dies Domini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though they say that Doomsday is at hand.

glosses.latin: Ne quis uos seducat, ullo modo, quoniam nisi uenerit primum discessio, et reuelatus fuerit homo peccati, filius perditionis.
footnotes: a: leg., with Sarauw, ciatloid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is dearest to me that ye escape.

glosses.latin: Ne quis uos seducat, ullo modo, quoniam nisi uenerit primum discessio, et reuelatus fuerit homo peccati, filius perditionis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of all that he has said.

glosses.latin: Ne quis uos seducat, ullo modo, quoniam nisi uenerit primum discessio, et reuelatus fuerit homo peccati, filius perditionis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ne quis uos seducat, ullo modo, quoniam nisi uenerit primum discessio, et reuelatus fuerit homo peccati, filius perditionis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of full sin.

glosses.latin: Qui aduersatur, et extollitur supra omne quod dicitur Deus, aut quod colitur, ita ut in teplo Dei sedeat, ostendens se tamquam sit Deus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]christo et membris eius[/GLat] [in marg.] cotí irchre fla(tho) román [ie].i.[/ie] tóiniud flatho óróma(nib) [vel]ɫ.[/vel] tóiniud niressach inamiriss [vel]ɫ.[/vel] cotí intí diantainm discessio [ie].i.[/ie] diabul arisainm dosuidiu [GLat]discessio et refuga[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. christo et membris eius [in marg.] cotí irchre fla(tho) román .i. tóiniud flatho óróma(nib) ɫ. tóiniud niressach inamiriss ɫ. cotí intí diantainm discessio .i. diabul arisainm dosuidiu discessio et refuga
glosses.glossFNs: .i. christo et membris eius [in marg.] cotí irchre fla(tho) román .i. tóiniud flatho óróma(nib) ɫ. tóiniud niressach inamiriss ɫ. cotí intí diantainm discessio .i. diabul arisainm dosuidiu discessio et refuga
footnotes: g: Desertio ueritatis uel sui principatus; siue discessio gentilium a Romano imperio...Discessio autem Diabolus non immerito dicitur, ab eo quod discessit a Deo, Primasius, Migne, P.L. 68, 648
glosses.glossTrans: until the fall of the Romans’ realm shall come, even the coming down of the realm from the Romans; or the coming down of the faithful into unfaith; or until he whose name is Discessio shall come, even the Devil, for Discessio et Refuga is a name for him<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Qui aduersatur, et extollitur supra omne quod dicitur Deus, aut quod colitur, ita ut in teplo Dei sedeat, ostendens se tamquam sit Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he will say he possesses every power that belongs to God.

glosses.latin: Qui aduersatur, et extollitur supra omne quod dicitur Deus, aut quod colitur, ita ut in teplo Dei sedeat, ostendens se tamquam sit Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as if he were God.

glosses.latin: Qui aduersatur, et extollitur supra omne quod dicitur Deus, aut quod colitur, ita ut in teplo Dei sedeat, ostendens se tamquam sit Deus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [b]seiss[/b] itempul amal [c]donessid[/c] crist [vel]ɫ.[/vel] dogéntar aidchumtach tempuil less [GLat]et[/GLat] pridchibid smactu rechto fetarlicce [GLat]et[/GLat]gebtit [GLat]iudei[/GLat] inapid[d] [GLat]et[/GLat] ↄscéra rect núiadnissi
glosses.glossText: seiss itempul amal donessid crist ɫ. dogéntar aidchumtach tempuil less et pridchibid smactu rechto fetarlicce etgebtit iudei inapid et ↄscéra rect núiadnissi
glosses.glossFNs: seissb itempul amal donessidc crist ɫ. dogéntar aidchumtach tempuil less et pridchibid smactu rechto fetarlicce etgebtit iudei inapidd et ↄscéra rect núiadnissi
footnotes: b: In the MS. it looks like isses, or, according to Chroust, rather issis; cf. Séis na tri suidiu, Egerton 1782, fo. 17b
c: MS. donesfid: corr. Thurneysen
d: according to Chroust’s reading of the MS.
h: ab .i. tighearna, O’Cl.

i: Templum Hierosolymis restituet et omnia Legis caeremonialia restaurabit, tantum ut Euangelium Christi dissoluat; quae res miserabiles Iudaeos eum pro Christo suscipere persuadebit, in suo, non in Dei nomine uenientem, Primasius
glosses.glossTrans: he will sit in the Temple as Christ sat. Or rebuilding of the Temple will be wrought by him, and he will preach the institutes of the law of the Old Testament, and Iudaei will receive him as lord<sup>h</sup>, and he will destroy the law of the New Testament<sup>i</sup>.

glosses.latin: Non retinetis quod ... haec dicebam uobis?
footnotes: e: leg. inní ‘is it something’?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. something which ye do not remember.

glosses.latin: Et nunc quid detineat scitis, ut reueletur in suo tempore.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. destruction of the Romans’ realm (will take place) before.

glosses.latin: Et nunc quid detineat scitis, ut reueletur in suo tempore.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rofitid cid aridfuirig afoilsigud [ie].i.[/ie] ↄtí indaimser doarchet dó
glosses.glossText: .i. rofitid cid aridfuirig afoilsigud .i. ↄtí indaimser doarchet dó
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rofitid cid aridfuirig afoilsigud .i. ↄtí indaimser doarchet dó
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye know what delays his manifestation, till the time come which has been foretold of him.

glosses.latin: Nam ministerium iam operatur iniquitatis; tantum ut qui tenet nunc, teneat, donec de medio fiat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cinidaccastar[f] ni nachthised agním arandogenadsom iártichte dagní amuntar [GLat]et[/GLat] dagniat abaill ished inso fodrig
glosses.glossText: .i. cinidaccastar ni nachthised agním arandogenadsom iártichte dagní amuntar et dagniat abaill ished inso fodrig
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cinidaccastarf ni nachthised agním arandogenadsom iártichte dagní amuntar et dagniat abaill ished inso fodrig
footnotes: f: ciniaccastar might have been expected
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though he be not seen. Not that his work has not come, for what he would do after coming his household doth it and his members do it: it is this that delays him.

glosses.latin: Nam ministerium iam operatur iniquitatis; tantum ut qui tenet nunc, teneat, donec de medio fiat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. while he holds.

glosses.latin: Nam ministerium iam operatur iniquitatis; tantum ut qui tenet nunc, teneat, donec de medio fiat.
glosses.glossTrans: on the spot, so that he may not be for long.

glosses.latin: Et tunc reuelabitur ille iniquus, quem Dominus ... destruet inlustratione aduentus sui.
glosses.glossTrans: provided all this be fulfilled.

glosses.latin: Et tunc reuelabitur ille iniquus, quem Dominus ... destruet inlustratione aduentus sui.
glosses.glossTrans: Antichrist.

glosses.latin: Et tunc reuelabitur ille iniquus, quem Dominus ... destruet inlustratione aduentus sui.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. by the brightness of Christ’s Godhead.

glosses.latin: Cuius est aduentus secundum operationem Satane, in omni uirtute, et signís, et prodigís mendacibus.
glosses.glossTrans: he will be opposed to God with His Gospel.

glosses.latin: Cuius est aduentus secundum operationem Satane, in omni uirtute, et signís, et prodigís mendacibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they (the prodigia) all will be lying.

glosses.latin: Cuius est aduentus secundum operationem Satane, in omni uirtute, et signís, et prodigís mendacibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: dogéna sáibfirtu [GLat]et[/GLat] sáibairde amal dondrigénsat druid triitsom
glosses.glossText: dogéna sáibfirtu et sáibairde amal dondrigénsat druid triitsom
glosses.glossFNs: dogéna sáibfirtu et sáibairde amal dondrigénsat druid triitsom
glosses.glossTrans: he (Antichrist) will perform false miracles and false signs, as wizards have done it through him.

glosses.latin: Et in omni seductione iniquitatis iis qui pereunt, eo quod caritatem ueritatis non receperunt, ut salui fierent. Ideo mittit illís Deus operationem erroris, ut credant mendacio.
footnotes: a: = sóibfitir, cf. saibes in obar, Wb. 27a 9
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they will be perverted into iniquity.

glosses.latin: Et in omni seductione iniquitatis iis qui pereunt, eo quod caritatem ueritatis non receperunt, ut salui fierent. Ideo mittit illís Deus operationem erroris, ut credant mendacio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if they should receive it.

glosses.latin: Ut iudicentur omnes qui non crediderunt ueritati sed consenserunt iniquitati.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] nitellfea doib irchoimted [GLat]in hora iudicii quando dicetur ad illos cúr non credidistis christo[/GLat] nianse [GLat]quia non agnouimus illum et celauit homanitas diuinitatem eius[/GLat] sechrocreitsidsi dodémun ciarudbói colinn imbi immaircide didiu indhí nád arróimsat buith [GLat]in gloria christi[/GLat] cerubet ipéin ladiabul
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] nitellfea doib irchoimted in hora iudicii quando dicetur ad illos cúr non credidistis christo nianse quia non agnouimus illum et celauit homanitas diuinitatem eius sechrocreitsidsi dodémun ciarudbói colinn imbi immaircide didiu indhí nád arróimsat buith in gloria christi cerubet ipéin ladiabul
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] nitellfea doib irchoimted in hora iudicii quando dicetur ad illos cúr non credidistis christo nianse quia non agnouimus illum et celauit homanitas diuinitatem eius sechrocreitsidsi dodémun ciarudbói colinn imbi immaircide didiu indhí nád arróimsat buith in gloria christi cerubet ipéin ladiabul
glosses.glossTrans: it will be impossible for them to excuse (themselves) in hora iudicii quando dicetur ad illos: Cur non credidistis Christo? “Easy (to answer), quia non agnouimus Illum, et celauit humanitas diuinitatem eius.” “Yet ye have believed in the Devil though he (also) had flesh around him.” It is meet then, that they who have not accepted existence in gloria Christi should be in punishment with the Devil.

glosses.latin: debemus gratias agere ... pro uobis, fratres dilecti á Deo, quod elegerit nos Deus primitias, ... in fide ueritatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God has elected you.

glosses.latin: debemus gratias agere ... pro uobis, fratres dilecti á Deo, quod elegerit nos Deus primitias, ... in fide ueritatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. into the apostolate, so that ye have taken example from us.

glosses.latin: debemus gratias agere ... pro uobis, fratres dilecti á Deo, quod elegerit nos Deus primitias, ... in fide ueritatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which ye have.

glosses.latin: In qua et uocauit uos per euangelium nostrum, in adquisitione gloriae Domini nostri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through our teaching.

glosses.latin: In qua et uocauit uos per euangelium nostrum, in adquisitione gloriae Domini nostri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye be in glory with Christ.

glosses.latin: Ipse autem Dominus noster Iesus Christus, et Deus Pater noster qui ... dedit consulationem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] [GLat]ostendit hic[/GLat] intreodatid [GLat]filium quando dicit dominus noster patrem quando dicit deus spiritum sanctum quando dicit consulatorem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] ostendit hic intreodatid filium quando dicit dominus noster patrem quando dicit deus spiritum sanctum quando dicit consulatorem
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] ostendit hic intreodatid filium quando dicit dominus noster patrem quando dicit deus spiritum sanctum quando dicit consulatorem
footnotes: b: Olden remarked that this gloss must have been taken from a commentary on a text in which (as in the Vulgate) there was an et after Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: ostendit híc the Threeness<sup>b</sup>, Filium etc.

glosses.latin: Exhortetur corda uestra, et confirmet in omni opere et sermone bono.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] badmaith forṅgnim [GLat]et[/GLat] formbriathar arbid loor dobar niráil
glosses.glossText: .i. badmaith forṅgnim et formbriathar arbid loor dobar niráil
glosses.glossFNs: .i. badmaith forṅgnim et formbriathar arbid loor dobar niráil
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let your deed and your word be good, for it will be enough to commend you.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, orate pro nobis, ut sermo Domini currat, et clarificetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from here onwards.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, orate pro nobis, ut sermo Domini currat, et clarificetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is due discipulis etc.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, orate pro nobis, ut sermo Domini currat, et clarificetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. into every one’s heart.

glosses.latin: De caetero, fratres, orate pro nobis, ut sermo Domini currat, et clarificetur.
glosses.glossTrans: pray ye for nothing else but the gift of teaching.

glosses.latin: Et ut liberemur ab inoportunís et malis hominibus; non enim omnium est fides.
footnotes: b: cf. doduthris, Wb. 20b 9
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who wish ill to us.

glosses.latin: Et ut liberemur ab inoportunís et malis hominibus; non enim omnium est fides.
glosses.glossTrans: all are not perfect.

glosses.latin: Fidelis autem Deus est, qui confirmauit [uos], et custodiet a malo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is manifest that they all are not perfect.

glosses.latin: Fidelis autem Deus est, qui confirmauit [uos], et custodiet a malo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He is able to protect you.

glosses.latin: Confidimus autem de uobis ... quoniam quae praecipimus, et facitis et facietis.
footnotes: c: according to Chroust, cf. taraisnech Ml. 58c 18, taraisnigte Ml. 39b 9, nantarasnigthi ‘nec confidendum,’ Ml. 144a 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is we trustful<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Confidimus autem de uobis ... quoniam quae praecipimus, et facitis et facietis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye have fulfilled what we have preached to you.

glosses.latin: Dominus autem dirigat corda uestra in caritate Dei et patientia Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄrogbaid desemrecht dicrist amal rombo ainmnetach oc fulung fochide [vel]ɫ.[/vel] combad ainmn(etich) ocindn(idiu) laithi (brá)th(a)
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄrogbaid desemrecht dicrist amal rombo ainmnetach oc fulung fochide ɫ. combad ainmn(etich) ocindn(idiu) laithi (brá)th(a)
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄrogbaid desemrecht dicrist amal rombo ainmnetach oc fulung fochide ɫ. combad ainmn(etich) ocindn(idiu) laithi (brá)th(a)
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye may take example from Christ, as He was patient in enduring sufferings. Or so that ye should be patient in awaiting Doomsday.

glosses.latin: Denuntiamus autem uobís, ... ut subtrahatis uos ab omni fratre ambulante inordinate, et non secundum traditionem quam acceperunt a nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we beseech of you.

glosses.latin: Denuntiamus autem uobís, ... ut subtrahatis uos ab omni fratre ambulante inordinate, et non secundum traditionem quam acceperunt a nobís.
footnotes: e: ambulante: Olden compared the Anglo-Irish ‘walking to support myself’
glosses.glossTrans: to beg<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Denuntiamus autem uobís, ... ut subtrahatis uos ab omni fratre ambulante inordinate, et non secundum traditionem quam acceperunt a nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Denuntiamus autem uobís, ... ut subtrahatis uos ab omni fratre ambulante inordinate, et non secundum traditionem quam acceperunt a nobís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni uainn raucsat ní accatar linn
glosses.glossText: .i. ni uainn raucsat ní accatar linn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni uainn raucsat ní accatar linn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not from us they have taken it, they have not seen it with us.

glosses.latin: Ipsi enim scitis, quemadmodum oporteat imitari nos, quoniam non inquieti fuimus inter uos.
glosses.glossTrans: ye are knowing therein.

glosses.latin: Ipsi enim scitis, quemadmodum oporteat imitari nos, quoniam non inquieti fuimus inter uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nongabthe desemrecht diínn nínchruth hí thall [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]non inquiete[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nongabthe desemrecht diínn nínchruth hí thall .i. non inquiete
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nongabthe desemrecht diínn nínchruth hí thall .i. non inquiete
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that ye should take example from us, not in that manner.

glosses.latin: Ipsi enim scitis, quemadmodum oporteat imitari nos, quoniam non inquieti fuimus inter uos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nírbommar utmuill ocfoigdi [GLat]inter uos[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nírbommar tromdi
glosses.glossText: .i. nírbommar utmuill ocfoigdi inter uos ɫ. nírbommar tromdi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nírbommar utmuill ocfoigdi inter uos ɫ. nírbommar tromdi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we have not been restless in begging inter uos, or we have not been oppressive.

glosses.latin: Neque gratis panem manducabimus ab aliquo, sed . . nocte et die operantes.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Neque gratis panem manducabimus ab aliquo, sed . . nocte et die operantes.
glosses.glossTrans: unless we had bought it with the fruit of our hands.

glosses.latin: Neque gratis panem manducabimus ab aliquo, sed . . nocte et die operantes.
glosses.glossTrans: to make ropes by night, to preach by day.

glosses.latin: ut nosmet ipsos formam daremus uobis ad emidandos nos.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] commimmis angraib dúibsi dogabaal[a] desimrechta díinni
glosses.glossText: .i. commimmis angraib dúibsi dogabaal desimrechta díinni
glosses.glossFNs: .i. commimmis angraib dúibsi dogabaal<sup>a</sup> desimrechta díinni
footnotes: a: recte dogabáil
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may be a pattern to you to take example from us.

glosses.latin: haec denuntiabamus uobís, quoniam si quis non uult operari, nec manducet.
glosses.glossTrans: we used to say it to you.

glosses.latin: haec denuntiabamus uobís, quoniam si quis non uult operari, nec manducet.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is its penance for it.

glosses.latin: haec denuntiabamus uobís, quoniam si quis non uult operari, nec manducet.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] ↄammadarsa andígail forru [ie].i.[/ie] bot(h doib) cen biad ma(ni)... irgn...
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] ↄammadarsa andígail forru .i. bot(h doib) cen biad ma(ni)... irgn...
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] ↄammadarsa andígail forru .i. bot(h doib) cen biad ma(ni)... irgn...
footnotes: e: conammadar = con-ad-madar, where the ad is perfective
glosses.glossTrans: I have adjudged<sup>e</sup> their punishment on them, that is, for them to be without food, unless they ...

glosses.latin: Audiuimus enim inter uos quosdam ambulare inquiete, nihil operantes, sed curiose agentes.
footnotes: b: leg. indualchib ‘in vices’
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Audiuimus enim inter uos quosdam ambulare inquiete, nihil operantes, sed curiose agentes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nip[c] arirlami far cúrsagtha manicloimmis forndrogscéla
glosses.glossText: .i. nip arirlami far cúrsagtha manicloimmis forndrogscéla
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nip<sup>c</sup> arirlami far cúrsagtha manicloimmis forndrogscéla
footnotes: c: leg. nipu? or is it subjunctive?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it was not on account of readiness to reproach you unless we should have heard evil tidings of you.

glosses.latin: Audiuimus enim inter uos quosdam ambulare inquiete, nihil operantes, sed curiose agentes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iarfigid dús cia port indib maith óigedacht
glosses.glossText: .i. iarfigid dús cia port indib maith óigedacht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iarfigid dús cia port indib maith óigedacht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a seeking to know in what place guesting is good.

glosses.latin: ut cum silentio operantes, suum panem manducent.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without asking aught of any one.

glosses.latin: si quis non obedit ... hunc notate, et ne commonicamini cum illo, ut confundatur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. blame ye.

glosses.latin: si quis non obedit ... hunc notate, et ne commonicamini cum illo, ut confundatur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] duús indip fochunn ícce do aindarpe aoentu [d][GLat]fratrum[/GLat][/d] arisrucce dó
glosses.glossText: .i. duús indip fochunn ícce do aindarpe aoentu fratrum arisrucce dó
glosses.glossFNs: .i. duús indip fochunn ícce do aindarpe aoentu fratrumd arisrucce dó
footnotes: d: MS. fratruum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if perchance his expulsion from the unity of the brethren may be cause of salvation to him, for it is a shame to him.

glosses.latin: Et nolite quasi inimicum existimare, sed corripite ut fratrem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not the correction be hostile.

glosses.latin: Et nolite quasi inimicum existimare, sed corripite ut fratrem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. correct him.

glosses.latin: Dominus pacis det uobis pacem sempiternam in omni loco.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄroib core dúib fricách [GLat]et[/GLat] dochach fribsi
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄroib core dúib fricách et dochach fribsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄroib core dúib fricách et dochach fribsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that there may be peace to you from every one and to every one from you.

glosses.latin: Salutatio mea manu Pauli; quod est signum in omni æpistola; ita scribo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] commad in so sís roscribad som combad suaíchnid leosom ataa icach epistil asainchomarde sin
glosses.glossText: .i. commad in so sís roscribad som combad suaíchnid leosom ataa icach epistil asainchomarde sin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. commad in so sís roscribad som combad suaíchnid leosom ataa icach epistil asainchomarde sin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it would be this below that he wrote: it would be well known to them: in every epistle is this special sign.

glosses.latin: Salutatio mea manu Pauli; quod est signum in omni æpistola; ita scribo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this below.

glosses.latin: Paulus apostolus Christi Iesu per uoluntatem Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] tadbatsom [GLat]híc nomen apostoli[/GLat][a] huare (con)secha alaill indib
glosses.glossText: .i. tadbatsom híc nomen apostoli huare (con)secha alaill indib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. tadbatsom híc nomen apostolia huare (con)secha alaill indib
footnotes: a: cf. Wb. 23a 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he manifests híc nomen apostoli because he corrects another thing in them.

glosses.latin: Paulus apostolus Christi Iesu per uoluntatem Dei.
glosses.glossFullTags: isóentu doathir [GLat]et[/GLat] macc oc [b]mothoóitse[/b] for apstalact cucuibsi
glosses.glossText: isóentu doathir et macc oc mothoóitse for apstalact cucuibsi
glosses.glossFNs: isóentu doathir et macc oc mothoóitseb for apstalact cucuibsi
footnotes: b: MS. mothoéitse: corr. Sarauw, see Wb. 14b 3
glosses.glossTrans: Father and Son are at one in sending me on (the) apostolate unto you.

glosses.latin: fructificat et crescit, sicut in uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: as it increases and fructifies in you.

glosses.latin: Sicut dedicistis ab Ephafra.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is he who has first preached to you.

glosses.latin: in omni sapientia et intellectu spiritali.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of knowledge of the Godhead.

glosses.latin: in omni sapientia et intellectu spiritali.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ἀναγωγή.

glosses.latin: in omni sapientia et intellectu spiritali.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the knowledge of the divine mysteries.

glosses.latin: in omni opere bono fructificantes, et crescentes in scientia Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: so that your good deeds may be abundant.

glosses.latin: in omni opere bono fructificantes, et crescentes in scientia Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of knowledge of God.

glosses.latin: Qui eripuit nos et transtulit in regnum Filii dilectionis suae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may be in the Kingdom with Christ.

glosses.latin: In quo habemus redemptionem et remisionem peccatorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is through Him that our sins have been forgiven to us.

glosses.latin: Qui est imago Dei inuissibilis.
glosses.glossFullTags: fírdelb [GLat]dei caeli[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]per ipsum cognoscitur deus pater[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: fírdelb dei caeli ɫ. per ipsum cognoscitur deus pater
glosses.glossFNs: fírdelb dei caeli ɫ. per ipsum cognoscitur deus pater
glosses.glossTrans: the very image Dei caeli, uel etc.

glosses.latin: Et ipse est ante omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for He is ever existent.

glosses.latin: primogenitus ex mortuis, ut sit in omnibus ipse primatum tenens.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it may be He who is a unique leader.

glosses.latin: Quia in ipso conplacuit omnem plenitudinem diuinitatis habitare.
footnotes: c: cf. atruirmed Wb. 2c 6, atroillisset 4c 15
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the whole fulness Diuinitatis that has dwelt in Christ.

glosses.latin: pacificans per sanguinem crucis eius, siue quae in caelis, siue quae in terrís sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. crux is a name for the act of crucifying.

glosses.latin: pacificans per sanguinem crucis eius, siue quae in caelis, siue quae in terrís sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. peace has been made between the household of heaven and (that) of earth.

glosses.latin: inmubiles ad spem euangeli, quod audistis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]spe future glorie[/GLat] bias dúib innim [GLat]et[/GLat] pridchabthar hisoscélu
glosses.glossText: .i. spe future glorie bias dúib innim et pridchabthar hisoscélu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. spe future glorie bias dúib innim et pridchabthar hisoscélu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. spe futurae gloriae that ye will have in heaven and which will be preached in the gospel.

glosses.latin: nunc gaudeo in passionibus pro uobís, et impleo ea quae desunt passionum Christi, in carne mea, pro corpore eius, quod est æclesia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (in hope) that ye might take example from us.

glosses.latin: nunc gaudeo in passionibus pro uobís, et impleo ea quae desunt passionum Christi, in carne mea, pro corpore eius, quod est æclesia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aní dodesta dichomalnad cæsta crist domsa isocca attóo ishéd didiu desta[a] disudiu dul martre tarfarcennsi
glosses.glossText: .i. aní dodesta dichomalnad cæsta crist domsa isocca attóo ishéd didiu desta disudiu dul martre tarfarcennsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aní dodesta dichomalnad cæsta crist domsa isocca attóo ishéd didiu desta<sup>a</sup> disudiu dul martre tarfarcennsi
footnotes: a: leg. dodesta
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that which was lacking of the fulfilment of Christ’s Passion by me, at that I am. This, then, is what is wanting of it, to go to martyrdom for your sake.

glosses.latin: ut impleam uerbum dei.
footnotes: b: His Birth, Baptism, Crucifixion, Burial, Resurrection, Ascension, coming to the Last Judgment; Scúap Chrábuid, Otia Merseiana II. 97
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the seven things that have been prophesied of Christ<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Misterium, quod absconditum fuit a seculís et generationibus, nunc autem manifestum est sanctis eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the mysteries of the Godhead till I have uplifted them gentibus.

glosses.latin: Misterium, quod absconditum fuit a seculís et generationibus, nunc autem manifestum est sanctis eius.
footnotes: c: See O’Don. Supp. s.v. togbhail, Sarauw
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that mystery has appeared<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Quibus uoluit Deus notas facere diuitias gloriae sacramenti huius in gentibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it might be known to them.

glosses.latin: Quibus uoluit Deus notas facere diuitias gloriae sacramenti huius in gentibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the salvation of the race of men.

glosses.latin: Quibus uoluit Deus notas facere diuitias gloriae sacramenti huius in gentibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for not even heaven’s household knows it.

glosses.latin: docentes omnem hominem in omni sapientia, ut exhibeamus omnem hominem perfectum in Iesu Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of science and knowledge of God.

glosses.latin: docentes omnem hominem in omni sapientia, ut exhibeamus omnem hominem perfectum in Iesu Christo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal rombo foirbthe crist condib foirbthe intí bess inna ellug
glosses.glossText: .i. amal rombo foirbthe crist condib foirbthe intí bess inna ellug
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal rombo foirbthe crist condib foirbthe intí bess inna ellug
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as Christ was perfect, so that he who is in union with Him may be perfect.

glosses.latin: In quo et laboro, certando secundum operationem eius, quam operatur in me in uirtute.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ató occombáig friss imsechim agníme [GLat]et[/GLat] imgabáil desimrechte de ↄroissinn cutrummus friss [GLat]et[/GLat] ↄgní som frimsa ocsuidiu
glosses.glossText: .i. ató occombáig friss imsechim agníme et imgabáil desimrechte de ↄroissinn cutrummus friss et ↄgní som frimsa ocsuidiu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ató occombáig friss imsechim agníme et imgabáil desimrechte de ↄroissinn cutrummus friss et ↄgní som frimsa ocsuidiu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am contending with Him as to imitating His deeds and as to taking example from Him, so that I might attain equality with Him; and He works with me in this.

glosses.latin: In quo et laboro, certando secundum operationem eius, quam operatur in me in uirtute.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. good is His share in it.

glosses.latin: Uolo enim uos scire qualem solicitudinem habeam pro uobís, et pro hís qui sunt Laudiciae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. great is the solicitude that I have for you.

glosses.latin: Uolo enim uos scire qualem solicitudinem habeam pro uobís, et pro hís qui sunt Laudiciae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Colossians then, in Laodicea they are.

glosses.latin: Ut consulentur corda ipsorum, instructi in caritate, et in omnes diuitias plenitudinis intellectus, in agnitionem misterii Dei Patris et Christi Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that they may console (them) lest they be sad for my bonds.

glosses.latin: Ut consulentur corda ipsorum, instructi in caritate, et in omnes diuitias plenitudinis intellectus, in agnitionem misterii Dei Patris et Christi Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they may have charity towards every one.

glosses.latin: Ut consulentur corda ipsorum, instructi in caritate, et in omnes diuitias plenitudinis intellectus, in agnitionem misterii Dei Patris et Christi Iesu.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] confesatar imbed indraith tecomnacht dia doib [GLat]et[/GLat] condip maith anintliucht
glosses.glossText: .i. confesatar imbed indraith tecomnacht dia doib et condip maith anintliucht
glosses.glossFNs: .i. confesatar imbed indraith tecomnacht dia doib et condip maith anintliucht
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that they may know the abundance of the grace that God has imparted to them, and that their understanding may be good.

glosses.latin: Ut consulentur corda ipsorum, instructi in caritate, et in omnes diuitias plenitudinis intellectus, in agnitionem misterii Dei Patris et Christi Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the mystery of the salvation of the race of men.

glosses.latin: In quo sunt omnes tesauri sapientiae et scientiae absconditi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] arisand isecne [GLat]et[/GLat] isfissid cách iar netarcnu crist
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] arisand isecne et isfissid cách iar netarcnu crist
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] arisand isecne et isfissid cách iar netarcnu crist
glosses.glossTrans: for therein is every one wise and a knower according to knowledge of Christ.

glosses.latin: Hoc autem dico, ut nemo uos decipiat in sublimitatesermonum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]filosophi[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] arnipagliccu felsub olambieidsi [GLat]sí in christo estis[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. filosophi .i. arnipagliccu felsub olambieidsi sí in christo estis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. filosophi .i. arnipagliccu felsub olambieidsi sí in christo estis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for no philosopher will be acuter than ye will be si etc.

glosses.latin: gaudens, et uidens ordinem uestrum, et firmamentum eius, quae in Christo est, fidei uestri. Sicut ergo accipistis Iesum Christum dominum in ipso ambulate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through thinking of you on account of your perfection.

glosses.latin: gaudens, et uidens ordinem uestrum, et firmamentum eius, quae in Christo est, fidei uestri. Sicut ergo accipistis Iesum Christum dominum in ipso ambulate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in belief in Jesus.

glosses.latin: gaudens, et uidens ordinem uestrum, et firmamentum eius, quae in Christo est, fidei uestri. Sicut ergo accipistis Iesum Christum dominum in ipso ambulate.
glosses.glossTrans: as hath been preached to you, observe.

glosses.latin: Radicati, et superaedificati in ipso, et confirmati fide, ... habundantes in gratiarum actione.
glosses.glossTrans: in the unity of His body.

glosses.latin: Radicati, et superaedificati in ipso, et confirmati fide, ... habundantes in gratiarum actione.
glosses.glossTrans: apostles at first, you afterwards.

glosses.latin: Radicati, et superaedificati in ipso, et confirmati fide, ... habundantes in gratiarum actione.
glosses.glossTrans: be ye strenuous in faith.

glosses.latin: Radicati, et superaedificati in ipso, et confirmati fide, ... habundantes in gratiarum actione.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] denid attlugud buide dodia dicachmaith dogní frib
glosses.glossText: .i. denid attlugud buide dodia dicachmaith dogní frib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. denid attlugud buide dodia dicachmaith dogní frib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. give thanks to God for every good that He does to you.

glosses.latin: Uidete ne quis uos decipiat per philosofiam, et inanem fallaciam, secundum traditionem hominum, ... et non secundum Christum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though he be acute and eloquent in declaration.

glosses.latin: Uidete ne quis uos decipiat per philosofiam, et inanem fallaciam, secundum traditionem hominum, ... et non secundum Christum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which perverts into vain-glory.

glosses.latin: Uidete ne quis uos decipiat per philosofiam, et inanem fallaciam, secundum traditionem hominum, ... et non secundum Christum.
glosses.glossFullTags: arishe besad felsub etarcert didúlib [GLat]et[/GLat]saigid forru [GLat]et[/GLat] nebchretem anadiadar[a] dicrist
glosses.glossText: arishe besad felsub etarcert didúlib etsaigid forru et nebchretem anadiadar dicrist
glosses.glossFNs: arishe besad felsub etarcert didúlib etsaigid forru et nebchretem anadiadara dicrist
footnotes: a: = anadfiadar
b: Contra philosophos agit, quorum omnis disputatio de elementis est...dicentes...uirginem parere non posse: et Deum ex homine nasci, mori, atque resurgere stultum esse credere, Primasius
glosses.glossTrans: for this is (the) usage of philosophers, to dissertate concerning the elements, and to dispute over them, and not to believe what is declared of Christ<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Uidete ne quis uos decipiat per philosofiam, et inanem fallaciam, secundum traditionem hominum, ... et non secundum Christum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niarcrist pridchit [ie].i.[/ie] nifitetar amal rongab arissamlid atá [GLat]quia in ipso habitat[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: .i. niarcrist pridchit .i. nifitetar amal rongab arissamlid atá quia in ipso habitat rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niarcrist pridchit .i. nifitetar amal rongab arissamlid atá quia in ipso habitat rl.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for Christ do they preach, that is, they know Him not as He is, for thus He is, quia etc.

glosses.latin: Quia in ipso inhabitat omnis plenitudo diuinitatis corporaliter.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]omnis plenitudo diuine naturæ in corpore eius inhabitat[/GLat][a] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ueraciter[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] inchorpdid [ie].i.[/ie] adrothreb láne deachte innachorpsom
glosses.glossText: Pelagius: omnis plenitudo diuine naturæ in corpore eius inhabitat .i. ueraciter ɫ. inchorpdid .i. adrothreb láne deachte innachorpsom
glosses.glossFNs: Pelagius: omnis plenitudo diuine naturæ in corpore eius inhabitata .i. ueraciter ɫ. inchorpdid .i. adrothreb láne deachte innachorpsom
footnotes: a: Migne, col. 896
glosses.glossTrans: or corporeally, i.e. the fulness of the Godhead has dwelt in His body.

glosses.latin: in circumcisione Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] Ceist cate imdibe crist nianse bás [GLat]et[/GLat]adnacul itheside immafolnget imdibe ódúalchib
glosses.glossText: .i. Ceist cate imdibe crist nianse bás etadnacul itheside immafolnget imdibe ódúalchib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. Ceist cate imdibe crist nianse bás etadnacul itheside immafolnget imdibe ódúalchib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. question, what is Christ’s circumcision? Easy (to answer): death and burial, it is they that effect circumcision from vices.

glosses.latin: Consepulti ei in baptismo, in quo et consurrexistis per fidem operationis Dei, qui suscitauit illum a mortuis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] teora tonna torunni [GLat]in babitsmo[/GLat] trédenus dosom [GLat]in sepulcro[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. teora tonna torunni in babitsmo trédenus dosom in sepulcro
glosses.glossFNs: .i. teora tonna torunni in babitsmo trédenus dosom in sepulcro
footnotes: c: An allusion to triple immersion. See Lismore Lives, p. 357
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. three waves over us in baptismo<sup>c</sup>; a space of three days to Him in sepulcro.

glosses.latin: Consepulti ei in baptismo, in quo et consurrexistis per fidem operationis Dei, qui suscitauit illum a mortuis.
glosses.glossFullTags: amal rongab comadnacul duún atá comeisseírge actrocretem oipred dǽ
glosses.glossText: amal rongab comadnacul duún atá comeisseírge actrocretem oipred dǽ
glosses.glossFNs: amal rongab comadnacul duún atá comeisseírge actrocretem oipred dǽ
glosses.glossTrans: as there is co-sepulture to us, (so) there is co-resurrection, provided we believe in God’s working.

glosses.latin: donans uobis omnia delicta.
footnotes: b: cf. Wb. 31c 18
glosses.glossTrans: there was somewhat there to be given.

glosses.latin: Delens quod aduersum nos erat chirografum decreti, quod erat contrarium nobís, et ipsum tulit de medio, adfigens illud cruci.
glosses.glossTrans: whereby death has been decreed to us.

glosses.latin: Delens quod aduersum nos erat chirografum decreti, quod erat contrarium nobís, et ipsum tulit de medio, adfigens illud cruci.
glosses.glossTrans: it is not our advantage that has been therein.

glosses.latin: Delens quod aduersum nos erat chirografum decreti, quod erat contrarium nobís, et ipsum tulit de medio, adfigens illud cruci.
glosses.glossTrans: He has taken away.

glosses.latin: Delens quod aduersum nos erat chirografum decreti, quod erat contrarium nobís, et ipsum tulit de medio, adfigens illud cruci.
glosses.glossTrans: so that it is not at all.
