glosses.latin: Delens quod aduersum nos erat chirografum decreti, quod erat contrarium nobís, et ipsum tulit de medio, adfigens illud cruci.
glosses.glossTrans: so that it was drowned in sanguine.

glosses.latin: traduxit confidens, palam triumphans illos in semet ipso.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He has won a victory from them.

glosses.latin: traduxit confidens, palam triumphans illos in semet ipso.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through death of His own Body.

glosses.latin: Nemo ergo uos iudicet in cibo, aut in potu, aut in parte diei festi, aut neominiae, aut sabbatorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nachib mided [ie].i.[/ie] nachib berar ismachtu rechta fetarlicce innandig [GLat]et[/GLat] ambiad innallíthu [GLat]et[/GLat] assapati act bad foirbthe farniress
glosses.glossText: .i. nachib mided .i. nachib berar ismachtu rechta fetarlicce innandig et ambiad innallíthu et assapati act bad foirbthe farniress
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nachib mided .i. nachib berar ismachtu rechta fetarlicce innandig et ambiad innallíthu et assapati act bad foirbthe farniress
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him not judge you, that is, be ye not borne into the institutions of the Law of the Old Testament, into their drink and their food, into their festivals and their sabbaths; but let your faith be perfect.

glosses.latin: Quae sunt umbra futurorum, corpus autem Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all that has been in the Old Law is a shadow of the New Testament.

glosses.latin: Quae sunt umbra futurorum, corpus autem Christi.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]quasi dixiset[/GLat] ni dír dúib ní disund act homaldóit docrist
glosses.glossText: quasi dixiset ni dír dúib ní disund act homaldóit docrist
glosses.glossFNs: quasi dixiset ni dír dúib ní disund act homaldóit docrist
glosses.glossTrans: quasi dixisset: nothing of this is meet for you, but service unto Christ.

glosses.latin: angelorum, quae non uidit ambulans frustra inflatus sensu carnis suae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciasberat doaidbdetar físi doib [GLat]et[/GLat]dotiagat angil andochum nichretidsi
glosses.glossText: .i. ciasberat doaidbdetar físi doib etdotiagat angil andochum nichretidsi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciasberat doaidbdetar físi doib etdotiagat angil andochum nichretidsi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though they say that visions are shown to them, and that angels come to them, believe ye it not.

glosses.latin: angelorum, quae non uidit ambulans frustra inflatus sensu carnis suae.
footnotes: e: The glossator seems to take frustra with ambulans
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. restlessness causes not benefits<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: angelorum, quae non uidit ambulans frustra inflatus sensu carnis suae.
footnotes: a: = móidid-i
glosses.glossTrans: not in spiritual senses does he boast him.

glosses.latin: Si [ergo] mortui estis cum Christo ab elimentís huius mundi, quid adhuc tamquam uiuentes in mundo decernitis?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] marudscarsid fritola tre bás crist cid arandluthid caratrad friu [GLat]iterum Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]elimenta mundi auaritia luxoria et cætera hís similia[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. marudscarsid fritola tre bás crist cid arandluthid caratrad friu iterum Pelagius: elimenta mundi auaritia luxoria et cætera hís similia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. marudscarsid fritola tre bás crist cid arandluthid caratrad friu iterum Pelagius: elimenta mundi auaritia luxoria et cætera hís similiab
footnotes: b: Migne, col. 898
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if ye have separated from the desires (of the flesh) through Christ’s death, why do ye make close a friendship with them iterum?

glosses.latin: Quae sunt omnia in interitu.
footnotes: c: robóidil..., Zimmer: according to Chroust, the next letter to d was perhaps e or i
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because they decay, i.e. there was a perishing.

glosses.latin: non ad parcendum corpori, non in honore aliquo ad saturitatem carnis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not without labour to body.

glosses.latin: non ad parcendum corpori, non in honore aliquo ad saturitatem carnis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]nec carnem in saturitate honorandam[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nibi ifledaib nalígaib frisgní
glosses.glossText: .i. nec carnem in saturitate honorandam ɫ. nibi ifledaib nalígaib frisgní
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nec carnem in saturitate honorandam ɫ. nibi ifledaib nalígaib frisgní
glosses.glossTrans: or it is not in banquets nor in ... that he practises.

glosses.latin: ubi Christus est in dextera Dei sedens.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the happiness of the glory.

glosses.latin: uita uestra abscondita est cum Christo.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the glory.

glosses.latin: Cum Christus apparuerit, uita uestra, tunc et uos apparebitis cum illo in gloria.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] madhǽ farmbethusi crist robia indocbál less
glosses.glossText: .i. madhǽ farmbethusi crist robia indocbál less
glosses.glossFNs: .i. madhǽ farmbethusi crist robia indocbál less
footnotes: f: robia = ro-b-bia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if Christ be your life, ye will have<sup>f</sup> glory with Him.

glosses.latin: Cum Christus apparuerit, uita uestra, tunc et uos apparebitis cum illo in gloria.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the place wherein He is.

glosses.latin: Mortificate ergo membra uestra, ... fornicationem, inmunditiam, libidinem, concupiscentiam malam, et auaritiam, quae est simulacrorum seruitus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ithé inso boill indsenduini [GLat]et[/GLat] ishé insenduine fessin [ie].i.[/ie] uilidetu nandúalche isball didiu cachhæ som [GLat]et[/GLat] iscorp ati(nól)[d]
glosses.glossText: .i. ithé inso boill indsenduini et ishé insenduine fessin .i. uilidetu nandúalche isball didiu cachhæ som et iscorp ati(nól)
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ithé inso boill indsenduini et ishé insenduine fessin .i. uilidetu nandúalche isball didiu cachhæ som et iscorp ati(nól)d
footnotes: d: The first part of the n is left
g: i.e. collectively they form the body
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are the members of the old man, and this is the old man himself, even the sum of the vices. Each of them, then, is a member, and the collection of them is (the) body<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Mortificate ergo membra uestra, ... fornicationem, inmunditiam, libidinem, concupiscentiam malam, et auaritiam, quae est simulacrorum seruitus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal fongníter ídil [GLat]síc[/GLat] fogníther donaib ánib
glosses.glossText: .i. amal fongníter ídil síc fogníther donaib ánib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal fongníter ídil síc fogníther donaib ánib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as idols are served, so service is rendered to riches.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem deponite et uos omnia, iram, indignationem, malitiam, blasfemiam, turpem sermonem de ore uestro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. meditation on sin.

glosses.latin: Nunc autem deponite et uos omnia, iram, indignationem, malitiam, blasfemiam, turpem sermonem de ore uestro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. put from you this burden uitiorum.

glosses.latin: Nolite mentiri inuicem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not one of you deceive another.

glosses.latin: induentes nouum, eum qui renouatur in agnitionem, secundum imaginem eius qui creauit illum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we shall be in Jesu’s form, to wit in unity of His Body.

glosses.latin: Ubi non est gentilis, et Iudeus ... seruus, et liber, sed omnia in omnibus Christus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he deems none of them more distinguished than another.

glosses.latin: Ubi non est gentilis, et Iudeus ... seruus, et liber, sed omnia in omnibus Christus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]hominibus[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] actrocretea deacht [GLat]et[/GLat]dóinecht crist bitless indhuili dáni [GLat]et[/GLat]nahu(ili) timn(e)
glosses.glossText: .i. hominibus .i. actrocretea deacht etdóinecht crist bitless indhuili dáni etnahu(ili) timn(e)
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hominibus .i. actrocretea deacht etdóinecht crist bitless indhuili dáni etnahu(ili) timn(e)
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided he believe in Christ’s Godhead and Manhood, all the gifts and all the testaments will be his.

glosses.latin: Induite uos ergo sicut electi Dei, sancti, et dilecti per uiscera misericordiae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] gaibid immib anetach macc cóimsa amal no ndad maicc cóima [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]uiscera[/GLat] ishé i(nde)chellt[b] (as)beir (som)
glosses.glossText: .i. gaibid immib anetach macc cóimsa amal no ndad maicc cóima .i. uiscera ishé i(nde)chellt (as)beir (som)
glosses.glossFNs: .i. gaibid immib anetach macc cóimsa amal no ndad maicc cóima .i. uiscera ishé i(nde)chelltb (as)beir (som)
footnotes: b: Pedersen, KZ. 35, 431, acc. deichelt ríg LL. 51b, dat. dechiult Amra Chonroi: celt .i. vestis .i. edach, Corm. Tr. 47, celt clithargarb finna, celt ásas treu, LU. 95b 25, 38. Nach i, das ein kurzungsstrich zu haben scheint, ist ein streif pergament weggeschnitten, Chroust
e: maic cóima, here we have a Middle-Irish nom. pl. masc. of the adj. cóim. So móra Ml. 98c 5
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. put on you this raiment of dear sons as ye are dear sons<sup>e</sup>, i.e. uiscera, this is the garment that he mentions.

glosses.latin: Supportantes inuicem, et donantes et uobís ipsís, ... sicut Dominus donauit uobís, ita et uos.
footnotes: c: MS. frichéle
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. forbearance to every one towards his fellow.

glosses.latin: Supportantes inuicem, et donantes et uobís ipsís, ... sicut Dominus donauit uobís, ita et uos.
glosses.glossTrans: what ye commit among you.

glosses.latin: Supportantes inuicem, et donantes et uobís ipsís, ... sicut Dominus donauit uobís, ita et uos.
glosses.glossTrans: mutual forgiveness.

glosses.latin: Super omnia autem haec, caritatem habete, quod est uinculum perfectionis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. above them, or beyond all the praedicta.

glosses.latin: Super omnia autem haec, caritatem habete, quod est uinculum perfectionis.
glosses.glossText: .i. óentad etruib immanetar ɫ. etruib et dia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. óentad etruib immanetar ɫ. etruib et dia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of unity among you mutually, or between you and God.

glosses.latin: Et pax Christi, ... in qua et uocati estis in uno corpore et grati estote.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to you towards God and to God towards you.

glosses.latin: Et pax Christi, ... in qua et uocati estis in uno corpore et grati estote.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to be in unity of Christ’s Body.

glosses.latin: Et pax Christi, ... in qua et uocati estis in uno corpore et grati estote.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. give ye thanks to God.

glosses.latin: Uerbum Christi habitet in uobis abundanter, in omni sapientia, docentes et commonentes uosmet ipsos, in ψalmis, imnis [et] canticís spiritalibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: badatrab nábad cuit tadill ished aatrab didiu aprecept [GLat]et[/GLat] acomal(nad)[d]
glosses.glossText: badatrab nábad cuit tadill ished aatrab didiu aprecept et acomal(nad)
glosses.glossFNs: badatrab nábad cuit tadill ished aatrab didiu aprecept et acomal(nad)d
footnotes: d: The fem. possessive is used because briathar ( = uerbum of the text) is fem.
glosses.glossTrans: let it be a residence: let it not be a passing visit: this, then, is its residence, teaching it and fulfilling it.

glosses.latin: Uerbum Christi habitet in uobis abundanter, in omni sapientia, docentes et commonentes uosmet ipsos, in ψalmis, imnis [et] canticís spiritalibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of knowledge of God.

glosses.latin: Uerbum Christi habitet in uobis abundanter, in omni sapientia, docentes et commonentes uosmet ipsos, in ψalmis, imnis [et] canticís spiritalibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: ished tra forchain som [GLat]híc[/GLat] aratucca cách acanas condibréil less indinne bess and [GLat]et[/GLat] ari(n)réla dochách rodchluinethar
glosses.glossText: ished tra forchain som híc aratucca cách acanas condibréil less indinne bess and et ari(n)réla dochách rodchluinethar
glosses.glossFNs: ished tra forchain som híc aratucca cách acanas condibréil less indinne bess and et ari(n)réla dochách rodchluinethar
glosses.glossTrans: this then is what he teaches Me, that every one should understand what he recites, so that the sense which is in it may be clear to him and that he may make it clear to every one who hears it.

glosses.latin: Omne quodcumque facitis in uerbo aut in opere, omnia in nomine Domini Iesu Christi, gratias agentes Deo et Patri per ipsum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in fulfilling Jesu’s commandments and in calling on His name.

glosses.latin: Omne quodcumque facitis in uerbo aut in opere, omnia in nomine Domini Iesu Christi, gratias agentes Deo et Patri per ipsum.
glosses.glossTrans: giving thanks unto God for your salvation through Him.

glosses.latin: Mulieres, subditae estote uirís, sicut oportet, in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: let the obedience be in Domino.

glosses.latin: Uiri, diligite uxores [uestras], et nolite amari esse ad illas.
footnotes: b: subditi (if not a scribal error for Lat. subditae) seems nom. pl. fem. of an adj. borrowed from Lat. subditus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because they are subditae.

glosses.latin: Uiri, diligite uxores [uestras], et nolite amari esse ad illas.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Patres, nolite ad indignationem prouocare filios uestros, (u)t non pusil(lo) ani(m)o filii fiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through correction with bitterness (and) without faults (on their part).

glosses.latin: Patres, nolite ad indignationem prouocare filios uestros, (u)t non pusil(lo) ani(m)o filii fiant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. mournful.

glosses.latin: Serui, obaedite dominís carnalibus per omnia, non ad oculum seruientes, quasi hominibus placentes; sed in semplicitate cordis, timentes Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] (for)cain som [GLat]híc seruos obidire et seruire dominis[/GLat] arnaérbarat [GLat]domini[/GLat] robtar irlithi ar(mog)e dúun resíu tised hiress robtar anirlithi iarum níáil tra insin doepirt olsesom ar nidoforcitul an(irl)atad dodechuid
glosses.glossText: .i. (for)cain som híc seruos obidire et seruire dominis arnaérbarat domini robtar irlithi ar(mog)e dúun resíu tised hiress robtar anirlithi iarum níáil tra insin doepirt olsesom ar nidoforcitul an(irl)atad dodechuid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. (for)cain som híc seruos obidire et seruire dominis arnaérbarat domini robtar irlithi ar(mog)e dúun resíu tised hiress robtar anirlithi iarum níáil tra insin doepirt olsesom ar nidoforcitul an(irl)atad dodechuid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. híc he teaches seruos oboedire et seruire dominis, lest domini should say ‘our servants were obedient to us before the Faith had come: they afterwards became disobedient.’ ‘It is not proper, then, that that should be said,’ saith he, ‘for not to teach disobedience hath it come.’

glosses.latin: Serui, obaedite dominís carnalibus per omnia, non ad oculum seruientes, quasi hominibus placentes; sed in semplicitate cordis, timentes Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nibo intain nombeid arsúil [GLat]tantum[/GLat] dogneith toil far coimded
glosses.glossText: .i. nibo intain nombeid arsúil tantum dogneith toil far coimded
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nibo intain nombeid arsúil tantum dogneith toil far coimded
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it must not be when ye are before (His) eye tantum that ye should do your master’s will.

glosses.latin: Serui, obaedite dominís carnalibus per omnia, non ad oculum seruientes, quasi hominibus placentes; sed in semplicitate cordis, timentes Deum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in desire, that is, let it be for a divine reward.

glosses.latin: Serui, obaedite dominís carnalibus per omnia, non ad oculum seruientes, quasi hominibus placentes; sed in semplicitate cordis, timentes Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] (a)dígail[c] forib ma(nba)d irlaithi arrofitir side imbo hochridiu fanacc
glosses.glossText: .i. (a)dígail forib ma(nba)d irlaithi arrofitir side imbo hochridiu fanacc
glosses.glossFNs: .i. (a)dígail<sup>c</sup> forib ma(nba)d irlaithi arrofitir side imbo hochridiu fanacc
footnotes: c: vor digail ist das pergament glatt abgeschnitten, und gar nichts zu lesen, Chroust
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. His punishment on you if ye be not obedient, for He knows whether it be from (your) heart or not.

glosses.latin: Scientes quod á Domino accipietis retributionem hereditatis.
footnotes: d: ropia = ro-b-bia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. ye will have<sup>d</sup> the heavenly heritage in reward of your prayers.

glosses.latin: Qui enim iniuriam facit, recipiet id quod inique gessit; et non est personarum acceptio apud Deum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he will suffer punishment for his ill-doing.

glosses.latin: Qui enim iniuriam facit, recipiet id quod inique gessit; et non est personarum acceptio apud Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] (int)í bes anirlithe [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nád chomalnathar anasberar friss rambia dígal tara ǽssi [ie].i.[/ie] cid incoimdiu dodgné friamug (cid) inmug friachoimdid
glosses.glossText: .i. (int)í bes anirlithe ɫ. nád chomalnathar anasberar friss rambia dígal tara ǽssi .i. cid incoimdiu dodgné friamug (cid) inmug friachoimdid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. (int)í bes anirlithe ɫ. nád chomalnathar anasberar friss rambia dígal tara ǽssi .i. cid incoimdiu dodgné friamug (cid) inmug friachoimdid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he who is disobedient, or who does not fulfil what is said to him, shall suffer punishment therefor, that is, whether the lord do it to his servant, or the servant to his lord.

glosses.latin: Qui enim iniuriam facit, recipiet id quod inique gessit; et non est personarum acceptio apud Deum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]sed operum[/GLat] eter sóir [GLat]et[/GLat] dóir eter mug [GLat]et[/GLat]coimdid
glosses.glossText: sed operum eter sóir et dóir eter mug etcoimdid
glosses.glossFNs: sed operum eter sóir et dóir eter mug etcoimdid
glosses.glossTrans: both free and unfree, both servant and lord.

glosses.latin: Domini, quod iustum est et aequum, seruis praestáte, scientes quoniam et uos Dominum habetis in caelo.
glosses.glossFullTags: cosc innacoimded inso arnápforóil acumachte foramogaib
glosses.glossText: cosc innacoimded inso arnápforóil acumachte foramogaib
glosses.glossFNs: cosc innacoimded inso arnápforóil acumachte foramogaib
glosses.glossTrans: the correction of the lords, this, that their power over their servants be not excessive.

glosses.latin: Domini, quod iustum est et aequum, seruis praestáte, scientes quoniam et uos Dominum habetis in caelo.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]quasi dixisset[/GLat] abi[a] mogasi dano atá far cóimdiu innim
glosses.glossText: .i. quasi dixisset abi mogasi dano atá far cóimdiu innim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. quasi dixisset abia mogasi dano atá far cóimdiu innim
footnotes: a: Lege adib, Zimmer
glosses.glossTrans: ye are servants, then: your lord is in heaven.

glosses.latin: Orationi instate.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ishæ inso infognam donchoimdid nemdu [GLat]et[/GLat] isfriu huili atbeirsom ón [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]negligentis enim et dormientis oratio nihil impetrare ualet[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. ishæ inso infognam donchoimdid nemdu et isfriu huili atbeirsom ón Pelagius: negligentis enim et dormientis oratio nihil impetrare ualet
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ishæ inso infognam donchoimdid nemdu et isfriu huili atbeirsom ón Pelagius: negligentis enim et dormientis oratio nihil impetrare ualetb
footnotes: b: For the last three words Migne, col. 901, has: nec ab homine praeualet impetrare
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the service (due) to the heavenly Lord, and it is to them all that he says this.

glosses.latin: Orantes simul et pro nobis, ut aperiat Deus nobis hostium sermonis ad loquendum misterium Christi, propter quod etiam uinctus sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with prayer for you yourselves.

glosses.latin: Orantes simul et pro nobis, ut aperiat Deus nobis hostium sermonis ad loquendum misterium Christi, propter quod etiam uinctus sum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conroib búaid precepte duun tresaníccatar híli
glosses.glossText: .i. conroib búaid precepte duun tresaníccatar híli
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conroib búaid precepte duun tresaníccatar híli
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we may have the gift of teaching, through which many may be saved.

glosses.latin: Orantes simul et pro nobis, ut aperiat Deus nobis hostium sermonis ad loquendum misterium Christi, propter quod etiam uinctus sum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]euangelium[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] cororélam rúna incholnigthea [GLat]et[/GLat] geine crist [GLat]et[/GLat] achésta
glosses.glossText: .i. euangelium .i. cororélam rúna incholnigthea et geine crist et achésta
glosses.glossFNs: .i. euangelium .i. cororélam rúna incholnigthea et geine crist et achésta
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that we might manifest (the) mysteries of (the) Incarnation and Birth of Christ and of His Passion.

glosses.latin: Orantes simul et pro nobis, ut aperiat Deus nobis hostium sermonis ad loquendum misterium Christi, propter quod etiam uinctus sum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore am I a captive, because I preach that mystery.

glosses.latin: Ut manifestem illud ita ut oportet me loqui.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without connivance.

glosses.latin: In sapientia ambulate ad eos qui foris sunt, tempus redimentes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ipricept narrún diade doib [GLat]et[/GLat] innanebthórtrommad dochuingid neich cuccu
glosses.glossText: .i. ipricept narrún diade doib et innanebthórtrommad dochuingid neich cuccu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ipricept narrún diade doib et innanebthórtrommad dochuingid neich cuccu
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the teaching of the divine mysteries to them and in not pestering them by asking aught of them.

glosses.latin: In sapientia ambulate ad eos qui foris sunt, tempus redimentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the laity.

glosses.latin: In sapientia ambulate ad eos qui foris sunt, tempus redimentes.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: In sapientia ambulate ad eos qui foris sunt, tempus redimentes.
footnotes: c: This gloss is written on the margin of v. 3, in four lines, from the beginning of each of which the bookbinder has cut off four letters
d: But there is room for four letters
g: fo-ru-bid seems the 2nd pl. of the perfect act. of fobenim succīdo
glosses.glossTrans: the time that ye have wasted<sup>g</sup>(?) through your evil deeds, redeem ye through your deeds in the time Noui (Testamenti).

glosses.latin: Sermo uester semper in gratia sale sit conditus, ut sciatis quomodo oporteat uos unicuique respondere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] taibred formbríathar ráth spirito dochách trefoirbthetith farprecepte
glosses.glossText: .i. taibred formbríathar ráth spirito dochách trefoirbthetith farprecepte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. taibred formbríathar ráth spirito dochách trefoirbthetith farprecepte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let your word give the grace of the Spirit to every one through the perfection of your teaching.

glosses.latin: Sermo uester semper in gratia sale sit conditus, ut sciatis quomodo oporteat uos unicuique respondere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conirmissid[e] taithesc coir do cachgrád [GLat]et[/GLat] do cach aís
glosses.glossText: .i. conirmissid taithesc coir do cachgrád et do cach aís
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conirmisside taithesc coir do cachgrád et do cach aís
footnotes: e: Cf. the perf. pl. 3 irmadatar Wb. 5b 2
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that you may attain the answer proper to every grade and to every age.

glosses.latin: Tychicus . . fidilis minister, et conseruus in Domino;
glosses.glossTrans: his service is faithful.

glosses.latin: Tychicus . . fidilis minister, et conseruus in Domino;
footnotes: f: leg. with Sarauw, fognam
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in serving God.

glosses.latin: Quem misi ad uos ad hoc, ipsum ut cognoscatis quae circa uos sunt, et consuletur corda uestra,
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Quem misi ad uos ad hoc, ipsum ut cognoscatis quae circa uos sunt, et consuletur corda uestra,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye may know tidings of us.

glosses.latin: Quem misi ad uos ad hoc, ipsum ut cognoscatis quae circa uos sunt, et consuletur corda uestra,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄfessid dano fiss scél uáimse [GLat]et[/GLat]arnábadtoirsig dimchuimriugsa
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄfessid dano fiss scél uáimse etarnábadtoirsig dimchuimriugsa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄfessid dano fiss scél uáimse etarnábadtoirsig dimchuimriugsa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye may also know tidings of me, and that you may not be mournful at my captivity.

glosses.latin: Cum Onessimo. Omnia, quae [hic] aguntur, nota faciet uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is together that they have been sent.

glosses.latin: Cum Onessimo. Omnia, quae [hic] aguntur, nota faciet uobis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. both my bonds and those to whom I preach.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Aristharchus, et Marcus, consubrinus Barnabae, de quo accipistis mandata;
glosses.glossTrans: your salutation from them.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Aristharchus, et Marcus, consubrinus Barnabae, de quo accipistis mandata;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Aristharchus, et Marcus, consubrinus Barnabae, de quo accipistis mandata;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which he has preached to you.

glosses.latin: Et Iesus, qui dicitur Iustus; qui sunt ex circumcisione; hi soli sunt adiutores mei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of the Jews are they.

glosses.latin: Et Iesus, qui dicitur Iustus; qui sunt ex circumcisione; hi soli sunt adiutores mei.
glosses.glossTrans: in teaching.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Epaphras, qui est ex uobís, ... semper sollicitus pro uobís in orationibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of yourselves is his race.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Epaphras, qui est ex uobís, ... semper sollicitus pro uobís in orationibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he prays God for you constantly.

glosses.latin: Testimonium [enim] illi perhibeo, quod habet multum laborem pro uobis, et pro hís qui sunt Laudaciae.
footnotes: a: Ex hac glossa intelligi potest, codicem, cui glossatio hibernica primo adscripta esset, lectionem “quod habet multum amorem pro uobis” exhibuisse; neque discrepat glossa insequens nobcara huili, Zimmer
c: As Olden remarked, the ‘multum laborem’ of the text represents the reading πολὺν πόνον, whereas the gloss represents the reading πολὺν πόθον
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I bear witness that he hath a great love<sup>c</sup> for you.

glosses.latin: Testimonium [enim] illi perhibeo, quod habet multum laborem pro uobis, et pro hís qui sunt Laudaciae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he loves you all.

glosses.latin: Salutat uos Lucas medicus.
glosses.glossTrans: dicit híc the name of the profession which he practised at first.

glosses.latin: Salutat fratres, qui sunt Laudaciae, et Nympham, et quae in domo eius est æclesia.
footnotes: d: lit. ‘let it be peace to you towards them’
glosses.glossTrans: have peace towards them<sup>d</sup>, love ye good men.

glosses.latin: Salutat fratres, qui sunt Laudaciae, et Nympham, et quae in domo eius est æclesia.
footnotes: b: MS. munta
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all their household.

glosses.latin: Laudicensium æclesia legatur, et eam quae Laudicensium est, uos legatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] act arroilgither ind epistilse dúibsi berthir uáib [GLat]laudocensibus et[/GLat]doberthar indæpistil scríbther dosuidib ↄárlægthar duibsi doadbadar [GLat]híc[/GLat] nádroscribad dosuidib cedacht [GLat]et[/GLat]arrobe scribent doiib
glosses.glossText: .i. act arroilgither ind epistilse dúibsi berthir uáib laudocensibus etdoberthar indæpistil scríbther dosuidib ↄárlægthar duibsi doadbadar híc nádroscribad dosuidib cedacht etarrobe scribent doiib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. act arroilgither ind epistilse dúibsi berthir uáib laudocensibus etdoberthar indæpistil scríbther dosuidib ↄárlægthar duibsi doadbadar híc nádroscribad dosuidib cedacht etarrobe scribent doiib
footnotes: a: With cedacht (which occurs also in Sg. 148a 4) compare cadecht (gl. nondum) Ml. 19b 4, catecht (gl. nondum) Ml. 30b 15; cidecht Sg. 148a 9, and cadacht, Stowe Missal 17
b: lit. interfuit (‘instabat’ Sarauw who reads et arrobe): there was in the Epistle to the Colossians a message for the Laodiceans
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided that this epistle has been read out to you it shall be carried from you Laodicensibus, and the epistle which is being written to them shall be brought so that it may be read out to you. It is shown híc that it had not been written to these, yet<sup>a</sup> it contained<sup>b</sup> a writing to them.

glosses.latin: Laudicensium æclesia legatur, et eam quae Laudicensium est, uos legatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that ye may read out.

glosses.latin: vide ministerium quod accepisti in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: to teaching every one.

glosses.latin: Salutatio mea manu Pauli. AMHN ΦINIT.
glosses.glossTrans: it would have been a notary who had written it hitherto.

glosses.latLine: 1 Tim. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Incipit argumentum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Gratia, misericordia et pax á Deo Patre.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] sainred do daltu anisiu [GLat]quia asper fuit[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. sainred do daltu anisiu quia asper fuit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. sainred do daltu anisiu quia asper fuit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is special to a pupil quia, etc.

glosses.latin: Sicut rogaui té ut remaneres Ephesi cum irem in Macedoniam, ut denuntiares quibusdam ne aliter docerent,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]precor multifarie sicut rogaui[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] islerithir inso nonguidimse dia nerutsu amal rotgádsa imanad inephis sechropo léirsón. [GLat]Aliter adit ubi dicit hoc praeceptum tibi commendo filii timothe et[/GLat] ismedóntestimin áfil etarru
glosses.glossText: .i. precor multifarie sicut rogaui .i. islerithir inso nonguidimse dia nerutsu amal rotgádsa imanad inephis sechropo léirsón. Aliter adit ubi dicit hoc praeceptum tibi commendo filii timothe et ismedóntestimin áfil etarru
glosses.glossFNs: .i. precor multifarie sicut rogaui .i. islerithir inso nonguidimse dia nerutsu amal rotgádsa imanad inephis sechropo léirsón. Aliter adit ubi dicit hoc praeceptum tibi commendo filii timothe et ismedóntestimin áfil etarru
footnotes: b: Between v. 3 and v. 18: cf. Ml. 14b 3, 120d 1, etc., and teistemain medhonach liubuir Matha, Book of Lismore, 37a 1
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I beseech God for thee as urgently as I have besought thee about staying in Ephesus, though this was urgently. Aliter etc. what is between them is the middle of a period<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Sicut rogaui té ut remaneres Ephesi cum irem in Macedoniam, ut denuntiares quibusdam ne aliter docerent,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for this that thou wouldst have remained.

glosses.latin: Neque intenderent fabulís et genelogís interminatís, quae questiones praestant magis quam aedificationem Dei, quae est in fide.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. genealogies and origins of tales.

glosses.latin: Neque intenderent fabulís et genelogís interminatís, quae questiones praestant magis quam aedificationem Dei, quae est in fide.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. an end is not brought out of them.

glosses.latin: Neque intenderent fabulís et genelogís interminatís, quae questiones praestant magis quam aedificationem Dei, quae est in fide.
footnotes: a: Perhaps = to-air-thét ‘which every man pursues’
glosses.glossTrans: which every man ... about another.

glosses.latin: Neque intenderent fabulís et genelogís interminatís, quae questiones praestant magis quam aedificationem Dei, quae est in fide.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they produce not edification of faith.

glosses.latin: Finis autem praecepti est caritas de corde puro, et conscientia bona, et fide non ficta.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is better than everything.

glosses.latin: Finis autem praecepti est caritas de corde puro, et conscientia bona, et fide non ficta.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the place wherein it dwells.

glosses.latin: A quibus quidam aberrantes, conuersi sunt in uaniloquium,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from the three things which he has mentioned before.

glosses.latin: Uolentes esse legis doctores, non intelligentes neque quae loquntur, neque de quibus adfirmant.
footnotes: c: Olden thought this an allusion to the story of the revision of the laws of Ireland in S. Patrick’s time, Four Masters a.d. 438
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they may be making law with kings<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Uolentes esse legis doctores, non intelligentes neque quae loquntur, neque de quibus adfirmant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not meet is what they say.

glosses.latin: Sciens hoc quod iusto non est lex possita sed iniustis, et ... homicidis,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní dodígail forfírianu tuccad recht acht isdochosc cintach
glosses.glossText: .i. ní dodígail forfírianu tuccad recht acht isdochosc cintach
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní dodígail forfírianu tuccad recht acht isdochosc cintach
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Law was not given to punish the righteous, but it is to correct the guilty.

glosses.latin: Sciens hoc quod iusto non est lex possita sed iniustis, et ... homicidis,
glosses.glossTrans: one who slays his kindred.

glosses.latin: ... plagiarís, mendacibus et periuris.
footnotes: c: The glossator apparently derived plagiarius from plaga ‘a blow’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the torturers<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: ... plagiarís, mendacibus et periuris.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Gratias ago éi, qui me confortauit, Christo Iesu,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that I might preach His glory.

glosses.latin: Qui prius fui blasfemus et persecutor et contumiliossus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Qui prius fui blasfemus et persecutor et contumiliossus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Qui prius fui blasfemus et persecutor et contumiliossus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I was reviling them.

glosses.latin: Superabundauit autem gratia Domini.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that I have been healed de peccato.

glosses.latin: Fidelis sermo, ... quod Christus Iesus uenit in hunc mundum peccatores saluos facere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] beim foris inso [vel]ɫ.[/vel] istitul indí archiunn
glosses.glossText: .i. beim foris inso ɫ. istitul indí archiunn
glosses.glossFNs: .i. beim foris inso ɫ. istitul indí archiunn
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a recapitulation this, or it is the title of that which is ahead.

glosses.latin: Fidelis sermo, ... quod Christus Iesus uenit in hunc mundum peccatores saluos facere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is manifest in that He has saved me.

glosses.latin: misericordiam consecutus sum, ut in me primum ostenderet Christus Iesus omnem patientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that it might be an example of every one’s salvation.

glosses.latin: misericordiam consecutus sum, ut in me primum ostenderet Christus Iesus omnem patientiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. patience towards my sin, and afterwards my salvation.

glosses.latin: Regi autem saeculorum, ... gloria in saecula saeculorum.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Regi autem saeculorum, ... gloria in saecula saeculorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is just to praise Him.

glosses.latin: Regi autem saeculorum, ... gloria in saecula saeculorum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without any end; for it is unlimitedly that He bestows His benefits.

glosses.latin: Hoc praeceptum commendo tibi ... secundum praecedentes in te profetias, ut milites in illís bonam militam,
glosses.glossTrans: as hath been preached to thee at first.

glosses.latin: Hoc praeceptum commendo tibi ... secundum praecedentes in te profetias, ut milites in illís bonam militam,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thus will thy warfare be good.

glosses.latin: Habens fidem et bonam conscientiam, quam quidam repellentes, circa fidem naufragauerunt;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] roscarsat friæ [ie].i.[/ie] asbertar ananman arnagaba nech desimrecht diib intalaxander hí sin robochert [GLat]ut ipse dicit alaxander ærarius multa mala mihi fecit[/GLat][a]
glosses.glossText: .i. roscarsat friæ .i. asbertar ananman arnagaba nech desimrecht diib intalaxander hí sin robochert ut ipse dicit alaxander ærarius multa mala mihi fecit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. roscarsat friæ .i. asbertar ananman arnagaba nech desimrecht diib intalaxander hí sin robochert ut ipse dicit alaxander ærarius multa mala mihi fecita
footnotes: a: 2 Tim. iv. 14
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have separated from it: i.e. their names are mentioned that no one may take example from them. That Alexander had been an artizan ut etc.

glosses.latin: Ex quibvs est Hymenaeus et Alexander quos tradidi Satanae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]pænitentiæ[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] dodásacht [ie].i.[/ie] nibí indásachtach friǽicṅdar[b] arni irmadadar
glosses.glossText: .i. pænitentiæ ɫ. dodásacht .i. nibí indásachtach friǽicṅdar arni irmadadar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. pænitentiæ ɫ. dodásacht .i. nibí indásachtach friǽicṅdarb arni irmadadar
footnotes: b: leg. friǽicṅdach? Sarauw, who compares buith fri debuid, Wb. 30b 26
d: See 1 Cor. v. 5
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. poenitentiae or to madness<sup>d</sup>, i.e. the madman does not blaspheme for he does not attain it<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Obsecro ... fieri obsecrationes ... pro omnibus hominibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. general love (is) that.

glosses.latin: ut quietam et tranquillam uitam agamus, in omni pietate et castitate.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] act robǽ [GLat]quies et tranquilitas regibus[/GLat] bieid dano dúnni andedesin [GLat]et pietas et castitas[/GLat] lasodin
glosses.glossText: .i. act robǽ quies et tranquilitas regibus bieid dano dúnni andedesin et pietas et castitas lasodin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. act robǽ quies et tranquilitas regibus bieid dano dúnni andedesin et pietas et castitas lasodin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided there be quies et tranquillitas regibus we too shall have those two things and pietas et castitas therewith.

glosses.latin: coram ... Deo, qui omnes homines uult saluos fierí.
glosses.glossFullTags: Ceist cid natat sláin indhuli mátchobra [GLat]quia omnia quaecumque uoluit dominus fecit[/GLat][a] nianse hóre nád comeicnigther nech fritoil [vel]ɫ.[/vel] is [GLat]pars pro toto[/GLat] arnifil ceneel nabelre isinbiuth dinadrícthe[b] nech [vel]ɫ.[/vel] indíi adchobrasom dohícc ithé ronícc [GLat]tantum[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]qui uult omnes homines saluos fieri salui ut augustinus dicit. Augustinus Tamquam diceretur nullum hominem fieri saluum posse nisi is quem ipse fieri uoluerit[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: Ceist cid natat sláin indhuli mátchobra quia omnia quaecumque uoluit dominus fecit nianse hóre nád comeicnigther nech fritoil ɫ. is pars pro toto arnifil ceneel nabelre isinbiuth dinadrícthe nech ɫ. indíi adchobrasom dohícc ithé ronícc tantum .i. qui uult omnes homines saluos fieri salui ut augustinus dicit. Augustinus Tamquam diceretur nullum hominem fieri saluum posse nisi is quem ipse fieri uoluerit
glosses.glossFNs: Ceist cid natat sláin indhuli mátchobra quia omnia quaecumque uoluit dominus fecita nianse hóre nád comeicnigther nech fritoil ɫ. is pars pro toto arnifil ceneel nabelre isinbiuth dinadríctheb nech ɫ. indíi adchobrasom dohícc ithé ronícc tantum .i. qui uult omnes homines saluos fieri salui ut augustinus dicit. Augustinus Tamquam diceretur nullum hominem fieri saluum posse nisi is quem ipse fieri uoluerit
footnotes: a: Ps. cxv. 3
b: cf. supra p. 285 note b
e: Hinc probatur, nemini oportere ad credendum uim inferre, nec tollere arbitrii libertatem, Pelagius, Migne, 919
glosses.glossTrans: Question, why are not all saved if He desires it quia etc. Not hard (to say): because no one is constrained against (his) will<sup>e</sup>. Or it is pars pro toto, for there is neither race nor nation in the world of which some one shall not have been saved. Or those whom He desires to save, it is they whom He has saved tantum.

glosses.latin: Unus enim Deus, unus et mediator Dei et hominum.
glosses.glossTrans: as He is the one God omnium He desires the salvation omnium.

glosses.latin: Unus enim Deus, unus et mediator Dei et hominum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. between Himself and men.

glosses.latin: Qui dedit redemptionem semet ipsum pro omnibus, testimonium temporibus [suis].
glosses.glossTrans: He hath given Himself on the Cross.

glosses.latin: Qui dedit redemptionem semet ipsum pro omnibus, testimonium temporibus [suis].
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for salvation of every one.

glosses.latin: Qui dedit redemptionem semet ipsum pro omnibus, testimonium temporibus [suis].
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dorratad teist de isindaimsir sin hiforcomnucuir intaidchric [GLat]per crucem[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. dorratad teist de isindaimsir sin hiforcomnucuir intaidchric per crucem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dorratad teist de isindaimsir sin hiforcomnucuir intaidchric per crucem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a testimony of Him had been given in that time at which the redemption per crucem came to pass.

glosses.latin: In quo possitus sum ego praedicator et apostolus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the mystery of that testimony which I preach.

glosses.latin: sine ira et discep[ta]tione.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without division.

glosses.latin: mulieres ... cum uerecundia et sobriaetate ornantes se, et non in tortís crinibus;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. an adornment which is proper for faith.

glosses.latin: mulieres ... cum uerecundia et sobriaetate ornantes se, et non in tortís crinibus;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. braided.

glosses.latin: Sed, quod decet mulieres.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. what is becoming, to wit, modesty and chastity.

glosses.latin: Mulier in silentio discat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] na imchomarcad ní [GLat]in æclesia sed uiros interrogat domi[/GLat][c]
glosses.glossText: .i. na imchomarcad ní in æclesia sed uiros interrogat domi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. na imchomarcad ní in æclesia sed uiros interrogat domic
footnotes: c: 1 Cor. xiv. 35
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let her not ask aught in ecclesia, sed etc.

glosses.latin: Docere autem mulieri non permitto, neque dominari in uirum, sed esse in silentio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless it be her (own) children.

glosses.latin: Docere autem mulieri non permitto, neque dominari in uirum, sed esse in silentio.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let it not be her who is leader.

glosses.latin: Docere autem mulieri non permitto, neque dominari in uirum, sed esse in silentio.
footnotes: d: cf. oc erlabrai Ulad LU. 20a 1, aroslabra ‘speaks for them,’ Laws iv. 346
glosses.glossTrans: for the man is enough to speak for her.

glosses.latin: Adam enim primus formatus est, deinde Heva.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the man is elder and is stabler quam mulier.

glosses.latin: Saluabitur autem per filiorum generationem, si permanserit in fide.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] issamlid sin dano bid ícc disi tuistiu claindde
glosses.glossText: .i. issamlid sin dano bid ícc disi tuistiu claindde
glosses.glossFNs: .i. issamlid sin dano bid ícc disi tuistiu claindde
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is thus then that the bearing of children will be salvation to her.

glosses.latin: Fidelis sermo: Si quis aepiscopatum desiderat, bonum opus desiderat.
glosses.glossTrans: which he says below.

glosses.latin: Fidelis sermo: Si quis aepiscopatum desiderat, bonum opus desiderat.
glosses.glossText: .i. marterium ante omnes ɫ. dénad gnímu epsc(uip)
glosses.glossFNs: .i. marterium ante omnes ɫ. dénad gnímu epsc(uip)b
footnotes: b: The first stroke of the u is visible, the rest of the u, the i and p have been cut off by the bookbinder
glosses.glossTrans: or let him do a bishop’s deeds.

glosses.latin: Oportet ergo episcopum inreprehensibilem esse; unius uxoris uirum, ... hospitalem, doctorem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are a bishop’s deeds which he mentions below.

glosses.latin: Oportet ergo episcopum inreprehensibilem esse; unius uxoris uirum, ... hospitalem, doctorem.
glosses.glossTrans: before receiving orders, (and) after baptism.

glosses.latin: Oportet ergo episcopum inreprehensibilem esse; unius uxoris uirum, ... hospitalem, doctorem.
footnotes: c: MS. cáic
glosses.glossTrans: in receiving every one.

glosses.latin: Oportet ergo episcopum inreprehensibilem esse; unius uxoris uirum, ... hospitalem, doctorem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that he be skilled in knowledge and wisdom.

glosses.latin: Non uinolentum, ... non litigosum, non cupidum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he drinks not wine until he is drunk.

glosses.latin: Non uinolentum, ... non litigosum, non cupidum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní bii debuith do fri nech
glosses.glossText: .i. ní bii debuith do fri nech
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní bii debuith do fri nech
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he has no quarrel with any one.

glosses.latin: Non uinolentum, ... non litigosum, non cupidum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he is not avaricious.

glosses.latin: filios habentem subditos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. his children in subjection to him.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem domui suae bene praeesse nescit, quomodo aeclesiae Dei diligentiam habebit?
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] manirochoscasom amuntir intain biís cengrád ni uisse toisigecht sochuide do
glosses.glossText: .i. manirochoscasom amuntir intain biís cengrád ni uisse toisigecht sochuide do
glosses.glossFNs: .i. manirochoscasom amuntir intain biís cengrád ni uisse toisigecht sochuide do
footnotes: d: i.e. unordained
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if he cannot correct his household when he is without orders<sup>d</sup>, not proper for him is the leadership of a multitude.

glosses.latin: Non neophitum, ne, in superbiam elatus, in iudicium incidat diabuli.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not a novice.

glosses.latin: Non neophitum, ne, in superbiam elatus, in iudicium incidat diabuli.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] indígal dochoid for diabul iar nimmarmus ar nadecha foir
glosses.glossText: .i. indígal dochoid for diabul iar nimmarmus ar nadecha foir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. indígal dochoid for diabul iar nimmarmus ar nadecha foir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest the punishment which came upon the Devil after sin should come upon him.

glosses.latin: Oportet autem illum et testimonium habere bonum ab hís qui foris sunt, ut non in obprobrium incidat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄdarta cách teist foir asnuisse grad foir
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄdarta cách teist foir asnuisse grad foir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄdarta cách teist foir asnuisse grad foir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that every one may bear witness concerning him that orders are meet upon him.

glosses.latin: Oportet autem illum et testimonium habere bonum ab hís qui foris sunt, ut non in obprobrium incidat.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ondáes tuaithe eterarrobæ cindas abésse [in marg. inf.] arndip maith nairlethar amuntir ritecht gráid foir is irdorcu epirt iarum
glosses.glossText: .i. ondáes tuaithe eterarrobæ cindas abésse [in marg. inf.] arndip maith nairlethar amuntir ritecht gráid foir is irdorcu epirt iarum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ondáes tuaithe eterarrobæ cindas abésse [in marg. inf.] arndip maith nairlethar amuntir ritecht gráid foir is irdorcu epirt iarum
footnotes: e: lit. ‘before (the) coming of rank upon him’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from the lay-folk amongst whom he has been (as to) what sort are his morals. (Oportet) that he care well for his house- hold before taking orders<sup>e</sup>; it is needless to say afterwards (i.e. after taking orders).

glosses.latin: Diaconos ... non bilingues, ... non turpe lucrum sectantes,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not what they say and what they think be different: or (bilingues means) the slow of speech.

glosses.latin: Diaconos ... non bilingues, ... non turpe lucrum sectantes,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they shall not sell the divine gifts for worldly gain.

glosses.latin: Habentes ministerium fidei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for they are teachers of (the) faith.

glosses.latin: Et hi autem probentur primum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doberr teist diib ritecht gráid forib
glosses.glossText: .i. doberr teist diib ritecht gráid forib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doberr teist diib ritecht gráid forib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let testimony concerning them be given before they are ordained.

glosses.latin: Mulieres similiter pudicas.
footnotes: c: Unde intelligitur, quod de his dicat, quas adhuc hodie in Oriente diaconissas appellant, Pelagius, Migne 922
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for there were deaconesses there at that time<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Diacones sint unius uxoris uiri.
footnotes: d: non ut, si non habuerint, ducant; sed ne duas habeant, Pelagius, Migne, 923
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. before ordination<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Qui enim bene ministrauerint, gradum sibi bonum adquirunt.
glosses.glossText: .i. machomalnit angrád ɫ. apud plebiles marudchoiscset ammuintir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. machomalnit angrád ɫ. apud plebiles marudchoiscset ammuintir
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if they fulfil their orders: or apud plebiles if they have corrected their household.

glosses.latin: Qui enim bene ministrauerint, gradum sibi bonum adquirunt.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]praemium in regno caelesti[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] isuisse grad nepscuip dothabirt forru
glosses.glossText: .i. praemium in regno caelesti ɫ. isuisse grad nepscuip dothabirt forru
glosses.glossFNs: .i. praemium in regno caelesti ɫ. isuisse grad nepscuip dothabirt forru
glosses.glossTrans: or it is proper to confer a bishop’s rank upon them.

glosses.latin: Haec tibi scribo, sperans me uenire ad te cito.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. take heed of my coming. I shall soon come.

glosses.latin: Si autem tardauero, ut scias quomodo oporteat té in domo Dei conuersari.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I know not my goings as regards this.

glosses.latin: Si autem tardauero, ut scias quomodo oporteat té in domo Dei conuersari.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that thou shouldst teach and live.

glosses.latin: sacramentum, quod manifestatum est in carne .... apparuit angilis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] ([ie].i.[/ie]) isisin[b] rafetar (a)ngil arrobói i(fla)ith arsuidib (fé)ssin [vel]ɫ.[/vel] roardrigestar dúnni óan(g)lib inaidchi ingene
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] (.i.) isisin rafetar (a)ngil arrobói i(fla)ith arsuidib (fé)ssin ɫ. roardrigestar dúnni óan(g)lib inaidchi ingene
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] (.i.) isisin<sup>b</sup> rafetar (a)ngil arrobói i(fla)ith arsuidib (fé)ssin ɫ. roardrigestar dúnni óan(g)lib inaidchi ingene
footnotes: b: cf. Ml. 130b 8, Wb. 18c 8
e: The mystery (rún, fem.) of godliness (sacramentum pietatis)
f: cf. Wb. 27c 9
g: quando dicebant Gloria in excelsis, Pelagius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is therein<sup>e</sup> that angels know Him, for He was in the kingdom before them<sup>f</sup>; or it had appeared to us from angels on the night of the Nativity<sup>g</sup>.

glosses.latin: Spiritus [autem] manifeste dicit, quia in nouissimis temporibus discendent quidam á fide, adtendentes spiritibus erroris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through unfaith.

glosses.latin: Spiritus [autem] manifeste dicit, quia in nouissimis temporibus discendent quidam á fide, adtendentes spiritibus erroris.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ciaso demnithir so forcomnucuir bieid aimser nad creitfider [GLat]et[/GLat] dosluinfider
glosses.glossText: .i. ciaso demnithir so forcomnucuir bieid aimser nad creitfider et dosluinfider
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ciaso demnithir so forcomnucuir bieid aimser nad creitfider et dosluinfider
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though it is so certainly that it has happened, there will be a time when it will be disbelieved and denied.

glosses.latin: Spiritus [autem] manifeste dicit, quia in nouissimis temporibus discendent quidam á fide, adtendentes spiritibus erroris.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this which separates them from it.

glosses.latin: In hipocrisi loquentium mendacium, et cauteriatam habentium suam conscientiam,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in hypocrisy. Different are what they teach and what they do.

glosses.latin: In hipocrisi loquentium mendacium, et cauteriatam habentium suam conscientiam,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. branded or burnt.

glosses.latin: Prohibentium nubere, abstenere a cibis, quos Deus creauit ad percipiendum cum gratiarum actione fidelibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] conrobad adtlugud buide dodia treu [GLat]a fidelibus[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. conrobad adtlugud buide dodia treu a fidelibus
glosses.glossFNs: .i. conrobad adtlugud buide dodia treu a fidelibus
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that there might be rendering of thanks unto God through them a fidelibus.

glosses.latin: nihil reiiciendum quod cum gratiarum actione percipitur.
glosses.glossText: .i. mad cofoirbthetu hirisse arfemthar et attlugud ṁbuide
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mad cofoirbthetu hirisse arfemthara et attlugud ṁbuideb
footnotes: a: MS. arfenithar, as Zeuss correctly read
b: The dot over m is a punctum delens
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it be received with perfection of faith and thanksgiving.

glosses.latin: Sanctificatur enim per uerbum Dei.
footnotes: c: re proind might have been expected: cf. Wb. 9b 23, 19a 10, but pronn 31b 22
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through the blessing that is recited before a meal.

glosses.latin: Haec proponens fratribus, ... bonus eris minister . . enutritus uerbis ... bonae doctrinae, quam adsecutus és.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if these be the words that thou teachest.

glosses.latin: Haec proponens fratribus, ... bonus eris minister . . enutritus uerbis ... bonae doctrinae, quam adsecutus és.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which thou hast heard from me.

glosses.latin: Ineptas autem et inanes fabulas deuita, exerce autem teipsum ad pietatem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. old tales of the Law which false apostles declare.

glosses.latin: Ineptas autem et inanes fabulas deuita, exerce autem teipsum ad pietatem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nam corporalis exercitatio ad modicum utilis est; pietas autem ad omnia utilis est, promisionem habens uitae, quae nunc est, et futurae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not for long is the beauty of the body.

glosses.latin: Nam corporalis exercitatio ad modicum utilis est; pietas autem ad omnia utilis est, promisionem habens uitae, quae nunc est, et futurae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is good here and there.

glosses.latin: Fidelis sermo, et omni acceptione dignus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which he says below.

glosses.latin: Fidelis sermo, et omni acceptione dignus.
footnotes: d: leg. achoméit: cf. 29c 9. W. S.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is worth keeping.

glosses.latin: maledicimur, quod speramus in Deum uiuum, qui est saluator omnium hominum, maxime fidelium.
footnotes: f: Compare supra 21c 9
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore we are in evil plight<sup>f</sup>.

glosses.latin: maledicimur, quod speramus in Deum uiuum, qui est saluator omnium hominum, maxime fidelium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are the special favourites of the king.

glosses.latin: exemplo esto fidelium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that every one may take example from thee.

glosses.latin: Dum uenio, adtende lectioni, exortationi et doctrinae.
footnotes: e: anrolegais, Zimmer and Windisch; arrolegais, Chroust
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that thou mayst understand what thou hast read, that is, in fulfilling it and in teaching it.

glosses.latin: Dum uenio, adtende lectioni, exortationi et doctrinae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. encouraging a multitude in faith.

glosses.latin: gratiam quae data est tibi ... cum inpossitione manuum præsbiteri.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: gratiam quae data est tibi ... cum inpossitione manuum præsbiteri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when orders have been conferred upon thee.

glosses.latin: in hís esto, ut profectus tuus manifestus sit omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in fulfilling it.

glosses.latin: in hís esto, ut profectus tuus manifestus sit omnibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ↄfestar cách dofoirbthetu ↄrogba cách desimrecht díit
glosses.glossText: .i. ↄfestar cách dofoirbthetu ↄrogba cách desimrecht díit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ↄfestar cách dofoirbthetu ↄrogba cách desimrecht díit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that every one may know thy perfection, so that eyery one may take example from thee

glosses.latin: Ailtende tibi, et doctrinae; . . hoc enim faciens, et te ipsum saluum facies, et eos qui té audiunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to fulfil it.

glosses.latin: Ailtende tibi, et doctrinae; . . hoc enim faciens, et te ipsum saluum facies, et eos qui té audiunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that thou mayst teach it.

glosses.latin: Ailtende tibi, et doctrinae; . . hoc enim faciens, et te ipsum saluum facies, et eos qui té audiunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to fulfil it and to teach it.

glosses.latin: Ailtende tibi, et doctrinae; . . hoc enim faciens, et te ipsum saluum facies, et eos qui té audiunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will be salvation to thyself.

glosses.latin: Ailtende tibi, et doctrinae; . . hoc enim faciens, et te ipsum saluum facies, et eos qui té audiunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whosoever shall hear thee a-teaching.

glosses.latin: Seniorem ne increpaueris, sed obsecra ut patrem;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as it were (a father).

glosses.latin: Anus ut matres.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the elder women.

glosses.latin: Si qua autem uidua filios aut nepotes habet, discat primum domum suam regere, et motuam uicern reddere parentibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal dorígensat sidi aaltramsi dénadsi goiri doibsem
glosses.glossText: .i. amal dorígensat sidi aaltramsi dénadsi goiri doibsem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal dorígensat sidi aaltramsi dénadsi goiri doibsem
glosses.glossTrans: i.e as they have nurtured her (so) let her maintain them.

glosses.latin: Quae ... uidua est ... instat obsecratioonibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that she may be perfect.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem suorum, et maxime domesticorum curam non habet, fidem negauit, et est infidili deterior.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of their own household.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem suorum, et maxime domesticorum curam non habet, fidem negauit, et est infidili deterior.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] mabeid ní aratechta [GLat]uidua[/GLat] maccu [vel]ɫ.[/vel] tuistidi it cairigthi inmaicsi[a] [GLat]et[/GLat] intuistidi cendethidin dissi
glosses.glossText: .i. mabeid ní aratechta uidua maccu ɫ. tuistidi it cairigthi inmaicsi et intuistidi cendethidin dissi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. mabeid ní aratechta uidua maccu ɫ. tuistidi it cairigthi inmaicsia et intuistidi cendethidin dissi
footnotes: a: leg. inmaicsin
b: si accidit ut, Sarauw
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it be that<sup>b</sup> uidua has children or parents, these children and the parents are to be blamed when they do not take care of her.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem suorum, et maxime domesticorum curam non habet, fidem negauit, et est infidili deterior.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is a believer who is worse than an unbeliever.

glosses.latin: Uidua elegatur non minus sexaenta annorum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] is sí inso fedb asuisse dogoiri inæclis archuit óisa [GLat]et[/GLat] bésa
glosses.glossText: .i. is sí inso fedb asuisse dogoiri inæclis archuit óisa et bésa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. is sí inso fedb asuisse dogoiri inæclis archuit óisa et bésa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the widow whom it is just to maintain in the Church as regards age and morals.

glosses.latin: In operibus bonís testimonium habens: si filios educauit, si hospitio recepit, si sanctorum pedes lauauit, si
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when she was among lay-folk.

glosses.latin: In operibus bonís testimonium habens: si filios educauit, si hospitio recepit, si sanctorum pedes lauauit, si
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are the morals that bring her into the Church.

glosses.latin: In operibus bonís testimonium habens: si filios educauit, si hospitio recepit, si sanctorum pedes lauauit, si
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. quando fuit among lay-folk.

glosses.latin: In operibus bonís testimonium habens: si filios educauit, si hospitio recepit, si sanctorum pedes lauauit, si
glosses.glossTrans: if she has received guests.

glosses.latin: In operibus bonís testimonium habens: si filios educauit, si hospitio recepit, si sanctorum pedes lauauit, si
glosses.glossTrans: if she has had so much humility.

glosses.latin: tribulationem patientibus ministrauit, si omne opus bonum subsecuta est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if she has attended prisoners.

glosses.latin: tribulationem patientibus ministrauit, si omne opus bonum subsecuta est.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] manidtesarbi ní dimaith assagnímaib intain rombói etirtuáith isuisse a airitiu inæclis
glosses.glossText: .i. manidtesarbi ní dimaith assagnímaib intain rombói etirtuáith isuisse a airitiu inæclis
glosses.glossFNs: .i. manidtesarbi ní dimaith assagnímaib intain rombói etirtuáith isuisse a airitiu inæclis
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if nothing of good has been wanting to her actions while she was among the lay-folk, it is just to receive her into the Church.

glosses.latin: Adolescentiores . . uiduas deuita, cum enim luxoriatae fuerint ... nubere uolunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. (when) they are wanton.

glosses.latin: Habentes dampnationem, quia primam fidem inritam fecerunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if they marry.

glosses.latin: otiosae discunt circuire domus, non solum otiosae, sed et uerbosae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ithæ inso bésse inna fedb asluat hiris
glosses.glossText: .i. ithæ inso bésse inna fedb asluat hiris
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ithæ inso bésse inna fedb asluat hiris
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these are the manners of the widows who evade the faith.

glosses.latin: otiosae discunt circuire domus, non solum otiosae, sed et uerbosae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. visiting and being without doing aught.

glosses.latin: otiosae discunt circuire domus, non solum otiosae, sed et uerbosae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. women’s talk.

glosses.latin: Uolo ergo iuueniores nubere, . . nullam occassionem dare aduersario maledicti gratia.
footnotes: b: MS. isfer
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it seems to me better than to receive them into the Church.

glosses.latin: Uolo ergo iuueniores nubere, . . nullam occassionem dare aduersario maledicti gratia.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnaroib eícndag indraith diadi trea peccad som [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]maledicti gratia[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. arnaroib eícndag indraith diadi trea peccad som ɫ. maledicti gratia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnaroib eícndag indraith diadi trea peccad som ɫ. maledicti gratia
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that there be no blasphemy of the divine grace through their sin.

glosses.latin: Iam enim quedam conuersae sunt retro post Satanam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have gone again to worldly desires.

glosses.latin: Si quis fidelis habet uiduas, subministret illis, et non grauetur æclesia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they may provide their livelihood.

glosses.latin: Si quis fidelis habet uiduas, subministret illis, et non grauetur æclesia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest their maintenance in the Church be necessary.

glosses.latin: Qui bene praesunt præspiteri, duplici honore digni habentur, maxime qui laborant in uerbo et doctrina.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] comalnad neich forchanat [GLat]et[/GLat] biad [GLat]et[/GLat] éitach doib
glosses.glossText: .i. comalnad neich forchanat et biad et éitach doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. comalnad neich forchanat et biad et éitach doib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. fulfilling what they teach, and food and raiment to them.

glosses.latin: Qui bene praesunt præspiteri, duplici honore digni habentur, maxime qui laborant in uerbo et doctrina.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they that preach and teach God’s word.

glosses.latin: Dicit enim Scriptura: Non alligabis ós boui trituranti; et: Dignus est operarius mercide sua.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] desimrecht fetarlicci inso do imthrenugud asnuisse tasgid [GLat]et[/GLat] æítiud ind áisso gráid [GLat]et[/GLat]legind
glosses.glossText: .i. desimrecht fetarlicci inso do imthrenugud asnuisse tasgid et æítiud ind áisso gráid etlegind
glosses.glossFNs: .i. desimrecht fetarlicci inso do imthrenugud asnuisse tasgid et æítiud ind áisso gráid etlegind
footnotes: c: lit. the folk of grade and study
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is an example from the Old Law to confirm (the doctrine) that it is just to victual and clothe the clergy and students<sup>c</sup>.

glosses.latin: Dicit enim Scriptura: Non alligabis ós boui trituranti; et: Dignus est operarius mercide sua.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. just is the reward of his labour to every one.

glosses.latin: Aduersus prespiterum accusationem noli recipere, nisi sub dobus et tribus testibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to fasten a sin or transgression upon him.

glosses.latin: Aduersus prespiterum accusationem noli recipere, nisi sub dobus et tribus testibus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] maniastat indarecht peccad foir [GLat]uetus et nouum[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] natrirecte [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]naturae[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc] isiarum [a]iscomainsidi[/a] maniscomalnadar
glosses.glossText: .i. maniastat indarecht peccad foir uetus et nouum ɫ. natrirecte .i. naturae rl. isiarum iscomainsidi maniscomalnadar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. maniastat indarecht peccad foir uetus et nouum ɫ. natrirecte .i. naturae rl. isiarum iscomainsidia maniscomalnadar
footnotes: a: MS. iscomain side: see Pedersen KZ. 35. 318
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless the two laws–Vetus et Nouum–fasten a sin upon him, or the three laws, to wit, naturae, etc. he is then to be reproached unless he fulfils them.

glosses.latin: Peccantes coram omnibus argue, ut et caeteri timorem habeant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let as many as know their sin know their reprimanding.

glosses.latin: Peccantes coram omnibus argue, ut et caeteri timorem habeant.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as many as have heard it.

glosses.latin: Testor coram Deo, ... ut haec custodias sine praeiudicio, nihil facens in aliam partem declinando.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I beseech.

glosses.latin: Testor coram Deo, ... ut haec custodias sine praeiudicio, nihil facens in aliam partem declinando.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Testor coram Deo, ... ut haec custodias sine praeiudicio, nihil facens in aliam partem declinando.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]cogitatione[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]consilio[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] nitoibre grád fornech cena ætarcne riam
glosses.glossText: .i. cogitatione ɫ. consilio ɫ. nitoibre grád fornech cena ætarcne riam
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cogitatione ɫ. consilio ɫ. nitoibre grád fornech cena ætarcne riam
glosses.glossTrans: or thou shalt not confer orders on any one without knowing him previously.

glosses.latin: Testor coram Deo, ... ut haec custodias sine praeiudicio, nihil facens in aliam partem declinando.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] fadess nofathuaith manip tre dagcomairli dognether
glosses.glossText: .i. fadess nofathuaith manip tre dagcomairli dognether
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fadess nofathuaith manip tre dagcomairli dognether
footnotes: d: i.e. right and left, at all, à droite et à gauche, à tous côtés
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to south or to north<sup>d</sup>, unless it be done by good counsel.

glosses.latin: Manus cito nemini inpossueris; neque commonicaueris peccatís alienís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nitaibre grád fornech ↄfeser ainruccus dongrádsin
glosses.glossText: .i. nitaibre grád fornech ↄfeser ainruccus dongrádsin
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nitaibre grád fornech ↄfeser ainruccus dongrádsin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou shalt not confer orders on any one until thou knowest his fitness for those orders.

glosses.latin: Manus cito nemini inpossueris; neque commonicaueris peccatís alienís.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] armad [b]pecthaid[/b] intí forataibre grád lenit apecthe dindí dobeir angrád
glosses.glossText: .i. armad pecthaid intí forataibre grád lenit apecthe dindí dobeir angrád
glosses.glossFNs: .i. armad pecthaid<sup>b</sup> intí forataibre grád lenit apecthe dindí dobeir angrád
footnotes: b: MS. pecthad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for if he on whom thou conferrest orders is a sinner, his sins cleave to him who confers the orders.

glosses.latin: Noli adhuc bibere aquam; sed uino modico utere, propter stomachum tuum, et frequentes tuas infirmitates.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that it might not be an accession of illness to thee.

glosses.latin: Noli adhuc bibere aquam; sed uino modico utere, propter stomachum tuum, et frequentes tuas infirmitates.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Noli adhuc bibere aquam; sed uino modico utere, propter stomachum tuum, et frequentes tuas infirmitates.
footnotes: e: eclis gen. sg. of eclas ‘stomach,’ or (in case of birds) ‘craw’: cf. Frith grainne ’na egluis ⁊ ní fess cid arbar, Egerton 1782, fo. 40b 1
glosses.glossTrans: for the gastric<sup>e</sup> disease abides on thee.

glosses.latin: Noli adhuc bibere aquam; sed uino modico utere, propter stomachum tuum, et frequentes tuas infirmitates.
glosses.glossTrans: for thy infirmity continually.

glosses.latin: Quorumdam hominum peccata manifesta sunt, praecidentia ad iudicium; quosdam autem et subsecuntur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] [ie].i.[/ie] nitaibre grád fornech [GLat]causa[/GLat] apectha [vel]ɫ.[/vel] achaingníma arbiit alaili and rofinnatar apecthe rosíu[c] docói grád forru, alaili isiarum rofinnatar berir dano frilaa brátha
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] .i. nitaibre grád fornech causa apectha ɫ. achaingníma arbiit alaili and rofinnatar apecthe rosíu docói grád forru, alaili isiarum rofinnatar berir dano frilaa brátha
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] .i. nitaibre grád fornech causa apectha ɫ. achaingníma arbiit alaili and rofinnatar apecthe rosíuc docói grád forru, alaili isiarum rofinnatar berir dano frilaa brátha
footnotes: c: Sic: leg. resiu
f: lit. before grade shall go upon them
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou shouldst not confer orders on any one causa of his sin or of his good deed: for there are some whose sins are found out before their ordination<sup>f</sup>, others (whose sins) are (first) known afterwards. Reference is made, then, to Doomsday.

glosses.latin: Similiter et facta bona manifesta sunt; et quae aliter se habent, abscondi non possunt.
footnotes: b: MS. itsoilsi, Windisch
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there are virtues there that are manifest.

glosses.latin: Similiter et facta bona manifesta sunt; et quae aliter se habent, abscondi non possunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is after a time that the other good deeds are discovered.

glosses.latin: Similiter et facta bona manifesta sunt; et quae aliter se habent, abscondi non possunt.
footnotes: e: a glaring misinterpretation of the Latin
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is very difficult to conceal the good<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.latin: Quicumque sunt sub iugo, serui dominos suos omni honore dignos arbitrentur, né nomen Domini et doctrina blasfemetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the correction of the slaves this below.

glosses.latin: Quicumque sunt sub iugo, serui dominos suos omni honore dignos arbitrentur, né nomen Domini et doctrina blasfemetur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] arnaǽrbarthar roptar irlithi armoge dún ↄtanicc hiress [GLat]et[/GLat] itanirlithi iarum
glosses.glossText: .i. arnaǽrbarthar roptar irlithi armoge dún ↄtanicc hiress et itanirlithi iarum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. arnaǽrbarthar roptar irlithi armoge dún ↄtanicc hiress et itanirlithi iarum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest it be said our slaves were obedient to us until the faith came, and they are disobedient afterwards.

glosses.latin: Si quis ... non adquiescit sanís sermonibus,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which I preach.

glosses.latin: Superbus est, nihil sciens, sed languens circa questiones, et pugnas uerborum; ex quibus oriuntur inuidiae, contentiones, blasfemiae, suspiciones malae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he is haughty and he is ignorant.

glosses.latin: Superbus est, nihil sciens, sed languens circa questiones, et pugnas uerborum; ex quibus oriuntur inuidiae, contentiones, blasfemiae, suspiciones malae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dobeir cesti dochách [GLat]et[/GLat] ni maith less cia gabthar do
glosses.glossText: .i. dobeir cesti dochách et ni maith less cia gabthar do
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dobeir cesti dochách et ni maith less cia gabthar do
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he puts questions to every one and he likes not that (an answer) should be given(?) to him.

glosses.latin: Superbus est, nihil sciens, sed languens circa questiones, et pugnas uerborum; ex quibus oriuntur inuidiae, contentiones, blasfemiae, suspiciones malae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. mutual contests with bitterness.

glosses.latin: Superbus est, nihil sciens, sed languens circa questiones, et pugnas uerborum; ex quibus oriuntur inuidiae, contentiones, blasfemiae, suspiciones malae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to each against the other.

glosses.latin: Superbus est, nihil sciens, sed languens circa questiones, et pugnas uerborum; ex quibus oriuntur inuidiae, contentiones, blasfemiae, suspiciones malae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. mutual questions.

glosses.latin: Superbus est, nihil sciens, sed languens circa questiones, et pugnas uerborum; ex quibus oriuntur inuidiae, contentiones, blasfemiae, suspiciones malae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. each gives judgment on the other.

glosses.latin: Conflictiones hominum mente corrumptorum, ... existimantium questum esse pietatem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. mutual complaints and reproaches.

glosses.latin: Conflictiones hominum mente corrumptorum, ... existimantium questum esse pietatem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no one who does that has sense.

glosses.latin: Conflictiones hominum mente corrumptorum, ... existimantium questum esse pietatem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] asberat isar indeb isdénti tol dǽ
glosses.glossText: .i. asberat isar indeb isdénti tol dǽ
glosses.glossFNs: .i. asberat isar indeb isdénti tol dǽ
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who say that God’s will is to be done for sake of gain.

glosses.latin: Est autem questus magnus, pietas cum sufficientia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a pittance of food and raiment, just what is sufficient.

glosses.latin: Nihil enim intulimus in hunc mundum, haud dubium quod nec aufferre quid possimus.
footnotes: c: MS. isimbithsa, the second i being superscribed
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we brought no provision into this world with us.

glosses.latin: Nihil enim intulimus in hunc mundum, haud dubium quod nec aufferre quid possimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we shall not carry it out then.

glosses.latin: Habentes autem alimenta, et quibus tegamur, contenti sumus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the way that He supplies us.

glosses.latin: Habentes autem alimenta, et quibus tegamur, contenti sumus.
footnotes: d: leg. arndagairle, which is translated
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let us be thankful, this is our good counsel.

glosses.latin: Nam qui uolunt diuites feri, incidunt in temptationem,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] iscor lame ardodced buith ocairbiathad sainte
glosses.glossText: .i. iscor lame ardodced buith ocairbiathad sainte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. iscor lame ardodced buith ocairbiathad sainte
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is giving a hand to(?) unhappiness to be feeding covetousness.

glosses.latin: et [in] laqueum diabuli, et desideria multa, et inutilia, et nociua, quae mergunt homines in interitum et perditionem.
footnotes: a: línn for lín as fínn, Wb. 28b 24 for fín
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is the net wherein the Devil takes peccatores.

glosses.latin: et [in] laqueum diabuli, et desideria multa, et inutilia, et nociua, quae mergunt homines in interitum et perditionem.
footnotes: b: leg. bidaccobor i.e. bith-accobor, and cf. Wb 29b 23
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. constant craving semper.

glosses.latin: et [in] laqueum diabuli, et desideria multa, et inutilia, et nociua, quae mergunt homines in interitum et perditionem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to death.

glosses.latin: errauerunt a fide, et inseruerunt sé doloribus multis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have separated from (the) faith.

glosses.latin: errauerunt a fide, et inseruerunt sé doloribus multis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. perpetual languishing to them.

glosses.latin: sectare uero iustitiam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is juster for thee.

glosses.latin: adprehende uitam aeternam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which there is for thee in heaven.

glosses.latin: Ut serues mandatum sine macula, inreprehensibile, usque in aduentum Domini nostri,
footnotes: d: ‘donec ei succurres,’ Ebel G.C.2 880. But tarilbæ is = to-ad-ro-ṡelbae
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that thou mayst deliver it<sup>d</sup> on the day of death or of doom.

glosses.latin: Quem suís temporibus ostendet beatus et solus potens, Rex regum et Dominus dominantium.
glosses.glossTrans: as hath been prophesied.

glosses.latin: Quem suís temporibus ostendet beatus et solus potens, Rex regum et Dominus dominantium.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doadbadar [GLat]híc[/GLat] bríg inna persine dodiccfa asmó de focíaltar
glosses.glossText: .i. doadbadar híc bríg inna persine dodiccfa asmó de focíaltar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doadbadar híc bríg inna persine dodiccfa asmó de focíaltar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. híc is shown the might of the Person that will so come, who is the more expected.

glosses.latin: cui gloria, honor et imperium sempeternum.
footnotes: e: Perhaps trechenc is = trecheṅg YBL. 414b 24, treching, Fél. Oeng. Sep. 16, .i. triar. In tre-thenc (if this be the right reading), the tenc may be cogn. with A.-S. þing, Eng. thing, Nhd. ding, W. S.: the tre- is the form of the numeral ‘three’ in composition: it here refers to ‘gloria, honor et imperium’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a fitting triad<sup>e</sup> to Him.

glosses.latin: Diuitibus huius seculi praecipe non sublime sapere, . . sed in Deo uiuo, qui prestat nobís omnia abunde;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. with an apostle’s power.

glosses.latin: Diuitibus huius seculi praecipe non sublime sapere, . . sed in Deo uiuo, qui prestat nobís omnia abunde;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is He who is the well of the treasures.

glosses.latin: Thesaurizare sibi fundamentum bonum in futurum, ut adprehendant ueram uitam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] condipmaith afuirec innim [GLat]et[/GLat]ↄrobat inhellug coirp crist innim
glosses.glossText: .i. condipmaith afuirec innim etↄrobat inhellug coirp crist innim
glosses.glossFNs: .i. condipmaith afuirec innim etↄrobat inhellug coirp crist innim
footnotes: f: fuirec, cf. LU. 60a 44, LL. 172a 33, 48, = O’Clery’s fuireag .i. fleadh no fésda
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that their provision<sup>f</sup> in heaven may be good, and that they may be in union with Christ’s Body in heaven.

glosses.latin: depossitum cus[to]di, diuitans profanas uocum nouitates, et oppossitiones falsi nominis scientiae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thus is its preservation.

glosses.latin: depossitum cus[to]di, diuitans profanas uocum nouitates, et oppossitiones falsi nominis scientiae.
footnotes: c: = cobra LL. 194b 47 .i. comṡuilbire, P. O’C.
g: etercert. Ebel, G.C.2 248, renders this by ‘interpretatio,’ the usual meaning, but one which here is unsuitable, cf. etercert di dúlib, Wb. 27a 10
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a dissertation<sup>g</sup> concerning sins and worldly conversation.

glosses.latin: depossitum cus[to]di, diuitans profanas uocum nouitates, et oppossitiones falsi nominis scientiae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. imperfect mutual questions.

glosses.latin: circa fidem exciderunt.
