glosses.glossTrans: or beyond faith.

glosses.latin: circa fidem exciderunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who have fallen away.

glosses.latin: Paulus, apostolus Christi Iesu, per uoluntatem Dei, secundum promisionem uitae,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not without God’s counsel though.

glosses.latin: Paulus, apostolus Christi Iesu, per uoluntatem Dei, secundum promisionem uitae,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. my deeds are not at variance with my rank and my calling.

glosses.latin: Timotheo carissimo filio, gratia et mesericordia, pax á ... Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: of the whole of my pupils.

glosses.latin: Timotheo carissimo filio, gratia et mesericordia, pax á ... Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Dei et to him to every one.

glosses.latin: Timotheo carissimo filio, gratia et mesericordia, pax á ... Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: I myself.

glosses.latin: Gratias ago Deo meo, cui seruio a progenitoribus meís, . . quod sine intermissione habeam tui memoriam in orationibus meis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóbói mochland [GLat]et[/GLat] mochenéel isocfrecur céill dæ atáa isocca dano attósa
glosses.glossText: .i. hóbói mochland et mochenéel isocfrecur céill dæ atáa isocca dano attósa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóbói mochland et mochenéel isocfrecur céill dæ atáa isocca dano attósa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. since my clan and my kindred came into being, it has been engaged in worshipping God; I too am at it.

glosses.latin: Gratias ago Deo meo, cui seruio a progenitoribus meís, . . quod sine intermissione habeam tui memoriam in orationibus meis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. praying God for thee continually.

glosses.latin: Desiderans té uidere, memor lacrimarum tuarum, ut gaudio inplear.
glosses.glossTrans: it were much to me that thou hadst not separated from me.

glosses.latin: Desiderans té uidere, memor lacrimarum tuarum, ut gaudio inplear.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] intain ronanissiu domhéisse nírbo accur[a] lat
glosses.glossText: .i. intain ronanissiu domhéisse nírbo accur lat
glosses.glossFNs: .i. intain ronanissiu domhéisse nírbo accur<sup>a</sup> lat
footnotes: a: cf. Ml. 92a 16
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when thou hast remained after me it was no joy to thee.

glosses.latin: Desiderans té uidere, memor lacrimarum tuarum, ut gaudio inplear.
footnotes: b: immanárladmar = imm-an-ad-ro-gládmar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided we converse together<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Recordationem accipiens eius fidei quae est in té non ficta; quae et habitauit primum in abia tua Loidae, et matre tua Eunichæ, certus sum autem quod et in té.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in thy grandmother.

glosses.latin: Recordationem accipiens eius fidei quae est in té non ficta; quae et habitauit primum in abia tua Loidae, et matre tua Eunichæ, certus sum autem quod et in té.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is her name.

glosses.latin: Recordationem accipiens eius fidei quae est in té non ficta; quae et habitauit primum in abia tua Loidae, et matre tua Eunichæ, certus sum autem quod et in té.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rofetarsa isfoirbthe do hiresso batoich deit dano arbafoirbthe hires domathar etdosenmathar
glosses.glossText: .i. rofetarsa isfoirbthe do hiresso batoich deit dano arbafoirbthe hires domathar etdosenmathar
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rofetarsa isfoirbthe do hiresso batoich deit dano arbafoirbthe hires domathar etdosenmathar
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I know thy faith is perfect: it were natural for thee, moreover, for the faith of thy mother and of thy grandmother was perfect.

glosses.latin: Recordationem accipiens eius fidei quae est in té non ficta; quae et habitauit primum in abia tua Loidae, et matre tua Eunichæ, certus sum autem quod et in té.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am sure that thou hast it.

glosses.latin: admoneo te ut resuscites gratiam Dei.
footnotes: c: conatil = con-ad-til, where the ad is perfective: cf. the non-perfective preterite con-tuil cotlud cimmeda, Br. h. 2
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if it has slept<sup>c</sup> a little through fear of tribulations.

glosses.latin: Non enim dedit Deus nobís spiritum timoris, sed uirtutis et dilectionis et sobrietatis.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Non enim dedit Deus nobís spiritum timoris, sed uirtutis et dilectionis et sobrietatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that we should be timid in sufferings.

glosses.latin: Non enim dedit Deus nobís spiritum timoris, sed uirtutis et dilectionis et sobrietatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that is the triad which sustains (power, love, discipline).

glosses.latin: Noli itaque erubescere testimonium Domini nostri, neque me uinctum eius, sed conlabora euangelio, secundum uirtutem Dei,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nabad mebul lat precept crist crochthi
glosses.glossText: .i. nabad mebul lat precept crist crochthi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nabad mebul lat precept crist crochthi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be not ashamed to teach Christ crucified.

glosses.latin: Noli itaque erubescere testimonium Domini nostri, neque me uinctum eius, sed conlabora euangelio, secundum uirtutem Dei,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be not mournful though I be in prison.

glosses.latin: Noli itaque erubescere testimonium Domini nostri, neque me uinctum eius, sed conlabora euangelio, secundum uirtutem Dei,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. both fulfilling it and teaching it.

glosses.latin: Noli itaque erubescere testimonium Domini nostri, neque me uinctum eius, sed conlabora euangelio, secundum uirtutem Dei,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] niba anse duit iar neurt inspirito nóib
glosses.glossText: .i. niba anse duit iar neurt inspirito nóib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. niba anse duit iar neurt inspirito nóib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it will not be hard for thee according to the strength of the Holy Ghost.

glosses.latin: Qui nos liberauit et uocauit ... secundum propossitum suum, et gratiam quae data est in nobís in Christo Iesu ante tempora secularia;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hóre arinrobe buith inelluch coirp crist
glosses.glossText: .i. hóre arinrobe buith inelluch coirp crist
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hóre arinrobe buith inelluch coirp crist
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it had remained for us to be in union with Christ’s Body.

glosses.latin: Qui nos liberauit et uocauit ... secundum propossitum suum, et gratiam quae data est in nobís in Christo Iesu ante tempora secularia;
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] fo besad fir trebuir crenas tíir diachlainnd cidrisíu robǽ cland les issamlid arrobertsom arnícc ni cidrisíu robeimmis etir
glosses.glossText: .i. fo besad fir trebuir crenas tíir diachlainnd cidrisíu robǽ cland les issamlid arrobertsom arnícc ni cidrisíu robeimmis etir
glosses.glossFNs: .i. fo besad fir trebuir crenas tíir diachlainnd cidrisíu robǽ cland les issamlid arrobertsom arnícc ni cidrisíu robeimmis etir
footnotes: a: ‘perfecit,’ Ebel G.C.2 454; ‘paravit,’ Sarauw, who refers to Ml. 53d 4, 66c 19, 102c 5; cf. Trip. Life 162, 164, 190
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. after the manner of a prudent man who buys land for his children even before he has children, it is thus that He has designed<sup>a</sup> our salvation even before we existed at all.

glosses.latin: inluminauit autem uitam et incorruptionem per euangelium:
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. how life and immortality are to be pursued.

glosses.latin: In quo positus sum ego praedicator et apostolus et magister gentium.
glosses.glossTrans: this is my rank.

glosses.latin: Ob quam causam etiam haec patior, sed non confundor. Scio enim, cui credidi, et certus sum quia potens est depossitum meum seruare in illum diem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because I am the teacher of the gentiles.

glosses.latin: Ob quam causam etiam haec patior, sed non confundor. Scio enim, cui credidi, et certus sum quia potens est depossitum meum seruare in illum diem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I am not ashamed that I suffer it.

glosses.latin: Ob quam causam etiam haec patior, sed non confundor. Scio enim, cui credidi, et certus sum quia potens est depossitum meum seruare in illum diem.
footnotes: b: cf. Wb. 1b 14
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that he is a supreme being<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Ob quam causam etiam haec patior, sed non confundor. Scio enim, cui credidi, et certus sum quia potens est depossitum meum seruare in illum diem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rodbodia adroni [GLat]et[/GLat]ↄnói arrad file andsom [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ishésom adroni dodia infochricc file do innim [GLat]et[/GLat]isdia cota óeiade treagnímosom
glosses.glossText: .i. rodbodia adroni etↄnói arrad file andsom ɫ. ishésom adroni dodia infochricc file do innim etisdia cota óeiade treagnímosom
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rodbodia adroni etↄnói arrad file andsom ɫ. ishésom adroni dodia infochricc file do innim etisdia cota óeiade treagnímosom
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. either God has committed and preserves the grace that there is in him; or it is he that has committed to God the reward that there is for him in heaven, and it is God who preserves that through his deeds.

glosses.latin: Formam habe sanorum uerborum quae a me audisti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. fulfil them sicut audisti.

glosses.latin: Formam habe sanorum uerborum quae a me audisti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which heal (both) body and soul.

glosses.latin: Scis hoc, quod auersi sunt á me omnes qui in Assia sunt: ex quibus [est] Phigelus et Hermogines.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. their names are mentioned that it may be a shame to them.

glosses.latin: Det misericordiam Dominus Onesfori domui, quia sepe me refrigerauit, et catenam meam non erubuit;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to the household.

glosses.latin: Det misericordiam Dominus Onesfori domui, quia sepe me refrigerauit, et catenam meam non erubuit;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. before my captivity and in my captivity.

glosses.latin: Det misericordiam Dominus Onesfori domui, quia sepe me refrigerauit, et catenam meam non erubuit;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he has not been ashamed of my friendship although I have been a captive.

glosses.latin: Sed ... sollicite me quesiuit et inuenit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because it was sollicite (that he sought me).

glosses.latin: quanta Ephesi ministrauit [mihi], melius tú nosti.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ismó afius deitsiu andorigeni dimaith frimsa
glosses.glossText: .i. ismó afius deitsiu andorigeni dimaith frimsa
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ismó afius deitsiu andorigeni dimaith frimsa
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou knowest better what good he has done unto me.

glosses.latin: Tu ergo ... confortare in gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. strengthen thyself.

glosses.latin: Tu ergo ... confortare in gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. may it not escape thee.

glosses.latin: Et quae audisti a me per multos testes, haec commenda fidelibus hominibus, qui idonei erunt et alios docere.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ind hí[a] rochualatar inprecept [GLat]et[/GLat] inmairb atathestis donuccussa do deimnigud moprecepte
glosses.glossText: .i. ind hí rochualatar inprecept et inmairb atathestis donuccussa do deimnigud moprecepte
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ind hía rochualatar inprecept et inmairb atathestis donuccussa do deimnigud moprecepte
footnotes: a: Palaeographically perhaps int hí
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they who have heard the doctrine and the dead, are the testes which I have brought to assure my doctrine.

glosses.latin: Et quae audisti a me per multos testes, haec commenda fidelibus hominibus, qui idonei erunt et alios docere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. preach to them.

glosses.latin: Et quae audisti a me per multos testes, haec commenda fidelibus hominibus, qui idonei erunt et alios docere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they will be faithful through that teaching.

glosses.latin: Labora sicut bonus miles Christi Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in teaching and fulfilling.

glosses.latin: Nemo militans Deo implicat se negotiis secularibus, ut ei placeat cui se probauit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because, then, thou art bonus miles.

glosses.latin: Nemo militans Deo implicat se negotiis secularibus, ut ei placeat cui se probauit.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Nemo militans Deo implicat se negotiis secularibus, ut ei placeat cui se probauit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided there be nothing on (his) conscience.

glosses.latin: Nam et qui certat in agone, non coronatur nisi ligitime certauerit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he puts, then, a similitude of the worldly warfare híc.

glosses.latin: Nam et qui certat in agone, non coronatur nisi ligitime certauerit.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished didiu al[GLat]ligitime[/GLat] scarad fri indeb indomuin [GLat]et[/GLat]tol dǽ do dénum
glosses.glossText: .i. ished didiu alligitime scarad fri indeb indomuin ettol dǽ do dénum
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished didiu alligitime scarad fri indeb indomuin ettol dǽ do dénum
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this, then, is the legitime, to separate from the gain of the world and to do God’s will.

glosses.latin: dabit tibi enim Dominus in omnibus intellectum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that thou mayst understand it.

glosses.latin: Memor esto Dominum Iesum Christum resurrexisse a mortuis, ... secundum euangelium meum,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to answer those who deny (the) resurrection.

glosses.latin: Memor esto Dominum Iesum Christum resurrexisse a mortuis, ... secundum euangelium meum,
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as I preach it.

glosses.latin: In quo laboro usque ad uincula, quasi male operans; sed uerbum Dei non est alligatum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that I abide in bonds and in prisons.

glosses.latin: In quo laboro usque ad uincula, quasi male operans; sed uerbum Dei non est alligatum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. though I be in a prison and in a bond.

glosses.latin: Ideo omnia sustineo propter electos; ut [et] ipsi salutem consequantur, quae est in Christo Iesu, cum gloria caelesti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that they may take example from me.

glosses.latin: Ideo omnia sustineo propter electos; ut [et] ipsi salutem consequantur, quae est in Christo Iesu, cum gloria caelesti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. through imitating me.

glosses.latin: Ideo omnia sustineo propter electos; ut [et] ipsi salutem consequantur, quae est in Christo Iesu, cum gloria caelesti.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. salvation with glory following it.

glosses.latin: Si sustenebimus, et conregnabimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in sovranty.

glosses.latin: Si non credimus, ille fidelis permanet; negare sé ipsum non potest.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] hifírad [a]neich[/a] dorairngert [ie].i.[/ie] dígal fornn mani cretem
glosses.glossText: .i. hifírad neich dorairngert .i. dígal fornn mani cretem
glosses.glossFNs: .i. hifírad neich<sup>a</sup> dorairngert .i. dígal fornn mani cretem
footnotes: a: MS. nech
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in making true what He has promised, even punishment upon us unless we believe.

glosses.latin: Si non credimus, ille fidelis permanet; negare sé ipsum non potest.
footnotes: c: cf. Sarauw, Irske Studier 98
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that<sup>c</sup> what He has promised is untrue.

glosses.latin: Haec commone, testificans coram Domino. Noli uerbís contendeire, ad nihil [enim] utile est, nisi ad subuersionem audientium.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Haec commone, testificans coram Domino. Noli uerbís contendeire, ad nihil [enim] utile est, nisi ad subuersionem audientium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. when thou beseechest every one for its fulfilment.

glosses.latin: Haec commone, testificans coram Domino. Noli uerbís contendeire, ad nihil [enim] utile est, nisi ad subuersionem audientium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. quarrels and questions.

glosses.latin: Haec commone, testificans coram Domino. Noli uerbís contendeire, ad nihil [enim] utile est, nisi ad subuersionem audientium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is no profit for good.

glosses.latin: Haec commone, testificans coram Domino. Noli uerbís contendeire, ad nihil [enim] utile est, nisi ad subuersionem audientium.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is, however, good for this.

glosses.latin: Sollicite cura té ipsum probabilem exhibere Deo operarium inconfussibilem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that there may be no vices in thee.

glosses.latin: Sollicite cura té ipsum probabilem exhibere Deo operarium inconfussibilem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Sollicite cura té ipsum probabilem exhibere Deo operarium inconfussibilem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not thy deeds make void what thou sayest.

glosses.latin: Profana autem et inaniloquia debita; multum enim proficent ad impetatem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. philosophy and dialectic.

glosses.latin: Profana autem et inaniloquia debita; multum enim proficent ad impetatem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they effect nothing else.

glosses.latin: Et sermo eorum ut cancer serpit; ex quibus est Hymenaeus et Philetus,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal tuthle [vel]ɫ.[/vel] ailsin [GLat]Pelagius[/GLat]: [GLat]cancer esse dicitur uulnus quod in mammellís feminarum nascitur, quibus nissi cito sub[Sup]u[/Sup]entum fuerit cum ad cór uirus serpendo peruenerit nullum ulltra remedium est. Ita hereticorum uitanda sunt eloquia[/GLat][b]
glosses.glossText: .i. amal tuthle ɫ. ailsin Pelagius: cancer esse dicitur uulnus quod in mammellís feminarum nascitur, quibus nissi cito sub[u]entum fuerit cum ad cór uirus serpendo peruenerit nullum ulltra remedium est. Ita hereticorum uitanda sunt eloquia
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal tuthle ɫ. ailsin Pelagius: cancer esse dicitur uulnus quod in mammellís feminarum nascitur, quibus nissi cito subuentum fuerit cum ad cór uirus serpendo peruenerit nullum ulltra remedium est. Ita hereticorum uitanda sunt eloquiab
footnotes: b: colloquia, Migne, col. 935, where the words “ne per aures irremediabiliter uulnerent mentes” are added
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. like a swelling or gangrene.

glosses.latin: Dicentes resurrectionem esse iam factam.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished anesséirge leu maic indegaid anathre [vel]ɫ.[/vel] tuáth dǽ adóiri
glosses.glossText: .i. ished anesséirge leu maic indegaid anathre ɫ. tuáth dǽ adóiri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished anesséirge leu maic indegaid anathre ɫ. tuáth dǽ adóiri
footnotes: d: In filiis, siue ossa uiuificata in Ezechiele Israelis, interpretabantur de captiuitate collecta, quasi resurrexisse, Pelagius, Migne xxx. 935
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this they deem the resurrection: sons succeeding their fathers, or God’s people (coming) out of bondage<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Sed firmum fundamentum Dei stetit, habens signaculum hoc.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it can never be moved.

glosses.latin: Sed firmum fundamentum Dei stetit, habens signaculum hoc.
glosses.glossText: .i. stabilitatis ɫ. fiuss do amuntire ut dicit nouit rl.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. stabilitatis ɫ. fiuss do amuntire ut dicit nouit rl.
glosses.glossTrans: or knowledge to Him of His household.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem emundauerit sé ab istís, erit uas in honorem sanctificatum, et utile Domino, ad omne opus bonum paratum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] precept athirge arnaepret indheritic hóre is [GLat]in contumiliam[/GLat] dúnni nipiam fri aithirgi
glosses.glossText: .i. precept athirge arnaepret indheritic hóre is in contumiliam dúnni nipiam fri aithirgi
glosses.glossFNs: .i. precept athirge arnaepret indheritic hóre is in contumiliam dúnni nipiam fri aithirgi
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. teaching repentance lest the heretics say, ‘because it is in contumeliam to us we will not be at repentance.’

glosses.latin: Si quis autem emundauerit sé ab istís, erit uas in honorem sanctificatum, et utile Domino, ad omne opus bonum paratum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the Lord will abide therein.

glosses.latin: Si quis autem emundauerit sé ab istís, erit uas in honorem sanctificatum, et utile Domino, ad omne opus bonum paratum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. provided he cleanse himself by repentance.

glosses.latin: Iuuenilia autem desideria fuge, sectare uero iustitiam, fidem, caritatem, et pacem cum ís qui inuocant Dominum de corde puro.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Iuuenilia autem desideria fuge, sectare uero iustitiam, fidem, caritatem, et pacem cum ís qui inuocant Dominum de corde puro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. of pride and restlessness.

glosses.latin: Iuuenilia autem desideria fuge, sectare uero iustitiam, fidem, caritatem, et pacem cum ís qui inuocant Dominum de corde puro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is better.

glosses.latin: Iuuenilia autem desideria fuge, sectare uero iustitiam, fidem, caritatem, et pacem cum ís qui inuocant Dominum de corde puro.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal ata cáinchumracig [c]side[/c] armbacháinchomraccachso [vel]ɫ.[/vel] cáinchomracc deit friu
glosses.glossText: .i. amal ata cáinchumracig side armbacháinchomraccachso ɫ. cáinchomracc deit friu
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal ata cáinchumracig side<sup>c</sup> armbacháinchomraccachso ɫ. cáinchomracc deit friu
footnotes: c: MS. sid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as these are benevolent, that thou mayst be benevolent, or have thou benevolence towards them.

glosses.latin: Stultas autem, et sine diciplina questiones debita, sciens quia generant lites.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as heretics and false apostles do.

glosses.latin: Stultas autem, et sine diciplina questiones debita, sciens quia generant lites.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. therefore it is to be avoided.

glosses.latin: Seruum autem Domini non oportet litigare, sed mansuetum esse ad omnes, docebilem, patientem.
footnotes: d: cf. Wb. 28a 21
g: mug Dé = W. meu-dwy ‘hermit’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not proper for a bondslave of God<sup>g</sup> to be at strife.

glosses.latin: Seruum autem Domini non oportet litigare, sed mansuetum esse ad omnes, docebilem, patientem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] cense fricách eter carit [GLat]et[/GLat]escarit [GLat]ut beati mítes[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. cense fricách eter carit etescarit ut beati mítes
glosses.glossFNs: .i. cense fricách eter carit etescarit ut beati mítes
footnotes: h: Matth. v. 4
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. gentleness to every one, both friend and foe, ut ‘Beati mites<sup>h</sup>.’

glosses.latin: Seruum autem Domini non oportet litigare, sed mansuetum esse ad omnes, docebilem, patientem.
footnotes: i: sochoisc seems intended for ‘docebilem’
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. easy to teach<sup>i</sup>.

glosses.latin: Cum modestia corripientem eos qui resistunt ueritati.
footnotes: e: Sarauw would emend to seirbe ‘bitterness,’ comparing Wb. 20c 3, 27c 6, 27c 8
k: aill, cf. mad aill duib, Wb. 13b 3
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for not becoming<sup>k</sup> is harshness(?) in reproaching.

glosses.latin: Ut resipiscent a diabuli laqueís, á quo capti tenentur ad ipsius uoluntatem.
footnotes: l: an emendent se, Asc. Gloss. cc: sed v. KZ. xxxv. 409
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. if perchance they may repent it<sup>l</sup>.

glosses.latin: Ut resipiscent a diabuli laqueís, á quo capti tenentur ad ipsius uoluntatem.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Ut resipiscent a diabuli laqueís, á quo capti tenentur ad ipsius uoluntatem.
footnotes: f: MS. doaireor, with u written over the penultimate letter. Leg. dia réir?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to satisfaction(?).

glosses.latin: Hoc autem scito, quod ... instabunt tempora periculosa;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. take heed of this.

glosses.latin: Hoc autem scito, quod ... instabunt tempora periculosa;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to body and soul.

glosses.latin: Erunt homines se ipsos amantes,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ni ↄchechrat act ní bas tol doib
glosses.glossText: .i. ni ↄchechrat act ní bas tol doib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni ↄchechrat act ní bas tol doib
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they will love nothing but what is their will.

glosses.latin: sine pace, creminatores, incontinentes, inmites, sine benegnitate.
glosses.glossTrans: towards God and man.

glosses.latin: sine pace, creminatores, incontinentes, inmites, sine benegnitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. slandering every one.

glosses.latin: sine pace, creminatores, incontinentes, inmites, sine benegnitate.
footnotes: a: leg. fricachréit? cf. Wb. 31c 13
glosses.glossTrans: on everything.

glosses.latin: sine pace, creminatores, incontinentes, inmites, sine benegnitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. bitter to every one.

glosses.latin: sine pace, creminatores, incontinentes, inmites, sine benegnitate.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. towards any one.

glosses.latin: proterui, ... et uoluntatum amatores magis quam Dei.
footnotes: b: leg. múcni
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: proterui, ... et uoluntatum amatores magis quam Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they prefer love of their will to (love) of God.

glosses.latin: uirtutem autem eius abnegantes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] asberat istol dǽ forchanat [GLat]et[/GLat] nisí dongníat
glosses.glossText: .i. asberat istol dǽ forchanat et nisí dongníat
glosses.glossFNs: .i. asberat istol dǽ forchanat et nisí dongníat
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they say it is God’s will that they teach, and it is not it that they do.

glosses.latin: Ex his enim sunt, qui penetrant domos, et captiuas ducunt mulierculas oneratas peccatis.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] consoibat cách treu aritmathi side ocaslug
glosses.glossText: .i. consoibat cách treu aritmathi side ocaslug
glosses.glossFNs: .i. consoibat cách treu aritmathi side ocaslug
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they deceive every one through them, for these are good at seduction.

glosses.latin: Ex his enim sunt, qui penetrant domos, et captiuas ducunt mulierculas oneratas peccatis.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who commit every sin through their seduction.

glosses.latin: Semper discentes, et numquam ad scientiam ueritatis peruenientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. continual learning to them.

glosses.latin: Semper discentes, et numquam ad scientiam ueritatis peruenientes.
glosses.glossTrans: for each contends with the other.

glosses.latin: Quemodmodum autem Iamnes et Mambres restiterunt Moysi, ita et hi resistunt ueritati: homines corrupti mente, reprobi circa fidem.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] da druith ægeptacdi robatar ocimbresun frimmoysi [GLat]et[/GLat] nistuirmi recht act asenchassom fadesin arropo eola som na huile fetarlice
glosses.glossText: .i. da druith ægeptacdi robatar ocimbresun frimmoysi et nistuirmi recht act asenchassom fadesin arropo eola som na huile fetarlice
glosses.glossFNs: .i. da druith ægeptacdi robatar ocimbresun frimmoysi et nistuirmi recht act asenchassom fadesin arropo eola som na huile fetarlice
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. two Egyptian wizards who had been contending with Moses; and the Law records them not, but his own tradition, for he was skilled in the whole Old Testament.

glosses.latin: Quemodmodum autem Iamnes et Mambres restiterunt Moysi, ita et hi resistunt ueritati: homines corrupti mente, reprobi circa fidem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. corrupted (is) their mind.

glosses.latin: Quemodmodum autem Iamnes et Mambres restiterunt Moysi, ita et hi resistunt ueritati: homines corrupti mente, reprobi circa fidem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. false their faith.

glosses.latin: Sed ultra non proficient; insipientia enim eorum manifesta erit omnibus, sicut et illorum fuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they shall deceive no further.

glosses.latin: Sed ultra non proficient; insipientia enim eorum manifesta erit omnibus, sicut et illorum fuit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one knows their deeds and their errors as they have been.

glosses.latin: Tu autem adsecutus és meam doctrinam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. all from this onwards is of taking an example.

glosses.latin: Et omnes qui pie uolunt uiuire in Christo Iesu persecutionem patientur.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]eripiat Aliter[/GLat] ind hí lasmbi accobur tol dæ ishecen doib ingremmen dofoditiu isin biuth
glosses.glossText: .i. eripiat Aliter ind hí lasmbi accobur tol dæ ishecen doib ingremmen dofoditiu isin biuth
glosses.glossFNs: .i. eripiat Aliter ind hí lasmbi accobur tol dæ ishecen doib ingremmen dofoditiu isin biuth
footnotes: c: Perhaps the glossographer has dropt the words do dénum after dæ. If so, translate, ‘They who have a desire to do God’s will’
glosses.glossTrans: they who desire God’s will<sup>c</sup>, it is necessary for them to endure persecutions in the world.

glosses.latin: Et omnes qui pie uolunt uiuire in Christo Iesu persecutionem patientur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. this is the pie uiuere.

glosses.latin: Mali autem homines et seductores proficient in peius; errantes, et in errorem mittentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they will become worse and worse.

glosses.latin: Mali autem homines et seductores proficient in peius; errantes, et in errorem mittentes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. evil them selves

glosses.latin: Mali autem homines et seductores proficient in peius; errantes, et in errorem mittentes.
footnotes: d: Here (as in Wb. 6c 1) conéit is the act. s-fut. sg. 3 of conéitgim
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. every one who shall connive<sup>d</sup> at them.

glosses.latin: Omnis scriptura diuinitus inspirata, utilis est ... ad erudiendum in iustitia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which had been breathed into patriarchs and prophets and apostles.

glosses.latin: Omnis scriptura diuinitus inspirata, utilis est ... ad erudiendum in iustitia.
glosses.glossTrans: learning of righteousness.

glosses.latin: Testificor, coram Deo et Iesu Christo, qui iudicaturus est uiuos et mortuos, per aduentum ipsius et regnum eius.
glosses.glossTrans: I beseech.

glosses.latin: Testificor, coram Deo et Iesu Christo, qui iudicaturus est uiuos et mortuos, per aduentum ipsius et regnum eius.
glosses.glossTrans: by His kingdom.

glosses.latin: Praedica uerbum: insta oportune, inoportune.
glosses.glossTrans: it is this that is besought there.

glosses.latin: Praedica uerbum: insta oportune, inoportune.
glosses.glossTrans: whether it seem good or bad to any one, preach thou to him.

glosses.latin: Erit enim tempus, cum sanam doctrinam non sustinebunt; sed ad sua desideria coaceruabunt sibi magistros, prurientes auribus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ní ba fochen leu aforcital íccas corpu [GLat]et[/GLat]anmana
glosses.glossText: .i. ní ba fochen leu aforcital íccas corpu etanmana
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ní ba fochen leu aforcital íccas corpu etanmana
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not welcome will they deem the teaching that saves bodies and souls.

glosses.latin: Erit enim tempus, cum sanam doctrinam non sustinebunt; sed ad sua desideria coaceruabunt sibi magistros, prurientes auribus.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Erit enim tempus, cum sanam doctrinam non sustinebunt; sed ad sua desideria coaceruabunt sibi magistros, prurientes auribus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] bithé magistir dongegat [b]indhí[/b] asindisset atola féisne dóib
glosses.glossText: .i. bithé magistir dongegat indhí asindisset atola féisne dóib
glosses.glossFNs: .i. bithé magistir dongegat indhí<sup>b</sup> asindisset atola féisne dóib
footnotes: b: MS. inhí
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. these will be the masters whom they will choose, those who will declare to them their own desires.

glosses.latin: Et a ueritate quidem auditum auertent, ad fabulas autem conuertentur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the hearers.

glosses.latin: Et a ueritate quidem auditum auertent, ad fabulas autem conuertentur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to fables and stories of the Old Law.

glosses.latin: Ego enim iam delebor, et tempus resolutionis meae instat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the time of offering me has come.

glosses.latin: Bonum certamen certaui, cursum consummaui.
glosses.glossTrans: Paul’s conflicts and battles with the ending (days).

glosses.latin: In reliquo possita est mihi corona iustitiae, quam reddet mihi ... iustus iudex; non solum autem mihi, sed et hís qui diligunt aduentum eius.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] ished arthá inso buáid [GLat]et[/GLat] indocbál domsa [GLat]pro meo labore[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. ished arthá inso buáid et indocbál domsa pro meo labore
glosses.glossFNs: .i. ished arthá inso buáid et indocbál domsa pro meo labore
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is this that remains, victory and glory to me pro meo labore.

glosses.latin: In reliquo possita est mihi corona iustitiae, quam reddet mihi ... iustus iudex; non solum autem mihi, sed et hís qui diligunt aduentum eius.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. no one’s truth perishes with Him.

glosses.latin: In reliquo possita est mihi corona iustitiae, quam reddet mihi ... iustus iudex; non solum autem mihi, sed et hís qui diligunt aduentum eius.
glosses.glossTrans: who shall care for (His coming) in bonis operibus.

glosses.latin: Lucas est mecum solus. Marcum adsume, et adduc tecum.
glosses.glossTrans: without separation.

glosses.latin: Lucas est mecum solus. Marcum adsume, et adduc tecum.
glosses.glossTrans: to come with thee hither.

glosses.latin: Tithicum autem misi Ephesum.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to teach.

glosses.latin: Pænullam quam reliqui Troade ... affer tecum.
glosses.glossText: .i. penbolcc ɫ. uestis .i. tonica ɫ. lacerna .i. sái ɫ. fúan
glosses.glossFNs: .i. penbolcc ɫ. uestis .i. tonica ɫ. lacerna .i. sái ɫ. fúan
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. a cloak .... i.e. a mantle or gown.

glosses.latin: Alaxander aerrarius multa mala mihi ostendit; reddet éi Dominus secundum opera eius;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is best for thee that he come not with thee; avoid him!

glosses.latin: Alaxander aerrarius multa mala mihi ostendit; reddet éi Dominus secundum opera eius;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Alaxander aerrarius multa mala mihi ostendit; reddet éi Dominus secundum opera eius;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. he hath wrought much evil against me.

glosses.latin: Alaxander aerrarius multa mala mihi ostendit; reddet éi Dominus secundum opera eius;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Alaxander aerrarius multa mala mihi ostendit; reddet éi Dominus secundum opera eius;
glosses.glossText: .i. obtat malafactoribus male ɫ. niuccu act isfáitsine
glosses.glossFNs: .i. obtat malafactoribus male ɫ. niuccu act isfáitsine
glosses.glossTrans: or it is not a wish, but it is a prophecy.

glosses.latin: Quem [et] tú deuita, ualde enim restitit uerbís nostrís.
glosses.glossTrans: trust him not.

glosses.latin: Quem [et] tú deuita, ualde enim restitit uerbís nostrís.
footnotes: b: Si nostris restitit, quanto magis tuis! Migne, col. 940
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: In prima mea defensione nemo [mihi] adfuit, sed omnes me dereliquerunt; non illís reputetur.
glosses.glossText: .i. imchétni precept .i. dorretsa soscele ɫ. in catena
glosses.glossFNs: .i. imchétni precept .i. dorretsa soscele ɫ. in catena
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in my first teaching, i.e. by which I defended the Gospel.

glosses.latin: In prima mea defensione nemo [mihi] adfuit, sed omnes me dereliquerunt; non illís reputetur.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. may God forgive it to them!

glosses.latin: Liberauit [mé] Dominus ab omni opere malo, et saluum faciet in regnum suum caeleste.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] aromfoimfea innalaith [GLat]sicut mé liberauit ita mé saluum faciat[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. aromfoimfea innalaith sicut mé liberauit ita mé saluum faciat
glosses.glossFNs: .i. aromfoimfea innalaith sicut mé liberauit ita mé saluum faciat
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. He will receive me into His kingdom.

glosses.latin: Saluta Priscillam et Auuillam Onisifori domum.
glosses.glossTrans: salutation to them is taken from me.

glosses.latin: Erastus remansit Corinthi.
glosses.glossTrans: for instruction and teaching.

glosses.latin: apostolus autem Iesu Christi secundum fidem electorum Dei,
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] nifrittáit mo hiressa fri hiriss innaní as deg rochreitset hicrist [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]ut crescat fides sanctorum dei[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. nifrittáit mo hiressa fri hiriss innaní as deg rochreitset hicrist ɫ. ut crescat fides sanctorum dei
glosses.glossFNs: .i. nifrittáit mo hiressa fri hiriss innaní as deg rochreitset hicrist ɫ. ut crescat fides sanctorum dei
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. my faith does not contravene the faith of those who have best believed in Christ.

glosses.latin: In spe uitae aeternae, quam promissit qui non mentitur, qui fuit ante tempora secularia.
glosses.glossTrans: what he has promised Me then will not be false. What are they? omnia that he declares.

glosses.latin: In spe uitae aeternae, quam promissit qui non mentitur, qui fuit ante tempora secularia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. who has been in prescience.

glosses.latin: Manifestauit [autem] temporibus suís uerbum suum in praedicatione, quae credita est mihi secundum praeceptum saluatoris.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Manifestauit [autem] temporibus suís uerbum suum in praedicatione, quae credita est mihi secundum praeceptum saluatoris.

glosses.glossTrans: the life which He has promised, that is the Word, and He has manifested it when it seemed to him seasonable.

glosses.latin: Tito, dilecto filio secundum commonem fidem.
glosses.glossTrans: which is between us.

glosses.latin: reliqui té Cretae, ut ea quae desunt, corrigas et constituas per ciuitates presbiteros, sicut et ego tibi dispossui.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: reliqui té Cretae, ut ea quae desunt, corrigas et constituas per ciuitates presbiteros, sicut et ego tibi dispossui.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to our faith.

glosses.latin: reliqui té Cretae, ut ea quae desunt, corrigas et constituas per ciuitates presbiteros, sicut et ego tibi dispossui.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. arranging the conferment of orders.

glosses.latin: Si quis sine cremine est, unius uxoris uir; filios habens fideles, non in accussatione luxoriae, aut non subditos.
glosses.glossTrans: before ordination and after baptism: needless to say ‘afterwards’ then.

glosses.latin: Si quis sine cremine est, unius uxoris uir; filios habens fideles, non in accussatione luxoriae, aut non subditos.

glosses.glossFNs: .i. nípsartholach achland ɫ. né ab aliis accussetur pro luxsoria
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let not his children be lustful.

glosses.latin: Si quis sine cremine est, unius uxoris uir; filios habens fideles, non in accussatione luxoriae, aut non subditos.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. under their parents’ power.

glosses.latin: Oportet enim æpiscopum sine cremine esse, sicut Dei dispensatorem; ... non uinolentum.
glosses.glossTrans: for it is a fault of his if his household be evil.

glosses.latin: Oportet enim æpiscopum sine cremine esse, sicut Dei dispensatorem; ... non uinolentum.
glosses.glossTrans: for not proper is sin with him.

glosses.latin: Oportet enim æpiscopum sine cremine esse, sicut Dei dispensatorem; ... non uinolentum.
footnotes: c: leg. roibach, roebach?
glosses.glossTrans: fond of drink.

glosses.latin: Amplectantem eum, qui secundum doctrinam est, fidelem

glosses.glossText: arascrúta cid forchana do hícc cáich
glosses.glossFNs: arascrúta cid forchana do hícc cáich
glosses.glossTrans: that he may scrutinise what he may teach to save every one.

glosses.latin: sermonem ut potens sit exortari in doctrina sana, et eos qui contradicunt arguere.
footnotes: e: nerta for nertatho, gen. sg. of nertad governed by tualang
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. then is he effective in his exhortation<sup>e</sup>, provided he fulfil it before teaching it.

glosses.latin: sermonem ut potens sit exortari in doctrina sana, et eos qui contradicunt arguere.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which saves body and soul.

glosses.latin: sermonem ut potens sit exortari in doctrina sana, et eos qui contradicunt arguere.
glosses.glossTrans: so far the morals of the bishop.

glosses.latin: Sunt enim ... uaniloqui et seductores, maxime qui de circumcisione sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they boast in tales and old stories of the Law and of heathenism.

glosses.latin: Sunt enim ... uaniloqui et seductores, maxime qui de circumcisione sunt.
glosses.glossTrans: that is of the Jews.

glosses.latin: qui uniuersas domos subuertunt, docentes quae non oportet, turpis lucri gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from faith into unfaith.

glosses.latin: qui uniuersas domos subuertunt, docentes quae non oportet, turpis lucri gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not proper for sanctification is what they teach.

glosses.latin: qui uniuersas domos subuertunt, docentes quae non oportet, turpis lucri gratia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. so that they may get the world’s lucre.

glosses.latin: Dixit quidam ex illis, proprius ipsorum propheta; Credenses semper mendaces, malae bestiae, uentris pigri.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Dixit quidam ex illis, proprius ipsorum propheta; Credenses semper mendaces, malae bestiae, uentris pigri.

glosses.glossTrans: look at the testimony which their own poet has given, so that it is meet to beware of them and to teach them.

glosses.latin: Dixit quidam ex illis, proprius ipsorum propheta; Credenses semper mendaces, malae bestiae, uentris pigri.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Dixit quidam ex illis, proprius ipsorum propheta; Credenses semper mendaces, malae bestiae, uentris pigri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they follow falsehoods from covetousness.

glosses.latin: Dixit quidam ex illis, proprius ipsorum propheta; Credenses semper mendaces, malae bestiae, uentris pigri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. evil beasts who pour forth blood from cruelty.

glosses.latin: Dixit quidam ex illis, proprius ipsorum propheta; Credenses semper mendaces, malae bestiae, uentris pigri.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. gorged or greedy.

glosses.latin: Dixit quidam ex illis, proprius ipsorum propheta; Credenses semper mendaces, malae bestiae, uentris pigri.

glosses.glossTrans: sluggish, i.e. at service, constant in begging for dinners.

glosses.latin: Quam ob causam increpa illos duræ ut sani sint in fide.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. on account of these four things.

glosses.latin: Quam ob causam increpa illos duræ ut sani sint in fide.
glosses.glossTrans: they are corrected that they may be good.

glosses.latin: Non intendentes Iudaicís fabulís, et mandatis hominum auersantum se a ueritate.
glosses.glossTrans: tales and old stories and superstitious commands.

glosses.latin: Omnia munda mundís; coinquinatis autem, et infidelibus nihil mundum, sed inquina(tae sunt) eorum et mens et conscientia.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. mind, body, soul, thoughts, deeds.

glosses.latin: Omnia munda mundís; coinquinatis autem, et infidelibus nihil mundum, sed inquina(tae sunt) eorum et mens et conscientia.
footnotes: c: leg. manipglan
d: The letters in parenthesis were doubtless on a patch, which has dropt off
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. unless their mens be pure et etc.

glosses.latin: Omnia munda mundís; coinquinatis autem, et infidelibus nihil mundum, sed inquina(tae sunt) eorum et mens et conscientia.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Omnia munda mundís; coinquinatis autem, et infidelibus nihil mundum, sed inquina(tae sunt) eorum et mens et conscientia.
footnotes: f: a chocubus seems a scribal error for a cocubus
glosses.glossTrans: their mind and their conscience<sup>f</sup> are defiled.

glosses.latin: Confitentur sé nosse Deum, factís autem negant, cum sint ... incredibiles, et ad omne opus bonum reprobi.
glosses.glossTrans: their deeds conflict with their words.

glosses.latin: Confitentur sé nosse Deum, factís autem negant, cum sint ... incredibiles, et ad omne opus bonum reprobi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because they do not fulfil quod praedicant.

glosses.latin: Confitentur sé nosse Deum, factís autem negant, cum sint ... incredibiles, et ad omne opus bonum reprobi.
glosses.glossTrans: which is fitting to God.

glosses.latin: Tú autem loquere quae decet sanam doctrinam.
glosses.glossTrans: after fulfilling it.

glosses.latin: Tú autem loquere quae decet sanam doctrinam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. which saves body and soul.

glosses.latin: Senes ut sobri sint, pudici.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. delightful is a sober old man.

glosses.latin: Senes ut sobri sint, pudici.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. without sin.

glosses.latin: Anus similiter in habitu sancto; non creminatrices, non uino multo seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: uigelat that which is not holy.

glosses.latin: Anus similiter in habitu sancto; non creminatrices, non uino multo seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: of themselves and of any other.

glosses.latin: Anus similiter in habitu sancto; non creminatrices, non uino multo seruientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for (the) drunkenness of old women is not seemly.

glosses.latin: ut ... filios [suos] diligant.
glosses.glossTrans: by correction.

glosses.latin: benegnas, subditas uiris suis, ut non blasfemetur uerbum Dei.
footnotes: d: cf. Laws III. 182, 276, 492
glosses.glossTrans: in loaning (commodare) and lending (mutuo dare)<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: benegnas, subditas uiris suis, ut non blasfemetur uerbum Dei.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in every lowly service.

glosses.latin: benegnas, subditas uiris suis, ut non blasfemetur uerbum Dei.

footnotes: b: cf. Sg. 168a 1
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. lest it should be said, since they have believed we have not the management(?) of our wives.

glosses.latin: té ipsum praebe exemplum bonorum [operum], in doctrina, in integritate, in grauitate;
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that every one may take ensample from thy works.

glosses.latin: té ipsum praebe exemplum bonorum [operum], in doctrina, in integritate, in grauitate;
glosses.glossTrans: these are bona opera.

glosses.latin: ut is qui ex aduerso est, reuereatur, nihil habens dicere malum de nobís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that he may revere.

glosses.latin: ut is qui ex aduerso est, reuereatur, nihil habens dicere malum de nobís.

glosses.glossFNs: madinchrudso bemmi .i. cocomalnammar apridchimme et commandessimrecht dochach
glosses.glossTrans: if we be in this wise, to wit, that we fulfil what we preach and that we be an example to every one.

glosses.latin: Non frudantes, sed in omnibus fidem bonam ostendentes, ut doctrinam Saluatoris nostri Dei ornent in omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let them not take away what is entrusted to them.

glosses.latin: Non frudantes, sed in omnibus fidem bonam ostendentes, ut doctrinam Saluatoris nostri Dei ornent in omnibus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let them be faithful as to everything.

glosses.latin: Non frudantes, sed in omnibus fidem bonam ostendentes, ut doctrinam Saluatoris nostri Dei ornent in omnibus.
footnotes: c: MS. ngád: corr. Sarauw and Ascoli
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that every grade may fulfil it.

glosses.latin: Aparuit enim gratia Dei, Saluatoris [nostri], omnibus hominibus.

glosses.glossText: comtangad cách forcital crist arnicol do attá adeolid iarcúul caích

glosses.glossTrans: let every one upbuild Christ’s doctrine, for it is no fault of His<sup>e</sup> that His grace is behind every one.

glosses.latin: Erudiens nos, ut abnegantes impietatem ... pie uiuamus in hoc seculo.
glosses.glossTrans: it is for this purpose it teaches us.

glosses.latin: Exspectantes ... aduentum ... Saluatoris nostri,
glosses.glossTrans: when we expect.

glosses.glossTrans: i.e. there was something to be purified there.

glosses.latin: Qui dedit semetipsum pro nobis, ut nos redemeret ab omni iniquitate, et mundaret sibi populum acceptabilem.
glosses.glossTrans: in union with Christ’s Body.

glosses.latin: Haec loquere, et exhortare, et argue cum omni imperio. Nemo té contemnat.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Haec loquere, et exhortare, et argue cum omni imperio. Nemo té contemnat.
glosses.glossTrans: with an apostle’s command.

glosses.latin: Haec loquere, et exhortare, et argue cum omni imperio. Nemo té contemnat.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. be not indulgent in proclaiming his sin to every one.

glosses.latin: omnem mansuetudinem ostendentes ad omnes homines.

glosses.glossTrans: whether they deserve it, or deserve it not.

glosses.glossTrans: meet is gentleness in the teaching.

glosses.latin: et uarís desiderís, ... inuicem odientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. for the Law forbade us not.

glosses.latin: et uarís desiderís, ... inuicem odientes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. we folk of the Law mutually.

glosses.latin: Cum autem benegnitas et humanitas apparuit Saluatoris nostri.

glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is for great affection that there has come the taking of flesh by Christ.

glosses.latin: Cum autem benegnitas et humanitas apparuit Saluatoris nostri.
glosses.glossTrans: the taking of flesh by Him.

glosses.latin: Non ex operibus iustitiae, quae fecimus nos, sed secundum misericordiam saluos nos fecit.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not by works of (the) righteousness of (the) Law.

footnotes: c: cf. da lim rugenair iarsin, Carm. Ml.
glosses.glossTrans: yet we supposed it was righteousness.

glosses.latin: Non ex operibus iustitiae, quae fecimus nos, sed secundum misericordiam saluos nos fecit.

glosses.glossFNs: .i. ni arfírinni rechto immurgu ronnhícc sed misericordia eius
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not, however, for (the) righteousness of (the) Law has He saved us, sed, etc.

glosses.latin: ut curent bonis operibus praeesse, qui credunt Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: to every one.

glosses.latin: ut curent bonis operibus praeesse, qui credunt Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. because they are in fide.

glosses.latin: Stultas autem quaestiones ... deuita; sunt enim inutiles et uanae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they are not utilia.

glosses.latin: Stultas autem quaestiones ... deuita; sunt enim inutiles et uanae.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they produce no profit.

glosses.latin: Heriticum hominem, post unam et secundam correptionem, deuita.
footnotes: a: = nachi-t-tochaithed
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. let him not wear thee out in admonishing him any longer.

glosses.latin: Sciens quia subuersus est, qui eiusmodi est, et delinquit.
glosses.glossTrans: who does nothing for the admonition given to him.

glosses.latin: Cum misero ad té Arthemam aut Tithicum, festina ad me uenire Nicopolim, ibi enim constitui hiemare.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] doanad dartéssi siu arnafarcabtis cen forcitlaid
glosses.glossText: .i. doanad dartéssi siu arnafarcabtis cen forcitlaid
glosses.glossFNs: .i. doanad dartéssi siu arnafarcabtis cen forcitlaid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to remain in thy stead lest they should be left without a teacher.

glosses.latin: Cum misero ad té Arthemam aut Tithicum, festina ad me uenire Nicopolim, ibi enim constitui hiemare.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have determined to be there this winter.

glosses.latin: Zenan legisperitum et Appollo sollicite praemitte, ut nihil illis desit.
glosses.glossTrans: of their instruction that they may be versed in teaching.

glosses.latin: Discant autem et nostri bonis operibus praeesse ad ussus necessarios, ut non sint infructuosi.
footnotes: b: mattu = mad tú, cf. LU. 133a 4: LL. 246a 36
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. even our household as well as thou<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Discant autem et nostri bonis operibus praeesse ad ussus necessarios, ut non sint infructuosi.

glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal astoisc fribiathad naforcitlaide ɫ. amal astoisc frifoirbthetid caingníme naforcitlaide fadesine
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as it is need to support the teachers, or, as it is need for the perfecting of the good deeds of the teachers themselves.

glosses.latin: Salutant té qui mecum sunt omnes.
glosses.glossTrans: a salutation to thee is brought from them.

glosses.latin: Incipit argumentum aepistolae ad Philimonem. Philimoni familiares litteras fecit pro Onissimo eius seruo, scripsit autem éi a Roma de carcere per Onisimum accolitum. Explicit argumentum. Incipit textus eiusdem æpistolae.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] robói debuid dophilomóin frisuide [GLat]et[/GLat]docoid [GLat]onessimus[/GLat] iarum dochum poil forlongis roscrib pol iarum [GLat]hanc æpistolam ut susciperetur onessimus.[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. robói debuid dophilomóin frisuide etdocoid onessimus iarum dochum poil forlongis roscrib pol iarum hanc æpistolam ut susciperetur onessimus.
glosses.glossFNs: .i. robói debuid dophilomóin frisuide etdocoid onessimus iarum dochum poil forlongis roscrib pol iarum hanc æpistolam ut susciperetur onessimus.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. Philemon had had a quarrel with him, and Onesimus then had gone to Paul into exile. Paul then had written hanc epistolam ut etc.

glosses.latLine: Philem. - No Chapter or Verse Information Available
glosses.latin: Incipit argumentum aepistolae ad Philimonem. Philimoni familiares litteras fecit pro Onissimo eius seruo, scripsit autem éi a Roma de carcere per Onisimum accolitum. Explicit argumentum. Incipit textus eiusdem æpistolae.
footnotes: a: See p. 654 note e
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: conmilitoni nostro, et æclesiae quae in domu tua est.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in teaching and fulfilling (the) gospel.

glosses.latin: conmilitoni nostro, et æclesiae quae in domu tua est.
glosses.glossTrans: to all thy household.

glosses.latin: Ut commonicatio fidei tuae euidens fiat, in agnitionem omnis [operis] boni.
glosses.glossTrans: that it may be clear and that every one may take example from it.

glosses.latin: Ut commonicatio fidei tuae euidens fiat, in agnitionem omnis [operis] boni.
glosses.glossTrans: that ye may understand and that ye may fulfil every good (thing).

glosses.latin: fiduciam habens . . imperandi tibi ... quod ad rem pertinet.
glosses.glossTrans: that which I need.

glosses.latin: cum sim talis, ut Paulus senex, nunc autem et (uin)ctus Iesu Christi.
glosses.glossTrans: I have this peculiarity.

glosses.latin: Obsecro té pro meo filio, qu(em genui) in uinculís.
glosses.glossTrans: for it is thus he is.

glosses.latin: Obsecro té pro meo filio, qu(em genui) in uinculís.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. .... faithful.

glosses.latin: Tu autem illum, id est uiscera mea, suscipe.
glosses.glossTrans: as it were my soul.

glosses.latin: Quem ego uolueram mecum retinere, ut pro te mihi ministraret in uinculis euangelii.
glosses.glossTrans: I could wish that he were with myself because of his faithfulness.

glosses.latin: Quem ego uolueram mecum retinere, ut pro te mihi ministraret in uinculis euangelii.
glosses.glossTrans: in which I am (now) for the sake of the gospel.

glosses.latin: Sine consilio autem tuo nihil uolui facere, uti né uelud ex necessitate bonum tuum esset, sed uoluntarium.

glosses.glossText: acht niainfed liumsa mainbed maith latsu
glosses.glossFNs: acht niainfed liumsa mainbed maith latsu
glosses.glossTrans: but he would not remain with me unless it should seem good to thee.

glosses.latin: Sine consilio autem tuo nihil uolui facere, uti né uelud ex necessitate bonum tuum esset, sed uoluntarium.
glosses.glossFullTags: conabad éicen doberad ní domsa huaitsu act combadtol
glosses.glossText: conabad éicen doberad ní domsa huaitsu act combadtol
glosses.glossFNs: conabad éicen doberad ní domsa huaitsu act combadtol
glosses.glossTrans: that it should not be necessity which should give me aught from thee, but that it should be free will.

glosses.latin: Forsitan enim ideo discessit ad horam á té, ut in aeternum illum reciperes.
glosses.glossFullTags: bieid bes ferr de tra [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]ut aeternum illum[/GLat] [etc]rl.[/etc]
glosses.glossText: bieid bes ferr de tra .i. ut aeternum illum rl.
glosses.glossFNs: bieid bes ferr de tra .i. ut aeternum illum rl.
glosses.glossTrans: there will be something better therefore then, i.e. ut, etc.

glosses.latin: Forsitan enim ideo discessit ad horam á té, ut in aeternum illum reciperes.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to serve thee.

glosses.latin: quanto autem magis tibi, et in carne, et in Domino!
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]frater[/GLat] brathir infectso isbrathir deit iarcolinn [GLat]et in fide domini[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: frater brathir infectso isbrathir deit iarcolinn et in fide domini
glosses.glossFNs: frater brathir infectso isbrathir deit iarcolinn et in fide domini
glosses.glossTrans: a brother now, he is a brother to thee according to the flesh, et etc.

glosses.latin: Si ergo habes me socium, suscipe illum sicut me.
glosses.glossTrans: if thou takest me as a friend.

glosses.latin: Si ergo habes me socium, suscipe illum sicut me.
glosses.glossTrans: as if it were I myself that had gone to thee.

glosses.latin: Si autem aliquid nocuit tibi, aut debet, hoc mihi inputa.
glosses.glossTrans: if aught is owing from him.

glosses.latin: Si autem aliquid nocuit tibi, aut debet, hoc mihi inputa.
footnotes: a: leg. with Sarauw dlich i.e. dlig, literally, have as a claim against me
glosses.glossTrans: put (it) to my account.

glosses.latin: ego reddam, ut [non] dicam tibi, quod et té ipsum mihi debes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dineuch conicub [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [GLat]in orationibus meís[/GLat] [vel]ɫ.[/vel] coniepersa fritso dligim ní duit [ie].i.[/ie] ni épéer són [GLat]et[/GLat] niairbéer fritt
glosses.glossText: .i. dineuch conicub ɫ. in orationibus meís ɫ. coniepersa fritso dligim ní duit .i. ni épéer són et niairbéer fritt
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dineuch conicub ɫ. in orationibus meís ɫ. coniepersa fritso dligim ní duit .i. ni épéer són et niairbéer fritt
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. from what I shall be able: uel in orationibus meis: or that I may not say to thee I have a claim upon thee, i.e. I will not say it and I will not reproach thee with it.

glosses.latin: ego reddam, ut [non] dicam tibi, quod et té ipsum mihi debes.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] atfechem dom [GLat]et[/GLat]dalugub són [GLat]pro suscipione eius uiri[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. atfechem dom etdalugub són pro suscipione eius uiri
glosses.glossFNs: .i. atfechem dom etdalugub són pro suscipione eius uiri
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. thou art a debtor to me, and I will forgive it pro etc.

glosses.latin: Ita, frater, ego té fruar in Domino: refice uiscera mea in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: there is, however, (somewhat that) I will say, ego etc.

glosses.latin: Ita, frater, ego té fruar in Domino: refice uiscera mea in Domino.
glosses.glossTrans: to receive him is a refreshment for me.

glosses.latin: Confidens de obædientia tua scripsi tibi, sciens quoniam et super id quod dico facies.
glosses.glossFullTags: act dorronai cori frissom dogné [GLat]quod dico[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: act dorronai cori frissom dogné quod dico
glosses.glossFNs: act dorronai cori frissom dogné quod dico
glosses.glossTrans: provided that thou make peace with him thou wouldst do quod dico.

glosses.latin: Confidens de obædientia tua scripsi tibi, sciens quoniam et super id quod dico facies.
glosses.glossFullTags: bid mó dongenaesiu oldaas rofoided cucut
glosses.glossText: bid mó dongenaesiu oldaas rofoided cucut
glosses.glossFNs: bid mó dongenaesiu oldaas rofoided cucut
glosses.glossTrans: thou wilt do it more than has been sent to thee.

glosses.latin: Simul autem et para mihi hospitium; nam spero per orationes uestras donari me uobís.
glosses.glossTrans: at receiving Onesimus.

glosses.latin: Simul autem et para mihi hospitium; nam spero per orationes uestras donari me uobís.
footnotes: b: With eb-arthir cf. eb-arthi Ml. 46b 12. Sarauw, p. 126, regards it as a future with an imperfective meaning, and connects it with ro-erthar Wb. 18b 23, ro-erthe 27a 16, ro-ír 17b 13, ro-ratha Fiacc. h. 50
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I know it will be granted<sup>b</sup> to you so that I shall come unto you.

glosses.latin: Salutat té Epaphras, concaptiuus [meus] in Christo Iesu.
glosses.glossTrans: we twain are (now) in bonds for Christ’s sake.

glosses.latin: Marcus, Aristarcus, Demas [et] Lucas, adiutores mei.
glosses.glossTrans: salutation to thee is taken from the whole of them.

glosses.latin: Marcus, Aristarcus, Demas [et] Lucas, adiutores mei.
glosses.glossTrans: in teaching.

glosses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri ... cum spiritu uestro.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. God’s help (be) with you.

glosses.latin: Diebus istís loqutus est nobís in Filio.
footnotes: a: leg. -persana?
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. not through many Persons, sed, etc.

glosses.latin: Qui quum sit gloriae splendor, et figura substantiae eius, ... purgatioonem peccatorum faciens.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they have the same form of Substance.

glosses.latin: Qui quum sit gloriae splendor, et figura substantiae eius, ... purgatioonem peccatorum faciens.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]per passionem corporis sui[/GLat] amal asné as[GLat]splendor[/GLat] [GLat]et[/GLat] as[GLat]figura[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. per passionem corporis sui amal asné assplendor et asfigura
glosses.glossFNs: .i. per passionem corporis sui amal asné assplendor et asfigura
glosses.glossTrans: as it is He that is splendor and figura.

glosses.latin: Tanto melior angelís effectus.
glosses.glossTrans: than are the angels who have ministered ueterem legem.

glosses.latin: Cui enim dixit aliquando angelorum: Filius meus es tú, ego hodie genui té? Et rursum: Ego ero illi in patrem.
glosses.glossTrans: a very son by nature, not from adoption.

glosses.latin: Cui enim dixit aliquando angelorum: Filius meus es tú, ego hodie genui té? Et rursum: Ego ero illi in patrem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. in the day of the existence of the Godhead.

glosses.latin: Cui enim dixit aliquando angelorum: Filius meus es tú, ego hodie genui té? Et rursum: Ego ero illi in patrem.
footnotes: b: or both to the Godhead and to the Manhood, v. Sarauw, p. 32
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. whether to the Godhead or to the Manhood<sup>b</sup>.

glosses.latin: Dei et adorent eum omnes angili.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. His, then, are the angels.

glosses.latin: Ad angelos quidem dicit: Qui facit angelos suos spiritus, et ministros suos ignem urentem.
glosses.glossTrans: for breathing salvation to every one.

glosses.latin: Ad angelos quidem dicit: Qui facit angelos suos spiritus, et ministros suos ignem urentem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to inflict punishment on sinners.

glosses.latin: Ad Filium autem: Thronus tuus, Deus, in seculum seculi.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is not like unto the aforesaid.

glosses.latin: Dilexisti iustitiam.
glosses.glossTrans: in Thy creatures.

glosses.latin: Et: Tú in principio, Domine, terram fundasti, et (op)era manuum tuarum sunt caeli.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et: Tú in principio, Domine, terram fundasti, et (op)era manuum tuarum sunt caeli.
glosses.glossTrans: not like unto an angel’s works is that.

glosses.latin: Et: Tú in principio, Domine, terram fundasti, et (op)era manuum tuarum sunt caeli.
glosses.glossTrans: that has not been said to any of the angels.

glosses.latin: Ipsi peribunt, ... et omnes ut uestimentum ueterascent.
glosses.glossTrans: form and kind, non substantia.

glosses.latin: Ipsi peribunt, ... et omnes ut uestimentum ueterascent.
glosses.glossTrans: as a garment wears away.

glosses.latin: Et uelut amictum inuoluens eos, et mutabuntur Tú autem idem ipse és, et anni tui non deficient.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]ut in isaia plicabitur caelum sicut liber[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: ut in isaia plicabitur caelum sicut liber
glosses.glossFNs: ut in isaia plicabitur caelum sicut liber
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et uelut amictum inuoluens eos, et mutabuntur Tú autem idem ipse és, et anni tui non deficient.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et uelut amictum inuoluens eos, et mutabuntur Tú autem idem ipse és, et anni tui non deficient.
glosses.glossTrans: as one casts his garment from him.

glosses.latin: Et uelut amictum inuoluens eos, et mutabuntur Tú autem idem ipse és, et anni tui non deficient.
glosses.glossTrans: that will not be to Thee.

glosses.latin: Ad quem autem angelorum dixit aliquando: Sede a dextrís meís, quoadusque ponam inimicos tuos scabellum pedum tuorum?
glosses.glossFullTags: [in marg.] (is)deacht asrubart inso fridóinecht isand didiu bieit anamait foachossaibsom intain neidfider[a] carcar ifirnn fordemnib [GLat]et[/GLat]pecthachaib
glosses.glossText: [in marg.] (is)deacht asrubart inso fridóinecht isand didiu bieit anamait foachossaibsom intain neidfider carcar ifirnn fordemnib etpecthachaib
glosses.glossFNs: [in marg.] (is)deacht asrubart inso fridóinecht isand didiu bieit anamait foachossaibsom intain neidfidera carcar ifirnn fordemnib etpecthachaib
footnotes: a: neidfider, Zimmer Gloss. Hib. niadfider, Celt. Zeitschr. III. 487, : eidfider Windisch, idfider, before which may be two illegible letters, Chroust; for the future eidfider cf. Celt. Zeitschr. III. 487, note 1, cf. iadfaitir annsin tri glais na pecthach, Rev. Celt. IV. 252
glosses.glossTrans: it is the Godhead that had said this to the Manhood (in Jesus). Then, indeed, will His enemies be under His feet when the dungeon of Hell shall be shut over devils and sinners.

glosses.latin: Ad quem autem angelorum dixit aliquando: Sede a dextrís meís, quoadusque ponam inimicos tuos scabellum pedum tuorum?
glosses.glossTrans: under the power of the Manhood.

glosses.latin: Propterea abundantius oportet obseruare nos ea quae audiuimus, ne forte pereffluamus.
glosses.glossTrans: because it is the Son of the Godhead who has ministered unto it.

glosses.latin: Propterea abundantius oportet obseruare nos ea quae audiuimus, ne forte pereffluamus.
footnotes: b: torthissem (cf. torthaisset Laws IV. 318) seemingly from to-ro-tōssam
glosses.glossTrans: that we may not lapse into perdition in the manner of a swift stream.

glosses.latin: Si enim qui per angelos dictus est sermo, factus est firmus, et omnis praeuaricatio et in obaedientia accepit iustam mercedis retributionem;
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Si enim qui per angelos dictus est sermo, factus est firmus, et omnis praeuaricatio et in obaedientia accepit iustam mercedis retributionem;
glosses.glossTrans: so that its fulfilment became necessary.

glosses.latin: Si enim qui per angelos dictus est sermo, factus est firmus, et omnis praeuaricatio et in obaedientia accepit iustam mercedis retributionem;
glosses.glossTrans: present death.

glosses.latin: Contestante Deo signis et portentís, et uarís uirtutibus, et Spiritus sancti distributionibus?
glosses.glossTrans: through miracles.

glosses.latin: Contestante Deo signis et portentís, et uarís uirtutibus, et Spiritus sancti distributionibus?
glosses.glossTrans: God has. certified it by the four things (signs, wonders, powers, gifts of the Holy Spirit).

glosses.latin: Non enim angelis subiecit Deus orbem terrae.
footnotes: d: here, as in 13b 30, 19d 11, 22c 10, fo governs the accusative
glosses.glossTrans: under power<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: nunc autem necdum uidemus omnia subiecta éi.
glosses.glossTrans: a-sinning.

glosses.latin: Eum autem, qui modico quam angeli minoratus est, uidemus Iesum, propter passionem mortis, gloria et honore coronatum, ut gratia Dei, pro omnibus gustaret mortem.
glosses.glossTrans: a gloss on that which he had said before.

glosses.latin: Eum autem, qui modico quam angeli minoratus est, uidemus Iesum, propter passionem mortis, gloria et honore coronatum, ut gratia Dei, pro omnibus gustaret mortem.
glosses.glossTrans: just is this on account of (His) Passion.

glosses.latin: Eum autem, qui modico quam angeli minoratus est, uidemus Iesum, propter passionem mortis, gloria et honore coronatum, ut gratia Dei, pro omnibus gustaret mortem.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is a passing cup, it was not eternal death.

glosses.latin: Decebat enim eum ... per passionem consummari.
footnotes: c: exultari, Zimmer
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. that He should be made perfect.

glosses.latin: et qui sanctificantur.
glosses.glossTrans: No translation available.

glosses.latin: Et iterum: Ego ero fidens in eum. Et iterum: Ecce ego, et pueri mei, quos mihi dedit Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: saith the Son pro, etc.

glosses.latin: Et iterum: Ego ero fidens in eum. Et iterum: Ecce ego, et pueri mei, quos mihi dedit Deus.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] dobuid fomchumachtu [GLat]pro parte carnis dare dicit[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. dobuid fomchumachtu pro parte carnis dare dicit
glosses.glossFNs: .i. dobuid fomchumachtu pro parte carnis dare dicit
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. to be under my power.

glosses.latin: Et iterum: Ego ero fidens in eum. Et iterum: Ecce ego, et pueri mei, quos mihi dedit Deus.
glosses.glossTrans: He unites Himself híc to the faithful.

glosses.latin: ut per mortem destrueret eum, qui habebat mortis imperium.
glosses.glossTrans: who used to command death to every one.

glosses.latin: Nusquam enim angelos adprehendit, sed semen Abrachae [adprehendit].
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] isuaidib arróit colinn [GLat]et[/GLat] ithé dorraidchiúir [GLat]ut eosdem[/GLat] [in marg.] [GLat]qui eiusdem naturae sunt sanaret[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. isuaidib arróit colinn et ithé dorraidchiúir ut eosdem [in marg.] qui eiusdem naturae sunt sanaret
glosses.glossFNs: .i. isuaidib arróit colinn et ithé dorraidchiúir ut eosdem [in marg.] qui eiusdem naturae sunt sanaret
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. it is from them He has received flesh, and it is they whom He hath redeemed etc.

glosses.latin: Unde debuit per omnia fratribus simulare, ut misericors fieret ... ut repropitiaret delicta populi.
glosses.glossTrans: but in sin tantum.

glosses.latin: Unde debuit per omnia fratribus simulare, ut misericors fieret ... ut repropitiaret delicta populi.
glosses.glossTrans: so that He might forgive them their sin.

glosses.latin: In eo enim, in quo passus est ipse [et] temptatus, potens est et eís qui temptantur auxiliari.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] amal ronsóir fesin sóirfed[b] cách cretfes and
glosses.glossText: .i. amal ronsóir fesin sóirfed cách cretfes and
glosses.glossFNs: .i. amal ronsóir fesin sóirfed<sup>b</sup> cách cretfes and
footnotes: b: for sóirfid, as cretfed 1a 3 for cretfid
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. as He has delivered Himself (in His temptation), He will deliver every one who shall believe in him.

glosses.latin: considerate apostolum et pontificem confessionis nostrae, Iesum.
glosses.glossFullTags: [GLat]quem confitemur[/GLat] ba apstal cidmoysi hore baó dia dofoided act nitat cosmili
glosses.glossText: quem confitemur ba apstal cidmoysi hore baó dia dofoided act nitat cosmili
glosses.glossFNs: quem confitemur ba apstal cidmoysi hore baó dia dofoided act nitat cosmili
glosses.glossTrans: Moses too was an apostle, because he was sent from God, but they are not alike.

glosses.latin: Qui fidelis est ei qui fecit illum, sicut et Moyses in omni domo eius.
glosses.glossTrans: he has not been a betrayer.

glosses.latin: Amplioris enim gloriae iste prae Moysi dignus est habitus, quanto ampliorem honorem habet domus, qui fabricauit illam.
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. how much!

glosses.latin: Amplioris enim gloriae iste prae Moysi dignus est habitus, quanto ampliorem honorem habet domus, qui fabricauit illam.
glosses.glossFullTags: leissom atech didiu ⁊ ishe ↄidrotig fer imr̃ diamuintirsom inti moysi
glosses.glossText: leissom atech didiu ⁊ ishe ↄidrotig fer imr̃ diamuintirsom inti moysi
glosses.glossFNs: leissom atech didiu ⁊ ishe ↄidrotig fer imr̃ diamuintirsom inti moysi
glosses.glossTrans: His is the house, then, and it is He that has built it: a ... man of his household was this Moses.

glosses.latin: Omnis namque domus fabricatur ab aliquo; qui autem omnia creauit, Deus [est].
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. the whole house, i.e. plebs.

glosses.latin: Omnis namque domus fabricatur ab aliquo; qui autem omnia creauit, Deus [est].
glosses.glossFullTags: ceith cenmathá integdais nucut ishé dia
glosses.glossText: ceith cenmathá integdais nucut ishé dia
glosses.glossFNs: ceith cenmathá integdais nucut ishé dia
glosses.glossTrans: (omnia) even besides yonder house, it is God.

glosses.latin: Et Moyses quidem fidelis erat in tota domo eius tamquam famulus.
glosses.glossFullTags: rubu fersom muintere maith dano dul humal nirbuchoimdiu imurgu [in marg.] [GLat]Aliter[/GLat] isclí[c] darach moysi (i)sintegdais (i)shé som immurgu ↄrotaig integdais [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]fidelis totius terrae[/GLat] [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]in populo israhel[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: rubu fersom muintere maith dano dul humal nirbuchoimdiu imurgu [in marg.] Aliter isclí darach moysi (i)sintegdais (i)shé som immurgu ↄrotaig integdais .i. fidelis totius terrae .i. in populo israhel
glosses.glossFNs: rubu fersom muintere maith dano dul humal nirbuchoimdiu imurgu [in marg.] Aliter isclíc darach moysi (i)sintegdais (i)shé som immurgu ↄrotaig integdais .i. fidelis totius terrae .i. in populo israhel
footnotes: c: leg., with Chroust, clin J. S.
glosses.glossTrans: he had been a man of (the) household: good then .... humble: he had not been a lord however. Aliter. Moses is an oaken pillar in the house: it is He, however, that has built the house.

glosses.latin: Christus uero tamquam filus in domo sua; quae domus sumus nos, si fiduciam, et gloriam spei usque ad finem firmam retineamus.
footnotes: d: som, Zimmer; zwischen son und iscoimdiu steht ein einzelner schaft, der wol ein zweites i sein dürfte; obwol die form des buchstabes abweicht; som wäre palaeographisch schwer zu rechtfertigen, Chroust
glosses.glossTrans: He is a son in His Father’s house and He is a Lord.

glosses.latin: Christus uero tamquam filus in domo sua; quae domus sumus nos, si fiduciam, et gloriam spei usque ad finem firmam retineamus.
glosses.glossTrans: it is we righteous.

glosses.latin: Christus uero tamquam filus in domo sua; quae domus sumus nos, si fiduciam, et gloriam spei usque ad finem firmam retineamus.
glosses.glossTrans: of the gift of a reward to us.

glosses.latin: Christus uero tamquam filus in domo sua; quae domus sumus nos, si fiduciam, et gloriam spei usque ad finem firmam retineamus.
glosses.glossTrans: so that we may attain to our reward.

glosses.latin: Nolite obdurare corda uestra, sicut in exacerbatione, secundum diem temptationis in deserto.
footnotes: d: tacráth is intended for ‘exacerbatione’
glosses.glossTrans: provocation<sup>d</sup>.

glosses.latin: Ubi temptauerunt me patres uestri, probauerunt me, et uiderunt opera mea
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] rupu accubur leu etergne muchumachti ⁊ rusmbói dano
glosses.glossText: .i. rupu accubur leu etergne muchumachti ⁊ rusmbói dano
glosses.glossFNs: .i. rupu accubur leu etergne muchumachti ⁊ rusmbói dano
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. they had a desire to know my power, and they had it (i.e. that knowledge) accordingly.

glosses.latin: Quadraginta annis; propter quod offensus fui generationi huic.
glosses.glossFullTags: [ie].i.[/ie] friscomurtsa fodiuscartach [vel]ɫ.[/vel] [a]fuchésad[/a] rupsa frithortæse fritumchomartsa arin cheinélugud hisin [ie].i.[/ie] [GLat]pro israhel[/GLat]
glosses.glossText: .i. friscomurtsa fodiuscartach ɫ. fuchésad rupsa frithortæse fritumchomartsa arin cheinélugud hisin .i. pro israhel
glosses.glossFNs: .i. friscomurtsa fodiuscartach ɫ. fuchésada rupsa frithortæse fritumchomartsa arin cheinélugud hisin .i. pro israhel
footnotes: a: MS. futhesad
glosses.glossTrans: i.e. I have hurt, deponentially, or, passively, I have been offended. I have been offended for that generation.

glosses.latin: Sicut iuraui in ira mea: Si intrabunt in requiem meam.
footnotes: e: Here in is an obvious scribal error for im
glosses.glossTrans: in my wrath<sup>e</sup>.

glosses.glossTrans: how much older in age he was quam Abracham.

glosses.latin: Equidem de filís Leui sacerdotium accipientes, mandatum habent decimas sumere a populo sancto secundum legem, id est á fratribus suis.
glosses.glossTrans: it is from their brethren they receive tithes, not the same as Melchizedek.
